human_translation: And that is what Balaam said to Balak: “How can I curse whom God has not cursed? And how can I condemn whom God has not condemned?” teaches that all those days, was not angry.
llm_translation: And this is what he said to him, Balaam to Balak: "What can I curse whom God has not cursed, and how can I denounce whom the Lord has not denounced?" This teaches that all those days He did not denounce.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה זַעְמוֹ — רֶגַע. וְכַמָּה רֶגַע? אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אֲבִינָא: רֶגַע כְּמֵימְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And how does His anger a moment. And how is a moment? Rabbi Avin, and some say Rabbi Avina, said: to say it [ rega ]
llm_translation: "And how much is his anger? - A moment. And how much is a moment? Rabbi Avin said, and some say Rabbi Avina: A moment is like its name."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לָן דְּרֶגַע רָתַח? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי רֶגַע בְּאַפּוֹ חַיִּים בִּרְצוֹנוֹ״. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״חֲבִי כִּמְעַט רֶגַע עַד יַעֲבׇר זָעַם״.
human_translation: From where do we is angry for a moment? As it is stated: “His anger is but for a moment, His favor, for a lifetime” And if you wish, say from here, “Hide yourself for a brief moment, until the anger passes”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And teach us that a moment of anger? — as it is stated: "For a moment in His anger, life in His favor." And if you wish, say it from here: "Hide for a little moment until the indignation passes."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימַת רָתַח? אָמַר אַבַּיֵי: בְּהָנָךְ תְּלָת שָׁעֵי קַמָּיָיתָא כִּי חִיוָּרָא כַּרְבַּלְתָּא דְתַרְנְגוֹלָא וְקָאֵי אַחַד כַּרְעָא.
human_translation: When is angry? Abaye said: During the first three hours when the sun whitens the crest of the rooster and it stands on one leg.
llm_translation: And when does it boil? Abaye said: When three hours have passed since the heat of the midday sun is like the foot of a rooster and one leg is standing.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שַׁעְתָּא וְשַׁעְתָּא נָמֵי קָאֵי הָכִי?
human_translation: also stands that way every hour.
llm_translation: Every hour and hour, it stands thus?

hebrew_text: כֹּל שַׁעְתָּא — אִית בֵּיהּ שׁוּרְיָיקֵי סוּמָּקֵי, בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא לֵית בֵּיהּ שׁוּרְיָיקֵי סוּמָּקֵי.
human_translation: every hour there are red streaks when there are no red streaks
llm_translation: Every hour - there are white lines and black lines in it, in that hour there are no white lines and black lines.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִינָא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁבְבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, הֲוָה קָא מְצַעֵר לֵיהּ טוּבָא בִּקְרָאֵי. יוֹמָא חַד שְׁקַל תַּרְנְגוֹלָא, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ בֵּין כַּרְעֵיהּ דְּעַרְסָא, וְעַיֵּין בֵּיהּ, סְבַר: כִּי מָטָא הַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא, אֶלְטְיֵיהּ. כִּי מְטָא הַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא — נָיֵים. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֶעְבַּד הָכִי. ״וְרַחֲמָיו עַל כָּל מַעֲשָׂיו״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: A certain heretic who was in Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi’s neighborhood would upset him verses. One day, took a rooster and placed it between the legs of the bed and looked at it. He thought: When the moment arrives, I will curse him When the moment arrived, slept. he said Conclude from that it is not proper conduct to do so, “His mercy is over all His creations” is written
llm_translation: That certain heretic who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, was causing him trouble with his interpretations of the Scriptures. One day he took a rooster, placed it between his legs, and looked at it, thinking: "When that hour comes, I will pluck it." When that hour came - he fell asleep. He said: Learn from this, it is not the way of the world to act in this manner. "And His mercies are over all His works" is written.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״גַּם עָנוֹשׁ לַצַּדִּיק לֹא טוֹב״.
human_translation: it is written: “Punishment, even for the righteous, is not good”
llm_translation: And it is written: "Also, to punish the righteous is not good."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַחַמָּה זוֹרַחַת, וְכָל מַלְכֵי מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב מַנִּיחִים כִּתְרֵיהֶם בְּרָאשֵׁיהֶם וּמִשְׁתַּחֲוִים לַחַמָּה, מִיָּד כּוֹעֵס הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא.
human_translation: it is taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: When the sun rises and the kings of the East and the West place their crowns on their heads and bow down to the sun, the Holy One, Blessed be He, immediately grows angry.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: When the sun rises, all the kings of the east and the west place their crowns on their heads and bow down to the sun, immediately the Holy One, blessed be He, becomes angry.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: טוֹבָה מַרְדּוּת אַחַת בְּלִבּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם יוֹתֵר מִכַּמָּה מַלְקֻיוֹת. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרִדְּפָה אֶת מְאַהֲבֶיהָ וְגוֹ׳ וְאָמְרָה אֵלְכָה וְאָשׁוּבָה אֶל אִישִׁי הָרִאשׁוֹן כִּי טוֹב לִי אָז מֵעָתָּה״. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר, יוֹתֵר מִמֵּאָה מַלְקֻיוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תֵּחַת גְּעָרָה בְמֵבִין מֵהַכּוֹת כְּסִיל מֵאָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A single regret in one’s heart is preferable to many lashes as it is stated: “And she chases her lovers, and she will say ‘I will go and return to my first husband; for it was better for me then than now’” And Reish Lakish said preferable to one hundred lashes, as it is stated: “A rebuke enters deeper into a man of understanding than a hundred lashes to a fool”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: One admonition in a person's heart is better than many lashes. As it is stated: "She will pursue her lovers... and say, 'I will go and return to my first husband, for it was better for me then than now.'" And Reish Lakish said, more than a hundred lashes, as it is stated: "Instead of a rebuke to a wise man, one hundred blows to a fool."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים בִּקֵּשׁ מֹשֶׁה מִלִּפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, וְנָתַן לוֹ. בִּקֵּשׁ שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָה עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְנָתַן לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלוֹא בְּלֶכְתְּךָ עִמָּנוּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei requested three things from the Holy One, Blessed be He, all of which were granted him. He requested that the Divine Presence rest upon Israel and He granted to him, as it is stated: Is it not in that You go with us,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Three things Moses requested from the Holy One, blessed be He, and He granted them to him. He requested that the Divine Presence should rest upon Israel, and He granted it to him, as it is stated: "Is it not in your going with us."

hebrew_text: בִּקֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָה עַל עוֹבְדֵי כּוֹכָבִים, וְנָתַן לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִפְלִינוּ אֲנִי וְעַמְּךָ״.
human_translation: requested that the Divine Presence not rest upon the nations of the world, and He granted to him, as it is stated: “So that we are distinguished, I and Your people,
llm_translation: He sought that the Divine Presence not rest upon the idolaters, and He gave it to him, as it is said: "And we shall be distinguished, I and Your people."

hebrew_text: בִּקֵּשׁ לְהוֹדִיעוֹ דְּרָכָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, וְנָתַן לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹדִיעֵנִי נָא אֶת דְּרָכֶיךָ״, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! מִפְּנֵי מָה יֵשׁ צַדִּיק וְטוֹב לוֹ, וְיֵשׁ צַדִּיק וְרַע לוֹ, יֵשׁ רָשָׁע וְטוֹב לוֹ, וְיֵשׁ רָשָׁע וְרַע לוֹ? אָמַר לוֹ: מֹשֶׁה, צַדִּיק וְטוֹב לוֹ — צַדִּיק בֶּן צַדִּיק. צַדִּיק וְרַע לוֹ — צַדִּיק בֶּן רָשָׁע. רָשָׁע וְטוֹב לוֹ — רָשָׁע בֶּן צַדִּיק. רָשָׁע וְרַע לוֹ — רָשָׁע בֶּן רָשָׁע.
human_translation: requested that the ways God world be revealed to him, and He granted to him, as it is stated: “Show me Your ways said before Master of the Universe. Why is it that righteous prosper, the righteous suffer, wicked prosper, wicked suffer? said to him: Moses, the righteous who prospers is a righteous the son of a righteous The righteous who suffers is a righteous the son of a wicked The wicked who prospers is a wicked the son of a righteous The wicked who suffers is a wicked person, the son of a wicked person,
llm_translation: He sought to inform him of the ways of the Holy One, blessed be He, and He gave it to him, as it is said: "Make me know Your ways." He said before Him: Master of the Universe! Why is it that there is a righteous person who prospers, and there is a righteous person who suffers, there is a wicked person who prospers, and there is a wicked person who suffers? He said to him: Moses, a righteous person who prospers - a righteous son of a righteous person. A righteous person who suffers - a righteous son of a wicked person. A wicked person who prospers - a wicked son of a righteous person. A wicked person who suffers - a wicked son of a wicked person.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: צַדִּיק וְטוֹב לוֹ — צַדִּיק בֶּן צַדִּיק, צַדִּיק וְרַע לוֹ — צַדִּיק בֶּן רָשָׁע. אִינִּי? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״פֹּקֵד עֲוֹן אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבָנִים לֹא יוּמְתוּ עַל אָבוֹת״, וְרָמֵינַן קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי,
human_translation: The Master said: The righteous who prospers is a righteous the son of a righteous The righteous who suffers is a righteous the son of a wicked Is it so Isn’t it written: “He visits iniquity of the fathers upon the children, And it is written and children shall not be put to death for the fathers; And raises a contradiction between the two verses.
llm_translation: Master said: "Righteous and good for him - a righteous son of a righteous man, righteous and bad for him - a righteous son of a wicked man. Is it not so? But it is written: 'Visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children,' and it is written: 'And the children shall not be put to death for the fathers.' And we raise difficulties from verses that are contradictory."

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּינַן: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — כְּשֶׁאוֹחֲזִין מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֵיהֶם בִּידֵיהֶם, הָא — כְּשֶׁאֵין אוֹחֲזִין מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֵיהֶם בִּידֵיהֶם.
human_translation: resolves This is not difficult. This where they adopt the actions of their ancestors as their own. While this where they do not adopt the actions of their ancestors as their own,
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: It is not difficult, this — when they hold the deeds of their ancestors in their hands, this — when they do not hold the deeds of their ancestors in their hands.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: צַדִּיק וְטוֹב לוֹ — צַדִּיק גָּמוּר, צַדִּיק וְרַע לוֹ — צַדִּיק שֶׁאֵינוֹ גָּמוּר, רָשָׁע וְטוֹב לוֹ — רָשָׁע שֶׁאֵינוֹ גָּמוּר, רָשָׁע וְרַע לוֹ — רָשָׁע גָּמוּר.
human_translation: Rather, said to as follows: The righteous who prospers is completely righteous The righteous who suffers is not a completely righteous The wicked who prospers is not a completely wicked the wicked who suffers is completely wicked
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said to him: "Righteous and good for him - completely righteous; righteous and bad for him - not completely righteous; wicked and good for him - not completely wicked; wicked and bad for him - completely wicked."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שְׁתַּיִם נָתְנוּ לוֹ וְאַחַת לֹא נָתְנוּ לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְחַנֹּתִי אֶת אֲשֶׁר אָחוֹן״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן, ״וְרִחַמְתִּי אֶת אֲשֶׁר אֲרַחֵם״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן.
human_translation: disagrees with Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Meir said: Two were granted to him, and one was not granted to him. As it is said: “And I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious” even though he is not worthy. “And I will have mercy upon whom I will have mercy,” even though he is not worthy.
llm_translation: The dispute of Rabbi Meir, for Rabbi Meir said: Two they gave him and one they did not give him, as it is stated: "And I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion" — even though he is not deserving, "And I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy" — even though he is not deserving.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לֹא תוּכַל לִרְאוֹת אֶת פָּנָי״, תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה, כָּךְ אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: כְּשֶׁרָצִיתִי — לֹא רָצִיתָ, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאַתָּה רוֹצֶה — אֵינִי רוֹצֶה.
human_translation: “And He said: ‘You cannot see My face, it was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa that the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to as follows: When I wanted you did not want now that you want I do not want
llm_translation: "And He said, 'You cannot see My face,'" it was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha, thus said the Holy One, blessed be He, to Moses: 'When I desired - you did not desire, now that you desire - I do not desire.'"

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: בִּשְׂכַר שָׁלֹשׁ זָכָה לְשָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: disagrees with Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: as a reward for three was privileged three
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, Rabbi Yonatan said, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: "In reward three, merited for three."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׂכַר ״וַיַּסְתֵּר מֹשֶׁה פָּנָיו״ — זָכָה לִקְלַסְתֵּר פָּנִים. בִּשְׂכַר ״כִּי יָרֵא״ — זָכָה לְ״וַיִּירְאוּ מִגֶּשֶׁת אֵלָיו״. בִּשְׂכַר ״מֵהַבִּיט״ — זָכָה לְ״וּתְמֻנַת ה׳ יַבִּיט״.
human_translation: concealed his face, he was privileged to countenance [ kelaster ] he “feared,” he was privileged that “they feared to approach him” “gaze,” he was privileged to “behold the likeness of the Lord”
llm_translation: In reward "And Moses hid his face" — he merited to "hide faces." In reward "for he was afraid" — he merited "and they feared to approach him." In reward "from beholding" — he merited "the form of the Lord he beheld."

hebrew_text: ״וַהֲסִרֹתִי אֶת כַּפִּי וְרָאִיתָ אֶת אֲחֹרָי״. אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶרְאָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה קֶשֶׁר שֶׁל תְּפִילִּין.
human_translation: “And I will remove My hand, and you will see My back, Rav Ḥana bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida, This teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, showed him the knot of the phylacteries
llm_translation: "And you shall see My back." Rav Hanah bar Bizna said, Rabbi Shimon Chasida said: This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, showed Moses the knot of the tefillin.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כָּל דִּבּוּר וְדִבּוּר שֶׁיָּצָא מִפִּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְטוֹבָה, אֲפִילּוּ עַל תְּנַאי — לֹא חָזַר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Every statement that emerged from the mouth of the Holy One, Blessed be He, of good, even if it was conditional, He did not renege
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Every utterance and utterance that comes out from the mouth of the Holy One, blessed be He, for good, even on condition - it does not return void.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לָן — מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הֶרֶף מִמֶּנִּי וְאַשְׁמִידֵם וְגוֹ׳ וְאֶעֱשֶׂה אוֹתְךָ לְגוֹי עָצוּם״. אַף עַל גַּב דִּבְעָא מֹשֶׁה רַחֲמֵי עֲלַהּ דְּמִלְּתָא וּבַטְּלַהּ, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — אוֹקְמַהּ בְּזַרְעֵיהּ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה גֵּרְשׁוֹם וֶאֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַיִּהְיוּ בְנֵי אֱלִיעֶזֶר רְחַבְיָה הָרֹאשׁ וְגוֹ׳ וּבְנֵי רְחַבְיָה רָבוּ לְמָעְלָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where do we from Moses our teacher, said: “Leave Me alone; I will destroy them and I will make from you a nation mightier Even though prayed and was nullified, the promise was fulfilled descendants As it is stated “The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer…and the sons of Eliezer were Reḥaviya the chief. and the sons of Reḥaviya were very many”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Menah lan — mimMoshe rabbeinu, shene'emar 'heref mimenni ve'ashmideim ve'go,' ve'eseh ot'kha legoi atzum." Af al gav dib'a Moshe rachamei alah de'milta u'bat'lah, afilu hachi — okmaha bezar'ei. Shene'emar: "Benei Moshe ger'shom ve'eliezer. Vayihyu benei eliezer rechavyah harosh ve'go,' u'venei rechavyah ravu lema'alah ve'go'." English translation: "It was taught to us — from Moses our teacher, as it is said, 'Withdraw from Me and I will destroy them, and I will make you into a great nation.' Even though Moses sought mercy for it and nullified it, even so — it was established through his descendants. As it is said: 'The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer. And the sons of Eliezer were Rechavyah the chief, and so on. And the sons of Rechavyah multiplied greatly upwards, and so on.'"

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״לְמַעְלָה״ — מִשִּׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא, אַתְיָא ״רְבִיָּה״ ״רְבִיָּה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״רָבוּ לְמַעְלָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל פָּרוּ וַיִּשְׁרְצוּ וַיִּרְבּוּ״.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef taught “Many” than 600,000. many many. It is written here “Were very many.” And it is written there “And the children of Israel became numerous and multiplied and were very many,
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef teaches: "Above" - from sixty myriads, it comes "Rivya" "Rivya." It is written here: "They multiplied above," and it is written there: "And the children of Israel were fruitful and swarmed and multiplied."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מִיּוֹם שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת הָעוֹלָם, לֹא הָיָה אָדָם שֶׁקְּרָאוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא ״אָדוֹן״, עַד שֶׁבָּא אַבְרָהָם וּקְרָאוֹ אָדוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמַר אֲדֹנָי אֱלֹהִים בַּמָּה אֵדַע כִּי אִירָשֶׁנָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From the day that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created the world there was no person who called him “Lord” until Abraham came and called him Lord. As it is stated: “And he said, ‘My Lord, God, by what shall I know that I will inherit it?’”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From the day that the Holy One, blessed be He, created the world, no person called Him "Adon" until Abraham came and called Him Adon, as it is stated: "And he said, 'Adonai Elohim, how shall I know that I will inherit it?'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אַף דָּנִיאֵל לֹא נַעֲנָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל אַבְרָהָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַתָּה שְׁמַע אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֶל תְּפִלַּת עַבְדְּךָ וְאֶל תַּחֲנוּנָיו וְהָאֵר פָּנֶיךָ עַל מִקְדָּשְׁךָ הַשָּׁמֵם לְמַעַן אֲדֹנָי״, ״לְמַעַנְךָ״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav said: Even Daniel’s prayers were only answered on account of Abraham, as it is stated: “And now listen, God, to the prayer of Your servant and to his supplication; and cause Your face to shine upon Your desolate Temple, for the sake of the Lord” should have said: for Your sake,
llm_translation: Rav said: Even Daniel was answered only for the sake of Abraham, as it is stated: "Now, O our God, hearken unto the prayer of Your servant, and to his supplications, and cause Your face to shine upon Your sanctuary that is desolate, for the Lord's sake." "For Your sake" - he wanted.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא — לְמַעַן אַבְרָהָם שֶׁקְּרָאֲךָ ״אָדוֹן״.
human_translation: Rather, for the sake of Abraham, who called You, Lord.
llm_translation: Rather - for the sake of Abraham who called You "Adon."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין מְרַצִּין לוֹ לָאָדָם בִּשְׁעַת כַּעֲסוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פָּנַי יֵלֵכוּ וַהֲנִחוֹתִי לָךְ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From where that one must not placate a person while his anger? As it is stated: “My face will go, and I will give you rest”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From where do we derive that one should not appease a person in his time of anger? As it is stated: "My face shall go and I will give you rest."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מִיּוֹם שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת עוֹלָמוֹ לֹא הָיָה אָדָם שֶׁהוֹדָה לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, עַד שֶׁבָּאתָה לֵאָה וְהוֹדַתּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַפַּעַם אוֹדֶה אֶת ה׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From the day the Holy One, Blessed be He, created the world, no one thanked the Holy One, Blessed be He, until Leah came and thanked Him, as it is stated: ‘This time I will give thanks to God,’
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From the day that the Holy One, blessed be He, created His world, there was no person who acknowledged the Holy One, blessed be He, until Leah came and acknowledged Him, as it is stated: "This time I will thank the Lord."

hebrew_text: רְאוּבֵן. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמְרָה לֵאָה: רְאוּ מָה בֵּין בְּנִי לְבֶן חָמִי. דְּאִילּוּ בֶּן חָמִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִדַּעְתֵּיהּ זַבְּנַיהּ לִבְכֵירוּתֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּמְכֹּר אֶת בְּכֹרָתוֹ לְיַעֲקֹב״, חֲזוֹ מָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וַיִּשְׂטֹם עֵשָׂו אֶת יַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: Reuben. Rabbi Elazar said: Leah said: See [ re’u ] the difference between my son [ beni ] and the son of my father-in-law, Even though knowingly sold his birthright as it is written: “And he sold his birthright to Jacob” behold what is written him: “And Esau hated Jacob”
llm_translation: Reuben. Rabbi Elazar said: Leah said: See the difference between my son and my father-in-law. For if my father-in-law, even though he intended to sell him to his primogeniture, as it is written: "And he sold his birthright to Jacob," see what is written in it: "And Esau bore a grudge against Jacob."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הֲכִי קָרָא שְׁמוֹ יַעֲקֹב וַיַּעְקְבֵנִי זֶה פַעֲמַיִם״ וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: as it is written: “And he said, ‘Is he not rightly named Jacob, for he has supplanted me twice?
llm_translation: And it is written: "And He said, 'Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven with God and with men, and have prevailed.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ בְּנִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ שַׁקְלֵיהּ יוֹסֵף לִבְכֵירוּתֵיהּ מִנֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְחַלְּלוֹ יְצוּעֵי אָבִיו נִתְּנָה בְּכֹרָתוֹ לִבְנֵי יוֹסֵף״, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — לָא אִקַּנֵּא בֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע רְאוּבֵן וַיַּצִּלֵהוּ מִיָּדָם״.
human_translation: While my son, even though Joseph took his birthright from him by force, as it is written: but, since he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, Nevertheless, he was not jealous of him, as it is written “And Reuben heard and he saved him from their hands,
llm_translation: And if it were my sons, even though he Joseph took his Manasseh's share of the inheritance from him, as it is written: "But when he defiled his father's bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph," even so — I will not be jealous of him, as it is written: "And Reuben heard and delivered him out of their hand."

hebrew_text: רוּת, מַאי ״רוּת״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁזָּכְתָה וְיָצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד שֶׁרִיוָּהוּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּשִׁירוֹת וְתִשְׁבָּחוֹת.
human_translation: What is Ruth? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That she had the privilege that David, who inundated the Holy One, Blessed be He, with songs and praises, would descend from her.
llm_translation: Ruth, what is "Ruth"? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because she merited, and from her came forth David who would praise the Holy One, blessed be He, with songs and praises.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לַן דִּשְׁמָא גָּרֵים? אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לְכוּ חֲזוּ מִפְעֲלוֹת ה׳ אֲשֶׁר שָׂם שַׁמּוֹת בָּאָרֶץ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שַׁמּוֹת״ אֶלָּא ״שֵׁמוֹת״.
human_translation: From where do we that the name affects Rabbi Eliezer said the verse says: “Go, see the works of the Lord, who has made desolations [ shamot ] upon the earth” Do not read shamot , rather shemot , names.
llm_translation: We ask: Is it possible that converts are accepted? Rabbi Eliezer said, as the verse states: "Go and see the works of the Lord, who has made desolations in the earth." Do not read "desolations" (שמות) but rather "names" (שמות).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: קָשָׁה תַּרְבּוּת רָעָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם יוֹתֵר מִמִּלְחֶמֶת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד בְּבָרְחוֹ מִפְּנֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנוֹ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״ה׳ מָה רַבּוּ צָרָי רַבִּים קָמִים עָלָי״, וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי מִלְחֶמֶת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג, כְּתִיב: ״לָמָּה רָגְשׁוּ גוֹיִם וּלְאֻמִּים יֶהְגּוּ רִיק״. וְאִילּוּ ״מָה רַבּוּ צָרָי״ לָא כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: wayward in a person’s home is more troublesome than the war of Gog and Magog, As it is stated: “A Psalm of David, when he fled from his son, Absalom” And it is written thereafter: “Lord, how numerous are my enemies, many have risen against me” While concerning the war of Gog and Magog, it is written: “Why are the nations in an uproar? And why do the peoples speak for naught? Yet “how numerous are my enemies” is not written,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Bad manners in a person's house are more difficult than the war of Gog and Magog. As it is stated: "A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son," and it is written afterwards: "O Lord, how many are my adversaries! Many rise up against me." But regarding the war of Gog and Magog, it is written: "Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot in vain?" And regarding "how many are my adversaries," it is not written.

hebrew_text: ״מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד בְּבָרְחוֹ מִפְּנֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנוֹ״, ״מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד״?! ״קִינָה לְדָוִד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: “A Psalm of David, when fleeing his son, Absalom.” A Psalm of David? It should have A lament of David.
llm_translation: "Mizmor leDavid bevarcho mipnei Avshalom bno", "Mizmor leDavid"?! "Kinah leDavid" mibe'eilei lei!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֲבִישָׁלוֹם: מָשָׁל לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? — לְאָדָם שֶׁיָּצָא עָלָיו שְׁטַר חוֹב. קוֹדֶם שֶׁפְּרָעוֹ הָיָה עָצֵב, לְאַחַר שֶׁפְּרָעוֹ שָׂמַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Avishalom said a parable: To what is this similar? to a person about whom a promissory note was issued Before he repaid it, was despondent, After he repaid it, he was glad.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Avishalom said: What is the parable similar to? — To a person upon whom a debt document was issued. Before he paid it off, he was sad; after he paid it off, he was happy.

hebrew_text: אַף כֵּן דָּוִד, כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: ״הִנְנִי מֵקִים עָלֶיךָ רָעָה מִבֵּיתֶךָ״, הָיָה עָצֵב, אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא עֶבֶד אוֹ מַמְזֵר הוּא, דְּלָא חָיֵיס עֲלַי. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא דְּאַבְשָׁלוֹם הוּא — שָׂמַח. מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אֲמַר ״מִזְמוֹר״.
human_translation: So too David. When the Holy One, Blessed be He, told him, “Behold, I will raise up evil against you from your house” was despondent. He said: Perhaps a slave or a mamzer will have no pity on me. But once saw that Absalom was the one he rejoiced, That is why said a psalm,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even so, David, once the Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: "Behold, I will raise up evil against you from your own house," he was distressed, saying: Perhaps he is a slave or a mamzer, for he does not have mercy on me. Once he saw that it was Avshalom, he rejoiced. Therefore he said, "A psalm."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מוּתָּר לְהִתְגָּרוֹת בִּרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֹזְבֵי תוֹרָה יְהַלְלוּ רָשָׁע וְשֹׁמְרֵי תוֹרָה יִתְגָּרוּ בָם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: One is permitted to provoke the wicked in this world. as it is stated: “Those who abandon the Torah will praise wickedness, and the keepers of the Torah will fight them”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is permitted to engage with the wicked in this world, as it is stated: "Those who forsake the Torah praise the wicked, but those who keep the Torah contend with them."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בְּרַבִּי מָתוּן אוֹמֵר: מוּתָּר לְהִתְגָּרוֹת בִּרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֹזְבֵי תוֹרָה יְהַלְלוּ רָשָׁע״ וְגוֹ׳. וְאִם לְחָשְׁךָ אָדָם לוֹמַר: וְהָא כְּתִיב ״אַל תִּתְחַר בַּמְּרֵעִים אַל תְּקַנֵּא בְּעֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה״ — אֱמוֹר לוֹ: מִי שֶׁלִּבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ אוֹמֵר כֵּן. אֶלָּא: ״אַל תִּתְחַר בִּמְרֵעִים״ — לִהְיוֹת כַּמְּרֵעִים, ״אַל תְּקַנֵּא בְּעֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה״ — לִהְיוֹת כָּעוֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה.
human_translation: That was also taught Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Matun, says: One is permitted to provoke the wicked in this world, as it is stated: “Those who abandon the Torah will praise wickedness, And if someone whispered to you, saying, isn’t it written: “Do not compete with evil-doers, and do not envy the unjust” say to him: one whose heart strikes him says this. Rather, Do not compete with evil-doers, to be like the evil-doers, and do not envy the unjust to be like the unjust.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Dostai son of Rabbi Matun says: It is permitted to engage with the wicked in this world, as it is stated: "Forsakers of Torah will praise the wicked" etc. And if a person darkens your mind to say: But is it not written, "Do not contend with evildoers, and do not envy the wicked"? — Say to him: Let his heart that is pierced say so. Rather, "Do not contend with evildoers" — to be like evildoers, "and do not envy the wicked" — to be like the wicked.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״אַל יְקַנֵּא לִבְּךָ בַּחַטָּאִים כִּי אִם בְּיִרְאַת ה׳ כָּל הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: And it says: “One shall not envy the unjust, but be in fear of the Lord all the day”
llm_translation: And he says: "Do not be envious of sinners, but only in the fear of the Lord all day."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אִם רָאִיתָ רָשָׁע שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ אַל תִּתְגָּרֶה בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָחִילוּ דְרָכָיו בְּכָל עֵת״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁזּוֹכֶה בַּדִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מָרוֹם מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ מִנֶּגְדּוֹ״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁרוֹאֶה בְּצָרָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כָּל צוֹרְרָיו יָפִיחַ בָּהֶם״!
human_translation: Is this so? Didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak say: If you see a wicked person upon whom the hour is smiling, do not provoke him. As it is stated: “His ways prosper at all times; And not only that, but he emerges victorious in judgment, as it is stated: “Your judgments are far beyond him,” And not only that, but he witnesses his enemies’ as it is stated: “As for all his adversaries, he snorts at them.”
llm_translation: I?! And did not Rabbi Yitzchak say: If you see a wicked person for whom the hour is favorable, do not confront him, as it is stated: "His ways are always firm." Moreover, he merits judgment, as it is stated: "Your judgments are on high, facing him." Furthermore, he sees his distress, as it is stated: "All his adversaries he will blow away."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּמִילֵּי דִידֵיהּ, הָא בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא.
human_translation: This is not difficult, this, to his matters, while that, to matters of Heaven.
llm_translation: Not difficult, this in matters of ours, this in matters of Heaven.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא הָא וְהָא בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּרָשָׁע שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ, הָא בְּרָשָׁע שֶׁאֵין הַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that this, and that, to matters of Heaven, and, it is not difficult. This, to a wicked person upon whom the hour is smiling, While that, to a wicked person upon whom the hour is not smiling.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this are in matters of Heaven, and it is not difficult: this is regarding a wicked person for whom the hour plays, this is regarding a wicked person for whom the hour does not play.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא, בְּרָשָׁע שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא, בְּצַדִּיק גָּמוּר, הָא, בְּצַדִּיק שֶׁאֵינוֹ גָמוּר. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״לָמָּה תַבִּיט בּוֹגְדִים תַּחֲרִישׁ בְּבַלַּע רָשָׁע צַדִּיק מִמֶּנּוּ״, וְכִי רָשָׁע בּוֹלֵעַ צַדִּיק? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ה׳ לֹא יַעַזְבֶנּוּ בְיָדוֹ, וּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יְאֻנֶּה לַצַּדִּיק כָּל אָוֶן״. אֶלָּא: צַדִּיק מִמֶּנּוּ — בּוֹלֵעַ, צַדִּיק גָּמוּר — אֵינוֹ בּוֹלֵעַ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that this, and that, to a wicked person upon whom the hour is smiling, And not difficult. This, to a completely righteous person, while this, to one who is not completely righteous, as Rav Huna said: What is that which is written: “Why do You look on those who deal treacherously and hold Your peace? When the wicked swallows the man more righteous than he?” Do the wicked swallow the righteous? Isn’t it written: the Lord will not leave him in his hand, and it is written: “No mischief shall befall the righteous” Rather, The more righteous than he, he swallows. The completely righteous he does not swallow.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This one and this one, in the case of a wicked person for whom the hour mocks him, and it is not difficult; this one, in the case of a completely righteous person, this one, in the case of a not completely righteous person. For Rav Huna said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Why do you look at the treacherous, keep silent when the wicked swallows up the righteous?" Is the wicked one swallowing up the righteous? But it is written: "Hashem will not abandon him in his hand," and it is written: "No evil will befall the righteous." Rather, "the righteous from him" - he swallows up, "the completely righteous" - he does not swallow up.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, שָׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ — שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: when the hour is smiling upon him, it is different.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "A playful hour for him" - this is the explanation.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כָּל הַקּוֹבֵעַ מָקוֹם לִתְפִלָּתוֹ אוֹיְבָיו נוֹפְלִים תַּחְתָּיו. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי מָקוֹם לְעַמִּי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּנְטַעְתִּיו וְשָׁכַן תַּחְתָּיו וְלֹא יִרְגַּז עוֹד וְלֹא יֹסִיפוּ בְנֵי עַוְלָה לְעַנּוֹתוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: one who sets a fixed place for his prayer, his enemies fall beneath him, as it is said: “And I will appoint a place for My nation, Israel, and I will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place.” “be disturbed no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them anymore, as in the beginning”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Anyone who establishes a place for his prayer, his enemies fall beneath him. As it is stated: "And I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and I will plant them, and they will dwell in their place and not be disturbed anymore, and the sons of wickedness will no longer afflict them as they did at the beginning."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא רָמֵי כְּתִיב ״לְעַנּוֹתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְכַלּוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Huna raised a contradiction: : “To afflict them,” : “To destroy them.”
llm_translation: Rav Huna raises a contradiction: it is written "to afflict him," and it is written "to finish him."

hebrew_text: בַּתְּחִילָּה — לְעַנּוֹתוֹ, וּלְבַסּוֹף — לְכַלּוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: to afflict them, and, ultimately, destroy them
llm_translation: In the beginning - to humble him, and in the end - to complete him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: גְּדוֹלָה שִׁמּוּשָׁהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מִלִּמּוּדָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פֹּה אֱלִישָׁע בֶּן שָׁפָט אֲשֶׁר יָצַק מַיִם עַל יְדֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ״. ״לָמַד״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״יָצַק״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁגְּדוֹלָה שִׁמּוּשָׁהּ יוֹתֵר מִלִּמּוּדָהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Service of Torah is greater than its study, as it is stated: “Here is Elisha son of Shafat, who poured water over Elijah’s hands” does not say he learned rather he poured teaches the service of Torah is greater than its study.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Greater is the service of Torah than its study, as it is stated: "Here is Elisha the son of Shapat who poured water on the hands of Eliyahu." It does not say "learned," but rather "poured" - teaching that the service is greater than the study.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק לְרַב נַחְמָן: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָתֵי מָר לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא לְצַלּוֹיֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָכֵילְנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִכַּנְפִי לְמָר עַשְׂרָה וְלִיצַלֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טְרִיחָא לִי מִלְּתָא. וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ מָר לִשְׁלוּחָא דְצִבּוּרָא, בְּעִידָּנָא דִּמְצַלֵּי צִבּוּרָא לֵיתֵי וְלוֹדְעֵיהּ לְמָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said to Rav Naḥman: Why did the Master not come to the synagogue to pray? said to him: I was unable said to him: Let the Master gather ten and pray. said to him: It is difficult for me The Master should tell the congregation messenger when the congregation is praying to come and inform the Master
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yitzchak said to Rav Nachman: What is the reason that the Master does not come to the synagogue for prayers? He said to him: We are not able. He said to him: Go and gather ten people and pray. He said to him: It is difficult for me. And let the Master say to him, for the sending of the congregation, at the time when the congregation prays, let him come and inform the Master.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי:
human_translation: He asked: What is all this said to him: As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai:
llm_translation: He said to him, "What is the meaning of this?" He said to him, "As Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai:"

hebrew_text: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַאֲנִי תְפִלָּתִי לְךָ ה׳ עֵת רָצוֹן״. אֵימָתַי עֵת רָצוֹן — בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר מִתְפַּלְּלִין.
human_translation: What is that which is written: “But as for me, let my prayer be unto You, Lord, in a time of favor; When is a time of favor? at the time when the congregation is praying.
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of what is written, 'And I, my prayer is to You, Hashem, at an opportune time'? When is an opportune time? - When the congregation prays."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ בְּעֵת רָצוֹן עֲנִיתִיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said that from here: “Thus said the Lord, in a time of acceptance I have answered you and on a day of salvation I have aided you”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said from here: "So said the Lord, 'In an acceptable time I have answered you.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״הֶן אֵל כַּבִּיר וְלֹא יִמְאָס״: וּכְתִיב: ״פָּדָה בְשָׁלוֹם נַפְשִׁי מִקְּרָב לִי כִּי בְרַבִּים הָיוּ עִמָּדִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said from here: “Behold, God is mighty, He despises no one” And it is written: “He has redeemed my soul in peace so that none came upon me; for there were many with me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah son of Rabbi Hanina said from here: "Behold, God is mighty, and does not despise." And it is written: "He redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹאֵס בִּתְפִלָּתָן שֶׁל רַבִּים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֶן אֵל כַּבִּיר וְלֹא יִמְאָס״, וּכְתִיב: ״פָּדָה בְשָׁלוֹם נַפְשִׁי מִקְּרָב לִי״ וְגוֹ׳, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: כָּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּתוֹרָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים וּמִתְפַּלֵּל עִם הַצִּבּוּר — מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עָלָיו כְּאִילּוּ פְּדָאַנִי, לִי וּלְבָנַי, מִבֵּין אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: That was also taught Rabbi Natan says: From where do we know that the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not despise the prayer of the masses? As it is stated: “Behold, God does not despise the mighty,” and it is written: “He has redeemed my soul in peace so that none came upon me; The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: Anyone who engages in Torah and in acts of kindness, and prays with the congregation, I ascribe to him as if he redeemed Me and My children from among the nations of the world.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Natan says: From where do we derive that the Holy One, blessed be He, does not reject the prayer of the public? As it is stated: "Behold, God is exalted, and He does not reject" (Job 36:5). And it is also written: "He redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me" (Psalms 55:19). The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Anyone who engages in Torah study, performs acts of loving-kindness, and prays with the congregation—I consider it as if he has redeemed Me and My children from among the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּל מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּעִירוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ נִכְנָס שָׁם לְהִתְפַּלֵּל, נִקְרָא ״שָׁכֵן רַע״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ עַל כָּל שְׁכֵנַי הָרָעִים הַנֹּגְעִים בַּנַּחֲלָה אֲשֶׁר הִנְחַלְתִּי אֶת עַמִּי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁגּוֹרֵם גָּלוּת לוֹ וּלְבָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנְנִי נֹתְשָׁם מֵעַל אַדְמָתָם וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה אֶתּוֹשׁ מִתּוֹכָם״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: One who has a synagogue in his city but does not enter to pray there is called an evil neighbor, as it is stated: “Thus said the Lord: As for all My evil neighbors who touch My inheritance which I have caused My people Israel to inherit, And furthermore, he causes himself and his children exile, as it is stated: “Behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck the house of Judah up from among them.”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Anyone who has a synagogue in his city and does not enter there to pray is called a "bad neighbor," as it is stated: "Thus says the Lord concerning all my evil neighbors who touch the inheritance that I have given to my people, Israel." Moreover, he causes exile for himself and his children, as it is stated: "Behold, I will uproot them from their land and will uproot the house of Judah from among them."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִיכָּא סָבֵי בְּבָבֶל. תְּמַהּ וַאֲמַר: ״לְמַעַן יִרְבּוּ יְמֵיכֶם וִימֵי בְנֵיכֶם עַל הָאֲדָמָה״ כְּתִיב, אֲבָל בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — לָא? כֵּיוָן דְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ מְקַדְּמִי וּמְחַשְּׁכִי לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, אֲמַר: הַיְינוּ דְּאַהֲנִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: told Rabbi Yoḥanan there are elders in Babylonia, he was confounded and said: It is written: “So that your days will be lengthened and the days of your children upon the land but not outside of the Land. When they told him go early and go late to the synagogue, he said: That is what was effective for them
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Yochanan: There are elders in Babylon. He marveled and said: "So that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, upon the land" is written, but outside the land — not? Since they told him to go early and darken the synagogues, he said: This is what I am accustomed to.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לִבְנֵיהּ: קַדִּימוּ וְחַשִּׁיכוּ וְעַיִּילוּ לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתוֹרְכוּ חַיֵּי. אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי קְרָא — ״אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם שֹׁמֵעַ לִי לִשְׁקֹד עַל דַּלְתֹתַי יוֹם יוֹם לִשְׁמוֹר מְזוּזֹת פְּתָחָי״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״כִּי מֹצְאִי מָצָא חַיִּים״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to his sons: Go early and go late and enter the synagogue, so that your lives will be extended. Rabbi Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: what verse “Happy is the man who listens to Me, watching daily at My gates, guarding at My door posts” And is written thereafter: “For whoso finds Me finds life and obtains the favor of the Lord”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to his sons: "Go early and stay late in the synagogue, so that you may succeed in your lives." Rabbi Acha, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "What is the verse? 'Happy is the man who listens to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.' And it is written afterwards: 'For whoever finds me finds life.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לְעוֹלָם יִכָּנֵס אָדָם שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא, שִׁיעוּר שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A person should always enter two doorways into the synagogue. Does it enter your mind two doorways say one should enter a distance of two doorways and then pray.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A person should always enter the synagogue through two entrances. Two entrances, is it your opinion?! Rather, say, measure two entrances, and then pray.

hebrew_text: ״עַל זֹאת יִתְפַּלֵּל כָּל חָסִיד אֵלֶיךָ לְעֵת מְצֹא״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״לְעֵת מְצֹא״ זוֹ אִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מָצָא אִשָּׁה מָצָא טוֹב״.
human_translation: “For this, let every pious man pray to You in the time of finding, Rabbi Ḥanina said: The time of finding a wife, As it is said: “He who finds [ matza ] a wife finds [ matza ] good
llm_translation: "Regarding this, let every pious one pray to You at a time of finding," Rabbi Chanina said: "At a time of finding" - this refers to a woman, as it is stated: "He who finds a wife finds good."

hebrew_text: בְּמַעְרְבָא כִּי נָסֵיב אִינָשׁ אִתְּתָא, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״מָצָא״ אוֹ ״מוֹצֵא״? ״מָצָא״ דִּכְתִיב: ״מָצָא אִשָּׁה מָצָא טוֹב וַיָּפֶק רָצוֹן מֵה׳״, ״מוֹצֵא״ דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמוֹצֶא אֲנִי מָר מִמָּוֶת אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״ וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: In Eretz Yisrael, when a man married a woman, they would ask him: Matza or motzeh ? matza , as it is written: “He who finds a wife finds good and obtains favor from the Lord” motzeh , as it is written: “And I find [ motzeh ] the woman more bitter than death”
llm_translation: In the West, when a man marries a woman, they say to him thus: "Did you find her" or "Did you acquire her"? "Did you find her," as it is written: "He who finds a wife finds good and obtains favor from the Lord." "Did you acquire her," as it is written: "And I find more bitter than death the woman." And so on.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״לְעֵת מְצֹא״ — זוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מֹצְאִי מָצָא חַיִּים״ וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: The time of finding Torah, as it is stated “He who finds Me finds life.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: "At the time of finding" — this is the Torah, as it is stated: "For I have found life" etc.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר — ״לְעֵת מְצֹא״ זוֹ מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַמָּוֶת תּוֹצָאוֹת״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The time of finding death. as it is stated: “Issues [ totzaot ] of death”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said - "Le'et Metzoh" refers to death, as it is stated: "To death are the exits."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: תְּשַׁע מֵאוֹת וּשְׁלֹשָׁה מִינֵי מִיתָה נִבְרְאוּ בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַמָּוֶת תּוֹצָאוֹת״, ״תּוֹצָאוֹת״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא הָכִי הָווּ. קָשָׁה שֶׁבְּכֻלָּן — אַסְכָּרָא, נִיחָא שֶׁבְּכֻלָּן — נְשִׁיקָה. אַסְכָּרָא דָּמְיָא כְּחִיזְרָא בִּגְבָבָא דְעַמְרָא דִּלְאַחוֹרֵי נַשְׁרָא, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי כְּפִיטּוּרֵי בְּפִי וֶשֶׁט, נְשִׁיקָה דָּמְיָא כְּמִשְׁחַל בִּנִיתָא מֵחֲלָבָא.
human_translation: It was also taught Nine hundred and three types of death were created in the world, as it is stated: “Issues [ totzaot ] of death,” and that, is the numerical value [ gimatriya ] of totzaot the most difficult of is croup [ askara ], the easiest is kiss Croup is like a thorn in a wool fleece, which, when pulled out backwards, Some say that is like ropes at the entrance to the esophagus, kiss is like drawing a hair from milk.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Nine hundred and thirty-nine types of death were created in the world, as it is stated: "The outcomes of death." The word "outcomes" in this context were numerically equivalent. The most severe of them all is strangulation, and the most pleasant of them all is a kiss. Strangulation is like a piece of raw meat in the throat of a crow that is behind an eagle, and there are those who say it is like a piece of fat in the mouth of a snake. A kiss is like a piece of silk in the mouth of a baby.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״לְעֵת מְצֹא״ — זוֹ קְבוּרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מַאי קְרָא ״הַשְּׂמֵחִים אֱלֵי גִיל יָשִׂישׂוּ כִּי יִמְצְאוּ קָבֶר״. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: לִיבְעֵי אִינָשׁ רַחֲמֵי אֲפִילּוּ עַד זִיבּוּלָא בָּתְרָיְיתָא שְׁלָמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The time of finding burial, Rabbi Ḥanina said: What verse “Who rejoice in exultation and are glad when they can find a grave” Rabba bar Rav Sheila said, that is the folk saying: A person should even pray for mercy until the final shovelful is thrown
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "At the time of finding" — this refers to burial. Rabbi Chanina said, what is the verse "Those who rejoice at my vindication will shout for joy and gladness; they will say, 'The Lord be exalted, who delights in the well-being of his servant'" (Isaiah 49:13) teaching us? Rabba bar Rav Sheilah said, this is what people say: "May a person seek mercy, even until the last breath; it is well."

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: ״לְעֵת מְצֹא״ — זֶה בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא. אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: הָא דְּמָר זוּטְרָא עֲדִיפָא מִכֻּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: The time of finding a lavatory. In the West, they say: This of Mar Zutra is preferable to all of them,
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said: "Le'et Metzoh" - this refers to the toilet. They said in the West: The one that Mar Zutra mentioned is the most important of all.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא: לֵימָא לָן מָר מֵהָנֵי מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא בְּמִילֵּי דְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Rava said to Rafram bar Pappa: Let the Master say to us some of those outstanding statements that you said in the name of Rav Ḥisda with regard to matters of the synagogue.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava to Refram son of Papa: Let us say to our master from these matters of the upper world that you said in the name of Rav Chisda in matters of the synagogue.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״אֹהֵב ה׳ שַׁעֲרֵי צִיּוֹן מִכֹּל מִשְׁכְּנוֹת יַעֲקֹב״: אוֹהֵב ה׳ שְׁעָרִים הַמְצוּיָּינִים בַּהֲלָכָה, יוֹתֵר מִבָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּמִבָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: said to him, Rav Ḥisda said as follows: What is “The Lord loves the gates of Zion [ Tziyyon ] more than all the dwellings of Jacob” the Lord loves the gates distinguished [ metzuyanim ] through more than the synagogues and study halls.
llm_translation: He said to him, so said Rav Ḥisda: What is the meaning of what is written, "The Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob"? The Lord loves the gates that are established in halakha more than the synagogues and study halls.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין לוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּעוֹלָמוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל הֲלָכָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And this Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: Since the day the Temple, was destroyed, the Holy One, Blessed be He, has only in His world only the four cubits of halakha .
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Chiya bar Ami said in the name of Ulah: From the day the Temple was destroyed, the Holy One, blessed be He, has nothing in His world except for four cubits of halakha alone.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה גָּרֵיסְנָא בְּגוֹ בֵּיתָא וּמְצַלֵּינָא בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא. כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא — מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין לוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּעוֹלָמוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל הֲלָכָה בִּלְבַד — לָא הֲוָה מְצַלֵּינָא אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּגָרֵיסְנָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: At first I studied in the house and prayed in the synagogue. Once I heard what Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: Since the day the Temple was destroyed, the Holy One, Blessed be He, has only in His world, only the four cubits of halakha alone, I pray only where I study.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: Initially, we would eat in the house and pray in the synagogue. Once I heard what Rabbi Chiya bar Ami said in the name of Ulah: "Since the Temple was destroyed, the Holy One, blessed be He, has nothing in His world except for four cubits of Halacha alone." We only pray where we eat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי אַף עַל גַּב דַּהֲווֹ לְהוּ תְּלֵיסַר בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בִּטְבֶרְיָא לָא מְצַלּוּ אֶלָּא בֵּינֵי עַמּוּדֵי, הֵיכָא דַּהֲווֹ גָּרְסִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, despite that they had thirteen synagogues in Tiberias, they would only pray between the pillars where they studied.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, even though they were thirteen years old, did not pray except between the pillars, where they were learning.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: גָּדוֹל הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִיגִיעוֹ יוֹתֵר מִיְּרֵא שָׁמַיִם, דְּאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי יְרֵא שָׁמַיִם כְּתִיב ״אַשְׁרֵי אִישׁ יָרֵא אֶת ה׳״, וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי נֶהֱנָה מִיגִיעוֹ כְּתִיב: ״יְגִיעַ כַּפֶּיךָ כִּי תֹאכֵל אַשְׁרֶיךָ וְטוֹב לָךְ״. ״אַשְׁרֶיךָ״ — בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״וְטוֹב לָךְ״ — לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, וּלְגַבֵּי יְרֵא שָׁמַיִם, ״וְטוֹב לָךְ״ לָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: One who benefits from his hard labor is greater than a God-fearing As with regard to a God-fearing it is written: “Happy is the man who fears the Lord, while with regard to one who benefits from his hard work, it is written: “By the labor of your hands you will live; you are happy and it is good for you” you are happy in this world, and it is good for you in the World-to-Come. And regarding a God-fearing and it is good for you, is not written about him.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Ami said in the name of Ulai: Greater is one who benefits from his own labor than one who fears Heaven, for regarding one who fears Heaven it is written, "Happy is the man who fears the Lord," and regarding one who benefits from his own labor it is written, "When you eat the labor of your hands, you will be happy and it will be well with you." "You will be happy" - in this world, "and it will be well with you" - in the world to come. And regarding one who fears Heaven, "and it will be well with you" is not written concerning him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: לְעוֹלָם יָדוּר אָדָם בִּמְקוֹם רַבּוֹ, שֶׁכָּל זְמַן שֶׁשִּׁמְעִי בֶּן גֵּרָא קַיָּים, לֹא נָשָׂא שְׁלֹמֹה אֶת בַּת פַּרְעֹה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: One should always live in the place where his teacher For as long as Shimi ben Gera, was alive, Solomon did not marry Pharaoh’s daughter.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Ami said in the name of Ulah: A person should always reside in his teacher's place, for as long as Shimi ben Gera is alive, Solomon did not marry the daughter of Pharaoh.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא אַל יָדוּר!
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught should not live
llm_translation: And it was taught: "One should not dwell!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דִּכְיִיף לֵיהּ, הָא דְּלָא כְּיִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This is not difficult. This, where he is acquiescent to While this where he is not acquiescent to him
llm_translation: Not difficult, this that he likes, this that he does not like.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי מְנַחֵם, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״וְעוֹזְבֵי ה׳ יִכְלוּ״ — זֶה הַמַּנִּיחַ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rabbi Menaḥem said Rabbi Ami said: What is that which is written: “They who forsake the Lord will perish” This refers to one who abandons the Torah and leaves
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Yehuda said, Rabbi Menachem said, Rabbi Ammi said: What is the meaning of what is written, "And those who forsake the Lord shall perish" - this refers to one who neglects the Torah scroll and departs.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ נָפֵיק בֵּין גַּבְרָא לְגַבְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu would go out between person and the person
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu went out between man to man.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: בֵּין פְּסוּקָא לִפְסוּקָא מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: What is between verse and verse?
llm_translation: The question of Rav Papa: What is the difference between one verse and another verse?

hebrew_text: תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: stands
llm_translation: The case is unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ וְגָרֵיס. אָמַר: אֲנַן בְּדִידַן וְאִינְהוּ בְּדִידְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet would turn his face and study. he said: We are in ours, and they are in theirs,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet adorned his face and studied. He said: "We are diligent, and they are diligent."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: לְעוֹלָם יַשְׁלִים אָדָם פָּרָשִׁיּוֹתָיו עִם הַצִּבּוּר. שְׁנַיִם מִקְרָא וְאֶחָד תַּרְגּוּם.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rabbi Ami said: A person should always complete his portions with the congregation. Bible twice and translation once.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Yehuda said, Rabbi Ammi said: A person should always complete his portions with the congregation. Two verses and one translation.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ ״עֲטָרוֹת וְדִיבֹן״. שֶׁכָּל הַמַּשְׁלִים פָּרָשִׁיּוֹתָיו עִם הַצִּבּוּר מֵאֲרִיכִין לוֹ יָמָיו וּשְׁנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: even “Atarot and Divon as one who completes his portions with the congregation his days and years are extended.
llm_translation: "And even 'Atarot and Dibon.' For all those who expound his verses in public, his days and years are prolonged."

hebrew_text: רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי סָבַר לְאַשְׁלוֹמִינְהוּ לְפָרָשְׁיָיתָא דְּכֹלָּא שַׁתָּא בְּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרֵי, תְּנָא לֵיהּ חִיָּיא בַּר רַב מִדִּפְתִּי: כְּתִיב: ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם בְּתִשְׁעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ בָּעֶרֶב״.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye thought to finish all the portions of the entire year, on the eve of Yom Kippur Ḥiyya bar Rav of Difti taught him: It is written “And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth day of the month in the evening,
llm_translation: Rav Bibi son of Abbaye holds to make peace with them for the sake of the community every six hours of Yom Kippur. Hiyya son of Rav from Difti taught him: It is written, "And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth of the month in the evening."

hebrew_text: וְכִי בְּתִשְׁעָה מִתְעַנִּין?! וַהֲלֹא בַּעֲשָׂרָה מִתְעַנִּין! אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ כָּל הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה בִּתְשִׁיעִי, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ מִתְעַנֶּה תְּשִׁיעִי וַעֲשִׂירִי.
human_translation: And does one fast on the ninth Doesn’t one fast on the tenth of Tishrei, Rather, to tell you: One who eats and drinks on the ninth the verse ascribes him as if he fasted on the ninth and the tenth
llm_translation: "And is it on the ninth that they fast?! But isn't it on the tenth that they fast! Rather, to tell you that anyone who eats and drinks on the ninth, the Scripture accounts it to him as if he had fasted on the ninth and the tenth."

hebrew_text: סָבַר לְאַקְדּוֹמִינְהוּ, אָמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא, תְּנֵינָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַקְדִּים וְשֶׁלֹּא יְאַחֵר.
human_translation: he thought to earlier, A certain elder told him, we learned: As long as one does not earlier or later
llm_translation: He thought to outsmart them, that elder said to him, "We learned: 'And only that he not precede and not delay.'"

hebrew_text: כְּדַאֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לִבְנֵיהּ: אַשְׁלִימוּ פָּרָשְׁיוֹתַיְיכוּ עִם הַצִּבּוּר שְׁנַיִם מִקְרָא וְאֶחָד תַּרְגּוּם.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi told his sons: Complete your portions with the congregation, the Bible twice and translation once.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to his sons: Complete your portions with the congregation, two verses in Hebrew and one in Aramaic.

hebrew_text: וְהִזָּהֲרוּ בִּוְרִידִין כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁחוֹט אֶת הַוְּרִידִין.
human_translation: Be careful with the veins, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: until he slaughters the veins
llm_translation: Be cautious with the vridin like Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: Until one slaughters the vridin.

hebrew_text: וְהִזָּהֲרוּ בְּזָקֵן שֶׁשָּׁכַח תַּלְמוּדוֹ מֵחֲמַת אוֹנְסוֹ. דְּאָמְרִינַן: לוּחוֹת וְשִׁבְרֵי לוּחוֹת מוּנָּחוֹת בָּאָרוֹן.
human_translation: And be careful an elder who has forgotten his knowledge due to beyond his control. As we say: the tablets and the broken tablets are placed in the Ark
llm_translation: Be cautious with an elderly person who forgot his learning due to circumstances beyond his control. As we say: "The tablets and the broken tablets were placed in the Ark."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְהוּ רָבָא לִבְנֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁאַתֶּם חוֹתְכִין בָּשָׂר, אַל תַּחְתְּכוּ עַל גַּב הַיָּד. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: מִשּׁוּם סַכָּנָה. וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: מִשּׁוּם קִלְקוּל סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: Rava said to his sons When you cut meat, do not cut it on your hand. Some say: Due to danger and some say: Due to ruin the meal,
llm_translation: Rava said to his sons: When you are cutting meat, do not cut on the back of the hand. Some say: Due to danger. And some say: Due to spoiling the meal.

hebrew_text: וְאַל תֵּשְׁבוּ עַל מִטַּת אֲרַמִּית, וְאַל תַּעַבְרוּ אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר מִתְפַּלְּלִין. וְאַל תֵּשְׁבוּ עַל מִטַּת אֲרַמִּית, אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי לָא תִּגְנוֹ בְּלָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי דְּלָא תִּנְסְבוּ גִּיּוֹרְתָא. וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲרַמִּית מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: And Do not sit on the bed of an Aramean woman, and do not pass by a synagogue when the community is praying. Some say: Do not sit on the bed of an Aramean woman one should not go to sleep without reciting Shema, Others say: one should not marry a woman who converted, And some say: literally an Aramean, woman.
llm_translation: And do not sit on a bed of an Aramean, and do not pass behind the synagogue when the congregation is praying. And do not sit on a bed of an Aramean, some say do not defecate without reciting the Shema, and some say do not engage in marital relations. And some say, it is truly Aramaic.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה דְרַב פָּפָּא. דְּרַב פָּפָּא אֲזַל לְגַבֵּי אֲרַמִּית, הוֹצִיאָה לוֹ מִטָּה. אָמְרָה לוֹ: שֵׁב! אָמַר לָהּ: אֵינִי יוֹשֵׁב, עַד שֶׁתַּגְבִּיהִי אֶת הַמִּטָּה. הִגְבִּיהָה אֶת הַמִּטָּה וּמָצְאוּ שָׁם תִּינוֹק מֵת. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אָסוּר לֵישֵׁב עַל מִטַּת אֲרַמִּית.
human_translation: due to an incident Rav Pappa. Rav Pappa went to an Aramean woman. She took out a bed she said to him: Sit. He said to her: I will not sit until you lift the bed. and they found a dead baby there. From the Sages said: One is prohibited from sitting on the bed of an Aramean woman.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And because of the incident involving Rav Papa. Rav Papa went to the house of an Aramean, she brought out a bed for him. She said to him: Sit! He said to her: I will not sit until you raise the bed. She raised the bed and they found a dead baby there. From here the sages said: It is forbidden to sit on an Aramean bed.

hebrew_text: וְאַל תַּעַבְרוּ אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר מִתְפַּלְּלִין — מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר מִתְפַּלְּלִין.
human_translation: And do not pass behind a synagogue while the congregation is praying. This supports Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One is prohibited from passing behind a synagogue while the congregation is praying
llm_translation: And do not pass behind the synagogue when the congregation is praying - Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is supported. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is forbidden for a person to pass behind the synagogue when the congregation is praying.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא פִּתְחָא אַחֲרִינָא, אֲבָל אִיכָּא פִּתְחָא אַחֲרִינָא — לֵית לָן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא אַחֲרִינָא, אֲבָל אִיכָּא בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא אַחֲרִינָא — לֵית לָן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא דָּרֵי טוּנָא, וְלָא רָהֵיט, וְלָא מַנַּח תְּפִילִּין, אֲבָל אִיכָּא חַד מֵהָנָךְ — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: We only said there is no other entrance but there is does not apply. And we only said there is no other synagogue but there is another synagogue, does not apply. And we only said he is not carrying a burden, and not running, and not wearing phylacteries. But one of those applies does not apply.
llm_translation: Abaye said: And we only said this when there is no other entrance, but if there is another entrance - we do not have it. And we only said this when there is no other synagogue, but if there is another synagogue - we do not have it. And we only said this when he does not wear a turban, and is not a rider, and does not lay tefillin, but if one of these is present - we do not have it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְבָרִים אוֹהֵב אֲנִי אֶת הַמָּדִיִּים, כְּשֶׁחוֹתְכִין אֶת הַבָּשָׂר — אֵין חוֹתְכִין אֶלָּא עַל גַּבֵּי הַשּׁוּלְחָן, כְּשֶׁנּוֹשְׁקִין — אֵין נוֹשְׁקִין אֶלָּא עַל גַּב הַיָּד, וּכְשֶׁיּוֹעֲצִין — אֵין יוֹעֲצִין אֶלָּא בַּשָּׂדֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: In three aspects I like the Medes, When they cut meat, they cut it only on the table when they kiss, they kiss only the back of the hand when they hold counsel, they only hold counsel in the field
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said: In three things I love the Medes: when they cut meat, they only cut on the table; when they kiss, they only kiss on the hand; and when they give advice, they only give advice in the field.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: מַאי קְרָאָה ״וַיִּשְׁלַח יַעֲקֹב וַיִּקְרָא לְרָחֵל וּלְלֵאָה הַשָּׂדֶה אֶל צֹאנוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: what verse “And Jacob sent and he called Rachel and Leah to the field to his flock”
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: What is the verse "And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field to his flock" (Genesis 31:4) referring to?

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְבָרִים אוֹהֵב אֲנִי אֶת הַפַּרְסִיִּים: הֵן צְנוּעִין בַּאֲכִילָתָן, וּצְנוּעִין בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וּצְנוּעִין בְּדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: It was taught Rabban Gamliel said: In three aspects I like the Persians: they are modest in their eating, they are modest in the lavatory, and they are modest in another matter,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabban Gamliel said: In three things I love the Persians: They are modest in their eating, modest in the restroom, and modest in their speech.

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי צִוֵּיתִי לִמְקֻדָּשָׁי״, תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵלּוּ הַפַּרְסִיִּים הַמְקוּדָּשִׁין וּמְזוּמָּנִין לְגֵיהִנָּם.
human_translation: “I have commanded My consecrated ones; Rav Yosef taught These are the Persians who are consecrated and designated for Gehenna,
llm_translation: "I have commanded My consecrated ones," Rav Yosef teaches: These are the Persians who are sanctified and prepared for their Gehinnom.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says and so forth: Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים בַּלַּיְלָה, אַחַת קוֹדֶם שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר וְאַחַת לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר, וְיוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ אַחַת שֶׁל יוֹם וְאַחַת שֶׁל לַיְלָה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai said: At times, one recites Shema twice at night, once before dawn and once after dawn, and he thereby fulfills his obligation one of the day and one of the night.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says, "There are times when a person recites the Shema twice at night, once before the pillar of dawn rises and once after the pillar of dawn rises, thereby fulfilling his obligation, one of the day and one of the night."

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים בַּלַּיְלָה, אַלְמָא לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר לֵילְיָא הוּא, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ אַחַת שֶׁל יוֹם וְאַחַת שֶׁל לַיְלָה, אַלְמָא יְמָמָא הוּא!
human_translation: This is self-contradictory. you said: At times one recites Shema twice at night. Apparently, after dawn is night. And then you taught: He thereby fulfills his obligation one of the day and one of the night. Apparently, is day,
llm_translation: This is a difficult matter, as it is said: "Sometimes a person recites the Shema twice at night, implying that after the pillar of dawn rises, it is still night." And then it teaches: "He fulfills with them one obligation of the day and one obligation of the night," indicating that it is considered daytime!

hebrew_text: לָא — לְעוֹלָם לֵילְיָא הוּא. וְהָא דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יוֹם״ — דְּאִיכָּא אִינָשֵׁי דְּקָיְימִי בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא.
human_translation: No, Actually, is night and the fact that it is referred to day there are people who rise at that time
llm_translation: Not — forever night he is. And that which reads in it "day" — for there are people who are standing at that hour.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ḥanina said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai.
llm_translation: Said Rav Acha bar Chanina, said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אַהָא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים בַּיּוֹם, אַחַת קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה, וְאַחַת לְאַחַר הַנֵּץ הַחַמָּה, וְיוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ, אַחַת שֶׁל יוֹם וְאַחַת שֶׁל לַיְלָה.
human_translation: Some teach this of Rav Aḥa bar Ḥanina, with regard to this As it was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: At times, one recites Shema twice during the day, once before sunrise and once after sunrise, and he thereby fulfills his obligation One, of the day, and one, of the night.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches in the name of Rav Acha bar Chanina: It was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: Sometimes when a person recites the Shema prayer twice a day, once before the rising of the sun, and once after the rising of the sun, he fulfills his obligation, one during the day and one at night.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא. אָמְרַתְּ פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים בַּיּוֹם, אַלְמָא קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה יְמָמָא הוּא, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ אַחַת שֶׁל יוֹם וְאַחַת שֶׁל לַיְלָה, אַלְמָא לֵילְיָא הוּא!
human_translation: This is self-contradictory. you said: “At times one recites Shema twice during the day.” Apparently, before sunrise is day. And then you taught: “He thereby fulfills his obligation one of the day and one of the night.” Apparently, is night,
llm_translation: The matter is difficult. You said: "When a person recites the Shema twice a day, it implies that before the sunrise is daytime, and afterwards, he fulfills one obligation of the day and one of the night, thus it must be nighttime!"

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם יְמָמָא הוּא, וְהַאי דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ ״לֵילְיָא״ — דְּאִיכָּא אִינָשֵׁי דְּגָנוּ בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא.
human_translation: No, Actually, is day and the fact that it is referred to night there are people who asleep at that time
llm_translation: Not, forever, day it is, and this that they called to it "night" - that there are people who sleep at that time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר ״הַשְׁכִּיבֵנוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon who said in the name of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Zeira said: As long as he will not recite: Help us lie down [ hashkivenu ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah son of Rabbi Hanina said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon who said in the name of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Zeira said: And only that he should not say "Hashkiveinu."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר: הָא דְּרַבִּי אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, לָאו בְּפֵירוּשׁ אִיתְּמַר, אֶלָּא מִכְּלָלָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: when Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said this Rabbi Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi was not said explicitly Rather, it was stated based on inference.
llm_translation: When Rav Yitzchak son of Yosef came, he said: This that Rabbi Ahah son of Rabbi Chanina said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, was not stated explicitly, but was derived from a general principle.

hebrew_text: דְּהָהוּא זוּגָא דְּרַבָּנַן דְּאִשְׁתַּכּוּר בְּהִלּוּלָא דִּבְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אֲמַר: כְּדַאי הוּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לִסְמוֹךְ עָלָיו בִּשְׁעַת הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: This pair of Sages got drunk at the wedding of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi’s son They came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi He said Rabbi Shimon is worthy to rely upon in exigent circumstances.
llm_translation: The pair of sages, who were intoxicated with the wine of the words of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. He said: "It is fitting for Rabbi Shimon to rely on him in a time of distress."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּאוּ בָּנָיו וְכוּ׳:
human_translation: incident sons returned from a wedding hall
llm_translation: The matter that his sons came and so forth.

hebrew_text: וְעַד הַשְׁתָּא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לְהוּ הָא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל?!
human_translation: And until now, had they not heard this of Rabban Gamliel?
llm_translation: And until now not heard to them this of Rabban Gamliel?!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: רַבָּנַן פְּלִיגִי עִילָּווֹךְ, וְיָחִיד וְרַבִּים, הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים, אוֹ דִּלְמָא רַבָּנַן כְּווֹתָךְ סְבִירָא לְהוּ, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמְרִי ״עַד חֲצוֹת״ — כְּדֵי לְהַרְחִיק אָדָם מִן הָעֲבֵירָה. אָמַר לְהוּ: רַבָּנָן כְּווֹתִי סְבִירָא לְהוּ, וְחַיָּיבִין אַתֶּם. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמְרִי ״עַד חֲצוֹת״ — כְּדֵי לְהַרְחִיק אָדָם מִן הָעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: they said to him as follows: Do the Rabbis disagree with you an individual and many the halakha is in accordance with many, Or perhaps, do the Rabbis hold your and that which they say until midnight in order to distance a person from transgression? replied to his sons: The Rabbis agree with me and you are obligated say until midnight in order to distance a person from transgression,
llm_translation: So they said to him: The sages dispute the verse, and an individual and the majority, the halacha follows the majority. Or perhaps the sages agree with you, and this that they say "until midnight" - in order to distance a person from transgression. He said to them: The sages agree with you, and you are obligated. And this that they say "until midnight" - in order to distance a person from transgression.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא זוֹ בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא וְכוּ׳:
human_translation: And not only but, rather,
llm_translation: And not this alone they said, but and so forth.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִי קָאָמַר ״עַד חֲצוֹת״ דְּקָתָנֵי ״וְלֹא זוֹ בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ״?
human_translation: Does Rabban Gamliel say until midnight, that he teaches: And not only did they say?
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel, who is he saying "until midnight," as it is taught "and not this alone did they say"?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לִבְנֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּקָאָמְרִי ״עַד חֲצוֹת״, מִצְוָתָהּ עַד שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר. וְהַאי דְּקָא אָמְרִי עַד חֲצוֹת — כְּדֵי לְהַרְחִיק אָדָם מִן הָעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: this is what Rabban Gamliel said to his sons: Even according to the Rabbis, who say until midnight, the mitzva until dawn, and that which they say until midnight in order to distance a person from transgression.
llm_translation: Thus was Rabban Gamliel saying to his sons: Even according to the sages who say "until midnight," its obligation is until the pillar of dawn ascends. And this that they say "until midnight" - in order to distance a person from transgression.

hebrew_text: הֶקְטֵר חֲלָבִים וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: the burning of fats and limbs
llm_translation: The incense of fats, etc.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ אֲכִילַת פְּסָחִים לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: the eating of the Paschal lamb was not taught
llm_translation: And if eating of Passover sacrifices not it teaches.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע עַרְבִית, וְהַלֵּל בְּלֵילֵי פְּסָחִים, וַאֲכִילַת פֶּסַח, מִצְוָתָן עַד שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר!
human_translation: raises a contradiction The mitzvot of the recitation of the evening Shema, hallel on the nights of Passover as well as eating the Paschal lamb, until dawn.
llm_translation: And ask: The reading of the Shema in the evening, and Hillel on the nights of Passover, and the eating of the Passover offering, their obligation is until the pillar of dawn rises!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, הָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״וְעָבַרְתִּי בְאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, מַה לְּהַלָּן עַד חֲצוֹת, אַף כָּאן עַד חֲצוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is not difficult This, is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. While this, is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught “And they shall eat of the meat on that night; Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: Here it is stated: “On that night,” “And I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night just as below, until midnight, so too here, until midnight.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult. Here we have Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and here we have Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught: "And they shall eat the flesh in that night," Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: It is stated here "in that night," and it is stated there: "And I will pass through the land of Egypt in that night," just as there until midnight, so too here until midnight.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״בְּחִפָּזוֹן״, עַד שְׁעַת חִפָּזוֹן. אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּלַּיְלָה״?
