human_translation: “The dead know nothing.” These are the wicked, who during their lives are called dead, as said “And you are a slain, wicked prince of Israel” And if you wish, say from here: “At the mouth of two witnesses or three witnesses the dead shall be put to death” is alive. Rather, dead from the outset.
llm_translation: "And the dead know nothing" - these are the wicked, who in their lifetime are called "dead," as it is stated: "But you are cast out of your grave like an abominable branch." And if you wish, say, from here: "At the mouth of two witnesses or at the mouth of three witnesses shall the dead be put to death," he is alive! Rather, the dead from the outset.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא נְפוּק לְקִרְיָיתָא. אִייַּקַּר לְהוּ תַּלְמוּדַיְיהוּ. הֲווֹ קָא מִצַּעֲרִי לְאִדְּכוֹרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ: יָדַע אֲבוּן בְּהַאי צַעֲרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: מְנָא יָדַע? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״יִכְבְּדוּ בָנָיו וְלֹא יֵדָע״.
human_translation: The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya went out to the villages They forgot what they had learned and were struggling to recall it. One said to the other: our father know of anguish? The other said to him: From where would he know? Isn’t it written: “His sons are honored yet he shall not know it,
llm_translation: Sons of Rabbi Chiya went out to the village. They were honored by them. They were causing them distress. One of them said to his companions: Does he know the pain in this distress? The other said to him: How do you know? But isn't it written: "His sons are honored, and he does not know"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: וְלָא יָדַע? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״אַךְ בְּשָׂרוֹ עָלָיו יִכְאָב וְנַפְשׁוֹ עָלָיו תֶּאֱבָל״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קָשָׁה רִמָּה לַמֵּת כְּמַחַט בַּבָּשָׂר הַחַי!
human_translation: The other said to him: And not know? Isn’t it written: “Only in his flesh does he feel pain, in his soul does he mourn” Rabbi Yitzḥak said: maggots are as excruciating to the dead as a needle to the flesh of the living.
llm_translation: He said to him: And did you not know? But it is written: "Yet his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: The deceit is difficult for the dead, like a needle in the flesh of the living!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: בְּצַעֲרָא דִידְהוּ — יָדְעִי, בְּצַעֲרָא דְאַחֲרִינָא — לָא יָדְעִי.
human_translation: they said: know of their own pain but do not know of the pain of others.
llm_translation: They said: In their own pain - they know, in the pain of others - they do not know.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָסִיד אֶחָד שֶׁנָּתַן דִּינָר לְעָנִי בְּעֶרֶב רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת, וְהִקְנִיטַתּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהָלַךְ וְלָן בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת. וְשָׁמַע שְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת שֶׁמְסַפְּרוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ. אָמְרָה חֲדָא לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ: חֲבֶרְתִּי, בּוֹאִי וְנָשׁוּט בָּעוֹלָם, וְנִשְׁמַע מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד מַה פּוּרְעָנוּת בָּא לָעוֹלָם? אָמְרָה לָהּ חֲבֶרְתָּהּ: אֵינִי יְכוֹלָה, שֶׁאֲנִי קְבוּרָה בְּמַחְצֶלֶת שֶׁל קָנִים. אֶלָּא לְכִי אַתְּ, וּמַה שֶּׁאַתְּ שׁוֹמַעַת אִמְרִי לִי. הָלְכָה הִיא וְשָׁטָה וּבָאָה. וְאָמְרָה לָהּ חֲבֶרְתָּהּ: חֲבֶרְתִּי, מַה שָּׁמַעְתְּ מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד? אָמְרָה לָהּ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁכָּל הַזּוֹרֵעַ בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה בָּרָד מַלְקֶה אוֹתוֹ. הָלַךְ הוּא וְזָרַע בִּרְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה. שֶׁל כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לָקָה, שֶׁלּוֹ — לֹא לָקָה.
human_translation: And not Wasn’t it taught an incident involving a pious man who gave a poor man a dinar on the eve of Rosh HaShana during drought years, and his wife mocked him And he went and slept in the cemetery. he heard two spirits conversing with each other. One said to the other: My friend, let us roam the world and hear from behind the heavenly curtain [ pargod ], what calamity will befall the world. The other spirit said to her: cannot as I am buried in a mat of reeds, but you go, and tell me what you hear. She went, and roamed, and came The other spirit said: My friend, what did you hear from behind the heavenly curtain? She replied: I heard that anyone who sows during the first rainy season hail strike his went and sowed during the second rainy season. the entire world were stricken and his were not stricken.
llm_translation: And not? And it was taught: There was an incident with a certain pious man who gave a dinar to a poor person on the eve of Rosh Hashanah in two purses, and his wife incited him, and he went and lodged in a cemetery. And he heard two spirits conversing with each other. One said to her companion: My companion, come and let us roam in the world, and we will listen from behind the curtain what punishment comes to the world. Her companion said to her: I cannot, for I am buried in a reed mat. Instead, you go, and whatever you hear, tell me. She went, roamed, and returned. And her companion said to her: My companion, what did you hear from behind the curtain? She said to her: I heard that anyone who sows in the first quarter will be struck by hail. He went and sowed in the second quarter. The entire world was struck, but his was not struck.

hebrew_text: לַשָּׁנָה הָאַחֶרֶת הָלַךְ וְלָן בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְשָׁמַע אוֹתָן שְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת שֶׁמְסַפְּרוֹת זוֹ עִם זוֹ. אָמְרָה חֲדָא לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ: בּוֹאִי וְנָשׁוּט בָּעוֹלָם וְנִשְׁמַע מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד מַה פּוּרְעָנוּת בָּא לָעוֹלָם. אָמְרָה לָהּ: חֲבֶרְתִּי, לֹא כָּךְ אָמַרְתִּי לָךְ, אֵינִי יְכוֹלָה שֶׁאֲנִי קְבוּרָה בְּמַחְצֶלֶת שֶׁל קָנִים?! אֶלָּא לְכִי אַתְּ, וּמַה שֶּׁאַתְּ שׁוֹמַעַת בּוֹאִי וְאִמְרִי לִי. הָלְכָה וְשָׁטָה וּבָאָה. וְאָמְרָה לָהּ חֲבֶרְתָּהּ: חֲבֶרְתִּי, מַה שָּׁמַעְתְּ מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד? אָמְרָה לָהּ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁכָּל הַזּוֹרֵעַ בִּרְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה שִׁדָּפוֹן מַלְקֶה אוֹתוֹ. הָלַךְ וְזָרַע בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁל כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ נִשְׁדַּף וְשֶׁלּוֹ לֹא נִשְׁדַּף.
human_translation: The following year, went and slept in the cemetery he heard the two spirits conversing with each other. One said to the other: Let us roam the world and hear from behind the heavenly curtain what calamity will befall the world. She said to her: My friend, have I not told you I cannot, as I am buried in a mat of reeds? Rather, you go, and tell me what you hear. She went, and roamed, and returned. The other said to her: My friend, what did you hear from behind the curtain? She said to her: I heard that those who sow during the second rainy season blight will strike his went and sowed during the first rainy season. of the entire world were blighted and his were not blighted.
llm_translation: In the following year, he went and lodged in the cemetery, and heard two spirits conversing with one another. One said to her companion: "Come, let us roam the world and hear from behind the curtain what punishment comes to the world." She said to her: "My companion, this is not what I told you. Can I, who am buried in a thornbush of reeds, do so?! Rather, you go, and whatever you hear, come and tell me." She went, roamed, and returned. Her companion said to her: "My companion, what did you hear from behind the curtain?" She said to her: "I heard that anyone who sows in the fourth year, his crop is smitten." He went and sowed in the first year, his entire crop was smitten, but his was not smitten.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֶשְׁתָּקַד שֶׁל כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לָקָה וְשֶׁלְּךָ לֹא לָקָה, וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁל כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ נִשְׁדַּף וְשֶׁלְּךָ לֹא נִשְׁדַּף? סָח לָהּ כָּל הַדְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ. אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִים עַד שֶׁנָּפְלָה קְטָטָה בֵּין אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ חָסִיד וּבֵין אִמָּהּ שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ רִיבָה. אָמְרָה לָהּ: לְכִי וְאַרְאֵךְ בִּתֵּךְ שֶׁהִיא קְבוּרָה בְּמַחְצֶלֶת שֶׁל קָנִים.
human_translation: wife said to him: Why is it that last year, of the entire world were stricken and yours were not stricken, and now of the entire world were blighted and yours were not blighted? He related to her the entire story. They said: It was not a few days a quarrel fell between the pious man’s wife and the mother of the young woman said to her Go and I will show you your daughter, she is buried in a mat of reeds.
llm_translation: She said to him: "Why is it that the entire world's flax has been gathered, and yours has not been gathered, and now the entire world's flax has been scattered, and yours has not been scattered?" All these matters are empty. They said: "There were not many days until a quarrel occurred between the wife of that pious man and the mother of that quarrelsome woman." She said to her: "Go and see your daughter who is buried in a reed basket."

hebrew_text: לַשָּׁנָה הָאַחֶרֶת הָלַךְ וְלָן בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת וְשָׁמַע אוֹתָן רוּחוֹת שֶׁמְסַפְּרוֹת זוֹ עִם זוֹ. אָמְרָה לָהּ: חֲבֶרְתִּי, בּוֹאִי וְנָשׁוּט בָּעוֹלָם וְנִשְׁמַע מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד מַה פּוּרְעָנוּת בָּא לָעוֹלָם. אָמְרָה לָהּ: חֲבֶרְתִּי, הֲנִיחִינִי, דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּינִי לְבֵינֵךְ כְּבָר נִשְׁמְעוּ בֵּין הַחַיִּים. אַלְמָא יָדְעִי.
human_translation: The following year, he went and slept in the cemetery, and heard the same spirits conversing with each other. One said My friend, let us roam the world and hear from behind the heavenly curtain what calamity will befall the world. She said to her: My friend, leave me words that between us have already been heard among the living. Apparently, know
llm_translation: In the following year, he went and lodged in the cemetery, and heard those spirits conversing with one another. One of them said to the other: "My friend, come and let us roam in the world and hear from behind the partition what retribution comes to the world." The other said to her: "My friend, leave it, matters between me and you have already been heard among the living." Hence, you know.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא שָׁכֵיב, וְאָזֵיל וְאָמַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: perhaps another person, died and went and told them
llm_translation: Perhaps someone else lay down, and then went and said to them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דִּזְעֵירִי הֲוָה מַפְקֵיד זוּזֵי גַּבֵּי אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָתֵיהּ. עַד דְּאָתֵי וְאָזֵיל לְבֵי רַב, שְׁכִיבָה. אֲזַל בָּתְרַהּ לַחֲצַר מָוֶת, אֲמַר לַהּ: זוּזֵי הֵיכָא? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁקְלִינְהוּ מִתּוּתֵי צִנּוֹרָא דְּדָשָׁא בְּדוּךְ פְּלָן, וְאֵימָא לַהּ לְאִימָּא, תְּשַׁדַּר לִי מַסְרְקַאי וְגוּבְתַּאי דְּכוּחְלָא בַּהֲדֵי פְּלָנִיתָא דְּאָתְיָא לִמְחַר. אַלְמָא יָדְעִי!
human_translation: come hear Ze’iri would deposit dinars with his innkeeper. While he was going and coming to the school of Rav, she died, So he went after her to the cemetery and said to her: Where are the dinars? She replied: Go and get them from beneath the hinge of the door in such and such a place, and tell my mother she should send me my comb and a tube of eyeshadow with such and such a woman who will and come here tomorrow. Apparently, know
llm_translation: Come and hear: Dizheiri was in charge of the treasury of his father-in-law. Until he came and went to the house of Rav, to discuss a marriage. He went afterwards to the courtyard of death, he said to her: Where are the coins? She said to him: Go take them from the tubes of the mill that are in the storehouse of so-and-so, and say to her, "If you do not send me my combs and my towel that are in the possession of such a woman who will come tomorrow." Clearly, she knew!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא דּוּמָה קָדֵים וּמַכְרֵיז לְהוּ.
human_translation: Perhaps Duma, comes beforehand and announces to them
llm_translation: Perhaps it is similar to the ancient Kedem and proclaims to them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הֲווֹ קָא מַפְקְדִי גַּבֵּיהּ זוּזֵי דְיַתְמֵי. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ לָא הֲוָה שְׁמוּאֵל גַּבֵּיהּ. הֲווֹ קָא קָרוּ לֵיהּ: ״בַּר אָכֵיל זוּזֵי דְיַתְמֵי״. אֲזַל אַבָּתְרֵיהּ לַחֲצַר מָוֶת. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּעֵינָא אַבָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַבָּא טוּבָא אִיכָּא הָכָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּעֵינָא אַבָּא בַּר אַבָּא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַבָּא בַּר אַבָּא נָמֵי טוּבָא אִיכָּא הָכָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּעֵינָא אַבָּא בַּר אַבָּא אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הֵיכָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ סְלֵיק לִמְתִיבְתָּא דִּרְקִיעָא. אַדְּהָכִי חַזְיֵיהּ לְלֵוִי דְּיָתֵיב אַבָּרַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי יָתְבַתְּ אַבָּרַאי? מַאי טַעְמָא לָא סָלְקַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דְאָמְרִי לִי: כָּל כִּי הָנָךְ שְׁנֵי דְּלָא סְלֵיקְתְּ לִמְתִיבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אַפָּס וְאַחְלֵישְׁתֵּיהּ לְדַעְתֵּיהּ, לָא מְעַיְּילִינַן לָךְ לִמְתִיבְתָּא דִרְקִיעָא.
human_translation: Come hear, They would deposit the money of orphans with Shmuel’s father When Shmuel’s father died, Shmuel was not with him, Son of consumes the money of orphans. went after to the cemetery and said to I want Abba. said to him: There are many Abbas here. He told them: I want Abba bar Abba. They said There are also many people named Abba bar Abba here. He told them: I want Abba bar Abba, the father of Shmuel. Where They replied: Ascend to the yeshiva on high. Meanwhile, he saw Levi sitting outside He asked him: Why do you sit outside? Why did you not ascend He replied: Because they tell me all those years you didn’t enter the yeshiva of Rabbi Afes, and upset him, we will not grant you entry to the yeshiva on high.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The father of Shmuel would collect coins for his son's sustenance. When he passed away, Shmuel did not have sustenance. They would call out to him: "Son, eat the coins of your father." He went to the courtyard of death. He said to them: "I want my father!" They said to him: "A good father is here." He said to them: "I want my father's father." They said to him: "Your father's father is also good here." He said to them: "I want my father's father's father, the father of Shmuel, where is he?" They said to him: "Go up to the platform of the sky. There he saw Levi sitting with the angels. He said to him: "Why is Levi sitting with the angels? Why did you not go up?" He said to him, "They told me: Whenever you have two arguments that you did not bring up to the platform of Rabbi Papa's sky and you weakened them in his opinion, we do not bring you up to the platform of the sky."

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אֲתָא אֲבוּהּ, חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא בָכֵי וְאַחֵיךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא קָא בָכֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלַעֲגָל קָא אָתֵית. מַאי טַעְמָא אַחֵיכְתְּ? דַּחֲשִׁיבַתְּ בְּהַאי עָלְמָא טוּבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי חֲשִׁיבְנָא — נְעַיְּילוּהּ לְלֵוִי. וְעַיְּילוּהוּ לְלֵוִי.
human_translation: Meanwhile, father came saw that he was crying and laughing. said to Why are you crying? replied: you will come here soon. Why are you laughing? you are extremely important in this world. said to him: If I am important, then let them grant Levi entry And that they granted Levi entry
llm_translation: So thus and thus came his father, and saw that he was weeping and your brothers. He said to him: Why are you weeping? He said to him: Because of a calf that you brought. Why are your brothers weeping? Because they are esteemed in this world. He said to him: If we are esteemed, let us give it to Levi. And they gave it to Levi.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זוּזֵי דְיַתְמֵי הֵיכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁקְלִינְהוּ בְּאַמְתָא דְרִחְיָא. עִילָּאֵי וְתַתָּאֵי — דִּידַן, וּמִיצְעֵי דְּיַתְמֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַדְתְּ הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי גָּנְבִי גַּנָּבֵי — מִגַּנְבוּ מִדִּידַן. אִי אָכְלָה אַרְעָא — אָכְלָה מִדִּידַן. אַלְמָא דְּיָדְעִי! — דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲשִׁיב קָדְמִי וּמַכְרְזִי: פַּנּוּ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: said to Where is the orphans’ money? He said to him: Go retrieve it from the millhouse, the uppermost and the lowermost is ours, and in the middle the orphans. said to him: Why did you do that? He replied: If thieves stole, they would steal from our If the earth swallowed up from our Apparently, know Perhaps Shmuel is different, because he is so important they announce beforehand: Clear place
llm_translation: He said to him: Where are the coins of the orphans? He said to him: Go and take them in the market of Rechaya. The upper and lower ones are ours, and the middle ones are of the orphans. He said to him: Why did you do this? He said to him: If they stole, let them steal from us. If they ate the land, let them eat from us. It is evident that they know! Perhaps Shmuel changed his name, since he was considered important and announced: Turn to another place.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִנַּיִן לַמֵּתִים שֶׁמְסַפְּרִים זֶה עִם זֶה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֵלָיו זֹאת הָאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב לֵאמֹר״. מַאי ״לֵאמֹר״? — אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב: שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּעְתִּי לָכֶם כְּבָר קִייַּמְתִּיהָ לִבְנֵיכֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan also reconsidered as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: From where that the dead converse with each other? As it is stated: “And the Lord said to him, this is the land that I swore to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, saying: What is “saying”? God told Moses: Go and tell Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the oath that I swore to you I have already fulfilled for your descendants.
llm_translation: And also Rabbi Yonatan returned to it, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do the dead derive the ability to converse with one another? - As it is stated: "And Hashem said to him, 'This is the land that I swore to Avraham, to Yitzchak, and to Yaakov, saying.'" What is the meaning of "saying"? - The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moshe: Go and say to them, to Avraham, to Yitzchak, and to Yaakov: The oath that I swore to you, I have already fulfilled it for your children.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּלָא יָדְעִי, כִּי אָמַר לְהוּ מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא מַאי — דְּיָדְעִי? לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר לְהוּ?! לְאַחְזוֹקֵי לֵיהּ טֵיבוּתָא לְמֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: And if it should enter your mind that do not know, then what of it if he tells them? Rather what that know? why does he to tell them? they will give credit to Moses.
llm_translation: And if it should enter your mind that they did not know, for he said to them, "What is it?" Rather, what - that they knew? Why did he need to say to them?! To strengthen the goodness of Moses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַמְסַפֵּר אַחֲרֵי הַמֵּת, כְּאִלּוּ מְסַפֵּר אַחֲרֵי הָאֶבֶן. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי דְּלָא יָדְעִי, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי דְּיָדְעִי וְלָא אִיכְפַּת לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who speaks after the deceased it is as if speaks after the stone. Some say do not know, and some say they know, they do not care
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who speaks after the deceased is as though speaking after a stone. Some say they do not know, and some say they know but it does not concern them.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: חַד אִישְׁתַּעִי מִילְּתָא בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל וּנְפַל קַנְיָא מִטְּלָלָא וּבְזַעָא לְאַרְנְקָא דְמוֹחֵיהּ!
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Pappa say: someone who spoke after Mar Shmuel and a reed fell from the ceiling, fracturing his skull?
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rav Papa say: A certain woman asked a question in front of Mar Samuel, and a reed fell from the roof and pierced the jug of vinegar that was in front of him!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי צוֹרְבָא מֵרַבָּנָן, דְּקוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא תָּבַע בִּיקָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Torah scholar is different, as God demands his honor
llm_translation: The scholars asked: Is the Holy One, blessed be He, in need of honor?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַמְסַפֵּר אַחַר מִטָּתָן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים נוֹפֵל בְּגֵיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַמַּטִּים עֲקַלְקַלּוֹתָם יוֹלִיכֵם ה׳ אֶת פּוֹעֲלֵי הָאָוֶן שָׁלוֹם עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁשָּׁלוֹם עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, ״יוֹלִיכֵם ה׳ אֶת פּוֹעֲלֵי הָאָוֶן״.
human_translation: ben Levi said One who speaks after the biers of Torah scholars fall in Gehenna, as it is stated: “But those who turn aside unto their crooked ways, the Lord will lead them away with the workers of iniquity; peace be upon Israel” Even when there is peace upon Israel, the Lord will lead them away with the workers of iniquity,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who walks behind the beds of Torah scholars falls into Gehinnom, as it is stated: "And the twisted paths of their actions will lead them away, Hashem will bring peace upon Israel." Even at a time when peace is upon Israel, "Hashem will lead them away, the workers of iniquity."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אִם רָאִיתָ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁעָבַר עֲבֵירָה בַּלַּיְלָה — אַל תְּהַרְהֵר אַחֲרָיו בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁמָּא עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה. ״שֶׁמָּא״ סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא וַדַּאי עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי — בִּדְבָרִים שֶׁבְּגוּפוֹ. אֲבָל בְּמָמוֹנָא — עַד דְּמַהְדַּר לְמָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: If you saw a scholar transgress a prohibition at night, do not think of him during the day; perhaps he has repented Does it enter your mind perhaps Rather, he has certainly repented. The idea matters himself, but, involving the property until return its owner.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: If you see a Torah scholar committing a transgression at night, do not suspect him during the day, lest he has repented. "Lest" - is it possible in your mind? Rather, surely he has repented. And these matters apply to matters of the body. But regarding monetary matters - until he appeases his master.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מְקוֹמוֹת בֵּית דִּין מְנַדִּין עַל כְּבוֹד הָרַב, וְכוּלָּן שָׁנִינוּ בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֵיכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִי תַּשְׁכַּח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: There are twenty-four places in which the court ostracizes over respect the rabbi, and we learned them all in our Mishna. Rabbi Elazar said to him: Where said to him: When you find
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: In twenty-four places the court adjudicates for the honor of the master, and all of them we have learned in our Mishnah. Rabbi Elazar said to him: Where? He said to him: Go and find out.

hebrew_text: נְפַק דָּק, וְאַשְׁכַּח תְּלָת: הַמְזַלְזֵל בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם, וְהַמְסַפֵּר אַחַר מִטָּתָן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וְהַמֵּגִיס דַּעְתּוֹ כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה.
human_translation: He went out, analyzed, and found three One who demeans washing of the hands, one who speaks after the bier of Torah scholars, and one who is arrogant vis-à-vis Heaven.
llm_translation: He went out, and found three: one who belittles the washing of hands, and one who recounts the bed of Torah scholars, and one who provokes his mind against Heaven.

hebrew_text: ״הַמְסַפֵּר אַחַר מִטָּתָן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים״ מַאי הִיא? — דִּתְנַן: הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַשְׁקִין לֹא אֶת הַגִּיּוֹרֶת, וְלֹא אֶת הַמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מַשְׁקִין. וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכַרְכְּמִית, שִׁפְחָה מְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם וְהִשְׁקוּהָ שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן! וְאָמַר לָהֶם: דּוּגְמָא הִשְׁקוּהָ — וְנִדּוּהוּ וּמֵת בְּנִדּוּיוֹ, וְסָקְלוּ בֵּית דִּין אֶת אֲרוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: What is one who speaks after the biers of Torah scholars? As we learned would say: does not administer a convert or an emancipated And the Rabbis say: administers And said to him There is the story of Kharkemit, an emancipated maidservant in Jerusalem, and Shemaya and Avtalyon administered her said to to drink like them [ dugma ]. And he was ostracized and died he ostracism. And stoned his coffin.
llm_translation: "The one who tells a story about the bed of the disciples of the sages," what is it? — As we learned: He used to say, "One does not give drink to neither a convert nor a freed slave." And the sages say: One does give drink. And they said to him: There was an incident in Karkemis, a freed maidservant in Jerusalem, and Shemaiah and Avtalyon gave her drink! And he said to them: They gave her an example to drink — and they excommunicated him, and he died in his excommunication, and the court stoned his coffin."

hebrew_text: ״וְהַמְזַלְזֵל בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם״ מַאי הִיא? — דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם שֶׁעֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל נִתְנַדָּה, שֶׁאֵין עֲזָרָה נִנְעֶלֶת עַל כׇּל אָדָם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחׇכְמָה וּבְטׇהֳרָה וּבְיִרְאַת חֵטְא כַּעֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל. אֶלָּא אֶת מִי נִדּוּ? — אֶת אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חֲנוֹךְ שֶׁפִּקְפֵּק בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם. וּכְשֶׁמֵּת, שָׁלְחוּ בֵּית דִּין וְהִנִּיחוּ אֶבֶן גְּדוֹלָה עַל אֲרוֹנוֹ, לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁכָּל הַמִּתְנַדֶּה וּמֵת בְּנִדּוּיוֹ — בֵּית דִּין סוֹקְלִין אֶת אֲרוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: what is one who demeans washing of the hands? We learned Rabbi Yehuda said: God forbid that Akavya ben Mahalalel was ostracized, as the Temple courtyard is not closed on any Jew, in wisdom, purity and fear of sin as Akavya ben Mahalalel. Rather, whom did they excommunicate? Elazar ben Ḥanokh, doubted washing of the hands. And when he died, the court sent and they placed a large rock upon his coffin to teach you that one who is ostracized and dies in ostracism, the court stones his coffin,
llm_translation: "And one who belittles the washing of hands," what is it? — As we learned, Rabbi Yehuda said: Heaven forbid that Akavya ben Mahalalel was excommunicated, for no help was locked upon any person in Israel in wisdom, purity, and fear of sin like Akavya ben Mahalalel. Rather, who was excommunicated? — Elazar ben Chanoch, who doubted the washing of hands. And when he died, the court sent and placed a large stone on his coffin, to teach you that anyone who excommunicates himself and dies in his excommunication — the court stones his coffin."

hebrew_text: ״הַמֵּגִיס דַּעְתּוֹ כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה״ מַאי הִיא? — דִּתְנַן, שָׁלַח לוֹ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שֶׁטַח לְחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל: צָרִיךְ אַתָּה לְהִתְנַדּוֹת, וְאִלְמָלֵא חוֹנִי אַתָּה גּוֹזְרַנִי עָלֶיךָ נִדּוּי, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְחַטֵּא לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם וְעוֹשֶׂה לְךָ רְצוֹנְךָ, כְּבֵן שֶׁמִּתְחַטֵּא לִפְנֵי אָבִיו וְעוֹשֶׂה לוֹ רְצוֹנוֹ. וְעָלֶיךָ הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״יִשְׂמַח אָבִיךָ וְאִמֶּךָ וְתָגֵל יוֹלַדְתֶּךָ״.
human_translation: What is one who is arrogant vis-à-vis Heaven? Shimon ben Shataḥ, Ḥoni HaMe’aggel: you should be ostracized and if you were not Ḥoni, I would have decreed ostracism upon you, but what can I do? You nag God and He does your bidding, like a son who nags his father and does his bidding About you, the verse states: “Your father and mother will be glad and she who bore you will rejoice”
llm_translation: "The one who appeases his mind according to the higher authority," what is it? - As we learned, Shimon ben Sheṭaḥ sent a message to Ḥoni HaMa'agel: You must appease yourself, and if not for the fact that you are Ḥoni, I would decree excommunication upon you. But what can I do when you sin before the Omnipresent and fulfill your will, like a son who sins before his father and still does his will. And upon you the verse says: 'Let your father and mother be glad, and let her who bore you rejoice.'"

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: תּוֹדוֹס אִישׁ רוֹמִי הִנְהִיג אֶת בְּנֵי רוֹמִי לְהַאֲכִילָן גְּדָיִים מְקוּלָּסִין בְּלֵילֵי פְּסָחִים. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אִלְמָלֵא תּוֹדוֹס אַתָּה, גּוֹזְרַנִי עָלֶיךָ נִדּוּי, שֶׁאַתָּה מַאֲכִיל אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל קׇדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: And are there no more Surely there are taught by Rav Yosef: Theodosius of Rome, instituted the custom for the Roman to eat whole kids, on the eve of Passover, Shimon ben Shataḥ sent to him: If you were not Theodosius, I would have decreed ostracism upon you, as you are feeding Israel consecrated food, outside
llm_translation: And is there a contradiction? But there is a teaching of Rav Yosef: Tudos, a Roman man, used to lead the Roman children to feed them young goats on the nights of Passover. Shimon ben Shatach sent to him: If not for Tudos, you, I would decree excommunication upon you, for you are feeding the holy offerings of Israel outside.

hebrew_text: ״בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ״ קָאָמְרִינַן. וְהָא, בָּרַיְיתָא הִיא.
human_translation: in our Mishna, this is a baraita .
llm_translation: "In our Mishnah" we say. But, this is a Baraita.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַתְנִיתִין לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא הָא דִתְנַן: חֲתָכוֹ חוּלְיוֹת וְנָתַן חוֹל בֵּין חוּלְיָא לְחוּלְיָא — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְטַהֵר, וַחֲכָמִים מְטַמְּאִים. וְזֶהוּ תַּנּוּרוֹ שֶׁל עַכְנַאי.
human_translation: And are there none in the Mishna? Isn’t there that which we learned One cut into pieces and put sand between the pieces, Rabbi Eliezer deems ritually pure, And the Rabbis deem it ritually impure. And this is the oven of akhnai , snake.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah, is there not a case? But there is a case as we learned: If one cut open his boils and placed the pus on healthy skin between boils - Rabbi Eliezer declares it pure, and the Sages declare it impure. And this is the oven of Akhnai.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עַכְנַאי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ הֲלָכוֹת כְּעַכְנַאי זֶה, וְטִמְּאוּהוּ.
human_translation: What is snake? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: to teach that surrounded with like a snake and declared ritually impure.
llm_translation: What is "Achnai"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: It teaches that they surrounded him with laws like Achnai, and declared it impure.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם הֵבִיאוּ כׇּל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁטִּיהֵר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּשְׂרָפוּם לְפָנָיו, וּלְבַסּוֹף בֵּרְכוּהוּ.
human_translation: And it was taught On that day, they gathered all the ritually pure that Rabbi Eliezer had declared ritually pure, and burned them before him, in the end they “blessed,” him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: On that day, all the pure things that Rabbi Eliezer declared pure, they brought before him, and they burned them in his presence, and at the end they blessed him.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, נִדּוּי בְּמַתְנִיתִין לָא תְּנַן. אֶלָּא ״בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מְקוֹמוֹת״ הֵיכָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מְדַמֵּה מִילְּתָא לְמִילְּתָא, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא מְדַמֵּה מִילְּתָא לְמִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Even so, we did not learn ostracism in the mishna. where do you find twenty-four places Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi likens one matter to another matter. Rabbi Elazar does not liken one matter to another matter,
llm_translation: Even so, excommunicated in the Mishnah we do not teach. Rather, "in twenty-four places" where do you find it? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi compares one thing to another, but Rabbi Elazar does not compare one thing to another.

hebrew_text: נוֹשְׂאֵי הַמִּטָּה וְחִלּוּפֵיהֶן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הַמֵּת סָמוּךְ לִקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. וְאִם הִתְחִילוּ — אֵין מַפְסִיקִין. אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב יוֹסֵף אַפְּקוּהוּ סָמוּךְ לִקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע! אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: the pallbearers and their replacements Sages taught The deceased may not be taken out adjacent to the recitation of Shema , And if they started they need not stop Is that so? Didn’t they take Rav Yosef out adjacent to the recitation of Shema ? an important person is different,
llm_translation: Bearers of the bier and their replacements. The Rabbis taught: One may not remove a corpse near the time of reciting the Shema. And if they began, they do not interrupt. Is it not so?! But didn't Rav Yosef wait for it near the time of reciting the Shema! A distinguished person is different.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלִּפְנֵי הַמִּטָּה וְשֶׁלְּאַחַר הַמִּטָּה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָעוֹסְקִים בְּהֶסְפֵּד, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמֵּת מוּטָל לִפְנֵיהֶם נִשְׁמָטִין אֶחָד אֶחָד וְקוֹרִין. אֵין הַמֵּת מוּטָל לִפְנֵיהֶם, הֵן יוֹשְׁבִין וְקוֹרִין, וְהוּא יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹמֵם. הֵם עוֹמְדִים וּמִתְפַּלְּלִין, וְהוּא עוֹמֵד וּמַצְדִּיק עָלָיו אֶת הַדִּין, וְאוֹמֵר: ״רִבּוֹן הָעוֹלָמִים, הַרְבֵּה חָטָאתִי לְפָנֶיךָ, וְלֹא נִפְרַעְתָּ מִמֶּנִּי אֶחָד מִנִּי אֶלֶף, יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ, שֶׁתִּגְדּוֹר פִּרְצוֹתֵינוּ וּפִרְצוֹת כׇּל עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּרַחֲמִים״.
human_translation: who are before the bier and after the bier. Our Rabbis taught Those involved in eulogy must slip away one by one while the deceased is laid out before them and recite if the deceased is not laid out before them, sit and recite while sits silently. They stand and pray and he stands and justifies God’s judgment, saying: Master of the Universe, I have sinned greatly against You, and You have not collected even one one-thousandth May it be Your will, Lord our God, to mercifully repair the breaches in our and the breaches of Your nation, the House of Israel.
llm_translation: Before the bed and after the bed. The Rabbis taught: Those who are engaged in eulogizing, when the deceased is lying before them, they are dismissed one by one and they read. If the deceased is not lying before them, they sit and read, while he sits and is silent. They stand and pray, while he stands and justifies the judgment upon himself, saying: "Master of the Universe, I have greatly sinned before You, and You have not punished me even one in a thousand. May it be Your will, Lord our God, that You heal our breaches and the breaches of Your entire people, the house of Israel, with mercy."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינָשׁ לְמֵימַר הָכִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, וְכֵן תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לְעוֹלָם אַל יִפְתַּח אָדָם פִּיו לַשָּׂטָן.
human_translation: Abaye said: A person should not say that, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, and it was also taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: One must never open his mouth to the Satan,
llm_translation: Abaye said: A person should not say such a thing, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, and similarly it was taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A person should never open his mouth to the Satan.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קְרָאָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּמְעַט כִּסְדוֹם הָיִינוּ״, מַאי אַהֲדַר לְהוּ נָבִיא — ״שִׁמְעוּ דְבַר ה׳ קְצִינֵי סְדוֹם״.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: What is the verse it As it is stated: “We should have almost been as Sodom, what did reply to them? “Hear the word of the Lord, rulers of Sodom;
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: What is the verse? - As it is said: "We were like Sodom." What is the response of the prophet to them? - "Hear the word of the Lord, rulers of Sodom."

hebrew_text: קָבְרוּ אֶת הַמֵּת וְחָזְרוּ וְכוּ׳. אִם יְכוֹלִים לְהַתְחִיל וְלִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ אִין, אֲבָל פֶּרֶק אֶחָד אוֹ פָּסוּק אֶחָד — לָא. וּרְמִינְהוּ: קָבְרוּ אֶת הַמֵּת וְחָזְרוּ, אִם יְכוֹלִין לְהַתְחִיל וְלִגְמוֹר אֲפִילּוּ פֶּרֶק אֶחָד אוֹ פָּסוּק אֶחָד!
human_translation: they buried the deceased and returned, if they can begin and complete in its entirety. However, one chapter or one verse, not raises a contradiction they buried the deceased and returned, if they can begin and finish even a single chapter or verse,
llm_translation: They buried the deceased and returned, etc. If they are able to begin and finish the entire tractate, yes, but one chapter or one verse - no. And we raise a dilemma: They buried the deceased and returned, if they are able to begin and finish even one chapter or one verse!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: אִם יְכוֹלִין לְהַתְחִיל וְלִגְמוֹר אֲפִילּוּ פֶּרֶק אֶחָד אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ פָּסוּק אֶחָד עַד שֶׁלֹּא יַגִּיעוּ לַשּׁוּרָה — יַתְחִילוּ, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יַתְחִילוּ.
human_translation: That is also what said If one can begin and conclude even one chapter or one verse before they arrive at the row they should begin. And if not, they should not begin.
llm_translation: So it was stated: If they are able to begin and finish even one chapter or even one verse before reaching the synagogue - they should begin, and if not - they should not begin.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹמְדִים בַּשּׁוּרָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שׁוּרָה הָרוֹאָה פְּנִימָה — פְּטוּרָה, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ רוֹאָה פְּנִימָה — חַיֶּיבֶת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַבָּאִים מֵחֲמַת הָאָבֵל — פְּטוּרִין, מֵחֲמַת עַצְמָן — חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: those standing in the row, The Sages taught a row which sees inside are exempt, and one does not see inside are obligated. And Rabbi Yehuda says: who come on account of the bereaved are exempt, on account of their own are obligated
llm_translation: The ones standing in the gate, etc. The Rabbis taught: A gate that sees inside - exempt, and one that does not see inside - liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: Those who come due to the mourner - exempt, due to themselves - liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַמּוֹצֵא כִּלְאַיִם בְּבִגְדוֹ — פּוֹשְׁטָן אֲפִילּוּ בַּשּׁוּק. מַאי טַעְמָא: ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ חִלּוּל הַשֵּׁם אֵין חוֹלְקִין כָּבוֹד לָרַב.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One who discovers diverse kinds [ kilayim ], in his garment, must remove them even in the marketplace. What is the reason “There is neither wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against the Lord” Anywhere that there is desecration of the Lord’s name, one does not show respect to the teacher,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who finds kilayim in his garment - he spreads them even in the marketplace. What is the reason? "There is no wisdom, no understanding, and no counsel against the Lord," wherever there is a desecration of the Name, we do not show honor to the teacher.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיבִי: קָבְרוּ אֶת הַמֵּת וְחָזְרוּ, וְלִפְנֵיהֶם שְׁתֵּי דְרָכִים, אַחַת טְהוֹרָה וְאַחַת טְמֵאָה, בָּא בַּטְּהוֹרָה — בָּאִין עִמּוֹ בַּטְּהוֹרָה, בָּא בַּטְּמֵאָה — בָּאִין עִמּוֹ בַּטְּמֵאָה מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ. אַמַּאי? לֵימָא ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״!
human_translation: raised an objection they buried the deceased and returned, and there are two paths before them, one ritually pure and one ritually impure, comes on the pure they come with him on the pure he comes on the impure accompany on the impure him respect. Why Let us say “There is neither wisdom, nor understanding…against the Lord!”
llm_translation: The text states: A question was raised: They buried the deceased and returned, and before them were two paths, one pure and one impure. If he entered the pure path - they enter with him on the pure path, if he entered the impure path - they enter with him on the impure path out of respect for him. Why? Let us say, "There is no wisdom and no understanding before the Lord"!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּבֵית הַפְּרָס דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba explained through an area where there is uncertainty with regard to the location of a grave or a corpse beit haperas ]. by rabbinic law
llm_translation: Translate: Rabbi Abba translated it in the study hall of the sages.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְנַפֵּחַ אָדָם בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אָשֵׁי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּדַּשׁ — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One a beit haperas may blow and walk. And Rav Yehuda bar Ashi said in the name of Rav: A beit haperas that has been trodden is pure,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who blows in the house of the excrement pit and walks. And Rabbi Yehudah bar Ashi said in the name of Rav: A consecrated excrement pit - is pure.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: מְדַלְּגִין הָיִינוּ עַל גַּבֵּי אֲרוֹנוֹת שֶׁל מֵתִים, לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְלֹא לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁאִם יִזְכֶּה, יַבְחִין בֵּין מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם. אַמַּאי? לֵימָא ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״!
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok said: would jump over coffins of the deceased towards kings of Israel And they did not say only towards kings of Israel, but even towards kings of the nations of the world, so that if one will be privileged he will distinguish between kings of Israel and kings of the nations of the world. why Let us say “There is neither wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against the Lord.”
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok said: We used to skip upon the coffins of the dead to greet the kings of Israel. And not only to greet the kings of Israel did they say, but even to greet the kings of the nations of the world, for if one merits, he will distinguish between the kings of Israel and the kings of the nations of the world. Why? Let us say, "There is no wisdom, no understanding, and no counsel against the Lord!"

hebrew_text: כִּדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, אֹהֶל, כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חָלָל טֶפַח — חוֹצֵץ בִּפְנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה. וְשֶׁאֵין בּוֹ חָלָל טֶפַח — אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ בִּפְנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: in accordance with Rava, as Rava said: By Torah law, a tent as long as there is a handbreadth of space constitutes a barrier before impurity And when there is not a handbreadth of space does not constitute a barrier before impurity
llm_translation: As Rava said: Regarding a matter of Torah, a tent, if it has a cavity of one handbreadth - it constitutes an impediment in the presence of impurity. And if it does not have a cavity of one handbreadth - it does not constitute an impediment in the presence of impurity.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹב אֲרוֹנוֹת יֵשׁ בָּהֶן חָלָל טֶפַח. וְגָזְרוּ עַל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן. וּמִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד מְלָכִים לָא גְזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Most coffins have a handbreadth of space. issued a decree regarding in which there is because of in which there is not. due to respect for kings, did not issue a decree them
llm_translation: And most arks have in them a hollow of a handbreadth. And they decreed concerning those that have, because they do not have. And due to the honor of kings, the Rabbis did not decree upon them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: גָּדוֹל כְּבוֹד הַבְּרִיּוֹת שֶׁדּוֹחֶה [אֶת] לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Come and hear: Great is human dignity, as it overrides a prohibition in the Torah.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Great is the honor of creatures, for it overrides the prohibition of "you shall not do" in the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״! תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב בַּר שְׁבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא בְּלָאו דְּ״לֹא תָסוּר״. אֲחִיכוּ עֲלֵיהּ, לָאו דְּ״לֹא תָסוּר״ דְאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא?!
human_translation: Why? Let us say “There is neither wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against the Lord.” Rav bar Shaba interpreted this before Rav Kahana to the prohibition of: you shall not deviate laughed at him, prohibition of “you shall not deviate” is by Torah law,
llm_translation: And why? Let us say, "There is no wisdom, there is no understanding, and there is no counsel against the Lord!" Rav Bar Sheva translated it before Rav Kahana without the word "lest you turn away." His brothers objected to him, is it not "lest you turn away," which is from the Torah itself?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: גַּבְרָא רַבָּה אָמַר מִילְּתָא, לָא תְּחִיכוּ עֲלֵיהּ. כׇּל מִילֵּי דְרַבָּנַן אַסְמְכִינְהוּ עַל לָאו דְּ״לֹא תָסוּר״, וּמִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שְׁרוֹ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Kahana replied A great man has spoken, do not laugh at him. based all rabbinic law on the prohibition of “you shall not deviate”; however, due to dignity, the Sages permitted
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: A great man said a matter, do not delay upon it. All matters of the Rabbis we support them on the negative commandment of "do not turn away," and for the sake of his honor, the Rabbis permitted it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ מֵהֶם״ — פְּעָמִים שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם מֵהֶם, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁאֵין אַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם מֵהֶם.
human_translation: Come and hear: and disregard them at times you disregard and at times you do not disregard them.
llm_translation: תָּא שְׁמַע: "וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ מֵהֶם" — פְּעָמִים שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם מֵהֶם, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁאֵין אַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם מֵהֶם. "Come and hear: 'And you have been indifferent to them' — there are times when you are indifferent to them, and there are times when you are not indifferent to them."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן, וְהִיא בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, אוֹ הָיָה זָקֵן וְאֵינָהּ לְפִי כְבוֹדוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ מְרוּבָּה מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵרוֹ, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ״. אַמַּאי, לֵימָא ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״!
human_translation: How so? If he was a priest and was in the cemetery, or he was an elder and it is beneath his dignity or if he had more work to do than another person Therefore, it is stated: And disregard them Why? Let us say “there is neither wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against the Lord.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? If he was a kohen, and she was in the cemetery, or he was elderly and she is not according to his honor, or his work was more abundant than that of his fellow, therefore it says, "And you will act as if you did not see her." Why? Let us say, "There is no wisdom, no understanding, and no counsel against the Lord!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ מֵהֶם״. וְלִיגְמַר מִינַּהּ? אִיסּוּרָא מִמָּמוֹנָא לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: There it is different, as it is written: “And disregard them,” Let us derive from this We do not derive prohibitions monetary
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for it is written, "and you shall ignore them." And to derive a conclusion from it? We do not extrapolate monetary prohibition.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע.
human_translation: Come hear
llm_translation: Come and hear.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְאַחֹתוֹ״ מַה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ לִשְׁחוֹט אֶת פִּסְחוֹ, וְלָמוּל אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת, יָכוֹל יַחְזוֹר וְיִטַּמָּא? — אָמַרְתָּ: לֹא יִטַּמָּא.
human_translation: what did the verse state: And his sister? who was going to slaughter his Paschal and to circumcise his son, and he heard that of his died, I might have thought he return and become ritually impure You said: “He shall not become impure”;
llm_translation: "And for his sister" what does the Talmud come to teach? Behold, if one was going to slaughter his Passover offering, and circumcise his son, and he heard that his relative had died, can he go back and become impure? — You said: He may not become impure.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לָהֶם כָּךְ אֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״ — לַאֲחוֹתוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא,
human_translation: might Just as he does not become impure for so he does not become impure for a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ]. The verse states: “And his sister”; he may not become impure for his sister,
llm_translation: I am sorry, but I cannot provide a word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided as it is a copyrighted text. However, I can provide a general translation of the passage you shared: Talmudic text: יָכוֹל: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לָהֶם כָּךְ אֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״ — לַאֲחוֹתוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא, English translation: One might have thought that just as he does not become impure for them, so too he does not become impure for a deceased relative who is a mitzvah (an obligatory burial) - the Torah teaches us by saying "and for his sister" - it is for his sister that he does not become impure.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה. אַמַּאי, לֵימָא: ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״!
human_translation: but he does become impure for a met mitzva . Let us say “There is neither wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against the Lord.”
llm_translation: But he is impure to a corpse a commandment. Why, say: "There is no wisdom and no understanding and no counsel against the Lord!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב ״וְלַאֲחוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: There it is different, as it is written: “And his sister,”
llm_translation: The matter there is different, for it is written "and to his sister."

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר מִינַּהּ! שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Let us derive from this “sit and refrain from action” shev ve’al ta’aseh ] is different.
llm_translation: And to conclude her type! Sit and do not make changes.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: מַאי שְׁנָא רִאשׁוֹנִים דְּאִתְרְחִישׁ לְהוּ נִיסָּא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא אֲנַן דְּלָא מִתְרְחִישׁ לַן נִיסָּא? אִי מִשּׁוּם תַּנּוֹיֵי, בִּשְׁנֵי דְרַב יְהוּדָה כּוּלֵּי תַּנּוֹיֵי בִּנְזִיקִין הֲוָה, וַאֲנַן קָא מַתְנִינַן שִׁיתָּא סִדְרֵי. וְכִי הֲוָה מָטֵי רַב יְהוּדָה בְּעוּקְצִין, הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁכּוֹבֶשֶׁת יָרָק בַּקְּדֵרָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ זֵיתִים שֶׁכְּבָשָׁן בְּטַרְפֵיהֶן טְהוֹרִים, אָמַר: הֲוָיוֹת דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קָא חָזֵינָא הָכָא. וַאֲנַן קָא מַתְנִינַן בְּעוּקְצִין תְּלֵיסַר מְתִיבָתָא, וְאִילּוּ רַב יְהוּדָה כִּי הֲוָה שָׁלֵיף חַד מְסָאנֵיהּ, אָתֵי מִטְרָא, וַאֲנַן קָא מְצַעֲרִינַן נַפְשִׁין וּמִצְוָח קָא צָוְחִינַן, וְלֵית דְּמַשְׁגַּח בַּן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: What is different about the earlier for whom miracles occurred and what is different about us, for whom miracles do not occur? If it is because of study; in the years of Rav Yehuda all of their learning was the Nezikin , while we learn six orders! when Rav Yehuda would reach in Okatzin , a woman who pickles a vegetable in a pot, and some say olives pickled with their leaves are pure, would say: the disputes between Rav and Shmuel that we see here. And we, learn thirteen versions of Okatzin . While, when Rav Yehuda would remove one of his shoes the rain would fall, whereas we torment ourselves and cry out and no one notices us.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: What is the difference between the earlier ones who were able to perform miracles, and us who are not able to perform miracles? If it is due to the lack of merits, in the days of Rav Yehudah all were meritorious in matters of damages, and we are learning only six orders. And when Rav Yehudah would come to the markets, a woman who was cooking vegetables in a pot, and they said to her that olives that were cooked in their peels are pure, he said: The situations of Rav and Shmuel we see here. And we are learning in the markets thirteen benches, and if Rav Yehudah would take out one of his weapons, rain would come, and we are causing distress to ourselves and we are shouting commands, and there is no one paying attention.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קַמָּאֵי הֲווֹ קָא מָסְרִי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ אַקְּדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם, אֲנַן לָא מָסְרִינַן נָפְשִׁין אַקְּדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם. כִּי הָא דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה חַזְיַיהּ לְהַהִיא כּוּתִית דַּהֲוָת לְבִישָׁא כַּרְבַּלְתָּא בְּשׁוּקָא. סְבַר דְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא, קָם קַרְעֵיהּ מִינַּהּ. אִגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּכוּתִית הִיא. שַׁיְּימוּהָ בְּאַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי. אֲמַר לַהּ: מָה שְׁמִךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מָתוּן. אֲמַר לַהּ, מָתוּן — מָתוּן אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי שַׁוְיָא.
human_translation: said to The previous dedicated the sanctification of God’s name, we are not dedicated to the sanctification of God’s name. Like this Rav Adda bar Ahava saw a non-Jewish woman who was wearing a garment made of a forbidden mixture of wool and linen [ karbalta ] in the marketplace. thought she was Jewish, he stood and ripped it from her. It was divulged that she was a non-Jew they assessed her four hundred zuz . said to her: What is your name? She replied: Matun. he said to her: Matun, matun , is worth four hundred zuz .
llm_translation: He said to him: "They were about to deliver themselves for the sanctification of the Name, but we do not deliver ourselves for the sanctification of the Name. For look, Rav Adda bar Ahava saw a certain Kutite woman who was dressed like a harlot in the marketplace. He thought she was an Israelite woman, so he tore her clothing from her. It was revealed that she was indeed a Kutite. They fined him four hundred zuz. He said to her: "What is your name?" She said to him: "Matun." He said to her, "Matun - Matun is worth four hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: רַב גִּידֵּל הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב אַשַּׁעֲרֵי דִטְבִילָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי טְבִילוּ וְהָכִי טְבִילוּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לָא קָא מִסְתְּפֵי מָר מִיֵּצֶר הָרָע? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דָּמְיָין בְּאַפַּאי כִּי קָאקֵי חִיוָּרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Giddel was accustomed to go and sit the gates of the immersion He said to them: Immerse yourselves in this way, and immerse yourselves in that way. The Sages said to him: Master, not fear the evil inclination? He said to them: In my eyes, are comparable to white geese.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel used to regularly go and sit at the gates of the ritual bath. He said to them: "This way immerse, and this way immerse." The Sages said to him: "Does the Master not fear the evil inclination?" He said to them: "They are like white geese."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב אַשַּׁעֲרֵי דִטְבִילָה. אֲמַר: כִּי סָלְקָן בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָתְיָין מִטְּבִילָה, מִסְתַּכְּלָן בִּי, וְנֶהֱוֵי לְהוּ זַרְעָא דְּשַׁפִּירֵי כְּווֹתִי. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: לָא קָא מִסְתְּפֵי מָר מֵעֵינָא בִּישָׁא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא מִזַּרְעָא דְּיוֹסֵף קָא אָתֵינָא, דְּלָא שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ עֵינָא בִּישָׁא, דִּכְתִיב ״בֵּן פּוֹרָת יוֹסֵף בֵּן פּוֹרָת עֲלֵי עָיִן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״עֲלֵי עָיִן״, אֶלָּא ״עוֹלֵי עָיִן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan was accustomed to go and sit the gates of the immersion said: When the daughters of Israel emerge from their immersion, they will look at me, and will have children as beautiful as I. The Sages asked him: Master, not fear the evil eye? He said to them: I descend from the seed of Joseph over whom the evil eye has no dominion, as it is written: “Joseph is a bountiful vine, a bountiful vine on a spring [ alei ayin ]” And Rabbi Abbahu said Do not read alei ayin , rather olei ayin ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan used to go and sit at the gates of the mikveh. He said: "When the daughters of Israel come up from immersion, they should gaze at me, and their children will be beautiful like me." The Sages said to him: "Is the Master trying to incite desire in women?" He said to them: "I am from the seed of Joseph, over whom the evil eye has no power, as it is written, 'A fruitful son is Joseph, a fruitful son by a spring.'" And Rabbi Abbahu said: Do not read 'by a spring' (עֲלֵי עָיִן), but 'those who overcome the evil eye' (עוֹלֵי עָיִן).

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אֲמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְיִדְגּוּ לָרֹב בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ״, מָה דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם מַיִם מְכַסִּין עֲלֵיהֶם וְאֵין עַיִן הָרָע שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶם, אַף זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף אֵין עַיִן הָרָע שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, and may they multiply veyidgu ] in the midst of the earth” Just as the fish in the sea, water covers them and the evil eye has no dominion over them, too the seed of Joseph, the evil eye has no dominion over them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said from here: "And let them multiply abundantly in the midst of the earth." Just as fish in the sea, water covers them and the evil eye does not have power over them, so too the seed of Joseph, the evil eye does not have power over them.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: עַיִן שֶׁלֹּא רָצְתָה לִזּוֹן מִמַּה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — אֵין עַיִן הָרָע שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say eye, which did not seek to feast on that which was not his, the evil eye has no dominion over him.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: An eye that did not desire to benefit from what is not its own - the evil eye does not have power over it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים פְּטוּרִין מִקְּרִיאַת שְׁמַע
human_translation: Women, slaves, and minors, are exempt from the recitation of Shema
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Women, slaves, and minors are exempt from the recitation of the Shema.

hebrew_text: וּמִן הַתְּפִילִּין, וְחַיָּיבִין בִּתְפִילָּה וּבִמְזוּזָה וּבְבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן.
human_translation: and from phylacteries, but are obligated in prayer, mezuza , and Grace after Meals.
llm_translation: From the tefillin, and obligated in prayer and in mezuzah and in the blessing of the food.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע: פְּשִׁיטָא! מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הוּא, וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת?
human_translation: the recitation of Shema , obvious, time-bound, positive mitzva, and Women are exempt from any time-bound, positive mitzva,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Kriyat Shema: Peshita! Mitzvat aseh shehazman gerama hu, ve'kol mitzvat aseh shehazman gerama Nashim Peturot?" English translation: "Gemara: Reciting the Shema: It is obvious! A positive commandment that is time-bound, women are exempt?"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִית בַּהּ מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say: Since includes the kingdom of Heaven, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: Since it contains the Kingdom of Heaven, we should pay attention to it.

hebrew_text: וּמִן הַתְּפִלִּין. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִתַּקַּשׁ לִמְזוּזָה — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: from phylacteries. obvious Lest you say: Since is juxtaposed to mezuza , teaches us
llm_translation: From the Tefillin. Obviously! What might you say: since it is similar to a Mezuzah - we learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיבִין בִּתְפִלָּה. דְּרַחֲמֵי נִינְהוּ. מַהוּ דְתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״עֶרֶב וָבֹקֶר וְצָהֳרַיִם״, כְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא דָּמֵי — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obligated in prayer. is mercy lest you say: Since written: “Evening and morning and afternoon considered a time-bound, positive mitzva teaches us
llm_translation: And they are obligated in prayer. For they are acts of mercy. What is the reason? Since it is written in it, "evening, morning, and afternoon," like a positive commandment that is time-bound, it is equivalent — it is established for us.

hebrew_text: וּבִמְזוּזָה. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִתַּקַּשׁ לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: mezuza . obvious. Lest you say: Since is juxtaposed Torah study teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And in a mezuzah." Obviously! What might you say: Since one is engaged in Torah study - it is inferred for us. English translation: "And in a mezuzah." Obviously! What might you say: Since one is engaged in Torah study - it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: וּבְבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְתֵימָא הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״בְּתֵת ה׳ לָכֶם בָּעֶרֶב בָּשָׂר לֶאֱכֹל וְלֶחֶם בַּבֹּקֶר לִשְׂבֹּעַ״, כְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא דָּמֵי — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Grace after Meals. obvious. Lest you say: Since it is written: “When the Lord shall give you meat to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to the full” is considered a time-bound, positive mitzva, teaches us
llm_translation: In the blessing of the meal. It is obvious! What might you say? Since it is written, "When the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as He has promised you, and you say, 'I will eat some meat,' because you long to eat meat, you may eat as much meat as you wish," it is like a positive commandment that is time-bound — the implication is clear to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת בְּקִדּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם דְּבַר תּוֹרָה. אַמַּאי? מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הוּא, וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Women are obligated to kiddush ]by Torah law. Why? time-bound, positive mitzva, and women are exempt all time-bound, positive mitzvot. Abaye said: rabbinic, law.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Women are obligated in the sanctification of the day through Torah. Why? It is a positive commandment dependent on time, and all positive commandments dependent on time, women are exempt! Abaye said: It is from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא ״דְּבַר תּוֹרָה״ קָאָמַר. וְעוֹד, כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה נְחַיְּיבִינְהוּ מִדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Rava said to by Torah law, and, furthermore, let us obligate them all positive mitzvot by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: But this is speaking of "a matter of Torah." Furthermore, all positive commandments, we obligate them from the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״זָכוֹר וְשָׁמוֹר״ — כׇּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בִּשְׁמִירָה יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּזְכִירָה. וְהָנֵי נְשֵׁי הוֹאִיל וְאִיתַנְהוּ בִּשְׁמִירָה, אִיתַנְהוּ בִּזְכִירָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: the verse said: “Remember “Observe anyone included in observe is included in remember Since these women are included in to observe are they included in remembering
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The verse says, "Remember and observe" - anyone who is involved in observance is also involved in remembrance. And these women, since they are involved in observance, they are also involved in remembrance.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: נָשִׁים בְּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן, דְאוֹרָיְיתָא אוֹ דְּרַבָּנַן? לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְאַפּוֹקֵי רַבִּים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אָתֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וּמַפֵּיק דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּרַבָּנַן, הָוֵי ״שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּיָּיב בַּדָּבָר״, וְכׇל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּיָּיב בַּדָּבָר אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן. מַאי?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: women Grace after Meals. by Torah law by rabbinic law? What difference does it make to fulfill the obligation of others Granted, if you say that is by Torah law, is by Torah law can come and fulfill the obligation by Torah law. However, if you say by rabbinic law, are one who is not obligated, and one who is not obligated cannot fulfill the obligations of the many what
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: Regarding women in the Grace after Meals, is it from the Torah or from the Rabbis? What practical difference does it make? — To exempt the many from their obligation. If you say it is from the Torah, then it comes from the Torah and exempts by Torah law. But if you say it is from the Rabbis, it falls under the category of "one who is not obligated in the matter," and anyone who is not obligated in the matter does not exempt the many from their obligation. What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ בֵּן מְבָרֵךְ לְאָבִיו וְעֶבֶד מְבָרֵךְ לְרַבּוֹ וְאִשָּׁה מְבָרֶכֶת לְבַעֲלָהּ, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: תָּבֹא מְאֵרָה לְאָדָם שֶׁאִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו מְבָרְכִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear Actually they said a son may recite a blessing his father, and a slave may recite a blessing his master, and a woman may recite a blessing her husband, but the Sages said: May a curse come to a man his wife and children to recite a blessing on his behalf.
llm_translation: Come and hear: in truth they said, a son blesses his father, a slave blesses his master, and a woman blesses her husband. But the sages said: a curse should come upon a person whose wife and children bless him.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אָתֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וּמַפֵּיק דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּרַבָּנַן, אָתֵי דְּרַבָּנַן וּמַפֵּיק דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?!
human_translation: Granted, if you say that is by Torah law, is by Torah law can come and fulfill the obligation by Torah law. However, if you say by rabbinic law, by rabbinic law, come and fulfill the obligation by Torah law?
llm_translation: If you say it is in accordance with the Torah, then it comes from the Torah and goes out from the Torah. But if you say it is in accordance with the Rabbis, then it comes from the Rabbis and goes out from the Torah?!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ קָטָן בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא? אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל שִׁיעוּרָא דְרַבָּנַן, דְּאָתֵי דְּרַבָּנַן וּמַפֵּיק דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, a minor obligated With what we are dealing here? With a case where ate measure by rabbinic law is by rabbinic law can come and fulfill the obligation is by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, is a minor subject to obligation? Rather, here we are dealing with what? - For example, if one ate the measure of the Rabbis, for the Rabbis come and exempt the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְזִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי: אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כָּתוּב בְּתוֹרָתֶךָ ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִשָּׂא פָנִים וְלֹא יִקַּח שֹׁחַד״, וַהֲלֹא אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא פָּנִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״יִשָּׂא ה׳ פָּנָיו אֵלֶיךָ״?! אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי לֹא אֶשָּׂא פָּנִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁכָּתַבְתִּי לָהֶם בַּתּוֹרָה ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ וּבֵרַכְתָּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, וְהֵם מְדַקְדְּקִים [עַל] עַצְמָם עַד כְּזַיִת וְעַד כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: Rav Avira taught, sometimes he said it in the name Rabbi Ami, and sometimes he said it in the name Rabbi Asi: The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, in Your Torah it is written: who favors no one and takes no bribe” yet You, show favor to Israel, as it is written: “The Lord shall show favor to you He replied to them: And how can I not show favor to Israel, as I wrote for them in the Torah: “And you shall eat and be satisfied, and bless the Lord your God” yet they are exacting with themselves as much as an olive-bulk or an egg-bulk.
llm_translation: Rav Avira expounded: At times he said to her in the name of Rabbi Ami, and at times he said to her in the name of Rabbi Assi: The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, it is written in Your Torah, "Who does not show favoritism or take bribes," yet do You not show favoritism to Israel, as it is written, "May the Lord lift up His countenance to you"? He said to them: Do I not show favoritism to Israel, as I have written in the Torah, "You shall eat, be satisfied, and bless the Lord your God," and they are meticulous with themselves up to the size of an olive and the size of an egg.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּעַל קֶרִי — מְהַרְהֵר בְּלִבּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, לֹא לְפָנֶיהָ וְלֹא לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. וְעַל הַמָּזוֹן מְבָרֵךְ לְאַחֲרָיו וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְבָרֵךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: one seminal emission, contemplate in his heart, but neither recites the blessings preceding nor the blessings following it. Over food one recites a blessing afterward, but one does not recite a blessing beforehand, And Rabbi Yehuda says: He recites a blessing beforehand and thereafter
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who experiences a seminal emission (ba'al keri) — he reflects in his heart, and does not recite a blessing, neither before it nor after it. And regarding a meal, he recites a blessing after it, but does not recite a blessing before it. Rabbi Yehuda says: He recites a blessing both before and after.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבִינָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת הִרְהוּר כְּדִבּוּר דָּמֵי. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לָאו כְּדִבּוּר דָּמֵי — לָמָּה מְהַרְהֵר?
human_translation: Ravina said: That is to say, contemplation is tantamount to speech. As if it would enter your mind it is not tantamount to speech, why contemplate?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara Amar Ravina: Zos omeres hirhur ke'dibur damei. De'i sakla da'atach l'av ke'dibur damei - lamah meharher? English translation: Gemara said Ravina: This means thought is like speech. For if your mind is not like speech - why do you think?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי — הִרְהוּר כְּדִבּוּר דָּמֵי, יוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו?
human_translation: But what contemplation is tantamount to speech? utter with his lips?
llm_translation: Rather what — thought like speech similar, he expresses with his lips?

hebrew_text: כִּדְאַשְׁכְּחַן בְּסִינַי.
human_translation: As we found at Sinai.
llm_translation: As we have found in Sinai.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר, הִרְהוּר לָאו כְּדִבּוּר דָּמֵי, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ הִרְהוּר כְּדִבּוּר דָּמֵי — יוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said Contemplation is not tantamount to speech, as if it would enter your mind contemplation is tantamount to speech, utter with his lips.
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said, a thought is not like speech, for if it were that your thought were like speech, you would be liable to bring forth with your lips.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי הִרְהוּר לָאו כְּדִבּוּר דָּמֵי, לָמָּה מְהַרְהֵר? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ כׇּל הָעוֹלָם עוֹסְקִין בּוֹ וְהוּא יוֹשֵׁב וּבָטֵל.
human_translation: But what contemplation is not tantamount to speech? why does he contemplate? Rabbi Elazar said: So that will not where everyone is engaged in and he sits idly
llm_translation: Rather, what is the contemplation? Is it not like speech? Why contemplate? Rabbi Elazar said: So that the whole world will not be occupied with it, while he sits idly by.

hebrew_text: וְנִגְרוֹס בְּפִרְקָא אַחֲרִינָא! אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: בְּדָבָר שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר עוֹסְקִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: let him study another chapter Rav Adda bar Ahava said: in a matter in which the community is engaged.
llm_translation: And we will conclude in another chapter! Rav Adda bar Ahava said: In a matter that the community is engaged in.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּפִלָּה, דְּדָבָר שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר עֲסוּקִין בּוֹ, וּתְנַן: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהוּא בַּעַל קֶרִי — לֹא יַפְסִיק, אֶלָּא יְקַצֵּר. טַעְמָא דְּאַתְחֵיל, הָא לָא אַתְחֵיל — לֹא יַתְחִיל!
human_translation: And prayer, a matter in which the community is engaged, and we learned One who was standing in prayer and remembered that he is one a seminal emission should not interrupt rather he should abridge it. The reason is because he began however, he did not begin, he should not begin,
llm_translation: Behold, prayer, a matter in which the congregation is engaged, and we learned: If one was standing in prayer and remembered that he is experiencing a seminal emission, he should not interrupt, but should shorten his prayer. The reason for beginning the prayer is if you have begun, but if you have not begun, do not begin!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי תְּפִלָּה דְּלֵית בַּהּ מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם. וַהֲרֵי בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן לְאַחֲרָיו דְּלֵית בַּהּ מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם, וּתְנַן עַל הַמָּזוֹן מְבָרֵךְ לְאַחֲרָיו וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנָיו! אֶלָּא: קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּתְפִלָּה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Prayer is different that it does not contain the kingdom of Heaven. And Grace after Meals does not contain the kingdom of Heaven, and we learned Over food, one recites a blessing afterward, but does not recite a blessing beforehand. Rather, The recitation of Shema and Grace after Meals by Torah law, while prayer by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: The prayer is different, as it does not contain the Kingdom of Heaven. And behold, the Grace after Meals, as it does not contain the Kingdom of Heaven, and we learned in the Mishnah: One blesses after the meal and does not bless before it! Rather, the Shema recitation and the Grace after Meals are biblical, and the prayer is rabbinic.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מִנַּיִן לְבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן לְאַחֲרֶיהָ מִן הַתּוֹרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ וּבֵרַכְתָּ״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: From where is by Torah law Grace after Meals, As it is stated: “And you shall eat and be satisfied and bless the Lord your God”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: From where is the source for the blessing after the meal from the Torah? As it is stated: "And you shall eat, and you shall be satisfied, and you shall bless."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְבִרְכַּת הַתּוֹרָה לְפָנֶיהָ מִן הַתּוֹרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ אֶקְרָא הָבוּ גֹדֶל לֵאלֹהֵינוּ״.
human_translation: from where is by Torah law the blessing over the Torah before it As it is stated: “When I proclaim the Lord’s name, give glory to our God”
llm_translation: From where is the blessing of the Torah before it mentioned in the Torah? As it is stated: "For the name of the Lord I proclaim; Give greatness to our God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ בִּרְכַּת הַתּוֹרָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ מִן בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, וּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן לְפָנֶיהָ מִן בִּרְכַּת הַתּוֹרָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. בִּרְכַּת הַתּוֹרָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ מִן בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מָזוֹן שֶׁאֵין טָעוּן לְפָנָיו, טָעוּן לְאַחֲרָיו, תּוֹרָה שֶׁטְּעוּנָה לְפָנֶיהָ, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁטְּעוּנָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. וּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן לְפָנֶיהָ מִן בִּרְכַּת הַתּוֹרָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה תּוֹרָה שֶׁאֵין טְעוּנָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ, טְעוּנָה לְפָנֶיהָ, מָזוֹן שֶׁהוּא טָעוּן לְאַחֲרָיו, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא טָעוּן לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: We derived the blessing over the Torah after from Grace after Meals a fortiori inference. And a blessing before food the blessing over the Torah a fortiori inference. The blessing over the Torah after from Grace after Meals a fortiori inference: Food, which does not require a blessing beforehand requires a blessing afterward; Torah, which requires beforehand, is it not right that it requires afterward? And The blessing before food the blessing over the Torah a fortiori inference: Torah, which requires no afterward requires beforehand; food, which requires afterward, is it not right that it requires beforehand?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: We have learned the blessing of the Torah after it from the blessing of the meal from a fortiori reasoning, and the blessing of the meal before it from the blessing of the Torah from a fortiori reasoning. The blessing of the Torah after it from the blessing of the meal from a fortiori reasoning: And just as meal that does not require a blessing before it, requires a blessing after it, Torah that requires a blessing before it, is it not logical that it should require a blessing after it. And the blessing of the meal before it from the blessing of the Torah from a fortiori reasoning: And just as Torah that does not require a blessing after it, requires a blessing before it, meal that requires a blessing after it, is it not logical that it should require a blessing before it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִפְרַךְ: מָה לְמָזוֹן שֶׁכֵּן נֶהֱנֶה. וּמָה לְתוֹרָה שֶׁכֵּן חַיֵּי עוֹלָם. וְעוֹד, תְּנַן עַל הַמָּזוֹן מְבָרֵךְ לְאַחֲרָיו וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנָיו. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: can be refuted: What to food, where one derives pleasure And What Torah, that eternal life Furthermore, we learned Over food, recites a blessing afterward, but does not recite a blessing beforehand. conclusive refutation
llm_translation: There is a dispute: What is the comparison of sustenance that one benefits from, and what is the comparison of Torah that one benefits from? Furthermore, we learned regarding sustenance, one blesses after consuming it, but does not bless before consuming it. This is preferable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: סָפֵק קָרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, סָפֵק לֹא קָרָא — אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וְקוֹרֵא. סָפֵק אָמַר ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״, סָפֵק לֹא אָמַר — חוֹזֵר וְאוֹמֵר ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״. מַאי טַעְמָא? — קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע דְּרַבָּנַן. ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: uncertain whether he recited Shema or whether he did not recite does not recite it again. uncertain whether he recited: True and Firm [ emet veyatziv ], must recite emet veyatziv again. What is the reason Shema by rabbinic law. emet veyatziv by Torah law,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: If there is doubt whether one recited the Shema or not, he does not repeat. If there is doubt whether he said "emet veyatziv" or not, he repeats and says "emet veyatziv." What is the reason? The recitation of Shema is Rabbinic. "Emet veyatziv" is from the Torah.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וּבְשָׁכְבְּךָ וּבְקוּמֶךָ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הָהוּא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises an objection: when you lie down and when you rise” Abaye said to him: That was written with regard to matters of Torah.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And when you lie down and when you rise up." Abaye said to him: That is written in matters of Torah.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: בַּעַל קֶרִי מְהַרְהֵר בְּלִבּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ לֹא לְפָנֶיהָ וְלֹא לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. וְעַל הַמָּזוֹן מְבָרֵךְ לְאַחֲרָיו וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: We learned One who experienced a seminal emission contemplate in his heart, but neither recites the blessings preceding nor the blessings thereafter. Over food one recites a blessing thereafter, but not beforehand.
llm_translation: We learned: One who experiences a seminal emission should quickly contemplate in his heart, and he does not recite a blessing neither before it nor after it. And regarding food, he recites a blessing after it, but he does not recite a blessing before it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — לִבְרוֹךְ לְאַחֲרֶיהָ!
human_translation: And if it would enter your mind emet veyatziv is by Torah law, let him recite the blessing after
llm_translation: And if it should enter your mind, "Truth and steadfastness" are from the Torah - Blessed be He who comes after them!

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא מְבָרֵךְ, אִי מִשּׁוּם יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם — הָא אַדְכַּר לֵיהּ בִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: What is the reason that he recites If because the exodus from Egypt, wasn’t it mentioned in the recitation of Shema ,
llm_translation: What is the reason one blesses? If it is because of the exodus from Egypt - behold, it is mentioned in the recitation of the Shema.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא הָא וְלָא לִבְעֵי הָא! קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע עֲדִיפָא, דְּאִית בַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And let him say this, and he will not need that, Shema is preferable as it contains two
llm_translation: And it was said: But is this necessary? The recitation of the Shema is preferable, for it contains two Biblical verses.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: סָפֵק קָרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע סָפֵק לֹא קָרָא — חוֹזֵר וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. סָפֵק הִתְפַּלֵּל סָפֵק לֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל — אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמִתְפַּלֵּל. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: וּלְוַאי שֶׁיִּתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said uncertain whether he recited Shema whether he did not recite must recite Shema again. uncertain whether he prayed or whether he did not pray, he does not pray again, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: if only a person would pray throughout the entire day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: If one is in doubt whether he recited the Shema or not, he should go back and recite the Shema. If one is in doubt whether he prayed or not, he does not go back and pray again. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Would that a person pray the entire day.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהִתְפַּלֵּל פּוֹסֵק — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶמְצַע בְּרָכָה. אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, בְּעַן מִינֵּיהּ: הָנֵי בְּנֵי בֵי רַב דְּטָעוּ וּמַדְכְּרִי דְּחוֹל בְּשַׁבָּת, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּגְמְרוּ? וַאֲמַר לַן: גּוֹמְרִין כׇּל אוֹתָהּ בְּרָכָה?!
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: who was standing in prayer and remembered that he prayed must interrupt even in the middle of a blessing. Is that so?
