llm_translation: And was it created?! If with small creatures, after it is a handbreadth, why do I need it? Rather, both with big creatures, and not difficult, this one with a man, this one with a woman.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי הָא דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ, ״זֶהוּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו תְּשׁוּבָה״ — מַאי ״אֵין עָלָיו תְּשׁוּבָה״? דַּרְכָּא דְמִלְּתָא הָכִי אִיתָא.
human_translation: If so, then that which is taught with regard to This is an a fortiori for which there is no refutation, what for which there is no refutation? That is the nature of the matter;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, this that is taught regarding it, "This is a fortiori reasoning that does not have repentance" — What is "does not have repentance"? The way of the matter is thus.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, תְּפִילִּין, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Rather,  not phylacteries, And the refutation of Rava says Rav Sheshet  a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Rather, no, phylacteries, and the additional statement of Rava, Rav Sheshet said. The additional statement.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, קַשְׁיָא, הַשְׁתָּא בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ שְׁרֵי, בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא עֲרַאי לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Nevertheless, it difficult: Now, regular bathroom is permitted, all the more so a makeshift bathroom.
llm_translation: From every place, Kashya, the question: the permanent toilet is permitted, the temporary toilet not all the more so!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ דְּלֵיכָּא נִיצוֹצוֹת, שָׁרוּ. בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא עֲרַאי דְּאִיכָּא נִיצוֹצוֹת, אָסְרִי.
human_translation: It says as follows: a regular bathroom, where there are no drops permitted a makeshift bathroom, where there are drops it is prohibited.
llm_translation: So it is stated: A fixed toilet, if there are no splinters, is permitted. A temporary toilet, if there are splinters, is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי ״אֵין עָלָיו תְּשׁוּבָה״? תְּשׁוּבָה מְעַלַּיְתָא הִיא!
human_translation: If so, then why “cannot be refuted”? an excellent refutation
llm_translation: If so, why does it say, "There is no repentance for him"? Repentance is superior!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: הָא מִילְּתָא תֵּיתֵי לַהּ בְּתוֹרַת טַעְמָא, וְלָא תֵּיתֵי לַהּ בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר, דְּאִי אָתְיָא לַהּ בְּתוֹרַת קַל וָחוֹמֶר, זֶהוּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: it says as follows: Derive this matter based on the reason Do not derive it by means of an a fortiori inference, as to derive it by means of an a fortiori inference, it would be an a fortiori inference that cannot be rebutted.
llm_translation: So it is stated: This matter is established for it in the Torah of reasoning, and not established for it in the rule of inference from minor to major, for if it were established for it in the rule of inference from minor to major, this would be a rule of inference from minor to major that does not have a remedy.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹצֶה לִיכָּנֵס לִסְעוּדַת קֶבַע, מְהַלֵּךְ עֲשָׂרָה פְּעָמִים אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אוֹ אַרְבָּעָה פְּעָמִים עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, וְיִפָּנֶה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִכְנָס.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who wishes to enter a regular meal paces four cubits ten times, or ten cubits four times, defecates. then may he enter
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who wishes to enter for a fixed meal, walks ten times four cubits, or four times ten cubits, and turns, and then enters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הַנִּכְנָס לִסְעוּדַת קֶבַע, חוֹלֵץ תְּפִילָּיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִכְנָס. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מַנִּיחָן עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ, וְכֵן הָדוּר לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: One who partakes of a regular meal removes his phylacteries and then enters, And disputes of Rabbi Ḥiyya, as Rabbi Ḥiyya said: one places on his table, and it is admirable for him so
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: One who enters a fixed meal removes his tefillin and afterwards enters. And it is in dispute with Rabbi Chiya, for Rabbi Chiya said: He leaves them on his table, and that is the proper way for him.

hebrew_text: וְעַד אֵימַת? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: עַד זְמַן בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: And until when Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Until the time of the recitation of the blessing
llm_translation: Until when? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Until the time of blessing.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: צוֹרֵר אָדָם תְּפִילָּיו עִם מְעוֹתָיו בַּאֲפַרְקְסוּתוֹ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יָצוֹר.
human_translation: It was taught one One may bundle his phylacteries with his money in his head covering [ apraksuto ], and it was taught in another One may not bundle
llm_translation: One taught: A person may bind his phylacteries with his money pouch. And it was taught in another source: He should not bind.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאַזְמְנֵיהּ. הָא דְּלָא אַזְמְנֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַאי סוּדָרָא דִתְפִילִּין דְּאַזְמְנֵיהּ לְמֵיצַר בֵּיהּ תְּפִילִּין, צָר בֵּיהּ תְּפִילִּין — אָסוּר לְמֵיצַר בֵּיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי, אַזְמְנֵיהּ וְלָא צָר בֵּיהּ, צָר בֵּיהּ וְלָא אַזְמְנֵיהּ — שְׁרֵי לְמֵיצַר בֵּיהּ זוּזִי.
human_translation: This is not difficult, this was designated this was not designated Rav Ḥisda said: this cloth phylacteries that one designated to bundle phylacteries in it, bundled phylacteries in it then it is prohibited to bundle coins in it, designated it but did not yet bundle in it, if he bundled in it not designate it it is permitted to bundle money in it.
llm_translation: Not difficult, this that he designated. This that he did not designate. For Rav Ḥisda said: This arrangement of the phylacteries that he designated for the purpose of binding phylacteries with it, if he bound phylacteries with it, it is forbidden to bind phylacteries with it - it is obvious; if he designated it but did not bind phylacteries with it, or if he bound phylacteries with it but did not designate it - it is permitted to bind phylacteries with it.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר הַזְמָנָה מִילְּתָא הִיא: אַזְמְנֵיהּ אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא צָר בֵּיהּ. צָר בֵּיהּ, אִי אַזְמְנֵיהּ — אֲסִיר, אִי לָא אַזְמְנֵיהּ — לָא.
human_translation: And according to Abaye, who said designation is significant, If he designated even if he did not bundle in it, he bundled in it, if he designated it is prohibited if he did not designate it, no,
llm_translation: To Abbaye who said: "Invitation is a matter." His invitation, even though he does not need it. If he needs it, if his invitation - forbidden, if he does not need his invitation - not.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּנְיָא מֵרַב יְהוּדָה: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּנִּיחַ אָדָם תְּפִילָּיו תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו? תַּחַת מַרְגְּלוֹתָיו לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי, שֶׁנּוֹהֵג בָּהֶן מִנְהַג בִּזָּיוֹן. כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי, תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּתָּר, אֲפִילּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Neḥunya, raised a dilemma before Rav Yehuda: What is a man place his phylacteries under his head under his feet, I have no dilemma, as that would be treating them in a deprecating manner My dilemma is under his head; what is said to him, Shmuel said as follows: It is permitted, even his wife is with him
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Yosef son of Rav Neḥunyah from Rav Yehudah: What about a person placing his phylacteries beneath his feet? Beneath his feet, I do not require it, as he is accustomed to treat them disrespectfully. When I require it, beneath his head, what is the ruling? He said to him thus said Shmuel: It is permitted, even if his wife is with him.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: לָא יַנִּיחַ אָדָם תְּפִילָּיו תַּחַת מַרְגְּלוֹתָיו מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנּוֹהֵג בָּהֶם דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן, אֲבָל מַנִּיחָם תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו. וְאִם הָיְתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ — אָסוּר. הָיָה מָקוֹם שֶׁגָּבוֹהַּ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים אוֹ נָמוּךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: raises an objection A man may not place his phylacteries under his feet, as he treats them in a deprecating manner, but he may place them under his head. And if his wife was with him, it is prohibited If there was a place three handbreadths above or three handbreadths below it is permissible,
llm_translation: Challenger: A person should not place his phylacteries beneath his feet because he is accustomed to treat them disrespectfully, but he should place them above his head. And if his wife is with him - it is prohibited. If the place is elevated three handbreadths or lowered three handbreadths - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: This is a conclusive refutation of Shmuel’s a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The goodness of Shmuel, goodness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַף עַל גַּב דְּתַנְיָא תְּיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל, הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Rava said: Although was taught a conclusive refutation of Shmuel, the halakha is in accordance with his What is the reason
llm_translation: Rava said: Even though it is taught as a contradiction to the opinion of Shmuel, the halakha follows his view. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: כֹּל לְנַטּוֹרִינְהוּ טְפֵי עֲדִיף. וְהֵיכָא מַנַּח לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: בֵּין כַּר לְכֶסֶת, שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: whatever protection is preferable And where does he place them? Rabbi Yirmeya said: between the pillow and the mattress, not aligned with his head
llm_translation: All to guard them, drops better. And where does one place them? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: Between the beam and the ceiling, not opposite his head.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מַנִּיחָן בְּכוֹבַע, תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו! דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְמוּרְשָׁא דְכוֹבַע לְבַר.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach a he places them in a pouch under his head? that the bulge pouch, protrudes out
llm_translation: And this was taught by Rabbi Chiya: He places them in a hat, beneath his head! For it protrudes to the inheritance of the hat to the son.

hebrew_text: בַּר קַפָּרָא צָיַיר לְהוּ בְּכִילְּתָא, וּמַפִּיק לְמוּרְשְׁהוֹן לְבַר. רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידֵּי מַנַּח לְהוּ אַשַּׁרְשִׁיפָא, וּפָרֵיס סוּדָרָא עִילָּוַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Bar Kappara would tie them in bed curtain and project their bulge outward. Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, would place them on a bench and spread a cloth over them.
llm_translation: Son of Capara painted for them in a basket, and he took it to the son of Murshah to the well. Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, brought them a dish of lentils, and he spread a cloth over them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: זִימְנָא חֲדָא הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, וַאֲמַר לִי: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי תְּפִילִּין. וְאַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ בֵּין כַּר לְכֶסֶת, שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד רֹאשׁוֹ. וַהֲוָה יָדַעְנָא דְּיוֹם טְבִילָה הֲוָה, וּלְאַגְמוֹרַן הֲלָכָה לְמַעֲשֶׂה הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna, son of Rav Yosef, said: I was once standing before Rava and he told me: Go bring me phylacteries. And I found them between the mattress and the pillow, not aligned with his head. And I knew it was the day of immersion and he did so, to teach us the practical halakha
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna, son of Rav Yosef, said: One time I was standing before Rava, and he said to me, "Go bring me my tefillin." I found them between the pillow and the mattress, not opposite his head. I knew it was a day of immersion, and he did not complete the halacha for practical application.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּנְיָא מֵרַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁיְּשֵׁנִים בְּמִטָּה אַחַת, מַהוּ שֶׁזֶּה יַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו וְיִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, וְזֶה יַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו וְיִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וַאֲפִילּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Neḥunya, raised a dilemma before Rav Yehuda: Two individuals sleeping in a single bed, what is for this to turn his head and recite Shema and for that turns his head and recites Shema ; He said to him: Shmuel said as follows: even his wife with him.
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Yosef son of Rav Nachunya from Rav Yehuda: Two who are sleeping in one bed, what should this one turn his face and recite the Shema, and this one turn his face and recite the Shema? He said to him: So said Shmuel: Even if his wife is with him.

hebrew_text: מַתְקִיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אִשְׁתּוֹ וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא אַחֵר?! אַדְּרַבָּה, אִשְׁתּוֹ כְּגוּפוֹ, אַחֵר לָאו כְּגוּפוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to his wife, and needless to say another. On the contrary, his wife is like his own flesh, another is not like his own flesh
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Yosef: His wife and not another?! Responded Ravah, his wife is like his own body, another is not like his own body.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁיְּשֵׁנִים בְּמִטָּה אַחַת — זֶה מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו וְקוֹרֵא, וְזֶה מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו וְקוֹרֵא. וְתַנְיָא אַחֲרִיתִי: הַיָּשֵׁן בַּמִּטָּה, וּבָנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ בְּצִדּוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיְתָה טַלִּית מַפְסֶקֶת בֵּינֵיהֶן. וְאִם הָיוּ בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ קְטַנִּים — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: raises an objection Two individuals who are sleeping in a single bed, this turns his head and recites and that turns his head and recites And it was taught in another One who is sleeping in bed and his children and members of his household are beside him, may not recite Shema unless a garment separates between them. If his children and the members of his household were minors, it is permitted
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: Two individuals who are sleeping in one bed - this one turns his face and reads, and this one turns his face and reads. And it was taught in a later source: If the one who is sleeping in the bed, and his sons and the members of his household are beside him, he should not recite the Shema, unless there is a garment separating between them. And if his sons and the members of his household are minors - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב יוֹסֵף לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהָא בְּאַחֵר. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Yosef, is not difficult, this where his wife while this where another However, according to Shmuel, it is difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, for Rav Yosef it is not difficult, this one, and this one is different. Rather, is it difficult for Shmuel?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: לְרַב יוֹסֵף מִי נִיחָא? וְהָתַנְיָא הָיָה יָשֵׁן בַּמִּטָּה, וּבָנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ בַּמִּטָּה — לֹא יִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיְתָה טַלִּיתוֹ מַפְסֶקֶת בֵּינֵיהֶן. אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — אִשְׁתּוֹ לְרַב יוֹסֵף תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, לְדִידִי נָמֵי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: And according to Rav Yosef’s does it well? Wasn’t it taught one who is sleeping in bed and his children and members of his household are beside him, may not recite Shema unless a garment separates between them? Rather, what have you to say Rav Yosef holds that there is a tannaitic one’s wife; I, too, hold that it is a tannaitic
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: Is it pleasing to Rav Yosef? And it was taught: If he was sleeping in bed, and his sons and the members of his household were sleeping in bed — he should not recite the Shema unless his garment separates between them. Rather, what do you have to say? His wife is a scholar for Rav Yosef, she is a scholar for me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: זֶה מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. וְהָא אִיכָּא עֲגָבוֹת! מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עֲגָבוֹת אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם עֶרְוָה. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא: הָאִשָּׁה יוֹשֶׁבֶת, וְקוֹצָה לָהּ חַלָּתָהּ עֲרוּמָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְכַסּוֹת פָּנֶיהָ בְּקַרְקַע, אֲבָל לֹא הָאִישׁ.
human_translation: The Master said This turns his head and recites Shema. Aren’t there buttocks? supports Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: Buttocks do not constitute nakedness. Let us say supports Rav Huna’s A woman sits and separates her ḥalla naked, because she can cover her face, in the ground, but a male, not
llm_translation: Master said: This one turns his face and recites the Shema. But are there not beds! It supports Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: Beds do not involve a matter of nakedness. Let it support Rav Huna: A woman is sitting, and her garment has slipped off her, she can cover her face with the ground, but not a man.

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ פָּנֶיהָ טוּחוֹת בַּקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak interpreted a case where her face, was completely covered in the ground
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak interpreted it: For example, her face was smeared in the ground.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִם הָיוּ בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵּיתוֹ קְטַנִּים, מוּתָּר: וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: תִּינוֹקֶת בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְתִינוֹק בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: תִּינוֹקֶת בַּת אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְתִינוֹק בֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי עַד כְּדַי ״שָׁדַיִם נָכֹנוּ וּשְׂעָרֵךְ צִמֵּחַ״.
human_translation: The Master said If his children and the members of his household were minors, it is permitted Until what Rav Ḥisda said: A girl three years and one day old, and a boy he is nine years and one day old, Some say: A girl eleven years and one day old and a boy of twelve years and one day old, this, and that, at “Your breasts were formed and your hair was grown”
llm_translation: Master said: If his sons and the members of his household are young, it is permitted. And until when? Rav Ḥisdah said: A girl child of three years and one day, and a boy child of nine years and one day. Some say: A girl child of eleven years and one day, and a boy child of twelve years and one day. Both are sufficient until "your breasts are formed and your hair has grown."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָתָם אָמַר רָבָא: אַף עַל גַּב דִּתְיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. הָכָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ בַּחֲדָא מְחִתָא מְחִתִינְהוּ? אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאִיתְּמַר — אִיתְּמַר, וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר — לָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Rav Ashi: There, Rava said: Despite a conclusive refutation of Shmuel, the halakha is in accordance with of Shmuel. Here, what He said to him: Were all of them woven in the same weaving? Rather, where it is stated, it is stated, and where it is not stated, it is not stated,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Kahana said to Rav Ashi: There, Rava said: Even though it is a dispute of Shmuel, the halacha follows the view of Shmuel. What about here? He said to him: Do we combine all of them into one firebrand? Rather, where it is stated - it is stated, and where it is not stated - it is not stated.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרִי לְרַב פָּפָּא: שֵׂעָר יוֹצֵא בְּבִגְדוֹ מַהוּ? קְרָא עֲלֵיהּ: שֵׂעָר, שֵׂעָר.
human_translation: Rav Mari said to Rav Pappa: if one’s hair protruded from his garment? about him: A hair, a hair.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said to Rav Papa: "If hair protrudes from his garment, what is the ruling?" The verse states regarding it: "Hair, hair."

hebrew_text: אָמַר ר׳ יִצְחָק: טֶפַח בָּאִשָּׁה עֶרְוָה. לְמַאי? אִילֵּימָא לְאִסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ, וְהָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָמָּה מָנָה הַכָּתוּב תַּכְשִׁיטִין שֶׁבַּחוּץ עִם תַּכְשִׁיטִין שֶׁבִּפְנִים — לוֹמַר לָךְ כׇּל הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בְּאֶצְבַּע קְטַנָּה שֶׁל אִשָּׁה, כְּאִילּוּ מִסְתַּכֵּל בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוֹרֶף.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak stated: An handbreadth in a woman nakedness. which If you say looking at her, didn’t Rav Sheshet say: Why did the verse enumerate jewelry that is externally, together with jewelry internally, to tell you: Anyone who gazes upon a woman’s little finger as if he gazed upon her genitals,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: A handbreadth in a woman is considered nakedness. For what? If you will say to gaze at her, but didn't Rav Sheshet say: Why did the Scripture enumerate the external ornaments along with the internal ornaments? To tell you that whoever gazes at a woman's little finger as if he were gazing at her private parts.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ וְלִקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rather, his wife, with regard to recitation of Shema .
llm_translation: Rather, concerning his wife and the recitation of the Shema.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שׁוֹק בָּאִשָּׁה עֶרְוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּלִּי שׁוֹק עִבְרִי נְהָרוֹת״, וּכְתִיב: ״תִּגָּל עֶרְוָתֵךְ וְגַם תֵּרָאֶה חֶרְפָּתֵךְ״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קוֹל בָּאִשָּׁה — עֶרְוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי קוֹלֵךְ עָרֵב וּמַרְאֵךְ נָאוֶה״. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֵׂעָר בָּאִשָּׁה עֶרְוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שַׂעֲרֵךְ כְּעֵדֶר הָעִזִּים״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: a woman’s leg nakedness, as it is stated: “Uncover the leg and pass through the rivers” and it is written “Your nakedness shall be revealed and your shame shall be seen” Shmuel stated: A woman’s voice is nakedness, as it is stated: “Sweet is your voice and your countenance is alluring” Rav Sheshet stated: a woman’s hair is nakedness, as it is written: “Your hair is like a flock of goats,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A woman's leg is considered nakedness, as it is stated: "Uncover the leg, cross the rivers," and it is also written: "Uncover your nakedness, yes, let your shame be seen." Shmuel said: A woman's voice is nakedness, as it is stated: "For your voice is sweet and your appearance is lovely." Rav Sheshet said: A woman's hair is nakedness, as it is stated: "Your hair is like a flock of goats."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי שֶׁתָּלָה תְּפִילָּיו. מֵיתִיבִי: הַתּוֹלֶה תְּפִילָּיו יִתָּלוּ לוֹ חַיָּיו!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: I saw Rabbi hang his phylacteries. raises an objection: one who hangs his phylacteries will have his life hang
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: I saw Rabbi Shetaya hanging his prayers. The students asked: One who hangs his prayers, his life should be hanged for him!

hebrew_text: דּוֹרְשֵׁי חֲמוּרוֹת אָמְרוּ: ״וְהָיוּ חַיֶּיךָ תְּלֻאִים לְךָ מִנֶּגֶד״, זֶה הַתּוֹלֶה תְּפִילָּיו.
human_translation: the Symbolic Interpreters said “And your life shall hang in doubt before you [ minneged ]” one who hangs his phylacteries.
llm_translation: Interpreters of donkeys said: "And your life shall hang in doubt before you," this refers to one who suspends his prayers.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא בִּרְצוּעָה. הָא בִּקְצִיצָה.
human_translation: is not difficult, as this by the strap, That from the box
llm_translation: Not difficult this in the case of "birtzua." This in the case of "kitzitza."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָא שְׁנָא רְצוּעָה וְלָא שְׁנָא קְצִיצָה — אָסוּר. וְכִי תְּלָה רַבִּי — בְּכִיסְתָּא תְּלָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say There is no difference strap and there is no difference the box; are prohibited. And when Rabbi hung he hung them in pouch.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: It makes no difference whether it is crushed or cut – it is prohibited. And if you ask, "What is Rabbi's reasoning?" – he relies on the principle of "hanging by a thread."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְתֵימָא תִּיבְעֵי הַנָּחָה כְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, what to relate Lest you say would require placement as a Torah scroll. it teaches us
llm_translation: So what is there to say? What might you say? You might say, "It should be sought like the Book of the Torah" — this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי שֶׁגִּיהֵק וּפִיהֵק וְנִתְעַטֵּשׁ וְרָק
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: I saw Rabbi belch, yawn, sneeze, spit,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: I saw Rabbi Sheshet who was laughing, and his mouth was open, and he sneezed and spit.

hebrew_text: וּמְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּבִגְדוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא הָיָה מִתְעַטֵּף. וּכְשֶׁהוּא מְפַהֵק הָיָה מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עַל סַנְטֵרוֹ.
human_translation: and feel with his garment, but he would not wrap himself And when he would yawn he would place his hand on his chin
llm_translation: He who serves in his garment, but was not wrapped. And when he was removing, he would place his hand on his belt.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּשְׁמִיעַ קוֹלוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה מִקְּטַנֵּי אֲמָנָה. הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ קוֹלוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ הֲרֵי זֶה מִנְּבִיאֵי הַשֶּׁקֶר.
human_translation: raises an objection One who sounds his voice during his prayer is among those of little faith, One who raises his voice during prayer is among the false prophets,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who raises his voice in his prayer - behold, this is among the small of faith. One who elevates his voice in his prayer - behold, this is among the false prophets.

hebrew_text: מְגַהֵק וּמְפַהֵק — הֲרֵי זֶה מִגַּסֵּי הָרוּחַ. הַמִּתְעַטֵּשׁ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ — סִימָן רַע לוֹ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: נִיכָּר שֶׁהוּא מְכוֹעָר. הָרָק בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ — כְּאִילּוּ רָק בִּפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
human_translation: belches and yawns is surely among the uncouth. One who sneezes during his prayer, for him it is a bad omen. And some say: It is clear that he is repulsive. one who spits during prayer, it is tantamount to spitting in the face of the king.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meghaek u'mephaek — harei zeh miggasei haruach. Hamit'atesh b'tfilato — siman ra lo. Ve'yesh omrim: Nikar shehu mekhoar. Harak b'tfilato — ke'ilu rak bifnei hamelekh." English translation: "One who sighs and groans — this is of arrogant spirit. One who stretches in his prayer — it is a bad sign for him. And some say: It is recognizable that he is ugly. One who spits in his prayer — as if he spits before the king."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מְגַהֵק וּמְפַהֵק לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לְאוֹנְסוֹ, כָּאן לִרְצוֹנוֹ. אֶלָּא מִתְעַטֵּשׁ אַמִּתְעַטֵּשׁ קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, one who belches and yawns, it is not difficult: Here, it was involuntary here, it is deliberate. between sneezing and sneezing is difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, twisting and turning is not difficult: here for his coercion, here for his will. Rather, he twists and twists, difficult!

hebrew_text: מִתְעַטֵּשׁ אַמִּתְעַטֵּשׁ נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן מִלְּמַעְלָה, כָּאן מִלְּמַטָּה. דְּאָמַר רַב זֵירָא: הָא מִילְּתָא אִבַּלְעָא לִי בֵּי רַב הַמְנוּנָא וּתְקִילָא לִי כִּי כּוּלֵּי תַּלְמוּדַאי: הַמִּתְעַטֵּשׁ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁעוֹשִׂים לוֹ נַחַת רוּחַ מִלְּמַטָּה, כָּךְ עוֹשִׂים לוֹ נַחַת רוּחַ מִלְּמַעְלָה.
human_translation: between sneezing and sneezing is also not difficult: Here, from above, here, from below, As Rav Zeira said: In the school of Rav Hamnuna I absorbed this matter and it is equal to all the rest of my learning: One who sneezes in the midst of prayer, it is a good omen for him. Just as giving him pleasure below, they are similarly giving him pleasure above.
llm_translation: He who wraps himself, let him wrap himself well; it is not difficult. Here from above, here from below. For Rav Zeira said: This matter I swallowed in the house of Rav Hamnuna and it became light to me like all the students of the Talmud: One who wraps himself in his prayer, it is a good sign for him, just as they bring him satisfaction from below, so too they bring him satisfaction from above.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רָק אַרָק קַשְׁיָא! רָק אַרָק נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא, אֶפְשָׁר כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִילָּה וְנִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ רוֹק — מַבְלִיעוֹ בְּטַלִּיתוֹ. וְאִם טַלִּית נָאֶה הוּא — מַבְלִיעוֹ בַּאֲפַרְקְסוּתוֹ. רָבִינָא הֲוָה קָאֵי אֲחוֹרֵי רַב אָשֵׁי, נִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ רוֹק, פַּתְקֵיהּ לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה מַבְלִיעוֹ בַּאֲפַרְקְסוּתוֹ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא אֲנִינָא דַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: However, between spitting and spitting is difficult. between spitting and spitting is also not difficult, it is possible in accordance with Rav Yehuda, Rav Yehuda said: One who was standing in prayer, and saliva happened his he absorbs it in his garment. And if it was a fine garment he may cover it up in his head covering. Ravina was standing behind Rav Ashi saliva happened his so he discharged it behind him. said to him: does the Master not hold that Rav Yehuda, who said one absorbs it in his head covering? He said to him: I am delicate,
llm_translation: Rather, only a cough! Only a cough is not a concern, it is possible as Rav Yehudah said: If one is standing in prayer and saliva comes to him, he swallows it with his cloak. And if his cloak is nice, he swallows it with his sleeve. Ravina was standing behind Rav Ashe, saliva came to him, he spat it behind him. He said to him: Does the Master not hold like Rav Yehudah that one should swallow it with his sleeve? He said to him: I have my own opinion.

hebrew_text: הַמַּשְׁמִיעַ קוֹלוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ הֲרֵי זֶה מִקְּטַנֵּי אֲמָנָה. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְכַוֵּון אֶת לִבּוֹ בְּלַחַשׁ, אֲבָל אֵין יָכוֹל לְכַוֵּון אֶת לִבּוֹ בְּלַחַשׁ — מוּתָּר. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי, בְּיָחִיד, אֲבָל בְּצִיבּוּר — אָתֵי לְמִיטְרַד צִיבּוּרָא.
human_translation: One who sounds his voice during his prayer is among those of little faith. Rav Huna said: This was only taught where one is able to focus his heart but is unable to focus his heart silently, he is permitted This applies only to alone, in a congregation will come to disturb the congregation
llm_translation: The one who makes his voice heard in his prayer, behold, this is among the minor faithful. Rav Huna said: They did not teach this, rather, that he can direct his heart in a whisper, but he cannot direct his heart in a whisper - it is permitted. And these matters, in private, but in public - it leads to disturbing the public.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא הֲוָה קָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה דַּהֲוָה קָא בָּעֵי לְמִיסַּק לְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה מִבָּבֶל לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּבֶלָה יוּבָאוּ וְשָׁמָּה יִהְיוּ עַד יוֹם פׇּקְדִי אוֹתָם נְאֻם ה׳״. אָמַר: אֵיזִיל וְאֶשְׁמַע מִינֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא מִבֵּית וַועֲדָא, וַהֲדַר אֶפֹּיק.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba was avoiding by Rav Yehuda, sought to ascend to Eretz Yisrael as Rav Yehuda said: Anyone who ascends from Babylonia to Eretz Yisrael transgresses a positive commandment, as it is stated: “They shall be taken to Babylonia and there they shall remain until the day that I recall them, said the Lord” he said: I will go and hear something from him at the hall assemble, and afterwards I will leave
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba was distancing himself from the teachings of Rav Yehuda, who was seeking to go to the Land of Israel, as Rav Yehuda said: "Anyone who ascends from Babylon to the Land of Israel - he transgresses a positive commandment, as it is stated: 'To Babylon they shall be brought and there they shall remain until the day I remember them,' says the Lord." He said: "I will go and hear from him a matter from the House of Study, and then I will come out."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְתַנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְנִתְעַטֵּשׁ — מַמְתִּין עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה הָרוּחַ וְחוֹזֵר וּמִתְפַּלֵּל. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וּבִיקֵּשׁ לְהִתְעַטֵּשׁ — מַרְחִיק לְאַחֲרָיו אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמִתְעַטֵּשׁ, וּמַמְתִּין עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה הָרוּחַ, וְחוֹזֵר וּמִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאוֹמֵר: ״רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יְצַרְתָּנוּ נְקָבִים נְקָבִים חֲלוּלִים חֲלוּלִים, גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ חֶרְפָּתֵנוּ וּכְלִימָּתֵנוּ בְּחַיֵּינוּ וּבְאַחֲרִיתֵנוּ רִמָּה וְתוֹלֵעָה״, וּמַתְחִיל מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק.
human_translation: He went and found the tanna , reciting before Rav Yehuda: One who was standing in prayer and sneezed waits until the odor dissipates and resumes praying. Some say: One who was standing in prayer when he felt the need to sneeze retreats four cubits, sneezes, waits until the odor dissipates and resumes praying. And he says: Master of the universe, You have formed us with many orifices and cavities; our disgrace and shame in life are clear and evident before You, as is our destiny with maggots and worms, And he resumes from where he stopped.
llm_translation: He went, he found him, the Mishna that is taught before Rav Yehuda: If he was standing in prayer and he was interrupted — he waits until the wind finishes, and he returns and prays. There are those who say: If he was standing in prayer and he sought to be interrupted — he distances himself four cubits behind him, and he is interrupted, and he waits until the wind finishes, and he returns and prays, and he says: "Master of the Universe, You created us male and female, You created us in various hollows and hollows, it is revealed and known before You our disgrace and our shame in our lives and in our end, worm and maggot," and he begins from the place where he left off.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ לֹא בָּאתִי אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוֹעַ דָּבָר זֶה — דַּיִּי.
human_translation: said to him: Had I only come to hear this teaching, it would have been sufficient for me.
llm_translation: He said to him: If I had come only to hear this matter - it would have sufficed.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה יָשֵׁן בְּטַלִּיתוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיא אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ מִפְּנֵי הַצִּנָּה — חוֹצֵץ בְּטַלִּיתוֹ עַל צַוָּארוֹ, וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: עַל לִבּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: was sleeping with his garment, and he is unable to stick his head out because of the cold, form a barrier with his garment at his neck and recite Shema And some say: at his heart.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one was sleeping in his cloak, and he cannot remove his head because of the hood - he pushes his cloak onto his neck, and recites the Shema. And some say: in his heart.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא הֲרֵי לִבּוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה! קָסָבַר לִבּוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And the first tanna , his heart sees nakedness, holds that one’s heart sees nakedness, it is permitted
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna: "If one's heart sees the nakedness!" He holds that if one's heart sees the nakedness - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עַל פִּיו וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: הָאֱלֹהִים! אִם אַמְרָהּ לִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּפוּמֵּיהּ — לָא צָיֵיתְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who was walking in alleyways filthy he places his hand over his mouth and recites Shema . Rav Ḥisda said to him: By God! if Rabbi Yoḥanan had said it to me with his own mouth, I would not have obeyed him.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one was walking in the narrow alleyways, he places his hand over his mouth and recites the Shema. Rav Chisda said to him: By God! If Rabbi Yochanan had said it to me directly, I would not have paid attention to him.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עַל פִּיו וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: הָאֱלֹהִים! אִם אַמְרָהּ לִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי בְּפוּמֵּיהּ — לָא צָיֵיתְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Some say Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who was walking in alleyways filthy he places his hand over his mouth and recites Shema . Rav Ḥisda said to him: By God! if Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi had said it to me with his own mouth, I would not have obeyed him.
llm_translation: There are some who say: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: If he was walking in narrow alleyways - he would place his hand on his mouth and recite the Shema. Rav Ḥisda said to him: By God! If Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi had said it to me directly - I would not have paid attention to him.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: תַּלְמִיד חָכָם אָסוּר לוֹ לַעֲמוֹד בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת לְפִי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לַעֲמוֹד בְּלִי הִרְהוּר תּוֹרָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן — בְּעוֹמֵד, כָּאן — בִּמְהַלֵּךְ.
human_translation: Did Rav Huna say that? Didn’t Rav Huna say: A Torah scholar is prohibited from standing in a place of filth, as he is unable to stand without contemplating Torah, is not difficult; here, in standing here in walking
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said thus, Rav Huna? But didn't Rav Huna say: A Torah scholar is forbidden to stand in a place of frivolity because he cannot stand there without Torah thoughts! It is not difficult: here — standing, here — walking.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּכָל מָקוֹם מוּתָּר לְהַרְהֵר בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, חוּץ מִבֵּית הַמֶּרְחָץ וּמִבֵּית הַכִּסֵּא. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי כָּאן בְּעוֹמֵד כָּאן בִּמְהַלֵּךְ — אִינִי, וְהָא רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וַהֲוָה קָא קָרֵי קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. כִּי מְטָא בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת אִשְׁתִּיק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְהֵיכָן אֶהְדַּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם שָׁהִיתָ כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — חֲזוֹר לָרֹאשׁ!
human_translation: Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say that? Didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One is permitted to contemplate matters of Torah everywhere, except the bathhouse and the bathroom? And if you say: Here, too, here, in standing; here, in walking, is that so? Wasn’t Rabbi Abbahu walking after Rabbi Yoḥanan and reciting Shema , when he reached a filthy alleyway he fell silent said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: To where should I return said to him: If you delayed sufficient to complete the entire return to the beginning
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said thus, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabba bar bar Chana say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: In every place it is permitted to contemplate matters of Torah, except for the bathhouse and the restroom. And if you say: Here one stands, here one walks - I do not agree. But Rabbi Avahu used to follow behind Rabbi Yochanan and would recite the Shema. When he reached the filthy alleys, he would remain silent. He said to Rabbi Yochanan: Where should I return? He said to him: If you have stayed long enough to complete it all, return to the beginning!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידִי לָא סְבִירָא לִי, לְדִידָךְ דִּסְבִירָא לָךְ, אִם שָׁהִיתָ כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ חֲזוֹר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: he says to him as follows: I do not hold for you, who holds if you delayed sufficient to complete the entire return to the beginning
llm_translation: So he said to him: According to my opinion, I do not think so; according to your opinion, since you think so, if you have spent enough time to finish the entire matter, go back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: הַמְהַלֵּךְ בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עַל פִּיו וְיִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת — לֹא יִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם הָיָה קוֹרֵא וּבָא — פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rav Huna,   it is taught in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda. It is taught in accordance with of Rav Huna: One who was walking in filthy alleyways places his hand over his mouth and recites Shema . It is taught in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda: One who was walking in filthy alleyways may not recite Shema . Furthermore, if he was in the course of reciting he stops
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Huna, it was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Ḥisda. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Huna: One who walks in dark alleys should place his hand over his mouth and recite the Shema. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Ḥisda: If one was walking in dark alleys, he should not recite the Shema, and furthermore, if he was reciting and entered, he should stop.

hebrew_text: לֹא פָּסַק — מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי מְיָאשָׁה בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְגַם אֲנִי נָתַתִּי לָהֶם חֻקִּים לֹא טוֹבִים וּמִשְׁפָּטִים לֹא יִחְיוּ בָּהֶם״.
human_translation: one did not stop, what Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: Of him the verse says: “Moreover, I gave them statutes that were not good and laws by which they could not live”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Lo pasak - mai? Amar Rabbi Meyasha bar Berei d'Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Alav hakatuv omer: 'VeGam ani natati lahem chukim lo tovim u'mishpatim lo yichyu bahem.'" English translation: "Did he not cease - what is the reason? Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: Regarding him, the Scripture says: 'I also gave them statutes that were not good and ordinances by which they could not live.'"

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: ״הוֹי מוֹשְׁכֵי הֶעָוֹן בְּחַבְלֵי הַשָּׁוְא״. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי דְבַר ה׳ בָּזָה״.
human_translation: Rav Asi said “Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of vanity” Rav Adda bar Ahava said from here: “For he has shown contempt for the word of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: "Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of falsehood." Rav Adda bar Ahava said from here: "For they have despised the word of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְאִם פָּסַק מַה שְּׂכָרוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וּבַדָּבָר הַזֶּה תַּאֲרִיכוּ יָמִים״.
human_translation: And if he stopped what is his reward? Rabbi Abbahu said: Of him the verse says: “And it is through this matter that you will prolong your days”
llm_translation: "And if he stopped, what is his reward?" Rabbi Abbahu said: Upon him the Scripture says: 'And in this matter you will prolong days.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָיְתָה טַלִּיתוֹ חֲגוּרָה לוֹ עַל מׇתְנָיו — מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הָיְתָה טַלִּיתוֹ שֶׁל בֶּגֶד וְשֶׁל עוֹר וְשֶׁל שַׂק חֲגוּרָה עַל מׇתְנָיו — מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: One garment was tied around his waist, is permitted to recite Shema . that was also taught One garment of cloth, of leather, of sack was strapped around his waist, he is permitted to recite Shema .
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: If his cloak is girded upon his loins - he is permitted to recite the Shema. It was also taught in a Baraita likewise: If his cloak of cloth, leather, or sackcloth is girded upon his loins - he is permitted to recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לִתְפִלָּה עַד שֶׁיְּכַסֶּה אֶת לִבּוֹ.
human_translation: However, for prayer, until he covers his heart,
llm_translation: But for prayer until he covers his heart.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: שָׁכַח וְנִכְנַס בִּתְפִילִּין לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עֲלֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁיִּגְמוֹר. עַד שֶׁיִּגְמוֹר סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא כִּדְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: עַד שֶׁיִּגְמוֹר עַמּוּד רִאשׁוֹן. וְלִפְסוֹק לְאַלְתַּר וְלֵיקוּם? מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר, עַמּוּד הַחוֹזֵר — מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי הִדְרוֹקָן, סִילוֹן הַחוֹזֵר — מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי יֵרָקוֹן.
human_translation: And Rav Huna said: One forgot and entered the bathroom while donning phylacteries places his hand on them until he finishes. Does it enter your mind until he is finished? Rather, as Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Until he finishes the first mass Let him stop immediately and stand because of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. As it was taught A mass that is held back causes a person from dropsy [ hidrokan ], while a stream that is held back causes a person from jaundice [ yerakon ].
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said: If one forgot and entered the bathroom wearing tefillin, he places his hand on them until he finishes. Until he finishes, is it your opinion?! Rather, as Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Until he finishes the first pillar. And to stop immediately and remove them? Because of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, one who returns the pillar brings a person to the risk of being trampled, and one who returns the lintel brings a person to the risk of being struck.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: צוֹאָה עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ, אוֹ יָדוֹ מוּנַּחַת בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב הוּנָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּל הַנְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּל יָהּ הַלְלוּיָהּ״.
human_translation: It was stated fecal matter on his skin or hand, was placed inside the bathroom. Rav Huna said: permitted to recite Shema . Rav Ḥisda said: He is prohibited from reciting Shema . Rava said: What is the reason for Rav Huna’s As it is written: “Let every soul neshama praise the Lord; Halleluya”
llm_translation: It was stated: If one has excrement on his flesh, or his hand is resting in the privy, Rav Huna said: It is permitted to recite the Shema. Rav Chisda said: It is forbidden to recite the Shema. Rava said: What is the reason for Rav Huna's opinion? Because it is written: "Let every soul praise the Lord, Hallelujah."

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא — דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל עַצְמוֹתַי תֹּאמַרְנָה ה׳ מִי כָמוֹךָ״.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: He is prohibited from reciting Shema . What is the reason for Rav Ḥisda’s As it is written: “All of my bones shall say: Lord, who is like You”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: It is forbidden to recite the Shema. What is the reason for Rav Ḥisda's statement? As it is written: "All my bones shall say, 'O Lord, who is like You?'"

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: רֵיחַ רַע שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עִיקָּר — רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִמְּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק הָרֵיחַ, וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: It was said a foul odor that source? Rav Huna said: He distances himself four cubits and recites Shema . And Rav Ḥisda said: he distances himself four cubits from the place that the odor ceased and recites Shema .
llm_translation: It was stated: A bad smell that has a source - Rav Huna said: One should distance oneself four cubits and recite the Shema. And Rav Ḥisda said: One should distance oneself four cubits from where the smell ceased, and recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא יִקְרָא אָדָם קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, לֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת אָדָם, וְלֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת כְּלָבִים, וְלֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת חֲזִירִים, וְלֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת תַּרְנְגוֹלִים, וְלֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת אַשְׁפָּה שֶׁרֵיחָהּ רָע. וְאִם הָיָה מָקוֹם גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים אוֹ נָמוּךְ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — יוֹשֵׁב בְּצִדּוֹ וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. וְאִם לָאו — מַרְחִיק מִמֶּנּוּ מְלוֹא עֵינָיו. וְכֵן לִתְפִלָּה. רֵיחַ רַע שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עִיקָּר — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִמְּקוֹם הָרֵיחַ, וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: it was taught in in accordance with Rav Ḥisda: A person may not recite Shema opposite human excrement, dog excrement, pig excrement, chicken excrement, a foul-smelling dung-heap However, if were in a place ten handbreadths above or ten handbreadths below he may sit alongside it and recite Shema , And if not he must distance himself his range of vision. And the same is true of prayer. a foul odor with a source, he distances himself four cubits from the place the odor and recites Shema .
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ḥisda: A person should not recite the Shema opposite the excrement of a person, nor opposite the excrement of dogs, nor opposite the excrement of pigs, nor opposite the excrement of roosters, nor opposite the excrement of a foul-smelling herb. And if there is a height of ten handbreadths or a depression of ten handbreadths, he should sit on his side and recite the Shema. And if not, he should distance himself the space of his eyes. And the same applies to prayer. If there is a bad smell that has substance, he should distance himself four cubits from the source of the smell, and recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֵית הִלְכְתָא כִּי הָא מַתְנִיתָא בְּכָל הָנֵי שְׁמַעְתָּתָא, אֶלָּא כִּי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יִקְרָא אָדָם קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע לֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת אָדָם, וְלֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת חֲזִירִים וְלֹא כְּנֶגֶד צוֹאַת כְּלָבִים בִּזְמַן שֶׁנָּתַן עוֹרוֹת לְתוֹכָן.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is not in accordance with this baraita in all of these rulings, rather in accordance with that which was taught One may neither recite Shema opposite human excrement nor opposite pig excrement, nor opposite dog excrement into which skins had been placed
llm_translation: Rava said: There is no halakha like this Mishnah in all those teachings, but rather like this that is taught: A person should not recite the Shema opposite the excrement of a person, nor opposite the excrement of pigs, nor opposite the excrement of dogs when their hides have been placed within them.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: רֵיחַ רַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עִיקָּר, מַהוּ? אָמַר לְהוּ: אֲתוֹ חֲזוֹ הָנֵי צִיפֵּי דְבֵי רַב, דְּהָנֵי גָּנוּ וְהָנֵי גָּרְסִי. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֲבָל בִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — לָא. וְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲבָל דִּידֵיהּ — לָא.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: What is a foul odor that has no source, He said to them: Come and see these mats in the study hall, as these are sleeping and these are studying, However, this only applies to Torah study but not to the recitation of Shema . And with regard to Torah study we said only with another, but not with himself.
llm_translation: He inquired of Rav Sheshet: A bad smell that has no substance, what is the ruling? He said to them: These cups of Rav's house have come, some are made of gardenia wood and some of cedar wood. And these matters are concerning matters of Torah, but in the recitation of the Shema — no. And we did not say concerning matters of Torah either, only regarding his companions, but concerning himself — no.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: צוֹאָה עוֹבֶרֶת — אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. רָבָא אָמַר: אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: It was stated feces passing Abaye stated: One is permitted to recite Shema while Rava said: One is forbidden to recite Shema
llm_translation: It was stated: A passing gas - Abbaye said: It is permitted to recite the Shema. Rava said: It is forbidden to recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דִּתְנַן: הַטָּמֵא עוֹמֵד תַּחַת הָאִילָן וְהַטָּהוֹר עוֹבֵר — טָמֵא. טָהוֹר עוֹמֵד תַּחַת הָאִילָן וְטָמֵא עוֹבֵר — טָהוֹר. וְאִם עָמַד — טָמֵא. וְכֵן בְּאֶבֶן הַמְנוּגַּעַת.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this we learned the ritually impure is standing under a tree and a ritually pure passes is impure, pure person is standing under the tree and the impure passes, he pure. And if stopped impure. The same is true with regard to a stone afflicted
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this to her - as we learned: The impure one stands beneath the tree and the pure one passes - impure. The pure one stands beneath the tree and the impure one passes - pure. And if he stood - impure. And so too with the afflicted stone.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: הָתָם בִּקְבִיעוּתָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, דִּכְתִיב ״בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה מוֹשָׁבוֹ״. הָכָא, ״וְהָיָה מַחֲנֶיךָ קָדוֹשׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And Rava said to you: There, it is contingent upon the permanence as it is written: “He shall dwell alone; outside the camp shall his dwelling be” Here, the Torah stated “And your camp shall be holy” and there is no
llm_translation: Rava said to you: There, in a permanent matter hangs the issue, as it is written "He shall dwell alone outside the camp shall his dwelling be." Here, "And your camp shall be holy" the Merciful One said, but this does not apply.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: פִּי חֲזִיר כְּצוֹאָה עוֹבֶרֶת דָּמֵי. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּסָלֵיק מִנַּהֲרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: The mouth of a pig is like passing feces. That is obvious. No, necessary even though emerged from the river
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The mouth of a pig is like a tube that passes through blood. It is obvious! It is not necessary even though it comes up from the river.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: סְפֵק צוֹאָה — אֲסוּרָה. סְפֵק מֵי רַגְלַיִם — מוּתָּרִים. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: סְפֵק צוֹאָה, בַּבַּיִת — מוּתֶּרֶת, בָּאַשְׁפָּה — אֲסוּרָה. סְפֵק מֵי רַגְלַיִם — אֲפִילּוּ בָּאַשְׁפָּה נָמֵי מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: uncertainty feces, it is prohibited uncertainty urine, it is permitted Some say Rav Yehuda said: uncertainty feces, in the home it is permitted in the dung-heap forbidden uncertainty urine, even in the dung-heap it is permitted
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A doubtful matter of excrement - is forbidden. A doubtful matter of urine - is permitted. There are those who say, Rav Yehudah said: A doubtful matter of excrement, in the house - is permitted, in the garbage - is forbidden. A doubtful matter of urine - even in the garbage they are permitted.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד עַמּוּד בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: He holds in accordance with that which Rav Hamnuna as Rav Hamnuna said: The Torah prohibited only opposite the stream
llm_translation: He thought to her, as this that Rav Hamnuna said: The Torah only forbade opposite a pillar alone.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן. דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״וְיָד תִּהְיֶה לְךָ מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה וְיָצָאתָ שָׁמָּה חוּץ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיָתֵד תִּהְיֶה לְךָ וְגוֹ׳ וְכִסִּיתָ אֶת צֵאָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: And in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan, as Rabbi Yonatan contradiction it is written: “You shall also have a place outside the camp, to which you will go” and it is written “And you shall have a spade and cover your excrement”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yonatan said: It is written, "And a place shall be for you outside the camp, and you shall go out there" (Deuteronomy 23:13), and it is also written, "And you shall have a peg, and you shall cover your excrement" (Deuteronomy 23:14).

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן בִּגְדוֹלִים, כָּאן בִּקְטַנִּים. אַלְמָא קְטַנִּים לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד עַמּוּד בִּלְבַד. הָא נְפוּל לְאַרְעָא — שְׁרֵי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בְּהוּ, וְכִי גְזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן — בְּוַדָּאָן, אֲבָל בִּסְפֵקָן — לָא גְזוּר.
human_translation: How is this Here, it refers to feces; here, it refers to urine. Consequently, urine, was only prohibited by Torah law opposite the stream but once it has fallen to the ground, it is permitted. And the Sages are those who issued a decree with regard to And when they issued a decree, it was only in their certain but in their uncertain they did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? Here with adults, here with minors. This implies that the Torah only prohibited minors opposite a pillar alone. If it fell to the ground - it is permitted, and it is the Rabbis who decreed concerning it. And when the Rabbis decreed concerning it - it is certain, but in their doubt - they did not decree.

hebrew_text: וּבְוַדָּאָן עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין. וְכֵן אָמַר עוּלָּא: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין. גְּנִיבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁרִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר.
human_translation: In a case of the certain until when Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: As long as it moisten And so too Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: As long as it moistens. And so too Ulla said: As long as it moistens. Geniva in the name of Rav said: as long as its mark is apparent
llm_translation: In Vad'an, until when? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: As long as they drip. And so said Rabbah bar bar Ḥana in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: As long as they drip. And Ulla said: As long as they drip. Geniva in the name of Rav said: As long as the residue is recognizable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: שְׁרָא לֵיהּ מָרֵיהּ לִגְנִיבָא, הַשְׁתָּא צוֹאָה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב כֵּיוָן שֶׁקָּרְמוּ פָּנֶיהָ — מוּתָּר, מֵי רַגְלַיִם מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: May his Master, forgive Geniva, Now, feces, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Once its surface has crust, one is permitted is it necessary urine
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: His master permitted him to steal, now he says a cry? Rav Yehuda said Rav, since they have blackened her face - it is permitted, does it require the water of the feet?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָא, סְמוֹךְ אַהָא, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: צוֹאָה, אֲפִילּוּ כְּחֶרֶס — אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: What did you see that you to rely on that Rely on this as Rabba bar Rav Huna said Rav said: feces, even as earthenware, is prohibited.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: What do you see that you rely on this? Rely on this, for Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: A vessel, even like pottery, is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי צוֹאָה כְּחֶרֶס? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁזּוֹרְקָה וְאֵינָהּ נִפְרֶכֶת. וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁגּוֹלְלָהּ וְאֵינָהּ נִפְרֶכֶת.
human_translation: What are the circumstances feces like earthenware? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: As long as one throws it and it does not crumble, And some say: As long as one roll it and it does not crumble.
llm_translation: And how are the blood of excrement like earthenware? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: As long as it is being poured and not broken. And there are those who say: As long as it is rolled and not broken.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה מִדִּיפְתִּי חֲזָא צוֹאָה, אֲמַר לִי: עַיֵּין אִי קָרְמוּ פָּנֶיהָ אִי לָא. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי הָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַיֵּין אִי מִפְּלַאי אִפְּלוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said: I was standing before Rav Yehuda of Difti he saw feces. He said to me: Examine whether or not its surface has crust. Some say he said to him as follows: Examine if it is cracked,
llm_translation: Ravina said: I was standing before Rav Yehuda in Dipatay when I saw a woman, he said to me: "See if her face is black or not." Some say he said to him: "See if her face is shining or not."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אִתְּמַר: צוֹאָה כְּחֶרֶס, אֲמֵימַר אָמַר אֲסוּרָה, וּמַר זוּטְרָא אָמַר מוּתֶּרֶת. אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא: צוֹאָה כְּחֶרֶס אֲסוּרָה, וּמֵי רַגְלַיִם כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין.
human_translation: What about this? It was stated feces as earthenware; Ameimar said: It is prohibited, and Mar Zutra said: It is permitted. Rava said the halakha feces as earthenware it is prohibited, and urine, as long as it moistens.
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? It was stated: "Its excrement is like earthenware," Ameimar said it is prohibited, and Mar Zutra said it is permitted. Rava said: The halakha is: Its excrement is like earthenware, it is prohibited, but the urine of the feet is permissible as long as they are dripping.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מֵי רַגְלַיִם כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין — אֲסוּרִין, נִבְלְעוּ אוֹ יָבְשׁוּ — מוּתָּרִים. מַאי לָאו נִבְלְעוּ דֻּומְיָא דְּיָבְשׁוּ, מָה יָבְשׁוּ דְּאֵין רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר, אַף נִבְלְעוּ — דְּאֵין רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר. הָא רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר — אָסוּר, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵין מַטְפִּיחִין!
human_translation: raises an objection Urine, as long as it moistens it is prohibited. If it was absorbed or dried it is permitted. What, is absorbed not similar dried? Just as when it dries its mark is no apparent, so too when it is absorbed, its mark is no apparent But its mark is apparent, it is prohibited, even though it no longer moistens.
llm_translation: Challenger: Water of feet, as long as they are splashing - forbidden, if they were swallowed or dried - permitted. What is the reason that if they were swallowed it is similar to if they were dried? Just as if they were dried, where the footprint is not recognizable, so too if they were swallowed - where the footprint is not recognizable. If the footprint is recognizable - it is forbidden, even though they are not splashing!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין — הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר — שְׁרֵי! אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the first clause: As long as it moistens it is prohibited, But if its mark is apparent, it is permitted. Rather, no can be deduced from this
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the beginning: as long as they drip - it is forbidden, but if the smell is recognizable - it is permitted! Rather, from here it is not to be inferred.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּשְׁפְּכוּ מִמֶּנּוּ מֵי רַגְלַיִם, אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדּוֹ. וּמֵי רַגְלַיִם עַצְמָן שֶׁנִּשְׁפְּכוּ, נִבְלְעוּ — מוּתָּר, לֹא נִבְלְעוּ — אָסוּר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to a the tanna’im , It is forbidden to recite Shema opposite a vessel from which urine was poured. However, the urine itself that was poured, was absorbed it is permitted; was not absorbed, it is prohibited. Rabbi Yosei says: as long as it moistens.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: A vessel from which water of the feet spilled, it is forbidden to recite the Shema facing it. If the water of the feet themselves spilled, if they were absorbed — permitted, if they were not absorbed — forbidden. Rabbi Yosei says: As long as they are dripping.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״נִבְלְעוּ״ וּמַאי ״לֹא נִבְלְעוּ״ דְּקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אִילֵימָא נִבְלְעוּ דְּאֵין מַטְפִּיחִין, לֹא נִבְלְעוּ דְּמַטְפִּיחִין — וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר — שְׁרֵי, הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אֶלָּא נִבְלְעוּ דְּאֵין רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר, לֹא נִבְלְעוּ — דְּרִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: What is absorbed and not absorbed in what the first tanna says? If you say absorbed does not moisten and not absorbed moistens, and Rabbi Yosei came to say: As long as it moistens it is prohibited, but mark is apparent, it is permitted. that is first tanna Rather, absorbed its mark is not apparent not absorbed its mark is apparent. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: As long as it moistens, it is prohibited, but mark is apparent, it is permitted,
llm_translation: What is "they were swallowed" and what is "they were not swallowed" that the first Tanna is saying? If you say "they were swallowed" meaning that they do not bubble, and "they were not swallowed" meaning that they bubble - Rabbi Yosei came to say: as long as they bubble, it is forbidden, but if the foam is recognizable - it is permitted, this is what the first Tanna said! Rather, "they were swallowed" meaning that the foam is not recognizable, "they were not swallowed" - meaning that the foam is recognizable. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: as long as they bubble, it is forbidden, but if the foam is recognizable - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: לָא. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּטְפִּיחִין הוּא דְּאָסוּר הָא רִשּׁוּמָן נִיכָּר — שְׁרֵי,
human_translation: No, everyone, as long as it moistens, it is prohibited, mark is apparent, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Not. Of all the world, as long as they are dripping, it is forbidden. But if the smell is recognizable, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּטוֹפֵחַ עַל מְנָת לְהַטְפִּיחַ, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And here, the difference between them is where it is moist enough to moisten
llm_translation: And here, with a handbreadth for the purpose of smearing, there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: יָרַד לִטְבּוֹל, אִם יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת כוּ׳: לֵימָא תַּנָּא סְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר עַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה?
human_translation: one who descended to immerse himself whether or not he is able to ascend, Let us say taught unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: until sunrise.
llm_translation: He descended to immerse, if he is able to ascend, etc. Let us say: a Tanna taught anonymously like Rabbi Eliezer who said until sunrise?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְדִלְמָא כְּוָתִיקִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וָתִיקִין הָיוּ גּוֹמְרִין אוֹתָהּ עִם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Yehoshua, and perhaps in accordance with vatikin , Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The vatikin would conclude with sunrise.
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehoshua, but perhaps it is like the elders. As Rabbi Yochanan said: The elders used to finish it with the rising of the sun.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו — יִתְכַּסֶּה בְּמַיִם וְיִקְרָא. וַהֲרֵי לִבּוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה?
human_translation: And if not cover himself in the water and recite His heart sees nakedness
llm_translation: And if not - he shall cover himself with water and read. But behold, his heart sees the nakedness?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְאִי תֵּימָא רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר אַבָּא בַּר אַחָא מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: בְּמַיִם עֲכוּרִין שָׁנוּ, דְּדָמוּ כְּאַרְעָא סְמִיכְתָּא, שֶׁלֹּא יִרְאֶה לִבּוֹ עֶרְוָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, and some say Rabbi Aḥa bar Abba bar Aḥa in the name of Rabbeinu, This was taught with regard to murky water, which is like solid earth. his heart does not see nakedness.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, and if you wish say Rabbi Acha bar Abba bar Acha in the name of our teacher: In murky waters they decreed, for their blood is like the earth's closeness, so that his heart will not see his nakedness.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַיִם צְלוּלִין — ישֵׁב בָּהֶן עַד צַוָּארוֹ וְקוֹרֵא. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים עוֹכְרָן בְּרַגְלוֹ.
human_translation: the Sages taught clear water, he should sit in it up to his neck and recite Shema . And some say: He sullies with his foot.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Clear water" - one may immerse in it up to his neck and read. And some say, "He may defecate in it with his foot."

hebrew_text: וְתָנָא קַמָּא, וַהֲרֵי לִבּוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה! קָסָבַר לִבּוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה — מוּתָּר. וַהֲרֵי עֲקֵבוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה! קָסָבַר עֲקֵבוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And the first tanna doesn’t his heart see nakedness He holds his heart sees nakedness, it is permitted But doesn’t his heel see nakedness? holds his heel sees nakedness permitted.
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first clause: But his heart sees the nakedness! He holds that if his heart sees the nakedness, it is permitted. And in the second clause: But his heel sees the nakedness! He holds that if his heel sees the nakedness, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: עֲקֵבוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָעֶרְוָה מוּתָּר, נוֹגֵעַ — אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אָסוּר, וְרָבָא אָמַר: מוּתָּר. רַב זְבִיד מַתְנִי לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא הָכִי. רַב חִינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא מַתְנִי לַהּ הָכִי: נוֹגֵעַ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר, רוֹאֶה — אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אָסוּר, רָבָא אָמַר: מוּתָּר: לֹא נִתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת. וְהִלְכְתָא נוֹגֵעַ — אָסוּר, רוֹאֶה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: it was stated: one’s heel sees nakedness it is permitted. touches Abaye said: It is prohibited, and Rava said: It is permitted. Rav Zevid taught this halakha in that manner. Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rav Ika, taught it as follows: touches everyone agrees that it is prohibited. sees Abaye said: It is prohibited, and Rava said: It is permitted; the Torah was not given to the ministering angels, And the halakha touches it is prohibited, sees it is permitted.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who sees the nakedness, it is permitted; one who touches - Abbaye said: It is forbidden, and Rava said: It is permitted. Rav Zevid taught her this teaching: Rav Chinana, son of Rav Ika, taught her this teaching: One who touches - the words of everyone are forbidden, one who sees - Abbaye said: It is forbidden, Rava said: It is permitted. The Torah was not given to ministering angels. And the halacha is: one who touches - it is forbidden, one who sees - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: צוֹאָה בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית, מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדָּהּ. עֶרְוָה בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית, אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדָּהּ. צוֹאָה בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדָּהּ דְּצוֹאָה בְּכִיסּוּי תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, וְהָא מִיכַּסְּיָא. עֶרְוָה בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדָּהּ, ״וְלֹא יִרְאֶה בְךָ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא. וְהָא קָמִיתְחַזְיָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Opposite feces by lantern it is permitted to recite Shema . opposite nakedness by lantern- it is prohibited to recite Shema . Opposite feces in a lantern, it is permitted to recite Shema feces, is contingent upon covering, and it is covered. opposite nakedness by lantern- it is prohibited to recite Shema ; the Torah said: “And no indecent thing shall be seen in you” and it is seen.
llm_translation: Rava said: If there is feces in the sixth hour, it is permitted to recite the Shema facing it. If there is nakedness in the sixth hour, it is forbidden to recite the Shema facing it. If there is feces in the sixth hour, it is permitted to recite the Shema facing it because feces in a covering is considered like something covered. If there is nakedness in the sixth hour, it is forbidden to recite the Shema facing it, "and there shall not be seen among you any nakedness" - said the Merciful One. And this is a settled matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: צוֹאָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּ, מְבַטְּלָהּ בְּרוֹק. אָמַר רָבָא: וּבְרוֹק עָבֶה. אָמַר רָבָא: צוֹאָה בְּגוּמָּא — מַנִּיחַ סַנְדָּלוֹ עָלֶיהָ, וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. בְּעָא מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: צוֹאָה דְּבוּקָה בְּסַנְדָּלוֹ — מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: A small amount of feces may be nullified with spittle, Rava said: thick spittle. Rava said: Feces in a hole he places his sandal over it and recites Shema . Mar, son of Ravina, raised a dilemma: What feces is stuck to his sandal? Let stand
llm_translation: Abbaye said: A small excrement, one nullifies it with spit. Rava said: And with thick spit. Rava said: Excrement stuck to one's sandal - he should place his sandal on it, and recite the Shema. Mar, son of Ravina, asked: Excrement that is stuck to his sandal - what is the law? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: גּוֹי עָרוֹם אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדּוֹ. מַאי אִירְיָא גּוֹי? אֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי! יִשְׂרָאֵל פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּאָסוּר, אֶלָּא גּוֹי אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ מַהוּ דְתֵימָא, הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״אֲשֶׁר בְּשַׂר חֲמוֹרִים בְּשָׂרָם״, אֵימָא כַּחֲמוֹר בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִינְהוּ נָמֵי אִיקְּרוּ עֶרְוָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעֶרְוַת אֲבִיהֶם לֹא רָאוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Opposite a naked gentile, it is forbidden to recite Shema . Why did particularly a gentile? Even with regard to a Jew also a Jew, it is obvious prohibited; however, a gentile, it was necessary for him Lest you say since it is written about “Their flesh is the flesh of donkeys” say is like a mere donkey taught us that their is also considered nakedness, as it is written “And their father’s nakedness they did not see”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A naked non-Jew is forbidden to recite the Shema facing him. What is considered a non-Jew? Even an Israelite as well! It is obvious for an Israelite that it is forbidden, but a non-Jew needs it for what you might say, since it is written about them, "whose flesh is the flesh of donkeys," you might say that he is like a regular donkey, it teaches us that they too are called naked, as it is written: "And they did not see their father's nakedness."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִתְכַּסֶּה לֹא בַּמַּיִם הָרָעִים וְלֹא בְּמֵי הַמִּשְׁרָה עַד שֶׁיָּטִיל לְתוֹכָן מַיִם. וְכַמָּה מַיָּא רָמֵי וְאָזֵיל? אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר לֹא יִתְכַּסֶּה לֹא בְּמַיִם הָרָעִים וְלֹא בְּמֵי הַמִּשְׁרָה כְּלָל. וּמֵי רַגְלַיִם עַד שֶׁיָּטִיל לְתוֹכָן מַיִם, וְיִקְרָא.
human_translation: And may not cover himself with either foul water or water soaked until he pours water into it. How much water does he continue to pour Rather, this is what it says: One may neither cover himself with foul water nor water soaked at all; and urine, until he adds water to it, and he may
llm_translation: "And he shall not cover, neither with the bad waters nor with the waters of purification, until he pours water into them. And how much water should he raise and pour? Rather, this is what he is saying: He shall not cover, neither with the bad waters nor with the waters of purification at all. And the water of the feet until he pours water into them, and he shall read."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כַּמָּה יָטִיל לְתוֹכָן מַיִם — כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי זַכַּאי אוֹמֵר: רְבִיעִית.
human_translation: The Sages taught How much water must one add to Any quantity Rabbi Zakkai says: quarter
llm_translation: The sages taught: How much water one may pour into them - any amount. Rabbi Zakkai says: A quarter-log.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת לְבַסּוֹף. אֲבָל בַּתְּחִילָּה, כׇּל שֶׁהֵן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: dispute afterward However, at the beginning, any amount
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Disagreement in the end. But in the beginning, all of them.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: מַחֲלוֹקֶת לְכַתְּחִילָּה. אֲבָל לְבַסּוֹף דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל רְבִיעִית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: אַיְּיתִי לִי רְבִיעֵיתָא דְמַיָּא, כְּרַבִּי זַכַּאי.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: dispute at the beginning, However, afterward, everyone agrees a quarter Rav Yosef said to his servant Bring me a quarter of water, in accordance with Rabbi Zakkai.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Disagreement initially. But ultimately, everyone agrees a quarter. Rav Yosef said to his attendant: Bring me a quarter of water, like Rabbi Zechariah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גְּרָף שֶׁל רְעִי וְעָבִיט שֶׁל מֵי רַגְלַיִם — אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּנֶגְדָּן, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן כְּלוּם. וּמֵי רַגְלַיִם עַצְמָן — עַד שֶׁיָּטִיל לְתוֹכָן מַיִם. וְכַמָּה יָטִיל לְתוֹכָן מַיִם — כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי זַכַּאי אוֹמֵר: רְבִיעִית. בֵּין לִפְנֵי הַמִּטָּה בֵּין לְאַחַר הַמִּטָּה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לְאַחַר הַמִּטָּה — קוֹרֵא, לִפְנֵי הַמִּטָּה — אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא, אֲבָל מַרְחִיק הוּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְקוֹרֵא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית מֵאָה אַמָּה — לֹא יִקְרָא עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיאֵם אוֹ שֶׁיַּנִּיחֵם תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Opposite a chamber pot excrement or urine, it is prohibited to recite Shema , even if there is nothing in it, Opposite urine itself, until he pours water into it. And how much water must he pour into it? Any quantity. Rabbi Zakkai says: A quarter both before the bed and behind the bed. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: behind the bed, one may recite before the bed, one may not recite but he distance himself four cubits and recite Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar saying: Even a house one hundred cubits one may not recite until he removes it or places it beneath the bed.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A handful of a friend's dough and water of the feet — it is forbidden to recite the Shema opposite them, even though they contain nothing. And the water of the feet itself — until one pours water into them. And how much water should one pour into them — as much as they the feet are. Rabbi Zakkai says: a quarter-log, whether in front of the bed or behind the bed. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: behind the bed — one recites the Shema, in front of the bed — one does not recite, but he distances himself four cubits and recites. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: even in a house of a hundred cubits — one should not recite until he removes them or places them beneath the bed.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר, אַחַר הַמִּטָּה — קוֹרֵא מִיָּד, לִפְנֵי הַמִּטָּה — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְקוֹרֵא, אוֹ דִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: לְאַחַר הַמִּטָּה — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְקוֹרֵא, לִפְנֵי הַמִּטָּה — אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא כְּלָל.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised How does state behind the bed, he recites immediately; before the bed, he distances himself four cubits and recites? Or perhaps he states the following: behind the bed, he distances himself four cubits and then recites before the bed he may not recite at all?
llm_translation: He asked them: What is he saying? After the bed - he reads immediately, in front of the bed - he distances four cubits and reads, or perhaps he is saying this: after the bed - he distances four cubits and reads, in front of the bed - he does not read at all.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַחַר הַמִּטָּה — קוֹרֵא מִיָּד, לִפְנֵי הַמִּטָּה — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית מֵאָה אַמָּה — לֹא יִקְרָא עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיאֵם אוֹ שֶׁיַּנִּיחֵם תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: Come hear it was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: behind the bed he recites immediately; before the bed, he distances himself four cubits. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even a house of one hundred cubits one may not recite until he removes it or places it beneath the bed.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: After the bed - one reads immediately, before the bed - one distances four cubits. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even a house of one hundred cubits - one should not read until he removes them or places them under the bed.

hebrew_text: בַּעְיָין אִיפְּשִׁיטָא לַן, מַתְנְיָיתָא קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי: אֵיפוֹךְ בָּתְרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Our dilemma has been resolved, the baraitot contradict each other. Reverse latter
llm_translation: In the matter of the eye, it was taught to us, the Mishnah raises difficulties against each other: "Turn it over to the other side."

hebrew_text: מָה חָזֵית דְּאָפְכַתְּ בָּתְרָיְיתָא? אֵיפוֹךְ קַמַּיְיתָא!
human_translation: What did you see reverse latter Reverse the first
llm_translation: What did you see that you turned around? Turn back before you!

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר כּוּלֵּיהּ בַּיִת כְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דָּמֵי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא.
human_translation: Who did you hear said that an entire house is considered like four cubits? It is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar,
llm_translation: The one who heard from him that he said, "All of the house is like four cubits in value" - it is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּעַאי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: מִטָּה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּשִׁיטָא לִי דִּכְלָבוּד דָּמֵי. שְׁלֹשָׁה, אַרְבָּעָה, חֲמִשָּׁה, שִׁשָּׁה, שִׁבְעָה, שְׁמֹנָה, תִּשְׁעָה, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא. עֲשָׂרָה וַדַּאי לָא מִיבְּעֵי לִי. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַדְתְּ דְּלָא אִיבַּעְיָא לְךָ, כׇּל עֲשָׂרָה רְשׁוּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי הִיא.
