human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: It is obvious to me that a bed less than three is considered connected [ lavud ] What is three, four, five, six, seven, eight nine He said to him: I do not know. ten I certainly have no dilemma, Abaye said You did well that you did not have a dilemma, any ten is a separate domain.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: I asked Rav Huna: From less than three, it is obvious to me that it is considered like a dog's blood. Three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, what is the ruling? He said to him: I do not know. Ten, surely I do not require. Abaye said: You have done well by not requiring it, for ten is the final authority.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי. עֲשָׂרָה — רְשׁוּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי הִיא. מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עַד עֲשָׂרָה — הַיְינוּ דִּבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף מֵרַב הוּנָא וְלָא פְּשַׁט לֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. וְכֵן אָמַר בָּאלִי אָמַר רַב יַעֲקֹב בְּרַהּ דְּבַת שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is that less than three is considered connected Ten is a separate domain. Three to ten Rav Yosef raised a dilemma before Rav Huna, did not resolve it for him. Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. And, so too, Bali said Rav Ya’akov, son of Shmuel’s daughter, said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. And Rava said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is less than three is considered as if it were three. Ten - it is a separate domain. From three to ten - this is what Rav Yosef son of Rav Huna wanted, but it did not work out for him. Rav said: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. And similarly, in the upper Galilee, Rav Yaakov son of Raha of Shmuel said: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. And Rava said: The halakha is not like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחַאי אִיעַסַּק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא, עַיְּילֵיהּ לְחוּפָּה, וְלָא הֲוָה מִסְתַּיְּיעָא מִילְּתָא. אֲזַל בָּתְרֵיהּ לְעַיּוֹנֵי, חֲזָא סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה דְּמַנְּחָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֵיכוּ הַשְׁתָּא לָא אֲתַאי סַכֵּנְתּוּן לִבְרִי. דְּתַנְיָא: בַּיִת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אוֹ תְּפִילִּין אָסוּר לְשַׁמֵּשׁ בּוֹ אֶת הַמִּטָּה עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיאֵם אוֹ שֶׁיַּנִּיחֵם כְּלִי בְּתוֹךְ כְּלִי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai arranged for his son the family Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta. He him to enter the wedding canopy but he was unsuccessful followed him to examine he saw a Torah scroll placed He said to them: Had I not come now, you would have endangered my son. As it was taught In a room in which there is a Torah scroll or phylacteries, it is forbidden to engage in conjugal relations until he takes them out or places them in a vessel inside a vessel.
llm_translation: Rav Ahai was engaging with his son, the household of Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta. He took him to a wedding, but the matter was not successful. He went with him to the baths, saw a Torah scroll lying there, and said to them: "How can you now endanger the creation?" As it was taught: A house that contains a Torah scroll or phylacteries, it is forbidden to use the bed until they are removed or placed in a vessel within a vessel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ כִּלְיָין, אֲבָל בִּכְלִי שֶׁהוּא כִּלְיָין — אֲפִילּוּ עֲשָׂרָה מָאנֵי כְּחַד מָאנָא דָּמֵי. אָמַר רָבָא: גְּלִימָא
human_translation: Abaye said: They only taught when the vessel is not their, vessel. But a vessel that is their vessel, even ten vessels are considered as one vessel, Rava said: A cloak
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only taught this regarding a vessel that is not a utensil, but with a vessel that is a utensil - even ten measures are like one measure. Rava said: A robe.

hebrew_text: אַקַּמְטְרָא — כִּכְלִי בְּתוֹךְ כְּלִי דָּמֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה — צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מְחִיצָּה עֲשָׂרָה. מָר זוּטְרָא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי, חַזְיֵיהּ לְדוּכְתֵּיהּ דְּמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי דְּמַנַּח בֵּיהּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ מְחִיצָה עֲשָׂרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי? אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בֵּיתָא אַחֲרִינָא, מָר הָא אִית לֵיהּ בֵּיתָא אַחֲרִינָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: atop a chest is like a vessel within a vessel. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: a Torah scroll, must erect a partition ten Mar Zutra happened to the house of Rav Ashi he saw in the chamber of Mar bar Rav Ashi, there was a Torah scroll, and a partition of ten had been erected for it. He said to him: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi? Say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said he has no other room don’t Master, have another room He said to him: that not my mind.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Akamtra — kikli betokh keli damei. Amar Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Sefer Torah — tzarikh la'asot lo mechitzah asarah. Mar Zutra ikla lebei Rav Ashe, chazyeih leduchteih deMar bar Rav Ashei demannach bei sefer Torah va'aveid lei mechitzah asarah. Amar lei: k'man? k'Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi? eimar de'amar Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi de'leit lei beita akharina, mar ha it lei beita akharina? Amar lei: lav addaitai. English translation: Akamtra — like a vessel within a vessel of blood. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A Torah scroll requires a partition of ten. Mar Zutra came to the house of Rav Ashe, saw that Mar bar Rav Ashe placed a Torah scroll there and made a partition of ten. He said to him: Like whom? Like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi? Should we say that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, who does not have another house, but this one has another house? He said to him: I do not know.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה יַרְחִיק מֵהֶן וּמִן הַצּוֹאָה — אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב סְחוֹרָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לַאֲחוֹרָיו, אֲבָל לְפָנָיו — מַרְחִיק מְלֹא עֵינָיו, וְכֵן לִתְפִלָּה.
human_translation: And, how far must one distance himself from urine and from feces Four cubits. Rava said Rav Seḥora said Rav Huna said: They only taught behind him, but before him he must distance himself no longer within his range of vision; is the same prayer.
llm_translation: How far should one distance himself from them and from excrement? — Four cubits. Rava said, Rav Sechora said, Rav Huna said: They only taught regarding behind him, but in front of him — he should avert his gaze, and likewise for prayer.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: עוֹמֵד אָדָם כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּמִתְפַּלֵּל! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ צוֹאָה.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rafram bar Pappa say Rav Ḥisda said: One may stand opposite a bathroom and pray. With what are we dealing here? With a bathroom that has no feces,
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rafḥam son of Papa say that Rav Ḥisda said: A person may stand opposite the privy and pray! What are we dealing with here? We are dealing with a privy that does not contain excrement.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חֲנִינָא: בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא שֶׁאָמְרוּ אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ צוֹאָה וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אָדָם! אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּחַדְתֵי.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Yosef bar Ḥanina say: The bathroom to which referred even in which there were no feces, and the bathhouse to which referred even in which there was no person. Rather, with what are we dealing here? with a new
llm_translation: I?! And did not Rav Yosef bar Chanina say: Regarding a privy that they said even though it does not have excrement, and a bathhouse that they said even though there is no person! Rather, here we are dealing with what? With new ones.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרָבִינָא: הִזְמִינוֹ לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, מַהוּ? יֵשׁ זִימּוּן, אוֹ אֵין זִימּוּן? כִּי קָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרָבִינָא: לְמֵיקַם עֲלֵיהּ לְצַלּוֹיֵי בְּגַוֵּיהּ אֲבָל כְּנֶגְדּוֹ — לָא.
human_translation: Wasn’t this raised as a dilemma Ravina: One who designated as a bathroom, what is its designation or is designation not When Ravina raised the dilemma, stand and pray inside it, but no not one may pray opposite it.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question to Ravina: They invited him to the house of the seat, what is the law? Is there an invitation, or is there no invitation? When Ravina raised a question: To place it for hanging on his body, but opposite him - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי בָּתֵּי כִּסָּאֵי דְּפָרְסָאֵי אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית בְּהוּ צוֹאָה — כִּסְתוּמִין דָּמוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: These Persian bathrooms, even though they contain feces, they are considered as sealed,
llm_translation: Rava said: Those bathhouses of Parsa, even though there is excrement in them - their doors are sealed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זָב שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי, וְנִדָּה שֶׁפָּלְטָה שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, וְהַמְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת שֶׁרָאֲתָה נִדָּה — צְרִיכִין טְבִילָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: zav , who experienced a seminal emission, a menstruating woman who discharged semen, and who engaged in conjugal relations and saw menstrual blood, require immersion. And Rabbi Yehuda exempts
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man who experiences a seminal emission, and a woman who has a discharge of menstrual impurity, and a woman who engages in sexual intercourse while in a state of impurity - they require immersion. Rabbi Yehuda exempts.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בַּעַל קֶרִי, שֶׁרָאָה זִיבָה לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַהוּ? כִּי פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם בְּזָב שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו בַּר טְבִילָה הוּא. אֲבָל בַּעַל קֶרִי שֶׁרָאָה זִיבָה, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא בַּר טְבִילָה הוּא מְחַיַּיב, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before One who experienced a seminal emission saw a discharge zav ; according to Rabbi Yehuda, what is his legal status? When, Rabbi Yehuda exempted a zav who saw a seminal emission was because from the outset he was not fit for immersion, however, one who experienced a seminal emission, saw a discharge zav , was fit for immersion require Or perhaps there is no difference
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: In the case of a Ba'al Keri who saw Zivah according to Rabbi Yehudah, what is the law? When Rabbi Yehudah exempted there in the case of Zav who saw Keri, it is because originally it is not a matter of immersion. But in the case of a Ba'al Keri who saw Zivah, since originally it is a matter of immersion, is he liable, or perhaps it is not different.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע הַמְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת וְרָאֲתָה נִדָּה צְרִיכָה טְבִילָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר. וְהָא מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת וְרָאֲתָה נִדָּה כְּבַעַל קֶרִי שֶׁרָאָה זִיבָה דָּמְיָא, וְקָא פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּהֶדְיָא: בַּעַל קֶרִי שֶׁרָאָה זִיבָה צָרִיךְ טְבִילָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: come hear who engaged in conjugal relations and saw menstrual blood requires immersion. And Rabbi Yehuda exempts Isn’t the who engaged in conjugal relations and saw menstrual blood like one who experienced a seminal emission, saw a discharge zav , and Rabbi Yehuda exempts. Conclude from this Rabbi Ḥiyya explicitly taught: One who experienced a seminal emission saw a discharge zav requires immersion, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who gazes and sees a menstruating woman requires immersion, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts. But if one gazes and sees a menstruating woman like one who has experienced a seminal emission and sees a discharge of blood, Rabbi Yehuda exempts. Learn from this. Rabbi Chiyya taught in the presence of Rabbi Yehuda: One who has experienced a seminal emission and sees a discharge of blood requires immersion, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך מי שמתו
llm_translation: We will return to you, O one who has passed away.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תְּפִלַּת הַשַּׁחַר עַד חֲצוֹת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת. תְּפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה עַד הָעֶרֶב, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד פְּלַג הַמִּנְחָה.
human_translation: the morning prayer until noon. Rabbi Yehuda says: until four hours the afternoon prayer until the evening. Rabbi Yehuda says: until the midpoint of the afternoon [ pelag haminḥa ],
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The morning prayer until midday. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until the fourth hour. The afternoon prayer until evening. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until the half of the afternoon.

hebrew_text: תְּפִלַּת הָעֶרֶב אֵין לָהּ קֶבַע. וְשֶׁל מוּסָפִים כׇּל הַיּוֹם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁבַע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: The evening prayer is not fixed the additional prayer all day. Rabbi Yehuda says: until seven hours
llm_translation: Prayer of the evening has no fixed time. And the additional offerings all day, Rabbi Yehuda says: until seven hours.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: מִצְוָתָהּ עִם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמוֹךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה, וְנִמְצָא מִתְפַּלֵּל בַּיּוֹם!
human_translation: raises a contradiction The mitzva with sunrise he will juxtapose redemption, to prayer, find praying in the daytime.
llm_translation: Gemara: And we raised a dilemma: its commandment is with the rising of the sun, so that redemption should be adjacent to prayer, and it turns out that one prays during the day!

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הַהִיא לְוָתִיקִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וָתִיקִין הָיוּ גּוֹמְרִים אוֹתָהּ עִם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: taught that with regard to those who are scrupulous in fulfillment of mitzvot [ vatikin ]. As Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Vatikin would finish with sunrise,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita to the Elders. For Rabbi Yochanan said: The Elders used to finish it with the rising of the sun.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עַד חֲצוֹת וְתוּ לָא, וְהָאָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טָעָה וְלֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל עַרְבִית — מִתְפַּלֵּל בְּשַׁחֲרִית שְׁתַּיִם, שַׁחֲרִית — מִתְפַּלֵּל בְּמִנְחָה שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Does everyone until noon and no later? Didn’t Rav Mari, son of Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba, say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who erred and did not recite the evening prayer, prays in the morning prayer two the morning prayer, prays in the afternoon prayer two
llm_translation: And all the people until midnight and not yet, and this is what Rav Mari son of Rav Huna son of Rabbi Yirmiyah son of Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one erred and did not pray the evening prayer - he prays two prayers in the morning, morning - he prays two prayers in the afternoon.

hebrew_text: כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא מְצַלֵּי וְאָזֵיל, עַד חֲצוֹת, יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ שְׂכַר תְּפִלָּה בִּזְמַנָּהּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, שְׂכַר תְּפִלָּה — יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ, שְׂכַר תְּפִלָּה בִּזְמַנָּהּ — לָא יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: one may continue praying for the entire day. until noon, they give him a reward for prayer at its time. from there on, they give him a reward for prayer. They do not give him a reward for prayer at its time.
llm_translation: All the days, I pray and go, until midnight, I give him the reward of prayer in its time, from here on, the reward of prayer - I give him, the reward of prayer in its time - I do not give him.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: טָעָה וְלֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל מִנְחָה, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּתְפַּלֵּל עַרְבִית שְׁתַּיִם? אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, טָעָה וְלֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל עַרְבִית מִתְפַּלֵּל שַׁחֲרִית שְׁתַּיִם, מִשּׁוּם דְּחַד יוֹמָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי עֶרֶב וַיְהִי בֹקֶר יוֹם אֶחָד״, אֲבָל הָכָא תְּפִלָּה בִּמְקוֹם קׇרְבָּן הִיא, וְכֵיוָן דְּעָבַר יוֹמוֹ בָּטַל קׇרְבָּנוֹ. אוֹ דִילְמָא כֵּיוָן דִּצְלוֹתָא רַחֲמֵי הִיא, כׇּל אֵימַת דְּבָעֵי מְצַלֵּי וְאָזֵיל.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before them One who erred and did not recite the afternoon prayer, what is recite the evening prayer two If you say one who erred and did not pray the evening prayer prays in the morning prayer two because one day, as it is written: “And there was evening and there was morning, one day” But here, prayer is in place of sacrifice. since its day passed, its sacrifice is invalid Or, perhaps, since prayer is supplication, any time that one wishes, he may continue to pray?
llm_translation: He asked them: If one made a mistake and did not pray the afternoon prayer, what should he do? Should he pray the evening prayer twice? If you might say, if one made a mistake and did not pray the evening prayer, he should pray the morning prayer twice, because it is all considered one day, as it is written: "And there was evening and there was morning, one day." But here, prayer is in place of the offering, and once his day has passed, his offering is nullified. Or perhaps, since twilight is a time of mercy, whenever he wants, he can pray and go.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טָעָה וְלֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל מִנְחָה — מִתְפַּלֵּל עַרְבִית שְׁתַּיִם, וְאֵין בָּזֶה מִשּׁוּם דְּעָבַר יוֹמוֹ בָּטַל קׇרְבָּנוֹ.
human_translation: Come and hear which Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who erred and did not recite the afternoon prayer, prays in the evening prayer two and there is no element of: Its day passed, its sacrifice is invalid.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Huna son of Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one erred and did not pray the afternoon prayer, he should pray two evening prayers, and this does not constitute a case of retroactively nullifying his offering.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי. ״מְעֻוָּת לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקֹן וְחֶסְרוֹן לֹא יוּכַל לְהִמָּנוֹת״: ״מְעֻוָּת לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקֹן״ — זֶה שֶׁבִּטֵּל קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שֶׁל עַרְבִית וּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית, אוֹ תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל עַרְבִית אוֹ תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית. ״וְחֶסְרוֹן לֹא יוּכַל לְהִמָּנוֹת״ — זֶה שֶׁנִּמְנוּ חֲבֵירָיו לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, וְלֹא נִמְנָה עִמָּהֶם.
human_translation: raises an objection “That which is crooked cannot be made straight; and that which is wanting cannot be numbered” That which is crooked cannot be made straight one who omitted the evening Shema and the morning Shema, or the evening prayer, or the morning prayer. And that which is wanting cannot be numbered [ lehimanot ] one whose friends reached a consensus [ nimnu ] a mitzva and he was not part of their consensus [ nimnu ]
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: "A crookedness cannot be rectified, and a deficiency cannot be counted." "A crookedness cannot be rectified" — this refers to one who neglected the evening Shema and the morning Shema, or the evening prayer and the morning prayer. "And a deficiency cannot be counted" — this refers to one who was included with his companions for a mitzvah, but was not counted among them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — שֶׁבִּטֵּל בְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With what are we dealing here intentionally failed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak said Rabbi Yochanan: Here, with what are we dealing? — With nullification done intentionally.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי ״בִּטֵּל״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״טָעָה״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: is also precise as it teaches omitted and did not teach erred. learn from this.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: It is precisely stated, as it teaches "bitel," and it does not teach "ta'ah." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: טָעָה וְלֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל מִנְחָה בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מִתְפַּלֵּל בְּלֵיל שַׁבָּת שְׁתַּיִם. טָעָה וְלֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל מִנְחָה בְּשַׁבָּת — מִתְפַּלֵּל בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁל חוֹל. מַבְדִּיל בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, וְאֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל בִּשְׁנִיָּה. וְאִם הִבְדִּיל בַּשְּׁנִיָּה וְלֹא הִבְדִּיל בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה — שְׁנִיָּה עָלְתָה לוֹ, רִאשׁוֹנָה לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ.
human_translation: the Sages taught One who erred and did not recite the afternoon prayer on the eve of Shabbat, prays in two on Shabbat evening. One who erred and did not recite the afternoon prayer on Shabbat, recites two weekday at the conclusion of Shabbat. He recites havdala [ distinction] in the first but he does not recite havdala in the second if he recited havdala in the second and did not recite havdala in the first, the second prayer fulfilled his first one did not fulfill his
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one made a mistake and did not pray the afternoon prayer on Friday evening, he should pray twice on the night of Shabbat. If one made a mistake and did not pray the afternoon prayer on Shabbat, he should pray twice on Saturday night of the weekday. He should differentiate in the first prayer, but not differentiate in the second. And if he differentiated in the second and did not differentiate in the first, the second is acceptable to him, but the first is not acceptable to him.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכֵיוָן דְּלָא אַבְדִּיל בְּקַמַּיְיתָא כְּמַאן דְּלָא צַלִּי דָּמֵי, וּמַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Is that to say since he did not recite havdala in the first as one who did not pray and we require him to return
llm_translation: In the matter of, since he did not separate in the gathering as one who did not roast the blood, and we return to him?

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים וּשְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. הַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדַּעַת״ אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: raises a contradiction One who erred and did not mention the might of the rains: in the revival of the dead, and the request in the blessing of the years, we require him to return havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, we do not require him to return as he can recite over the cup difficult.
llm_translation: And they asked: If one erred and did not mention the might of rain in the blessing for the resurrection of the dead, and he asked in the blessing of the years - they return him. But in the Havdalah blessing of "Chonen HaDa'at" - they do not return him, because he can say it over the cup! This is difficult.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: תְּפִלּוֹת אָבוֹת תִּקְּנוּם. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: תְּפִלּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד תְּמִידִין תִּקְּנוּם.
human_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: prayers were instituted by the Patriarchs. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said prayers were instituted based on the daily offerings
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The prayers of the fathers they established. Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Levi, said: The prayers corresponding to the daily offerings they established.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, וְתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אַבְרָהָם תִּקֵּן תְּפִלַּת שַׁחֲרִית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּשְׁכֵּם אַבְרָהָם בַּבֹּקֶר אֶל הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַד שָׁם״, וְאֵין ״עֲמִידָה״ אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעֲמֹד פִּינְחָס וַיְפַלֵּל״.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, and it was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. It was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Abraham instituted the morning prayer, as it is stated “And Abraham rose early in the morning to the place where he had stood and standing nothing other than prayer, as it is stated: “And Pinehas stood up and prayed
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina, and it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina: Abraham established the morning prayer, as it is stated: "And Abraham arose early in the morning to the place where he had stood." And "standing" is nothing but prayer, as it is stated: "And Pinchas stood up and prayed."

hebrew_text: יִצְחָק תִּקֵּן תְּפִלַּת מִנְחָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיֵּצֵא יִצְחָק לָשׂוּחַ בַּשָּׂדֶה לִפְנוֹת עָרֶב״, וְאֵין ״שִׂיחָה״ אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״תְּפִלָּה לְעָנִי כִי יַעֲטֹף וְלִפְנֵי ה׳ יִשְׁפֹּךְ שִׂיחוֹ״.
human_translation: Isaac instituted the afternoon prayer, as it is stated: “And Isaac went out to converse [ lasuaḥ ] in the field toward evening” and conversation nothing other than prayer, as it is stated: “A prayer of the afflicted when he is faint and pours out his complaint [ siḥo ] before the Lord”
llm_translation: Isaac established the afternoon prayer, as it is stated, "And Isaac went out to meditate in the field towards evening." And "meditation" is nothing but prayer, as it is stated, "A prayer of the afflicted when he faints and pours out his meditation before the Lord."

hebrew_text: יַעֲקֹב תִּקֵּן תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּפְגַּע בַּמָּקוֹם וַיָּלֶן שָׁם״, וְאֵין ״פְּגִיעָה״ אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה אַל תִּתְפַּלֵּל בְּעַד הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאַל תִּשָּׂא בַעֲדָם רִנָּה וּתְפִלָּה וְאַל תִּפְגַּע בִּי״
human_translation: Jacob instituted the evening prayer, as it is stated: “And he encountered [ vayifga ] the place and he slept there encounter nothing other than prayer, as it is stated “And you, do not pray on behalf of this nation and do not raise on their behalf song and prayer, and do not encounter [ tifga ] Me
llm_translation: Jacob established the evening prayer, as it is stated: "And he encountered the place and spent the night there." And "encounter" is nothing but prayer, as it is stated: "But you, do not pray for this people, and do not lift up for them a cry or prayer, and do not intercede with Me."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ תְּפִלַּת הַשַּׁחַר עַד חֲצוֹת — שֶׁהֲרֵי תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר קָרֵב וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד חֲצוֹת. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת שֶׁהֲרֵי תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר קָרֵב וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: And it was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi Why did say the morning prayer until noon? Because, daily morning offering sacrificed until noon. And Rabbi Yehuda says: until four hours because the daily morning offering is sacrificed until four hours.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: For what reason did they say that the morning prayer can be recited until midday? Because the regular morning offering is brought and continues until midday. And Rabbi Yehuda says: Until the fourth hour, because the regular morning offering is brought and continues until the fourth hour.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ תְּפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה עַד הָעֶרֶב — שֶׁהֲרֵי, תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם קָרֵב וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד הָעֶרֶב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד פְּלַג הַמִּנְחָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם קָרֵב וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד פְּלַג הַמִּנְחָה.
human_translation: And why did say the afternoon prayer until the evening? Because the daily afternoon offering is sacrificed until the evening. Rabbi Yehuda says the afternoon prayer until the midpoint of the afternoon because, the daily afternoon offering is sacrificed until the midpoint of the afternoon.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And for what reason did they say that the afternoon prayer extends until evening? Because the afternoon daily offering is brought between the evenings and continues until evening. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until the half of the afternoon, for the afternoon daily offering is brought between the evenings and continues until the half of the afternoon."

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ תְּפִלַּת הָעֶרֶב אֵין לָהּ קֶבַע — שֶׁהֲרֵי אֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב, קְרֵבִים וְהוֹלְכִים כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: And why did they say the evening prayer is not fixed? Because limbs and fats not consumed until the evening. offered continuously the entire night.
llm_translation: And because of what they said, the evening prayer has no fixed time - for the limbs and joints that were not examined during the evening, draw near and walk all night.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ שֶׁל מוּסָפִין כׇּל הַיּוֹם — שֶׁהֲרֵי קׇרְבָּן שֶׁל מוּסָפִין קָרֵב כׇּל הַיּוֹם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁבַע שָׁעוֹת, שֶׁהֲרֵי קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף קָרֵב וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁבַע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: And why did say the additional prayer all day? Because the additional offering is brought the entire day. Rabbi Yehuda says the additional prayer until the seventh hour because the additional offering is sacrificed until the seventh hour.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for what reason did they say that the offering of the additional offerings is the entire day? For indeed, the offering of the additional offerings is brought the entire day. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until seven hours, for indeed, the offering of the additional offering is brought and continues until seven hours."

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא מִנְחָה גְדוֹלָה מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה וּלְמַעְלָה. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא מִנְחָה קְטַנָּה מִתֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה וּלְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Which is minḥa gedola ? From six-and-a-half hours and on, Which is minḥa ketana ? From nine-and-a-half hours and on,
llm_translation: "And which is the large Mincha offering? From six hours and a half and onwards. And which is the small Mincha offering? From nine hours and a half and onwards."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, פְּלַג מִנְחָה קַמָּא קָאָמַר אוֹ פְּלַג מִנְחָה אַחֲרוֹנָה קָאָמַר? תָּא שְׁמַע דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: פְּלַג הַמִּנְחָה אַחֲרוֹנָה אָמְרוּ, וְהִיא אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר רְבִיעַ.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before them: Rabbi Yehuda, he say the midpoint of the first minḥa , Or, he say the midpoint of the last minḥa ? Come and hear As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: They said the midpoint of the last minḥa , and that is eleven hours minus a quarter
llm_translation: He asked them: Rabbi Yehuda, does he mean the first half of the Mincha offering or the last half of the Mincha offering? Come and hear what was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: They spoke of the last half of the Mincha offering, and it is lacking a quarter of an hour.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא? אָמַר לְךָ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ, תְּפִלּוֹת, אָבוֹת תִּקְּנוּם, וְאַסְמְכִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן אַקׇּרְבָּנוֹת. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, תְּפִלַּת מוּסָף לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מַאן תַּקְּנַהּ. אֶלָּא תְּפִלּוֹת אָבוֹת תִּקְּנוּם, וְאַסְמְכִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן אַקׇּרְבָּנוֹת.
human_translation: Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said to you: Actually, I will say to you the Patriarchs instituted the prayers and the Sages based on the Temple offerings, As, if you do not say so, then, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, who instituted the additional prayer? Rather, the prayers were instituted by the Patriarchs and the Sages based them offerings.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Naima tehevei teyuvteih d'Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Chanina? Amar lecha Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Chanina: Le'olam eima lach, tefillot, avot tiknuhu, ve'asmekhinhu Rabbanan akkorvanot. D'i lo teima hachi, tefillat musaf l'Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Chanina man taknah. Ella tefillot avot tiknuhu, ve'asmekhinhu Rabbanan akkorvanot."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר עַד אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עַד וְעַד בַּכְּלָל, אוֹ דִילְמָא עַד וְלֹא עַד בַּכְּלָל?! תָּא שְׁמַע רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד פְּלַג הַמִּנְחָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא עַד וְלֹא עַד בַּכְּלָל — הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ עַד וְעַד בַּכְּלָל, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: until four hours A dilemma was raised before until, until and including or, perhaps “until” until and not including, Come and hear Rabbi Yehuda says: until the midpoint of the afternoon. granted, if you say until until and not including, then there is between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis. However, if you say until until and including, Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says until four hours. The question was raised to him: Until and until in general, or perhaps until and not until in general?! Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda says: Until half of the afternoon. If you say until and not until in general — that is the difference between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis. Rather, if you say until and until in general, Rabbi Yehuda...

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: is the Rabbis,
llm_translation: These are the words of the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, עַד וְלֹא עַד בַּכְּלָל? אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְשֶׁל מוּסָפִין כׇּל הַיּוֹם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁבַע שָׁעוֹת. וְתַנְיָא: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי תְּפִלּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל מוּסָף וְאַחַת שֶׁל מִנְחָה — מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מִנְחָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ שֶׁל מוּסָף, שֶׁזּוֹ תְּדִירָה, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ תְּדִירָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מוּסָף וְאַחַר כָּךְ שֶׁל מִנְחָה, שֶׁזּוֹ עוֹבֶרֶת, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rather, what until until and not including? Say the latter clause The additional prayer all day. Rabbi Yehuda says: until the seven hours. And it was taught If two prayers was before him, one the additional prayer and one the afternoon prayer, he prays the afternoon prayer and the additional prayer thereafter, this, is frequent and that, is infrequent Rabbi Yehuda says: He recites the additional prayer and the afternoon prayer thereafter, this, the additional prayer, elapse, and this, the afternoon prayer, not elapse,
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "until" and "not until" in general? Say the latter clause: and of additional offerings all day. Rabbi Yehuda says: until seven hours. And it was taught: if there were before him two prayers, one of the additional offering and one of the meal offering — he prays the meal offering first and then the additional offering, because this one is frequent, and that one is not frequent. Rabbi Yehuda says: he prays the additional offering first and then the meal offering, because this one is transgressed, and that one is not transgressed.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״עַד וְעַד בַּכְּלָל״, הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ שְׁתֵּי תְּפִלּוֹת בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ ״עַד וְלֹא עַד בַּכְּלָל״, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ שְׁתֵּי תְּפִלּוֹת בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי? כֵּיוָן דְּאָתְיָא לַהּ שֶׁל מִנְחָה, אָזְלָא לַהּ שֶׁל מוּסָפִין!
human_translation: Granted, if you say until until and including, that is how you can find two prayers, overlap. But if you say until until and not including, how can you find two prayers overlap? Once the afternoon prayer, has arrived, the additional prayer gone?
llm_translation: If you say "until and including in general," that means you find two prayers together. But if you say "until and not including in general," how do you find two prayers together? Since the Mincha prayer comes, the additional prayer goes away!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, ״עַד וְעַד בַּכְּלָל״? קַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא, מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְרַבָּנַן?! — מִי סָבְרַתְּ דְּהַאי ״פְּלַג מִנְחָה״ פְּלַג אַחֲרוֹנָה קָאָמַר? פְּלַג רִאשׁוֹנָה קָאָמַר, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵימַת נָפֵיק פְּלַג רִאשׁוֹנָה וְעָיֵיל פְּלַג אַחֲרוֹנָה — מִכִּי נָפְקִי אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר רְבִיעַ.
human_translation: Rather, what until until and including? the first clause is difficult, What is between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis? Do you think that this midpoint of the afternoon speaking of the midpoint, the last speaking of the midpoint, the first And this is what he is saying: When does the first half leave and the second half enter? From when eleven hours minus a quarter have passed
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "until and until in general"? The beginning is difficult, what is the difference between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis?! — Who holds that this "half of a meal-offering" refers to the latter half? He refers to the first half, and thus he says: When does the first half exit and bring in the latter half? — When eleven hours are lacking a quarter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: We, too, learned
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "We also agree."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא הֵעִיד חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים: שֶׁמְמָאֲנִין אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה, וְשֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד, וְעַל תַּרְנְגוֹל שֶׁנִּסְקַל בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם עַל שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, וְעַל יַיִן בֶּן אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם שֶׁנִּתְנַסֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְעַל תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר שֶׁקָּרֵב בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava testified five matters of one may persuade the minor girl to refuse And that one may a woman to marry based on one witness, And about a rooster that was stoned in Jerusalem for killing a person, And about forty-day-old wine that was libation on the altar. And about daily morning offering that was sacrificed at four hours
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava testified five things: that they refuse the minor, and that they marry the woman based on one witness, and on a rooster that was stoned in Jerusalem because it killed a person, and on wine that was forty days old poured on the altar, and on the morning daily offering that is brought within four hours.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״עַד וְעַד בַּכְּלָל״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Learn from this until until and including. learn from this.
llm_translation: Hear from it "until and until in general." Hear from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן בִּבְחִירָתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda since we learned preferred in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda, since we learned in the choice like his opinion.

hebrew_text: וְעַל תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר שֶׁקָּרֵב בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת, מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דִּתְנַן: ״וְחַם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְנָמָס״, בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: And about daily morning offering that was sacrificed at four hours. the tanna who taught that which we learned and when the sun grew hot it melted” four hours
llm_translation: And regarding the daily morning offering that is brought within four hours, who is the Tanna for that which we learned: "And the sun shall be hot and it shall melt," within four hours.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּשֵׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת?! כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״כְּחֹם הַיּוֹם״, הֲרֵי שֵׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְחַם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְנָמָס״ — בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת. מַנִּי? לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלָא רַבָּנַן. אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה עַד אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת נָמֵי צַפְרָא הוּא! אִי רַבָּנַן — עַד חֲצוֹת נָמֵי צַפְרָא הוּא.
human_translation: you say at four hours, or it was only at six hours When says: “In the heat of the day” six hours is mentioned How, then, do I establish “And when the sun grew hot it melted”? at four hours. Who neither Rabbi Yehuda nor the Sages. If Rabbi Yehuda, until four hours is also morning, If the Rabbis, until noon is also morning,
llm_translation: You say in four hours, or is it only in six hours?! When he says "like the heat of the day," behold, six hours are meant, so how do I fulfill "and the sun was hot and it melted" — in four hours. Who is the Tanna? Not Rabbi Yehuda and not the Rabbis. If Rabbi Yehuda, until four hours is also considered morning! If the Rabbis, until midnight is also considered morning.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבָּנַן: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבָּנַן: אָמַר קְרָא ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״ — חַלְּקֵהוּ לִשְׁנֵי בְּקָרִים. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַאי בֹּקֶר יַתִּירָא — לְהַקְדִּים לוֹ שָׁעָה אַחַת. דְּכוּלָּא עָלְמָא מִיהָא ״וְחַם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְנָמָס״ בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, if you wish, say the Rabbis. If you wish, say the Rabbis. The verse states: Morning by morning, divide it into two mornings. And if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, This extra morning make an hour earlier. everyone agrees And when the sun grew hot it melted, four hours
llm_translation: If you wish, say it is Rabbi Yehudah; if you wish, say it is the Rabbis; if you wish, say it is the Rabbis: The verse said, "In the morning, in the morning" - divide it into two mornings. And if you wish, say it is Rabbi Yehudah: This morning is extra - to advance it by one hour. In general, the entire world "and the sun was hot and it melted" in four hours.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְחַם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְנָמָס״ — אֵיזוֹ הִיא שָׁעָה שֶׁהַשֶּׁמֶשׁ חַם וְהַצֵּל צוֹנֵן — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: From where is the inference Rabbi Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: The verse states: “When the sun grew hot it melted.” Which is the hour that the sun is hot but the shade cool, You must say at four hours.
llm_translation: What is implied? Rabbi Ahah bar Jacob said: The verse says, "and the sun will be hot and it will melt" - which is the hour when the sun is hot and the shade is cool? It is during the first four hours.

hebrew_text: תְּפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה עַד הָעֶרֶב וְכוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב יִצְחָק: הָתָם אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן בִּבְחִירָתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ, הָכָא מַאי? אִישְׁתִּיק וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נֶחְזֵי אֲנַן, מִדְּרַב מְצַלֵּי שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: the afternoon prayer until the evening. Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Yitzḥak: There, Rav Kahana said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, since we learned preferred in accordance with his Here, what He was silent and said nothing to him, Rav Ḥisda said: Let us see from that Rav prayed Shabbat while it was still day. Learn from this the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: The prayer of the afternoon until evening, etc. Rav Ḥisdah said to Rav Yitzḥak: There, Rav Kahana said the halakha follows Rabbi Yehuda, since we learned it as his primary teaching. What about here? He remained silent and did not say anything. Rav Ḥisdah said: We can infer, since Rav Metzalei Shabbat lights the Shabbat lamp on Friday afternoon, we can conclude that the halakha follows Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה מִדְּרַב הוּנָא וְרַבָּנַן לָא הֲווֹ מְצַלּוּ עַד אוּרְתָּא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא אִתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּמָר וְלָא כְּמָר, דַּעֲבַד כְּמָר — עֲבַד, וְדַעֲבַד כְּמָר — עֲבַד.
human_translation: On the contrary, from that Rav Huna and the Sages, would not pray until evening, learn from that the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Now that the halakha was stated neither in accordance with Sage nor in accordance with Sage, one who acted in accordance with Sage has acted and one who acted in accordance with Sage has acted
llm_translation: Rabba from Rav Huna and the Rabbis did not reach a conclusion until Urtah. Learn from it: the halakha is not like Rabbi Yehudah. Now that it was not stated, the halakha is neither like Mar nor like Mar, if one acts like Mar - he acts, and if one acts like Mar - he acts.

hebrew_text: רַב אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי גְּנִיבָא וְצַלִּי שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וַהֲוָה מְצַלֵּי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא לַאֲחוֹרֵי דְרַב, וְסַיֵּים רַב וְלָא פַּסְקֵיהּ לִצְלוֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִתְפַּלֵּל תַּלְמִיד אֲחוֹרֵי רַבּוֹ. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אָסוּר לַעֲבוֹר כְּנֶגֶד הַמִּתְפַּלְּלִין.
human_translation: Rav happened by the house of Geniva, and he prayed Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba was praying behind Rav, and Rav finished but did not interrupt the prayer Rabbi Yirmeya. Derive from this three Derive from this one may pray the Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat And derive from this that a student pray behind his rabbi. And derive from this prohibited to pass before those who are praying.
llm_translation: Rav entered the house of G'niva and he roasted the Shabbat dish on Erev Shabbat, and Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba was roasting behind Rav, and Rav finished but did not allow Rabbi Yirmeya to roast. Learn from it three things: Learn from it that a person may pray the Shabbat prayer on Erev Shabbat. And learn from it that a student may pray behind his teacher. And learn from it that it is forbidden to pass in front of those who are praying.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָסוּר לַעֲבוֹר כְּנֶגֶד הַמִּתְפַּלְּלִין. אִינִי?! וְהָא רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי חָלְפִי. רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי — חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת הוּא דְּחָלְפִי.
human_translation: supports Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is prohibited to pass before those who are praying. Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi pass Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi beyond four cubits when they passed.
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is forbidden to pass in front of those praying. Is it not so?! But Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi interchanged. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi - except for four cubits, they interchanged.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי?! וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם
human_translation: How did Rabbi Yirmeya act that way Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said: A person should never pray
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya, how does he do this?! And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should never

hebrew_text: לֹא כְּנֶגֶד רַבּוֹ, וְלֹא אֲחוֹרֵי רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: next to his rabbi, and behind his rabbi
llm_translation: Not opposite his master, and not behind his master.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל אֲחוֹרֵי רַבּוֹ, וְהַנּוֹתֵן שָׁלוֹם לְרַבּוֹ, וְהַמַּחֲזִיר שָׁלוֹם לְרַבּוֹ, וְהַחוֹלֵק עַל יְשִׁיבָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבּוֹ, וְהָאוֹמֵר דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא שָׁמַע מִפִּי רַבּוֹ — גּוֹרֵם לַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁתִּסְתַּלֵּק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל!
human_translation: And it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: One who prays behind his rabbi and one who greets his rabbi one who returns his rabbi’s greeting one who rivals his rabbi’s yeshiva, and one who says something which he did not hear directly from his rabbi, causes the Divine Presence to withdraw from Israel.
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: One who prays behind his master, and one who greets his master, and one who returns the greeting to his master, and one who disputes the sitting arrangement of his master, and one who says something that he did not hear from his master's mouth - causes the Divine Presence to depart from Israel!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא דְּתַלְמִיד חָבֵר הֲוָה. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא לְרַב: מִי בְּדַלְתְּ? אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, בְּדֵילְנָא, וְלָא אֲמַר ״מִי בְּדֵיל מָר״?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba is different, was a disciple-colleague And that is why Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba asked him: Did you distance yourself Rav said to him: Yes, I distanced myself. And did not say to him: Did the Master distance himself,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Shā’nei Rabbi Yirmeyah bar Abba d’talmid ḥavēr havah. V’hainu d’ka’amar lei Rabbi Yirmeyah bar Abba l’rab: Mi b’dalta? Amar lei: Ein, b’dilna, v’lo amar "Mi b’dil mar"? English translation: The ways of Rabbi Yirmeyah bar Abba as a fellow student were different. And this is what Rabbi Yirmeyah bar Abba said to Rav: "Who is at the door?" He said to him: "No, in our door, and not 'Who is at the master's door'?"

hebrew_text: וּמִי בְּדֵיל? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: פַּעַם אַחַת הִתְפַּלֵּל רַבִּי שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְנִכְנַס לַמֶּרְחָץ, וְיָצָא וְשָׁנָה לַן פִּרְקִין, וַעֲדַיִין לֹא חָשְׁכָה! אָמַר רָבָא: הָהוּא דְּנִכְנַס לְהַזִּיעַ, וְקוֹדֶם גְּזֵירָה הֲוָה.
human_translation: did he distance himself Didn’t Rabbi Avin say: Once Rabbi prayed Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat He entered the bathhouse and emerged and taught us our chapters and it was not yet dark. Rava said: That entered to perspire, and it was before the decree
llm_translation: "And who is diligent? And Rabbi Avin said: Once Rabbi Sheshet prayed the Shabbat evening prayer on Erev Shabbat, and he entered the bathhouse, and he came out and recited to us chapters, and it was still not dark! Rava said: That one who entered to sweat, and before the decree it was."

hebrew_text: אִינִי, וְהָא אַבָּיֵי שְׁרָא לֵיהּ לְרַב דִּימִי בַּר לֵיוַאי לְכַבְרוֹיֵי סַלֵּי!
human_translation: Is that so, Didn’t Abaye permit Rav Dimi bar Liva’ei to fumigate baskets with sulfur
llm_translation: I am not, but Abaye permitted Rav Dimi son of Levi to bring him baskets of sallet!

hebrew_text: הַהוּא טָעוּתָא הֲוַאי.
human_translation: That was an error,
llm_translation: That error, it was.

hebrew_text: וְטָעוּתָא מִי הָדְרָא? וְהָא אָמַר אֲבִידָן: פַּעַם אַחַת נִתְקַשְּׁרוּ שָׁמַיִם בֶּעָבִים, כִּסְבוּרִים הָעָם לוֹמַר חֲשֵׁכָה הוּא, נִכְנְסוּ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְהִתְפַּלְּלוּ שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבָּת. וְנִתְפַּזְּרוּ הֶעָבִים וְזָרְחָה הַחַמָּה,
human_translation: Can a mistake be reversed, Didn’t Avidan, say: Once the sky became overcast, the people to think that it was dark they entered the synagogue and recited the prayer of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat. And the clouds cleared and the sun shone,
llm_translation: The error was rectified? But didn't Abidan say: Once the heavens were entangled in clouds, and the people thought it was night, they entered the synagogue and prayed the concluding Shabbat prayer on Shabbat eve. Then the clouds dispersed, and the sun shone forth.

hebrew_text: וּבָאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי. וְאָמַר: הוֹאִיל וְהִתְפַּלְּלוּ — הִתְפַּלְּלוּ! שָׁאנֵי צִבּוּר, דְּלָא מַטְרְחִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: And they came and asked Rabbi and he said: Since they have prayed, they have prayed, A community is different that we do not burden them
llm_translation: And they came and asked Rabbi. And he said: Since they prayed - they prayed! Different is the congregation, for we do not trouble them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: רַב צַלִּי שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה מְצַלֵּי שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבָּת. רַב צַלִּי שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת: אוֹמֵר קְדוּשָּׁה עַל הַכּוֹס, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר קְדוּשָּׁה עַל הַכּוֹס? תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְאוֹמֵר קְדוּשָּׁה עַל הַכּוֹס. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said: Rav prayed Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat Rabbi Yoshiya would pray the prayer of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat. Rav prayed Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat he recite kiddush over the cup or did he not recite kiddush over the cup Come and hear Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: One prays Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat and recites kiddush over the cup And the halakha is in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said: Rav prepares the Shabbat meal on Erev Shabbat, while Rabbi Yoshiyah prepares the meal for the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat itself. Rav prepares the Shabbat meal on Erev Shabbat: Does he recite the Kiddush over the cup, or does he not recite the Kiddush over the cup? Come and hear, as Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: A person may pray the Shabbat prayer on Erev Shabbat and recite the Kiddush over the cup. And the halakha is in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה מְצַלֵּי שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבָּת: אוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלָה עַל הַכּוֹס אוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלָה עַל הַכּוֹס? תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבָּת וְאוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלָה עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoshiya would pray the prayer of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat: does he recite havdala over the cup or does one not recite havdala over the cup Come and hear Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One prays the prayer of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat and recites havdala over the cup
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah prepares the havdalah of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat: Does he say the blessing over the cup or does he not say the blessing over the cup? Come and hear, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A person may pray at the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat and say the blessing over the cup.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַב: בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה הִתְפַּלֵּל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said Rav said: Alongside this pillar Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, prayed Shabbat on the eve of Shabbat
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said, Rabbi said: Next to this pillar Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, prayed on Shabbat eve before Shabbat.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא עוּלָּא אָמַר: בְּצַד תְּמָרָה הֲוָה, וְלֹא בְּצַד עַמּוּד הֲוָה. וְלֹא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הֲוָה, אֶלָּא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הֲוָה, וְלֹא שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הֲוָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבָּת הֲוָה.
human_translation: But when Ulla came He said beside a palm tree, not beside a pillar, and it was not Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, but Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, and it was not Shabbat on Shabbat eve rather prayer of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat.
llm_translation: When Ulla came, he said: It was on the side of the date-palm, and not on the side of the pillar. And it was not Rabbi Ishmael son of Rabbi Yosei, but it was Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei. And it was not for the sake of Shabbat on Erev Shabbat, but for the sake of the conclusion of Shabbat on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תְּפִלַּת הָעֶרֶב אֵין לָהּ קֶבַע. מַאי אֵין לָהּ קֶבַע? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִי בָּעֵי מְצַלֵּי כּוּלֵּיהּ לֵילְיָא, לִיתְנֵי ״תְּפִלַּת הָעֶרֶב כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה״! אֶלָּא מַאי אֵין לָהּ קֶבַע —
human_translation: The evening prayer is not fixed What is the meaning of is not fixed? If you say that if wishes, he may pray throughout the night, let teach: The evening prayer throughout the night. Rather, what is not fixed?
llm_translation: Prayer of the evening does not have a fixed time. What does it mean it does not have a fixed time? If you say that if one wants, they can pray the entire night, then let it teach "the prayer of the evening the whole night"! Rather, what does it mean it does not have a fixed time —

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר, תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית רְשׁוּת. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר חוֹבָה, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר רְשׁוּת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר חוֹבָה. וְרָבָא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: in accordance with the one who said: The evening prayer is optional. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said the evening prayer. Rabban Gamliel says: obligatory. Rabbi Yehoshua says: optional. Abaye said: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of the one who said: obligatory. Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of the one who said: optional.
llm_translation: As one who said, the evening prayer is optional. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The evening prayer. Rabban Gamliel says obligatory, Rabbi Yehoshua says optional. Abbaye said: The halakha is according to the one who says obligatory. And Rava said: The halakha is according to the one who says optional.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אָמַר לוֹ: תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית רְשׁוּת אוֹ חוֹבָה? אָמַר לֵיהּ: רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: an incident involving a student, who came before Rabbi Yehoshua. said to him: Is the evening prayer optional or obligatory? said to him: Optional.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with a certain disciple who came before Rabbi Yehoshua. He said to him: Is the evening prayer optional or obligatory? He said to him: Optional.

hebrew_text: בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אָמַר לוֹ: תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית רְשׁוּת אוֹ חוֹבָה? אָמַר לוֹ: חוֹבָה. אָמַר לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר לִי רְשׁוּת?! אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁיִּכָּנְסוּ בַּעֲלֵי תְּרִיסִין לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: came before Rabban Gamliel and said to him: Is the evening prayer optional or obligatory? said to him: Obligatory. said to But didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua tell me optional? said to Wait until the “masters of the shields,” enter the study hall,
llm_translation: He came before Rabban Gamliel, he said to him: The evening prayer, is it optional or obligatory? He said to him: Obligatory. He said to him: But didn't Rabbi Yehoshua say to me it is optional?! He said to him: Wait until the owners of the balconies enter the study hall.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ בַּעֲלֵי תְּרִיסִין, עָמַד הַשּׁוֹאֵל וְשָׁאַל: תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית רְשׁוּת אוֹ חוֹבָה? אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: חוֹבָה. אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַחֲכָמִים: כְּלוּם יֵשׁ אָדָם שֶׁחוֹלֵק בְּדָבָר זֶה? אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָאו. אָמַר לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא מִשִּׁמְךָ אָמְרוּ לִי רְשׁוּת!
human_translation: When the masters of the shields entered, the questioner stood and asked: Is the evening prayer optional or obligatory? Rabban Gamliel said to him: Obligatory. Rabban Gamliel said to Is there any person who disputes this matter? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, said to But was it not in your name that they told me optional?
llm_translation: When the owners of the storehouses entered, the inquirer stood and asked: Is the evening prayer optional or obligatory? Rabban Gamliel said to him: Obligatory. Rabban Gamliel said to the sages: Is there anyone who disputes this matter? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No. He said to him: But did they not say to me in your name that it is optional!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ: יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, עֲמוֹד עַל רַגְלֶיךָ וְיָעִידוּ בְּךָ. עָמַד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר אִלְמָלֵא אֲנִי חַי וְהוּא מֵת — יָכוֹל הַחַי לְהַכְחִישׁ אֶת הַמֵּת. וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֲנִי חַי וְהוּא חַי — הֵיאַךְ יָכוֹל הַחַי לְהַכְחִישׁ אֶת הַחַי?
human_translation: said to Yehoshua, stand on your feet and they will testify against you. Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said: If I were alive and were dead, the living can contradict the dead, Now that I am alive and he is alive, how can the living contradict the living?
llm_translation: He said to him: Yehoshua, stand on your feet and let them testify against you. Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said, "If I am alive and he is dead - can the living contradict the dead? But now that I am alive and he is alive - how can the living contradict the living?"

hebrew_text: הָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עוֹמֵד עַל רַגְלָיו, עַד שֶׁרִנְּנוּ כׇּל הָעָם וְאָמְרוּ לְחוּצְפִּית הַתּוּרְגְּמָן: עֲמוֹד! וְעָמַד.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel, was sitting and lecturing, and Rabbi Yehoshua was standing on his feet, until all of the people murmuring and said to Ḥutzpit the disseminator: Stop And he stopped.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel was sitting and expounding, and Rabbi Yehoshua was standing on his feet, until all the people murmured and said to the interpreter: "Stand!" And he stood.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: עַד כַּמָּה נְצַעֲרֵיהּ וְנֵיזִיל, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אֶשְׁתָּקַד צַעֲרֵיהּ. בִּבְכוֹרוֹת בְּמַעֲשֵׂה דְרַבִּי צָדוֹק צַעֲרֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי צַעֲרֵיהּ, תָּא וְנַעְבְּרֵיהּ!
human_translation: they said: How long will continue afflicting him? Last year on Rosh HaShana, he afflicted him; Regarding the firstborn, in the incident of Rabbi Tzadok, he afflicted him Here too, he is afflicting him. Let us remove him
llm_translation: They said: Until when will we suffer and go out, on Rosh Hashanah its suffering will be accounted for. In the firstborn animals, in the incident of Rabbi Tzadok, its suffering will be accounted for. Here too, its suffering will be accounted for, come and let us pass through it!

hebrew_text: מַאן נוֹקֵים לֵיהּ? נוֹקְמֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — בַּעַל מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא. נוֹקְמֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — דִּילְמָא עָנֵישׁ לֵיהּ, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ זְכוּת אָבוֹת.
human_translation: Whom shall we establish establish Rabbi Yehoshua was party to the incident establish Rabbi Akiva Perhaps would him punished as he lacks the merit of his ancestors
llm_translation: Who takes revenge for him? They take revenge for Rabbi Yehoshua - it is a matter of action. They take revenge for Rabbi Akiva - perhaps he is punished, for he does not have the merit of the fathers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא נוֹקְמֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, דְּהוּא חָכָם, וְהוּא עָשִׁיר, וְהוּא עֲשִׂירִי לְעֶזְרָא. הוּא חָכָם — דְּאִי מַקְשֵׁי לֵיהּ, מְפָרֵק לֵיהּ. וְהוּא עָשִׁיר — דְּאִי אִית לֵיהּ לְפַלּוֹחֵי לְבֵי קֵיסָר, אַף הוּא אָזֵל וּפָלַח. וְהוּא עֲשִׂירִי לְעֶזְרָא — דְּאִית לֵיהּ זְכוּת אָבוֹת, וְלָא מָצֵי עָנֵישׁ לֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמָר דְּלֶיהְוֵי רֵישׁ מְתִיבְתָּא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֵיזִיל וְאִימְּלִיךְ בְּאִינָשֵׁי בֵּיתִי. אֲזַל וְאִמְּלִיךְ בִּדְבֵיתְהוּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rather, let us establish Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya He is wise, rich, and a tenth of Ezra. He is wise, so if challenge he will answer it And he is rich, so if the need to pay homage to the Caesar’s court he too is able to go and pay homage. And he is tenth of Ezra, so he has the merit of his ancestors, and will be unable to him punished. They came and said to him: Would the Master consent to being the Head of the Yeshiva? He said to them: I will go and consult with my household. He went and consulted with his wife. She said to him:
llm_translation: Rather, they sought revenge against Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, who was wise, and he was rich, and he was a relative of Ezra. He was wise - for if they posed a difficult question to him, he would resolve it. And he was rich - for if there were those who needed to intercede with the house of Caesar, he himself would go and intercede. And he was a relative of Ezra - for he had the merit of his ancestors, and they could not find a reason to punish him. They came and said to him: Is it fitting for our master not to be at the head of the assembly? He said to them: I will go and appoint leaders in my household. He went and appointed leaders in his household. His wife said to him:

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא מְעַבְּרִין לָךְ. אֲמַר לַהּ: לִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ אִינָשׁ יוֹמָא חֲדָא בְּכָסָא דְמוֹקְרָא, וְלִמְחַר לִיתְּבַר. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לֵית לָךָ חִיוָּרָתָא. הָהוּא יוֹמָא בַּר תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי הֲוָה, אִתְרְחִישׁ לֵיהּ נִיסָּא וְאִהַדַּרוּ לֵיהּ תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי דָּרֵי חִיוָּרָתָא. הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: הֲרֵי אֲנִי כְּבֶן שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה. וְלֹא ״בֶּן שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה״.
human_translation: Perhaps they will remove you He said to her, Let a person use an expensive goblet one day and let it break tomorrow. She said to him: You have no white That day, he was eighteen years old, a miracle transpired for him and eighteen rows of hair turned white. That that which Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said: I am as one who is seventy years old and he did not say: I am seventy years old,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Perhaps they will pass you by. He said to her: To use a person one day in a rented chair, and the next day to break it. She said to him: You do not have a donkey. That day, on the eve of the eighteenth year, a miracle occurred for him, and they adorned him with eighteen rows of teeth. This is what Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah meant when he said: Behold, I am like a seventy-year-old. And not "a seventy-year-old."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם, סִלְּקוּהוּ לְשׁוֹמֵר הַפֶּתַח וְנִתְּנָה לָהֶם רְשׁוּת לַתַּלְמִידִים לִיכָּנֵס. שֶׁהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַכְרִיז וְאוֹמֵר: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד שֶׁאֵין תּוֹכוֹ כְּבָרוֹ, לֹא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: It was taught: On that day they dismissed the guard at the door and permission was granted to the students to enter. As Rabban Gamliel would proclaim and say: Any student whose inside, are not like his outside, will not enter the study hall.
llm_translation: It was taught: On that day, they removed him to be the doorkeeper, and permission was granted to the students to enter. For Rabban Gamliel would proclaim and say: "Any student whose inside is not like his outside, should not enter the study hall."

hebrew_text: הַהוּא יוֹמָא אִתּוֹסְפוּ כַּמָּה סַפְסַלֵּי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ אַבָּא יוֹסֵף בֶּן דּוֹסְתַּאי וְרַבָּנַן. חַד אָמַר: אִתּוֹסְפוּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה סַפְסַלֵּי. וְחַד אָמַר: שְׁבַע מְאָה סַפְסַלֵּי. הֲוָה קָא חָלְשָׁה דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲמַר: דִּלְמָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם מָנַעְתִּי תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. אַחְזוֹ לֵיהּ בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ חַצְבֵי חִיוָּרֵי דְּמַלְיִין קִטְמָא. וְלָא הִיא, הַהִיא לְיַתּוֹבֵי דַּעְתֵּיהּ, הוּא דְּאַחְזוֹ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: On that day several benches were added Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Abba Yosef ben Dostai and the Rabbis disputed this One said: Four hundred benches were added And one said: Seven hundred benches were added Rabban Gamliel was disheartened. He said: Perhaps, Heaven forbid, I prevented Israel from Torah They showed him in his dream white jugs filled with ashes That is not that was shown to him to ease his mind
llm_translation: On that day, they added several benches. Rabbi Yochanan said: Abba Yosef ben Dosatai and the sages disagreed about it. One said: they added four hundred benches. And one said: seven hundred benches. Rabban Gamliel's mind was weakened, he said: Perhaps I have withheld Torah from Israel. He saw in his dream white casks full of ashes. But it was not so, that dream was to settle his mind, that is why he saw it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: עֵדֻיוֹת בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם נִשְׁנֵית. וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּאָמְרִינַן ״בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם״, הַהוּא יוֹמָא הֲוָה. וְלֹא הָיְתָה הֲלָכָה שֶׁהָיְתָה תְּלוּיָה בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ שֶׁלֹּא פֵּירְשׁוּהָ. וְאַף רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לֹא מָנַע עַצְמוֹ מִבֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: It was taught: Eduyyot was taught that day. And everywhere that they say: On that day, it is that day. There was no halakha whose ruling was pending in the study hall that they did not explain And even Rabban Gamliel did not avoid the study hall for even one moment,
llm_translation: Mishnah: His testimonies in it during the day are repeated. And wherever we say "in it during the day," that very day was. And there was no halakha that was dependent on the study hall that they did not explain. And even Rabban Gamliel did not refrain from the study hall even for one hour.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם בָּא יְהוּדָה גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי לִפְנֵיהֶם בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. אָמַר לָהֶם: מָה אֲנִי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל?
human_translation: As we learned On that day, Yehuda, the Ammonite convert, came before and he said to them: What is my entering into the congregation
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: On that day, Yehudah, a convert from the Ammonites, came before them in the study hall. He said to them: "Why should I enter the congregation?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אָסוּר אַתָּה לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מוּתָּר אַתָּה לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל. אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יָבֹא עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי בִּקְהַל ה׳״? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב בִּמְקוֹמָן הֵן יוֹשְׁבִין? כְּבָר עָלָה סַנְחֵרִיב מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר וּבִלְבֵּל אֶת כׇּל הָאוּמּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָסִיר גְּבֻלוֹת עַמִּים וַעֲתוּדוֹתֵיהֶם שׁוֹשֵׂתִי וְאוֹרִיד כַּבִּיר יוֹשְׁבִים״, וְכׇל דְּפָרֵישׁ — מֵרוּבָּא פָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said to him: You are forbidden to enter into the congregation. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: You are permitted to enter into the congregation. Rabban Gamliel said to Wasn’t it already stated: “An Ammonite and a Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord; Rabbi Yehoshua said to Do Ammon and Moab reside in their place? Sennacherib already came and, scrambled all the nations as it is stated in “I have removed the bounds of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures, and have brought down as one mighty the inhabitants” And Anything that parts parts from the majority,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabban Gamliel: Prohibited you to enter in the congregation. He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Permitted you to enter in the congregation. He said to him Rabban Gamliel: But has it not already been said, "An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord"? He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Are the Ammonites and Moabites still dwelling in their place? Sancheriv, king of Assyria, already came up and confused all the nations, as it is said, "I remove the boundaries of peoples and plunder their treasures; like a mighty one I bring down the inhabitants." And anyone who separates himself - separates from the majority.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְאַחֲרֵי כֵן אָשִׁיב אֶת שְׁבוּת בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן נְאֻם ה׳״, וּכְבָר שָׁבוּ!
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said to But wasn’t it already stated: “But afterward I will bring back the captivity of the children of Ammon, says the Lord” and they have already returned
llm_translation: He said to him Rabban Gamliel: But hasn't it already been said, "And after that I will restore the fortunes of the people of Ammon, says the Lord," and they have already returned!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְשַׁבְתִּי אֶת שְׁבוּת עַמִּי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וַעֲדַיִין לֹא שָׁבוּ. מִיָּד הִתִּירוּהוּ לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to Wasn’t it already stated “And I will turn the captivity of My people Israel and they have not yet returned? They immediately permitted him to enter the congregation.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: But hasn't it already been said, "And I will bring back the captivity of My people Israel," and they have not yet returned. Immediately they permitted him to enter the assembly.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הוֹאִיל וְהָכִי הֲוָה, אֵיזִיל וַאֲפַיְּיסֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. כִּי מְטָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, חֲזִינְהוּ לְאַשְׁיָתָא דְבֵיתֵיהּ דְּמַשְׁחֲרָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִכּוֹתְלֵי בֵיתְךָ אַתָּה נִיכָּר שֶׁפֶּחָמִי אַתָּה. אָמַר לוֹ: אוֹי לוֹ לַדּוֹר שֶׁאַתָּה פַּרְנָסוֹ, שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ בְּצַעֲרָן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, בַּמֶּה הֵם מִתְפַּרְנְסִים וּבַמֶּה הֵם נִזּוֹנִים.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said Since this is go and appease Rabbi Yehoshua. When he reached house, he saw the walls of his house were black. said to From the walls of your house it is apparent that you are a blacksmith, said to him: Woe unto a generation that you are its leader as you are unaware of the difficulties of Torah scholars, how they make a living and how they feed themselves.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel said: Since this is the case, I will go and appease Rabbi Yehoshua. When he arrived at his house, he saw that the walls of his house were blackened. He said to him: Are you recognizable from the walls of your house, you are a servant of the king? He said to him: Woe to the generation that you are their leader, for you do not know the suffering of the students of the sages, how they sustain themselves and how they are nourished.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: נַעֲנֵיתִי לְךָ מְחוֹל לִי. לָא אַשְׁגַּח בֵּיהּ: עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹד אַבָּא. פַּיֵּיס.
human_translation: said to him: I insulted you, forgive me. paid him no attention Do it in deference to my father, He was appeased.
llm_translation: He said to him: "I have granted you a dance for me." He did not pay attention to him: "Do it for the honor of father." He appeased.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ: מַאן נֵיזִיל וְלֵימָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן. אֲמַר לְהוּ הַהוּא כּוֹבֵס: אֲנָא אָזֵילְנָא. שְׁלַח לְהוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא: מַאן דְּלָבֵישׁ מַדָּא — יִלְבַּשׁ מַדָּא, וּמַאן דְּלָא לָבֵישׁ מַדָּא יֵימַר לֵיהּ לְמַאן דְּלָבֵישׁ מַדָּא: שְׁלַח מַדָּךְ וַאֲנָא אֶלְבְּשֵׁיהּ?! אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבָּנַן: טְרוּקוּ גַּלֵּי דְּלָא לֵיתוּ עַבְדֵי דְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּלְצַעֲרוּ לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: They said: Who will go and inform the Sages? This launderer said to them: I will go. Rabbi Yehoshua sent to to the study hall: The one who wears the uniform will wear the uniform, the one who did not wear the uniform will say to the one who wears the uniform, remove your uniform and I will wear it. Rabbi Akiva said to the Sages: Lock the gates so that Rabban Gamliel’s servants will not come and disturb the Sages.
llm_translation: They said: Who will go and tell the Rabbis? That launderer said to them: I will go. Rabbi Yehoshua sent to the study hall: Whoever is wearing linen garments should wear linen, and whoever is not wearing linen should be told to wear linen. He said to them: Should I go and wear it myself?! Rabbi Akiva said to the Rabbis: Bring the chests that the servants of Rabbi Gamliel did not bring and present them to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מוּטָב דְּאֵיקוּם וְאֵיזִיל אֲנָא לְגַבַּיְיהוּ. אֲתָא טְרַף אַבָּבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַזֶּה בֶּן מַזֶּה יַזֶּה. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא מַזֶּה וְלֹא בֶּן מַזֶּה יֹאמַר לְמַזֶּה בֶּן מַזֶּה מֵימֶיךָ מֵי מְעָרָה וְאֶפְרְךָ אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, נִתְפַּיַּיסְתָּ? כְּלוּם עָשִׂינוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹדְךָ, לְמָחָר אֲנִי וְאַתָּה נַשְׁכִּים לְפִתְחוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: It is best if I go to them. He came and knocked on the door. He said to them One who sprinkles son of one who sprinkles shall to sprinkle neither one who sprinkles nor son of one who sprinkles will say to one who sprinkles son of one who sprinkles: Your water is cave water and your ashes are burnt ashes Rabbi Akiva said to him: Rabbi Yehoshua, have you been appeased? Everything we did was to your honor. Early tomorrow you and I will go to doorway
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: It is better that I be uprooted and go to him. A wild donkey came. He said to it: "Your father was a wild donkey, and you are a wild donkey." But if it is not a wild donkey and not the son of a wild donkey, he shall say to the wild donkey, "From your mother's waters, waters of the cave, and from your father's dust, dust of the grave." Rabbi Akiva said to him: Rabbi Yehoshua, have you been appeased? We did not do anything except for your honor. Tomorrow, you and I will be bitten at his doorstep.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד, נַעְבְּרֵיהּ — גְּמִירִי מַעֲלִין בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְאֵין מוֹרִידִין. נִדְרוֹשׁ מָר חֲדָא שַׁבְּתָא וּמַר חֲדָא שַׁבְּתָא — אָתֵי לְקַנּאוֹיֵי. אֶלָּא: לִדְרוֹשׁ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל תְּלָתָא שַׁבָּתֵי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה חֲדָא שַׁבְּתָא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר מָר שַׁבָּת שֶׁל מִי הָיְתָה — שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הָיְתָה. וְאוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי הֲוָה.
human_translation: They said: What shall we do? Remove him learned elevates sanctity and does not downgrade. Let Sage lecture one week and Sage one week, they will come to be jealous Rather, Rabban Gamliel will lecture three weeks and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya one week. and that is Whose week was it? It was the week of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. That student was Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai.
llm_translation: They said: How should we conduct ourselves, if we pass by it - we ascend in holiness and do not descend. One Master expounds one Sabbath and another Master expounds another Sabbath - it leads to zealotry. Rather, to expound Rabban Gamliel three Sabbaths and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah one Sabbath. And this is what the Master said: Whose Sabbath was it - it was that of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. And that disciple, Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, was there.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל מוּסָפִין כׇּל הַיּוֹם. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְנִקְרָא ״פּוֹשֵׁעַ״.
human_translation: And the additional prayer all day. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one is called negligent.
llm_translation: And of the additional offerings the entire day. Rabbi Yochanan said: And he shall be called a "transgressor."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי תְּפִלּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל מִנְחָה וְאַחַת שֶׁל מוּסָף — מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מִנְחָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מוּסָף, שֶׁזּוֹ תְּדִירָה, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ תְּדִירָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מוּסָף וְאַחַר כָּךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מִנְחָה, שֶׁזּוֹ מִצְוָה עוֹבֶרֶת, וְזוֹ מִצְוָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מִנְחָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מוּסָף.
human_translation: The Rabbis taught If two prayers was before him, one, the afternoon prayer and one, the additional prayer, he recites the afternoon prayer and the additional prayer thereafter, this, is frequent and this one, is infrequent Rabbi Yehuda says: He recites the additional prayer and the afternoon prayer thereafter, this, the additional prayer, is a mitzva elapses, and this, the afternoon prayer, is a mitzva not elapse Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha he recites the afternoon prayer and the additional prayer thereafter,
llm_translation: The sages taught: If there were before him two prayers, one of the Minchah offering and one of the Musaf offering, he prays the Minchah prayer first and then the Musaf prayer, because this one is frequent and that one is not frequent. Rabbi Yehudah says: He prays the Musaf prayer first and then the Minchah prayer, because this is a time-bound commandment and that is a non-time-bound commandment. Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is that one prays the Minchah prayer first and then the Musaf prayer.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי הֲוָה חֲלִישׁ מִגִּירְסֵיהּ הֲוָה אָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב אַפִּתְחָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי נָתָן בַּר טוֹבִי. אָמַר: כִּי חָלְפִי רַבָּנַן אָז אֵיקוּם מִקַּמַּיְיהוּ וַאֲקַבֵּל אַגְרָא. נְפַק אֲתָא רַבִּי נָתָן בַּר טוֹבִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן אֲמַר הֲלָכָה בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם שֶׁל מוּסָף וְאַחַר כָּךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל מִנְחָה.
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira would tire of his studies, he would go and sit in the doorway of Rabbi Natan bar Tovi’s study hall. He said When the Sages pass, I will rise before them and be rewarded Rabbi Natan bar Tovi emerged and came said to him: Who stated a halakha in the study hall? said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda who said: He recites the additional prayer and the afternoon prayer thereafter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira, when he was weak from his studies, would go and sit at the entrance of the study hall of Rabbi Natan bar Tovi. He said: "When I pass by the Rabbis, they will get up from their places and I will receive reward." Rabbi Natan bar Tovi came out and said to him: "Who said a Halacha in the study hall?" He said to him: "So said Rabbi Yochanan: The Halacha is not like Rabbi Yehuda who said that a person should pray the additional prayer first and then pray the afternoon prayer."
