hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַמְרַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. תְּנָא מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבְּעִין זִמְנִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲדָא הִיא לָךְ, אוֹ חֲדַת הִיא לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲדַת הִיא לִי, מִשּׁוּם דִּמְסַפְּקָא לִי בְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי.
human_translation: said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan say said to him: Yes. He learned from him forty times, said to him: it is singular for you, or is it new to you, said to him: is new to me, as I was uncertain Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi.
llm_translation: He said to him: Did Rabbi Yochanan say it? He said to him: No. A Tanna learned it from him forty times. He said to him: Is it new to you, or is it new to you? He said to him: It is new to me, because I have a doubt about Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל מוּסָפִין לְאַחַר שֶׁבַע שָׁעוֹת לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״נוּגֵי מִמּוֹעֵד אָסַפְתִּי מִמֵּךְ הָיוּ״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי נוּגֵי לִישָּׁנָא דִתְבָרָא הוּא? כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף: תְּבָרָא אָתֵי עַל שָׂנְאֵיהוֹן דְּבֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל דְּאַחַרוּ זִמְנֵי מוֹעֲדַיָּא דְּבִירוּשְׁלֶים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: anyone who recites the additional prayer after seven hours according to Rabbi Yehuda, the verse states: “Those who are destroyed [ nugei ] far from the Festivals, I shall gather from you, From where be inferred that nugei is an expression of destruction? As Rav Yosef translated Destruction comes upon the enemies the house of Israel, for they have delayed the times of the Festivals in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who prays the additional prayer after seven hours, the verse says about him: "I have gathered the outcasts of Israel." What is the implication that these outcasts come to be created? As Rav Yosef interpreted: They come to be created for those who delay the appointed times of the festivals in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית לְאַחַר אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״נוּגֵי מִמּוֹעֵד אָסַפְתִּי מִמֵּךְ הָיוּ״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי נוּגֵי לִישָּׁנָא דְצַעֲרָא הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״דָּלְפָה נַפְשִׁי מִתּוּגָה״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״בְּתוּלוֹתֶיהָ נוּגוֹת וְהִיא מָר לָהּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Regarding anyone who recites the morning prayer after four hours according to Rabbi Yehuda, the verse states: “Those who are in sorrow [ nugei ] far from the Festivals, I shall gather from you, From where be inferred that nugei is an expression of sorrow? As it is written: “My soul drips in sorrow [ tuga ]” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here: “Her virgins are sorrowed [ nugot ] and she is embittered”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who prays the morning prayer after four hours, Rabbi Yehuda holds the verse applies to him, "Your appointed feasts My soul hateth." What is the implication that these appointed feasts are a source of pain? For it is written, "My soul drips away because of trouble." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: From here, "Her virgins are afflicted, and she herself is in bitterness."

hebrew_text: רַב אַוְיָא חֲלַשׁ וְלָא אֲתָא לְפִרְקָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. לִמְחַר כִּי אֲתָא, בְּעָא אַבָּיֵי לְאַנּוֹחֵי דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲתָא מָר לְפִרְקָא? אָמַר לֵיהּ: דַּהֲוָה חֲלִישׁ לִבַּאי וְלָא מָצֵינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי לָא טְעַמְתְּ מִידֵּי וַאֲתֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּרַב הוּנָא? דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם כְּלוּם קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלַּת הַמּוּסָפִין! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמָר לְצַלּוֹיֵי צְלוֹתָא דְּמוּסָפִין בְּיָחִיד, וְלִטְעוֹם מִידֵּי וּלְמֵיתֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָסוּר לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּקְדִּים תְּפִלָּתוֹ לִתְפִלַּת הַצִּבּוּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּצִבּוּר שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Avya was ill and did not come to Rav Yosef’s Shabbat lecture. When came the following day, Abaye sought to placate Rav Yosef, Why did the Master not attend the Shabbat lecture? said to him: Because my heart was faint and I was unable said to him: Why did you not eat something and come? said to him: the Master not hold that of Rav Huna? As Rav Huna said: A person may not taste anything before he recites the additional prayer. said to him: My Master should have recited the additional prayer individually, eaten something, and come said to him: my Master not hold that of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A person may not recite his prayer prior to the communal prayer? said to him: it not stated regarding this Rabbi Abba said: They taught in a communal
llm_translation: Rav Avya became weak and did not come to the study hall of Rav Yosef. The next day, when he came, Abaye asked about the well-being of Rav Yosef. He said to him: Why did the master not come to the study hall? He said to him: Because my heart was weak and I could not find the strength. He said to him: Why did you not inform us immediately so we could come to you? He said to him: The master did not think like Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: It is forbidden for a person to taste anything before reciting the prayer of the Musaf additional offering. He said to him: Let the master try tasting a dish of Musaf alone, and he will die. He said to him: But the master did not think like Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is forbidden for a person to precede his prayer with the prayer of the congregation. He said to him: It was not stated about him that Rabbi Abba said in the congregation they differ.

hebrew_text: וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּרַב הוּנָא וְלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּרַב הוּנָא — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי — דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ זְמַן תְּפִלַּת מִנְחָה, אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם כְּלוּם קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה.
human_translation: And The halakha is neither in accordance with Rav Huna nor in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. in accordance with Rav Huna, as we said in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Once the time the afternoon prayer has arrived, a person may not taste anything before he recites the afternoon prayer.
llm_translation: There is no halakha like Rav Huna and no halakha like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Like Rav Huna — as we said. Like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi — as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Once the time for the Mincha prayer arrives, it is forbidden for a person to taste anything before praying the Mincha prayer.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה הָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וּבִיצִיאָתוֹ תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה מָקוֹם לִתְפִלָּה זוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶם: בִּכְנִיסָתִי אֲנִי מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁלֹּא יֶאֱרַע דְּבַר תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדִי. וּבִיצִיאָתִי אֲנִי נוֹתֵן הוֹדָאָה עַל חֶלְקִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥunya ben Hakana would recite a brief prayer upon his entrance into the study hall and upon his exit. They said to him: what room is there for this prayer? He said to them: Upon my entrance, I pray that no mishap will transpire by me And upon my exit, I give thanks for my portion.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Neḥunia the son of HaQana would pray upon entering the study hall and upon leaving, a brief prayer. They said to him: What is the reason for this prayer? He said to them: Upon entering, I pray that no mishap should occur through me. And upon leaving, I give thanks for my portion.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהַי שֶׁלֹּא יֶאֱרַע דְּבַר תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדִי, וְלֹא אֶכָּשֵׁל בִּדְבָר הֲלָכָה, וְיִשְׂמְחוּ בִּי חֲבֵרַי, וְלֹא אוֹמַר עַל טָמֵא טָהוֹר, וְלֹא עַל טָהוֹר טָמֵא. וְלֹא יִכָּשְׁלוּ חֲבֵרַי בִּדְבַר הֲלָכָה, וְאֶשְׂמַח בָּהֶם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught Upon his entrance, what does he say? May it be Your will, Lord my God, that no mishap transpires by me, and that I not fail in any matter of halakha , and that my colleagues, will rejoice in me. And that I will neither declare pure that which is impure, nor impure that which is pure and that my colleagues will not fail in any matter of halakha , and that I will rejoice in them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Upon entering, what does one say? "May it be Your will, Lord my God, that no mishap occur through me, and that I not stumble in a matter of halakha, and let my colleagues rejoice in me, and that I not say of impure that it is pure, or of pure that it is impure. And let not my colleagues stumble in a matter of halakha, and I will rejoice in them."

hebrew_text: בִּיצִיאָתוֹ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״מוֹדֶה אֲנִי לְפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהַי שֶׁשַּׂמְתָּ חֶלְקִי מִיּוֹשְׁבֵי בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְלֹא שַׂמְתָּ חֶלְקִי מִיּוֹשְׁבֵי קְרָנוֹת. שֶׁאֲנִי מַשְׁכִּים, וְהֵם מַשְׁכִּימִים. אֲנִי מַשְׁכִּים לְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְהֵם מַשְׁכִּימִים לִדְבָרִים בְּטֵלִים. אֲנִי עָמֵל וְהֵם עֲמֵלִים. אֲנִי עָמֵל וּמְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר, וְהֵם עֲמֵלִים וְאֵינָם מְקַבְּלִים שָׂכָר. אֲנִי רָץ וְהֵם רָצִים. אֲנִי רָץ לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְהֵם רָצִים לִבְאֵר שַׁחַת״.
human_translation: Upon his exit, what did he say? I give thanks before You, Lord my God, that You have placed my lot among those who sit in the study hall, and that you have not given me my portion among those who sit on corners. I rise early, and they rise early. I rise early to matters of Torah, and they rise early to frivolous matters. I toil and they toil. I toil and receive a reward, and they toil and do not receive a reward. I run and they run. I run to the life of the World-to-Come and they run to the pit of destruction.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Regarding his departure, what does he say? 'I acknowledge before You, Lord my God, that You have apportioned my share among the residents of the study hall, and have not apportioned my share among the residents of the synagogues. For I rise early, and they rise early. I rise early for words of Torah, and they rise early for idle matters. I toil and they toil. I toil and receive reward, and they toil and do not receive reward. I run and they run. I run for the life of the World to Come, and they run to the pit of destruction.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נִכְנְסוּ תַּלְמִידָיו לְבַקְּרוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבֵּינוּ לַמְּדֵנוּ אוֹרְחוֹת חַיִּים וְנִזְכֶּה בָּהֶן לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, his students entered to visit him. They said to him: Teach us paths of life, and we will thereby merit the life of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: The sages taught: When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, his students came to visit him. They said to him: Our teacher, teach us the ways of life, so that we may merit the life of the world to come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: הִזָּהֲרוּ בִּכְבוֹד חַבְרֵיכֶם, וּמִנְעוּ בְּנֵיכֶם מִן הַהִגָּיוֹן, וְהוֹשִׁיבוּם בֵּין בִּרְכֵּי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וּכְשֶׁאַתֶּם מִתְפַּלְּלִים — דְּעוּ לִפְנֵי מִי אַתֶּם עוֹמְדִים. וּבִשְׁבִיל כָּךְ תִּזְכּוּ לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: He said to them: Be vigilant in the honor of your counterparts, and prevent your children from logic and place between the knees of Torah scholars, and when you pray, know before Whom you stand. For that, you will merit the life of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: He said to them: Be careful with the honor of your friends, and prevent your children from engaging in idle talk, and seat them between the knees of Torah scholars, and when you pray - know before Whom you are standing. And for this you will merit the life of the World to Come.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי נִכְנְסוּ תַּלְמִידָיו לְבַקְּרוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה אוֹתָם הִתְחִיל לִבְכּוֹת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: ״נֵר יִשְׂרָאֵל, עַמּוּד הַיְּמִינִי, פַּטִּישׁ הֶחָזָק״, מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה בּוֹכֶה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai fell ill his students entered to visit him. When he saw them, he began to cry. His students said to him: Lamp of Israel, the right pillar, the mighty hammer, for what are you crying?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And when Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai fell ill, his students entered to visit him. Once he saw them, he began to cry. His students said to him: "Lamp of Israel, right pillar, mighty hammer," why are you crying? English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: אִילּוּ לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם הָיוּ מוֹלִיכִין אוֹתִי, שֶׁהַיּוֹם כָּאן וּמָחָר בַּקֶּבֶר, שֶׁאִם כּוֹעֵס עָלַי אֵין כַּעֲסוֹ כַּעַס עוֹלָם, וְאִם אוֹסְרֵנִי — אֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאִם מְמִיתֵנִי — אֵין מִיתָתוֹ מִיתַת עוֹלָם, וַאֲנִי יָכוֹל לְפַיְּיסוֹ בִּדְבָרִים וּלְשַׁחֲדוֹ בְּמָמוֹן, אַף עַל פִּי כֵן הָיִיתִי בּוֹכֶה, וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִים אוֹתִי לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁהוּא חַי וְקַיָּים לְעוֹלָם וּלְעוֹלְמֵי עוֹלָמִים, שֶׁאִם כּוֹעֵס עָלַי — כַּעֲסוֹ כַּעַס עוֹלָם, וְאִם אוֹסְרֵנִי — אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאִם מְמִיתֵנִי — מִיתָתוֹ מִיתַת עוֹלָם, וְאֵינִי יָכוֹל לְפַיְּיסוֹ בִּדְבָרִים וְלֹא לְשַׁחֲדוֹ בְּמָמוֹן. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְפָנַי שְׁנֵי דְרָכִים, אַחַת שֶׁל גַּן עֵדֶן וְאַחַת שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזוֹ מוֹלִיכִים אוֹתִי, וְלֹא אֶבְכֶּה?!
human_translation: He said to them: If they were leading me before a flesh and blood king who is here today and in the grave tomorrow; if he is angry with me, his anger is not eternal if he incarcerates me, his incarceration is not an eternal incarceration, If he kills me, his killing is not for eternity, I am able to appease him with words and bribe him with money, even so I would cry Now that they are leading me before the supreme King of Kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He, Who lives and endures forever and all time; if He is angry with me, His anger is eternal; if He incarcerates me, His incarceration is an eternal incarceration; and if He kills me, His killing is for eternity. I am unable to appease Him with words and bribe him with money. Moreover, but I have two paths before me, one of the Garden of Eden and one of Gehenna, and I do not know on which they are leading me; and will I not cry?
llm_translation: He said to them: If only before the King, flesh and blood, they would bring me, for today I am here and tomorrow in the grave. For if He becomes angry with me, His anger is eternal; and if He imprisons me, His imprisonment is eternal; and if He kills me, His death is eternal. And I can appease Him with words and bribe Him with money, yet nevertheless I weep. And now that they are bringing me before the King of kings, the Holy One, blessed be He, who is alive and enduring forever and ever, for if He becomes angry with me, His anger is eternal; and if He imprisons me, His imprisonment is eternal; and if He kills me, His death is eternal, and I cannot appease Him with words nor bribe Him with money. And not only that, but there are two paths before me, one leading to the Garden of Eden and one leading to Gehenna, and I do not know which path they will lead me on, so why should I not weep?!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבֵּינוּ, בָּרְכֵנוּ. אָמַר לָהֶם: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁתְּהֵא מוֹרָא שָׁמַיִם עֲלֵיכֶם כְּמוֹרָא בָּשָׂר וָדָם״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: עַד כָּאן? אָמַר לָהֶם: וּלְוַאי, תֵּדְעוּ כְּשֶׁאָדָם עוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אוֹמֵר: ״שֶׁלֹּא יִרְאַנִי אָדָם״.
human_translation: said to him: Our teacher, bless us. He said to them: May it be will that the fear of Heaven shall be upon you like the fear of flesh and blood. His students and said: To that point He said to them: Would that Know that when one commits a transgression, he says that no man will see me.
llm_translation: They said to him: Our teacher, bless us. He said to them: "May it be the will that the fear of Heaven be upon you like the fear of flesh and blood." His disciples said to him: Until here? He said to them: And would that you know that when a person commits a transgression, he says, "May no one see me."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתוֹ, אָמַר לָהֶם: פַּנּוּ כֵּלִים מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה, וְהָכִינוּ כִּסֵּא לְחִזְקִיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה שֶׁבָּא.
human_translation: at the time of his death, he said to them: Remove the vessels due to the ritual impurity And prepare a chair for Hezekiah, the King of Judea, who is coming
llm_translation: At the time of his death, he said to them: "Turn vessels away because of impurity, and prepare a throne for Hezekiah, king of Judah, who is coming."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בְּכָל יוֹם וְיוֹם מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אִם שְׁגוּרָה תְּפִלָּתוֹ בְּפִיו — מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וְאִם לָאו — מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Each and every day a person recites the eighteen blessings. Rabbi Yehoshua says: an abridged eighteen blessings. Rabbi Akiva says If he is fluent in his prayer, he recites the eighteen blessings, and if not, an abridged eighteen blessings.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabban Gamliel says: Every day a person should pray eighteen. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Similar to eighteen. Rabbi Akiva says: If one's prayer is fluent in his mouth, he should pray eighteen, and if not, similar to eighteen.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹשֶׂה תְּפִלָּתוֹ קֶבַע — אֵין תְּפִלָּתוֹ תַּחֲנוּנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: One whose prayer is fixed, his prayer is not supplication
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: One who makes his prayer fixed - his prayer is not supplications.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: הַהוֹלֵךְ בִּמְקוֹם סַכָּנָה, מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה, וְאוֹמֵר: ״הוֹשַׁע ה׳ אֶת עַמְּךָ אֵת שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּכָל פָּרָשַׁת הָעִבּוּר יִהְיוּ צׇרְכֵיהֶם לְפָנֶיךָ. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who is walking in a place of danger, recites a brief prayer and says: Redeem, Lord, Your people, the remnant of Israel, at every transition [ parashat ha’ibur ], May their needs be before You. Blessed are You, Lord, Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who walks in a place of danger, should pray a short prayer, and say: "Save, O Lord, Your people, the remnant of Israel, in every passage they need to pass before You. Blessed are You, O Lord, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: הָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַחֲמוֹר — יֵרֵד וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לֵירֵד — יַחֲזִיר אֶת פָּנָיו. וְאִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַחֲזִיר אֶת פָּנָיו — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקׇּדָשִׁים. הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בִּסְפִינָה אוֹ בְּאַסְדָּא — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקׇּדָשִׁים.
human_translation: One who was riding on a donkey should dismount and pray If he is unable to dismount, he should turn his face If he is unable to turn his face, he focus his heart opposite the Holy of Holies. one who was traveling in a ship or on a raft [ asda ] should focus his heart opposite the Holy of Holies.
llm_translation: He who is riding on a donkey - should dismount and pray, and if he cannot dismount - he should turn his face. And if he cannot turn his face - he should direct his heart towards the Holy of Holies. If one is walking on a ship or on a raft - he should direct his heart towards the Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָנֵי שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה כְּנֶגֶד מִי?
human_translation: Corresponding to what were these eighteen
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma, hanei shmonah esrei k'neged mi?" Translation: "Learned Ones, these eighteen correspond to whom?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי הִלֵּל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: כְּנֶגֶד שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה אַזְכָּרוֹת שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד בְּ״הָבוּ לַה׳ בְּנֵי אֵלִים״. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה אַזְכָּרוֹת שֶׁבִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּנֶגֶד שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה חוּלְיוֹת שֶׁבַּשִּׁדְרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, said: Corresponding to the eighteen mentions of God’s name David said “Give unto the Lord, O you sons of might” Rav Yosef said: Corresponding to the eighteen mentions of God’s name in Shema . Rabbi Tanḥum said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Corresponding to the eighteen vertebrae in the spine
llm_translation: Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, said: Corresponding to the eighteen mentions that David said in "Bring to the Lord, O sons of mighty ones." Rabbi Yosef said: Corresponding to the eighteen mentions in the recitation of the Shema. Rabbi Tanchum said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Corresponding to the eighteen vertebrae in the spine.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּכְרַע עַד שֶׁיִּתְפַּקְּקוּ כׇּל חוּלְיוֹת שֶׁבַּשִּׁדְרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: one who prays must bow until all the vertebrae in the spine protrude.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Tanhum said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: One who prays must bow until all the vertebrae in his spine separate.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: עַד כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּרְאֶה אִיסָּר כְּנֶגֶד לִבּוֹ. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּעְנַע רֹאשׁוֹ — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. אָמַר רָבָא: וְהוּא דִּמְצַעַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, וּמִחְזֵי כְּמַאן דְּכָרַע.
human_translation: Ulla said: he can see a small coin [ issar ], opposite his heart Rabbi Ḥanina said: once he moves his head he need not Rava said: But that he is exerting himself and he appears like one who is bowing.
llm_translation: Ulla said: Until the point that he sees Isar opposite his heart. Rabbi Chanina said: Once he nods his head - he no longer needs it. Rava said: And this is causing himself distress, and he looks like one who is bowing.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי?! תְּשַׁסְרֵי הָוְויָן!
human_translation: these eighteen They are nineteen.
llm_translation: These eight, are they nine?! They are nine!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: בִּרְכַּת הַמִּינִים בְּיַבְנֶה תִּקְּנוּהָ. כְּנֶגֶד מִי תִּקְּנוּהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: The blessing of the heretics, was instituted in Yavne Corresponding to what was instituted?
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: The blessing of the heretics in Yavneh they established it. Against whom did they establish it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: לְרַבִּי הִלֵּל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, כְּנֶגֶד ״אֵל הַכָּבוֹד הִרְעִים״. לְרַב יוֹסֵף, כְּנֶגֶד ״אֶחָד״ שֶׁבִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. לְרַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, כְּנֶגֶד חוּלְיָא קְטַנָּה שֶׁבַּשִּׁדְרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: According to Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, corresponds to “The God of glory thunders” ( According to Rav Yosef, corresponds to one that is in Shema . According to Rabbi Tanḥum Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, corresponds to the small vertebra that is of the spine.
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Regarding Rabbi Hillel, the son of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, it is like "El Hakavod Heiraim." Regarding Rav Yosef, it is like "Echad" in the recitation of Shema. Regarding Rabbi Tanchum, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, it is like the small window in the room.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁמְעוֹן הַפָּקוֹלִי הִסְדִּיר שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרָכוֹת לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל עַל הַסֵּדֶר בְּיַבְנֶה. אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַחֲכָמִים: כְּלוּם יֵשׁ אָדָם שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לְתַקֵּן בִּרְכַּת הַמִּינִים? עָמַד שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן וְתִקְּנָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Shimon HaPakuli arranged eighteen blessings, before Rabban Gamliel, in order in Yavne. Rabban Gamliel said to the Sages: Is there any person who knows to institute the blessing of the heretics, Shmuel HaKatan, stood and instituted it.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: Shimon the Pakoli arranged eighteen blessings before Rabban Gamliel in order in Yavneh. Rabban Gamliel said to the sages: Is there anyone who knows how to establish the blessing against the heretics? Shmuel the Young arose and established it.

hebrew_text: לְשָׁנָה אַחֶרֶת שְׁכָחָהּ,
human_translation: The next year, he forgot
llm_translation: In the year following, she forgot it.

hebrew_text: וְהִשְׁקִיף בָּהּ שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת, וְלֹא הֶעֱלוּהוּ.
human_translation: and scrutinized it, two or three hours, and they did not remove him
llm_translation: And he looked at it two and three hours, and they did not raise him.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי לֹא הֶעֱלוּהוּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: טָעָה בְּכָל הַבְּרָכוֹת כֻּלָּן — אֵין מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ, בְּבִרְכַּת הַמִּינִים — מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ. חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא מִין הוּא?
human_translation: Why did they not remove him? Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said: erred in any of the blessings, they do not remove him the blessing of the heretics they remove him, we suspect that perhaps he is a heretic
llm_translation: "Why was it not brought up? And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If one erred in all the blessings, we do not make him repeat them; in the blessing over heretics, we make him repeat it. We are concerned that perhaps he is from that sect."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן דְּאִיהוּ תַּקְּנַהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel HaKatan is different because he instituted
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Sha'anei Shmuel hakatan deihu taknaha." English translation: "The years of Samuel the Small, for he was young, were established."

hebrew_text: וְנֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גְּמִירִי, טָבָא לָא הָוֵי בִּישָׁא.
human_translation: Let us suspect perhaps he reconsidered Abaye said: We learned good does not become wicked.
llm_translation: And there is a concern that perhaps he will return. Abaye said: It is learned, good will not be embarrassed.

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּבְשׁוּב צַדִּיק מִצִּדְקָתוֹ וְעָשָׂה עָוֶל״. הָהוּא רָשָׁע מֵעִיקָּרוֹ, אֲבָל צַדִּיק מֵעִיקָּרוֹ — לָא.
human_translation: And not Isn’t it written: “And when the righteous one returns from his righteousness and does wicked That initially wicked However, one who is initially righteous not
llm_translation: And not?! And it is written: "And when a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and commits iniquity." That wicked person from the beginning, but a righteous person from the beginning - no.

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָא תְּנַן: אַל תַּאֲמִין בְּעַצְמְךָ עַד יוֹם מוֹתְךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי יוֹחָנָן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שִׁמֵּשׁ בִּכְהוּנָּה גְּדוֹלָה שְׁמֹנִים שָׁנָה וּלְבַסּוֹף נַעֲשָׂה צָדוֹקִי.
human_translation: And not Didn’t we learn Do not be sure of yourself until the day you die, as Yoḥanan the High Priest served in the High Priesthood for eighty years and ultimately became a Sadducee.
llm_translation: And not?! But didn't we learn: "Do not trust in yourself until the day of your death," for behold, Yochanan the High Priest served in the high priesthood for eighty years, and in the end, he became a Sadducee.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הוּא יַנַּאי, הוּא יוֹחָנָן. רָבָא אָמַר: יַנַּאי לְחוּד וְיוֹחָנָן לְחוּד, יַנַּאי — רָשָׁע מֵעִיקָּרוֹ, וְיוֹחָנָן — צַדִּיק מֵעִיקָּרוֹ. הַנִּיחָא לְאַבָּיֵי, אֶלָּא לְרָבָא קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Abaye responded: He is Yannai he is Yoḥanan. Rava said: Yannai is distinct and Yoḥanan is distinct. Yannai was wicked from the outset and Yoḥanan was righteous from the outset. it works out well according to Abaye’s however, according to Rava’s it is difficult.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: He is Yannai, he is Yochanan. Rava said: Yannai is distinct, and Yochanan is distinct. Yannai — wicked from the outset, and Yochanan — righteous from the outset. It is more difficult for Rava than for Abbaye.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: צַדִּיק מֵעִיקָּרוֹ נָמֵי דִּלְמָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי לָא אַסְּקוּהוּ?
human_translation: Rava said to you: also that one who is righteous from the outset will perhaps reconsider If so, Why did they not remove
llm_translation: Rava said to you: A righteous person from the beginning is similar to perhaps he will return to it. If so, why did they not appoint him?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן דְּאַתְחֵיל בַּהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לֹא שָׁנוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא הִתְחִיל בָּהּ, אֲבָל הִתְחִיל בָּהּ — גּוֹמְרָהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel HaKatan is different, as he began Rav Yehuda said Rav, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: They only taught where he did not begin it. But began it, and finish it.
llm_translation: The Mishna states: Shani Shmuel HaKatan de'atcheil bah. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and it was taught by Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: They did not teach this, rather that if one did not begin with it, but if one began with it — he completes it.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שֶׁבַע דְּשַׁבְּתָא כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲלַפְתָּא בֶּן שָׁאוּל: כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעָה ״קוֹלוֹת״ שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד עַל הַמַּיִם.
human_translation: Corresponding to what these seven of Shabbat Rabbi Ḥalafta ben Shaul said: Corresponding to the seven “voices” which David mentioned on the waters;
llm_translation: These seven of Shabbat correspond to whom? Rabbi Chalaphta son of Sha'ul said: Corresponding to the seven "voices" that David said over the waters.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי תֵּשַׁע דְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּמִן קַרְטִיגְנִין: כְּנֶגֶד תִּשְׁעָה אַזְכָּרוֹת שֶׁאָמְרָה חַנָּה בִּתְפִלָּתָהּ, דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה נִפְקְדָה שָׂרָה רָחֵל וְחַנָּה.
human_translation: Corresponding to what these nine of Rosh HaShana Rabbi Yitzḥak of Kartignin said: correspond to the nine mentions of God’s name that Hannah said in her prayer the Master said: On Rosh HaShana, Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were remembered
llm_translation: These nine on Rosh Hashanah, against whom? Rabbi Yitzchak said from Kartignin: Against the nine mentions that Chana said in her prayer, as the Master said: On Rosh Hashanah, Sarah, Rachel, and Chana were remembered.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע דְּתַעֲנִיתָא כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: כְּנֶגֶד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע ״רְנָנוֹת״ שֶׁאָמַר שְׁלֹמֹה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִכְנִיס אָרוֹן לְבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקׇּדָשִׁים: אִי הָכִי, כׇּל יוֹמָא נָמֵי נֵמְרִינְהוּ! אֵימַת אַמְרִינְהוּ שְׁלֹמֹה — בְּיוֹמָא דְרַחֲמֵי, אֲנַן נָמֵי בְּיוֹמָא דְרַחֲמֵי אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: Corresponding to what these twenty-four of the fast Rabbi Ḥelbo said: correspond to the twenty-four “songs” that Solomon said when he brought the ark into the Holy of Holies If so, then let us say these every day. When did Solomon say them? On a day of mercy. We, too, say them on a day of mercy.
llm_translation: These twenty-four fasts correspond to whom? Rabbi Helbo said: Corresponding to the twenty-four "songs" that Solomon said when he brought the Ark into the Holy of Holies. If not, we would fast every day! When did Solomon say them? On a day of mercy, so we also say them on a day of mercy.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מֵעֵין שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה. מַאי ״מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה״? רַב אָמַר: מֵעֵין כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״הֲבִינֵנוּ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ לָדַעַת דְּרָכֶיךָ, וּמוֹל אֶת לְבָבֵנוּ לְיִרְאָתֶךָ, וְתִסְלַח לָנוּ לִהְיוֹת גְּאוּלִים, וְרַחֲקֵנוּ מִמַּכְאוֹבֵינוּ, וְדַשְּׁנֵנוּ בִּנְאוֹת אַרְצֶךָ, וּנְפוּצוֹתֵינוּ מֵאַרְבַּע תְּקַבֵּץ, וְהַתּוֹעִים עַל דַּעְתְּךָ יִשְׁפְּטוּ, וְעַל הָרְשָׁעִים תָּנִיף יָדֶיךָ, וְיִשְׂמְחוּ צַדִּיקִים בְּבִנְיַן עִירֶךָ וּבְתִקּוּן הֵיכָלֶךָ, וּבִצְמִיחַת קֶרֶן לְדָוִד עַבְדֶּךָ וּבַעֲרִיכַת נֵר לְבֶן יִשַׁי מְשִׁיחֶךָ, טֶרֶם נִקְרָא אַתָּה תַעֲנֶה. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says an abridged eighteen blessings. What abridged eighteen blessings? Rav said: an abridged of each and every blessing. Shmuel said: Grant us understanding, Lord our God, to know Your ways, and sensitize our hearts so that we may revere You, and forgive us so that we may be redeemed, and keep us far from our suffering, and satisfy us with the pastures of Your land, and gather our scattered from the four and those who go astray shall be judged according to Your will, and raise Your hand against the wicked, and may the righteous rejoice in the rebuilding of Your city, and the restoration of Your Sanctuary, and in the flourishing of Your servant David, and in establishing a light for Your Messiah, son of Yishai. Before we call, may You answer. Blessed are You, Lord, Who listens to prayer.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "From the likeness of eighteen." What is "from the likeness of eighteen"? Rav said: "From the likeness of every blessing, blessing." And Shmuel said: "O Lord our God, make us understand Your ways, and circumcise our hearts to fear You, and forgive us to be redeemed, and distance us from our pains, and satisfy us with the delights of Your land, and gather our dispersed from the four corners, and let those who err in Your knowledge be judged, and against the wicked let Your hand be raised, and let the righteous rejoice in the building of Your city and in the restoration of Your sanctuary, and in the sprouting of the horn of David Your servant and in the setting up of the lamp for Your anointed son, before You answer. Blessed are You, O Lord, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: לָיֵיט עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי אַמַּאן דִּמְצַלֵּי ״הֲבִינֵנוּ״.
human_translation: Abaye would curse anyone who recited Grant us understanding,
llm_translation: "Leit alah Abbayei ammaan di'mtzallei 'havineinu'."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם ״הֲבִינֵנוּ״, חוּץ מִמּוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת וּמִמּוֹצָאֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לוֹמַר הַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: One may recite: Grant us understanding throughout the entire year, except for the conclusion of Shabbat and at the conclusion of Festivals, because he must recite distinction [ havdala ] in Who graciously grants knowledge.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Throughout the entire year, a person prays "Havinenu," except for the conclusion of Shabbat and the conclusion of festivals, because one must say the blessing of "Havdalah" with "Chonen HaDa'at."

hebrew_text: מַתְקִיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְנֵימְרַהּ בְּרָכָה רְבִיעִית בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ! מִי לָא תְּנַן רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אוֹמְרָהּ בְּרָכָה רְבִיעִית בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בַּהוֹדָאָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel strongly objects to this: let us say as an independent fourth blessing, Grant us understanding. Didn’t we learn Rabbi Akiva says: He says as an independent fourth blessing? Rabbi Eliezer says: in thanksgiving.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Shmuel objects to her: And let her say the fourth blessing separately! Did we not learn in a Mishnah: Rabbi Akiva says: Let her say the fourth blessing separately. Rabbi Eliezer says: With thanksgiving.

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ מִי עָבְדִינַן כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּהַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נַעֲבֵיד?! כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא עָבְדִינַן כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי תַּקּוּן, תְּשַׁסְרֵי לָא תַּקּוּן, הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁבַע תַּקּוּן תַּמְנֵי לָא תַּקּוּן.
human_translation: Do we practice in accordance with Rabbi Akiva throughout the entire year that we will also practice now? Throughout the entire year, what is the reason that we do not practice in accordance with Rabbi Akiva? they instituted eighteen they did not institute nineteen. Here too, they instituted seven they did not institute eight.
llm_translation: Now, all the year, all of it, who do we serve like Rabbi Akiva, for now we serve?! All the year, all of it, what is the reason we do not serve like Rabbi Akiva? Eighteen times the fixing, seventeen times not fixing, here we have seven times fixing, eight times not fixing.

hebrew_text: מַתְקִיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: וְנִכְלְלָה מִכְלָל: ״הֲבִינֵנוּ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל״! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Mar Zutra strongly objects to this: Let us include framework Grant us understanding, Lord our God, Who distinguishes between sacred and profane. difficult.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra objects to her: And it was included in the general principle: "Has the Lord our God separated between holy and profane"! It is difficult.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ מִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם ״הֲבִינֵנוּ״, חוּץ מִימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לוֹמַר שְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת ״הַשָּׁנִים״. מַתְקִיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: וְנִכְלְלָה מִכְלָל: ״וְדַשְּׁנֵנוּ בִּנְאוֹת אַרְצֶךָ, וְתֵן טַל וּמָטָר״!
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: One may recite Grant us understanding throughout the entire year, except during the rainy season, because he must recite the request in the blessing of the years. Mar Zutra strongly objects to this: Let us include framework And satisfy us with the pastures of Your land, and grant dew and rain.
llm_translation: Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said: Throughout the entire year, a person prays "Havinenu" except for the days of rain, because one must include a request in the blessing of "HaShanim." Mar Zutra objected to him: But it is already included in the verse: "And satisfy us with the goodness of Your land, and give dew and rain!"

hebrew_text: אָתֵי לְאִטְּרוֹדֵי. אִי הָכִי, הַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״, נָמֵי אָתֵי לְאִטְּרוֹדֵי!
human_translation: become confused If so, by havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, also become confused.
llm_translation: He comes to investigate. If so, the distinction in "Chonen HaDa'at" also he comes to investigate!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם כֵּיוָן דְּאָתְיָא בִּתְחִלַּת צְלוֹתָא — לָא מִטְּרִיד, הָכָא כֵּיוָן דְּאָתְיָא בְּאֶמְצַע צְלוֹתָא — מִטְּרִיד.
human_translation: They say There, since comes at the beginning of the prayer, he will not confused. Here, since comes in the middle of the prayer, he will confused.
llm_translation: They said: There, since it comes at the beginning of the shade - it does not disturb; here, since it comes in the middle of the shade - it does disturb.

hebrew_text: מַתְקִיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: וְנֵימְרַהּ בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּ״תְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים״ — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. שְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ בְּ"שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה". וְהַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס. טָעָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: let us say in Who listens to prayer. As Rabbi Tanḥum said Rav Asi said: One who erred and did not mention the might of the rains the revival of the dead, we require him to return the request in the blessing of the years, we do not require him to return because he can recite it in Who listens to prayer. And havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, we do not require him to return as he can recite over the cup One who erred is different,
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges it: Rav Ashe said: And it is stated in "Shomea Tefilah," as Rabbi Tanchum said in the name of Rav Assi: If one erred and did not mention the powers of rain in "Techiyat HaMeitim" — he repeats it. If one made a mistake in the blessing of the years — he does not repeat it, because he can say it in "Shomea Tefilah." And if one erred in the blessing of "Chonen HaDa'at" — he does not repeat it, because he can say it over the cup. The mistakes are different.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּ״תְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים״ — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. שְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת ״הַשָּׁנִים״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״. וְהַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: the matter itself. Rabbi Tanḥum said Rav Asi said: One who erred and did not mention the might of the rains the revival of the dead, we require him to return the request in the blessing of the years, we do not require him to return because he can recite it in Who listens to prayer. And havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, we do not require him to return as he can recite over the cup
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Tanhum said in the name of Rav Assi: If one erred and did not mention the might of rain in "the revival of the dead" - we return him. If he erred in the blessing of "the years" - we do not return him, because he can say it in "He who hears prayer." And if he erred in the blessing of "He who graciously bestows knowledge" - we do not return him, because he can say it over the cup.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּ״תְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים״ — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. שְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת ״הַשָּׁנִים״ — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, וְהַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: raised an objection One who erred and did not mention the might of the rains the revival of the dead, we require him to return the request in the blessing of the years, we require him to return havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, we do not require him to return as he can recite over the cup
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was asked: If one erred and did not mention the might of rain in the "Resurrection of the Dead" blessing - they return him. If one erred in the blessing of "the years" - they return him. But in the blessing of "He who graciously endows knowledge" - they do not return him, because he can say it over the cup.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּיָחִיד, הָא בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: This is not difficult. This as an individual. that as a congregation.
llm_translation: Not difficult, here in private, here in public.

hebrew_text: בְּצִבּוּר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּשַׁמְעַהּ מִשְּׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר, אִי הָכִי, הַאי ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ בְּשׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִילָּה״, ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשּׁוֹמֵעַ מִשְּׁלִיחַ צִיבּוּר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: as a congregation, what is the reason not Because when he hears it from the communal prayer leader If so, That because he can recite it in Who listens to prayer, should have been: Because he hears it from the communal prayer leader.
llm_translation: In a congregation, what is the reason for not repeating the Amidah prayer? — Because one has heard it from the messenger of the congregation. If so, this reason "because he can say it while the one who hears the prayer is silent," "because the one who hears is like a messenger of the congregation," what does he require?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּיָחִיד, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִדְּכַר קוֹדֶם ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״,
human_translation: this and that as an individual, and it is, not difficult. This he recalls before Who listens to prayer,
llm_translation: Rather, both cases are in a private domain, and it is not difficult: this case where "He remembers" precedes "He who hears prayer,"

hebrew_text: הָא, דְּאִדְּכַר בָּתַר ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: This he recalls his error after Who listens to prayer,
llm_translation: Here, that which is mentioned after "Shomea Tefillah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בָּ״עֲבוֹדָה״ — חוֹזֵר לָ״עֲבוֹדָה״. נִזְכַּר בַּ״הוֹדָאָה״ — חוֹזֵר לָ״עֲבוֹדָה״. בְּ״שִׂים שָׁלוֹם״ — חוֹזֵר לָ״עֲבוֹדָה״. וְאִם סִייֵּם — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum said Rav Asi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who erred and did not mention the New Moon, in the service, he returns to the service. remembers during thanksgiving, he returns to the service. Grant peace, he returns to the service. If completed he returns to the beginning
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum said in the name of Rav Assi who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: If one made a mistake and did not mention the new moon in the "service," he goes back to the "service." If he remembered during the "thanksgiving," he goes back to the "service." If he said "Shalom" (peace), he goes back to the "service." But if he finished, he goes back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא: הָא דַּאֲמַרַן סִייֵּם — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁעָקַר רַגְלָיו, אֲבָל לֹא עָקַר רַגְלָיו — חוֹזֵר לָעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa son of Rav Aḥa bar Adda said: That which we said finished he returns to the beginning, we only said where he moved his feet However, did not move his feet, he return to the service,
llm_translation: Rav Papa, son of Rav Acha bar Adda, said: That which we said "if he completed" - he returns to the beginning, we only said this if he uprooted his feet, but if he did not uproot his feet - he returns to the service.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ הָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵאַבָּא מָרִי שְׁמִיעַ לִי, וְאַבָּא מָרִי מֵרַב.
human_translation: He said to him: From where do you this He said to him: My father my teacher told me and my father my teacher from Rav.
llm_translation: He said to him: From where do you know this? He said to him: From my master I heard, and my master heard from Rav.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָא דַּאֲמַרַן עָקַר רַגְלָיו חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָגִיל לוֹמַר תַּחֲנוּנִים אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ, אֲבָל רָגִיל לוֹמַר תַּחֲנוּנִים אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: That which we said moved his feet he returns to the beginning, we only said where he is unaccustomed to reciting supplications after his prayer. However, he is accustomed to reciting supplications after his prayer, he return to the service,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This that we said, if one uproots his feet, he returns to the beginning, we only said this when he is not accustomed to say supplications after his prayer. But if he is accustomed to say supplications after his prayer, he returns to the service.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָא דַּאֲמַרַן כִּי לֹא עָקַר רַגְלָיו חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָה לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁרָגִיל לוֹמַר תַּחֲנוּנִים אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ, אֲבָל אִם אֵינוֹ רָגִיל לוֹמַר תַּחֲנוּנִים אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Some say, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: That which we said did not move his feet, he return to the service, we only said where he is accustomed to reciting supplications after his prayer. However, he is unaccustomed to reciting supplications after his prayer, he must return to the beginning of the prayer,
llm_translation: There is one who says: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This that we said, "If one did not uproot his feet, he returns to the service," we only said this when he is accustomed to say supplications after his prayer. But if he is not accustomed to say supplications after his prayer, he returns to the beginning.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה תְּפִלָּתוֹ קֶבַע וְכוּ׳: מַאי ״קֶבַע״? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: כֹּל שֶׁתְּפִלָּתוֹ דּוֹמָה עָלָיו כְּמַשּׂוֹי. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ אוֹמְרָהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן תַּחֲנוּנִים. רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ דָּבָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: One whose prayer is fixed, his prayer is not supplication. What is fixed Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Oshaya said: anyone for whom his prayer is like a burden upon him, The Rabbis say: anyone who does not recite in the language of supplication, Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: anyone unable to introduce element,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who makes his prayer fixed, etc. What is "fixed"? Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: Anyone whose prayer is like a burden upon him. And the Rabbis say: Anyone who does not say it in the language of supplication. Rabbah and Rav Yosef both say: Anyone who cannot innovate something in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֲנָא יָכֵילְנָא לְחַדּוֹשֵׁי בַּהּ מִילְּתָא, וּמִסְתְּפֵינָא דִּלְמָא מִטְּרִידְנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I could introduce element I am afraid that perhaps I will confused.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I am able to innovate a matter in it, and I am concerned that perhaps I will be troubled.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אָבִין דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מִתְפַּלֵּל עִם דִּמְדּוּמֵי חַמָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְוָה לְהִתְפַּלֵּל עִם דִּמְדּוּמֵי חַמָּה. וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״יִירָאוּךָ עִם שָׁמֶשׁ וְלִפְנֵי יָרֵחַ דּוֹר דּוֹרִים״. לָיְיטִי עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא אַמַּאן דִּמְצַלֵּי עִם דִּמְדּוּמֵי חַמָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא — דִּלְמָא מִיטַּרְפָא לֵיהּ שַׁעְתָּא.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rabbi Ḥanina bar Avin, both said: anyone who does not pray with the reddening of the sun, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is a mitzva to pray with the reddening of the sun. And Rabbi Zeira said: What is the verse “Let them fear You with the sun and before the moon, generation after generation” in the West, they cursed one who prays with the reddening of the sun What is the reason? Perhaps, confused about the hour
llm_translation: Abaye son of Avin and Rabbi Chanina son of Avin both said: Anyone who does not pray with the stillness of the sun. As Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: It is a mitzvah to pray with the stillness of the sun. And Rabbi Zeira said: What is the verse? "Let them fear You with the sun and before the moon, generation to generation." He should recite the evening prayer at sunset, for perhaps his time will be accepted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר הַמְהַלֵּךְ בִּמְקוֹם סַכָּנָה מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה וְכוּ׳ בְּכָל פָּרָשַׁת הָעִבּוּר: מַאי ״פָּרָשַׁת הָעִבּוּר״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְמַלֵּא עֲלֵיהֶם עֶבְרָה כְּאִשָּׁה עוּבָּרָהּ — יִהְיוּ כׇּל צׇרְכֵיהֶם לְפָנֶיךָ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהֵם עוֹבְרִים עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — יִהְיוּ כׇּל צׇרְכֵיהֶם לְפָנֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who is walking in a place of danger, recites a brief prayer…at parashat ha’ibur . What is parashat ha’ibur ? Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: Even at a time when You are as filled with anger [ evra ], towards them, as a pregnant woman [ ubara ], may all of their needs be before You. Some say Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: Even when they violate [ ovrim ] the commandments of the Torah, may all of their needs be before You.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who walks in a place of danger should pray a brief prayer, etc., in every passage of the crossing. What is "passage of the crossing"? Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva: Even at the time when you are angry with them like a woman with her transgressions, let all their needs be before You. Some say Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva: Even at the time when they transgress matters of Torah, let all their needs be before You.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְהַלֵּךְ בִּמְקוֹם גְּדוּדֵי חַיָּה וְלִסְטִים מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה, וְאֵיזֶה הִיא תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״עֲשֵׂה רְצוֹנְךָ בַּשָּׁמַיִם מִמַּעַל, וְתֵן נַחַת רוּחַ לִירֵאֶיךָ מִתַּחַת, וְהַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ עֲשֵׂה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who walks in a place where there are groups of wild beasts and robbers recites an abbreviated prayer. Which is an abbreviated prayer? Rabbi Eliezer says, “Carry out Your will in the heavens above, and give peace of mind to those who fear You below, and perform that which is good in Your eyes. Blessed are You, Lord, Who listens to prayer.”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who walks in a place of wild animals and bandits should pray a short prayer, and what is considered a short prayer? Rabbi Eliezer says: "Do Your will in heaven above, and grant tranquility to those who fear You below, and may Your good will be done in Your eyes. Blessed are You, Hashem, Who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁמַע שַׁוְעַת עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַעֲשֵׂה מְהֵרָה בַּקָּשָׁתָם, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says Hear the cry of Your nation, Israel, and quickly fulfill their request. Blessed are You, Lord, Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Hear the cry of Your people Israel, and act quickly in their request, blessed are You, Hashem, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁמַע צַעֲקַת עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַעֲשֵׂה מְהֵרָה בַּקָּשָׁתָם, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok says Hear the shout of Your nation, Israel, and quickly fulfill their request. Blessed are You, Lord, Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: "Hear the cry of Your people Israel, and act quickly in their request, blessed are You, Hashem, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: ״צׇרְכֵי עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל מְרוּבִּין וְדַעְתָּם קְצָרָה. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתִּתֵּן לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד כְּדֵי פַרְנָסָתוֹ, וּלְכׇל גְּוִיָּה וּגְוִיָּה דֵּי מַחְסוֹרָהּ, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Aḥerim say The needs of Your nation, Israel, are many and their intelligence is limited, may it be Your will, Lord our God, to provide each and every one with his necessary sustenance, and to each and every body all that it lacks. Blessed are You, Lord, Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: Others say: "The needs of Your people Israel are many, and their knowledge is limited. May it be Your will, Lord our God, to provide each and every one with their livelihood, and for each and every nation their necessary sustenance. Blessed are You, Lord, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כַּאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: The halakha is in accordance with Aḥerim .
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The halakha is like Acherim.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה אֲחוּהּ דְּרַב סַלָּא חֲסִידָא: לָא תִּרְתַּח וְלָא תִּחְטֵי. לָא תִּרְוֵי וְלָא תִּחְטֵי. וּכְשֶׁאַתָּה יוֹצֵא לַדֶּרֶךְ, הִמָּלֵךְ בְּקוֹנְךָ וָצֵא. מַאי הִמָּלֵךְ בְּקוֹנְךָ וָצֵא? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זוֹ תְּפִלַּת הַדֶּרֶךְ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל הַיּוֹצֵא לַדֶּרֶךְ צָרִיךְ לְהִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלַּת הַדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Elijah said to Rav Yehuda brother of Rav Sala Ḥasida: Do not get angry and you will not sin. Do not get drunk and you will not sin. And when you set out on a journey, consult with your Creator, and set out. The Gemara asks: What  Consult with your Creator, and  set out?  Rav Ḥisda said: That is the traveler’s prayer. And Rabbi Ya’akov said Rav Ḥisda said: anyone who sets out on a journey must recite the traveler’s prayer
llm_translation: He said to him, Elijah to Rav Yehuda, the brother of Rav Sala the Hasid: Do not be afraid and do not sin. Do not be afraid and do not sin. And when you go out on the road, pray to your Creator and go out. What is "pray to your Creator and go out"? Rabbi Yaakov said in the name of Rav Chisda: This is the traveler's prayer. And Rabbi Yaakov said in the name of Rav Chisda: Anyone who goes out on the road must say the traveler's prayer.

hebrew_text: מַאי תְּפִלַּת הַדֶּרֶךְ? ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהַי, שֶׁתּוֹלִיכֵנִי לְשָׁלוֹם, וְתַצְעִידֵנִי לְשָׁלוֹם, וְתִסְמְכֵנִי לְשָׁלוֹם, וְתַצִּילֵנִי מִכַּף כׇּל אוֹיֵב וְאוֹרֵב בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְתִשְׁלַח בְּרָכָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂי יָדַי, וְתִתְּנֵנִי לְחֵן לְחֶסֶד וּלְרַחֲמִים בְּעֵינֶיךָ וּבְעֵינֵי כׇּל רוֹאַי, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: What is the traveler’s prayer? May it be Your will, Lord my God, to lead me to peace, direct my steps to peace, and guide me to peace, and rescue me from the hands of any enemy or ambush along the way, and send blessing to the work of my hands, and let me find grace, kindness, and compassion in Your eyes and in the eyes of all who see me. Blessed are You, Lord, Who hears prayer.
llm_translation: What is the prayer of the way? "May it be Your will, Lord my God, to lead me toward peace, and direct my steps toward peace, and support me in peace, and deliver me from the hand of every enemy and ambush on the way, and send blessing in my handiwork, and grant me grace, kindness, and mercy in Your eyes and in the eyes of all who see me. Blessed are You, Lord, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם
human_translation: Abaye said: At all times
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Forever.

hebrew_text: לִישַׁתֵּף אִינָשׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ בַּהֲדֵי צִבּוּרָא. הֵיכִי נֵימָא? — ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתּוֹלִיכֵנוּ לְשָׁלוֹם״ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: a person should associate himself with the congregation How should he say May it be Your will, Lord our God, that You lead us to peace, etc.,
llm_translation: One should join himself with the community. How should this be said? "May it be Your will, Lord our God, to lead us to peace" etc.

hebrew_text: אִימַּת מְצַלֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁמְּהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: עַד פַּרְסָה. וְהֵיכִי מְצַלֵּי לַהּ? רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: מְעוּמָּד. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מְהַלֵּךְ.
human_translation: When does one pray? Rabbi Ya’akov said Rav Ḥisda said: From when one sets out on his journey, How long Rabbi Ya’akov said Rav Ḥisda said: At least a parasang. How does he recite Rav Ḥisda said: standing Rav Sheshet said: Even walking
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When does one recite the Shema in the evening? Rabbi Yaakov said in the name of Rav Chisda: From the time one sets out on the road. Until when? Rabbi Yaakov said in the name of Rav Chisda: Until a distance of one Parsah. And how does one recite it? Rav Chisda said: Standing. Rav Sheshet said: Even while walking.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא, קָם רַב חִסְדָּא וְקָא מְצַלֵּי. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: מַאי קָא עָבֵיד רַב חִסְדָּא? אָמַר לֵיהּ קָאֵי וּמְצַלֵּי. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אוֹקְמַן נָמֵי לְדִידִי וַאֲצַלֵּי, ״מֵהֱיוֹת טוֹב אַל תִּקָּרֵא רַע״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rav Sheshet were walking along the path, Rav Ḥisda stood and recited Rav Sheshet asked his servant: What is Rav Ḥisda doing said to him: He is standing and praying. said to Stand me up as well and I will pray. From being good, do not be called wicked.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rav Sheshet were walking on the road, Rav Ḥisda got up and prayed. Rav Sheshet said to him: What is Rav Ḥisda doing? He stands and prays. He said to him: Let him stand and pray, "Do not call evil good."

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין ״הֲבִינֵנוּ״ לִתְפִלָּה קְצָרָה? ״הֲבִינֵנוּ״ בָּעֵי לְצַלּוֹיֵי שָׁלֹשׁ קַמָּיָיתָא וְשָׁלֹשׁ בָּתְרָיָיתָא, וְכִי מָטֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ לָא בָּעֵי לְמֶהְדַּר לְצַלּוֹיֵי, בִּתְפִלָּה קְצָרָה, לָא בָּעֵי לְצַלּוֹיֵי לָא שָׁלֹשׁ קַמָּיָיתָא וְלָא שָׁלֹשׁ בָּתְרָיָיתָא, וְכִי מָטֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ בָּעֵי לְמֶהְדַּר לְצַלּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: What is Grant us understanding and the brief prayer Grant us understanding is required to recite the first three and the last three and when he reaches his home, he need not pray again. the brief prayer, need recite neither the first three nor the last three However, when he reaches his home, he must pray again.
llm_translation: What is the difference between "Havinenu" and a short prayer? "Havinenu" requires three before and three after, and when one goes home, he does not need to beautify the conclusion with a short prayer. A short prayer does not require three before or three after, and when one goes home, he needs to beautify the conclusion with a short prayer.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: ״הֲבִינֵנוּ״, מְעוּמָּד, תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה, בֵּין מְעוּמָּד בֵּין מְהַלֵּךְ.
human_translation: The halakha is: Grant us understanding, standing. The brief prayer, whether standing or whether walking.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Vehilchata: 'Havinenhu', me'umad, tefilah ketzarah, bein me'umad bein mehalech."

hebrew_text: הָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַחֲמוֹר וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַחֲמוֹר וְהִגִּיעַ זְמַן תְּפִלָּה, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ מִי שֶׁיֹּאחַז אֶת חֲמוֹרוֹ — יֵרֵד לְמַטָּה וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם לָאו — יֵשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יֵשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין דַּעְתּוֹ מְיוּשֶּׁבֶת עָלָיו.
human_translation: One who was riding on a donkey The Sages taught One who was riding on a donkey and the time for prayer arrived, if he has someone to hold the donkey, he should dismount and pray. If not, he should sit in his place and pray. Rabbi says: In any case, he should sit in his place and pray, as his mind will not be calm.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: He was riding on the donkey, etc. The Rabbis taught: If one was riding on a donkey and the time for prayer arrived, if he has someone to hold his donkey, he should dismount and pray; and if not, he should remain in his place and pray. Rabbi says: In either case, he should remain in his place and pray, because his mind is not settled upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Rava, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is according to Rabbi.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹמֵא וּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְכַוֵּין אֶת הָרוּחוֹת — יְכַוֵּין לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד אָבִיו שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְפַּלְלוּ אֶל ה׳״.
human_translation: The Sages taught A blind person and one who is unable to approximate the directions may focus his heart towards his Father in Heaven, as it is stated: “And they shall pray to the Lord”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who is blind and unable to direct the winds - should direct his heart towards his Father in Heaven, as it is stated: "And pray to the Lord."

hebrew_text: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְפַּלְלוּ אֵלֶיךָ דֶּרֶךְ אַרְצָם״. הָיָה עוֹמֵד בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְפַּלְלוּ אֶל ה׳ דֶּרֶךְ הָעִיר אֲשֶׁר בָּחַרְתָּ״. הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְפַּלְלוּ אֶל הַבַּיִת הַזֶּה״. הָיָה עוֹמֵד בְּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְפַּלְלוּ אֶל הַמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״. הָיָה עוֹמֵד בְּבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית הַכַּפּוֹרֶת. הָיָה עוֹמֵד אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכַּפּוֹרֶת — יִרְאֶה עַצְמוֹ כְּאִילּוּ לִפְנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת. נִמְצָא עוֹמֵד בַּמִּזְרָח מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב. בַּמַּעֲרָב מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו לַמִּזְרָח. בַּדָּרוֹם — מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו לַצָּפוֹן. בַּצָּפוֹן — מַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו לַדָּרוֹם. נִמְצְאוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְכַוְּונִין אֶת לִבָּם לְמָקוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: One who was standing in the Diaspora should focus his heart toward Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “And they shall pray to You by way of their land One who was standing in Eretz Yisrael should focus his heart toward Jerusalem, as it is stated: “And they shall pray to the Lord by way of the city that You have chosen” One who was standing in Jerusalem should focus his heart toward the Temple, as it is stated: “And they shall pray toward this house” One who was standing in the Temple should focus his heart toward the Holy of Holies, as it is stated: “And they shall pray toward this place” One who was standing in the Holy of Holies should focus his heart toward the seat of the ark-cover [ kapporet ], One who was standing behind the seat of the ark-cover should visualize himself as if standing before the ark-cover Consequently, standing in the East turns to face west, in the West turns to face east. in the South turns to face north, in the North turns to face south; Consequently, all of Israel focus focusing their hearts toward one place,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one is standing outside the Land of Israel, he should direct his heart towards the Land of Israel, as it is stated: "And they shall pray to You towards the way of their land." If one is standing in the Land of Israel, he should direct his heart towards Jerusalem, as it is stated: "And they shall pray to the Lord towards the way of the city that You have chosen." If one is standing in Jerusalem, he should direct his heart towards the Temple, as it is stated: "And they shall pray towards this house." If one is standing in the Temple, he should direct his heart towards the Holy of Holies, as it is stated: "And they shall pray towards this place." If one is standing in the Holy of Holies, he should direct his heart towards the Ark cover. If one is standing behind the Ark cover, he should consider himself as if he is before the Ark cover. If one is in the east, he should turn his face to the west. In the west, he should turn his face to the east. In the south, he should turn his face to the north. In the north, he should turn his face to the south. Thus, all of Israel are directing their hearts towards one place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אֲבִינָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״כְּמִגְדַּל דָּוִיד צַוָּארֵךְ בָּנוּי לְתַלְפִּיּוֹת״ — תֵּל שֶׁכָּל פִּיּוֹת פּוֹנִים בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin, and some say Rabbi Avina, said: What verse this? “Your neck is like the Tower of David, built with turrets [ talpiyyot ], hill tel ] toward which all mouths piyyot ] turn,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin said, and some say Rabbi Avina: What is the verse? "Your neck is like the tower of David, built with rows of stones" - a mound on which all mouths turn.

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְלֵוִי, כִּי הֲווֹ בָּעוּ לְמִיפַּק לְאוֹרְחָא, הֲווֹ מְקַדְּמִי וּמְצַלִּי, וְכִי הֲוָה מָטֵי זְמַן קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע קָרוּ.
human_translation: When Shmuel’s father and Levi wanted to set out on a journey they would pray early When, the time to recite Shema would arrive, they recited it.
llm_translation: Father of Shmuel and Levi, when they would go out on the road, they would go early and return late, and when the time for reciting the Shema arrived, they would read it.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא. דְּתַנְיָא: הִשְׁכִּים לָצֵאת לַדֶּרֶךְ, מְבִיאִין לוֹ שׁוֹפָר וְתוֹקֵעַ, לוּלָב וּמְנַעְנֵעַ, מְגִילָּה וְקוֹרֵא בָּהּ, וּכְשֶׁיַּגִּיעַ זְמַן קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — קוֹרֵא. הִשְׁכִּים לֵישֵׁב בַּקָּרוֹן אוֹ בִּסְפִינָה — מִתְפַּלֵּל, וּכְשֶׁיַּגִּיעַ זְמַן קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — קוֹרֵא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose In accordance with this tanna , as it was taught One who rose early to set out on path they bring him a shofar and he sounds a lulav and he takes it a megilla, and he reads it and when the time comes to recite Shema , he recites one who rose early to sit in a wagon or in a boat prays, and when the time comes to recite Shema , he recites it.
llm_translation: As whose opinion? Like this Tanna. For it was taught: If one rises early to set out on a journey, they bring him a shofar and he blows, a lulav and he shakes, a scroll of Esther and he reads from it, and when the time for reciting the Shema arrives, he recites it. If one rises early to sit in a wagon or on a boat, he prays, and when the time for reciting the Shema arrives, he recites it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּמִתְפַּלֵּל, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמוֹךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, says: In either case, recite Shema and pray so that he will juxtapose redemption and prayer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Whether this way or that way, one should recite the Shema and pray, in order to connect redemption to prayer.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר תְּפִלָּה מְעוּמָּד עָדִיף, וּמָר סָבַר מִסְמָךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה עָדִיף.
human_translation: Regarding what do they disagree? This Sage, holds prayer standing is preferable. This Sage, holds juxtaposition of redemption and prayer is preferable,
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Master holds that a standing prayer is preferable, and Master holds that linking redemption to prayer is preferable.

hebrew_text: מָרִימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא הֲווֹ מְכַנְּפִי בֵּי עַשְׂרָה בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִגְלָא וּמְצַלּוּ, וַהֲדַר נָפְקִי לְפִרְקָא.
human_translation: Mareimar and Mar Zutra would gather ten on Shabbat of the festival and pray, and set out to deliver their lecture [ pirka ].
llm_translation: Marimar and Mar Zutra were folding the sheets on Shabbat eve, and they went out to the marketplace.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מְצַלֵּי בַּהֲדֵי צִבּוּרָא בְּיָחִיד, מְיוּשָּׁב. כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ, הָדַר וּמְצַלֵּי מְעוּמָּד. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: וְלַעֲבֵיד מָר כְּמָרִימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: טְרִיחָא לִי מִלְּתָא. וְלַעֲבֵיד מָר כַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְלֵוִי! אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן קַשִּׁישֵׁי מִינַּן דְּעָבְדִי הָכִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi would pray with the congregation individually seated, when he would come to his house, he would pray again standing The Sages said to him: The Master should do as Mareimar and Mar Zutra He said to them: It is burdensome to me said to him: The Master should do as Shmuel’s father and Levi He said to them: I have not seen Sages older than us do that,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei would pray with the congregation in private, seated. When he would come home, he would stand and pray. The Rabbis said to him: "Shouldn't the Master act consistently, either sitting or standing?" He said to them: "I find it difficult to do so." They said to him: "Shouldn't the Master act like Marimr and Mar Zutra?" He said to them: "I do not see any elder Rabbis among us who do so."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין תְּפִלַּת הַמּוּסָפִין אֶלָּא בְּחֶבֶר עִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּחֶבֶר עִיר וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּחֶבֶר עִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם חֶבֶר עִיר — יָחִיד פָּטוּר מִתְּפִלַּת הַמּוּסָפִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: The additional prayer is only in a city where there is a quorum of ten [ ḥever ir ]. The Rabbis say: with a ḥever ir or without a ḥever ir. Rabbi Yehuda says in his name, Any place where there is a ḥever ir , an individual is exempt from the additional prayer.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: The additional prayers are only recited in a group. And the Sages say: In a group and even not in a group. Rabbi Yehuda says in his own name: Any place where there is a group - an individual is exempt from the additional prayers.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ יָחִיד שֶׁלֹּא בְּחֶבֶר עִיר, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר פָּטוּר. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda’s is the first tanna . There is between them: an individual who is not in a ḥever ir. first tanna holds individual is exempt And Rabbi Yehuda holds obligated
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yehuda said, that is the first Tanna! There is a difference between them - an individual who is not in a city with a group. The first Tanna holds he is exempt, and Rabbi Yehuda holds he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִימַי לָא מְצַלֵּינָא צְלוֹתָא דְמוּסָפִין בְּיָחִיד
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said Ḥiyya bar Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said to him: You have spoken well, as Shmuel said: In all my days I have never prayed the additional prayer as an individual
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chinena said, Rav Chiya son of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. Rav Chiya son of Avin said to him: You have spoken well, for Shmuel said: "We have never found a shadow of doubt in a solitary individual."

hebrew_text: בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, לְבַר מֵהָהוּא יוֹמָא דַּאֲתָא פּוּלְמוּסָא דְמַלְכָּא לְמָתָא, וְאִטְּרִידוּ רַבָּנַן וְלָא צַלּוֹ, וְצַלִּי לִי בְּיָחִיד, וַהֲוַאי יָחִיד שֶׁלֹּא בְּחֶבֶר עִיר.
human_translation: in Neharde’a, except for the day when the king’s army [ pulmusa ] came to the city, and the Sages were preoccupied and did not pray and I prayed as an individual, and I was an individual not in a prayer quorum.
llm_translation: In Nehardea, on the day that P'ulmusah, the king's officer, came to town, the Rabbis were occupied and did not pray. "Pray for me individually," he said, "and this individual who is not in the company of a city."

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי חֲנִינָא קָרָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוּק קְרֵא קְרָאָיךְ לְבָרָא, דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina Kara, sat before Rabbi Yannai, and he sat and he said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. said to him: Go and read your verses outside, as the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya.
llm_translation: Sitting Rabbi Chanina read before Rabbi Yannai, and he sat and said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. He said to him: Go out and proclaim your call to the Creator, for the halacha is not according to Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי יַנַּאי דְּצַלִּי וַהֲדַר צַלִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: וְדִילְמָא מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא כַּוֵּון דַּעְתֵּיהּ וּלְבַסּוֹף כַּוֵּון דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מַאן גַּבְרָא רַבָּה דְּקָמַסְהֵיד עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I saw Rabbi Yannai, who prayed and then prayed again. Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: Perhaps initially he did not focus his mind and ultimately he focused his mind, said to him: Look at who the great man is who is testifying about him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: I saw Rabbi Yannai who roasted and then roasted again. Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: Perhaps initially his intention was not focused, but ultimately his intention was focused. He said to him: See who is a great man who can testify about him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי אַף עַל גַּב דַּהֲווֹ לְהוּ תְּלֵיסַר בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בִּטְבֶרְיָא לָא הֲווֹ מְצַלּוּ אֶלָּא בֵּינֵי עַמּוּדֵי, הֵיכָא דַּהֲווֹ גָּרְסִי.
human_translation: although there were thirteen synagogues in Tiberias, Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi would only pray between the columns where they studied,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, even though there were thirteen synagogues in Tiberias, they only prayed between the pillars, where they used to learn.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא צַלִּי וַהֲדַר צַלִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי טַעְמָא עָבֵיד מָר הָכִי? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא כַּוֵּון מָר דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: לְעוֹלָם יָמוֹד אָדָם אֶת עַצְמוֹ, אִם יָכוֹל לְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ — יִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם לָאו — אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל. אֶלָּא דְּלָא אַדְכַּר מָר דְּרֵישׁ יַרְחָא.
human_translation: It was stated: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi in the name of Rabbeinu, said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba prayed and prayed again. Rav Zeira said to him: Why did the Master do this? If you say because the Master did not focus his mind didn’t Rabbi Eliezer say: One must always evaluate himself If he is able to focus his heart he should pray, but if not, he should not pray. Rather, my Master did not mention the New Moon
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said in the name of our teacher: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. Rabbi Chiya bar Abba roasted and then roasted again. Rabbi Zeira said to him: What is the reason that the Master does so? If you say it is because the Master did not intend, but Rabbi Eliezer said: A person should always examine himself. If he can direct his heart, let him pray, and if not, let him not pray. Rather, the Master does not remember that the moon is visible.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, בְּעַרְבִית — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ בְּשַׁחֲרִית. בְּשַׁחֲרִית — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ בְּמוּסָפִין. בְּמוּסָפִין — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ בְּמִנְחָה.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught One who erred and did not mention the New Moon in the evening prayer, we do not require him to return because he can recite it in the morning prayer. in the morning prayer, we do not require him to return because he can recite it in the additional prayer. in the additional prayer, we do not require him to return because he can recite it in the afternoon prayer?
llm_translation: And it was taught: If one erred and did not mention Rosh Chodesh in the evening prayer, one does not repeat it, because he can say it in the morning prayer. In the morning prayer, one does not repeat it, because he can say it in the additional prayers. In the additional prayers, one does not repeat it, because he can say it in the Mincha prayer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּצִבּוּר שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: said to him: Wasn’t it stated about that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught in a communal
llm_translation: He said to him: No, it was not stated about it, Rabbi Yochanan said in public they taught.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה יִשְׁהֶה בֵּין תְּפִלָּה לִתְפִלָּה? רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא. חַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְחוֹנֵן דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְחוֹלֵל דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: How long should one wait between prayer and prayer? Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda One said so that his mind will be in a pleading [ titḥonen ], One said: so that his mind will be in a beseeching [ titḥolel ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How long should one wait between one prayer and another? Rav Huna and Rav Hisda. One said: In order that his mind should settle upon it, and one said: In order that his mind should be humbled before it.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר ״כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְחוֹנֵן דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאֶתְחַנַּן אֶל ה׳״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְחוֹלֵל דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְחַל מֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: The one who said: So that his mind will be in a pleading [ titḥonen ], as it is written: “And I pleaded [ va’etḥanan ] before the Lord” And the one who said: So that his mind will be in a beseeching [ titḥolel ] as it is written: “And Moses besought [ vayeḥal ] the Lord”
