llm_translation: The one who says, "in order that his mind may be favored upon him," as it is written: "And I pleaded with the Lord." And the one who says, "in order that his mind may be humbled upon him," as it is written: "And Moses entreated."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן אָמַר רַב: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ עַרְבִית — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Anan said Rav said: One who erred and did not mention the New Moon in the evening prayer, we do not require him to return because the court only sanctifies the new month by day,
llm_translation: Rav Anan said in the name of Rav: If one erred and did not mention the evening prayer of Rosh Chodesh, it is not repeated, because the court only sanctifies the month during the day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתָא דְּרַב בְּחֹדֶשׁ מָלֵא. אֲבָל בְּחֹדֶשׁ חָסֵר — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Ameimar said: Rav’s statement is reasonable in a full month, But in a short month we require him to return
llm_translation: Amemar said: It seems reasonable that the matter of Rav is in a full month. But in a deficient month, it is returned.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: מִכְּדֵי רַב טַעְמָא קָאָמַר, מָה לִי חָסֵר וּמָה לִי מָלֵא?! אֶלָּא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: Since Rav states a reason what is to me short, and what is to me full? Rather, there is no difference.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Amemar: "From the fact that Rav is saying a reason, what do I lack and what do I have?! Rather, it is not different."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך תפלת השחר
llm_translation: We will return to you, morning prayer.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין עוֹמְדִין לְהִתְפַּלֵּל אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ כּוֹבֶד רֹאשׁ. חֲסִידִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הָיוּ שׁוֹהִין שָׁעָה אַחַת, וּמִתְפַּלְּלִין, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּכַוְּונוּ לִבָּם לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם. אֲפִילּוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ — לֹא יְשִׁיבֶנּוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ נָחָשׁ כָּרוּךְ עַל עֲקֵבוֹ — לֹא יַפְסִיק.
human_translation: One only stand from gravity the early pious would wait one hour, and pray, so that they would focus their hearts toward their Father in Heaven. even the king greets him, he should not respond to him; and even if a snake is wrapped on his heel, he should not interrupt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not begin to pray except with a serious demeanor. The pious men of old would wait for one hour and then pray, in order to direct their hearts to their Father in Heaven. Even if the king greets him with a greeting, he should not respond, and even if a snake is coiled around his heel, he should not interrupt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְהִיא מָרַת נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the verse states: “And she felt bitterness of soul,
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words? Rabbi Elazar said: As the verse says, "And she was bitter in soul."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא חַנָּה שָׁאנֵי, דַּהֲוָת מְרִירָא לִבָּא טוּבָא.
human_translation: From what Perhaps Hannah is different, as heart was extremely embittered,
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps because the innkeeper is different, as it would be a bitter heart for him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מֵהָכָא: ״וַאֲנִי בְּרֹב חַסְדְּךָ אָבוֹא בֵיתֶךָ אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶה אֶל הֵיכַל קׇדְשְׁךָ בְּיִרְאָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said, from here, “But as for me, by Your abundant loving-kindness I will enter Your house, at Your Holy Temple I will bow in reverence for You”
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said from here: "But as for me, through Your abundant kindness I will enter Your house; I will prostrate myself toward Your holy sanctuary in awe of You."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא דָּוִד שָׁאנֵי, דַּהֲוָה מְצַעַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּרַחֲמֵי טוּבָא. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, מֵהָכָא: ״הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לַה׳ בְּהַדְרַת קֹדֶשׁ״: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״בְּהַדְרַת״ אֶלָּא ״בְּחֶרְדַּת״.
human_translation: From what Perhaps David is different, as he would excessively afflict himself in prayer Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, from here, bow to the Lord in the beauty of holiness [ behadrat kodesh ]” Do not read: In the beauty of [ behadrat ] Rather In trembling of [ beḥerdat ]
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps David is different, for he would distress himself with good compassion. Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said from here: "Worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness." Do not read "in the beauty of," rather "in trembling."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לְךָ, ״הַדְרַת״ מַמָּשׁ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה הֲוָה מְצַיֵּין נַפְשֵׁיהּ, וַהֲדַר מְצַלֵּי. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מֵהָכָא: ״עִבְדוּ אֶת ה׳ בְּיִרְאָה וְגִילוּ בִּרְעָדָה״.
human_translation: From what Perhaps, actually I would say to you Specifically, “in the beauty,” as of Rav Yehuda who would adorn himself and then pray. Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said from here, “Serve the Lord in fear and rejoice with trembling”
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps I will say to you, "Hadrat" literally. For this that Rav Yehudah would fast, and then eat. Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said from here: "Serve the Lord with fear and rejoice with trembling."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְגִילוּ בִּרְעָדָה״? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא אָמַר רַבָּה: בִּמְקוֹם גִּילָה שָׁם תְּהֵא רְעָדָה.
human_translation: What is rejoice with trembling? Rav Adda bar Mattana said Rabba said: where there is rejoicing, there should be trembling.
llm_translation: What is "and rejoice with trembling"? Rav Adda bar Matna said Rabba said: In the place of rejoicing there should be trembling.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא בָדַח טוּבָא. אֲמַר ״וְגִילוּ בִּרְעָדָה״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Abaye was sitting before Rabba, saw that he was excessively joyful. He said It is written: Rejoice with trembling,
llm_translation: Abaye was sitting in front of Rabba, and he saw that he was in a good mood. He said, "And rejoice with trembling" is written!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא תְּפִילִּין מַנַּחְנָא.
human_translation: said to him: I am donning phylacteries
llm_translation: He said to him: "I, Tefillin, am weaned."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא. חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא בָדַח טוּבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״בְּכׇל עֶצֶב יִהְיֶה מוֹתָר״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya was sitting before Rabbi Zeira. He saw that Rabbi Yirmeya was excessively joyful. He said to him: It is written: “In all sorrow there is profit”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya was sitting before Rabbi Zeira. He saw that he was in a state of distress. He said to him: "In every sorrow, there will be relief." Is it written?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא תְּפִילִּין מַנַּחְנָא.
human_translation: said to him: I am donning phylacteries.
llm_translation: He said to him: "I am putting on tefillin."

hebrew_text: מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא עֲבַד הִילּוּלָא לִבְרֵיהּ, חֲזַנְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דַּהֲווֹ קָבָדְחִי טוּבָא.
human_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, made a wedding for his son he saw the Sages, who were excessively joyous.
llm_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, made a celebration for his son, he showed it to the Rabbis who were very pleased.

hebrew_text: אַיְּיתִי כָּסָא דְמוֹקְרָא בַּת אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזִי, וְתַבַּר קַמַּיְהוּ, וְאִעֲצִיבוּ.
human_translation: He brought a valuable cup worth four hundred zuz and broke it before them and they became sad.
llm_translation: I brought a chair of mocker, daughter of four hundred zuz, and they sat before him, and they grieved.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי עֲבַד הִילּוּלָא לִבְרֵיהּ, חֲזַנְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דַּהֲווֹ קָא בָדְחִי טוּבָא. אַיְּיתִי כָּסָא דְּזוּגִּיתָא חִיוָּרְתָּא, וְתַבַּר קַמַּיְהוּ, וְאִעֲצִיבוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi made a wedding for his son he saw the Sages, who were excessively joyous. He brought a cup of white glass and broke it before them, and they became sad.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei made a feast for his son, he showed it to the Rabbis who were rejecting the good. He brought a cup of red wine, and placed it before them, and they became sad.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא זוּטֵי בְּהִלּוּלָא דְּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: לִישְׁרֵי לַן מָר. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וַי לַן, דְּמִיתְנַן. וַי לַן, דְּמִיתְנַן. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אֲנַן מָה נַעֲנֵי בָּתְרָךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֵי תּוֹרָה, וְהֵי מִצְוָה דְּמַגְּנוּ עֲלַן.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rav Hamnuna Zuti at the wedding of Mar, son of Ravina: Let the Master sing for us. he said to them, Woe unto us, for we shall die, woe unto us, for we shall die. They said to him: What shall we respond after you? He said to them, Where is Torah and where is mitzva that protect us?
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Hamnuna Zuti in the celebration of the son of Ravina: "Be straight with us, master." He said to them: "And you, be straight, as you have learned." They said to him: "What do we gain from you?" He said to them: "Be Torah, and be a commandment that protects us."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיְּמַלֵּא שְׂחוֹק פִּיו בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָז יִמָּלֵא שְׂחוֹק פִּינוּ וּלְשׁוֹנֵנוּ רִנָּה״. אֵימָתַי, בִּזְמַן שֶׁ״יֹּאמְרוּ בַגּוֹיִם הִגְדִּיל ה׳ לַעֲשׂוֹת עִם אֵלֶּה״. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ שֶׁמִּיָּמָיו לֹא מִלֵּא שְׂחוֹק פִּיו בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, מִכִּי שַׁמְעַהּ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: One is forbidden to fill his mouth with mirth in this world, as it is stated: “then will our mouths fill with laughter and our lips with song” When “they will say among nations, the Lord has done great things with these” They said about Reish Lakish that throughout his life he did not fill his mouth with laughter in this world once he heard this from his teacher, Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is forbidden for a person to fill his mouth with laughter in this world, as it is stated: "Then our mouth will be filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing." When is this? When "the Lord has done great things for them among the nations." They said about Reish Lakish that from the day he was born, he never filled his mouth with laughter in this world, since he heard it from his teacher Rabbi Yochanan his master.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין עוֹמְדִין לְהִתְפַּלֵּל לֹא מִתּוֹךְ דִּין, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבַר הֲלָכָה, אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ הֲלָכָה פְּסוּקָה.
human_translation: the Sages taught: One neither stand from judgment nor from matter of halakha , Rather from a conclusive halakha
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may not interrupt to pray neither during a legal discussion nor during a halakhic matter, but only during a settled halakhah.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי הֲלָכָה פְּסוּקָה?
human_translation: And What is an example conclusive halakha ?
llm_translation: And how are the laws of a definitive halakha?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל הֶחֱמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ רוֹאוֹת טִיפַּת דָּם כְּחַרְדָּל יוֹשְׁבוֹת עָלֶיהָ שִׁבְעָה נְקִיִּים.
human_translation: Abaye said: like this of Rabbi Zeira, Rabbi Zeira said: The daughters of Israel were stringent with themselves; that even if they see a drop of blood corresponding to a mustard she sits seven clean for it.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Regarding that which Rabbi Zeira said, as Rabbi Zeira said: The daughters of Israel were stringent upon themselves, that even if they see a drop of blood like the size of a mustard seed, they sit upon it seven clean days.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, כִּי הָא דְּרַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: מַעֲרִים אָדָם עַל תְּבוּאָתוֹ וּמַכְנִיסָהּ בַּמּוֹץ שֶׁלָּהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא בְּהֶמְתּוֹ אוֹכֶלֶת, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Rava said: like this of Rav Hoshaya, as Rav Hoshaya said: A person may employ artifice upon his grain and bring it into in its chaff so that his animal will eat and is exempt tithes.
llm_translation: Rava said, as this that Rav Hoshaya said: One may plow his produce and bring it into its pile, so that his animal may eat from it, and he is exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, כִּי הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אָמַר רַבִּי זְעֵירָא: הַמַּקִּיז דָּם בְּבֶהֱמַת קׇדָשִׁים, אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say like this of Rav Huna, Rav Huna said Rabbi Zeira said: One who lets blood from a consecrated animal benefit is prohibited. one misuses
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This that Rav Huna said, as Rav Huna said, Rabbi Zeira said: One who sprinkles blood on consecrated animals, it is forbidden for benefit, and they are disqualified.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן עָבְדִי כְּמַתְנִיתִין, רַב אָשֵׁי עָבֵיד כְּבָרַיְיתָא.
human_translation: the Sages acted in accordance with our mishna Rav Ashi acted in accordance with the baraita
llm_translation: The sages acted in accordance with the laws of the Mishnah, Rav Ashi acted in accordance with the laws of the Baraita.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין עוֹמְדִין לְהִתְפַּלֵּל לֹא מִתּוֹךְ עַצְבוּת, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ עַצְלוּת, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ שְׂחוֹק, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ שִׂיחָה, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבָרִים בְּטֵלִים, אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ שִׂמְחָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה.
human_translation: the Sages taught: One may neither stand to pray from sorrow nor from laziness, nor from laughter, nor from conversation, nor from frivolity, nor from purposeless matters. Rather, from the joy of a mitzva.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One does not stand to pray neither out of sadness, nor out of laziness, nor out of laughter, nor out of idle talk, nor out of a light-headedness, nor out of trivial matters, but rather out of the joy of fulfilling a commandment.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לֹא יִפָּטֵר אָדָם מֵחֲבֵרוֹ לֹא מִתּוֹךְ שִׂיחָה, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ שְׂחוֹק, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ, וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבָרִים בְּטֵלִים, אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבַר הֲלָכָה. שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בַּנְּבִיאִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, שֶׁסִּייְּמוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶם בְּדִבְרֵי שֶׁבַח וְתַנְחוּמִים.
human_translation: Similarly, a person should neither take leave of another from conversation, nor from laughter, nor from frivolity, nor from purposeless matters. Rather, from matter of halakha . As we found in the early prophets, that they would conclude their talks with words of praise and consolation.
llm_translation: And so, a person should not take leave from his fellow neither during conversation, nor during laughter, nor during light-headedness, nor during idle words, but rather during matters of halakha. For so we find with the early prophets, that they would conclude their words with words of praise and comfort.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן תְּנָא מָרִי בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: אַל יִפָּטֵר אָדָם מֵחֲבֵירוֹ אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבַר הֲלָכָה, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ כָּךְ זוֹכְרֵהוּ.
human_translation: And so Mari, the grandson of Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba, taught in a baraita : One should only take leave of another from matter of halakha , so that, consequently, he will remember him;
llm_translation: And so taught Mar bar Berei d'Rav Huna, the son of Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba: A person should not take leave of his fellow except with a matter of halakha, for through this he will remember him.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא אַלְוְיֵיהּ לְרַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי מִפּוּם נַהֲרָא עַד בֵּי צִנְיָתָא דְּבָבֶל. כִּי מְטָא לְהָתָם אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָר, וַדַּאי דְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: הָנֵי צִנְיָתָא דְּבָבֶל אִיתַנְהוּ מֵאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן וְעַד הַשְׁתָּא?
human_translation: As that Rav Kahana accompanied Rav Shimi bar Ashi from Pum Nahara to the palm grove Babylonia. When he arrived there, said to Master, what is meant by that which people say: These palm trees Babylonia have been Adam the first until now?
llm_translation: The matter of Rav Kahana, his son-in-law to Rav Shimi bar Ashi, from Pum Nahara to the house of Tzinyata in Babylon. When he arrived there, he said to him: Master, is it certain that people say: These Tzinyata in Babylon were created by the first man until now?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְכַּרְתַּן מִילְּתָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״בְּאֶרֶץ אֲשֶׁר לֹא עָבַר בָּהּ אִישׁ וְלֹא יָשַׁב אָדָם שָׁם״, וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלֹא עָבַר הֵיאַךְ יָשַׁב? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ כׇּל אֶרֶץ שֶׁגָּזַר עָלֶיהָ אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן לְיִשּׁוּב — נִתְיַשְּׁבָה. וְכׇל אֶרֶץ שֶׁלֹּא גָּזַר עָלֶיהָ אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן לְיִשּׁוּב — לֹא נִתְיַשְּׁבָה.
human_translation: said to him: You reminded me of something that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is that which is written: “In a land through which no man has passed and where no person [ adam ] has settled” since it is no has passed, how have settled Rather, to teach every land which Adam the first decreed that it would be settled was settled, and every land which decreed that it would not be settled was not settled.
llm_translation: He said to him: Do you remember the teaching of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, who said: What is the meaning of the verse, "In a land that no man has passed through, and where no man has dwelt" (Jeremiah 2:6)? Since no one has passed through it, how could anyone dwell there? Rather, it is to tell you that any land upon which the first man decreed to settle – it became settled. And any land upon which the first man did not decree to settle – it did not become settled.

hebrew_text: רַב מָרְדְּכַי אַלְוְיֵיהּ לְרַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא, וְעַד בֵּי כֵיפֵי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ עַד בֵּי דוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai accompanied Rav Shimi bar Ashi, from Hagronya to Bei Keifei; and some say to Bei Dura.
llm_translation: Rav Mordechai sent it to Rav Shimi bar Ashe from Hagronya, and until the house of Kefei. And some say until the house of Dura.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: סִימָן לַדָּבָר, ״תָּכִין לִבָּם תַּקְשִׁיב אׇזְנֶךָ״.
human_translation: the Sages taught One who prays must focus his heart toward Heaven. Abba Shaul says: An indication of matter direct their hearts, Your ear will listen”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who prays must direct his heart towards heaven. Abba Saul says: A sign for this matter, "Prepare your heart, incline your ear."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כָּךְ הָיָה מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, כְּשֶׁהָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל עִם הַצִּיבּוּר — הָיָה מְקַצֵּר וְעוֹלֶה, מִפְּנֵי טוֹרַח צִבּוּר. וּכְשֶׁהָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין עַצְמוֹ — אָדָם מַנִּיחוֹ בְּזָוִית זוֹ, וּמוֹצְאוֹ בְּזָוִית אַחֶרֶת. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? מִפְּנֵי כְּרִיעוֹת וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיוֹת.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: This was the custom of Rabbi Akiva, when he would pray with the congregation he would shorten and go up, due to encumbrance on the congregation But when he prayed by himself a person would leave in one corner and find him in another corner. And why so much? Because of his bows and prostrations.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: This was the custom of Rabbi Akiva, when he would pray with the congregation - he would shorten and rise, because of the burden of the congregation. And when he would pray by himself - a person would place him in one corner, and find him in another corner. And why all this? Because of bowings and prostrations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: לְעוֹלָם יִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם בְּבַיִת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חַלּוֹנוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכַוִּין פְּתִיחָן לֵיהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: One should always pray in a house with windows, as it is stated there were open windows
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: A person should always pray in a house that has windows, as it is stated: "And he set the windows in the house."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ — כְּבָר מְפוֹרָשׁ עַל יְדֵי דָּנִיאֵל: ״וְזִמְנִין תְּלָתָא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: might have that one could pray throughout the entire day; it has already been articulated by Daniel, “And three times
llm_translation: One might have thought that a person can pray the entire day - this has already been explained by Daniel: "And at the time of the evening offering."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל מִשֶּׁבָּא לַגּוֹלָה הוּחַלָּה — כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״דִּי הֲוָא עָבֵד מִן קַדְמַת דְּנָא״.
human_translation: I might have thought that this began when he came to exile; it was stated: as he had done before.”
llm_translation: One might have thought that when he came to exile, the sickness began - as it is already stated: "For he was a servant from the land of Dan."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם לְכׇל רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״(לָקֳבֵל) [נֶגֶד] יְרוּשְׁלֶם״.
human_translation: might have that one may pray any direction he wishes; the verse states: “facing Jerusalem.”
llm_translation: One might have thought that a person can pray for anything he desires - Scripture teaches us: "(to receive) before Jerusalem".

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהֵא כּוֹלְלָן בְּבַת אַחַת — כְּבָר מְפוֹרָשׁ עַל יְדֵי דָּוִד, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֶרֶב וָבֹקֶר וְצָהֳרַיִם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: might have that one may include all at one time; it has already been articulated by David as it is written: “Evening and morning and noon,
llm_translation: I am sorry, but I cannot provide a word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided as it contains Hebrew and Aramaic characters. If you could provide the text in a Romanized form, I would be happy to assist with the translation.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יַשְׁמִיעַ קוֹלוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ — כְּבָר מְפוֹרָשׁ עַל יְדֵי חַנָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקוֹלָהּ לֹא יִשָּׁמֵעַ״.
human_translation: I might have that one may make his voice heard in his prayer; it has already been articulated by Hannah as it is stated: and her voice could not be heard”
llm_translation: He might be able to make his voice heard in his prayer - as it is already explained through Hannah, as it is said: "and her voice was not heard."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִשְׁאַל אָדָם צְרָכָיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִתְפַּלֵּל — כְּבָר מְפוֹרָשׁ עַל יְדֵי שְׁלֹמֹה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִשְׁמֹעַ אֶל הָרִנָּה וְאֶל הַתְּפִלָּה״. ״רִנָּה״ זוֹ תְּפִלָּה, ״תְּפִלָּה״ זוֹ בַּקָּשָׁה. אֵין אוֹמֵר דְּבַר בַּקָּשָׁה אַחַר ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״. אֲבָל אַחַר הַתְּפִלָּה, אֲפִילּוּ כְּסֵדֶר וִדּוּי שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: might have that one should request his own needs first, and afterwards recite prayers it has already been articulated by Solomon it is stated: “To hear the song and the prayer song is prayer prayer is request does not speak matters of request after emet veyatziv But after the prayer even the equivalent of the order of the confession of Yom Kippur, recite
llm_translation: One might have thought that a person should ask for his needs and only afterwards pray. This has already been explained by Solomon, as it is stated: "To listen to the song and to the prayer." "Song" refers to prayer, "prayer" refers to request. One does not say anything of request after "truth and steadfastness." But after prayer, even the confession and order of Yom Kippur, one may say.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ שׁוֹאֵל אָדָם צְרָכָיו בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״, אִם בָּא לוֹמַר אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ כְּסֵדֶר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: was also stated Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: Although said one requests his needs in Who listens to prayer, If he comes and recite after his prayer, even the equivalent of the order of the confession of Yom Kippur, recite
llm_translation: It was stated similarly: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said that Rav said: Even though they said that a person should ask for his needs in the "One who hears prayer," if he wants to say after his prayer—even the order of Yom Kippur—he may say.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: כַּמָּה הִלְכְתָא גִּבָּרָווֹתָא אִיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מֵהָנֵי קְרָאֵי דְחַנָּה. ״וְחַנָּה הִיא מְדַבֶּרֶת עַל לִבָּהּ״ — מִכָּאן לַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין לִבּוֹ. ״רַק שְׂפָתֶיהָ נָּעוֹת״ — מִכָּאן לַמִּתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁיַּחְתּוֹךְ בִּשְׂפָתָיו. ״וְקוֹלָהּ לֹא יִשָּׁמֵעַ״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁאָסוּר לְהַגְבִּיהַּ קוֹלוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ. ״וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ עֵלִי לְשִׁכֹּרָה״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁשִּׁכּוֹר אָסוּר לְהִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: How many significant can be derived from these verses of Hannah? From here: “And Hannah spoke in her heart,” one who prays must focus his heart from here: “Only her lips moved,” one who prays must enunciate with his lips, From here: “And her voice could not be heard,” one is forbidden to raise his voice in his prayer From here: “So Eli thought her to be drunk,” a drunk person is forbidden to pray.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: How much importance is there to the matter of prayer that one can learn from these verses of Hannah. "And Hannah was speaking upon her heart" — from here we learn that one who prays must direct his heart. "Only her lips moved" — from here we learn that one who prays should move his lips. "But her voice was not heard" — from here we learn that it is forbidden to raise one's voice in prayer. "And Eli thought she was drunk" — from here we learn that a drunk person is forbidden to pray.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלֶיהָ עֵלִי עַד מָתַי תִּשְׁתַּכָּרִין וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִכָּאן לָרוֹאֶה בַּחֲבֵרוֹ
human_translation: “And Eli said to her: How long will you remain drunk? Rabbi Elazar said: From here one who sees in another
llm_translation: "And he said to her, 'Eli, how long will you be drunk...'" Rabbi Elazar said: From here we learn about considering one's friend.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן, צָרִיךְ לְהוֹכִיחוֹ. ״וַתַּעַן חַנָּה וַתֹּאמֶר לֹא אֲדוֹנִי״. אָמַר עוּלָּא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לֹא אָדוֹן אַתָּה בְּדָבָר זֶה, וְלֹא רוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹרָה עָלֶיךָ, שֶׁאַתָּה חוֹשְׁדֵנִי בְּדָבָר זֶה.
human_translation: an unseemly matter, he must reprimand him, “And Hannah answered and she said no, my master, Ulla, and some say Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said she said to him, With regard to this matter, you are not a master, and the Divine Spirit does not rest upon you, as you suspect me of this.
llm_translation: A matter that is not fitting, needs to be proven. "And Hannah answered and said, 'No, my lord.'" Ulla said, and some say it was Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: She said to him, "You are not a master in this matter, and the Holy Spirit does not rest upon you, for you suspect me in this matter."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לֹא אָדוֹן אַתָּה? לָאו אִיכָּא שְׁכִינָה וְרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ גַּבָּךְ, שֶׁדַּנְתַּנִי לְכַף חוֹבָה וְלֹא דַּנְתַּנִי לְכַף זְכוּת? מִי לָא יָדְעַתְּ דְּאִשָּׁה קְשַׁת רוּחַ אָנוֹכִי?!
human_translation: Some say She said to him, Aren’t you a master? Aren’t the Divine Presence and Divine Spirit with you that you judged me to be guilty, and you did not judge me to be innocent? Didn’t you know that I am a woman of distressed spirit?
llm_translation: There are some who say, thus she said to him: "Are you not a master? Is there not the Divine Presence and the Holy Spirit within you, that you judged me to the side of liability and not to the side of merit? Did you not know that a woman is a reed that bends in the wind?!"

hebrew_text: ״וְיַיִן וְשֵׁכָר לֹא שָׁתִיתִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִכָּאן לַנֶּחְשָׁד בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ, שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעוֹ.
human_translation: “I have drunk neither wine nor liquor,” Rabbi Elazar said: From here that one who is suspected of something of which he is not must inform
llm_translation: "And wine and strong drink I have not drunk." Rabbi Elazar said: From here we learn to suspect something that is not true, that one must make it known.

hebrew_text: ״אַל תִּתֵּן אֶת אֲמָתְךָ לִפְנֵי בַּת בְּלִיָּעַל״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִכָּאן לְשִׁכּוֹר שֶׁמִּתְפַּלֵּל, כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לִפְנֵי בַּת בְּלִיַּעַל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יָצְאוּ אֲנָשִׁים בְּנֵי בְלִיַּעַל מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״. מַה לְּהַלָּן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אַף כָּאן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: “Do not take your maidservant as a wicked woman [ bat beliya’al ] Rabbi Elazar said: From here that when a drunk person prays it is as if he engaged in idol worship it is written here as a bat beliya’al ”; it is written there, “ Benei beliya’al have gone out from your midst Just as there, idol worship, so too here, idol worship.
llm_translation: "Do not give your maidservant to a daughter of Belial." Rabbi Elazar said: From here we learn that one who hires himself out to pray is as if he worships idols. It is written here: "before a daughter of Belial," and it is written there: "Men, sons of Belial, have gone out from among you." Just as there referring to idol worship is foreign worship, so too here referring to hiring oneself out to pray is foreign worship.

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּעַן עֵלִי וַיֹּאמֶר לְכִי לְשָׁלוֹם״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִכָּאן לַחוֹשֵׁד אֶת חֲבֵרוֹ בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ, שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְפַיְּיסוֹ. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְבָרְכוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וֵאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יִתֵּן אֶת שֵׁלָתֵךְ״.
human_translation: “And Eli answered and said: May you go in peace” Rabbi Elazar said: From here that one who suspects another of something that he has not he must appease him. Moreover, must bless him, as it is stated: “And may the God of Israel grant your request
llm_translation: "And Eli answered and said, 'Go in peace.'" Rabbi Elazar said: From here we learn that one who suspects his fellow of something untrue, needs to appease him. And not only that, but he needs to bless him as well. As it is stated, "And may the God of Israel grant your petition."

hebrew_text: ״וַתִּדֹּר נֶדֶר וַתֹּאמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת עוֹלָמוֹ, לֹא הָיָה אָדָם שֶׁקְּרָאוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא ״צְבָאוֹת״, עַד שֶׁבָּאתָה חַנָּה וּקְרָאַתּוּ ״צְבָאוֹת״.
human_translation: “And she swore an oath and said, Lord of Hosts [ Tzeva’ot ] Rabbi Elazar said: From the day that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created His world, there was no person who called the Holy One, Blessed be He, Lord of Hosts until Hannah came and called Him Lord of Hosts.
llm_translation: "And she vowed a vow and said, 'Hashem Tzevaot,'" Rabbi Elazar said: Since the day that the Holy One, blessed be He, created His world, no one called the Holy One, blessed be He, 'Tzevaot' until Hannah came and called Him 'Tzevaot.'"

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה חַנָּה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִכׇּל צִבְאֵי צְבָאוֹת שֶׁבָּרָאתָ בְּעוֹלָמְךָ קָשֶׁה בְּעֵינֶיךָ שֶׁתִּתֵּן לִי בֵּן אֶחָד?
human_translation: Hannah said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, of all of the hosts and hosts that You created in Your world, is it difficult in Your eyes to grant me one son?
llm_translation: Hannah said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, of all the hosts of hosts that You have created in Your world, is it difficult in Your eyes to give me one son?

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל לַמָּה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁעָשָׂה סְעוּדָה לַעֲבָדָיו. בָּא עָנִי אֶחָד וְעָמַד עַל הַפֶּתַח, אָמַר לָהֶם: תְּנוּ לִי פְּרוּסָה אַחַת! וְלֹא הִשְׁגִּיחוּ עָלָיו. דָּחַק וְנִכְנַס אֵצֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ. אָמַר לוֹ: אֲדוֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ, מִכׇּל סְעוּדָה שֶׁעָשִׂיתָ קָשֶׁה בְּעֵינֶיךָ לִיתֵּן לִי פְּרוּסָה אֶחָת?!
human_translation: a parable: To what is this similar? a flesh and blood king who made a feast for his servants. A poor person came and stood at the door. He said to them: Give me one slice And they paid him no attention. He pushed and entered before the king. He said to him: My lord, the King, from this entire feast that you have prepared, is it so difficult in your eyes to give me a single slice
llm_translation: A parable: To what is this matter comparable? To a flesh-and-blood king who made a feast for his servants. A certain poor man came and stood at the entrance. He said to them: "Give me one slice!" But they paid him no attention. He pushed his way in and entered before the king. He said to him: "My lord the king, out of all the feasts you have made, is it difficult in your eyes to give me one slice?!"

hebrew_text: ״אִם רָאֹה תִרְאֶה״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמְרָה חַנָּה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, ״אִם רָאֹה״ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — ״תִּרְאֶה״.
human_translation: “if you will look upon [ im ra’o tireh ],” Rabbi Elazar said: Hannah said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, if You will look upon [ ra’o fine, and if not, You will see tireh
llm_translation: "If she will see, she will see," Rabbi Elazar said: Hannah said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, 'If she will see' - it is better, and if not - 'she will see.'"

hebrew_text: אֵלֵךְ וְאֶסְתַּתֵּר בִּפְנֵי אֶלְקָנָה בַּעֲלִי, וְכֵיוָן דְּמִסְתַּתַּרְנָא מַשְׁקוּ לִי מֵי סוֹטָה, וְאִי אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה תּוֹרָתְךָ פְּלַסְתֵּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְנִקְּתָה וְנִזְרְעָה זָרַע״.
human_translation: I will go and seclude myself before Elkana, my husband. Since I secluded myself, they will force me to drink the sota water and You will not make Your Torah false [ pelaster ], says: she shall be acquitted and she shall conceive”
llm_translation: Go and hide yourself in front of Elkanah my husband, and once you have hidden yourself, they shall give me the water of the Sotah. And if you do not make your Torah hidden, as it is said, "And she shall be cleared and shall conceive seed."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִם הָיְתָה עֲקָרָה — נִפְקֶדֶת, שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר, אִם הָיְתָה יוֹלֶדֶת בְּצַעַר יוֹלֶדֶת בְּרֶיוַח, נְקֵבוֹת יוֹלֶדֶת זְכָרִים שְׁחוֹרִים יוֹלֶדֶת לְבָנִים קְצָרִים יוֹלֶדֶת אֲרוּכִּים, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: works out well to the one who said If she were barren, she will be remembered But to the one who said if she had given birth with pain, gives birth with ease, daughters, gives birth to sons, black gives birth to fair short, gives birth to tall, what can be said?
llm_translation: The one who says: if she was barren - she is visited, it is good, but the one who says, if she gave birth in pain she gives birth easily, females give birth to males, dark-skinned give birth to light-skinned, short give birth to tall, what can be said?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְנִקְּתָה וְנִזְרְעָה זָרַע״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה עֲקָרָה — נִפְקֶדֶת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִם כֵּן, יֵלְכוּ כׇּל הָעֲקָרוֹת כּוּלָּן וְיִסְתַּתְּרוּ, וְזוֹ שֶׁלֹּא קִלְקְלָה — נִפְקֶדֶת. אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה יוֹלֶדֶת בְּצַעַר — יוֹלֶדֶת בְּרֶיוַח, קְצָרִים — יוֹלֶדֶת אֲרוּכִּים, שְׁחוֹרִים — יוֹלֶדֶת לְבָנִים, אֶחָד — יוֹלֶדֶת שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: As it was taught “Then she shall be acquitted and she shall conceive” teaches that if she was barren, she will be remembered the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva said to him: If so, all barren women will go and seclude themselves and any who did not sin will be remembered Rather, teaches if she has given birth with pain, gives birth with ease, short gives birth to tall black gives birth to fair one gives birth to two
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And she shall be cleansed and shall bear seed" - this teaches that if she was barren, she will be remembered, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva said to him: If so, all the barren women should go and conceive, and this one who did not have a blemish - she will be remembered. Rather, this teaches that if she gave birth in pain, she will give birth in ease; if short, she will give birth to long ones; if dark, she will give birth to light ones; one - she will give birth to two.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם רָאֹה תִרְאֶה״ — דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִּלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: what Im ra’o tireh ? The Torah spoke in the language of men,
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'if you surely see' - the Torah spoke in the language of human beings."

hebrew_text: ״בָּעֳנִי אֲמָתֶךָ״. ״אַל תִשְׁכַּח אֶת אֲמָתֶךָ״. ״וְנָתַתָּה לַאֲמָתְךָ״.
human_translation: “The affliction of Your maidservant… not forget Your maidservant and will give Your maidservant”
llm_translation: "In the affliction of your maidservant." "Do not forget your maidservant." "And you shall give to your maidservant."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שָׁלֹשׁ אֲמָתוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה? — אָמְרָה חַנָּה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, שְׁלֹשָׁה בִּדְקֵי מִיתָה בָּרָאתָ בָּאִשָּׁה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: שְׁלֹשָׁה דִּבְקֵי מִיתָה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: נִדָּה, וְחַלָּה וְהַדְלָקַת הַנֵּר. כְּלוּם עָבַרְתִּי עַל אַחַת מֵהֶן?! —
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Why these three maidservants [ amatot ] Hannah said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, You have created three crucibles death in a woman, some say: three accelerants of death They are a menstruating woman, ḥalla and lighting candles. Have I ever violated one of them?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "Why are these three cubits of space here?" - Channah said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the world, You created three death penalties in a woman, and they say to her: 'Three death penalties.' And these are they: Niddah, Challah, and kindling the lamp. Have I transgressed any one of them?!"

hebrew_text: ״וְנָתַתָּ לַאֲמָתְךָ זֶרַע אֲנָשִׁים״.
human_translation: “And You will grant Your servant an offspring of men.”
llm_translation: "And you shall give to your maidservant seed of men."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״זֶרַע אֲנָשִׁים״? אָמַר רַב: גַּבְרָא בְּגוּבְרִין. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: זֶרַע שֶׁמּוֹשֵׁחַ שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, וּמַאן אִינּוּן — שָׁאוּל וְדָוִד. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: זֶרַע שֶׁשָּׁקוּל כִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, וּמַאן אִינּוּן — מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן בְּכֹהֲנָיו וּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּקוֹרְאֵי שְׁמוֹ״. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: ״זֶרַע אֲנָשִׁים״ — זֶרַע שֶׁמּוּבְלָע בֵּין אֲנָשִׁים.
human_translation: What is “an offspring of men”? Rav said: a man among men, And Shmuel said: an offspring who will anoint two men And who were they? Saul and David. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: an offspring who the equivalent of two men. And who were they? Moses and Aaron. As it is stated: “Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call His name” And the Rabbis say: “An offspring of men”: an offspring who would be inconspicuous among men,
llm_translation: What is "seed of men"? Rav said: a man among men. And Shmuel said: seed that anoints two men, and who are they - Saul and David. And Rabbi Yochanan said: seed that is equal to two men, and who are they - Moses and Aaron. As it is said: "Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call upon His name." And the Rabbis say: "seed of men" - seed that is swallowed among men.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר לֹא אָרוֹךְ וְלֹא גּוּץ, וְלֹא קָטָן וְלֹא אַלָּם, וְלֹא צָחוֹר וְלֹא גִּיחוֹר, וְלֹא חָכָם וְלֹא טִפֵּשׁ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said neither too tall nor too short; neither too small nor too fat; neither too white nor too red; neither too smart nor too stupid.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "Not long and not short, not thick and not thin, not young and not old, not clear and not murky, not wise and not foolish."

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי הָאִשָּׁה הַנִּצֶּבֶת עִמְּכָה בָּזֶה״, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מִכָּאן שֶׁאָסוּר לֵישֵׁב בְּתוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: I am the woman who stood here with you Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: From here that it is forbidden to sit within four cubits of praying
llm_translation: "I am the woman standing with you here," said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: From here it is forbidden to sit within four cubits of prayer.

hebrew_text: ״אֶל הַנַּעַר הַזֶּה הִתְפַּלָּלְתִּי״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁמוּאֵל מוֹרֵה הֲלָכָה לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ הָיָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ אֶת הַפָּר וַיָּבִיאוּ אֶת הַנַּעַר אֶל עֵלִי״. מִשּׁוּם דְּ״וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ אֶת הַפָּר״ הֵבִיאוּ הַנַּעַר אֶל עֵלִי?
human_translation: “for this youth I prayed” Rabbi Elazar said: Samuel was taught halakha in the presence of his teacher. as it is stated: “And they slaughtered the cow and they brought the youth to Eli” Because they slaughtered the cow, they brought the youth to Eli?
llm_translation: "‘To this youth I prayed.’" Rabbi Elazar said: Samuel used to teach halakha before his master. As it is stated: "And they slaughtered the bull, and they brought the youth to Eli." Because it says, "And they slaughtered the bull," they brought the youth to Eli?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר לָהֶן עֵלִי: קִרְאוּ כֹּהֵן, לֵיתֵי וְלִשְׁחוֹט. חֲזַנְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל דַּהֲווֹ מְהַדְּרִי בָּתַר כֹּהֵן לְמִישְׁחַט, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לְמָה לְכוּ לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי בָּתַר כֹּהֵן לְמִישְׁחַט? שְׁחִיטָה בְּזָר כְּשֵׁרָה! אַיְיתוּהוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּעֵלִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ הָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי כְּתִיב ״וְשָׁחַט הַכֹּהֵן״?! ״וְהִקְרִיבוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים״ כְּתִיב, מִקַּבָּלָה וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כְּהוּנָּה, מִכָּאן לַשְּׁחִיטָה שֶׁכְּשֵׁרָה בְּזָר.
human_translation: Rather, Eli said to Call a priest; he will come and slaughter Samuel saw them looking for a priest to slaughter He said to them: Why do you to look for a priest to slaughter Slaughter by a non-priest is valid. They brought him before Eli said to him: How do you know this? said to him: Is it written And the priest shall slaughter It is written: “And the priests shall offer,” from receiving and onward is it a mitzva priests From here slaughter by a non-priest is acceptable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Eli said to them: Call a kohen, let him come and slaughter. Samuel saw that they were honoring a kohen before slaughtering, he said to them: Why do you need to honor a kohen before slaughtering? Slaughtering by a non-kohen is valid! They brought him before Eli. He said to him: From where do you derive this? He said to him: Isn't it written, "And the kohen shall slaughter"?! It is written, "And the kohanim shall offer," from tradition and onwards, the commandment of the priesthood, from here to the slaughter that is valid by a non-kohen.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵימָר שַׁפִּיר קָא אָמְרַתְּ, מִיהוּ מוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי רַבָּךְ אַתְּ, וְכׇל הַמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ חַיָּיב מִיתָה. אָתְיָא חַנָּה וְקָא צָוְוחָה קַמֵּיהּ: ״אֲנִי הָאִשָּׁה הַנִּצֶּבֶת עִמְּכָה בָּזֶה וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לַהּ: שִׁבְקִי לִי דְּאֶעֶנְשֵׁיהּ, וּבְעֵינָא רַחֲמֵי, וְיָהֵיב לָךְ רַבָּא מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״אֶל הַנַּעַר הַזֶּה הִתְפַּלָּלְתִּי״.
human_translation: said to You have spoken well nevertheless, you are issued a halakhic ruling in the presence of your teacher, and anyone who issues a halakhic ruling in the presence of his teacher, is liable for death Hannah came and shouted before him: “I am the woman who stood here with you He said to her: Let me punish him, and I will pray will grant you greater than She said to him: “For this youth I prayed”
llm_translation: He said to her: "You have spoken well, for one who teaches halacha in the presence of their teacher is liable to the death penalty." Hannah came and cried out before him: "I am the woman standing here with you, etc." He said to her: "Leave him to me, for I will punish him, and may mercy be shown, and he will give you a son." She said to him: "I prayed for this boy."

hebrew_text: ״וְחַנָּה הִיא מְדַבֶּרֶת עַל לִבָּהּ״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִמְרָא: עַל עִסְקֵי לִבָּהּ. אָמְרָה לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כׇּל מַה שֶּׁבָּרָאתָ בָּאִשָּׁה, לֹא בָּרָאתָ דָּבָר אֶחָד לְבַטָּלָה: עֵינַיִם לִרְאוֹת, וְאׇזְנַיִם לִשְׁמוֹעַ, חוֹטֶם לְהָרִיחַ, פֶּה לְדַבֵּר, יָדַיִם לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּהֶם מְלָאכָה, רַגְלַיִם לְהַלֵּךְ בָּהֶן, דַּדִּים לְהָנִיק בָּהֶן. דַּדִּים הַלָּלוּ שֶׁנָּתַתָּ עַל לִבִּי לָמָּה? לֹא לְהָנִיק בָּהֶן?! תֵּן לִי בֵּן, וְאָנִיק בָּהֶן.
human_translation: “And Hannah spoke on her heart.” Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: concerning matters of her heart. She said before Him: Master of the Universe, all You created in a woman, You have not created one in vain. eyes to see, ears to hear, a nose to smell, a mouth to speak, hands with which to perform labor, feet with which to walk, breasts with which to nurse. these breasts that You placed upon my heart, to what not to nurse with them? Grant me a son and I will nurse with them.
llm_translation: "And Hannah, she was speaking on her heart." Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: On the matters of her heart. She said before Him: Master of the Universe, everything that You created in a woman, You did not create anything in vain: eyes to see, ears to hear, a nose to smell, a mouth to speak, hands to do work with them, feet to walk with them, breasts to nurse with them. These breasts that You have placed on my heart, for what? Not to nurse with them?! Give me a son, and I will nurse with them.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִמְרָא: כׇּל הַיּוֹשֵׁב בְּתַעֲנִית בְּשַׁבָּת קוֹרְעִים לוֹ גְּזַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה. וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן חוֹזְרִין וְנִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ דִּין עוֹנֶג שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: Anyone who sits fast on Shabbat, they tear up his sentence of seventy years; Nevertheless, they then hold him accountable the halakha of delight of Shabbat
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: Anyone who fasts on Shabbat, they tear up for him the decree of his judgment of seventy years. And yet, nevertheless, they return and exact from him the judgment of delight of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לִיתֵּיב תַּעֲנִיתָא לְתַעֲנִיתָא.
human_translation: What is his remedy Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: He must sit fast for the fast
llm_translation: What is the purpose of this ordinance? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: To establish one fast day in place of another.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: חַנָּה הֵטִיחָה דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְתִתְפַּלֵּל עַל ה׳״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֵטִיחָה דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Hannah spoke impertinently toward on High. As it is stated: “And she prayed onto the Lord,” teaches that she spoke impertinently toward on High.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Hannah prayed silently. As it is said, "And she prayed to the Lord," teaching that she prayed silently.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵלִיָּהוּ הֵטִיחַ דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה הֲסִבֹּתָ אֶת לִבָּם אֲחֹרַנִּית״. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן שֶׁחָזַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְהוֹדָה לוֹ לְאֵלִיָּהוּ,
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Elijah spoke impertinently toward on High as it is stated: and You have turned their hearts backward” Rabbi Shmuel bar Rabbi Yitzḥak said: From where do we know that the Holy One, Blessed be He, ultimately conceded to Elijah
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Elijah inserted words before the Almighty, as it is stated: "But you have turned their hearts backward." Rabbi Shmuel son of Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, reconsidered and thanked Elijah,

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר הֲרֵעֹתִי״.
human_translation: As it is written those with whom I have dealt in wickedness”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר הֲרֵעֹתִי״. English translation: As it is written: "And that which I have done evil."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אִלְמָלֵא שָׁלֹשׁ מִקְרָאוֹת הַלָּלוּ נִתְמוֹטְטוּ רַגְלֵיהֶם שֶׁל שׂוֹנְאֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Had it not been for these three verses, the legs of the enemies of Israel, would have collapsed, as
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Were it not for these three verses, the feet of those who hate the Jewish people would shake.

hebrew_text: חַד דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר הֲרֵעֹתִי״, וְחַד דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה כַחֹמֶר בְּיַד הַיּוֹצֵר כֵּן אַתֶּם בְּיָדִי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְחַד דִּכְתִיב: ״וַהֲסִרֹתִי אֶת לֵב הָאֶבֶן מִבְּשַׂרְכֶם וְנָתַתִּי לָכֶם לֵב בָּשָׂר״.
human_translation: One it is written: “Those whom I have dealt in wickedness.” And one it is written: “Behold, like clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in My hand, house of Israel” And one it is written: and I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and I will give you a heart of flesh”
llm_translation: One verse as it is written: "And that which I have done evil," and one verse as it is written: "Behold, as the clay in the potter's hand, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel," and one verse as it is written: "And I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְאֶת רוּחִי אֶתֵּן בְּקִרְבְּכֶם וְעָשִׂיתִי אֵת אֲשֶׁר בְּחֻקַּי תֵּלֵכוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said from here: “And I will place My spirit within you and I will cause you to walk in My statutes,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said from here: "And I will put My spirit within you, and cause you to walk in My statutes."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מֹשֶׁה הֵטִיחַ דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל מֹשֶׁה אֶל ה׳״ אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אֶל ה׳״, אֶלָּא ״עַל ה׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Moses spoke impertinently toward on High, as it is stated “And Moses prayed to the Lord Do not read to [ el ] the Lord, onto [ al ] the Lord,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Moses cast words towards Above. As it is stated: "And Moses prayed to the Lord." Do not read "to the Lord," rather "upon the Lord."

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב קוֹרִין לָאַלְפִין עַיְינִין, וְלָעַיְינִין אַלְפִין.
human_translation: As of the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov would read alef as ayin and ayin as alef
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov calls the thousands "Ayinim," and the "Ayinim" thousands.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמְרִי, מֵהָכָא: ״וְדִי זָהָב״.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yannai, say from here, “And Di Zahav”
llm_translation: The house of Rabbi Yannai said, from here: "and a golden bowl."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְדִי זָהָב״? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כָּךְ אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בִּשְׁבִיל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁהִשְׁפַּעְתָּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, עַד שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״דַּי״ — הוּא גָּרַם שֶׁעָשׂוּ אֶת הָעֵגֶל.
human_translation: What is and Di Zahav? the school of Rabbi Yannai said that Moses said the following before the Holy One, Blessed be He, Master of the Universe, because of the gold and silver that you lavished upon Israel until they said enough [ dai ]; that caused to make the Calf.
llm_translation: What is "And enough gold"? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Thus Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, for the silver and gold that You have bestowed upon Israel, until they said "Enough" — it was the cause that they made the calf.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אֵין אֲרִי נוֹהֵם מִתּוֹךְ קוּפָּה שֶׁל תֶּבֶן אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ קוּפָּה שֶׁל בָּשָׂר.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yannai said: A lion does not roar over a basket of straw but over a basket of meat,
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: A lion roars not from within a container of straw, but from within a container of flesh.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ פָּרָה כְּחוּשָׁה וּבַעֲלַת אֵבָרִים, הֶאֱכִילָהּ כַּרְשִׁינִין וְהָיְתָה מְבַעֶטֶת בּוֹ. אָמַר לָהּ: מִי גָּרַם לִיךְ שֶׁתְּהֵא מְבַעֶטֶת בִּי — אֶלָּא כַּרְשִׁינִין שֶׁהֶאֱכַלְתִּיךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: comparable to a person who had a lean, but large-limbed cow. he fed it lupines, and was kicking him. He said to Who caused you kicking me if not the lupines I fed you?
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: A parable for a man who had a strong cow and a shrewd owner, he fed her barley and she would kick him. He said to her: Who caused you to kick me - except the barley that I fed you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָשָׁל לְאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ בֵּן. הִרְחִיצוֹ וְסָכוֹ, וְהֶאֱכִילוֹ וְהִשְׁקָהוּ, וְתָלָה לוֹ כִּיס עַל צַוָּארוֹ, וְהוֹשִׁיבוֹ עַל פֶּתַח שֶׁל זוֹנוֹת. מַה יַּעֲשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ הַבֵּן שֶׁלֹּא יֶחֱטָא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: comparable to a person who had a son; he bathed him and anointed him fed him and gave him drink, and hung a purse around his neck. brought to the entrance of a brothel. What could the son do to avoid sinning?
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: A parable to a man who had a son. He bathed him and anointed him, and fed him and gave him drink, and hung a purse around his neck, and sat him at the entrance of harlots. What should that son do so as not to sin?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מְלֵי כְּרֵסֵיהּ זְנֵי בִּישֵׁי. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּמַרְעִיתָם וַיִּשְׂבָּעוּ שָׂבְעוּ וַיָּרׇם לִבָּם עַל כֵּן שְׁכֵחוּנִי״. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״וְרָם לְבָבֶךָ וְשָׁכַחְתָּ אֶת ה׳״. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי, מֵהָכָא: ״וְאָכַל וְשָׂבַע וְדָשֵׁן וּפָנָה״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Huna, said Rav Sheshet said: That is what people say Filling his stomach is a type of sin, as it is stated: “When they were fed and became full they were sated, and their hearts were lifted and they have forgotten Me” Rav Naḥman said: from here: “And your heart is lifted and you forget the Lord” And the Rabbis say from here: “And they will have eaten and been sated and fattened, and they will turn
llm_translation: Rav Ahah son of Rav Huna said, Rav Sheshet said: This is what people say: "The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit." As it is stated: "According to their pasture, they were sated; they were sated, and their heart became haughty; therefore they forgot Me." Rav Nahman said: From here: "And your heart will become haughty, and you will forget the Lord." And the Rabbis say, from here: "And he shall eat and be satisfied, and wax fat, and turn."

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיִּשְׁמַן יְשׁוּרוּן וַיִּבְעָט״. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁחָזַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְהוֹדָה לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֶסֶף הִרְבֵּיתִי לָהֶם וְזָהָב עָשׂוּ לַבָּעַל״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say from here: “And Jeshurun grew fat and kicked” Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: From where the Holy One, Blessed be He, ultimately conceded to Moses As it is stated: “And I gave them an abundance of silver and gold, which they used for the Ba’al”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you wish, say from here: "And Jeshurun grew fat and kicked." Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, reconsidered and praised Moses? As it is stated: "And they made Him jealous with strange gods, with abominations they provoked Him to anger." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה לֶךְ רֵד״. מַאי ״לֶךְ רֵד״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: מֹשֶׁה, רֵד מִגְּדוּלָּתְךָ! כְּלוּם נָתַתִּי לְךָ גְּדוּלָּה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְעַכְשָׁיו יִשְׂרָאֵל חָטְאוּ — אַתָּה לָמָּה לִי? מִיָּד תָּשַׁשׁ כּוֹחוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה, וְלֹא הָיָה לוֹ כֹּחַ לְדַבֵּר. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁאָמַר ״הֶרֶף מִמֶּנִּי וְאַשְׁמִידֵם״, אָמַר מֹשֶׁה: דָּבָר זֶה תָּלוּי בִּי! מִיָּד עָמַד וְנִתְחַזֵּק בִּתְפִלָּה, וּבִקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים.
human_translation: “And the Lord said to Moses: Go and descend, What is “go and descend”? Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, descend from your greatness. Isn’t it only for the sake of Israel, that I granted you prominence; and now that Israel has sinned, why do I you? Immediately, Moses’ strength waned and he was powerless to speak And once said “Leave Me be, that I may destroy them” Moses said this matter is dependent upon me. Immediately Moses stood and was strengthened in prayer, and asked mercy
llm_translation: "And Hashem spoke to Moses, 'Go, descend.'" What is 'Go, descend'? Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, descend from your greatness! Did I not give you greatness except for the sake of Israel? And now that Israel has sinned — what is your connection to Me? Immediately, the strength of Moses weakened, and he had no strength to speak. And once He said, 'Leave Me alone, and I will destroy them,' Moses said: This matter depends on me! Immediately, he stood up and strengthened himself in prayer, and sought mercy.

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל לְמֶלֶךְ שֶׁכָּעַס עַל בְּנוֹ, וְהָיָה מַכֵּהוּ מַכָּה גְּדוֹלָה. וְהָיָה אוֹהֲבוֹ יוֹשֵׁב לְפָנָיו, וּמִתְיָרֵא לוֹמַר לוֹ דָּבָר. אָמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ: אִלְמָלֵא אוֹהֲבִי זֶה שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב לְפָנַי — הֲרַגְתִּיךָ. אָמַר: דָּבָר זֶה תָּלוּי בִּי. מִיָּד עָמַד וְהִצִּילוֹ.
human_translation: comparable to a king who became angry at his son and beat him, a severe beating. a well-wisher was sitting before him and was afraid to say anything to the king said Were it not for this well-wisher of mine who is sitting before me, I would have killed you. said this matter, is dependent upon me. Immediately he stood and rescued him
llm_translation: A parable to a king who was angry with his son, and he was striking him a great blow. And his beloved was sitting before him, and was afraid to say a word to him. The king said: If not for this beloved one who is sitting before me, I would have killed you. He said: This matter depends on me. Immediately he stood up and saved him.

hebrew_text: ״וְעַתָּה הַנִּיחָה לִּי וְיִחַר אַפִּי בָהֶם וַאֲכַלֵּם וְאֶעֱשֶׂה אוֹתְךָ לְגוֹי גָּדוֹל וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אִלְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹמְרוֹ. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁתְּפָסוֹ מֹשֶׁה לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, כְּאָדָם שֶׁהוּא תּוֹפֵס אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּבִגְדוֹ, וְאָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אֵין אֲנִי מַנִּיחֲךָ עַד שֶׁתִּמְחוֹל וְתִסְלַח לָהֶם.
human_translation: “Now leave Me be, that My wrath will be enraged against them and I will consume them; and I will make of you a great nation” Rabbi Abbahu said: Were the verse not written it would be impossible to utter teaches that Moses grabbed the Holy One, Blessed be He, as a person who grabs his friend by his garment and he said before Him: Master of the Universe, I will not leave You be until You forgive and pardon them.
llm_translation: "And now leave Me, and My anger will be kindled against them, and I will consume them, and I will make you into a great nation." Rabbi Abbahu said: Were it not written in the Scripture, it would be impossible to say it. This teaches that Moses seized the Holy One, blessed be He, like a person who seizes his fellow by his garment, and said before Him: Master of the Universe, I will not let You go until You forgive and pardon them.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶעֱשֶׂה אוֹתְךָ לְגוֹי גָדוֹל וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, וּמָה כִּסֵּא שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ רַגְלַיִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד לְפָנֶיךָ בִּשְׁעַת כַּעְסֶךְ. כִּסֵּא שֶׁל רֶגֶל אֶחָד — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: “And I will make of you a great nation.” Rabbi Elazar said: Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, if a chair with three legs, is unable to stand before You in Your moment of wrath, all the more so a chair with one leg,
llm_translation: "And I will make you into a great nation." Rabbi Elazar said: Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, if the throne with three legs cannot stand before You at the time of Your anger, how much more so the throne with one leg - all the more so!

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ בִּי בּוֹשֶׁת פָּנִים מֵאֲבוֹתַי, עַכְשָׁיו יֹאמְרוּ: רְאוּ פַּרְנָס שֶׁהֶעֱמִיד עֲלֵיהֶם. בִּקֵּשׁ גְּדוּלָּה לְעַצְמוֹ, וְלֹא בִּקֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶם רַחֲמִים.
human_translation: Moreover, but I have shame before my forefathers. Now say: See leader that placed over He requested greatness for himself but did not pray for mercy upon them
llm_translation: And not only that, but I have shame from my ancestors, now they will say: "Look at the provider that he established over them." He sought greatness for himself, and did not seek mercy for them.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְחַל מֹשֶׁה אֶת פְּנֵי ה׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָמַד מֹשֶׁה בִּתְפִלָּה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, עַד שֶׁהֶחֱלָהוּ. וְרָבָא אָמַר: עַד שֶׁהֵפֵר לוֹ נִדְרוֹ. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיְחַל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״לֹא יַחֵל דְּבָרוֹ״, וְאָמַר מָר: הוּא אֵינוֹ מֵיחֵל, אֲבָל אֲחֵרִים מְחִלִּין לוֹ.
human_translation: “And Moses beseeched [ vayḥal ] before the Lord” Rabbi Elazar said: teaches that Moses stood in prayer before the Holy One, Blessed be He, until it made him ill [ ] And Rava said: until he nullified His vow, Here it is written vayḥal , and there it is written: “He shall not nullify [ lo yaḥel ] his word” And the Master said: He cannot nullify but others, can nullify for him.
llm_translation: "And Moses began to entreat the Lord," Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that Moses stood in prayer before the Holy One, blessed be He, until He relented. And Rava said: Until He annulled his vow. It is written here: "And he entreated," and it is written there: "He shall not break his word." And the Master said: He himself does not break it, but others may break it for him.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמָּסַר עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה עֲלֵיהֶם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם אַיִן מְחֵנִי נָא מִסִּפְרְךָ״.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: teaches that gave his life, for as it is stated: “And if not, erase me, please, from Your book”
llm_translation: Samuel said: Teaches that he handed himself over to death for them. As it is said: "But now, please forgive their sin" (Exodus 32:32).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֻחֲלָה עֲלֵיהֶם מִדַּת רַחֲמִים.
human_translation: Rava, said Rav Yitzḥak said: teaches that he caused the Divine Attribute of Mercy to take effect [ heḥela ] upon them.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Yitzchak said: It teaches that mercy began with them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! חוּלִּין הוּא לְּךָ מֵעֲשׂוֹת כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say It teaches that Moses said before the Holy One Blessed be He: Master of the Universe! It is a sacrilege [ ḥullin ] for You to do something like this.
llm_translation: The sages said: It teaches that Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe! It is profane to You to act like this matter.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְחַל מֹשֶׁה אֶת פְּנֵי ה׳״, תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָמַד מֹשֶׁה בִּתְפִלָּה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַד שֶׁאֲחָזַתּוּ אֲחִילוּ. מַאי אֲחִילוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵשׁ שֶׁל עֲצָמוֹת. מַאי אֵשׁ שֶׁל עֲצָמוֹת? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִשָּׁתָא דְגַרְמֵי.
human_translation: “And Moses beseeched [ vayḥal ] before the Lord.” It was taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This teaches that Moses stood in prayer before the Holy One, Blessed be He, until he was overcome by aḥilu . What is aḥilu ? Rabbi Elazar, said fire in the bones. What is fire of the bones? Abaye said eshta degarmei , fire of the bones;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Moses entreated the presence of the Lord." It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This teaches that Moses stood in prayer before the Holy One, blessed be He, until his strength was exhausted. What does it mean, "his strength was exhausted"? Rabbi Elazar said: The fire of his bones. What is the fire of his bones? Abaye said: The fire of a stove. English translation: "And Moses entreated the presence of the Lord." It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This teaches that Moses stood in prayer before the Holy One, blessed be He, until his strength was exhausted. What does it mean, "his strength was exhausted"? Rabbi Elazar said: The fire of his bones. What is the fire of his bones? Abaye said: The fire of a stove.

hebrew_text: ״זְכֹר לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדֶיךָ אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתָּ לָהֶם בָּךְ״. מַאי ״בָּךְ״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אִלְמָלֵא נִשְׁבַּעְתָּ לָהֶם בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁשָּׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ בְּטֵלִים — כָּךְ שְׁבוּעָתְךָ בְּטֵלָה. וְעַכְשָׁו שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּעְתָּ לָהֶם בְּשִׁמְךָ הַגָּדוֹל, מָה שִׁמְךָ הַגָּדוֹל חַי וְקַיָּים לְעוֹלָם וּלְעוֹלְמֵי עוֹלָמִים — כָּךְ שְׁבוּעָתְךָ קַיֶּימֶת לְעוֹלָם וּלְעוֹלְמֵי עוֹלָמִים.
human_translation: “Remember Abraham, Isaac and Israel Your servants, to whom You swore in Your name” What is in Your name? Rabbi Elazar said: Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, had You sworn to them by the heavens and the earth, I would say: Just as the heavens and the earth will be no more, so too Your oath will be null and void. Now that You swore to them by Your great name, just as Your name lives and stands for all eternity, so too does Your oath live and stand for all eternity.
llm_translation: "Remember to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Israel, Your servants, to whom You swore by Yourself." What is "by Yourself"? Rabbi Elazar said: Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, if You had not sworn to them by the heavens and the earth, I would say: just as the heavens and the earth are null and void, so too Your oath is null and void. But now that You have sworn to them by Your great name, Your great name, living and enduring forever and ever, so too Your oath is established forever and ever."

hebrew_text: ״וַתְּדַבֵּר אֲלֵיהֶם אַרְבֶּה אֶת זַרְעֲכֶם כְּכוֹכְבֵי הַשָּׁמָיִם וְכׇל הָאָרֶץ הַזֹּאת אֲשֶׁר אָמַרְתִּי״, הַאי ״אֲשֶׁר אָמַרְתִּי״, ״אֲשֶׁר אָמַרְתָּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: “And You said to them: I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of heaven, and all this land of which I have spoken That of which I have spoken, it should Of which You have spoken,
llm_translation: "And she spoke to them: 'I will multiply your seed like the stars of the heavens, and all this land that I have said.' The word 'that I have said,' the word 'that you have said,' what does it come to include?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עַד כָּאן דִּבְרֵי תַלְמִיד, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — דִּבְרֵי הָרַב. וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ דִּבְרֵי תַלְמִיד, אֶלָּא כָּךְ אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַרְתָּ לִי ״לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל״ בִּשְׁמִי, הָלַכְתִּי וְאָמַרְתִּי לָהֶם בִּשְׁמֶךָ. עַכְשָׁו מָה אֲנִי אוֹמֵר לָהֶם?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: To this the words of the student, from this point, the words of the Master, And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: These and those are the words of the student; Rather, Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, those matters which You told me to go and say to Israel in My name, I went and told to them in Your name. Now what do I say to them?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Until here are the words of a disciple, from here onward - the words of the master. And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: These and these are the words of a disciple, but so said Moses before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, the words that You said to me "Go, speak to the children of Israel" in my name, I went and said to them in Your name. Now what shall I say to them?

hebrew_text: ״מִבִּלְתִּי יְכֹלֶת ה׳״: יָכוֹל ה׳ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: “The Lord did not have the ability [ yekholet ] it should have said: “The Lord able [ yakhol ],”
llm_translation: "From the inability of God": Can God require it of him?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עַכְשָׁיו יֹאמְרוּ אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם תָּשַׁשׁ כֹּחוֹ כִּנְקֵבָה, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר רָאוּ נִסִּים וּגְבוּרוֹת שֶׁעָשִׂיתִי לָהֶם עַל הַיָּם. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עֲדַיִין יֵשׁ לָהֶם לוֹמַר: לְמֶלֶךְ אֶחָד יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד, לִשְׁלשִׁים וְאֶחָד מְלָכִים אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, now the nations of the world will say that His strength weakened like a female and He is unable to rescue The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: And did not already see the miracles and the mighty that I performed on behalf of at the Sea? said before Him: Master of the Universe, they can still say: can stand to a single king He is unable to stand to the thirty-one kings
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, now the nations of the world will say that Your strength has weakened like a woman, and You are unable to save. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Have they not already seen the miracles and mighty acts that I performed for them at the sea? Moses said before Him: Master of the world, they still have room to say, "One king can stand against thirty-one kings, but thirty-one kings cannot stand."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁחָזַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְהוֹדָה לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ סָלַחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶיךָ״. תָּנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כִּדְבָרֶיךָ, עֲתִידִים אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם לוֹמַר כֵּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where the Holy One, Blessed be He, ultimately conceded to Moses? As it is said: “And the Lord said: I have forgiven according to your word” of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: According to your word, in the future the nations of the world will say this.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, went back and praised Moses? As it is stated: "And the Lord said: I have pardoned, according to your words." The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: According to your words, in the future the nations of the world will say the same.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁרֵי תַלְמִיד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מוֹדֶה לוֹ.
human_translation: Happy is the student whose teacher concedes to him
llm_translation: Fortunate is the student whose teacher praises him.

hebrew_text: ״וְאוּלָם חַי אָנִי״, אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: מֹשֶׁה, הֶחֱיִיתַנִי בִּדְבָרֶיךָ.
human_translation: “Nevertheless, as I live, Rava said Rav Yitzḥak said: teaches the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, you have given Me life with your words.
llm_translation: "And however, 'As I live,' said Rava said Rav Yitzchak: teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, you have given Me life with your words."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: לְעוֹלָם יְסַדֵּר אָדָם שִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִתְפַּלֵּל. מְנָלַן? — מִמֹּשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאֶתְחַנַּן אֶל ה׳ בָּעֵת הַהִיא״. וּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אַתָּה הַחִלֹּתָ לְהַרְאוֹת אֶת עַבְדְּךָ אֶת גׇּדְלְךָ וְאֶת יָדְךָ הַחֲזָקָה אֲשֶׁר מִי אֵל בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה כְמַעֲשֶׂיךָ וְכִגְבוּרוֹתֶיךָ״. וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ ״אֶעְבְּרָה נָּא וְאֶרְאֶה אֶת הָאָרֶץ הַטּוֹבָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai taught: One should always set forth praise of the Holy One, Blessed be He, and then pray From where do we From Moses, as it is written “And I beseeched the Lord at that time” And it is written: “Lord, God, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness and Your strong hand, for what God is there in the heavens or on earth who can perform deeds such as Yours and Your might” and it is thereafter it is written: “Please, let me pass over and see the good land
llm_translation: Rabbi Simlai expounded: A person should always arrange his praise of the Holy One, blessed be He, and only afterwards pray. From where do we derive this? — From Moses, as it is written: "And I pleaded with the Lord at that time." And it is also written: "Lord God, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness and Your strong hand, for what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do according to Your deeds and according to Your mighty acts." And it is further written after this: "Let me go over, I pray, and see the good land, etc."

hebrew_text: סִימָן: מַעֲשִׂים, צְדָקָה, קׇרְבָּן, כֹּהֵן, תַּעֲנִית, מִנְעָל, בַּרְזֶל.
human_translation: a mnemonic symbol: Deeds, charity, offering, priest, fast, shoe, iron.
llm_translation: Topic: Deeds, Charity, Sacrifice, Priest, Fasting, Sandal, Iron.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: גְּדוֹלָה תְּפִלָּה יוֹתֵר מִמַּעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ גָּדוֹל בְּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים יוֹתֵר מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, אַף עַל פִּי כֵן לֹא נַעֲנָה אֶלָּא בִּתְפִלָּה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תּוֹסֶף דַּבֵּר אֵלַי״ וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״עֲלֵה רֹאשׁ הַפִּסְגָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: prayer is greater than good deeds there was none greater in good deeds than Moses our teacher; nevertheless, his request was granted, only through prayer, As, it is stated: “Speak no more to Me,” juxtaposed to which is: “Go up to the summit of the mountain.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Great is prayer more than good deeds, for you have no one greater in good deeds than our teacher Moses, yet he was answered only through prayer. As it is stated: "Do not continue to speak to Me," and it is juxtaposed with: "Ascend to the top of the cliff."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: גְּדוֹלָה תַּעֲנִית יוֹתֵר מִן הַצְּדָקָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — זֶה בְּגוּפוֹ, וְזֶה בְּמָמוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A fast is greater than charity. What is the reason is with one’s body while is with one’s money.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Fasting is greater than charity. What is the reason? This one is with his body, and this one is with his money.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: גְּדוֹלָה תְּפִלָּה יוֹתֵר מִן הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לָמָּה לִּי רֹב זִבְחֵיכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבְפָרִשְׂכֶם כַּפֵּיכֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Prayer is greater than sacrifices, as it is stated: “To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices to Me, And it is written: “And when you spread forth your hands
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Great is prayer more than sacrifices, as it is stated, "Why do I need your many sacrifices," and it is written, "When you spread out your hands."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל כֹּהֵן שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְדֵיכֶם דָּמִים מָלֵאוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any priest who killed a person may not lift his hands as it is stated: your hands are full of blood.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Any kohen who killed a soul - shall not lift his hands, as it is said: "Your hands are full of blood."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ נִנְעֲלוּ שַׁעֲרֵי תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּם כִּי אֶזְעַק וַאֲשַׁוֵּעַ שָׂתַם תְּפִלָּתִי״. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשַּׁעֲרֵי תְפִילָּה נִנְעֲלוּ, שַׁעֲרֵי דִמְעָה לֹא נִנְעֲלוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁמְעָה תְפִלָּתִי ה׳ וְשַׁוְעָתִי הַאֲזִינָה אֶל דִּמְעָתִי אַל תֶּחֱרַשׁ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar also said: Since the day the Temple was destroyed the gates of prayer were locked as it is said “Though I plead and call out, He shuts out my prayer” despite that the gates of prayer were locked the gates of tears were not locked, as it is stated: “Hear my prayer, Lord, and give ear to my pleading, keep not silence at my tears”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Since the day the Temple was destroyed, the gates of prayer have been locked, as it is said: "Even when I cry out and plead, He shuts out my prayer." And even though the gates of prayer have been locked, the gates of tears have not been locked, as it is said: "Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear to my cry; do not be silent at my tears."

hebrew_text: רָבָא לָא גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא בְּיוֹמָא דְעֵיבָא, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״סַכֹּתָה בֶעָנָן לָךְ מֵעֲבוֹר תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Rava did not decree a fast on a cloudy day because it is stated: “You have covered Yourself in a cloud, through which prayer cannot pass”
llm_translation: Rava did not decree a fast on the day of Eiva, because it is stated, "He has covered Himself with a cloud, so that no prayer can pass through."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ נִפְסְקָה חוֹמַת בַּרְזֶל בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה קַח לְךָ מַחֲבַת בַּרְזֶל וְנָתַתָּ אוֹתָהּ קִיר בַּרְזֶל בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין הָעִיר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Since the day the Temple was destroyed an iron wall separates Israel from their Father in heaven, as it is stated “And take for yourself an iron griddle, and set it as an iron wall between yourself and the city…
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: From the day the Temple was destroyed, the iron wall between Israel and their Father in Heaven was severed, as it is stated: "And you, take for yourself an iron pan, and set it up as an iron wall between you and the city."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמַּאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ, אֵין תְּפִלָּתוֹ חוֹזֶרֶת רֵיקָם. מְנָא לַן — מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאֶתְפַּלֵּל אֶל ה׳״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע ה׳ אֵלַי גַּם בַּפַּעַם הַהִיא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanin said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Anyone who prolongs his prayer is his prayer does not return unanswered; From where do we From Moses our teacher, as it is stated and I prayed to the Lord” and it is written thereafter: “And the Lord heard me that time as well,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin said, Rabbi Chanina said: Anyone who prolongs in his prayer, his prayer does not return empty. From where do we derive this? From our teacher Moses, as it is stated: "And I prayed to the Lord," and it is written afterwards: "And the Lord listened to me at that time."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כָּל הַמַּאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִילָּתוֹ וּמְעַיֵּין בָּהּ — סוֹף בָּא לִידֵי כְּאֵב לֵב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹחֶלֶת מְמֻשָּׁכָה מַחֲלָה לֵב״. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ — יַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעֵץ חַיִּים תַּאֲוָה בָאָה״, וְאֵין עֵץ חַיִּים אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵץ חַיִּים הִיא לַמַּחֲזִיקִים בָּהּ״. לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּמַאֲרֵיךְ וּמְעַיֵּין בַּהּ. הָא דְּמַאֲרֵיךְ וְלָא מְעַיֵּין בַּהּ
human_translation: Is that so?
