Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who prolongs his prayer and expects it to be answered, will ultimately come to heartache, As it is stated: “Hope deferred makes the heart sick” And what is the remedy engage in Torah as it is stated: “But desire fulfilled is the tree of life” and tree of life is nothing other than Torah, as it is stated: “It is a tree of life to those who hold fast to it, not difficult. This, who prolongs and expects it to be answered; that, one who prolongs his prayer and not expect it to be answered.
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rabbi Chiya bar Abba say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who prolongs his prayer and examines it, in the end it leads to heartache, as it is stated: "A deferred hope makes the heart sick." What is its remedy? Engage in Torah study, as it is stated: "But a desire fulfilled is a tree of life," and the tree of life is nothing but Torah, as it is stated: "It is a tree of life to those who grasp it." There is no difficulty; this one refers to one who prolongs and examines it, while that one refers to one who prolongs but does not examine it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אִם רָאָה אָדָם שֶׁהִתְפַּלֵּל וְלֹא נַעֲנָה — יַחְזוֹר וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קַוֵּה אֶל ה׳ חֲזַק וְיַאֲמֵץ לִבֶּךָ וְקַוֵּה אֶל ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: A person who prayed and saw that he was not answered pray again, as it is stated: “Hope in the Lord, strengthen yourself, let your heart take courage, and hope in the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: If a person saw that he prayed and was not answered, he should pray again. As it is stated: "Hope to the Lord, be strong and let your heart take courage, and hope to the Lord."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעָה צְרִיכִין חִזּוּק, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: תּוֹרָה, וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים, תְּפִלָּה, וְדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ.
human_translation: the Sages taught Four require bolstering, and they are: Torah, good deeds, prayer, and occupation.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Four things require strengthening, and they are: Torah, good deeds, prayer, and a livelihood.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים מִנַּיִן? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַק חֲזַק וֶאֱמַץ מְאֹד לִשְׁמֹר וְלַעֲשׂוֹת כְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה״, ״חֲזַק״ — בַּתּוֹרָה, ״וֶאֱמַץ״ — בְּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים.
human_translation: From where Torah and good deeds As it is stated “Only be strong and be extremely courageous, observe and do all of the Torah Be strong in Torah and be courageous in good deeds.
llm_translation: Torah and good deeds, from where? - as it is stated: "Only be strong and very courageous, to observe and to do according to all the Torah," "be strong" - in Torah, "and very courageous" - in good deeds.

hebrew_text: תְּפִלָּה מִנַּיִן? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״קַוֵּה אֶל ה׳ חֲזַק וְיַאֲמֵץ לִבֶּךָ וְקַוֵּה אֶל ה׳״.
human_translation: From where prayer As it is said: “Hope in the Lord, strengthen yourself, let your heart take courage, and hope in the Lord.”
llm_translation: Prayer, from where? - As it is said, "Wait for the Lord; be strong and let your heart take courage; and wait for the Lord."

hebrew_text: דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ מִנַּיִן? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״חֲזַק וְנִתְחַזַּק בְּעַד עַמֵּנוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where occupation As it is stated: “Be strong and we will be strong for the sake of our nation
llm_translation: The way of the land, from where? - As it is said, "Be strong and let us strengthen ourselves for our people."

hebrew_text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר צִיּוֹן עֲזָבַנִי ה׳ וַה׳ שְׁכֵחָנִי״. הַיְינוּ עֲזוּבָה, הַיְינוּ שְׁכוּחָה? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אָדָם נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ רִאשׁוֹנָה, זוֹכֵר מַעֲשֵׂה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. אַתָּה עֲזַבְתַּנִי וּשְׁכַחְתַּנִי.
human_translation: “But Zion said: The Lord has forsaken me and the Lord has forgotten me. Forsaken is the same as forgotten. Reish Lakish said: The community of Israel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, a man marries wife after his first wife, he recalls the deeds of his first You have forsaken me, forgotten me
llm_translation: "And Zion said, 'The Lord has forsaken me, and the Lord has forgotten me.'" Is forsaken the same as forgotten? Reish Lakish said: The congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, a man marries a woman, he remembers the deeds of the first wife. You have forsaken me and forgotten me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: בִּתִּי, שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מַזָּלוֹת בָּרָאתִי בָּרָקִיעַ, וְעַל כׇּל מַזָּל וּמַזָּל בָּרָאתִי לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים חַיִל, וְעַל כׇּל חַיִל וְחַיִל בָּרָאתִי לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים לִגְיוֹן, וְעַל כׇּל לִגְיוֹן וְלִגְיוֹן בָּרָאתִי לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים רַהֲטוֹן, וְעַל כׇּל רַהֲטוֹן וְרַהֲטוֹן בָּרָאתִי לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים קְרָטוֹן, וְעַל כׇּל קְרָטוֹן וּקְרָטוֹן בָּרָאתִי לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים גַּסְטְרָא, וְעַל כׇּל גַּסְטְרָא וְגַסְטְרָא תָּלִיתִי בּוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אַלְפֵי רִבּוֹא כּוֹכָבִים כְּנֶגֶד יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה. וְכוּלָּן לֹא בָּרָאתִי אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִילֵךְ, וְאַתְּ אָמַרְתְּ ״עֲזַבְתַּנִי״ וּ״שְׁכַחְתַּנִי״?!
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to My daughter, I created twelve constellations in the firmament, and for each and every constellation I have created thirty armies, and for each and every army I have created thirty legions [ ligyon ], and for each and every legion I have created thirty infantry division leaders [ rahaton ], and for each and every infantry division leader I have created thirty military camp leaders [ karton ], and for each and every military camp leader I have created thirty leaders of forts [ gastera ], and on each and every leader of a fort I have hung three hundred and sixty-five thousand stars corresponding to the days of the solar year. And all of them I have created only for your sake; and you said has forsaken me and has forgotten me?
llm_translation: He said to her, the Holy One, blessed be He: My daughter, twelve constellations I created in the firmament, and upon each constellation I created for it thirty armies, and upon each army and army I created for it thirty legions, and upon each legion and legion I created for it thirty cohorts, and upon each cohort and cohort I created for it thirty camps, and upon each camp and camp I created for it thirty companies, and upon each company and company I suspended for it three hundred and sixty-five thousand myriad of stars corresponding to the days of the sun. And all of them I created only for you, and you said, "You have forsaken me" and "You have forgotten me"?!

hebrew_text: ״הֲתִשְׁכַּח אִשָּׁה עוּלָהּ״, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: כְּלוּם אֶשְׁכַּח עוֹלוֹת אֵילִים וּפִטְרֵי רְחָמִים שֶׁהִקְרַבְתְּ לְפָנַי בַּמִּדְבָּר?! אָמְרָה לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין שִׁכְחָה לִפְנֵי כִּסֵּא כְבוֹדֶךָ, שֶׁמָּא לֹא תִּשְׁכַּח לִי מַעֲשֵׂה הָעֵגֶל? אָמַר לָהּ: ״גַּם אֵלֶּה תִשְׁכַּחְנָה״.
human_translation: “Can a woman forget her suckling baby, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said Have I forgotten the ram offerings and firstborn animals that you offered before Me in the desert? replied to Him: Master of the Universe, since there is no forgetfulness before the Throne of Your Glory, perhaps you will not forget my sin of the Golden Calf? responded to “These [ eleh ] too shall be forgotten.” “
llm_translation: "The Holy One, blessed be He, said: 'Can a woman forget her nursing child?' (Isaiah 49:15). You have forgotten the burnt offerings of rams and the sacrifices of mercy that you brought before Me in the wilderness?! She said before Him: 'Master of the Universe, since there is no forgetfulness before Your glorious throne, perhaps You will not forget the incident of the Golden Calf?' He said to her: 'Even these you shall forget.'"

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ שִׁכְחָה לִפְנֵי כִּסֵּא כְבוֹדֶךָ, שֶׁמָּא תִּשְׁכַּח לִי מַעֲשֵׂה סִינַי? אָמַר לָהּ: ״וְאָנֹכִי לֹא אֶשְׁכָּחֵךְ״.
human_translation: said before Him: Master of the Universe, since there is forgetfulness before the Throne of Your Glory, perhaps You will forget the events Sinai? said to I [ anokhi ] will not forget you
llm_translation: She said before Him: Master of the Universe, since there is forgetfulness before Your glorious throne, perhaps You will forget the event of Sinai for me? He said to her: "Yet I will not forget you."

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״גַּם אֵלֶּה תִשְׁכַּחְנָה״ — זֶה מַעֲשֵׂה הָעֵגֶל, ״וְאָנֹכִי לֹא אֶשְׁכָּחֵךְ״ — זֶה מַעֲשֵׂה סִינַי.
human_translation: That Rabbi Elazar said Rav Oshaya said: What is written: “These too will be forgotten”? That is the sin of the Golden Calf. I will not forget you? Those are the events Sinai.
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rav Oshaya: What is the meaning of what is written, "Even these may forget"? - This refers to the incident of the Golden Calf. "Yet I will not forget you" - this refers to the incident at Sinai.

hebrew_text: חֲסִידִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הָיוּ שׁוֹהִין שָׁעָה אַחַת:
human_translation: the early pious would wait one hour
llm_translation: The early Hasidim would sit for one hour.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַשְׁרֵי יוֹשְׁבֵי בֵיתֶךָ״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: the verse states: “Happy are those who dwell in Your House”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei? Amar Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, amar kra: 'Ashrei yoshevei vetecha'." English translation: "What are these words? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, the verse says: 'Happy are those who dwell in Your house'."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ לִשְׁהוֹת שָׁעָה אַחַת אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַךְ צַדִּיקִים יוֹדוּ לִשְׁמֶךָ יֵשְׁבוּ יְשָׁרִים אֶת פָּנֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who prays must wait one hour after his prayer, as it is stated: “Surely the righteous will give thanks unto Your name, the upright will sit before You”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who prays must wait one hour after his prayer, as it is stated: "But the righteous shall give thanks to Your name; the upright shall dwell in Your presence."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם תְּפִלָּתוֹ, וְשָׁעָה אַחַת אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ. קוֹדֶם תְּפִלָּתוֹ, מִנַּיִן? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי יוֹשְׁבֵי בֵיתֶךָ״. לְאַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ מִנַּיִן? — דִּכְתִיב: ״אַךְ צַדִּיקִים יוֹדוּ לִשְׁמֶךָ יֵשְׁבוּ יְשָׁרִים אֶת פָּנֶיךָ״.
human_translation: That was also taught One who prays must wait one hour before his prayer and one hour after his prayer. From where before his prayer? As it is stated: “Happy are those who dwell in Your House.” And from where after his prayer? As it is written: “Surely the righteous will give thanks unto Your name, the upright will sit before You.”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: One who prays should wait for one hour before his prayer, and one hour after his prayer. Before his prayer, from where do we derive this? As it is stated: "Happy are those who dwell in Your house." After his prayer, from where do we derive this? — As it is written: "But the righteous will give thanks to Your name; the upright will dwell in Your presence."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲסִידִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הָיוּ שׁוֹהִין שָׁעָה אַחַת, וּמִתְפַּלְּלִין שָׁעָה אַחַת, וְחוֹזְרִין וְשׁוֹהִין שָׁעָה אַחַת. וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁשּׁוֹהִין תֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת בַּיּוֹם בִּתְפִלָּה, תּוֹרָתָן הֵיאַךְ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, וּמְלַאכְתָּם הֵיאַךְ נַעֲשֵׂית?
human_translation: The Sages taught The early pious would wait one hour, pray one hour, then wait one hour again. Since would spend nine hours per day in prayer how is their Torah preserved? And how was their work accomplished?
llm_translation: The sages taught: The early pious ones would spend one hour in meditation, and pray for one hour, and then spend one hour in meditation again. But since they spend nine hours a day in prayer, how do they maintain their Torah study, and how do they manage their work?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁחֲסִידִים הֵם — תּוֹרָתָם מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, וּמְלַאכְתָּן מִתְבָּרֶכֶת.
human_translation: Rather, because they were pious their Torah is preserved and their work is blessed.
llm_translation: Rather, because they are pious individuals - their Torah is preserved, and their work is blessed.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ לֹא יְשִׁיבֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Even the king greets him he should not respond to him
llm_translation: Even the king inquires about his well-being, he shall not respond.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל לְמַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם — פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: They only taught with regard to kings of Israel, However, with regard to kings of the nations of the world, he interrupts
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, "They only decreed this law for the kings of Israel, but for the kings of the nations of the world, it is concluded."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל וְרָאָה אַנָּס בָּא כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, רָאָה קָרוֹן בָּא כְּנֶגְדּוֹ — לֹא יְהֵא מַפְסִיק, אֶלָּא מְקַצֵּר וְעוֹלֶה!
human_translation: raised an objection One who is praying and saw a violent person, coming toward him, a carriage coming toward him he should not stop but rather abridge it and move
llm_translation: Challenger: One who is praying and saw a danger coming towards him, he saw a crown coming towards him - he should not interrupt, rather he should shorten and ascend!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְקַצֵּר (יְקַצֵּר. וְאִם לָאו — פּוֹסֵק).
human_translation: not difficult. this where it is possible to abridge should abridge And if not he interrupts
llm_translation: Not difficult, this that possible to cut short (he will cut short. And if not — he will not cut short).

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָסִיד אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל בַּדֶּרֶךְ. בָּא הֶגְמוֹן אֶחָד וְנָתַן לוֹ שָׁלוֹם, וְלֹא הֶחְזִיר לוֹ שָׁלוֹם. הִמְתִּין לוֹ עַד שֶׁסִּייֵּם תְּפִלָּתוֹ. לְאַחַר שֶׁסִּייֵּם תְּפִלָּתוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: רֵיקָא, וַהֲלֹא כָּתוּב בְּתוֹרַתְכֶם ״רַק הִשָּׁמֶר לְךָ וּשְׁמֹר נַפְשְׁךָ״, וּכְתִיב ״וְנִשְׁמַרְתֶּם מְאֹד לְנַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם״. כְּשֶׁנָּתַתִּי לְךָ שָׁלוֹם לָמָּה לֹא הֶחְזַרְתָּ לִי שָׁלוֹם? אִם הָיִיתִי חוֹתֵךְ רֹאשְׁךָ בְּסַיִיף, מִי הָיָה תּוֹבֵעַ אֶת דָּמְךָ מִיָּדִי?!
human_translation: The Sages taught: a incident, involving a particular pious man who was praying along his path an officer [ hegmon ] came and greeted him. and did not respond with a greeting. waited for him until he finished his prayer. After he finished his prayer, said to him: good for nothing. Isn’t it written in your Torah: “Take utmost care and guard yourself diligently” And it is written: “Take therefore good heed unto yourselves” When I greeted you, why did you not respond with a greeting? Were I to sever your head with a sword, who would hold me accountable for your blood?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving a certain pious individual who was praying on the road. A certain Arab merchant came and greeted him, but he did not return the greeting. He waited for him until he finished his prayer. After he finished his prayer, he said to him: Empty one, is it not written in your Torah, "Only take heed to yourself and guard your soul," and it is also written, "And you shall greatly guard your souls"? When I offered you peace, why did you not return peace to me? If I had been cutting off your head with a sword, who would demand your blood from me immediately?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן לִי עַד שֶׁאֲפַיֶּיסְךָ בִּדְבָרִים. אָמַר לוֹ: אִילּוּ הָיִיתָ עוֹמֵד לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם, וּבָא חֲבֵרְךָ וְנָתַן לְךָ שָׁלוֹם — הָיִיתָ
human_translation: said to him: Wait for me until I will appease you with words. He said to him: Had you been standing before a flesh and blood king and your friend came and greeted you, you return his
llm_translation: He said to him: "Wait for me until I appease you with words." He said to him: "If you were standing before a king of flesh and blood, and your friend came and greeted you - you would be."

hebrew_text: מַחֲזִיר לוֹ?! אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו. וְאִם הָיִיתָ מַחֲזִיר לוֹ, מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂים לְךָ? אָמַר לוֹ: הָיוּ חוֹתְכִים אֶת רֹאשִׁי בְּסַיִיף. אָמַר לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה אַתָּה שֶׁהָיִיתָ עוֹמֵד לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם, שֶׁהַיּוֹם כָּאן וּמָחָר בַּקֶּבֶר — כָּךְ אֲנִי שֶׁהָיִיתִי עוֹמֵד לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁהוּא חַי וְקַיָּים לָעַד וּלְעוֹלְמֵי עוֹלָמִים — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: said to him: No. And if you would him, what would they do to you? said to him: They would cut my head with a sword. said to him: Isn’t this matter an a fortiori inference? You who were standing before a king of flesh and blood, because today he is here but tomorrow he is in the grave, that I, who was standing before the Supreme King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He, Who lives and endures for all eternity, all the more so
llm_translation: Returning to him?! He said to him: No. And if you were to return to him, what would they do to you? He said to him: They would cut off my head with a sword. He said to him: Is it not logical, and how much more so, that you, who stood before a mortal king, who today is here and tomorrow in the grave — so I, who stood before the King of kings, the Holy One, blessed be He, who is alive and enduring forever and ever — how much more so.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד נִתְפַּיֵּיס אוֹתוֹ הֶגְמוֹן, וְנִפְטַר אוֹתוֹ חָסִיד לְבֵיתוֹ לְשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: the officer was immediately appeased and the pious man returned home in peace.
llm_translation: Immediately he was appeased by the Gemara, and the pious one sent him off to his home in peace.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ נָחָשׁ כָּרוּךְ עַל עֲקֵבוֹ, לֹא יַפְסִיק. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא נָחָשׁ. אֲבָל עַקְרָב — פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: even if a snake is wrapped around his heel, he may not interrupt Rav Sheshet said: They only taught with regard to a snake, But a scorpion he stops,
llm_translation: Even if a snake is tied on its tail, it does not break. Rav Sheshet said: They only said this regarding a snake, but regarding a scorpion - it breaks.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נָפַל לְגוֹב אֲרָיוֹת — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו שֶׁמֵּת. נָפַל לַחֲפִירָה מְלֵאָה נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים — מְעִידִין עָלָיו שֶׁמֵּת!
human_translation: raises an objection fall into a lions’ den do not testify that he died. fall into a pit of snakes and scorpions, testify that he died
llm_translation: Challenger: If one falls into a pit of lions - they do not testify against him that he died. If one falls into a pit full of snakes and scorpions - they testify against him that he died!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאַגַּב אִיצְצָא מַזְּקִי.
human_translation: There, is different, as due to the pressure will harm him,
llm_translation: The matter there is different, for due to the issue of "itztsa" it is considered a damage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: רָאָה שְׁוָורִים — פּוֹסֵק. דְּתָנֵי רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָה: מַרְחִיקִין מִשּׁוֹר תָּם חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, וּמִשּׁוֹר מוּעָד — כִּמְלוֹא עֵינָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: One who saw oxen he interrupts as Rav Hoshaya taught: One distances himself fifty cubits from an innocuous ox [ shor tam ], and from a forewarned ox [ shor muad ], eyeshot.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: "He sees oxen - he stops." For Rav Hoshaya taught: "One must keep a distance of fifty cubits from a docile ox, and from a known ox - as far as the eye can see."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: רֵישׁ תּוֹרָא בְּדִקּוּלָא — סְלֵיק לְאַגְרָא וּשְׁדִי דַּרְגָּא מִתּוּתָךְ. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּשׁוֹר שָׁחוֹר וּבְיוֹמֵי נִיסָן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַשָּׂטָן מְרַקֵּד לוֹ בֵּין קַרְנָיו.
human_translation: taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: the head of the ox is in the basket go up on the roof and kick the ladder out from underneath you. Shmuel said: This applies only with regard to a black ox, and during the days of Nisan, because Satan dances between its horns.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: The head of the ox is in the basket - bring up the hire and the demon from underneath. Samuel said: These matters apply to a black ox and in the days of Nissan, because the Satan dances between its horns.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה עַרְוָד, וְהָיָה מַזִּיק אֶת הַבְּרִיּוֹת. בָּאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא. אָמַר לָהֶם: הַרְאוּ לִי אֶת חוֹרוֹ! הֶרְאוּהוּ אֶת חוֹרוֹ. נָתַן עֲקֵבוֹ עַל פִּי הַחוֹר, יָצָא וּנְשָׁכוֹ — וּמֵת אוֹתוֹ עַרְוָד.
human_translation: the Sages taught: an incident in one place where an arvad was harming the people. They came and told Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa He told them: Show me hole of the arvad . They showed him its hole. He placed his heel over the mouth of the hole arvad came out and bit him, and died.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident in a certain place where there was a snake that was harming people. They came and informed Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa. He said to them: "Show me its hole!" They showed him its hole. He placed his heel over the hole, the snake came out and bit him, and that snake died.

hebrew_text: נְטָלוֹ עַל כְּתֵפוֹ וֶהֱבִיאוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. אָמַר לָהֶם: רְאוּ בָּנַי, אֵין עַרְוָד מֵמִית, אֶלָּא הַחֵטְא מֵמִית.
human_translation: placed over his shoulder and brought it to the study hall. He said to See, my sons, it is not arvad that kills rather transgression kills
llm_translation: He took it upon his shoulder and brought it to the study hall. He said to them: "See, my sons, the stake does not kill, but rather sin kills."

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: אוֹי לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁפָּגַע בּוֹ עַרְוָד, וְאוֹי לוֹ לָעַרְוָד שֶׁפָּגַע בּוֹ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא.
human_translation: At that moment said: Woe unto the person who was attacked by an arvad and woe unto the arvad that was attacked by Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa.
llm_translation: At that moment they said: Woe to the person who is encountered by a wild boar, and woe to the wild boar that is encountered by Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַזְכִּירִין גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים, וּשְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים, וְהַבְדָּלָה בְּחוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אוֹמְרָהּ בְּרָכָה רְבִיעִית בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בַּהוֹדָאָה.
human_translation: One mentions the might of the rains in the revival of the dead. And the request in the blessing of the years. And the prayer of distinction [ havdala ], in Who graciously grants knowledge. Rabbi Akiva says: is recited an independent fourth blessing. Rabbi Eliezer says in thanksgiving.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: We mention the might of rain in the blessing for the resurrection of the dead, and we ask for rain in the blessing for sustenance, and we make the distinction in the blessing for knowledge. Rabbi Akiva says: One should say it as a separate blessing by itself. Rabbi Eliezer says: In thanksgiving.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַזְכִּירִין גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים: מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: one mentions the might of the rains What is the reason
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar mazkirin gevurot geshamim: mai taama?" English translation: "The Gemara mentions the might of rains: what is the reason?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁשְּׁקוּלָה כִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים לְפִיכָךְ קְבָעוּהָ בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because is equivalent to the resurrection of the dead, therefore it was inserted in the revival of the dead.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because it is weighed like the revival of the dead, therefore it is established in the revival of the dead.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים: מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: And request the blessing of the years. What is the reason
llm_translation: And he asked in the blessing of the years: What is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהִיא פַּרְנָסָה, לְפִיכָךְ קְבָעוּהָ בְּבִרְכַּת פַּרְנָסָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because sustenance, therefore it was inserted in the blessing of sustenance
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because she is a provider, therefore they established her with the blessing of a provider.

hebrew_text: הַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״: מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: havdala , in Who graciously grants knowledge. What is the reason
llm_translation: Separation in "Honen HaDa'at": What is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהִיא חָכְמָה, קְבָעוּהָ בְּבִרְכַּת חָכְמָה. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהִיא חוֹל, לְפִיכָךְ קְבָעוּהָ בְּבִרְכַּת חוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: because it wisdom they established it in the blessing of wisdom. The Rabbis say Because is profane, established it in the blessing of weekdays.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because it is wisdom, they established it with the blessing of wisdom. And the Rabbis say: Because it is mundane, therefore they established it with the blessing of the mundane.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי: גְּדוֹלָה דֵּעָה, שֶׁנִּתְּנָה בִּתְחִלַּת בְּרָכָה שֶׁל חוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Ami said Great is knowledge that was placed at the beginning of the weekday blessings;
llm_translation: Rav Ammi said: Great is knowledge, for it was given at the beginning of the blessing of the weekday.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב אַמֵּי: גְּדוֹלָה דֵּעָה, שֶׁנִּתְּנָה בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי אֵל דֵּעוֹת ה׳״. וְכׇל מִי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דֵּעָה — אָסוּר לְרַחֵם עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא עַם בִּינוֹת הוּא עַל כֵּן לֹא יְרַחֲמֶנּוּ עוֹשֵׂהוּ״.
human_translation: And Rav Ami said Great is knowledge that was placed between two letters, as it is stated: “For God of knowledge is the Lord” And anyone without knowledge, it is forbidden to have compassion upon him, as it is stated: “For they are a people of no wisdom, so their Creator will have no compassion upon them
llm_translation: And Rav Ammi said: Great is knowledge, for it was given between two letters, as it is said, "For the knowledge of the Lord." And anyone who lacks knowledge - it is forbidden to have mercy upon him, as it is said: "For he is not a people of understanding, therefore he will not have compassion on him who made him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: גָּדוֹל מִקְדָּשׁ שֶׁנִּתַּן בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פָּעַלְתָּ ה׳ מִקְּדָשׁ ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Great is the Holy Temple, as was placed between two letters, as it is stated: You have made, Lord, the Temple, Lord,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Great is the sanctuary that was given between two vavs, as it is stated: "You have made, O Lord, the sanctuary, O Lord."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ דֵּעָה כְּאִילּוּ נִבְנָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּיָמָיו. דֵּעָה נִתְּנָה בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת, מִקְדָּשׁ נִתַּן בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and said: Anyone with knowledge, as if the Holy Temple was built in his days; knowledge was placed between two letters the Temple was placed between two letters,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Any man who has knowledge, it is as if the Temple was built in his days. Knowledge is given between two letters, and the Temple is given between two letters.

hebrew_text: מַתְקִיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא קַרְחִינָאָה: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גְּדוֹלָה נְקָמָה שֶׁנִּתְּנָה בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״אֵל נְקָמוֹת ה׳״!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa Karḥina’a strongly objects to this However, if so, Great revenge that was placed between two letters, as it is stated: “God of vengeance, Lord,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Rav Acha challenges her: Rather from now on, great is the vengeance that was placed between two letters, as it is said, 'God of vengeance, Hashem!'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, בְּמִילְּתַהּ מִיהָא גְּדוֹלָה הִיא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא שְׁתֵּי נְקָמוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה? אַחַת לְטוֹבָה, וְאַחַת לְרָעָה. לְטוֹבָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״הוֹפִיעַ מֵהַר פָּארָן״. לְרָעָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵל נְקָמוֹת ה׳ אֵל נְקָמוֹת הוֹפִיעַ״.
human_translation: He said to him: Yes. At least in its place, it is great. That is that which Ulla said: Why these two vengeances One for good and one for evil. for good, as it is written: “He shined forth from Mount Paran” for evil, as it is written: “God of vengeance, Lord, God of vengeance shine forth”
llm_translation: He said to him: No, in its essence it is great. And that is what Ulla said: Why are these two vengeances necessary? One for good, and one for evil. For good - as it is written: "He shone forth from Mount Paran." For evil - as it is written: "God of vengeance, Lord, God of vengeance, appear."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אוֹמְרָהּ בְּרָכָה רְבִיעִית כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: is recited fourth blessing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It says in the fourth blessing, as it is written: "והסרתי ממך את לב האבן ונתתי לך לב בשר" (Ezekiel 36:26).

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִכְּדִי אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה תִּקְּנוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּרָכוֹת וּתְפִלּוֹת, קְדוּשּׁוֹת וְהַבְדָּלוֹת. נֶחְזֵי הֵיכָן תַּקּוּן.
human_translation: Rav Shemen, bar Abba said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Now, since were instituted for Israel by the members of the Great Assembly blessings and prayers, sanctifications and havdalot ; let us see where instituted
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shemen bar Abba to Rabbi Yochanan: Since the men of the Great Assembly instituted for Israel blessings, prayers, sanctifications, and separations, see where the institution should be established.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּתְּחִילָּה קְבָעוּהָ בַּתְּפִלָּה. הֶעֱשִׁירוּ — קְבָעוּהָ עַל הַכּוֹס. הֶעֱנוּ — חָזְרוּ וּקְבָעוּהָ בַּתְּפִלָּה. וְהֵם אָמְרוּ: הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: He said to him: Initially, they established in the prayer. became wealthy, they established over the cup became impoverished, they again established it in the prayer. And they said: One who recites havdala in the prayer must, recite havdala over the cup
llm_translation: He said to him: Initially, establish it in the prayer. If they became wealthy - establish it on the cup. If they answered - they should go back and establish it in the prayer. And they said: One who separates in the prayer must also separate on the cup.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה תִּקְּנוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּרָכוֹת וּתְפִלּוֹת, קְדוּשּׁוֹת וְהַבְדָּלוֹת. בַּתְּחִלָּה קְבָעוּהָ בַּתְּפִלָּה. הֶעֱשִׁירוּ — קְבָעוּהָ עַל הַכּוֹס. חָזְרוּ וְהֶעֱנוּ — קְבָעוּהָ בַּתְּפִלָּה. וְהֵם אָמְרוּ: הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: It was also stated: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The members of the Great Assembly established for Israel blessings and prayers, sanctifications and havdalot . Initially, they established in the prayer. became wealthy, they established over the cup again became impoverished, they established it in the prayer. And they said: One who recites havdala in the prayer must recite havdala over the cup
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: The men of the Great Assembly instituted for Israel blessings, prayers, sanctifications, and havdalot. Initially, they established it in the prayer. If one became wealthy, they established it over the cup. If they returned and answered, they established it in the prayer. And they said: One who makes havdalah in the prayer, must also make havdalah over the cup.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: It was also stated: Rabba and Rav Yosef who both said: One who recites havdala in the prayer must recite havdala over the cup
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: One who separates during the prayer - needs to separate over the cup.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וּמוֹתְבִינַן אַשְּׁמַעְתִּין: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים וּשְׁאֵלָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, וְהַבְדָּלָה בְּ״חוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: Rava said: We raise an objection to our halakha One who erred and did not mention the might of the rains in the revival of the dead, and the request in the blessing of the years, we require him to return havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, we do not require him to return as he can recite over the cup
llm_translation: Rava said, and we are sitting and learning: If one erred and did not mention the powers of rain in the resurrection of the dead and asked in the blessing of years - we return him, but in the "Chonen HaDa'at" blessing - we do not return him, because he can say it over the cup.

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאוֹמְרָהּ עַל הַכּוֹס״.
human_translation: Do not say Because he can recite over the cup Rather, say: Because he recites over the cup
llm_translation: Do not say: "because he can say it over the cup," rather say: "because he said it over the cup."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת: שָׁאַל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֶת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּצַיְדָּן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יַעֲקֹב דְּמִן צוֹר אֶת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וַאֲנָא שְׁמַעִית: הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס, אוֹ לֹא? וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: was also stated: Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said Rabbi Yosei asked Rabbi Yoḥanan in Sidon, and some say that Rabbi Shimon ben Ya’akov from Tyre Rabbi Yoḥanan, and I, heard: One who recited havdala in the prayer, must he recite havdala over the cup or not? And said to him: He must recite havdala over the cup.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Benjamin bar Yefet said: Rabbi Yosei asked Rabbi Yochanan in Tzaydan, and they said to him: Rabbi Shimon ben Yaakov from Tyre asked Rabbi Yochanan, and I heard: One who separates in the prayer, does he need to separate over the cup or not? And he said to him: He needs to separate over the cup.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַמַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה?
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before One who recited havdala over the cup what is to recite havdala in the prayer
llm_translation: He asked them: One who separates over the cup, what should he separate in the prayer?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִתְּפִלָּה. וּמָה תְפִלָּה דְּעִיקַּר תַּקַּנְתָּא הִיא, אָמְרִי: הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס. הַמַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס, דְּלָאו עִיקַּר תַּקַּנְתָּא הִיא — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: a fortiori from the prayer. Just as the prayer, which is the principal ordinance said one who recited havdala in the prayer must recite havdala over the cup all the more so one who recited havdala over the cup which is not the principal ordinance
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: A fortiori from prayer. And what is prayer, which is the main enactment? They said: One who separates in prayer - he must separate over the cup. One who separates over the cup, since it is not the main enactment - not all the more so!

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב אַחָא אֲרִיכָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִינָּנָא: הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה מְשׁוּבָּח יוֹתֵר מִמִּי שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס. וְאִם הִבְדִּיל בְּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ — יָנוּחוּ לוֹ בְּרָכוֹת עַל רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa Arikha, the tall, taught before Rav Ḥinnana: One who recited havdala in the prayer more praiseworthy than one who recites it over the cup and if he recited havdala in this, and that, may blessings rest upon his head.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Ahah stood before Rav Hinnana and said: One who distinguishes in prayer is more praiseworthy than one who distinguishes over the cup. And if he distinguished in this and in that - blessings shall rest upon his head.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ הַמַּבְדִּיל בַּתְּפִלָּה מְשׁוּבָּח יוֹתֵר מִמִּי שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס, אַלְמָא תְּפִלָּה לְחוּדַהּ סַגִּי. וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי אִם הִבְדִּיל בְּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ — יָנוּחוּ לוֹ בְּרָכוֹת עַל רֹאשׁוֹ. וְכֵיוָן דְּנָפֵיק לֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא — אִפְּטַר, וְהָוְיָא בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה, וְאָמַר רַב וְאִיתֵּימָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כׇּל הַמְבָרֵךְ בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה — עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תִשָּׂא״!
human_translation: This is self-contradictory. you said that one who recites havdala in the prayer more praiseworthy than one who recites havdala over the cup the prayer alone is sufficient. And then it is taught: If one recited havdala in this, and that, may blessings rest upon his head. And since he fulfilled with one, exempt, and is an unnecessary blessing. And Rav, and some say Reish Lakish, and say Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both said: Anyone who recites an unnecessary blessing violates “Do not take
llm_translation: The matter is difficult: You said, "One who distinguishes in prayer is more praiseworthy than one who distinguishes over the cup." This implies that prayer by itself is sufficient. And furthermore, if one distinguishes both here and there - blessings rest upon his head. And once he concludes with one - he should not add, and it becomes a blessing that is unnecessary. And Rav, and some say Reish Lakish, and some say Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish together said: Anyone who recites an unnecessary blessing transgresses the prohibition of 'You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain'!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֵימָא הָכִי: אִם הִבְדִּיל בְּזוֹ וְלֹא הִבְדִּיל בָּזוֹ — יָנוּחוּ לוֹ בְּרָכוֹת עַל רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, and say as follows: If one recited havdala in this and not in that, may blessings rest upon his head.
llm_translation: Rather, say it thus: If he separated with this and did not separate with that - blessings shall rest upon his head.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: טָעָה בְּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טָעָה בְּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda asked Rav Sheshet one erred in this and in that, what is said to him: One who erred in this, and that, returns to the beginning
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Ḥisdah from Rav Sheshet: He erred in this and in that, what is the ruling? He said to him: He erred in this and in that - he goes back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: הִלְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, כִּי קִידּוּשׁ: מָה קִידּוּשׁ אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּצְלוֹתָא מְקַדֵּשׁ אַכָּסָא, אַף הַבְדָּלָה נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמַבְדֵּיל בִּצְלוֹתָא מַבְדֵּיל אַכָּסָא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: What is the halakha ? said to him: like kiddush . Just as kiddush , although one recited kiddush in the prayer recite kiddush over the cup so too with havdala , although one recited havdala in the prayer recite havdala over the cup
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: What is the halakha? He said to him, like Kiddush: Just as Kiddush, even though one sanctifies with a cup, he also sanctifies with a cover, so too with Havdalah, even though one makes a distinction with a cup, he also makes a distinction with a cover.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בְּ״הוֹדָאָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: in thanksgiving.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: In "hoda'ah."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא הֲוָה רְכִיב חֲמָרָא, הֲוָה קָא שָׁקֵיל וְאָזֵיל רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין בָּתְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וַדַּאי דְּאָמְרִיתוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira was riding a donkey Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin was coming and walking after him. He said to him: Is true that you said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer a Festival that occurs after Shabbat? He said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira was riding on a donkey, he was taking and going after Rabbi Chiya bar Avin. He said to him: "Surely you have said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, the halacha is like Rabbi Eliezer on a festival that falls after Shabbat?" He said to him: "No."

hebrew_text: הֲלָכָה — מִכְלָל דִּפְלִיגִי?
human_translation: halakha indicates that dispute
llm_translation: Halakha - miklal dipligi?

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי? וְהָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And don’t they dispute Don’t the Rabbis dispute
llm_translation: "And did they not dispute? But they did dispute, the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דִּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת מִי פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: Say that the Rabbis dispute during the rest of the days of the year, in the case of a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, do they dispute
llm_translation: Statement: If the Rabbis argue regarding the rest of the days of the year, on a festival that happens to fall after Shabbat, who do they argue with?

hebrew_text: וְהָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא!
human_translation: Doesn’t Rabbi Akiva dispute
llm_translation: And here Rabbi Akiva disagrees!

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ מִי עָבְדִינַן כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּהַשְׁתָּא נֵיקוּ וְנַעֲבֵיד כְּווֹתֵיהּ?! כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא עָבְדִינַן כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — דְּתַמְנֵי סְרֵי תַּקּוּן, תְּשַׁסְרֵי לָא תַּקּוּן. הָכָא נָמֵי, שָׁב תַּקּוּן תַּמְנֵי לָא תַּקּוּן.
human_translation: Is that to say that throughout the entire year we act in accordance with Rabbi Akiva so that now, we will stand and act in accordance with What is the reason that throughout the whole, entire year, we do not act in accordance with Rabbi Akiva? Because instituted eighteen they did not institute nineteen Here, too, instituted seven they did not institute eight
llm_translation: Now, all the year, all of it, who do we serve like Rabbi Akiva, that now we are clean and we serve like his students?! All the year, all of it, what is the reason we do not serve like Rabbi Akiva — because eight rows of correction, nine rows of no correction. Here too, if you correct eight rows, you will not correct nine rows.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו ״הֲלָכָה״ אִתְּמַר, אֶלָּא ״מַטִּין״ אִתְּמַר.
human_translation: said to him it was not the halakha that was stated inclined that was stated
llm_translation: He said to him: Not "halakha" was stated, but "matin" was stated.

hebrew_text: דְּאִתְּמַר, רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּנוּ: הֲלָכָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: מַטִּין.
human_translation: As it was stated Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said in the name of Rabbeinu, The halakha And some say this inclined
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said in the name of our teacher: Halacha, and some say to him: Matin.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מוֹדִים. וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: נִרְאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said agree And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said appears
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They agree. And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: They appear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: נְקוֹט דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא בִּידָךְ, דְּדָיֵיק וְגָמַר שְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמָּא דְמָרַהּ שַׁפִּיר כְּרַחֲבָא דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Take Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba in your hand, as he is scrupulous and he learned the halakha well from the mouth of its originator, like Raḥava Pumbedita.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Take the teachings of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba in your hand, for he is precise and has completed the learning from the mouth of his teacher beautifully, like the width of the mouth of a well.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַחֲבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַר הַבַּיִת סְטָיו כָּפוּל הָיָה, וְהָיָה סְטָיו לְפָנִים מִסְּטָיו.
human_translation: Raḥava said Rabbi Yehuda said: The Temple Mount was a double stav , and there was a stav within a stav .
llm_translation: The text reads: "De'amar Rachava amar Rabbi Yehuda: Ha'har habayit setav kaful haya, vehayah setav lefanim misetav." Translation: "For Rachava said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: The Mount of the Temple was doubled, and its base was within its base."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲנָא לָא הַאי יָדַעְנָא וְלָא הַאי יָדַעְנָא, אֶלָּא מִדְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל יָדַעְנָא, דְּתַקִּינוּ לַן מַרְגָּנִיתָא בְּבָבֶל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said I don’t know this and I don’t know that, but I do know from Rav and Shmuel they have instituted a pearl for us in Babylonia.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: I do not know this one, and I do not know that one, but from Rav and Shmuel I know, for they established for us the marganita in Babylonia.

hebrew_text: ״וַתּוֹדִיעֵנוּ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֶת מִשְׁפְּטֵי צִדְקֶךָ וַתְּלַמְּדֵנוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת חֻקֵּי רְצוֹנֶךָ, וַתַּנְחִילֵנוּ זְמַנֵּי שָׂשׂוֹן וְחַגֵּי נְדָבָה, וַתּוֹרִישֵׁנוּ קְדוּשַּׁת שַׁבָּת וּכְבוֹד מוֹעֵד וַחֲגִיגַת הָרֶגֶל. בֵּין קְדוּשַּׁת שַׁבָּת לִקְדוּשַּׁת יוֹם טוֹב הִבְדַּלְתָּ, וְאֶת יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי הַמַּעֲשֶׂה קִדַּשְׁתָּ. הִבְדַּלְתָּ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ אֶת עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּקְדוּשָּׁתֶךָ. וַתִּתֶּן לָנוּ וְכוּ׳״.
human_translation: You have made known to us, Lord our God, Your righteous laws, and taught us to perform Your will’s decrees. You have given us as our heritage seasons of joy and Festivals of voluntary offerings. You have given us as our heritage the holiness of Shabbat, the glory of the festival and the festive offerings of the Pilgrim Festivals. You have distinguished between the holiness of Shabbat and the holiness of the Festival, and have made the seventh day holy over the six days of work. You have distinguished and sanctified Your people Israel with Your holiness, And You have given us, etc.
llm_translation: "And You made known to us, Hashem our God, Your righteous judgments, and You taught us to perform the statutes of Your will, and You bestowed upon us times of joy and festivals of voluntary offerings, and You bequeathed to us the sanctity of Shabbat and the honor of the appointed times and the celebration of the pilgrimage festival. You distinguished between the sanctity of Shabbat and the sanctity of a festival day, and You sanctified the seventh day from the six days of work. You distinguished and sanctified Your people Israel with Your holiness. And You gave to us, etc."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר: ״עַל קַן צִיפּוֹר יַגִּיעוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ״, וְ״עַל טוֹב יִזָּכֵר שְׁמֶךָ״, ״מוֹדִים, מוֹדִים״ — מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: One who recites Your mercy is extended to a bird’s nest, and May Your name be mentioned with the good We give thanks, we give thanks silence him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "Upon a nest of a bird may Your mercies reach," and "For good may Your name be remembered," "We acknowledge, we acknowledge" — they silence him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא, ״מוֹדִים, מוֹדִים״ מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ — מִשּׁוּם דְּמֶיחְזֵי כִּשְׁתֵּי רָשׁוּיוֹת. וְ״עַל טוֹב יִזָּכֵר שְׁמֶךָ״ נָמֵי, מַשְׁמַע עַל הַטּוֹבָה וְלֹא עַל הָרָעָה, וּתְנַן: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְבָרֵךְ עַל הָרָעָה כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּבָרֵךְ עַל הַטּוֹבָה. אֶלָּא ״עַל קַן צִפּוֹר יַגִּיעוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ״ מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, We give thanks, we give thanks, as it appears like two authorities. And they also silence May Your name be mentioned with the good, clearly for the good and not for the bad, and we learned One is required to bless for the bad just as he blesses for the good. However, Your mercy is extended to a bird’s nest, why
llm_translation: Gemara: In Shlama, "Modim, Modim" they silence him - because it appears like two blessings. And "For good, may Your name be remembered" also, it implies for the good and not for the bad. And we learned: A person is obligated to bless for the bad just as he blesses for the good. Rather, "Upon the nest of a bird, may Your mercies reach" what is the reason?

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי בְּמַעְרְבָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר זְבִידָא: חַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמֵּטִיל קִנְאָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְּרֵאשִׁית. וְחַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רַחֲמִים, וְאֵינָן אֶלָּא גְּזֵרוֹת.
human_translation: Two amora’im in Eretz Yisrael disputed this Rabbi Yosei bar Avin and Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida; one said because he engenders jealousy among God’s creations, And one said because he transforms the attributes of the Holy One, Blessed be He, into mercy, when they are nothing but decrees
llm_translation: They disputed it: two Amoraim in the West, Rabbi Yosei bar Avin and Rabbi Yosei bar Zavida. One said: Because he Joseph acted out of jealousy in the incident of the beginning. And one said: Because he Joseph emulates the attributes of the Holy One, blessed be He, who is merciful, and they are nothing but decrees.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה וַאֲמַר: אַתָּה חַסְתָּ עַל קַן צִפּוֹר, אַתָּה חוּס וְרַחֵם עָלֵינוּ. אֲמַר רַבָּה: כַּמָּה יָדַע הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנָן לְרַצּוֹיֵי לְמָרֵיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ תְּנַן!
human_translation: a particular descended before the ark in the presence of Rabba, and said You have shown mercy to the bird’s nest, now have mercy and pity upon us. Rabba said: How much does this Torah scholar know to appease his Master. Abaye said to him: Didn’t we learn they silence him?
llm_translation: That one who stood before Rabba and said: "You have had mercy on a nest of birds, have mercy and be compassionate upon us." Rabba said: "How much the Tzurba (great one) knows the will of their Master!" Abaye said to him: "But don't we silence him?"

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה נָמֵי, לְחַדּוֹדֵי אַבָּיֵי הוּא דְּבָעֵי.
human_translation: And Rabba too he wanted to hone Abaye’s
llm_translation: And Rabbah Nami, for the needs of Abaye, is the one who is required.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אֲמַר ״הָאֵל הַגָּדוֹל הַגִּבּוֹר וְהַנּוֹרָא וְהָאַדִּיר וְהָעִזּוּז וְהַיָּראוּי, הֶחָזָק וְהָאַמִּיץ וְהַוַּדַּאי וְהַנִּכְבָּד״.
human_translation: a particular descended before the ark in the presence of Rabbi Ḥanina. said: God, the great, mighty, awesome, powerful, mighty, awe-inspiring, strong, fearless, steadfast and honored.
llm_translation: That one who stood before Rabbi Chanina said, "The great, mighty, awesome, majestic, powerful, and awe-inspiring God, the strong, the mighty, the true, and the glorious."

hebrew_text: הִמְתִּין לוֹ עַד דְּסַיֵּים. כִּי סַיֵּים אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סַיֵּימְתִּינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ שִׁבְחֵי דְמָרָךְ?! לְמָה לִי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲנַן, הָנֵי תְּלָת דְּאָמְרִינַן אִי לָאו דְּאַמְרִינְהוּ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּנוּ בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וַאֲתוֹ אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה וְתַקְּנִינְהוּ בִּתְפִלָּה — לָא הֲוֵינַן יְכוֹלִין לְמֵימַר לְהוּ, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי וְאָזְלַתְּ! מָשָׁל לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ אֶלֶף אֲלָפִים דִּינְרֵי זָהָב, וְהָיוּ מְקַלְּסִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשֶׁל כֶּסֶף. וַהֲלֹא גְּנַאי הוּא לוֹ!
human_translation: waited for him until he completed When he finished, asked him: Have you concluded all of the praises of your Master? Why do I need all of this Even these three that we recite: had Moses our teacher not said them in the Torah and had the members of the Great Assembly not come and incorporated them into the we would not be permitted to recite them. And you went on and recited all of these. It is comparable to a king who possessed many thousands of golden dinars, yet they were praising him for silver Isn’t that deprecatory?
llm_translation: He waited for him until he finished. When he finished, he said to him: "Have I finished all the praises of your Master?! Why do I need all this? We, these three that we say, if not that Moses our teacher said them in the Torah, and the men of the Great Assembly came and established them in prayer - we would not be able to say them, and you say all this and go away! A parable to a king of flesh and blood who had a thousand thousands of gold dinars, and they were mocking him with silver. Is it not a disgrace to him!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַכֹּל בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, חוּץ מִיִּרְאַת שָׁמַיִם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַתָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל מָה ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ שׁוֹאֵל מֵעִמָּךְ כִּי אִם לְיִרְאָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina said: Everything is in the hands of Heaven, except for fear of Heaven. as it is stated: “And now Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you other than to fear
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: Everything is in the hands of Heaven, except for the fear of Heaven. As it is stated: "And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you, but to fear."

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ יִרְאַת שָׁמַיִם מִילְּתָא זוּטַרְתָּא הִיא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: אֵין לוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּבֵית גְּנָזָיו אֶלָּא אוֹצָר שֶׁל יִרְאַת שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״יִרְאַת ה׳ הִיא אוֹצָרוֹ״.
human_translation: Is fear of Heaven a minor matter Didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina say in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: The Holy One, Blessed be He, has nothing in his treasury other than a treasure of fear of Heaven, as it is stated: “Fear of the Lord is his treasure”
llm_translation: The fear of Heaven, is it a minor matter? But didn't Rabbi Chanina say in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: The Holy One, blessed be He, has nothing in His treasury except a treasure of the fear of Heaven, as it is said, "The fear of the Lord, that is His treasure."

hebrew_text: אִין, לְגַבֵּי מֹשֶׁה מִילְּתָא זוּטַרְתָּא הִיא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁמְבַקְּשִׁים מִמֶּנּוּ כְּלִי גָּדוֹל, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ — דּוֹמֶה עָלָיו כִּכְלִי קָטָן. קָטָן, וְאֵין לוֹ — דּוֹמֶה עָלָיו כִּכְלִי גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Indeed, for Moses is a minor matter. As Rabbi Ḥanina stated: It is comparable to one who is asked for a large vessel and he has it seems to him like a small vessel small it seems to him like a large vessel.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, l'gabei Moshe milta zutrata hi. D'amar Rabbi Chanina: Mashal l'adam she'mevakshim mimenu kli gadol, v'yesh lo — domeh alav k'kli katan. Katan, v'ein lo — domeh alav k'kli gadol." English translation: "There is, in relation to Moses, a minor matter. As Rabbi Chanina said: It is a parable for a person from whom they seek a large vessel, and he has it — he is likened to a small vessel. If he is small, and does not have it — he is likened to a large vessel."

hebrew_text: ״מוֹדִים מוֹדִים״ מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: We give thanks, we give thanks, they silence him.
llm_translation: "Modim Modim" meshatkin oto.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״שְׁמַע שְׁמַע״ — כְּאוֹמֵר ״מוֹדִים מוֹדִים״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: One who says: Listen Listen is like one who says: We give thanks, we give thanks.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: Anyone who says "Shema Shema" is like one who says "Modim Modim," it is as if he repeats.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע וְכוֹפְלָהּ — הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה. מְגוּנֶּה הוּא דְּהָוֵי, שַׁתּוֹקֵי לָא מְשַׁתְּקִינַן לֵיהּ!
human_translation: raises an objection: One who recites Shema and repeats it, it is reprehensible. It is reprehensible, but they do not silence him.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who reads the Shema and repeats it - this is considered arrogant. It is considered arrogant because it becomes like a burden, and those who make it a burden will not be granted a share in the World to Come!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא, דְּאָמַר מִילְּתָא מִילְּתָא וְתָנֵי לַהּ. וְהָא, דְּאָמַר פְּסוּקָא פְּסוּקָא וְתָנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This is not difficult; this one who recites and repeats each individual word this one who recites and repeats an entire verse,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this, that he said word by word and taught it to him. And this, that he said verse by verse and taught it to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְדִילְמָא מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא כַּוֵּון דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וּלְבַסּוֹף כַּוֵּון דַּעְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye And perhaps initially he did not focus his attention and ultimately he focused his attention
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Perhaps initially he did not intend, but ultimately he intended?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him:

hebrew_text: חַבְרוּתָא כְּלַפֵּי שְׁמַיָּא מִי אִיכָּא?! אִי לָא כַּוֵּון דַּעְתֵּיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא — מָחֵינַן לֵיהּ בְּמַרְזַפְתָּא דְנַפָּחָא עַד דִּמְכַוֵּין דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Can one have familiarity with Heaven, If he did not focus his attention initially, we beat him with a blacksmith’s hammer until he focuses his attention,
llm_translation: Companionship according to the will of Heaven, is there anyone like it?! If his intention is not from the outset — we sharpen it in the crucible of blowing until his intention is established.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ (הָאוֹמֵר: ״יְבָרְכוּךָ טוֹבִים״ — הֲרֵי זֶה דַּרְכֵי מִינוּת). הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה וְטָעָה — יַעֲבוֹר אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו, וְלֹא יְהֵא סָרְבָן בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה. מֵהֵיכָן הוּא מַתְחִיל? מִתְּחִלַּת הַבְּרָכָה שֶׁטָּעָה זֶה.
human_translation: (If one says: “May the good bless You,” this is a path of heresy.) One who is passing before the ark, and erred, another should pass in his place, and at that moment, should not refuse From where does commence? From the beginning of the blessing in which had erred.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "May the good bless you" — this is a form of heresy. If one passes in front of the ark and makes a mistake, he should pass behind it, and there should not be a disturbance at that time. From where does he begin? From the beginning of the blessing in which he erred.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה לֹא יַעֲנֶה ״אָמֵן״ אַחַר הַכֹּהֲנִים, מִפְּנֵי הַטֵּרוּף. וְאִם אֵין שָׁם כֹּהֵן אֶלָּא הוּא — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. וְאִם הַבְטָחָתוֹ שֶׁהוּא נוֹשֵׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו, וְחוֹזֵר לִתְפִלָּתוֹ — רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: one who passes before the ark should not respond amen after the priests, because of confusion. if there is no priest other than he does not lift his hands And, if he is certain that he can lift his hands and resume his prayer he is permitted
llm_translation: The one passing before the ark shall not respond "Amen" after the priests, due to the danger of the demon. And if there is no other priest there except him, he shall not raise his hands. But if his intention was to raise his hands, and he returns to his prayer, he is permitted.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה — צָרִיךְ לְסָרֵב. וְאִם אֵינוֹ מְסָרֵב — דּוֹמֶה לְתַבְשִׁיל שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מֶלַח. וְאִם מְסָרֵב יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי — דּוֹמֶה לְתַבְשִׁיל שֶׁהִקְדִּיחַתּוּ מֶלַח. כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה: פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה — יְסָרֵב, שְׁנִיָּה — מְהַבְהֵב, שְׁלִישִׁית — פּוֹשֵׁט אֶת רַגְלָיו וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: The Sages taught to pass before the ark should refuse, And if he does not refuse, he is like cooked food without salt, However, if he refuses too much he is like cooked food that was ruined by salt. how should he act? the first time, one should refuse; the second vacillate the third he should stretch his legs and descend
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who passes before the Ark - must bow. And if he does not bow - he is like a dish without salt. And if he bows excessively - he is like a dish that you have over-salted. How does one do it: The first time - he bows, the second time - he nods, the third time - he spreads his feet and descends.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה רוּבָּן — קָשֶׁה, וּמִיעוּטָן — יָפֶה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: שְׂאוֹר, וּמֶלַח, וְסָרְבָנוּת.
human_translation: the Sages taught three are harmful in excess but are beneficial when used sparingly. Leavening salt and refusal
llm_translation: The sages taught: Three things are difficult in their abundance, and their scarcity is good, and these are they: leaven, salt, and thorns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: טָעָה בְּשָׁלֹשׁ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ. בְּאֶמְצָעִיּוֹת — חוֹזֵר לְ״אַתָּה חוֹנֵן״. בְּאַחֲרוֹנוֹת — חוֹזֵר לָ״עֲבוֹדָה״.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: erred in the first three he must return to the beginning erred in the middle he returns to You grace in final he must return to the Temple service,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: If one made a mistake in the first three blessings of the Amidah prayer - he goes back to the beginning. In the middle blessings - he goes back to "Atah Honen." In the final blessings - he goes back to "Avodah."

hebrew_text: וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אֶמְצָעִיּוֹת אֵין לָהֶן סֵדֶר.
human_translation: And Rav Asi he said: The middle have no order.
llm_translation: And Rav Assi said: The middle ones do not have order.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מֵהֵיכָן הוּא חוֹזֵר — מִתְּחִלַּת הַבְּרָכָה שֶׁטָּעָה זֶה. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection From where does he repetition from the beginning of the blessing in which had erred. a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna’s
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection: From where does he return? From the beginning of the blessing in which this one erred. The response of Rav Huna's student.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: אֶמְצָעִיּוֹת כּוּלְּהוּ חֲדָא בִּרְכְתָא נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you: The middle are all one blessing;
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: All of them are one blessing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְעוֹלָם אַל יִשְׁאַל אָדָם צְרָכָיו לֹא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת, וְלֹא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ אַחֲרוֹנוֹת, אֶלָּא בְּאֶמְצָעִיּוֹת. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רִאשׁוֹנוֹת — דּוֹמֶה לְעֶבֶד שֶׁמְּסַדֵּר שֶׁבַח לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ. אֶמְצָעִיּוֹת — דּוֹמֶה לְעֶבֶד שֶׁמְבַקֵּשׁ פְּרָס מֵרַבּוֹ. אַחֲרוֹנוֹת — דּוֹמֶה לְעֶבֶד שֶׁקִּבֵּל פְּרָס מֵרַבּוֹ, וְנִפְטָר וְהוֹלֵךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: One must never request his needs in the first three or in the last three rather, in the middle As Rabbi Ḥanina said: first is like a servant who arranges praise before his master; middle is like a servant who requests a reward from his master; final is like a servant who received a reward from his master and is taking his leave and departing.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A person should always not ask for his needs neither in the first three hours, nor in the last three hours, but rather in the middle hours. As Rabbi Chanina said: The first hours are like a servant who arranges praise before his master. The middle hours are like a servant who requests his reward from his master. The last hours are like a servant who received his reward from his master, and is dismissed and goes on his way.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד שֶׁיָּרַד לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בִּפְנֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְהָיָה מַאֲרִיךְ יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: כַּמָּה אָרְכָן הוּא זֶה! אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּלוּם מַאֲרִיךְ יוֹתֵר מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״אֵת אַרְבָּעִים הַיּוֹם וְאֶת אַרְבָּעִים הַלַּיְלָה וְגוֹ׳״?!
human_translation: the Sages taught: an incident where one student descended before the ark in the presence of Rabbi Eliezer, and he was excessively prolonging his prayer. His students said to him: How long-winded he is. He said to them: Is prolonging than Moses our teacher As about it is written: for the forty days and forty nights
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with one student who went down before the ark in the presence of Rabbi Eliezer, and he was praying longer than usual. His students said to him: How long is this one extending his prayer! He said to them: Is he extending longer than our teacher Moses, as it is written about him: "Forty days and forty nights, etc."?

hebrew_text: שׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד שֶׁיָּרַד לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בִּפְנֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְהָיָה מְקַצֵּר יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: כַּמָּה קַצְרָן הוּא זֶה! אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּלוּם מְקַצֵּר יוֹתֵר מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵל נָא רְפָא נָא לָהּ״.
human_translation: again an incident where one student descended before the ark in the presence of Rabbi Eliezer, and he was excessively abbreviating his prayer. His students and said to him: How brief is his He said to them: Is he abbreviating any more than Moses our teacher As it is written ‘Please, God, heal her, please’”
llm_translation: The incident occurred with one disciple who descended before the ark in the presence of Rabbi Eliezer, and he was more concise than necessary. His disciples said to him: How concise is he! He said to them: Is he more concise than our teacher Moses, as it is written: "O God, please heal her."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל חֲבֵירוֹ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהַזְכִּיר שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵל נָא רְפָא נָא לָהּ״, וְלָא קָמַדְכַּר שְׁמַהּ דְּמִרְיָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said Rav Ḥisda said: Anyone who requests mercy on another need not mention his name, as it is stated: “Please, God, heal her, please,” and he did not mention Miriam’s name.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov said, Rabbi Chisda said: Anyone who requests mercy for his fellow does not need to mention his name, as it is stated: "God, please heal her," without mentioning the name of Miriam.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵלּוּ בְּרָכוֹת שֶׁאָדָם שׁוֹחֶה בָּהֶן: בְּ״אָבוֹת״, תְּחִלָּה וָסוֹף. בַּ״הוֹדָאָה״, תְּחִלָּה וָסוֹף. וְאִם בָּא לָשׁוּחַ בְּסוֹף כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה, וּבִתְחִלַּת כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה — מְלַמְּדִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁחֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught These blessings in which a person bows: In Patriarchs, at the beginning and the end; in thanksgiving, at the beginning and the end; and if one seeks to bow at the end of each and every blessing and at the beginning of each and every blessing, they teach him not to bow
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: These are the blessings that a person concludes with: In "Avot," both at the beginning and the end. In "Hoda'ah," both at the beginning and the end. And if one comes to conclude with each blessing individually, both at the beginning of each blessing and at the end — we teach him not to conclude.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: הֶדְיוֹט, כְּמוֹ שֶׁאָמַרְנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of bar Kappara: An ordinary [ hedyot ], as we said;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of Bar Kappara: "The common people, as we have said."

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, בְּסוֹף כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ, תְּחִלַּת כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה וְסוֹף כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה.
human_translation: a High Priest at the end of each and every blessing; and a king at the beginning of each and every blessing and at the end of each and every blessing.
llm_translation: High Priest, at the end of each blessing and blessing. And the king, beginning of each blessing and blessing and end of each blessing and blessing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי: לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֶדְיוֹט, כְּמוֹ שֶׁאָמַרְנוּ. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, תְּחִלַּת כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה. הַמֶּלֶךְ — כֵּיוָן שֶׁכָּרַע שׁוּב אֵינוֹ זוֹקֵף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי כְּכַלּוֹת שְׁלֹמֹה לְהִתְפַּלֵּל וְגוֹ׳ קָם מִלִּפְנֵי מִזְבַּח ה׳ מִכְּרֹעַ עַל בִּרְכָּיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani said: It was explained to me from Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi An ordinary as we said; a High Priest the beginning of each and every blessing; the king, once he has bowed does not rise as it is stated: “And it was that when Solomon finished praying he rose from before the altar of the Lord, from kneeling upon his knees
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani said: According to my understanding from the explanation of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: A commoner, as we have said. A High Priest, the beginning of every blessing and blessing. The king - once he bows, he does not straighten up, as it is stated: "And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished praying, etc., he arose from before the altar of the Lord, from kneeling on his knees."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קִידָּה — עַל אַפַּיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתִּקֹּד בַּת שֶׁבַע אַפַּיִם אֶרֶץ״. כְּרִיעָה — עַל בִּרְכַּיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מִכְּרֹעַ עַל בִּרְכָּיו״. הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה — זוֹ פִּשּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲבוֹא נָבוֹא אֲנִי וְאִמְּךָ וְאַחֶיךָ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֹת לְךָ אָרְצָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught kidda upon face, as it is stated: “Then Bathsheba bowed [ vatikod ] with her face to the ground” Keria upon one’s knees, as it is stated: “he rose from before the altar of the Lord, from kneeling [ mikkeroa ] upon his knees.” hishtaḥava’a , that is one’s hands and legs spread as it is stated “Shall we, I and your mother and your brothers, come and bow down [ lehishtaḥavot ] to you to the ground?”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Kiddah" - on the palms, as it is stated: "And she bowed and prostrated herself with her face to the ground." "K'ri'ah" - on the knees, as it is stated: "He bowed upon his knees." "Hishtachava'ah" - this is the spreading out of hands and feet, as it is stated: "Shall I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow down to you to the ground?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּמַצְלוּ אַצְלוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: I saw Abaye and Rava, who would lean
llm_translation: Rav Chiya, son of Rav Huna, said: "We saw that Abaye and Rava were sitting and smiling."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: הַכּוֹרֵעַ בַּהוֹדָאָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה!
human_translation: One taught: One who bows in thanksgiving, it is praiseworthy. And it was taught in another it is reprehensible.
llm_translation: One taught: One who bows in gratitude - behold, this one is praiseworthy. And it was taught in another source: Behold, this one is despicable!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּתְּחִלָּה, הָא לְבַסּוֹף.
human_translation: not difficult; this at the beginning This at the end
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in the beginning, this in the end.

hebrew_text: רָבָא כָּרַע בְּהוֹדָאָה תְּחִלָּה וָסוֹף. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: אַמַּאי קָא עָבֵיד מָר הָכִי? אָמַר לְהוּ: חֲזֵינָא לְרַב נַחְמָן דְּכָרַע וַחֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת דְּקָא עָבֵד הָכִי.
human_translation: Rava bowed in thanksgiving, beginning and end. The Sages said to him: Why does our master do this? He said to them: I saw Rav Naḥman who bowed and I saw Rav Sheshet who did so
llm_translation: Rava bent down in acknowledgment at the beginning and at the end. The Rabbis said to him: Why does our master act in this way? He said to them: I saw Rav Nachman bend down, and I saw Rav Sheshet do so.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא הַכּוֹרֵעַ בַּהוֹדָאָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה!
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught one who bows in thanksgiving, it is reprehensible?
llm_translation: "And it was taught: one who bows in Hodaa - behold, this is considered disgraceful!"

hebrew_text: הַהִיא בְּהוֹדָאָה שֶׁבְּ״הַלֵּל״.
human_translation: That in thanksgiving in hallel ,
llm_translation: That one in Hodaa of "Hillel."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הַכּוֹרֵעַ בַּהוֹדָאָה וּבַהוֹדָאָה שֶׁל ״הַלֵּל״ — הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught One who bows in thanksgiving or in thanksgiving of hallel , it is reprehensible?
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One who bows in Hodaa and in the Hodaa of "Hillel" - this one is derogatory.

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הַהִיא בְּהוֹדָאָה דְּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן.
human_translation: When that was taught, thanksgiving, in Grace after Meals:
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the context of the blessing after the meal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל וְטָעָה — סִימָן רַע לוֹ. וְאִם שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר הוּא — סִימָן רַע לְשׁוֹלְחָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא שֶׁהָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל עַל הַחוֹלִים, וְאוֹמֵר: ״זֶה חַי, וְזֶה מֵת״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִנַּיִן אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ? אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם שְׁגוּרָה תְּפִלָּתִי בְּפִי — יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהוּא מְקוּבָּל. וְאִם לָאו — יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהוּא מְטוֹרָף.
human_translation: One who prays and erred a bad omen for him; And if he is the communal prayer leader, a bad omen for those who sent him, because a person’s agent equivalent to his own. they said about Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa that he would pray on the sick and say: This live and this die. they said to him: From where do you know? He said to them: If my prayer is fluent in my mouth I know that is accepted. And if not, I know that is rejected.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: one who prays and errs — it is a bad sign for him. And if he is the emissary of the congregation — it is a bad sign for his senders, because the emissary of a person is like himself. They said about Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa that he used to pray for the sick and say: "This one is alive, and this one is dead." They said to him: How do you know? He said to them: If my prayer is fluent in my mouth — I know that it is accepted. And if not — I know that it is rejected.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַהֵיָיא?
human_translation: In which blessing
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the case of Ahaiya?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא מִשּׁוּם חַד דְּבֵי רַבִּי: בְּ״אָבוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said Rav Safra said in the name of one of the school of Rabbi in Patriarchs
llm_translation: Rav Chiya said, Rav Safra said in the name of one of the House of Rabbi: in "Avot."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַבָּרַיְיתָא: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ בְּכוּלָּן, וְאִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְכַוֵּין בְּכוּלָּן — יְכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ בְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Some teach this on a baraita One who prays must focus his heart in all And if he is unable to focus in all of them, he should focus his heart in one.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches the following Baraita: One who prays must direct his heart in all of them, and if he cannot direct his heart in all of them — he should direct his heart in one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא מִשּׁוּם חַד דְּבֵי רַבִּי: בְּ״אָבוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said Rav Safra said in the name of one of the school of Rabbi In Patriarchs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya said, Rabbi Safra said in the name of one of the scholars of the house of Rabbi: in "Avot."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְכוּ׳: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בּוֹרֵא נִיב שְׂפָתָיִם שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם לָרָחוֹק וְלַקָּרוֹב אָמַר ה׳ וּרְפָאתִיו״.
human_translation: They said about Rabbi Ḥanina From where are these matters, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: As the verse stated: “The Lord that creates the expression of the lips says, Peace, peace, to him that is far off and to him that is near; and I will heal him”
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Chanina and so forth: From where are these words? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: As the verse states: "He who creates the fruit of the lips, peace, peace to the far and to the near, says the Lord, and I will heal him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן לֹא נִתְנַבְּאוּ אֶלָּא לַמַּשִּׂיא בִּתּוֹ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, וְלָעוֹשֶׂה פְּרַקְמַטְיָא לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, וְלַמְהַנֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם מִנְּכָסָיו. אֲבָל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים עַצְמָן — ״עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אֱלֹהִים זוּלָתְךָ יַעֲשֶׂה לִמְחַכֵּה לוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said All the prophets only prophesied with regard to one who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar and to one who conducts business [ perakmatya ] on behalf of a Torah scholar as well as to one who to benefit a Torah scholar However, Torah scholars themselves, no eye has seen it, God, aside from You, who will do for those who await Him”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: All the prophets, all of them, were not prophesied except for the son of the leader for a Torah scholar, and for one who makes a patch for a Torah scholar, and for what reason does a Torah scholar benefit from his possessions. But Torah scholars themselves — "No eye has seen, O God, except for You, what He will do for the one who waits for Him."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן לֹא נִתְנַבְּאוּ אֶלָּא לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ, אֲבָל לְעוֹלָם הַבָּא, ״עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אֱלֹהִים זוּלָתְךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All the prophets only prophesied with regard to the days of the Messiah. However, with regard to the World-to-Come, “No eye has seen it, God, aside from You.”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: All the prophets all not prophesied except for the days of the Messiah, but for the World to Come, "Eye has not seen, O God, besides You."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בֵּין הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אֶלָּא שִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכוּיוֹת בִּלְבַד. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא יֶחְדַּל אֶבְיוֹן מִקֶּרֶב הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: And disagrees with Shmuel, as Shmuel said: The only between this world and the days of the Messiah is servitude to kingdoms alone. as it is stated: “For the poor shall not cease from the land”
llm_translation: Disagreement of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: There is no difference between this world and the days of the Messiah except for the subjugation of kingdoms alone. As it is stated: "For the needy shall not cease out of the land."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן לֹא נִתְנַבְּאוּ אֶלָּא לְבַעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה, אֲבָל צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִים ״עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אֱלֹהִים זוּלָתְךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All of the prophets only prophesied with regard to penitents but with regard to the full-fledged righteous “No eye has seen it, God, aside from You.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: All the prophets, all of them, were only prophesied for those who repent, but completely righteous individuals "Eye has not seen, O God, besides You."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מָקוֹם שֶׁבַּעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה עוֹמְדִין — צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִים אֵינָם עוֹמְדִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם לָרָחוֹק וְלַקָּרוֹב״. ״לָרָחוֹק״ בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר ״לַקָּרוֹב״.
human_translation: And this disagrees with Rabbi Abbahu As Rabbi Abbahu said: In the place where penitents stand, even the full-fledged righteous do not stand, as it is stated: “Peace, peace upon him who is far and him who is near.” him who is far, and thereafter him who is near,
