hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הַאי כְּשַׁרְתָּא מְבָרְכִין עִלָּוֵיהּ ״בּוֹרֵא עֲצֵי בְּשָׂמִים״, אֲבָל מִשְׁחָא כְּבִישָׁא — לָא. וְרַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִשְׁחָא כְּבִישָׁא, אֲבָל מִשְׁחָא טְחִינָא — לָא. נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ מִשְׁחָא טְחִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Over costus, one recites: Who creates fragrant trees, but oil pressed no, And Rav Kahana said: Even oil pressed but not oil ground. The Sages of Neharde’a say: Even oil ground,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: With regard to this type of wax, one recites the blessing "Who creates fragrant trees," but with regard to wax that is processed — no. And Rav Kahana said: Even with regard to processed wax, but with regard to wax that is crushed — no. The Nehardeans say: Even with regard to wax that is crushed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: הַאי סִמְלָק — מְבָרְכִין עִלָּוֵיהּ ״בּוֹרֵא עֲצֵי בְּשָׂמִים״. אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: הָנֵי חִלְפֵי דְיַמָּא — מְבָרְכִין עֲלַיְיהוּ ״בּוֹרֵא עֲצֵי בְּשָׂמִים״. אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״וְהִיא הֶעֱלָתַם הַגָּגָה וַתִּטְמְנֵם בְּפִשְׁתֵּי הָעֵץ״.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: Over this jasmine [ simlak ], one recites: Who creates fragrant trees. Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: Over these spikenards, the sea, one recites: Who creates fragrant trees. Mar Zutra said: What is the verse “She had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under the trees of flax”
llm_translation: Rav Gidel said in the name of Rav: concerning this type of wool garment - one recites the blessing "Who creates fragrant trees." Rav Chananel said in the name of Rav: those bundles of dates - one recites the blessing "Who creates fragrant trees." Mar Zutra said: what is the verse? "And she took them up to the roof and hid them in the flax stalks."

hebrew_text: רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא אָמַר: הַאי נַרְקוֹם דְּגִינוּנִיתָא — מְבָרְכִין עִלָּוֵיהּ ״בּוֹרֵא עֲצֵי בְשָׂמִים״. דְּדַבְרָא — ״בּוֹרֵא עִשְׂבֵי בְשָׂמִים״. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָנֵי סִיגְלֵי — מְבָרְכִין עֲלַיְיהוּ ״בּוֹרֵא עִשְׂבֵי בְשָׂמִים״. אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: הַאי מַאן דְּמוֹרַח בְּאֶתְרוֹגָא אוֹ בְּחַבּוּשָׁא אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁנָּתַן רֵיחַ טוֹב בַּפֵּירוֹת״.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya said: Over this garden daffodil one recites: Who creates fragrant trees, in the field, Who creates fragrant plants. Rav Sheshet said: Over violets one recites: Who creates fragrant plants. Mar Zutra said: One who smells a citron [ etrog ] or a quince recites: Blessed…who gave pleasant fragrance in fruits.
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: With regard to this fragrant herb - one recites the blessing "Who creates the trees of fragrance." Regarding a gourd - "Who creates the herbs of fragrance." Rav Sheshet said: Those myrtle branches - one recites the blessing "Who creates the herbs of fragrance" over them. Mar Zutra said: One who smells an etrog or a myrtle says, "Blessed is He who has given a pleasant fragrance to fruits."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מַאן דְּנָפֵיק בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן וְחָזֵי אִילָנֵי דְּקָא מְלַבְלְבִי, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁלֹּא חִיסֵּר בְּעוֹלָמוֹ כְּלוּם וּבָרָא בּוֹ בְּרִיּוֹת טוֹבוֹת וְאִילָנוֹת טוֹבוֹת לְהִתְנָאוֹת בָּהֶן בְּנֵי אָדָם״. אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמְּבָרְכִין עַל הָרֵיחַ? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל הַנְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּל יָהּ״. אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה נֶהֱנֵית מִמֶּנּוּ וְאֵין הַגּוּף נֶהֱנֶה מִמֶּנּוּ? — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה הָרֵיחַ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: One who goes out during Nisan and sees trees that are blossoming recites: Blessed…who has withheld nothing from His world, and has created in it beautiful creatures and trees for human beings to enjoy. Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said: From where that one recites a blessing over scent? As it is stated: “Let every soul praise the Lord” What is it from which the soul derives benefit and the body does not derive benefit from it? You must say: That is scent.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: One who goes out in the days of Nisan and sees the trees budding, should say: "Blessed is He who did not withhold anything from His world, and created within it good creatures and good trees for people to enjoy." Rav Zutra bar Toviyya said in the name of Rav: From where do we learn to recite a blessing on a fragrance? — As it is stated: "Let every soul praise the Lord." What is something that the soul benefits from and the body does not benefit from? — One should say: This is fragrance.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: עֲתִידִים בַּחוּרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיִּתְּנוּ רֵיחַ טוֹב כַּלְּבָנוֹן. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵלְכוּ יוֹנְקוֹתָיו וִיהִי כַזַּיִת הוֹדוֹ וְרֵיחַ לוֹ כַּלְּבָנוֹן״.
human_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said: The young men of Israel are destined to emit a sweet scent as the Lebanon, as it is stated: “His branches shall spread and his beauty will be as the olive tree, and his fragrance as Lebanon”
llm_translation: And said Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said Rav: In the future, the young men of Israel will give off a good fragrance like Lebanon. As it is stated: "His shoots shall go forth, and his beauty shall be like the olive tree, and his fragrance like Lebanon."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אֶת הַכֹּל עָשָׂה יָפֶה בְעִתּוֹ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד יִפָּה לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אוּמָּנוּתוֹ בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said: What is that which is written: “He has made everything beautiful in its time, teaches that each and every individual, God has made his work pleasant for him in his own eyes.
llm_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Toviya said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of the verse, "He has made everything beautiful in its time"? - This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, has made each and every one beautiful in His own craftsmanship.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: ״תְּלֵה לֵיהּ קוֹרָא לְדָבָר אַחֵר, וְאִיהוּ דִּידֵיהּ עָבֵיד״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This is that people say: Hang a heart of palm on a pig, and he will to perform his
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This is what people say: "Hang a verse for it on another matter, and he himself will do it."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: אֲבוּקָה כִּשְׁנַיִם, וְיָרֵחַ כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אֲבוּקָה כִּשְׁנַיִם בַּהֲדֵי דִידֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא אֲבוּקָה כִּשְׁנַיִם לְבַר מִדִּידֵיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: וְיָרֵחַ כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּהֲדֵי דִידֵיהּ — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְבַר מִדִּידֵיהּ, אַרְבָּעָה לְמָה לִי? וְהָאָמַר מָר: לְאֶחָד נִרְאֶה וּמַזִּיק, לִשְׁנַיִם נִרְאֶה וְאֵינוֹ מַזִּיק, לִשְׁלֹשָׁה אֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה כׇּל עִיקָּר. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֲבוּקָה כִּשְׁנַיִם — בַּהֲדֵי דִידֵיהּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said: a torch it is like two and moon is like three. raises a dilemma: Is a torch like two including or perhaps a torch is like two besides him Come and hear And the moon is like three. Granted, if you say including him, well. However, if you say besides him, why do I need four, Didn’t the Master say: To one can be seen and cause harm. To two and cause harm. To three it cannot be seen at all. Rather, can’t we learn from this a torch is like two, including him. conclude from this.
llm_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav: A cloud is like two, and a moon is like three. They asked: Is a cloud like two in its own right, or perhaps a cloud is like two in comparison to the sun? Come and hear: And a moon is like three, if you say in its own right — it is well. But if you say in comparison to the sun, why do I need four? And Mar said: To one it appears and harms, to two it appears and does not harm, to three it does not appear at all. Rather, isn't it clear from this that a cloud is like two in its own right? It is clear from this.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵרוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן? — מִתָּמָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִיא מוּצֵאת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said; and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna said Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said; and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is preferable, for one to throw himself into a fiery furnace rather than humiliate another in public. From where do we From Tamar, as it is stated: “As she was brought forth,
llm_translation: And Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rav Hana bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is better for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace than to shame his fellow in public. From where do we derive this? - From a palm tree, as it is stated: "She finds it..." (Proverbs 3:13).

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֵבִיאוּ לְפָנָיו שֶׁמֶן וַהֲדַס, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַהֲדַס. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַהֲדַס וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אֲנִי אַכְרִיעַ. שֶׁמֶן — זָכִינוּ לְרֵיחוֹ וְזָכִינוּ לְסִיכָתוֹ, הֲדַס — לְרֵיחוֹ זָכִינוּ לְסִיכָתוֹ לֹא זָכִינוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְרִיעַ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: they brought before him oil and myrtle Beit Shammai say: One recites a blessing over the oil and over the myrtle thereafter And Beit Hillel say: One recites a blessing over the myrtle and over the oil thereafter. Rabban Gamliel said: I will decide oil; we are privileged its fragrance and we are privileged anointing it. myrtle we are privileged its fragrance, we are not privileged anointing it. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with the decisor,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: They brought before him oil and myrtle branches. Beit Shammai say: One recites a blessing over the oil and then recites a blessing over the myrtle branches. Beit Hillel say: One recites a blessing over the myrtle branches and then recites a blessing over the oil. Rabban Gamliel said: I will decide. Oil—we have benefited from its fragrance and we have benefited from its use; myrtle branches—we have benefited from their fragrance but we have not benefited from their use. Rabbi Yochanan said: The halakha is in accordance with the words of the one who decides.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא. אַיְיתוֹ לְקַמַּיְיהוּ שֶׁמֶן וַהֲדַס. שְׁקַל רַב פָּפָּא בָּרֵיךְ אַהֲדַס בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר בָּרֵיךְ אַשֶּׁמֶן. אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְרִיעַ? אָמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל. וְלָא הִיא, לְאִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: Rav Pappa happened to the house of Rav Huna, son of Rav Ika. They brought before him oil and myrtle Rav Pappa took and recited a blessing myrtle branch first and then recited a blessing oil. said to him: does the Master not hold the halakha is in accordance the decisor? Rava said the following: The halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel. That is not so, Rather, Rav Pappa did in order to extricate himself
llm_translation: Rav Papa entered the house of Rav Huna, son of Rav Ika. They brought before them oil and myrtle branches. Rav Papa took the myrtle branches first, and then took the oil. He said to him: Does the master not hold the halakha according to the decisive ruling? He said to him: So said Rava: The halakha is according to Beit Hillel. And it is not, for he acted to calm his own conscience.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֵבִיאוּ לִפְנֵיהֶם שֶׁמֶן וְיַיִן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אוֹחֵז הַשֶּׁמֶן בִּימִינוֹ וְאֶת הַיַּיִן בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן וְחוֹזֵר וּמְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן. בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹחֵז אֶת הַיַּיִן בִּימִינוֹ וְאֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְחוֹזֵר וּמְבָרֵךְ עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן, וְטָחוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַשַּׁמָּשׁ. וְאִם שַׁמָּשׁ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא — טָחוֹ בַּכּוֹתֶל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁגְּנַאי לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם לָצֵאת לַשּׁוּק כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבוּשָּׂם.
human_translation: Our Sages taught they brought before them oil and wine, Beit Shammai say: He grasps the oil in his right and the wine in his left He recites a blessing over the oil and then he recites a blessing over the wine. Beit Hillel say He grasps the wine in his right and the oil in his left He recites a blessing over the wine and then he recites a blessing over the oil. And he smears on the head of the servant And if the servant is a Torah scholar, he smears on the wall, as it is unbecoming for a Torah scholar to go out perfumed into the marketplace.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: They brought before them oil and wine. Beit Shammai say: One holds the oil in his right hand and the wine in his left, he blesses over the oil and then goes back and blesses over the wine. Beit Hillel say: One holds the wine in his right hand and the oil in his left, he blesses over the wine and then goes back and blesses over the oil, and he anoints on the head of the sun. And if the student is a Torah scholar, he anoints on the wall, because it is disgraceful for a Torah scholar to go out to the marketplace when he is perfumed.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים גְּנַאי לוֹ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם: אַל יֵצֵא כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבוּשָּׂם לַשּׁוּק, וְאַל יֵצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאַל יֵצֵא בְּמִנְעָלִים הַמְטוּלָּאִים, וְאַל יְסַפֵּר עִם אִשָּׁה בַּשּׁוּק, וְאַל יָסֵב בַּחֲבוּרָה שֶׁל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ, וְאַל יִכָּנֵס בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף לֹא יַפְסִיעַ פְּסִיעָה גַּסָּה, וְאַל יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה.
human_translation: the Sages taught Six things are disgraceful for a Torah scholar: He may not go out perfumed into the marketplace; he may not go out alone at night; he may not go out patched shoes; he may not converse with a woman in the marketplace; he may not recline in the company of ignoramuses; and he may not be the last to enter the study hall. And some say he may not take long strides and he may not walk with an upright posture.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Six things bring disgrace to a Torah scholar: He should not go out when he is disheveled to the marketplace, and he should not go out alone at night, and he should not go out wearing patched sandals, and he should not engage in conversation with a woman in the marketplace, and he should not associate with the common people, and he should not enter the study hall last. Some say: He should not even take a large stride, and he should not walk with an erect posture.

hebrew_text: אַל יֵצֵא כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבוּשָּׂם לַשּׁוּק: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁחֲשׁוּדִים עַל מִשְׁכַּב זָכוּר. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּבִגְדוֹ, אֲבָל בְּגוּפוֹ — זֵיעָה מְעַבְּרָא לֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּשְׂעָרוֹ כְּבִגְדוֹ דָּמֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּגוּפוֹ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: He may not go out perfumed into the marketplace; Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in a place where they are suspected of homosexuality. Rav Sheshet said: We only said this with regard to his clothing but with regard to his body, his sweat causes the fragrance to dissipate. Rav Pappa said: his hair is like his clothing. And some say: His hair is like his body.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Do not go out when he is in a state of confusion to the market." Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "In a place where there are suspicions regarding a male's bed." Rav Sheshet said: "We only said this regarding his garment, but regarding his body - sweat is equivalent to it." Rav Papa said: "And his hair is like his garment, and some say it is like his body."

hebrew_text: וְאַל יֵצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה: מִשּׁוּם חֲשָׁדָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ עִידָּנָא, אֲבָל קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ עִידָּנָא — מִידָּע יְדִיעַ דִּלְעִידָּנֵיהּ קָא אָזֵיל.
human_translation: He may not go out alone at night because of suspicion And this was only if he does not have a set time but he has a set time, knows that he is going to his set time,
llm_translation: And should not go out individual at night because of suspicion. And not said except that not established for him testimony, but established for him testimony — immediately goes from his testimony.

hebrew_text: וְאַל יֵצֵא בְּמִנְעָלִים הַמְטוּלָּאִים: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: גְּנַאי הוּא לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁיֵּצֵא בְּמִנְעָלִים הַמְטוּלָּאִים. אִינִי? וְהָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא נָפֵיק! אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: בִּטְלַאי עַל גַּבֵּי טְלַאי. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּפַנְתָּא, אֲבָל בְּגִילְדָּא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וּבְפַנְתָּא לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּאוֹרְחָא, אֲבָל בְּבֵיתָא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, אֲבָל בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: He may not go out patched shoes. supports Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: It is disgraceful for a Torah scholar to go out patched shoes. Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba go out Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: a patch upon a patch. And we only said this with regard to the upper but on the sole, this does not And with regard to the upper we only said this on the road, but in his house, we need not And we only said this with regard to the summer but during the rainy season, we need not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one should not go out with sandals that are nailed. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba supports him. For Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: It is disgraceful for a Torah scholar to go out with nailed sandals. Is it not so? But Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba did go out with them! Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: On a plastered surface, one may go out with nailed sandals. And we only said this regarding a path, but on a bridge - we may not go out with them. And we only said this regarding a public domain, but in a private domain - we may not go out with them. And we only said this regarding sunny days, but on rainy days - we may not go out with them.

hebrew_text: וְאַל יְסַפֵּר עִם אִשָּׁה בַּשּׁוּק: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא אִשְׁתּוֹ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֲפִילּוּ הִיא אִשְׁתּוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא בִּתּוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא אֲחוֹתוֹ — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בִּקְרוֹבוֹתָיו.
human_translation: He may not converse with a woman in the marketplace. Rav Ḥisda said: Even if she is his wife. This was also taught even if she is his wife, even if she is his daughter and even if she is his sister, not everyone is well-versed in his female relatives
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one should not converse with a woman in the marketplace. Rav Ḥisda said: Even if she is his wife. It was also taught in a baraita: Even if she is his wife, and even if she is his daughter, and even if she is his sister—because not everyone is knowledgeable about his relatives.

hebrew_text: וְאַל יָסֵב בַּחֲבוּרָה שֶׁל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ: מַאי טַעְמָא? — דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאִמְּשׁוֹכֵי בָּתְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: He may not recline in the company of ignoramuses. What is the reason? Perhaps he will be drawn after them
llm_translation: "And one should not sit in the company of the common people of the land. What is the reason? Perhaps one will come to imitate their behavior."

hebrew_text: וְאַל יִכָּנֵס בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ ״פּוֹשֵׁעַ״.
human_translation: He may not be the last to enter the study hall. Because they call him negligent,
llm_translation: "And one should not enter last into the study hall, because they called him a 'transgressor'."

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים, אַף לֹא יַפְסִיעַ פְּסִיעָה גַּסָּה: דְּאָמַר מָר, פְּסִיעָה גַּסָּה נוֹטֶלֶת אֶחָד מֵחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת מִמְּאוֹר עֵינָיו שֶׁל אָדָם. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לַהְדְּרֵיהּ בְּקִדּוּשָׁא דְבֵי שִׁמְשֵׁי.
human_translation: And some say he may not take long strides, as the Master said: A long stride takes one five-hundredth of a person’s eyesight. What is his remedy He can restore it kiddush on eve.
llm_translation: And some say, even a large step should not be taken, as Mar said, a large step takes away one out of five hundred of the light of a person's eyes. What is its remedy? To honor it with the sanctity of the house of the ministers.

hebrew_text: וְאַל יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה: דְּאָמַר מָר הַמְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, כְּאִילּוּ דּוֹחֵק רַגְלֵי שְׁכִינָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״מְלֹא כׇל הָאָרֶץ כְּבוֹדוֹ״.
human_translation: And he may not walk with an upright posture, as the Master said: One who walks with an upright posture even four cubits, as if he is pushing away the feet of the Divine Presence, it is written: “The entire world is full of His glory”
llm_translation: And one should not walk on a raised platform, for Mar said: One who walks on a raised platform, even four cubits, as if he is pushing away the feet of the Divine Presence, as it is written: "The whole earth is full of His glory."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֵבִיאוּ לְפָנָיו מָלִיחַ תְּחִלָּה וּפַת עִמּוֹ — מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַמָּלִיחַ וּפוֹטֵר אֶת הַפַּת, שֶׁהַפַּת טְפֵלָה לוֹ. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא עִיקָּר וְעִמּוֹ טְפֵלָה — מְבָרֵךְ עַל הָעִיקָּר וּפוֹטֵר אֶת הַטְּפֵלָה.
human_translation: they brought salted before him first and bread with it, he recites a blessing over the salted and exempts the bread, because the bread is secondary to it. This is the principle: Any that is primary and a secondary is with it, one recites a blessing over the primary and, exempts the secondary
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one brings before him salt first and bread with it, he blesses over the salt and exempts the bread, because the bread is subsidiary to it. This is the principle: whenever the main item is accompanied by a subsidiary item, one blesses over the main item and exempts the subsidiary item.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵי מָלִיחַ עִיקָּר וּפַת טְפֵלָה? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב עַוִּירָא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּאוֹכְלֵי פֵּירוֹת גִּנּוֹסַר שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: And is there a where salted food is primary and bread is secondary? Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avira, said Rav Ashi said: was taught with regard to those who eat fruits of Genosar,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is there anyone who can say that it is due to the fact that he is eating the main dish and the bread is secondary? Rav Acha, son of Rav Avira, said that Rav Ashei said: With regard to those who eat fruits, the bread is secondary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: כִּי הֲוָה אָזְלִינַן בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְמֵיכַל פֵּירוֹת גִּנּוֹסַר, כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי מְאָה — מְנַקְּטִינַן לֵיהּ לְכֹל חַד וְחַד עַשְׂרָה עַשְׂרָה, וְכִי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי עַשְׂרָה, מְנַקְּטִינַן לֵיהּ כֹּל חַד וְחַד מְאָה מְאָה. וְכׇל מְאָה מִינַּיְיהוּ הֲוָה מַחֲזִיק לְהוּ צַנָּא בַּר תְּלָתָא סָאוֵי וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ, וּמִשְׁתְּבַע דְּלָא טְעֵים זִיּוּנָא. זִיּוּנָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא ״מְזוֹנָא״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: When we would go after Rabbi Yoḥanan to eat fruits of Genosar, when we were one hundred each and every one of us would bring him ten and when we were ten each and every one of us would bring him one hundred and every hundred of would basket of three se’a to hold them. eat them and to swear that he had not tasted food. Does it enter your mind he had not tasted food? Rather, say sustenance.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: When we would go after Rabbi Yoḥanan to the orchard of Ginosar, when we were one hundred in number, we would pick for him each and every ten, and when we were ten, we would pick for him each and every one hundred. And all one hundred of them would suffice for him a basket of three se’a, and he would eat them, and he would not taste any degradation. Degradation, is it in your mind?! Rather say, "provision."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָכֵיל עַד דַּהֲוָה שָׁרֵיק לֵיהּ דּוּדְבָא מֵאַפּוּתֵיהּ. וְרַב אַמֵּי וְרַב אַסִּי הֲווֹ אָכְלִי עַד דִּנְתוּר מָזַיְיהוּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ הֲוָה אָכֵיל עַד דְּמָרֵיד. וְאָמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לִדְבֵי נְשִׂיאָה וַהֲוָה מְשַׁדַּר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה בָּאלוֹשֵׁי אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, וּמַיְיתִי לֵיהּ לְבֵיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu ate until a fly would slip from his forehead. And Rav Ami and Rav Asi would eat until their hair fell out. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish would eat them until he became confused. And Rabbi Yoḥanan would tell the household of the Nasi and Rabbi Yehuda Nesia would send the authorities after him and they would take him to his house.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu would eat until a hornet would whistle from his apple. And Rav Amei and Rav Assi would eat until their napkins were wiped. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish would eat until he became satiated. And Rabbi Yochanan said to the household of the Nasi, and he would send to him Rabbi Yehudah the Nasi with the radishes of his father-in-law, and he would bring them to his house.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: עִיר אַחַת הָיְתָה לוֹ לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּהַר הַמֶּלֶךְ, שֶׁהָיוּ מוֹצִיאִים מִמֶּנָּה שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא סִפְלֵי טָרִית לְקוֹצְצֵי תְּאֵנִים מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: King Yannai had a city on the King’s Mountain, from which they would take six-hundred thousand bowls of sardines for those cutting figs trees from Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Yanai the king had a city on the Mountain of the King, from which they would bring out sixty myriads of barrels of Tyrian wine for the trimmers of figs from Friday evening to Friday evening.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: אִילָן אֶחָד הָיָה לוֹ לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּהַר הַמֶּלֶךְ, שֶׁהָיוּ מוֹרִידִים מִמֶּנּוּ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה גּוֹזָלוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ בְּרֵיכוֹת בְּחֹדֶשׁ. כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: עִיר אַחַת הָיְתָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוּפְנִית שְׁמָהּ, שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהּ שְׁמֹנִים זוּגוֹת אַחִים כֹּהֲנִים נְשׂוּאִים לִשְׁמֹנִים זוּגוֹת אֲחָיוֹת כֹּהֲנוֹת. וּבְדַקוּ רַבָּנַן מִסּוּרָא וְעַד נְהַרְדָּעָא וְלָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ בַּר מִבְּנָתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, דַּהֲווֹ נְסִיבָן לְרָמִי בַּר חָמָא וּלְמָר עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִינְהִי הֲווֹ כָּהֲנָתָא, אִינְהוּ לָא הֲווֹ כָּהֲנֵי.
human_translation: when Rav Dimi came he said: King Yannai had a tree on the King’s Mountain from which they would remove forty se’a of pigeons from three broods each month. When Rabbi Yitzḥak came he said: There was a city in Eretz Yisrael named Gufnit, in which there were eighty pairs of brothers who were priests, married to eighty pairs of sisters, who were all from priestly And The Sages checked from Sura to Neharde’a, and with the exception of the daughters of Rav Ḥisda, who were married to Rami bar Ḥama and Mar Ukva bar Ḥama, they could not find And, although they, were a priest, they, were not priests.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: Yanai the king had one tree on the Mount of the King, from which they would bring down forty se'ah of its produce from three pools every month. When Rabbi Yitzchak came, he said: There was a city in the land of Israel called Gufnit, in which there were eighty pairs of brothers, priests, married to eighty pairs of their sisters, priestesses. The Rabbis searched from Sura to Nehardea and did not find the son of Rav Chisda's daughter, who was married to Rami bar Hama and Uqva bar Hama. Even though she was not a priestess, they were not priests.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: כׇּל סְעוּדָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מֶלַח, אֵינָהּ סְעוּדָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל סְעוּדָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שְׂרִיף, אֵינָהּ סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav said: Any meal in which there is no salt is not a meal. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any meal in which there is no gravy is not a meal.
llm_translation: Rav said: Every meal that does not have salt, is not a meal. Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Every meal that does not have garlic, is not a meal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָכַל עֲנָבִים וּתְאֵנִים וְרִמּוֹנִים — מְבָרֵךְ אַחֲרֵיהֶם שָׁלֹשׁ בְּרָכוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּרָכָה אַחַת מֵעֵין שָׁלֹשׁ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אָכַל שֶׁלֶק וְהוּא מְזוֹנוֹ — מְבָרֵךְ עָלָיו שָׁלֹשׁ בְּרָכוֹת. הַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם לִצְמָאוֹ — מְבָרֵךְ ״שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיָה בִּדְבָרוֹ״. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״בּוֹרֵא נְפָשׁוֹת רַבּוֹת וְחֶסְרוֹנָן״.
human_translation: One who ate grapes and figs and pomegranates, recites three blessings the statement of Rabban Gamliel. And the Rabbis say: one blessing abridged from three Rabbi Akiva says: even one ate boiled vegetables, but it is his sustenance, he recites three blessings One who drinks water his thirst recites: By whose word all things came to be. Rabbi Tarfon says: Who creates the many forms of life and their needs.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who eats grapes, figs, and pomegranates - he recites three blessings after them, the words of Rabban Gamliel. And the Sages say: one blessing that is like three. Rabbi Akiva says: even if one eats vegetables as his meal - he recites three blessings over them. One who drinks water due to his thirst - he recites "Blessed is He by whose word all things exist." Rabbi Tarfon says: "Who creates many living beings and their deficiencies."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶרֶץ חִטָּה וּשְׂעֹרָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״אֶרֶץ אֲשֶׁר לֹא בְמִסְכֵּנֻת תֹּאכַל בָּהּ לֶחֶם וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ וּבֵרַכְתָּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabban Gamliel? As it is written “A land of wheat and barley, and it is written: “A land in which you will eat bread without scarcity” and it is written: “And you will eat and be satisfied and then you shall bless the Lord your God
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for Rabban Gamliel? As it is written: "A land of wheat and barley, etc." And it is written: "A land which you will not lack anything in, it will not lack anything in it, a land whose stones are iron, and from its mountains you will mine copper." And it is written: "And you shall eat and be satisfied, and you shall bless the Lord your God."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן ״אֶרֶץ״ הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נָמֵי ״אֶרֶץ״ הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן! הָהוּא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי הַכּוֹסֵס אֶת הַחִטָּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis “A land concluded that matter, And Rabban Gamliel as well, “land” conclude that matter? Rather, that is necessary to exclude one who chews wheat
llm_translation: The sages interrupted the matter with the word "land." And Rabban Gamliel the Elder also interrupted the matter with the word "land"! That one wanted to exclude those who gather the wheat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין, בַּתְּחִלָּה — מְבָרֵךְ עָלָיו ״בּוֹרֵא מִינֵי מְזוֹנוֹת״, וּלְבַסּוֹף — בְּרָכָה אַחַת מֵעֵין שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Anything that is from the five species at the start, one recites over it: Who creates the various kinds of nourishment, and at the end, one blessing abridged from three
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said Rabbi Chanina: Anyone who is from the five species, at the beginning - he blesses upon it "Who creates various kinds of sustenance," and in the end - one blessing similar to three.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר מָרִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מִשִּׁבְעַת הַמִּינִין, בַּתְּחִלָּה — מְבָרֵךְ ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הָעֵץ״, וּלְבַסּוֹף — בְּרָכָה אַחַת מֵעֵין שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Mari said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anything that is from the seven species at the start, one recites over it: Who creates fruit of the tree, and afterward and at the end, one blessing abridged from three
llm_translation: Rabba bar Mari said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Anyone who is from the seven species, at the beginning - he blesses "Who creates the fruit of the tree," and at the end - one blessing similar to three.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: מַאי נִיהוּ ״בְּרָכָה אַחַת מֵעֵין שָׁלֹשׁ״? אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַפֵּירֵי דְעֵץ ״עַל הָעֵץ וְעַל פְּרִי הָעֵץ, וְעַל תְּנוּבַת הַשָּׂדֶה, וְעַל אֶרֶץ חֶמְדָּה טוֹבָה וּרְחָבָה שֶׁהִנְחַלְתָּ לַאֲבוֹתֵינוּ לֶאֱכוֹל מִפִּרְיָהּ וְלִשְׂבּוֹעַ מִטּוּבָהּ. רַחֵם ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל עַמֶּךָ, וְעַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עִירֶךָ, וְעַל מִקְדָּשְׁךָ, וְעַל מִזְבְּחֶךָ. וְתִבְנֶה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עִיר קׇדְשְׁךָ בִּמְהֵרָה בְּיָמֵינוּ. וְהַעֲלֵנוּ לְתוֹכָהּ, וְשַׂמְּחֵנוּ בָּהּ. כִּי אַתָּה טוֹב וּמֵטִיב לַכֹּל״.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Dimi: What is the one blessing abridged from three Over fruits of a tree one recites: For the tree and the fruit of the tree, and for the produce of the field, and for the desirable, good and spacious land that you gave as a heritage to our ancestors that they might eat of its fruit and be satisfied with its goodness. Have compassion, Lord our God, upon Israel Your people and upon Jerusalem Your city, and upon Your Temple and upon Your altar. May You rebuild Jerusalem, Your holy city, swiftly in our time, and may You bring us back there rejoicing in it as You are good and do good to all.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Dimi: What is the meaning of "one blessing resembling three"? He said to him: The blessings of the land, "on the tree and on the fruit of the tree, and on the produce of the field, and on the good and spacious land that You have given to our ancestors to eat of its fruit and be satisfied with its goodness. Have mercy, Lord our God, on Israel Your people, on Jerusalem Your city, on Your sanctuary, and on Your altar. And rebuild Jerusalem, the city of Your holiness, speedily in our days. And bring us up into it, and make us rejoice in it. For You are good and beneficent to all."

hebrew_text: דַּחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין: ״עַל הַמִּחְיָה וְעַל הַכַּלְכָּלָה וְעַל תְּנוּבַת הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּ׳״. וְחוֹתֵם: ״עַל הָאָרֶץ וְעַל הַמִּחְיָה״.
human_translation: five species For the nourishment and sustenance and for the produce of the field, and he concludes: For the land and for the nourishment.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Of the five species: 'On the beast and on the cattle and on the produce of the field, etc.' And the seal: 'On the land and on the beast.'"

hebrew_text: מִיחְתָּם בְּמַאי חָתֵים? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: רַב חָתֵים בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ ״בָּרוּךְ מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים״, הָכָא מַאי?
human_translation: conclusion, with what does he conclude When Rav Dimi came he said: Rav conclude on the New Moon: Blessed…Who sanctifies Israel and the New Moons. What here?
llm_translation: Their discussion was about what they seal with? When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rav seals on Rosh Chodesh "Blessed is He who sanctifies Israel and the beginnings of months." What is the case here?

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: ״עַל הָאָרֶץ וְעַל פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״עַל הָאָרֶץ וְעַל הַפֵּירוֹת״. אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא לַן, וְהָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: For the land and for its fruits. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For the land and for the fruits. Rav Amram said: They do not disagree; this for us, and this them,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "On the land and its fruits." And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: "On the land and the fruits." Rav Amram said, and they do not disagree: This one for us, and that one for them.

hebrew_text: מַתְקִיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אִינְהוּ אָכְלִי, וַאֲנַן מְבָרְכִין?! אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר ״עַל הָאָרֶץ וְעַל הַפֵּירוֹת״, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר ״עַל הָאָרֶץ וְעַל פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak strongly objects: They, eat and we, recite a blessing? Rather, reverse Rav Ḥisda said: For the land and for the fruits, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For the land and for its fruits.
llm_translation: Challenges to her, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: They ate, and we bless?! Rather, the opposite: Rav Chisda said "on the land and on the fruits," Rabbi Yochanan said "on the land and on its fruits."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: עַל הַבֵּיעָא וְעַל מִינֵי קוּפְרָא, בַּתְּחִלָּה מְבָרֵךְ ״שֶׁהַכֹּל״, וּלְבַסּוֹף ״בּוֹרֵא נְפָשׁוֹת רַבּוֹת וְכוּ׳״. אֲבָל יַרְקָא לָא. וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ יַרְקָא, אֲבָל מַיָּא — לָא. וְרַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מַיָּא.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said in the name of Rabbeinu, Over the egg and types of meat [ kupra ], at the start, one recites: By Whose word all things came to be, and at the end: Who creates the many forms of life. However, vegetables, no, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Even vegetables but water, no, And Rav Pappa said: Even water
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said in the name of our teacher: Regarding eggs and various types of liver, initially one recites "Shehakol" and in the end "Borei Nefashot Rabbot, etc." But regarding vegetables, no. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Even regarding vegetables, but not water. And Rav Papa said: Even water.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא עָבֵיד כְּרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, וְרַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי עָבֵיד כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק. וְסִימָנָךְ: חַד כִּתְרֵי, וּתְרֵי כְּחַד.
human_translation: Mar Zutra acted in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi Rav Shimi bar Ashi acted in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak And a mnemonic One like two, and two like one.
llm_translation: Mar Zutra acted like Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi, and Rav Shimi bar Ashe acted like Rabbi Yitzchak. And your mnemonic: one is like two, and two like one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנָא, זִמְנָא דְּכִי מִדְּכַרְנָא, עָבֵידְנָא כְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: At times when I remember, I act in accordance with all of them
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: I, the time when I remember, I do all of them.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כׇּל שֶׁטָּעוּן בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרָיו — טָעוּן בְּרָכָה לְפָנָיו, וְיֵשׁ שֶׁטָּעוּן בְּרָכָה לְפָנָיו, וְאֵין טָעוּן בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרָיו. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, לְאַפּוֹקֵי יַרְקָא. לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַיָּא, אֶלָּא לְרַב פָּפָּא, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי?
human_translation: We learned Anything that requires a blessing thereafter requires a blessing beforehand; and there are that require a blessing beforehand and do not require a blessing thereafter. granted, according to Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi’s excludes vegetables according to Rabbi Yitzḥak’s excludes water However, according to Rav Pappa’s opinion, what does it exclude?
llm_translation: We learned: Anyone who is obligated in a blessing after him - is obligated in a blessing before him, and there are those who are obligated in a blessing before him, but not obligated in a blessing after him. According to Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi, to wash vegetables. According to Rabbi Yitzchak, to wash hands. Rather, according to Rav Papa, to wash what?

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִצְוֹת.
human_translation: to exclude mitzvot,
llm_translation: To fulfill commandments.

hebrew_text: וְלִבְנֵי מַעַרְבָא, דְּבָתַר דִּמְסַלְּקִי תְּפִילַּיְיהוּ מְבָרְכִי ״אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ לִשְׁמוֹר חֻקָּיו״, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי?
human_translation: And for the residents of the West, who, after they remove their phylacteries, recite: Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and commanded us to keep His laws, what come to exclude?
llm_translation: To the sons of Ma'arva, after they remove their tefillin, they bless "Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to observe His statutes," what is the law?

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי רֵיחָנֵי.
human_translation: to exclude fragrances.
llm_translation: To go out to smell the fragrance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר רַבִּי: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא כְּבֵיצָה — בֵּיצָה טוֹבָה מִמֶּנּוּ. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: טָבָא בֵּיעֲתָא מְגוּלְגַּלְתָּא מִשִּׁיתָּא קְיָיסֵי סוּלְתָּא. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: טָבָא בֵּיעֲתָא מְגוּלְגַּלְתָּא — מִשִּׁיתָּא, מִטְּוִיתָא — מֵאַרְבַּע, מְבוּשַׁלְתָּא — כֹּל שֶׁהוּא כְּבֵיצָה, בֵּיצָה טוֹבָה הֵימֶנּוּ, לְבַר מִבִּשְׂרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said Rabbi said: Anything that is an egg’s equivalent an egg is superior to it. when Ravin came he said: A lightly cooked egg is better than six log of fine flour. when Rav Dimi came he said: A lightly cooked egg is better than six roasted four, cooked Anything that is an egg’s equivalent, an egg is superior to it except for meat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said in the name of Rabbi: Anything that is like an egg - an egg is better than it. When Ravin came, he said: A good egg is better than a rolled pastry made from fine flour. When Rav Dimi came, he said: A good egg is better than a rolled pastry - from fine flour, from coarse flour - from four, from cooked - anything that is like an egg, an egg is better than it, in terms of meat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר אֲפִילּוּ אָכַל שֶׁלֶק כּוּ׳: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה שֶׁלֶק מְזוֹנֵי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּקֶלַח שֶׁל כְּרוּב שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even one ate boiled vegetables, but it is his sustenance, he recites three blessings And is there a where in its boiled it is sustenance? Rav Ashi said: This was taught a cabbage stalk,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even if one ate the stomach lining (shelek) of an animal - Is there anything that sustains a person more than the stomach lining? Rav Ashi said: It is in the gizzard of a young bird that it differs.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: טְחוֹל יָפֶה לַשִּׁינַּיִם וְקָשֶׁה לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. כְּרֵישִׁין קָשִׁין לַשִּׁינַּיִם וְיָפִין לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. כׇּל יָרָק חַי מוֹרִיק, וְכׇל קָטָן מַקְטִין, וְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ מֵשִׁיב אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, וְכׇל קָרוֹב לַנֶּפֶשׁ מֵשִׁיב אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ. כְּרוּב לְמָזוֹן, וּתְרָדִין לִרְפוּאָה. אוֹי לוֹ לַבַּיִת שֶׁהַלֶּפֶת עוֹבֶרֶת בְּתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: the Sages taught spleen is beneficial for the teeth and harmful for the intestines. Leeks, are harmful for the teeth and beneficial for the intestines. all raw vegetables pale. anything small impedes growth, and any living creature restores the soul. And anything close to the soul restores the soul. Cabbage for nourishment and beets for healing. Woe unto the house through which the turnip passes,
llm_translation: The sages taught: Black cumin is good for the teeth and hard on the bowels. Leeks are hard on the teeth and good for the bowels. Every living green vegetable is purgative, and every small one causes contraction, and every soul restores the soul, and every relative to the soul restores the soul. Beets are for sustenance, and cabbage for healing. Woe to the household in which bread is passed around within it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: טְחוֹל יָפֶה לַשִּׁינַּיִם וְקָשֶׁה לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? נִלְעֲסֵיהּ וְנִשְׁדְּיֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Master said The spleen is beneficial for the teeth and harmful for the intestines. What is its remedy? One should chew it, and throw it away.
llm_translation: Master said: Fine flour for the teeth and hard for the intestines. What is its benefit? It is absorbed and excreted.

hebrew_text: כְּרֵישִׁין קָשִׁין לַשִּׁינַּיִם וְיָפִין לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לִשְׁלְקִינְהוּ וְנִבְלְעִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Leeks are harmful for the teeth and beneficial for the intestines. What is its remedy? One should boil them and swallow them
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'reishin kashin la'shinayim v'yafin livnei me'ayim. Maai takantei? Lishlekinehu v'nibla'inehu." English translation: "Cabbage is hard for the teeth and good for the intestines. What is its remedy? To boil it and swallow it."

hebrew_text: כׇּל יָרָק חַי מוֹרִיק, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: בִּסְעוּדָה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל אַחַר הַקָּזָה.
human_translation: All raw vegetables pale. Rabbi Yitzḥak said: to the first meal after bloodletting,
llm_translation: Every fresh vegetable is a stimulant, Rabbi Yitzchak said: at the first meal after the wedding feast.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל יָרָק קוֹדֶם אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת אָסוּר לְסַפֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם רֵיחָא. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיֹּאכַל יָרָק חַי קוֹדֶם אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who eats vegetables before four hours it is forbidden to speak with him. What is the reason? because the smell And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: It is forbidden to eat raw vegetables before four hours
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who eats vegetables before four hours have passed is forbidden to count them. What is the reason? Because of the smell. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: It is forbidden for a person to eat raw vegetables before four hours have passed.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי, אַיְיתוֹ קַמַּיְיהוּ יָרָק חַי קוֹדֶם אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת. אַמֵּימָר וְרַב אָשֵׁי אֲכוּל וּמָר זוּטְרָא לָא אֲכַל. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל יָרָק קוֹדֶם אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת אָסוּר לְסַפֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ מִשּׁוּם רֵיחָא? וְהָא אֲנַן דְּקָא אָכְלִינַן וְקָא מִשְׁתָּעֵית בַּהֲדַן!
human_translation: Ameimar, Mar Zutra, and Rav Ashi were sitting. They brought raw vegetables before them before four hours Ameimar and Rav Ashi ate and Mar Zutra did not eat. They said to him: What is your thinking Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who eats vegetables before four hours it is forbidden to speak with him because of the smell? Aren’t we eating and you are speaking with us?
llm_translation: Ammemar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashe were sitting. They brought before them fresh vegetables four hours before. Ammemar and Rav Ashe ate, but Mar Zutra did not eat. They said to him: What is your opinion? For Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who eats fresh vegetables four hours before is forbidden to count them because of their smell? But we are eating and enjoying them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא כְּאִידַּךְ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק סְבִירָא לִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיֹּאכַל יָרָק חַי קוֹדֶם אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: He said to them: I hold in accordance with the other Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak said It is forbidden to eat raw vegetables before four hours
llm_translation: He said to them: I, like your teacher Rabbi Yitzchak, hold the opinion. For Rabbi Yitzchak said: It is forbidden for a person to eat raw vegetables before four hours.

hebrew_text: כׇּל קָטָן מַקְטִין, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֲפִילּוּ גַּדְיָא בַּר זוּזָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ רִבְעָא, אֲבָל אִית בֵּיהּ רִבְעָא — לֵית לַן בָּהּ.
human_translation: Anything small impedes growth. Rav Ḥisda said: even to a small goat, a zuz . And we only said to has not one fourth But it has one fourth we need not
llm_translation: All minors, we diminish. Rav Ḥisda said: Even a goat of a coin. And we only said this when it does not have a quarter of its full value, but if it has a quarter of its full value — we do not diminish it.

hebrew_text: כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ מֵשִׁיב נֶפֶשׁ, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ גִּילְדָּנֵי דְּבֵי גִילֵי.
human_translation: And any living creature restores the soul. Rav Pappa said: even small fish among the reeds,
llm_translation: Every soul that answers another soul, Rav Papa said: Even the inhabitants of the city of Gildei.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַקָּרוֹב לַנֶּפֶשׁ מֵשִׁיב אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: עוּנְקָא. אָמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: כִּי מַיְיתֵית לִי אוּמְצָא דְּבִשְׂרָא, טְרַח וְאַיְיתִי לִי מֵהֵיכָא דִּמְקָרַב לְבֵי ״בָרוּךְ״.
human_translation: Anything close to the soul restores the soul. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: neck, Rava said to his servant: When you bring me a piece of meat, make an effort to bring me from the place of the blessing,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Everyone who is close to the soul, revives the soul," Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "U'nka." Rava said to him in response: "When you brought me a piece of meat, you made an effort and brought it to me from a place close to 'Baruch'."

hebrew_text: כְּרוּב לְמָזוֹן וּתְרָדִין לִרְפוּאָה. כְּרוּב לְמָזוֹן אִין, וְלִרְפוּאָה לָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים מְרַפְּאִין אֶת הַחוֹלֶה מֵחׇלְיוֹ וּרְפוּאָתָן רְפוּאָה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: כְּרוּב וּתְרָדִין וּמֵי סִיסִין דְּבַשׁ וְקֵיבָה וְהֶרֶת וְיוֹתֶרֶת הַכָּבֵד! אֶלָּא אֵימָא ״כְּרוּב אַף לְמָזוֹן״.
human_translation: Cabbage for nourishment and beets for healing. cabbage for nourishment and not for healing? Wasn’t it taught Six things cure the ill of his disease and their cure is an cure, and these are: Cabbage, beets, chamomile water, honey, stomach, heret , and liver. Rather, say: Cabbage is even for sustenance
llm_translation: Cherub for sustenance and Tardin for healing. Cherub for sustenance - no, and for healing - yes? But it was taught: Six things heal the sick from his illness, and their healing is a healing, and these are they: Cherub, Tardin, sycamore figs, honey, the liver, and the gallbladder! Rather say, "Cherub is also for sustenance."

hebrew_text: אוֹי לוֹ לַבַּיִת שֶׁהַלֶּפֶת עוֹבֶרֶת בְּתוֹכוֹ, אִינִי?! וְהָא אָמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: כִּי חָזֵית לִיפְתָּא בְּשׁוּקָא לָא תֵּימָא לִי ״בְּמַאי כָּרְכַתְּ רִיפְתָּא״!
human_translation: Woe unto the house through which the turnip passes, Is that so? Didn’t Rava say to his servant: When you see a turnip in the market, do not ask me with what will you eat your bread today?
llm_translation: Woe to the house in which the loaf passes through within it, is it not so?! And Rava said to his attendant: "When you see a loaf in the marketplace, do not say to me, 'With what should I buy this loaf?'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִבְּלִי בָּשָׂר. וְרָבָא אָמַר: מִבְּלִי יַיִן. אִיתְּמַר רַב אָמַר: מִבְּלִי בָּשָׂר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מִבְּלִי עֵצִים. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִבְּלִי יַיִן.
human_translation: Abaye said: without meat. And Rava said: Without wine. It was stated Rav said: without meat. And Shmuel said: Without wood, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Without wine.
llm_translation: Abaye said: from without meat. And Rava said: from without wine. It was stated: Rav said: from without meat. And Shmuel said: from without wood. And Rabbi Yochanan said: from without wine.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב פָּפָּא: סוּדָנִי, אֲנַן תָּבְרִינַן לַהּ בְּבִשְׂרָא וְחַמְרָא, אַתּוּן דְּלָא נְפִישׁ לְכוּ חַמְרָא בְּמַאי תָּבְרִיתוּ לַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּצִיבֵי, כִּי הָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא בָּתַר דִּמְבַשְּׁלָא לַהּ, תָּבְרָא לַהּ בִּתְמָנָן אוּפֵי פָּרְסְיָיתָא.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Pappa: Farmer we break with meat and wine. You, who do not have a lot of wine, with what do you break its said to him: With wood. As that Rav Pappa’s wife After she cooked she would break it with eighty pieces from a palm tree.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Papa: "Sudani, we cook for her with meat and wine, but you who do not cook for her with wine, with what will you cook for her?" He said to him: "With eggs, for when the household of Rav Papa finished cooking for her, they would prepare for her Persian dishes."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דָּג קָטָן מָלִיחַ פְּעָמִים שֶׁהוּא מֵמִית בְּשִׁבְעָה, בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר, וּבְעֶשְׂרִים וְשִׁבְעָה. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּמִטְּוֵי וְלָא מִטְּוֵי, אֲבָל מִטְּוֵי שַׁפִּיר — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וּדְלָא מִטְּוֵי שַׁפִּיר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא שְׁתָה בָּתְרֵיהּ שִׁכְרָא, אֲבָל שְׁתָה בָּתְרֵיהּ שִׁכְרָא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: the Sages taught A small salted fish sometimes kills, seven seventeen and twenty-seven And some say: Twenty-three. And we only said this when it is roasted and not roasted but roasted well, we need not And when it is not roasted well, we only said this when one does not drink beer thereafter; however, one drinks beer thereafter, we need not
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A small fish that is salted, it causes death in seven, seventeen, and twenty-seven. And some say: in twenty-three. And we only said this regarding a fish that was not rinsed, but if it was rinsed properly - we have no issue with it. And if it was not rinsed properly, we only said this because it did not drink beer afterwards, but if it drank beer afterwards - we have no issue with it.

hebrew_text: וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם לִצְמָאוֹ וְכוּ׳: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי? אֲמַר רַב אִידֵּי בַּר אָבִין: לְאַפּוֹקֵי לְמַאן
human_translation: drinks water his thirst. What does to exclude? Rav Idi bar Avin said: to exclude one
llm_translation: The one who drinks water due to thirst, etc.: To what is this comparable? Rav Idi bar Avin said: To what is this comparable?

hebrew_text: דַּחֲנַקְתֵּיהּ אוּמְצָא.
human_translation: who was choked by a piece of meat
llm_translation: His throat was constricted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר ״בּוֹרֵא נְפָשׁוֹת רַבּוֹת וְחֶסְרוֹנָן״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הִלְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק חֲזִי מַאי עַמָּא דָּבַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: Who creates the many forms of life and their needs. Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye, and some say to Rav Yosef: What is the halakha He said to him: Go out and observe what the people are doing
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says, "The Creator of many souls and their deficiencies." Rava son of Rav Hanan said to Abbaye, and some say to Rav Yosef: What is the halakha? He said to him: Go out and see what the people are saying.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כיצד מברכין
llm_translation: We will return to you, how do we bless.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת, חַיָּיבִין לְזַמֵּן. אָכַל דְּמַאי, וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ, וְהַשַּׁמָּשׁ שֶׁאָכַל כְּזַיִת, וְהַכּוּתִי — מְזַמְּנִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Three who ate as one are required to form a zimmun one ate doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ], and first tithe from which its teruma was taken, second tithe, and consecrated food that were redeemed and the waiter who ate an olive-bulk and the Samaritan [ Kuti ] to obligate in a zimmun .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three individuals who ate together are obligated to recite the Grace after Meals. If one ate produce subject to the uncertainty of tithing (d'mai), and the first tithe whose terumah was separated, the second tithe and consecrated items that were redeemed, and the attendant who ate an olive's worth, and the Kutite - one recites the Grace after Meals on their behalf.

hebrew_text: אָכַל טֶבֶל, וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ, וְהַשַּׁמָּשׁ שֶׁאָכַל פָּחוֹת מִכַּזַּיִת, וְהַנׇּכְרִי — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין עָלָיו. נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין עֲלֵיהֶן. עַד כַּמָּה מְזַמְּנִין? — עַד כְּזַיִת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: one who ate untithed produce [ tevel ], and first tithe from which its teruma was not separated, and second tithe, and consecrated food that were not redeemed, and the waiter who did not eat an olive-bulk, and the gentile to obligate in a zimmun . Women, slaves, and minors do not obligate in a zimmun . How much to obligate in a zimmun ? An olive-bulk Rabbi Yehuda says: An egg-bulk
llm_translation: He ate tevel, and the first tithe that its terumah was not taken, and the second tithe and consecrated items that were not redeemed, and the servant who ate less than an olive's worth, and a non-Jew - one does not appoint them to separate tithes. Women, slaves, and minors - one does not appoint them. How much do we appoint them? - Up to an olive's worth. Rabbi Yehudah says: Up to an egg's worth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״גַּדְּלוּ לַה׳ אִתִּי וּנְרוֹמְמָה שְׁמוֹ יַחְדָּו״. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ אֶקְרָא הָבוּ גֹדֶל לֵאלֹהֵינוּ״.
human_translation: From where are these matters , Rav Asi said: As the verse states: “Praise God with me, and we will exalt His name together” Rabbi Abbahu said: from here: “When I call the Name of the Lord, give praise to our God”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rav Assi: De'amar kra "Gadlu laHashem iti uneromemah shemo yachdav." Rabbi Avahu amar: Me'hacha: "Ki shem Hashem ekra havu go'del leEloheinu." English translation: What are these matters comparable to? Rav Assi said: As the verse says, "Magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt His name together." Rabbi Avahu said: From here: "For the name of the Lord I will call; ascribe greatness to our God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר אַבָּא: מִנַּיִן לָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ שֶׁלֹּא יַגְבִּיהַּ קוֹלוֹ יוֹתֵר מִן הַמְבָרֵךְ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּדְּלוּ לַה׳ אִתִּי וּנְרוֹמְמָה שְׁמוֹ יַחְדָּו״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Abba said: From where that one who answers amen should not raise his voice louder than the one reciting the blessing? As it is stated: “Praise God with me, and we will exalt His Name together”;
llm_translation: Rav Hanan bar Abba said: From where do we derive that one who responds "Amen" should not raise his voice louder than the one who is blessing? As it is stated: "Magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt His name together" (Psalms 34:4).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הַמְתַרְגֵּם רַשַּׁאי לְהַגְבִּיהַּ קוֹלוֹ יוֹתֵר מִן הַקּוֹרֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֹשֶׁה יְדַבֵּר וְהָאֱלֹהִים יַעֲנֶנּוּ בְקוֹל״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְקוֹל״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְקוֹל״ — בְּקוֹלוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said: From where that the translator is not permitted to raise his voice louder than the reader? As it is stated: “Moses spoke, and God responded in a voice” there is no need for the verse to state: In a voice. what did the verse state: In a voice? In Moses’ voice,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said: From where do we derive that the interpreter is not permitted to raise his voice louder than the reader? As it is stated: "Moses speaks, and God answers him with a voice." The Torah did not need to say "with a voice," so why did it say "with a voice"? - With the voice of Moses.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין הַמְתַרְגֵּם רַשַּׁאי לְהַגְבִּיהַּ קוֹלוֹ יוֹתֵר מִן הַקּוֹרֵא. וְאִם אִי אֶפְשָׁר לַמְתַרְגֵּם לְהַגְבִּיהַּ קוֹלוֹ כְּנֶגֶד הַקּוֹרֵא — יְמַעֵךְ הַקּוֹרֵא קוֹלוֹ וְיִקְרָא.
human_translation: This was also taught The translator is not permitted to raise his voice louder than the reader. and if the translator cannot raise his voice to match the reader, the reader should lower his voice and read.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: One who translates is not permitted to raise his voice louder than the reader. And if it is not possible for the translator to raise his voice opposite the reader, the reader should lower his voice and read.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת, פְּלִיגִי רַב וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. חַד אָמַר: אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — מְזַמְּנִין, וְחַד אָמַר: אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין.
human_translation: It was stated: Two who ate as one  Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagreed: One said: If they wanted to join together, they may form a zimmun . The other said: if they wanted to join together, they may not form a zimmun .
llm_translation: It was stated: Two who ate together, Rav and Rabbi Yochanan disagree. One said: If they wanted to invite others - they may invite, and one said: If they wanted to invite others - they may not invite.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת חַיָּיבִין לְזַמֵּן. שְׁלֹשָׁה — אִין, שְׁנַיִם — לָא!
human_translation: we learned Three who ate as one are required to join together Three, yes, two, no,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Three who ate together are obligated to recite the Grace after Meals. Three - yes, two - no!

hebrew_text: הָתָם חוֹבָה, הָכָא רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: there, obligatory here, optional
llm_translation: There, obligation; here, permission.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת — חַיָּיבִין לְזַמֵּן, וְאֵין רַשָּׁאִין לֵיחָלֵק. שְׁלֹשָׁה — אִין, שְׁנַיִם — לָא!
human_translation: Come and hear: Three who ate as one are required to join together and may not disperse three, yes, two, no,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Three who ate together - obligated to recite the Grace after Meals, and not permitted to separate. Three - no, two - yes!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּקָבְעוּ לְהוּ בְּחוֹבָה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: It is different there, from the outset, they established themselves as obligated
llm_translation: The difference there is that they established for him in obligation from the outset.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַשַּׁמָּשׁ שֶׁהָיָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ עַל הַשְּׁנַיִם — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹכֵל עִמָּהֶם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתְנוּ לוֹ רְשׁוּת. הָיָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ עַל הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה — הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל עִמָּהֶם, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נָתְנוּ לוֹ רְשׁוּת!
human_translation: Come and hear, A waiter who was serving two people eats with them, although they did not give him permission was serving three he may not eat with them unless they gave him permission
llm_translation: Come and hear: If the servant was serving two people, behold, he may eat with them, even though they did not give him permission. If he was serving three people, behold, he may not eat with them unless they gave him permission!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם
human_translation: It is different there,
llm_translation: Differences there.

hebrew_text: דְּנִיחָא לְהוּ דְּמַקְבַּע לְהוּ בְּחוֹבָה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: because from the outset, they prefer to establish as an obligation
llm_translation: It is preferable for them that it be established for them as an obligation from the outset.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נָשִׁים מְזַמְּנוֹת לְעַצְמָן, וַעֲבָדִים מְזַמְּנִים לְעַצְמָן, נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין. וְהָא נָשִׁים אֲפִילּוּ מְאָה וְהָא מְאָה נָשֵׁי כִּתְרֵי גַּבְרֵי דָּמְיָין, וְקָתָנֵי נָשִׁים מְזַמְּנוֹת לְעַצְמָן וַעֲבָדִים מְזַמְּנִין לְעַצְמָן!
human_translation: Come and hear: Women form a zimmun for themselves and slaves form a zimmun for themselves; women, slaves, and minors, if they wish to form a zimmun they may not form a zimmun . But aren’t one hundred women the equivalent of two men, And teaches women form a zimmun for themselves and   slaves form a zimmun for themselves
llm_translation: Come and hear: Women invite for themselves, and slaves invite for themselves, women and slaves and minors, if they wish to invite - they do not invite. But these women, even a hundred, and these a hundred women are like two men, and minor women invite for themselves and slaves invite for themselves!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא דֵּעוֹת.
human_translation: There it is different because, there are minds,
llm_translation: The matter there is different, for there are opinions.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין. אַמַּאי לָא, וְהָא אִיכָּא דֵּעוֹת!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause Women and slaves, if they wish to form a zimmun , they may not form a zimmun . Why not? Aren’t minds,
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: Women and slaves, if they wish to summon — they are not summoned. Why not? But there are those who have knowledge!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם מִשּׁוּם פְּרִיצוּתָא.
human_translation: it is different there, due to promiscuity.
llm_translation: The matter there is different due to a breach.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים, דְּרַב דְּאָמַר אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין. דְּאָמַר רַב דִּימִי בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת וְיָצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶם לַשּׁוּק — קוֹרְאִין לוֹ וּמְזַמְּנִין עָלָיו. טַעְמָא דְּקוֹרְאִין לוֹ, הָא לֹא קוֹרְאִין לוֹ — לָא!
human_translation: Conclude that Rav said: If they wanted to join together, they may not form a zimmun . As Rav Dimi bar Yosef said Rav said: Three who ate as one and one of them went out to the marketplace, they call him and include him in the zimmun . The reason is because they call him; if they do not call him, no,
llm_translation: The matter was concluded, for Rav said: If they wanted to invite him - they do not invite. For Rav Dimi bar Yosef said in the name of Rav: Three who ate together and one of them went out to the marketplace - they call him and invite him. The reason they call him is because they do not call him - no!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאִקְּבַעוּ לְהוּ בְּחוֹבָה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: It is different there, from the outset, they established themselves as obligated
llm_translation: The difference there is that they established for him in a debt from the outset.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תִּסְתַּיֵּים, דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — אֵין מְזַמְּנִין, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת — אֶחָד מֵהֶן יוֹצֵא בְּבִרְכַּת חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, conclude that Rabbi Yoḥanan is the one who said: If they wanted to join together, they may not form a zimmun , as Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Two who ate as one, one fulfills his obligation with the blessing of the other.
llm_translation: Rather, it is concluded, for Rabbi Yochanan is the one who said: If they wanted to invite others to join them in the meal — they do not invite, for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Two who ate together — one of them recites the blessing for the other.

hebrew_text: וַהֲוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, תְּנֵינָא: שָׁמַע וְלֹא עָנָה — יָצָא! וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין בִּרְכַּת הַזִּימּוּן בֵּינֵיהֶם. תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: And we discussed it What is he teaching us? We learned this One who heard and did not respond, he fulfilled And Rabbi Zeira said: there is no blessing of zimmun among them. conclude
llm_translation: We were in it: What is it teaching us? We learned: "He heard and did not respond - he fulfilled his obligation!" And Rabbi Zeira said to say that the Grace after Meals does not require their participation. It is concluded.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא לְרַב הוּנָא: וְהָא רַבָּנַן דַּאֲתוֹ מִמַּעְרְבָא אָמְרִי, אִם רָצוּ לְזַמֵּן — מְזַמְּנִין, מַאי לָאו דִּשְׁמִיעַ לְהוּ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? לָא, דִּשְׁמִיעַ לְהוּ מֵרַב, מִקַּמֵּי דִּנְחֵית לְבָבֶל.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Huna said to Rav Huna: Didn’t the Sages who came from the West, say that if they wanted to join together, they may form a zimmun ? What, is it not that they heard from Rabbi Yoḥanan, No, that they heard from Rav before he descended to Babylonia.
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Huna said to Rav Huna: And the Rabbis who came from the West say, if they wanted to invite - they would invite, why not to listen to them from Rabbi Yochanan? No, to listen to them from Rav, before he arrived in Babylonia.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב דִּימִי בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת, וְיָצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶם לַשּׁוּק — קוֹרְאִין לוֹ, וּמְזַמְּנִין עָלָיו. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְהוּא דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ וְעָנֵי.
human_translation: the matter itself: Rav Dimi bar Yosef said Rav said: Three who ate as one and one of them went out to the marketplace, they call him and include him in the zimmun , Abaye said: This is that they call him and he responds,
llm_translation: Body. Rav Dimi son of Joseph said Rav: Three that ate together, and one of them left to the market - they call him, and they invite him. Abaye said: And this is what they called him and he answered.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: וְלָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אֲבָל בַּעֲשָׂרָה עַד דְּנֵיתֵי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: We only said with regard to three; but, with regard to ten, until comes
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: And we did not say, except with three, but with ten until you reach.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: אַדְּרַבָּא אִיפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא תִּשְׁעָה נִרְאִין כַּעֲשָׂרָה, שְׁנַיִם אֵין נִרְאִין כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: On the contrary, the opposite is more reasonable. Nine appear like ten, Two do not appear like three,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Ashei objects to her: Adraba, if it were reversed, nine would appear as ten, but two would not appear as three.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּמָר זוּטְרָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? — כֵּיוָן דְּבָעֵי לְאַדְכּוֹרֵי שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם — בְּצִיר מֵעֲשָׂרָה לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא.
human_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with Mar Zutra. What   the reason? Because    they need to mention the Name of Heaven,     not proper conduct  fewer than ten
llm_translation: The halakha is like Mar Zutra. What is the reason? - Since he wants to sanctify the name of Heaven - with less than ten is not the way of the land.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נְקִיטִינַן שְׁנַיִם שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת — מִצְוָה לֵיחָלֵק. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת — מִצְוָה לֵיחָלֵק. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, כְּשֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם סוֹפְרִים, אֲבָל אֶחָד סוֹפֵר וְאֶחָד בּוּר — סוֹפֵר מְבָרֵךְ, וּבוּר יוֹצֵא.
human_translation: Abaye said we have a tradition: Two who ate as one, it is a mitzva to separate This was also taught Two who ate as one, it is a mitzva to separate In what are these matters stated? when both are learned people [ soferim ] However, one of them was a learned person and the other an ignoramus, the learned person recites the blessing the ignoramus thereby fulfills
llm_translation: Abaye said: If two people partook of a meal together — it is a mitzvah to divide the cost. It was also taught in a baraita likewise: If two people partook of a meal together — it is a mitzvah to divide the cost. In what case are these matters said? When both of them are counting their money, but if one is counting and the other is inspecting — the one who is counting recites the blessing, and the one who is inspecting fulfills his obligation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָא מִילְּתָא אַמְרִיתָא אֲנָא, וְאִיתַּמְרָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא כְּווֹתִי: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת, אֶחָד מַפְסִיק לַשְּׁנַיִם, וְאֵין שְׁנַיִם מַפְסִיקִין לָאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rava said: This is a statement that I said and it was stated in the name of Rabbi Zeira in accordance with my Three who ate as one one interrupts to two but two do not interrupt to one
llm_translation: Rava said: This matter I have said, and it was said in the name of Rabbi Zeira like my measure: Three who ate together, one interrupts for the two, and the two do not interrupt for the one.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא רַב פָּפָּא אַפְסֵיק לֵיהּ לְאַבָּא מָר בְּרֵיהּ אִיהוּ וְחַד! שָׁאנֵי רַב פָּפָּא, דְּלִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: And not Didn’t Rav Pappa interrupt to Abba Mar, his son, and one Rav Pappa is different, as acted beyond the letter of the law.
llm_translation: And not? But Rav Papa interrupted his father, his son, and one! Rav Papa is different, for he acts according to the strict law.

hebrew_text: יְהוּדָה בַּר מָרִימָר וּמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי וְרַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי כָּרְכִי רִיפְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, לָא הֲוָה בְּהוּ חַד דַּהֲוָה מוּפְלָג מֵחַבְרֵיהּ לְבָרוֹכֵי לְהוּ. יָתְבִי וְקָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָא דִּתְנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת חַיָּיבִין לְזַמֵּן, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא אָדָם גָּדוֹל, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ — חִלּוּק בְּרָכוֹת עָדִיף.
human_translation: Yehuda bar Mareimar, Mar bar Rav Ashi and Rav Aḥa of Difti ate bread together. None among them was greater than the other recite the blessing on their behalf. They sat down and raised a dilemma: That which we learned Three who ate as one are required to join together that apply only when there is a great man but where they are on a par with each other, separating blessings is preferable?
llm_translation: Judah son of Marimar, and Mar son of Rav Ashe, and Rav Acha from Difti Karkei Riftha were sitting together. There was not one among them who was distinguished from his companions in blessings. They were sitting and they were asking: "Regarding what we learned, three who ate together are obligated to recite the Grace after Meals, where is the place that there is a distinguished person, but where there are equals — the division of blessings is preferable."

hebrew_text: בָּרֵיךְ אִינִישׁ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָרִימָר. אָמַר לְהוּ: יְדֵי בְּרָכָה יְצָאתֶם, יְדֵי זִימּוּן לֹא יְצָאתֶם. וְכִי תֵּימְרוּ: נֶיהְדַּר וּנְזַמֵּן, אֵין זִימּוּן לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: each person recited the blessing for himself. they came before Mareimar said to them: you fulfilled your blessing you did not fulfill zimmun . And if you say: Let us go back and form a zimmun , there is no retroactive zimmun .
llm_translation: Blessed is a person for himself. They came before Marimar. He said to them: You have fulfilled the obligation of blessing, you have not fulfilled the obligation of invitation. And if you say: Be honored and invite, there is no obligation of invitation for a freeloader.

hebrew_text: בָּא וּמְצָאָן כְּשֶׁהֵן מְבָרְכִים, מַהוּ אוֹמֵר אַחֲרֵיהֶם? רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ וּמְבוֹרָךְ״. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: עוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״.
human_translation: One who came and found them reciting the blessing, what does he say after them Rav Zevid said Blessed and blessed Rav Pappa said: He answers amen.
llm_translation: He came and found them when they were blessing, what does he say after them? Rav Zevid said: "Blessed and blessed." Rav Papa said: He answers "Amen."

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי, הָא — דְּאַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דְּקָא אָמְרִי ״נְבָרֵךְ״, וְהָא — דְּאַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דְּקָא אָמְרִי ״בָּרוּךְ״. אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דְּקָא אָמְרִי ״נְבָרֵךְ״ — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ וּמְבוֹרָךְ״, אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דְּקָא אָמְרִי ״בָּרוּךְ״ — עוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״.
human_translation: do not disagree. This is where he found them saying: Let us bless; and that is where he found them saying: Blessed be. Where he found them saying: Let us bless, he says: Blessed and blessed where he found them saying: Blessed be, he answers amen.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And they do not argue, this one - that they found him saying 'nevarēkh', and this one - that they found him saying 'barukh'. They found him saying 'nevarēkh' - one says 'barukh u'mevorakh', they found him saying 'barukh' - one answers 'amen'."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: הָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ אַחַר בִּרְכוֹתָיו — הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה.
human_translation: One taught: One who answers amen after his blessings, it is praiseworthy. Another taught: It is reprehensible.
llm_translation: One taught: One who responds "Amen" after his blessings - this one is praiseworthy. And it was taught in another source: this one is contemptible.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בְּ״בוֹנֶה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם״. הָא — בִּשְׁאָר בְּרָכוֹת.
human_translation: not difficult. This, is in Who builds Jerusalem; this, is in other blessings.
llm_translation: Not difficult, this - in "Boneh Yerushalayim." This - in other blessings.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי עָנֵי לֵיהּ בְּקָלָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִשְׁמְעוּ פּוֹעֲלִים וְלֵיקוּמוּ, דְּ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. רַב אָשֵׁי עָנֵי לֵיהּ בִּלְחִישָׁא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נְזַלְזְלוּ בְּ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״.
human_translation: Abaye would answer aloud so the workers would hear and stand as Who is good and does good, is not by Torah law, Rav Ashi, answer in a whisper, so that would not relate to Who is good and does good, with contempt.
llm_translation: Abaye answered him softly, so that the workers would hear and rise, for "the good and the pleasing" is not from the Torah. Rav Ashei answered him in a whisper, so that they would not treat "the good and the pleasing" lightly.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא חֲלַשׁ, עָל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ: אִי מִתְּפַח קַטִּינָא חֲרִיךְ שָׁקֵי — עָבֵידְנָא יוֹמָא טָבָא לְרַבָּנַן. אִתְּפַח, עֲבַד סְעוֹדְתָּא לְכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. כִּי מְטָא לְמִשְׁרֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: לִישְׁרֵי לַן מָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בּוֹצֵעַ? שְׁרָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira took ill. Rabbi Abbahu went to visit him and resolved: If the little man with the scorched legs, is cured, I will make a festival, for the Sages. was cured and made a feast for all the Sages. When it came time to break said to Rabbi Zeira: Master, break for us. said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold that of Rabbi Yoḥanan, said: The host breaks broke for them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira fell ill, Rabbi Abahu visited him, he accepted upon himself: if the small pot boils, prepare a good day for the Rabbis. If it boils, he made a feast for all the Rabbis. When it came time to leave, he said to Rabbi Zeira: "May the Master prepare for us a feast." He said to him: "The Master does not hold like the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan who said: Does the owner of the house cut the bread? Let him prepare for them."

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לְבָרוֹכֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְבָרֵיךְ לַן מָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּרַב הוּנָא דְּמִן בָּבֶל דְּאָמַר: בּוֹצֵעַ מְבָרֵךְ?
human_translation: When came to recite the blessing, said to Master, recite on our behalf. said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold that of Rabbi Huna of Babylonia, said: He who breaks recites
llm_translation: When he came to the scholars, he said to them: "Let the Master bless us." They said to him: "The Master did not intend to bless us like Rav Huna from Babylon who said: 'The one who cuts blesses?'"

hebrew_text: וְאִיהוּ, כְּמַאן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And in accordance with whose does hold
llm_translation: And who is of the opinion that he agrees with him?

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בּוֹצֵעַ, וְאוֹרֵחַ מְבָרֵךְ. בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בּוֹצֵעַ — כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּבְצַע בְּעַיִן יָפָה. וְאוֹרֵחַ מְבָרֵךְ — כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּבָרֵךְ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: that Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: The host breaks bread and a guest recites The host breaks so that he will break generously, and the guest recites so that he may bless the host
llm_translation: The one that Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: The homeowner cuts the bread, and the guest recites the blessing. The homeowner cuts the bread - in order that he should cut with a good eye. And the guest recites the blessing - in order that the homeowner should be blessed.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְבָרֵךְ — ״יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁלֹּא יֵבוֹשׁ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וְלֹא יִכָּלֵם לְעוֹלָם הַבָּא״.
human_translation: What is blesses May it be Your will that the master of the house shall not suffer shame in this world, nor humiliation in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: "What does one bless? 'May it be the will of God that the master of the house not be ashamed in this world, and not be confounded in the world to come.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מוֹסִיף בָּהּ דְּבָרִים: ״וְיִצְלַח מְאֹד בְּכָל נְכָסָיו, וְיִהְיוּ נְכָסָיו וּנְכָסֵינוּ מוּצְלָחִים וּקְרוֹבִים לָעִיר, וְאַל יִשְׁלוֹט שָׂטָן לֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂי יָדָיו וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂי יָדֵינוּ, וְאַל יִזְדַּקֵּר לֹא לְפָנָיו וְלֹא לְפָנֵינוּ שׁוּם דְּבַר הִרְהוּר חֵטְא וַעֲבֵירָה וְעָוֹן מֵעַתָּה וְעַד עוֹלָם״.
