And Rav Nahman said: Even if one begins with "Have mercy upon Israel" - concludes with "Who builds Jerusalem," as it is stated, "He who builds Jerusalem, Hashem, the outcasts of Israel He will gather." When does Hashem build Jerusalem? When the outcasts of Israel are gathered.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא: נֵיתֵי מָר וְנִתְנֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּרְכַּת מְזוֹנָא לָא גְּמִירְנָא, וְתַנּוֹיֵי מַתְנֵינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאִקְּלַעִי לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, וּבָרֵיכִי בִּרְכַּת מְזוֹנָא, וְזַקְפֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְקוֹעֵיהּ עֲלַי כְּחִוְיָא. וְאַמַּאי? דְּלָא אֲמַרִי לֹא בְּרִית וְלֹא תּוֹרָה וְלֹא מַלְכוּת. וְאַמַּאי לָא אֲמַרְתְּ? כִּדְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: לֹא אָמַר בְּרִית וְתוֹרָה וּמַלְכוּת — יָצָא. בְּרִית — לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּנָשִׁים. תּוֹרָה וּמַלְכוּת — לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן לֹא בְּנָשִׁים וְלֹא בַּעֲבָדִים. וְאַתְּ שְׁבַקְתְּ כֹּל הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי וְאָמוֹרָאֵי, וַעֲבַדְתְּ כְּרַב?!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Ḥisda: Let the Master come and teach He responded: I have not learned Grace after Meals, and I will teach Mishna? He responded: What is this? He said to him: I happened to the house of the Exilarch and recited Grace after Meals, and Rav Sheshet stiffened his neck over me like a snake, And why I did not mention covenant, Torah, or sovereignty And why did you not mention in accordance with Rav Ḥananel Rav said, as Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: If one does not mention covenant, Torah or sovereignty he fulfilled Covenant does not apply to women; Torah and sovereignty apply neither to women nor to slaves. And you abandoned all of these tanna’im and amora’im and followed Rav?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira to Rav Ḥisda: Let the Master come and eat. He said to him: We have not completed the grace after meals, and the students are waiting. He said to him: What is this? He said to him: I happened to come to the house of the head of the exile, and I recited the grace after meals, and Rav Sheshet stood up to cover me with his cloak. And why? Because I did not mention neither the covenant, nor the Torah, nor the kingship. And why did you not mention them? As Rav Ḥanan'el said in the name of Rav, for Rav Ḥanan'el said in the name of Rav: If one did not mention the covenant, the Torah, and the kingship — he has fulfilled his obligation. The covenant — because it does not pertain to women. The Torah and the kingship — because they do not pertain to either women or slaves. And you, have you abandoned all those teachings and statements, and acted like Rav?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ צְרִיכָה מַלְכוּת. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, כׇּל בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מַלְכוּת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ בְּרָכָה? וְהָא אַמְרַהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חֲדָא זִימְנָא! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לוֹמַר שֶׁצְּרִיכָה שְׁתֵּי מַלְכֻיוֹת, חֲדָא דִּידַהּ וַחֲדָא דְּ״בוֹנֵה יְרוּשָׁלָיִם״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Who is good and does good, requires sovereignty. What is he teaching us any blessing that does not contain mention of sovereignty is not blessing, didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan already say that once? Rabbi Zeira said: is saying that requires two sovereignty, one for itself and one for Who builds Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "Good and beneficent" requires kingship. What does this teach us? Any blessing that does not include kingship — is not considered a blessing? But didn't Rabbi Yoḥanan say this only once! Rabbi Zeira said: To say that it requires two kingships, one for itself and one for "Who builds Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי נִיבְעֵי תְּלָת: חֲדָא דִּידַהּ, וַחֲדָא דְּ״בוֹנֵה יְרוּשָׁלָיִם״, וַחֲדָא דְּבִרְכַּת הָאָרֶץ! אֶלָּא בִּרְכַּת הָאָרֶץ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוְיָיא לַהּ בְּרָכָה הַסְּמוּכָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, ״בּוֹנֵה יְרוּשָׁלָיִם״ נָמֵי לָא תִּבְעֵי, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ בְּרָכָה הַסְּמוּכָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ!
human_translation: If so, it should require three one of its own, one for Who builds Jerusalem, and one for the blessing of the land, Rather, the blessing of the land, what is the reason not Because it is a blessing juxtaposed to another Who builds Jerusalem, should also not require as it is a blessing juxtaposed to another
llm_translation: So it was taught in three things: one regarding the blessing after a meal, one regarding "Bonen Yerushalayim," and one regarding the blessing of the land. But why is the blessing of the land not necessary? Because it is considered a blessing that is adjacent to its counterpart. Similarly, "Bonen Yerushalayim" is also not necessary, as it is considered a blessing that is adjacent to its counterpart!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ ״בּוֹנֵה יְרוּשָׁלָיִם״ נָמֵי לָא בָּעֲיָא. אַיְּידֵי דְּאָמַר מַלְכוּת בֵּית דָּוִד, לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא דְּלָא אָמַר מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר, הָכִי קָאָמַר: צְרִיכָה שְׁתֵּי מַלְכֻיוֹת לְבַר מִדִּידַהּ.
human_translation: The same is true even Who builds Jerusalem, does not require since he mentioned the royal house of David it would not be proper he did not mention God’s sovereignty Rav Pappa said: requires two sovereignty besides its own;
llm_translation: It is the same as even "Builder of Jerusalem" also not necessary. Since he said the kingdom of the house of David, he did not say the kingdom of heaven. Rav Papa said, this is what he is saying: It requires two kingdoms for a son of his.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי זֵירָא אֲחוֹרֵי דְּרַב גִּידֵּל, וְיָתֵיב רַב גִּידֵּל קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל שַׁבָּת, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁנָּתַן שַׁבָּתוֹת לִמְנוּחָה לְעַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאַהֲבָה לְאוֹת וְלִבְרִית, בָּרוּךְ מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן אַמְרַהּ? רַב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira sat behind Rav Giddel and Rav Giddel sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and he said: One who erred and did not mention for Shabbat says Blessed…Who gave Shabbatot for rest to His people Israel with love, as a sign and a covenant; Blessed…Who sanctifies the Shabbat. said to him: Who said Rav.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira sat behind Rav Giddel, and Rav Giddel sat in front of Rav Huna, and he sat and said: "He erred and did not mention the Sabbath, he says: 'Blessed is He who gave Sabbaths for rest to His people Israel with love, as a sign and covenant, blessed is He who sanctifies the Sabbath.'" He said to him: Who said this? Rav.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר יָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁנָּתַן יָמִים טוֹבִים לְעַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְשִׂמְחָה וּלְזִכָּרוֹן, בָּרוּךְ מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן אַמְרַהּ? רַב.
human_translation: Again sat and said: One who erred and did not mention for Festivals says: “Blessed…Who gave Festivals to His people Israel for joy and for commemoration; Blessed…Who sanctifies Israel and the seasons.” said to him: Who said Rav.
llm_translation: The text reads: Hadr yateiv ve'ka'amar: Ta'ah ve'lo hizkir shel yom tov, omer: "Baruch shenatan yamim tovim le'ammo Yisrael l'simchah u'l'zikaron, baruch mekadesh Yisrael ve'hazmanim." Amar lei: Maan amra? Rav. Translation: He returned and said: He erred and did not mention the blessing of the holiday, he says: "Blessed be He who gave good days to His nation Israel for joy and remembrance, blessed be He who sanctifies Israel and the appointed times." He said to him: Who said this? Rav.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר יָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁנָּתַן רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים לְעַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְזִכָּרוֹן״. וְלָא יָדַעְנָא אִי אָמַר בָּהּ ״שִׂמְחָה״ אִי לָא אָמַר בָּהּ ״שִׂמְחָה״, אִי חָתֵים בָּהּ, אִי לָא חָתֵים בָּהּ, אִי דִּידֵיהּ אִי דְּרַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Again sat and said: If one erred and did not mention the New Moon, he says: “Blessed…Who gave the New Moon to His people Israel for commemoration. I do not know whether he mentioned joy in or whether he did not mention joy, whether he concluded this or if he did not conclude it and whether is his or whether it is his teacher
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hadar yateiv ve'ka'amar: Ta'ah ve'lo hizkir she'l rosh chodesh omer 'Baruch shenatan rashei chodashim le'ammo Yisrael le'zikaron'. Ve'lo yadana i amar bah 'simchah' i lo amar bah 'simchah', i chatem bah, i lo chatem bah, i dideih i d'rabbei."

hebrew_text: גִּידֵּל בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי הֲוָה קָאֵי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, טְעָה רַב נַחְמָן
human_translation: Giddel bar Manyumi was standing before Rav Naḥman, Rav Naḥman erred
llm_translation: Gidel bar Minyomei was standing before Rav Nachman, Rav Nachman erred.

hebrew_text: וַהֲדַר לְרֵישָׁא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא עָבֵיד מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב: טָעָה — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: and he returned to the beginning said to Why did the master act in that manner? He said: As Rabbi Sheila said Rav said: If one erred, he returns to the beginning.
llm_translation: And return to the beginning. He said to him: What is the reason Master does so? He said to him, as Rabbi Sheila said in the name of Rav: If one makes a mistake, he goes back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: טָעָה — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁנָּתַן״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא פָּתַח בְּ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״, אֲבָל פָּתַח בְּ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Huna say Rav said: If one erred, he recites: Blessed…Who gave? said to him: Wasn’t it stated about this Rabbi Menashya bar Taḥlifa said Rav said: They only taught that he did not begin Who is good and does good; however, he began Who is good and does good, he must return to the beginning
llm_translation: And this, Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: If one made a mistake, he should say, "Blessed is the One who gave." He said to him: It was not stated regarding this. Rav Menashya bar Tahalifa said in the name of Rav: They only taught that if one did not begin with "He who is good and does good," but if he began with "He who is good and does good," he should go back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טָעָה וְלֹא הִזְכִּיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בַּתְּפִלָּה — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. בְּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said Rav Amram said Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: If one erred and did not mention the New Moon in his prayer, we require him to return in Grace after Meals, we do not require him to return
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Amram who said in the name of Rav Nachman who said in the name of Shmuel: If one erred and did not mention Rosh Chodesh in the Amidah prayer - one must repeat it. In Birkat Hamazon (Grace after Meals) - one does not repeat it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָבִין לְרַב עַמְרָם: מַאי שְׁנָא תְּפִלָּה וּמַאי שְׁנָא בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף לְדִידִי קַשְׁיָא לִי וּשְׁאֵילְתֵּיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן, וַאֲמַר לִי: מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, אֶלָּא נֶחְזֵי אֲנַן: תְּפִלָּה דְּחוֹבָה הִיא — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. בִּרְכַּת מְזוֹנָא, דְּאִי בָּעֵי אָכֵיל אִי בָּעֵי לָא אָכֵיל — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Avin said to Rav Amram What is the difference between prayer and Grace after Meals? He said to him: That was also difficult for me and I asked Rav Naḥman it, and he said to me: I did not hear from Mar Shmuel but let us see prayer, which is an obligation, we require him to return Grace after Meals, which if he wants he eats and if he wants he does not eat, we do not require him to return
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Avin to Rav Amram: What is the difference between prayer and the grace after meals? He said to him: Even for me it is difficult, and I asked Rav Nachman, and he said to me: The opinion of Mar Shmuel is not heard by me, but we see: Prayer, which is obligatory - we repeat it. Grace after meals, if one wants to eat or if one does not want to eat - we do not repeat it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים, דְּלָא סַגִּי דְּלָא אָכֵיל — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאִי טָעֵי הָדַר? — אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב: טָעָה — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ. וְהָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: טָעָה — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁנָּתַן״! — לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא פָּתַח בְּ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״, אֲבָל פָּתַח בְּ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: If so, on Shabbatot and Festivals, when it is not possible to refrain from eating, too, if he erred he must return He said: Yes. As Rabbi Sheila said Rav said: If one erred, he returns to the beginning Didn’t Rav Huna say Rav said: If one erred, he recites: Blessed…Who gave? Wasn’t it stated about this: They only taught that he did not begin Who is good and does good; however, he began Who is good and does good, he must return to the beginning
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, Sabbaths and festivals, since he did not reach satiety — is it so that if he erred, he returns? — he said to him: No, as Rabbi Sheilah said in the name of Rav: If one erred, he returns to the beginning. But didn't Rav Huna say in the name of Rav: If one erred, he says "Blessed be He who gave"? — It was not stated regarding this: They only taught that if one did not begin with "Who is good and does good," but if he began with "Who is good and does good" — he returns to the beginning.

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה מְזַמְּנִין וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: How much to obligate in a zimmun ?
llm_translation: Until how much they invite, etc.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ כְּזַיִת, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּבֵיצָה? וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁיָּצָא מִיְּרוּשָׁלַיִם וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהָיָה בְּיָדוֹ בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ, אִם עָבַר צוֹפִים — שׂוֹרְפוֹ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — חוֹזֵר וְשׂוֹרְפוֹ לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabbi Meir considers an olive-bulk significant and Rabbi Yehuda considers an egg-bulk significant? Didn’t we hear them the opposite As we learned And similarly, one who left Jerusalem and remembered that there was consecrated meat in his hand, if he passed Scopus, he burns at the site he and if not he must return to burn it before the Temple with the wood of the arrangement
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Meir, it is considered like an olive, and Rabbi Yehuda like an egg? But the opposite we heard for them, as we learned: "And similarly, one who goes out from Jerusalem and remembers that he had holy meat in his possession, if he passed Tzofim - he burns it in its place, and if not - he returns and burns it in front of the capital from the wood of the arranged pile."

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה הֵם חוֹזְרִים? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה בִּכְבֵיצָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה בִּכְזַיִת.
human_translation: How much them to return? Rabbi Meir says: for an egg-bulk of this, and that, And Rabbi Yehuda says: for an olive-bulk of this and that.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until when do they repeat? Rabbi Meir says: This and this in a basket. And Rabbi Yehuda says: This and this in a jug.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ. הָכָא בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״ — זוֹ אֲכִילָה, ״וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״ — זוֹ שְׁתִיָּה, וַאֲכִילָה בִּכְזַיִת. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״ — אֲכִילָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׂבִיעָה, וְאֵיזוֹ זוֹ — כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions are reversed Abaye said: Actually do not reverse Here, they disagree with regard to verses. Rabbi Meir holds: “And you shall eat,” that is eating; “and be satisfied,” that is drinking eating an olive-bulk. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: “And you shall eat and be satisfied,” eating that includes satisfaction. And what is an egg-bulk.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The order of the verse is reversed. Abbaye said: One should never reverse it. Here they argue based on the verses, Rabbi Meir holds: "And you shall eat" — this refers to eating, "and you shall be satisfied" — this refers to drinking, and eating with an olive's bulk. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: "And you shall eat and be satisfied" — eating that includes satisfaction, and what is that? — like an egg.

hebrew_text: הָתָם בִּסְבָרָא פְּלִיגִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: חֲזָרָתוֹ כְּטוּמְאָתוֹ, מָה טוּמְאָתוֹ בִּכְבֵיצָה — אַף חֲזָרָתוֹ בִּכְבֵיצָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: חֲזָרָתוֹ כְּאִיסּוּרוֹ, מָה אִיסּוּרוֹ בִּכְזַיִת — אַף חֲזָרָתוֹ בִּכְזַיִת.
human_translation: there, they disagree with regard to logical reasoning. Rabbi Meir holds: return is analogous to its ritual impurity, and just as its ritual impurity is egg-bulk, so too, return it is egg-bulk. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: return is analogous to its prohibition, and just as its prohibition is olive-bulk, so too, return it is olive-bulk.
llm_translation: There, in reasoning, they dispute. Rabbi Meir holds: His return is like his impurity, just as his impurity is in a kevaitza - so too his return is in a kevaitza. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: His return is like his prohibition, just as his prohibition is in a kza'it - so too his return is in a kza'it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מְזַמְּנִין? בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה — אוֹמֵר: ״נְבָרֵךְ״, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה וָהוּא — אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרְכוּ״.
human_translation: How does one recite the zimmun ? In three says: Let us bless In three and him, says: Bless
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do we invite guests to recite the Grace after Meals? With three people present, one says, "Let us bless." With three and he the host present, one says, "You all bless."

hebrew_text: בַּעֲשָׂרָה — אוֹמֵר ״נְבָרֵךְ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״, בַּעֲשָׂרָה וָהוּא — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרְכוּ״. אֶחָד עֲשָׂרָה וְאֶחָד עֲשָׂרָה רִבּוֹא.
human_translation: In ten says: Let us bless our God. In ten and him, says: Bless both ten and in one hundred thousand.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ba'asarah — omer 'nevarakh Eloheinu', ba'asarah vahu — omer 'barkhu'. Echad asarah ve'echad asarah ribbo." English translation: "With ten — one says 'Let us bless our God', with ten and he — says 'Bless'. One and one are many."

hebrew_text: בְּמֵאָה — הוּא אוֹמֵר ״נְבָרֵךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״, בְּמֵאָה וָהוּא — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרְכוּ״. וּבְאֶלֶף — הוּא אוֹמֵר ״נְבָרֵךְ לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, בְּאֶלֶף וָהוּא — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרְכוּ״. בְּרִבּוֹא — אוֹמֵר ״נְבָרֵךְ לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֱלֹהֵי צְבָאוֹת יוֹשֵׁב הַכְּרוּבִים עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ״, בְּרִבּוֹא וָהוּא — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרְכוּ״.
human_translation: In one hundred says: Let us bless the Lord our God. In one hundred and him, says: Bless In one thousand says: Let us bless the Lord our God, the God of Israel. In one thousand and him, he says: Bless In ten thousand says: Let us bless the Lord our God, the God of Israel, the God of Hosts, Who sits upon the cherubs, for the food that we have eaten. In ten thousand and him, says: Bless
llm_translation: In a hundred — he says "Let us bless the Lord our God," in a hundred and one — he says "Bless." And in a thousand — he says "Let us bless the Lord our God, God of Israel," in a thousand and one — he says "Bless." In a myriad — he says "Let us bless the Lord our God, God of Israel, God of hosts, who dwells among the cherubim, for the food we have eaten," in a myriad and one — he says "Bless."

hebrew_text: כָּעִנְיָן שֶׁהוּא מְבָרֵךְ, כָּךְ עוֹנִים אַחֲרָיו ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֱלֹהֵי צְבָאוֹת יוֹשֵׁב הַכְּרוּבִים עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ״.
human_translation: just as he recites the blessing, so too recite in response: Blessed be the Lord our God, the God of Israel, the God of Hosts, Who sits upon the cherubs, for the food that we have eaten.
llm_translation: As the matter of one who blesses, so they respond after him: "Blessed is Hashem our God, God of Israel, God of hosts, who dwells among the cherubim, for the food that we have eaten."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: לְפִי רוֹב הַקָּהָל הֵם מְבָרְכִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מַה מָּצִינוּ בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, אֶחָד מְרוּבִּים וְאֶחָד מוּעָטִים אוֹמֵר ״בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳״. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳ הַמְבוֹרָךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: According to the size of the crowd, they recite the blessing, as it is stated: “Bless you God in full assemblies, even the Lord, you who are from the fountain of Israel” Rabbi Akiva said What do we find in the synagogue? Both many and few, says: Bless [ barekhu ] the Lord. Rabbi Yishmael said Bless the Lord the blessed One.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says: According to the majority of the congregation, they bless, as it is stated, "In the congregations bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel." Rabbi Akiva said: What do we find in the synagogue, whether many or few, they say, "Bless the Lord." Rabbi Yishmael says: "Bless the Lord, the blessed."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְעוֹלָם אַל יוֹצִיא אָדָם אֶת עַצְמוֹ מִן הַכְּלָל.
human_translation: Shmuel said: One should never exclude himself from the collective.
llm_translation: Gemara, Shmuel said: Always not should a person remove himself from the community.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה וָהוּא — אוֹמֵר ״בָּרְכוּ״!
human_translation: we learned In three and him, says: Bless
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: With three and he says, "Bless!"

hebrew_text: אֵימָא:
human_translation: Say
llm_translation: Mother:

hebrew_text: אַף ״בָּרְכוּ״, וּמִכׇּל מָקוֹם ״נְבָרֵךְ״ עֲדִיף, דְּאָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, תְּנֵינָא: שִׁשָּׁה נֶחְלָקִין עַד עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: even Bless; nevertheless: Let us bless, is preferable as Rav Adda bar Ahava said they said in the school of Rav: We learned: six to ten divide
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even "barkhu," and from every place "n'varekh" is preferable, as Rav Adda bar Ahava said, the house of Rav said, we learned: Six are divided until ten.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״נְבָרֵךְ״ עֲדִיף — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי נֶחְלָקִין, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ ״בָּרְכוּ״ עֲדִיף — אַמַּאי נֶחְלָקִין! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״נְבָרֵךְ״ עֲדִיף. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Granted, if you say: Let us bless is preferable, that is why divide However, if you say: Bless is preferable, why divide Rather, mustn’t one conclude from this: Let us bless is preferable conclude from this
llm_translation: If you say "we will bless" is preferable - because of this they dispute. But if you say "bless" is preferable - why do they dispute! Rather, it is not heard from it that "we will bless" is preferable. It is not heard from it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״בָּרְכוּ״ בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״נְבָרֵךְ״ — אֵין תּוֹפְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַל כָּךְ, וְהַנַּקְדָּנִין תּוֹפְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַל כָּךְ. וּמִבִּרְכוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם נִיכָּר אִם תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא אִם לָאו. כֵּיצַד? רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וּבְטוּבוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, ״וּמִטּוּבוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר.
human_translation: That was also taught Both he said: Bless, and he said: Let us bless, we do not reprimand him for so; and the punctilious reprimand him for so. And from one’s blessings it is obvious whether or not he is a Torah scholar. How so? Rabbi says: and by Whose goodness he is a Torah scholar. and from Whose goodness he is an ignoramus,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: whether one said "Baruch" or whether one said "Nevarech" — one does not hold him accountable for this, but the punctilious hold him accountable for this. And from a person's blessings, it is recognizable whether he is a Torah scholar or not. How so? Rabbi says: "Uvetuvo" — this one is a Torah scholar, "Umituvo" — this one is a boor.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּמִבִּרְכָתְךָ יְבֹרַךְ (אֶת) בֵּית עַבְדְּךָ לְעוֹלָם״! — בִּשְׁאֵלָה שָׁאנֵי. בִּשְׁאֵלָה נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״הַרְחֶב פִּיךָ וַאֲמַלְּאֵהוּ״! — הַהוּא, בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Dimi: Isn’t it written And from Your blessing may Your servant’s house be blessed forever” In request it is different, In request, too, is it not written “Open your mouth wide, that I will fill it” That is written with regard to matters of Torah,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Dimi: And it is written: "And from your blessing let your servant's house be blessed forever"! — In the context of a question it is different. In the context of a question it is also written: "Open your mouth wide and I will fill it"! — That one, it is written in matters of Torah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״בְּטוּבוֹ חָיִינוּ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, ״חַיִּים״ — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. נְהַרְבְּלָאֵי מַתְנִי אִיפְּכָא, וְלֵית הִילְכָתָא כִּנְהַרְבְּלָאֵי.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi says: And by His goodness we live, he is a Torah scholar. they live, he is a fool, of Neharbela taught the opposite. The halakha is not in accordance with of Neharbela.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says, "In his goodness, our lives" — this is a Torah scholar; "lives" — this is a boor. Neharbelai taught the opposite, and the halakha is not like Neharbelai.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״נְבָרֵךְ שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, ״לְמִי שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Let us bless the One Whose food we have eaten, he is a Torah scholar. to Him from Whose food we have eaten, he is an ignoramus,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "We shall bless Him from whose food we have eaten" - this is a Torah scholar. "To whom belongs the food from which we have eaten" - this is an ignoramus.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא אָמְרִינַן ״לְמִי שֶׁעָשָׂה לַאֲבוֹתֵינוּ וְלָנוּ אֶת כׇּל הַנִּסִּים הָאֵלּוּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא, מַאן עָבֵיד נִיסֵּי — קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa the son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: Don’t we say To He Who performed all of these miracles for our ancestors and for us, said to him: There, it is self-evident Who performs miracles? The Holy One, blessed be He.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "But don't we say, 'To whom performed for our ancestors and for us all these miracles'?" He said to him: "There, the matter is evident, who performs miracles? The Holy One, blessed be He."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, ״עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said Blessed be the One from Whose food we have eaten, he is a Torah scholar. For the food we have eaten, he is an ignoramus,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Blessed be He from whose food we have eaten" - this is a Torah scholar, "for the sustenance we have eaten" - this is a boor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם, אֲבָל בַּעֲשָׂרָה, דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם — מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא, כְּדִתְנַן: כָּעִנְיָן שֶׁהוּא מְבָרֵךְ, כָּךְ עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֱלֹהֵי הַצְּבָאוֹת יוֹשֵׁב הַכְּרוּבִים עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua said: We only said with regard to three, where there is no God’s name. In ten, however, where there is God’s name, it is self-evident as we learned Just as he recites the blessing, so too recite in response: Blessed be the Lord our God, the God of Israel, the God of Hosts, Who sits upon the cherubs, for the food that we have eaten.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: We only say it with three, for there is no mention of the Name of Heaven, but with ten, for there is a mention of the Name of Heaven — this is a proof of the matter, as we learned: In the matter for which he blesses, so do they respond after him: "Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, God of hosts, who dwells between the cherubim, for the food that we have eaten."

hebrew_text: אֶחָד עֲשָׂרָה, וְאֶחָד עֲשָׂרָה רִבּוֹא. הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ אֶחָד עֲשָׂרָה וְאֶחָד עֲשָׂרָה רִבּוֹא, אַלְמָא כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, וַהֲדַר קָתָנֵי בְּמֵאָה אוֹמֵר, בְּאֶלֶף אוֹמֵר, בְּרִבּוֹא אוֹמֵר!
human_translation: both ten and in one hundred thousand. The itself is difficult. you said: both ten and in one hundred thousand; consequently, are the same. it is then taught: In one hundred says; in one thousand says; in ten thousand says.
llm_translation: One is eleven, and one is eleven thousand. The difficulty itself is resolved: you said one is eleven and one is eleven thousand, implying that they are equal. This proves that they are equal, and then it states in hundreds, in thousands, in ten thousands!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, הָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: לְפִי רוֹב הַקָּהָל הֵם מְבָרְכִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מַה מָּצִינוּ בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult, This is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, and that is Rabbi Akiva. As we learned Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: According to the size of the crowd, they recite the blessing, as it is stated: “Bless you God in full assemblies, Rabbi Akiva said What do we find in the synagogue?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult, as there is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, and there is Rabbi Akiva. For we learned: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: According to the majority of the congregation, they bless, as it is stated: "In the congregations bless God." Rabbi Akiva said: What do we find in the synagogue, etc.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַאי קְרָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִין שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְאִידַּךְ? מִ״מְּקוֹר״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what does he do with that verse Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? He needs it to that which was taught Rabbi Meir says: From where that even fetuses in their mother’s womb recited song at the Sea? As it is stated “In assemblies, bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel,” And the other He derives from   the source
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, this verse of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, what does he do with it? He derives from it as it was taught, Rabbi Meir used to say: From where do we know that even fetuses in their mother's wombs sang a song at the sea? As it is stated: "In congregations bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel." And the other? From "from the source" it is derived.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רָבִינָא וְרַב חָמָא בַּר בּוּזִי אִקְּלַעוּ לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא. קָם רַב חָמָא וְקָא מְהַדַּר אַבֵּי מְאָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא: לָא צְרִיכַתְּ, הָכִי אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. Ravina and Rav Ḥama bar Buzi happened to the house of the Exilarch. Rav Ḥama rose and was seeking one hundred Ravina said to him: You need not Rava declared the following: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. Ravina and Rav Hama bar Buzi happened to enter the house of the head of the exile. Rav Hama stood up and honored Abba Me'ah. Ravina said to him: You did not need to do so, for thus said Rava: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי אָכְלִינַן רִפְתָּא בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, מְבָרְכִינַן שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁלֹשָׁה. וְלִיבָרְכוּ עֲשָׂרָה עֲשָׂרָה! — שְׁמַע רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא וְאִיקְּפַד. וְנִיפְּקוּ בְּבִרְכְּתָא דְּרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא! — אַיְּידֵי דְּאָוְושׁוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, לָא שָׁמְעִי.
human_translation: Rava said: When we would eat bread at the house of the Exilarch, we would recite the blessing in groups of three. Let them recite the blessing in groups of ten. the Exilarch would hear and become angry Why could they not satisfy their obligation with the Exilarch’s blessing? Since everyone is making noise, they do not hear
llm_translation: Rava said: When we eat bread at the head of the exile, we bless three times three times. And they should have blessed ten times ten times! — Listen, head of the exile, and be appeased. And they went out with the blessing of the head of the exile! — Because they were embarrassed before all the people, they did not listen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה תּוֹסְפָאָה: הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּכָרְכִי רִפְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וּקְדֵים חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וּבָרֵיךְ לְדַעְתֵּיהּ — אִינּוּן נָפְקִין בְּזִמּוּן דִּידֵיהּ, אִיהוּ לָא נָפֵיק בְּזִמּוּן דִּידְהוּ — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין זִמּוּן לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: Rabba Tosefa’a said: These three who break bread together and one of them went ahead and recited on his own they, fulfill with his zimmun ; he, does not fulfill with their zimmun because there is no retroactive zimmun ,
llm_translation: Rabba Tosfa'ah said: Those three male demons were walking together, and one of them went ahead and blessed according to his own opinion - they did not depart at their appointed time, but he did not depart at his appointed time - because there is no appointed time for a rebel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר. רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אִקְּלַע לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דַּאֲבִי גִיבָּר, קָם קְרָא בְּסִפְרָא וַאֲמַר ״בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳״, וְאִשְׁתִּיק, וְלָא אֲמַר ״הַמְבוֹרָךְ״. אֲוַושׁוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא: ״בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳ הַמְבוֹרָךְ״. אֲמַר רָבָא: פַּתְיָא אוּכָּמָא, בַּהֲדֵי פְּלוּגְתָּא לְמָה לְךָ? וְעוֹד, הָא נְהוּג עָלְמָא כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said Bless the Lord the blessed One. Rafram bar Pappa happened to the synagogue of Abei Givar when he rose to read from the scroll and recited: Bless the Lord, and was silent, and did not recite: The blessed One. everyone cried out: Bless the Lord the blessed One. Rava said You black pot, why are you in this dispute? Furthermore, standard practice is in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: Raphram bar Pappa happened to enter the synagogue of Avi Givar, he rose and read in the book and said, "Bless the Lord," and was silent, and did not say "who is blessed." Everyone was astonished: "Bless the Lord who is blessed." Rava said: You foolish person, why do you involve yourself in a dispute? Furthermore, the world is accustomed to the practice of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת — אֵינָן רַשָּׁאִין לֵיחָלֵק. וְכֵן אַרְבָּעָה, וְכֵן חֲמִשָּׁה. שִׁשָּׁה — נֶחְלָקִין, עַד עֲשָׂרָה. וַעֲשָׂרָה — אֵין נֶחֱלָקִין, עַד עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: Three who ate as one are not permitted to divide And the same four and the same five. six, up to ten may divide And ten may not divide until there are twenty
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three who ate together are not permitted to divide a meal. And likewise four, and likewise five. Six - they may divide the meal, until ten. And ten - they may not divide the meal, until twenty.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹכְלוֹת בְּבַיִת אֶחָד, בִּזְמַן שֶׁמִּקְצָתָן רוֹאִין אֵלּוּ אֶת אֵלּוּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מִצְטָרְפִין לְזִמּוּן, וְאִם לָאו — אֵלּוּ מְזַמְּנִין לְעַצְמָן וְאִלּוּ מְזַמְּנִין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: Two groups that were eating in one house, when some can see each other, they may combine to zimmun . And if not, these recite a zimmun for themselves and those recite a zimmun for themselves.
llm_translation: Two groups that were eating in one house, when some of them see these others — these join for the meal, and if not — these invite themselves and those invite themselves.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הַיַּיִן עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרְכִין.
human_translation: One does not recite a blessing over wine until he adds water to it, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: recites a blessing over it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein mevarkhin al ha'yayin ad sheyiten le'tokho mayim, divrei Rabbi Eliezer. Va'chachamim omrim: mevarkhin." English translation: "One does not bless over the wine until water is added to it, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: one blesses."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא, שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאָכְלוּ כְּאַחַת חַיָּיבִין לְזַמֵּן!
human_translation: What does this teach us? We learned this once: Three who ate as one are required to form a zimmun .
llm_translation: Gemara: What does this teach us? We learned in a Baraita: One time, three people who ate together are obligated to recite the Grace after Meals!

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיָּשְׁבוּ לֶאֱכוֹל כְּאַחַת, וַעֲדַיִן לֹא אָכְלוּ — אֵינָן רַשָּׁאִין לֵיחָלֵק.
human_translation: This teaches us that which Rabbi Abba said Shmuel said: Three who sat to eat as one, and they have not yet begun to eat, they are not permitted to divide
llm_translation: This is what we have heard: as Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel: Three individuals who sat down to eat together, and have not yet eaten - they are not permitted to divide.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיָּשְׁבוּ לֶאֱכוֹל כְּאַחַת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד אוֹכֵל מִכִּכָּרוֹ, אֵינָן רַשָּׁאִין לֵיחָלֵק. אִי נָמֵי כִּי הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁבָּאוּ מִשָּׁלֹשׁ חֲבוּרוֹת, אֵינָן רַשָּׁאִין לֵיחָלֵק.
human_translation: another version: Rabbi Abba said Shmuel said this is what teaches: Three who sat to eat as one, even though each and every one eats from his own loaf, they are not permitted to divide. Alternatively, that of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: Three who came from three groups are not permitted to divide.
llm_translation: Another version: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel, so it was taught: Three who sat down to eat together may not divide the bread even though each one eats from his own loaf. Indeed, when Rav Huna came, for Rav Huna said: Three who came from three groups may not divide the bread.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁבָּאוּ מִשָּׁלֹשׁ חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁל שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: And that came from three groups of three people
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: And this is referring to one who came from three groups of three people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא אַקְדִּימוּ הָנָךְ וְאַזְמוּן עֲלַיְיהוּ בְּדוּכְתַּיְיהוּ, אֲבָל אַזְמוּן עֲלַיְיהוּ בְּדוּכְתַּיְיהוּ — פְּרַח זִימּוּן מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: We only said where those did not include them in the zimmun in their place, but in a case where they included them in the zimmun in their place, their zimmun has left them.
llm_translation: And we did not say except that they did not precede Hanach and Azmun in their readiness, but if they are ready in their readiness - the time has come for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דִּתְנַן: מִטָּה שֶׁנִּגְנְבָה חֶצְיָהּ, אוֹ שֶׁאָבְדָה חֶצְיָהּ, אוֹ שֶׁחֲלָקוּהָ אַחִין אוֹ שׁוּתָּפִין — טְהוֹרָה. הֶחֱזִירוּהָ — מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this As we learned A bed, half of which was stolen or half of which was lost, or it was divided by brothers partners, it is ritually pure. if they restored it it is susceptible to ritual impurity from here on.
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? — For it was taught: If a stolen bed was found, or if half of it was lost, or if brothers divided it or became partners in it — it is pure. If they returned it — it accepts impurity from now on and in the future.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא — אִין, לְמַפְרֵעַ — לָא. אַלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּפַלְגוּהָ — פְּרַח לַהּ טוּמְאָה מִינַּהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי כֵּיוָן דְּאַזְמוּן עֲלַיְיהוּ, פְּרַח זִימּוּן מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: From here on, yes, retroactively, no, Apparently, once they divided it, the ritual impurity left it. Here, too, once they included them in the zimmun , their left them
llm_translation: From here and onwards - no, to retract - yes. This implies, once they have divided it - its impurity has blossomed from it. Here too, once they have designated it for them, its designated impurity has blossomed from them.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: אִם יֵשׁ שַׁמָּשׁ בֵּינֵיהֶם — שַׁמָּשׁ מְצָרְפָן.
human_translation: two groups It was taught: If there is a waiter among them, the waiter joins them
llm_translation: Two groups, etc. It was taught: If there is a sun between them - the sun joins them.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הַיַּיִן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יַיִן עַד שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם — אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״ אֶלָּא ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הָעֵץ״. וְנוֹטְלִין מִמֶּנּוּ לַיָּדַיִם. מִשֶּׁנָּתַן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם — מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״, וְאֵין נוֹטְלִין מִמֶּנּוּ לַיָּדַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ, מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״ וְאֵין נוֹטְלִין הֵימֶנּוּ לַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: One does not recite a blessing over wine the Sages taught Over wine, until he added water to it, one does not recite: Who creates fruit of the vine; rather, Who creates fruit of the tree, one washes his hands with it. Once he added water to it, one recites over it: Who creates fruit of the vine, and one does not wash his hands with it, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. The Rabbis say: In either case, one recites over it: Who creates fruit of the vine, and one may not wash his hands from it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We do not bless over wine. The Rabbis taught: Wine, until water is not added to it - we do not bless over it "Who creates the fruit of the vine," but rather "Who creates the fruit of the tree." And we take it into our hands. Once water is added to it - we bless over it "Who creates the fruit of the vine," and we do not take it into our hands, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Sages say: In either case, we bless over it "Who creates the fruit of the vine" and we do not take it into our hands.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם כׇּל צְרָכָיו בְּפַת, כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Shmuel said: A person may perform all his needs with bread? In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: As to where did this go? This is what Shmuel said: A person should fulfill all his needs with bread. Whose opinion? Like Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּכוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: בָּעֵינַן מִצְוָה מִן הַמּוּבְחָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina said: The Rabbis agree with Rabbi Eliezer with regard to a cup of blessing, that one does not recite a blessing over it until he adds water to it. What is the reason? Rav Oshaya said: We require a mitzva be in the best
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The Sages agree with Rabbi Eliezer regarding a cup of blessing that one does not recite a blessing over it until water is placed inside it. What is the reason? Rav Oshaya said: We require a mitzvah from the finest.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, לְמַאי חֲזֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא חֲזֵי לְקוּרְיָיטֵי.
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis, for what is fit? Rabbi Zeira said: for koraiytei ,
llm_translation: The sages, what do they see? Rabbi Zeira said: They see the lectionaries.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּפַת: אֵין מַנִּיחִין בָּשָׂר חַי עַל הַפַּת. וְאֵין מַעֲבִירִין כּוֹס מָלֵא עַל הַפַּת. וְאֵין זוֹרְקִין אֶת הַפַּת. וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין אֶת הַקְּעָרָה בְּפַת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Four things were said with regard to bread: One may not place raw meat on bread and one may not pass a full cup over bread and one may not throw bread; and one may not prop up a dish with bread.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Four things were said regarding bread: One may not place raw meat on bread. And one may not pass a full cup over bread. And one may not crumble bread. And one may not lean a bowl on bread.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי כְּרַכוּ רִיפְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, אַיְּיתִי לְקַמַּיְיהוּ תַּמְרֵי וְרִמּוֹנֵי. שְׁקַל מָר זוּטְרָא פְּתַק לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי דַּסְתָּנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּתַנְיָא אֵין זוֹרְקִין אֶת הָאוֹכָלִין? הַהִיא בְּפַת תַּנְיָא. וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין זוֹרְקִין אֶת הַפַּת, כָּךְ אֵין זוֹרְקִין אֶת הָאוֹכָלִין! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָתַנְיָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין זוֹרְקִין אֶת הַפַּת, אֲבָל זוֹרְקִין אֶת הָאוֹכָלִין!
human_translation: Ameimar, Mar Zutra and Rav Ashi ate bread together when they brought dates and pomegranates before them. Mar Zutra took and threw a portion before Rav Ashi. said to him: the Master not hold with that which was taught One may not throw food? That was taught with regard to bread, Wasn’t it taught Just as one may not throw bread, so too one may not throw foods? said to him: Wasn’t taught Although one may not throw bread, he may throw foods?
llm_translation: Ammemar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashei were reclining at a meal together. Ammemar brought before them dates and pomegranates. Mar Zutra took a piece and presented it before Rav Ashei as a question. He said to him: Does the Master not hold in accordance with what is taught: One may not throw food? That is in the case of bread it is taught. And it was taught: Just as one may not throw bread, so too one may not throw food! He said to him: But it was taught: Even though one may not throw bread, nevertheless one may throw food!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בְּמִידֵּי דְּמִמְּאִיס, הָא — בְּמִידֵּי דְּלָא מִמְּאִיס.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult, This a item that becomes disgusting that a item that does not become disgusting
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult. Here - in cases where he despises, here - in cases where he does not despise.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַמְשִׁיכִין יַיִן בְּצִנּוֹרוֹת לִפְנֵי חָתָן וְלִפְנֵי כַּלָּה, וְזוֹרְקִין לִפְנֵיהֶם קְלָיוֹת וֶאֱגוֹזִים בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, אֲבָל לֹא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים. אֲבָל לֹא גְּלוּסְקָאוֹת לֹא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה וְלָא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: the Sages taught: One may draw wine through pipes before a bride and groom throw roasted grain and nuts before them in the summer, but not in the rainy season, But one may not throw cakes, neither in the summer nor in the rainy season.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may draw wine through pipes in front of the groom and in front of the bride, and they may throw nuts and walnuts before them in the days of the sun, but not in the days of rain. But glass vessels are not permitted neither in the days of the sun nor in the days of rain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שָׁכַח וְהִכְנִיס אוֹכָלִין לְתוֹךְ פִּיו בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה — מְסַלְּקָן לְצַד אֶחָד וּמְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: If one forgot and put food in his mouth without a blessing, he moves them to one side and recites the blessing.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: "If one forgot and inserted food into his mouth without a blessing - he removes them to the side and recites the blessing."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא חֲדָא: בּוֹלְעָן, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: פּוֹלְטָן, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מְסַלְּקָן.
human_translation: It was taught one He swallows them. It was taught another He spits them out. Another taught: He moves them
llm_translation: It was taught in one Baraita: "Bol'an," and it was taught in another Baraita: "Pol'tan," and it was taught in another Baraita: "Mesalkan."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא. הָא דְּתַנְיָא בּוֹלְעָן בְּמַשְׁקִין. וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא פּוֹלְטָן בְּמִידֵּי דְּלָא מִמְּאִיס. וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא מְסַלְּקָן בְּמִידֵּי דְּמִמְּאִיס.
human_translation: not difficult, This in which it was taught: He swallows them to liquids, This in which it was taught: He spits them out, a item that does not become disgusting This in which it was taught: He moves them a item that becomes disgusting,
llm_translation: Not difficult. This that was taught: Bol'an in drinks. And this that was taught: Pol'tan in things that are not repulsive. And this that was taught: Mesalkan in things that are repulsive.

hebrew_text: בְּמִידֵּי דְּלָא מִמְּאִיס נָמֵי, לְסַלְּקִינְהוּ לְצַד אֶחָד וְלִיבָרֵךְ? תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב יִצְחָק קַסְקְסָאָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״יִמָּלֵא פִי תְּהִלָּתֶךָ״.
human_translation: With regard to a item that does not become disgusting as well, let him shift it to the side and recite the blessing. Rav Yitzḥak Kaskesa’a explained before Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: because it is stated: “My mouth will be filled with Your praise”
llm_translation: In the hands of one who does not despise, should we remove it to one side and bless it? Rav Yitzchak translated it before Rabbi Yosei bar Avin in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Because it is stated, "Let my mouth be filled with Your praise."

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: מִי שֶׁאָכַל וְשָׁתָה וְלֹא בֵּרַךְ, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּחֲזוֹר וִיבָרֵךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי שֶׁאָכַל שׁוּם וְרֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף, יַחְזוֹר וְיֹאכַל שׁוּם אַחֵר כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא רֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף?!
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: One who ate and drank and did not recite a blessing, what is return and recite said to them one who ate garlic and the odor his smells return and eat another garlic so that the odor his will smell?
llm_translation: He asked from Rav Ḥisda: One who ate and drank and did not bless, what should he do to rectify? He said to them: One who ate garlic and his breath is offensive, should he eat other garlic so that his breath becomes offensive again?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הִלְכָּךְ אֲפִילּוּ גָּמַר סְעוּדָּתוֹ, יַחְזוֹר וִיבָרֵךְ. דְּתַנְיָא: טָבַל וְעָלָה, אוֹמֵר בַּעֲלִיָּיתוֹ ״בָּרוּךְ אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל הַטְּבִילָה״.
human_translation: Ravina said: Therefore, even if one finished his meal, he must return and recite a blessing. as it was taught One who immersed and emerged, as he emerges he recites: Blessed…Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and has commanded us about ritual immersion.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Therefore, even if he finished his meal, he should go back and bless. As it was taught: He dips and comes up, he says upon his coming up, "Blessed are You, Hashem our God, King of the universe, who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning immersion."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, הָתָם — מֵעִיקָּרָא גַּבְרָא לָא חֲזֵי, הָכָא — מֵעִיקָּרָא גַּבְרָא חֲזֵי, וְהוֹאִיל וְאִידְּחִי — אִידְּחִי.
human_translation: That is not so, there, initially, the man was unfit here, initially he was fit and since and is, therefore, excluded excluded
llm_translation: And not it is, there — from the outset, a man does not see, here — from the outset, a man sees, and since he has pushed away, he has pushed away.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִסְפָּרָגוֹס — יָפֶה לַלֵּב וְטוֹב לָעֵינַיִם, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. וְהָרָגִיל בּוֹ — יָפֶה לְכׇל גּוּפוֹ. וְהַמִּשְׁתַּכֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ — קָשֶׁה לְכׇל גּוּפוֹ.
human_translation: the Sages taught: Asparagus , is agreeable for the heart and beneficial for the eyes, and all the more so for the intestines. And One who is accustomed to it is agreeable for his entire body. one who becomes drunk, it is harmful for his entire body.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Asparagus - beautiful to the heart and good for the eyes, and all the more so for the children of Ma'ayim. And one who is accustomed to it - beautiful for his entire body. And one who indulges in it - harmful to his entire body.

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָתָנֵי יָפֶה לַלֵּב, מִכְּלָל דִּבְחַמְרָא עָסְקִינַן, וְקָתָנֵי: וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. וְהָתַנְיָא: לְלַעַ״ט — יָפֶה, לְרָמַ״ת — קָשֶׁה!
human_translation: From the fact that it was taught agreeable for the heart, we are dealing with wine, And we learned: And all the more so, beneficial for the intestines. Wasn’t it taught For L-E-T , it is beneficial, for R-M-T , it is harmful.
llm_translation: From where do we derive that it is beautiful to the heart? From the inference of wine, and it is taught: "And all the more so, the sons of Ma'ayim." And it was taught: for "La'at" - beautiful, for "Ramat" - difficult!

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הַהִיא, בִּמְיוּשָּׁן. כְּדִתְנַן: קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם, שֶׁהַיַּיִן קָשֶׁה לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא מְיוּשָּׁן יָפֶה הוּא לִבְנֵי מֵעַיִם! וְשָׁתַק — אָסוּר בְּחָדָשׁ, וּמוּתָּר בִּמְיוּשָּׁן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: That it was taught with old As we learned Wine is konam for me to taste because it is harmful to the intestines, and said to him: But isn’t old beneficial to the intestines? If he was silent forbidden new but he is permitted old Conclude from this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When it was taught in that place, in Meushan. As we learned: "Their wine is like the venom of serpents, like the deaf cobra that stops its ear." They said to him: "But is not Meushan good for the stomach?" And he was silent. It is prohibited when new, but permitted in Meushan. Draw your inference from this.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּאִסְפָּרָגוֹס: אֵין שׁוֹתִין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁהוּא חַי וּמָלֵא; מְקַבְּלוֹ בְּיָמִין וְשׁוֹתֵהוּ בִּשְׂמֹאל; וְאֵין מְשִׂיחִין אַחֲרָיו, וְאֵין מַפְסִיקִין בּוֹ; וְאֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ; וְרָק אַחֲרָיו; וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא בְּמִינוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Six things were said with regard to asparagus : One only drinks it undiluted and full he receives it in right and drinks it with left one should not converse after and one does not stop it, one only returns it to who gave it to him; and he spits after it; and one may only supplement it with its own kind,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Six things were said in Aspargos: One may not drink it except when it is alive and full; one receives it with the right hand and drinks it with the left; one does not converse after it, and one does not interrupt it; one does not return it except to the one who gave it; and only after him; and one may only rely on it according to its kind.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא אֵין סוֹמְכִין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפַת! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בִּדְחַמְרָא, הָא — בִּדְשִׁכְרָא.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught one may only supplement with bread? not difficult. This , of wine, that , of beer.
llm_translation: And it was taught: One may only rely on it with bread! It is not difficult: here — with barley, here — with beer.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא לְלַעַ״ט יָפֶה, לְרָמַ״ת קָשֶׁה. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לְרָמַ״ת יָפֶה, לְלַעַ״ט קָשֶׁה! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בִּדְחַמְרָא, הָא — בִּדְשִׁכְרָא.
human_translation: It was taught one is beneficial for L-E-T , and harmful for R-M-T , And it was taught another is beneficial for R-M-T , and harmful for L-E-T , not difficult. This of wine, that of beer.
llm_translation: One taught: For the "La'at" it is beautiful, for the "Ramat" it is difficult. And it was taught in another place: For the "Ramat" it is beautiful, for the "La'at" it is difficult! It is not difficult, this one - with wine, that one - with beer.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: רָק אַחֲרָיו — לוֹקֶה. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא רָק אַחֲרָיו — לוֹקֶה! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בִּדְחַמְרָא, הָא — בִּדְשִׁכְרָא.
human_translation: It was taught one if he spit after suffers And it was taught another if he did not spit after suffers not difficult. This suffers of wine, that of beer.
llm_translation: One taught: "Only after him - he is lashed." And it was taught in another place: "Not only after him - he is lashed!" It is not difficult: this one - in wine, that one - in drunkenness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ לֹא רָק אַחֲרָיו לוֹקֶה, מֵימָיו נִזְרָקִין אֲפִילּוּ בִּפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Now you said if he did not spit after suffers its water, , even before the king,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The case where you said "not only is he lashed after him, but even his waters are poured out even in front of the king."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים סָח לִי סוּרִיאֵל שַׂר הַפָּנִים: אַל תִּטּוֹל חֲלוּקְךָ בְּשַׁחֲרִית מִיַּד הַשַּׁמָּשׁ וְתִלְבַּשׁ. וְאַל תִּטּוֹל יָדֶיךָ מִמִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָטַל יָדָיו. וְאַל תַּחֲזִיר כּוֹס אִסְפָּרָגוֹס אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לְךָ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁתַּכְסְפִית, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אִסְתַּלְגָּנִית שֶׁל מַלְאֲכֵי חַבָּלָה מְצַפִּין לוֹ לָאָדָם, וְאוֹמְרִים: אֵימָתַי יָבֹא אָדָם לִידֵי אֶחָד מִדְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ וְיִלָּכֵד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha said: Suriel, the ministering of the Divine Presence, told me three things Do not take your cloak in the morning from the hand of your servant and wear it; do not wash your hands from one who has not washed his hands; and only return a cup of asparagus to who gave it to you. Because a band of demons and some say a band of angels of destruction wait for a person and say: When will a person encounter one of these circumstances and be captured?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha said: Three things the angel Suriael, the prince of the countenance, cautioned me: Do not take your portion in the morning from the hand of the sun, and dress. And do not remove your hands from one who did not remove his hands. And do not return a cup of crystal to one who gave it to you — because you have become suspicious. And some say, the crystal goblet of the ministering angels is kept for a person, and they say: When will a person come into the hands of one of these matters and be caught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים סָח לִי מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת: אַל תִּטּוֹל חֲלוּקְךָ שַׁחֲרִית מִיַּד הַשַּׁמָּשׁ וְתִלְבַּשׁ. וְאַל תִּטּוֹל יָדֶיךָ מִמִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָטַל יָדָיו. וְאַל תַּעֲמוֹד לִפְנֵי הַנָּשִׁים בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁחוֹזְרוֹת מִן הַמֵּת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַקֵּד וּבָא לִפְנֵיהֶן וְחַרְבִּי בְּיָדַי וְיֵשׁ לִי רְשׁוּת לְחַבֵּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The Angel of Death told me three things: Do not take your cloak in the morning from the hand of your servant and wear it; do not wash your hands from one who has not washed his hands; and do not stand before the women when they return from the deceased, because I dance and come before them and my sword is in hand, and I have license to destroy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, "Three things the Angel of Death detests me for: Do not remove your morning portion from the hand of the sun, and get dressed. And do not remove your hands from one who has not yet taken his hands. And do not stand before women when they return from the dead, because I am dancing and coming before them with my sword in hand, and I have permission to harm."

hebrew_text: וְאִי פָּגַע, מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לִינְשׁוֹף מִדּוּכְתֵּיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אִי אִיכָּא נַהֲרָא — לֶיעְבְּרֵיהּ, וְאִי אִיכָּא דַּרְכָּא אַחֲרִינָא — לֵיזִיל בַּהּ, וְאִי אִיכָּא גּוּדָא — לֵיקוּ אֲחוֹרָא, וְאִי לָא — לַיהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ וְלֵימָא: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל הַשָּׂטָן יִגְעַר ה׳ בְּךָ וְגוֹ׳״ עַד דְּחָלְפִי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And if one encounters what is his remedy? Let him jump four cubits from where he stands; if there is a river, let him cross it; if there is another path, let him go down it; if there is a wall, let him stand behind it; and if not, he should turn his face around and recite “And the Lord said to the Satan: The Lord rebukes you, until they pass him.
llm_translation: If he encountered, what is its remedy? To sweep from its place four cubits. If there is a river - let him cross it, and if there is another path - let him go on it, and if there is a fence - let him go around it. And if not - let him turn back and say: "And Hashem said to the Satan, 'Hashem rebuke you...'" until he scares away its species.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּכוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה: טָעוּן הַדָּחָה וּשְׁטִיפָה. חַי וּמָלֵא. עִיטּוּר וְעִיטּוּף. נוֹטְלוֹ בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו, וְנוֹתְנוֹ בַּיָּמִין. וּמַגְבִּיהוֹ מִן הַקַּרְקַע טֶפַח, וְנוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בּוֹ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מְשַׁגְּרוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה לְאַנְשֵׁי בֵיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Abbahu said, and some say that this was taught in a baraita : Ten things were said with regard to a cup of blessing, It requires rinsing and washing; undiluted and full; adorning and wrapping; he takes it in his two hands and places it in his right and he lifts it one handbreadth from the ground, and he fixes his eyes upon it. And some say: He also sends it as a gift to members of his household.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabbi Avahu, and some say it was taught in a baraita: Ten things were said regarding the cup of blessing: It requires rinsing and washing. It must be full and overflowing. It should be lifted with both hands and given with the right hand. It should be raised from the ground a handbreadth, and one should look at it. Some say: He should also pass it around to the members of his household in a gift.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא אַרְבָּעָה בִּלְבַד: הֲדָחָה, שְׁטִיפָה, חַי, וּמָלֵא. תָּנָא: הֲדָחָה — מִבִּפְנִים, וּשְׁטִיפָה — מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: We only have four Rinsing, washing, undiluted, and full. it was taught: Rinsing is from the inside and washing is from the outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: We have only four things: Hadachah, Shtifah, Chai, and Malei. It was taught: Hadachah is from the inside, and Shtifah is from the outside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמְבָרֵךְ עַל כּוֹס מָלֵא — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ נַחֲלָה בְּלִי מְצָרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמָלֵא בִּרְכַּת ה׳ יָם וְדָרוֹם יְרָשָׁה״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אוֹמֵר: זוֹכֶה וְנוֹחֵל שְׁנֵי עוֹלָמִים, הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who recites a blessing over a full cup, they give him a boundless inheritance, as it is stated: “And full of the blessing of the Lord, possess the sea and the south” Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: He merits and inherits two worlds, this world and the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who blesses over a full cup - they give him inheritance without distress, as it is said: "And the blessing of the Lord shall possess the sea and the south." Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina says: He merits and inherits two worlds, this world and the world to come.

hebrew_text: עִיטּוּר. רַב יְהוּדָה מְעַטְּרֵהוּ בְּתַלְמִידִים, רַב חִסְדָּא מְעַטַּר לֵיהּ בְּנַטְלֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן: וּבְחַי. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וּבְבִרְכַּת הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: adorn Rav Yehuda adorn it with students, Rav Ḥisda, adorn it with cups; Rabbi Ḥanan said: And with undiluted Rav Sheshet said: And in the blessing of the land.
llm_translation: Interpretation. Rav Yehudah crowns them with students, Rav Ḥisdah crowns him with bundles. Rabbi Ḥanan said: And with life. Rav Sheshet said: And with the blessing of the land.

hebrew_text: עִיטּוּף. רַב פָּפָּא מִעַטַּף וְיָתֵיב. רַב אַסִּי פָּרֵיס סוּדָרָא עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: wrapping. Rav Pappa wrap and sit Rav Asi spread a cloth on his head
llm_translation: Gathering. Rav Papa wrapped himself and sat. Rav Assi spread a scarf on his head.

hebrew_text: נוֹטְלוֹ בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: מַאי קְרָאָה? — ״שְׂאוּ יְדֵיכֶם קֹדֶשׁ וּבָרְכוּ אֶת ה׳״.
human_translation: he takes it in his two hands, Rabbi Ḥinnana bar Pappa said: What is the verse “Lift your hands in holiness and bless the Lord”
llm_translation: He takes it with both his hands. Rabbi Chinena bar Papa said: What is the verse? - "Lift up your hands to the holy place and bless the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתְנוֹ לַיָּמִין. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רִאשׁוֹנִים שָׁאֲלוּ: שְׂמֹאל מַהוּ שֶׁתְּסַיֵּיעַ לַיָּמִין? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הוֹאִיל וְרִאשׁוֹנִים אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ וְלֹא אִיפְּשִׁט לְהוּ,
human_translation: And he places it in his right Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The early asked: What is the left assist the right Rav Ashi said: Since the early raised this dilemma and it was not resolved for them,
llm_translation: And he shall place it to the right. Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The earlier sages asked, "What benefit does the left provide to the right?" Rav Ashi said: Since the earlier sages desired it and it was not granted to them,

hebrew_text: אֲנַן נַעֲבֵד לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: we will act stringently
llm_translation: We are serving the wine.

hebrew_text: וּמַגְבִּיהוֹ מִן הַקַּרְקַע טֶפַח. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״כּוֹס יְשׁוּעוֹת אֶשָּׂא וּבְשֵׁם ה׳ אֶקְרָא״.
human_translation: And he lifts it one handbreadth from the ground. Rav Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is the verse “I will lift the cup of salvation and upon the name of the Lord I will call”
llm_translation: And he raises it from the ground a handbreadth. Rav Acha son of Rabbi Chanina said: What is the verse? "I will lift up the cup of salvation and call upon the name of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בּוֹ — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נַיסַּח דַּעְתֵּיהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And he fixes his eyes upon so that his attention will not be distracted from it.
llm_translation: And he sets his eyes on him - so that his mind will not be distracted from him.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁגְּרוֹ לְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּיתוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִתְבָּרַךְ דְּבֵיתְהוּ.
human_translation: And he sends it as a gift to members of his household; so that his wife will be blessed.
llm_translation: "And he sends gifts to the people of his household as a gift - so that his household will be blessed."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אִקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב נַחְמָן. כְּרֵיךְ רִיפְתָּא, בָּרֵיךְ בִּרְכַּת מְזוֹנָא, יְהַב לֵיהּ כָּסָא דְּבִרְכְּתָא לְרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: לִישַׁדַּר מָר כָּסָא דְבִרְכְּתָא לְיַלְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין פְּרִי בִטְנָהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה מִתְבָּרֵךְ אֶלָּא מִפְּרִי בִּטְנוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וּבֵרַךְ פְּרִי בִטְנְךָ״. ״פְּרִי בִטְנָהּ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״פְּרִי בִטְנְךָ״.
human_translation: Ulla happened to the house of Rav Naḥman. He ate bread, recited Grace after Meals, and gave the cup of blessing to Rav Naḥman. Rav Naḥman said to him: Master, please send the cup of blessing to Yalta, responded to him: as Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: The fruit of a woman’s body is blessed only from the fruit of a man’s body, as it is stated: and He will bless the fruit of your body” the fruit of her body” was not stated. Rather, the fruit of your body.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ulai iklah lebei Rav Nachman. Kreich rif'ta, bareich birkat mezonah, yehav lei kasa d'virkata leRav Nachman. Amar lei Rav Nachman: Lishadar mar kasa d'virkata leylata. Amar lei: Hachi amar Rabbi Yochanan: Ein peri vitnah shel isha mitbarekh ela miperi bitno shel ish, shene'emar "uveirach peri vitnecha." "Peri vitnah" lo ne'emar, ela "peri vitnecha." English translation: Ulai came to the house of Rav Nachman. He wrapped himself, said the grace after meals, and gave the cup of blessing to Rav Nachman. Rav Nachman said to him: "The master should pass the cup of blessing to the night." He said to him: "So said Rabbi Yochanan: The fruit of a woman's womb is blessed only from the fruit of a man's womb, as it is said, 'And He will bless the fruit of your womb.' It does not say 'the fruit of her womb,' but 'the fruit of your womb.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין פְּרִי בִטְנָהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה מִתְבָּרֵךְ אֶלָּא מִפְּרִי בִּטְנוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבֵרַךְ פְּרִי בִטְנְךָ״, ״פְּרִי בִטְנָהּ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״פְּרִי בִטְנְךָ״.
human_translation: That was also taught Rabbi Natan says: From where that the fruit of a woman’s body is only blessed from the fruit of a man’s body? As it is stated: And He will bless the fruit of your body; the fruit of her body was not stated. Rather, the fruit of your body.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: similarly, Rabbi Natan says: From where do we derive that one blesses upon the fruit of a woman's womb only from the fruit of a man's womb? — As it is stated: "And He will bless the fruit of your womb," "the fruit of her womb" is not stated, rather "the fruit of your womb."

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי שְׁמַעָה יַלְתָּא, קָמָה בְּזִיהֲרָא, וְעַלַּת לְבֵי חַמְרָא, וּתְבַרָא אַרְבַּע מְאָה דַּנֵּי דְחַמְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: נְשַׁדַּר לַהּ מָר כָּסָא אַחֲרִינָא, שְׁלַח לַהּ: כֹּל הַאי נַבְגָּא, דְּבִרְכְּתָא הִיא. שְׁלַחָה לֵיהּ: מִמְּהַדּוּרֵי — מִילֵּי, וּמִסְּמַרְטוּטֵי — כַּלְמֵי.
human_translation: meanwhile Yalta heard she arose in a rage, entered the wine-storage, and broke four hundred barrels of wine. Rav Naḥman said to Let the Master send her another cup. sent all this barrel is of blessing; She sent him From itinerant words, and from rags lice.
llm_translation: Until now, Yalta heard, she arose with clarity, and went to the house of wine, and created four hundred barrels of wine. Rav Nachman said to her: "Another chair should be sent to her." He sent to her: "All this pride, it is a blessing." She sent to him: "From the dwellings - words, and from the nails - shames."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֵין מַסִּיחִין עַל כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה. וְאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל כּוֹס שֶׁל פּוּרְעָנוּת. מַאי ״כּוֹס שֶׁל פּוּרְעָנוּת״? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כּוֹס שֵׁנִי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַשּׁוֹתֶה כִּפְלַיִם לֹא יְבָרֵךְ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִכּוֹן לִקְרַאת אֱלֹהֶיךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְהַאי לָא מְתַקַּן.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: One may not speak over a cup of blessing And Rav Asi said: One may not recite a blessing over a cup of punishment. What is a cup of punishment? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: A second cup. That was also taught One who drinks in pairs should not recite a blessing, because it is stated: “Prepare to meet your God, O Israel” and this is not prepared,
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: One does not engage in conversation over a cup of blessing. And Rav Assi said: One does not recite a blessing over a cup of retribution. What is a "cup of retribution"? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: A second cup. It was also taught likewise: One who drinks double does not recite a blessing, because it is stated, "Prepare to meet your God, O Israel," and this one does not prepare.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: הָאוֹכֵל וּמְהַלֵּךְ מְבָרֵךְ מְעוּמָּד, וּכְשֶׁהוּא אוֹכֵל מְעוּמָּד — מְבָרֵךְ מְיוּשָּׁב, וּכְשֶׁהוּא מֵיסֵב וְאוֹכֵל — יוֹשֵׁב וּמְבָרֵךְ. וְהִלְכְתָא בְּכוּלְּהוּ יוֹשֵׁב וּמְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said, and some say it was taught in a baraita : One who eats and walks, recites the blessing standing and one who eats standing, recites the blessing seated, and one who eats reclining sits and recites the blessing. And the halakha In all of these cases one sits and recites the blessing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said, and some say it was taught in a baraita: One who eats and walks recites the blessing standing, and when he eats standing, he recites the blessing sitting. And when he reclines and eats, he sits and recites the blessing. The general rule is to sit and recite the blessing.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך שלשה שאכלו
llm_translation: The three who ate shall return to you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵין בֵּית הִלֵּל בַּסְּעוּדָה: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: These matters between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel with regard to a meal: Beit Shammai say: one recites a blessing over the day and recites a blessing over the wine thereafter. And Beit Hillel say: One recites a blessing over the wine and recites a blessing over the day thereafter.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the matters in which Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel differ in the order of the blessings at the meal: Beit Shammai say: One blesses over the day, and afterwards blesses over the wine. And Beit Hillel say: One blesses over the wine, and afterwards blesses over the day.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם וְאַחַר כָּךְ מוֹזְגִין אֶת הַכּוֹס. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹזְגִין אֶת הַכּוֹס וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One washes his hands and mixes the cup thereafter, and Beit Hillel say: One mixes the cup and washes his hands thereafter.
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: We wash the hands first and then pour the cup. And House of Hillel says: We pour the cup first and then wash the hands.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְקַנֵּחַ יָדָיו בַּמַּפָּה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ עַל הַשּׁוּלְחָן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַל הַכֶּסֶת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: one dries his hands with a cloth and places it on the table. And Beit Hillel say: on the cushion
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: He wipes his hands with a cloth and places it on the table. And House of Hillel says: On the cushion.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְכַבְּדִין אֶת הַבַּיִת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְכַבְּדִין אֶת הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One sweeps the house and he washes his hands thereafter. And Beit Hillel say: One washes his hands and sweeps the house thereafter.
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "We honor the house, and afterwards we wash our hands." And House of Hillel says: "We wash our hands, and afterwards we honor the house."

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּמָזוֹן, בְּשָׂמִים וְהַבְדָּלָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּבְשָׂמִים, מָזוֹן וְהַבְדָּלָה.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: candle, Meals spices, havdala . And Beit Hillel say: candle, spices, Meals, and havdala .
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: Candle and food, spices and havdalah. And House of Hillel says: Candle and spices, food and havdalah.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: ״שֶׁבָּרָא מְאוֹר הָאֵשׁ״, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: ״בּוֹרֵא מְאוֹרֵי הָאֵשׁ״.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Who created [ bara ] the light of fire. And Beit Hillel say: Who creates [ boreh ] the lights of fire.
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: "Who created the light of the fire," and House of Hillel say: "Who creates the lights of the fire."

hebrew_text: אֵין מְבָרְכִין לֹא עַל הַנֵּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, וְלֹא עַל הַנֵּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל מֵתִים, וְלֹא עַל הַנֵּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וְאֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הַנֵּר עַד שֶׁיֵּאוֹתוּ לְאוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: One may neither recite a blessing over the candle nor over the spices of gentiles, nor over the candle nor the spices to the dead, nor over the candle nor the spices of idolatry. And one does not recite the blessing over the candle until he derives benefit from its light.
llm_translation: We do not bless neither on the candle nor on the spices of gentiles, and neither on the candle nor on the spices of the dead, and neither on the candle nor on the spices of idolatry. And we do not bless on the candle until they are lit for its light.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁאָכַל, וְשָׁכַח וְלֹא בֵּירַךְ. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְזוֹר לִמְקוֹמוֹ וִיבָרֵךְ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יְבָרֵךְ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנִּזְכַּר. וְעַד מָתַי מְבָרֵךְ? — עַד כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְעַכֵּל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁבְּמֵעָיו.
human_translation: One who ate and forgot and did not recite a blessing; Beit Shammai say: He returns to place he and recites the blessing. Beit Hillel say: He recites the blessing at the place he remembered. And until when does he recite the blessing? Until the food is digested in his intestines.
llm_translation: One who ate, and forgot and did not bless. Beit Shammai say: he should return to his place and bless. And Beit Hillel say: he should bless where he remembered. Until when should one bless? - Until the food in his stomach is digested.

hebrew_text: בָּא לָהֶן יַיִן אַחַר הַמָּזוֹן, אִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא אוֹתוֹ כּוֹס, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַמָּזוֹן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַמָּזוֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: Wine came before after the meal; if only that cup is there, Beit Shammai say: One recites a blessing over the wine and recites a blessing over the food, thereafter. And Beit Hillel say: One recites a blessing over the food and recites a blessing over the wine thereafter.
llm_translation: He came to them wine after the meal, if there is there only that cup, Beit Shammai says: blesses on the wine and afterwards blesses on the meal. And Beit Hillel says: blesses on the meal and afterwards blesses on the wine.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ אַחַר יִשְׂרָאֵל הַמְבָרֵךְ, וְאֵין עוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ אַחַר כּוּתִי הַמְבָרֵךְ, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמַע כׇּל הַבְּרָכָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: And one answers amen after a Jew who recites a blessing and one does not answer amen after a Samaritan [ Kuti ] who recites a blessing until he hears the whole blessing in its entirety,
llm_translation: And we respond "Amen" after a Jew who blesses, and we do not respond "Amen" after a Samaritan who blesses, until the entire blessing is heard in its entirety.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בִּסְעוּדָה. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן. שֶׁהַיּוֹם גּוֹרֵם לַיַּיִן שֶׁיָּבֹא, וּכְבָר קָדַשׁ הַיּוֹם וַעֲדַיִין יַיִן לֹא בָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught matters between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel with regard to a meal: Beit Shammai say: one recites a blessing over the day and recites a blessing over the wine thereafter as the day causes the wine to come The day has been sanctified and the wine has not yet come.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding matters between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel at a meal. Beit Shammai say: One blesses on the day and afterwards blesses on the wine. For the day causes the wine to come, and the day has already been sanctified, yet the wine has not yet come.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם. שֶׁהַיַּיִן גּוֹרֵם לַקְּדוּשָּׁה שֶׁתֵּאָמֵר. דָּבָר אַחֵר: בִּרְכַּת הַיַּיִן תְּדִירָה, וּבִרְכַּת הַיּוֹם אֵינָהּ תְּדִירָה. תָּדִיר וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּדִיר — תָּדִיר קוֹדֵם. וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: One recites a blessing over the wine and recites a blessing over the day thereafter, the wine causes the sanctification to be recited.
