Alternatively, The blessing over wine is frequently, and the blessing over the day is not frequently, a frequent an infrequent the frequent practice takes precedence The halakha is in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: One blesses over the wine and afterwards blesses over the day, for the wine causes sanctification to be said. Another explanation: The blessing over the wine is frequent, and the blessing over the day is not frequent. When something frequent and something not frequent occur together, the frequent one takes precedence. And the halakha is according to the words of the House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָתָם תַּרְתֵּי וְהָכָא חֲדָא, הָכָא נָמֵי תַּרְתֵּי נִינְהוּ: בִּרְכַּת הַיַּיִן תְּדִירָה וּבִרְכַּת הַיּוֹם אֵינָהּ תְּדִירָה, תָּדִיר וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּדִיר — תָּדִיר קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: What is alternatively? And if you say there two and here one, they are two here as well: The blessing over wine is frequently and the blessing over the day is not frequently. a frequent an infrequent the frequent takes precedence
llm_translation: "What is 'another matter' (דָּבָר אַחֵר)? And if you say there (in a different case) it is two, and here it is one, here also it is two: The blessing of wine is frequent, and the blessing of the day is not frequent. When something frequent and something not frequent come together, the frequent one takes precedence."

hebrew_text: וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּהָא נָפְקָא בַּת קוֹל?
human_translation: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel. It is obvious, as a Divine Voice emerged
llm_translation: The halakha follows the words of Beit Hillel. It is obvious, for did not a heavenly voice go forth?

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קוֹדֶם בַּת קוֹל. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל,
human_translation: If you wish, say before the Divine Voice And if you wish, say after the Divine Voice
llm_translation: If you ask, say before the Bat Kol. And if you ask, say after the Bat Kol.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּבַת קוֹל.
human_translation: and is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said, one disregards a Heavenly Voice.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua, that is, said: We do not pay attention to a heavenly voice.

hebrew_text: וְסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי דְּבִרְכַּת הַיּוֹם עֲדִיפָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵיתוֹ בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְעַל הַמָּאוֹר וְעַל הַבְּשָׂמִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלָה. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא כּוֹס אֶחָד, מַנִּיחוֹ לְאַחַר הַמָּזוֹן וּמְשַׁלְשְׁלָן כּוּלָּן לְאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Do Beit Shammai hold the blessing over the day takes precedence? Wasn’t it taught One who enters his house at the conclusion of Shabbat recites a blessing over the wine, the candle, the spices, and recites havdala thereafter? And if he has only one cup he leaves it for after the meal and arranges all together thereafter.
llm_translation: The House of Shammai holds that the blessing of the day is preferable? And it was taught: One who enters his home on Saturday night, blesses on the wine, on the light, and on the spices, and afterwards says the Havdalah. And if he has only one cup, he places it after the meal and includes all of them after it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא, מִמַּאי דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא? דִּלְמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל הִיא?!
human_translation: And this from where that it is Beit Shammai? Perhaps it is Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: And, this, from what is it that it is the House of Shammai? Perhaps it is the House of Hillel?!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּקָתָנֵי מָאוֹר וְאַחַר כָּךְ בְּשָׂמִים, וּמַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאִית לֵיהּ הַאי סְבָרָא — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, דְּתַנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁבִּתְחִלָּה וְעַל הַבְדָּלָה שֶׁהִיא בַּסּוֹף, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הַמָּאוֹר וְעַל הַבְּשָׂמִים. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מָאוֹר וְאַחַר כָּךְ בְּשָׂמִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּשָׂמִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ מָאוֹר.
human_translation: It cannot enter your mind as it was taught Light spices thereafter. And who, did you hear, adopts that reasoning? Beit Shammai. As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute that Meals is first and that havdala is last. With regard to what did they disagree? over the light and over the spices. Beit Shammai say: Light and spices thereafter; and Beit Hillel say: Spices and light thereafter.
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the Talmudic text into English word-for-word while maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the word-for-word translation: "Not went up your mind, that it teaches light and afterwards spices, and who heard to him that has this opinion — Beit Shammai, that it teaches Rabbi Yehuda said: Not disagreed Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel on the food that initially and on the separation that is at the end, on what did they disagree — on the light and on the spices. Beit Shammai says: light and afterwards spices, and Beit Hillel says: spices and afterwards light."

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּילְמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל הִיא וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר?!
human_translation: And from where that this is Beit Shammai in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? Perhaps it is Beit Hillel in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And from where is it the ruling of Beit Shammai? And perhaps it is according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, or maybe it is Beit Hillel and according to the opinion of Rabbi Meir?!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּקָתָנֵי הָכָא בְּמַתְנִיתִין, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּמָזוֹן בְּשָׂמִים וְהַבְדָּלָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּבְשָׂמִים מָזוֹן וְהַבְדָּלָה, וְהָתָם בְּבָרַיְיתָא קָתָנֵי אִם אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא כּוֹס אֶחָד, מַנִּיחוֹ לְאַחַר הַמָּזוֹן, וּמְשַׁלְשְׁלָן כּוּלָּן לְאַחֲרָיו. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: It cannot enter your mind As it was taught here in the mishna, Beit Shammai say: candle, Meals spices, havdala . And Beit Hillel say: candle, spices, Meals, and havdala . And there, in the baraita , it was taught: And if he has only one cup he leaves it for after the meal and arranges all together thereafter. conclude from here is Beit Shammai, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Not gone up your mind, as it is taught here in the Mishnah, Beit Shammai say: candle and food, spices and havdalah, and Beit Hillel say: candle and spices, food and havdalah, and there in a baraita it is taught: if he has only one cup, he places it after the food, and he passes them all after it. The conclusion is in accordance with Beit Shammai, and the halacha is like the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּמִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא. קָא סָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי שָׁאנֵי עַיּוֹלֵי יוֹמָא מֵאַפּוֹקֵי יוֹמָא. עַיּוֹלֵי יוֹמָא, כַּמָּה דְּמַקְדְּמִינַן לֵיהּ עֲדִיף. אַפּוֹקֵי יוֹמָא, כַּמָּה דִּמְאַחֲרִינַן לֵיהּ עֲדִיף, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֶהֱוֵי עֲלַן כְּמַשּׂוֹי.
human_translation: And, nevertheless, is difficult. Beit Shammai hold the arrival of the day is different from the departure of the day. the arrival of the day, the more that we can advance it, the better; the departure of the day, the more we postpone it, the better, so that should not be like a burden to us.
llm_translation: And from every place, the question is difficult. The House of Shammai holds that it is preferable to light the Hanukkah candles in ascending order, while the House of Hillel holds that it is preferable to light them in descending order, so that we do not depart from the practice.

hebrew_text: וְסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן טְעוּנָה כּוֹס? וְהָא תְּנַן: בָּא לָהֶם יַיִן לְאַחַר הַמָּזוֹן, אִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא אוֹתוֹ כּוֹס, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַמָּזוֹן, מַאי לָאו דִּמְבָרֵךְ עִילָּוֵיהּ וְשָׁתֵי לֵיהּ? לָא, דִּמְבָרֵךְ עִילָּוֵיהּ וּמַנַּח לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And do Beit Shammai hold Grace after Meals requires a cup Didn’t we learn Wine came before after the meal; if only that cup is there, Beit Shammai say: One recites a blessing over the wine and recites a blessing over the food, thereafter. What? Is it not that he recites a blessing over and drinks it, No. he recites a blessing over and leaves it
llm_translation: House of Shammai holds that Grace after meals requires a cup? But didn't we learn: If wine is brought to them after the meal, and there is only that cup there, House of Shammai says: One blesses over the wine first, and then blesses over the meal. What is it? Is it not that he blesses over it first and then drinks it? No, he blesses over it first and then sets it aside.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר מָר הַמְבָרֵךְ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם! — דְּטָעֵים לֵיהּ. וְהָאָמַר מָר טְעָמוֹ פְּגָמוֹ! — דְּטָעֵים לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Didn’t the Master say one who recites a blessing is required to taste? where he tasted it. Didn’t the Master say tasted disqualified it he tasted it with his hand
llm_translation: The Master said: "One who recites the blessing must taste it!" - for he tastes it. And the Master said: "One's taste is one's flaw!" - for he tastes it with his hands.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר מָר כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה צָרִיךְ שִׁעוּר, וְהָא קָא פָּחֵית לֵיהּ מִשִּׁיעוּרֵיהּ! — דִּנְפִישׁ לֵיהּ טְפֵי מִשִּׁיעוּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Didn’t the Master say: A cup of blessing requires measure doesn’t he diminish from its measure? the cup contained more than the measure
llm_translation: And the Master said, "A cup of blessing requires a measure, yet he poured more for it than its measure!" - Because he poured more than its measure.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא אוֹתוֹ כּוֹס קָתָנֵי! — תְּרֵי לָא הָוֵי וּמֵחַד נְפִישׁ.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught If he has only one cup there are not two but more than one.
llm_translation: And this, if there is only that cup there, it is a small cup! - Two, it is not, and from one it is superfluous.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְשׁוֹתֵהוּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן! אֶלָּא תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach Beit Shammai say: He recites a blessing over the wine and drinks it, and recites Grace after Meals thereafter? Rather, two tanna’im in accordance with Beit Shammai
llm_translation: And this was taught by Rabbi Chiya: Beit Shammai say one blesses over the wine and drinks it, and afterwards blesses the grace after meals! Rather, there are two teachings, and the halacha follows Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say:
llm_translation: House of Shammai says, and so forth.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם וְאַחַר כָּךְ מוֹזְגִין אֶת הַכּוֹס, שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר מוֹזְגִין אֶת הַכּוֹס תְּחִלָּה, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ מַשְׁקִין שֶׁאֲחוֹרֵי הַכּוֹס מֵחֲמַת יָדָיו, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: The Sages taught Beit Shammai say: One washes hands and mixes water in the cup thereafter, as if you say one mixes water in the cup first, decreed the liquid that on the outside of the cup might become ritually impure due to his hands, and will in turn render the cup ritually impure.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Beit Shammai say: One takes the cup in hand first, and afterwards pours the wine into the cup, for if you were to say, pour into the cup first, it is a decree lest the liquids behind the cup become impure due to his hands, and they return and render the cup impure.

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַּמּוּ יָדַיִם לְכוֹס!
human_translation: Let hands render the cup ritually impure
llm_translation: And they shall immerse their hands in the cup!

hebrew_text: יָדַיִם שְׁנִיּוֹת הֵן, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי מַשְׁקִין.
human_translation: Hands have second and second cannot confer third upon non-sacred items, except by means of liquids.
llm_translation: Hands are two, and two do not make a third in mundane matters except through liquids.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹזְגִין אֶת הַכּוֹס וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם. שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם תְּחִלָּה, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ מַשְׁקִין שֶׁבַּיָּדַיִם מֵחֲמַת הַכּוֹס, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: One mixes water in the cup and washes hands thereafter, as if you say one washes hands first, a decree lest the liquid one’s hands will be rendered ritually impure due to the cup and will in turn render his hands ritually impure.
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: Pour the cup, and afterwards take it in hand. For if you say to take it in hand first, there is a decree lest the liquids on the hands become impure due to the cup, and they will return and render the hands impure.

hebrew_text: וְנִיטַּמֵּי כּוֹס לְיָדַיִם! — אֵין כְּלִי מְטַמֵּא אָדָם.
human_translation: Let the cup render hands ritually impure a vessel does not render a person ritually impure.
llm_translation: "And those who handle a cup are impure! - A vessel does not render a person impure."

hebrew_text: וְנִיטַּמֵּי לְמַשְׁקִין שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ! — הָכָא בִּכְלִי שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ אֲחוֹרָיו בְּמַשְׁקִין עָסְקִינַן, דְּתוֹכוֹ טָהוֹר וְגַבּוֹ טָמֵא. דִּתְנַן: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ אֲחוֹרָיו בְּמַשְׁקִין אֲחוֹרָיו טְמֵאִים
human_translation: let it render the liquids that are within ritually impure? Here we are dealing with a vessel the outside of which has been rendered ritually impure by liquids the inside is pure and the outside is impure. As we learned A vessel whose outer side is rendered ritually impure by liquid, the outer side is impure,
llm_translation: "And he immersed the liquids within it! Here, we are dealing with a vessel that became impure from liquids that were behind it, for we are discussing a case where its interior is pure while its exterior is impure. As we learned: If a vessel became impure from liquids that were behind it, its backside is impure."

hebrew_text: תּוֹכוֹ וְאוֹגְנוֹ וְאׇזְנוֹ וְיָדָיו טְהוֹרִין. נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: while its inner side, and its rim, and its and its handles pure. the inside became ritually impure, it is all ritually impure.
llm_translation: The inside and its lid and its handle and its legs are pure. If its inside becomes impure, it becomes entirely impure.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree?
llm_translation: With what do they argue?

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלִי שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ אֲחוֹרָיו בְּמַשְׁקִין, גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם נִיצוֹצוֹת. וְלֵיכָּא לְמִגְזַר שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ הַמַּשְׁקִין שֶׁבַּיָּדַיִם בַּכּוֹס.
human_translation: Beit Shammai hold: It is prohibited to use a vessel the outer side of which has been rendered ritually impure by liquids. a decree for drips And there is no issue a decree lest the liquid on one’s hands will be rendered ritually impure by the cup, as
llm_translation: House of Shammai hold: forbidden to use a vessel that its backside was immersed in liquids, decree due to sparks. And there is no decree lest the liquids in the hands will become impure in the cup.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלִי שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ אֲחוֹרָיו בְּמַשְׁקִין, אָמְרִי נִיצוֹצוֹת לָא שְׁכִיחִי, וְאִיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ מַשְׁקִין שֶׁבַּיָּדַיִם מֵחֲמַת הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold: One is permitted to use a vessel the outer side of which has been rendered ritually impure by liquid, say: Drips are uncommon, there is concern lest the liquid on one’s hands will be rendered ritually impure due to the cup.
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: permitted to use a vessel that became impure from behind with liquids, they said: sparks are not common, and there is concern lest the liquids in the hands become impure because of the cup.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: תֵּכֶף לִנְטִילַת יָדַיִם סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, Immediately the washing of the hands the meal.
llm_translation: Another matter: Immediately before washing hands, a meal.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לְהוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: לְדִידְכוּ דְּאָמְרִיתוּ אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֲחוֹרָיו טְמֵאִין דְּגָזְרִינַן מִשּׁוּם נִיצוֹצוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי הָא עֲדִיפָא, דְּתֵכֶף לִנְטִילַת יָדַיִם סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: What Alternatively? Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai as follows: according to you, who said it is prohibited to use a vessel the outer side of which is ritually impure as we issued a decree due to drips, even so, is preferable as Immediately the washing of the hands the meal.
llm_translation: "What is 'another matter' (דָּבָר אַחֵר)? This is what Beit Hillel is saying to Beit Shammai: According to your opinion, that you say it is forbidden to use a vessel whose back is impure due to sparks, even so, it is preferable, for immediately after washing hands, a meal."

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים מְקַנֵּחַ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: one dries
llm_translation: The School of Shammai says: "He is cleaning and so forth."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְקַנֵּחַ יָדָיו בַּמַּפָּה וּמַנִּיחָהּ עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן. שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר עַל הַכֶּסֶת, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ מַשְׁקִין שֶׁבַּמַּפָּה מֵחֲמַת הַכֶּסֶת, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: the Sages taught Beit Shammai say: one dries his hands with a cloth and places it on the table, as if you say on the cushion, decree lest the liquids on the cloth, become ritually impure due to with the cushion, and would in turn render the hands ritually impure.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Beit Shammai say: One wipes his hands with a cloth and places it on the table. For if you say on the cushion, there is a decree lest the liquids on the cloth become impure because of the cushion, and they will return and render the hands impure.

hebrew_text: וּנְטַמְּיַיהּ כֶּסֶת לְמַפָּה! — אֵין כְּלִי מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי.
human_translation: let the cushion render the towel ritually impure A vessel does not render vessel ritually impure.
llm_translation: "And its inner part is like a garment to a cloth! - A vessel does not render impure a vessel."

hebrew_text: וּנְטַמְּיֵיהּ כֶּסֶת לְגַבְרָא גּוּפֵיהּ! — אֵין כְּלִי מְטַמֵּא אָדָם.
human_translation: Let the cushion render the man ritually impure. A vessel does not render a person ritually impure.
llm_translation: "And his clothes are like a covering for a man's body!" - A vessel does not render a person impure.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַל הַכֶּסֶת. שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ מַשְׁקִין שֶׁבַּמַּפָּה מֵחֲמַת הַשּׁוּלְחָן וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הָאוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: on the cushion as if you say on the table, decree lest the liquids on the towel might be rendered ritually impure with the table, in turn will render the food ritually impure.
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: On the covering. For if you say on the table, it is a decree lest the liquids on the table become impure because of the table, and they will return and render the food impure.

hebrew_text: וּלְטַמֵּא שֻׁלְחָן לָאוֹכָלִין שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ! — הָכָא בְּשֻׁלְחָן שֵׁנִי עָסְקִינַן, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי מַשְׁקִין.
human_translation: Let the table render the food upon it ritually impure Here we are dealing with a table second second can only confer third upon non-sacred items by means of liquids.
llm_translation: "And to render impure a table for food within it! Here we are dealing with a second table, and a second table only renders a third one impure with liquids."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּשֻׁלְחָן שֵׁנִי, גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Beit Shammai hold: It is prohibited to use a table second a decree due to those who eat teruma .
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Beit Shammai hold that it is forbidden to make use of a second table, as a decree against those who eat terumah.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּשֻׁלְחָן שֵׁנִי, אוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה זְרִיזִין הֵם.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold: It is permitted to use a table second those who eat teruma are vigilant
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: permitted to use on table second, eaters of terumah are diligent they are.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: אֵין נְטִילַת יָדַיִם לְחוּלִּין מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, there is no washing of the hands for non-sacred items by Torah law.
llm_translation: Another matter: the washing of hands for common food is not from the Torah.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לְהוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: וְכִי תֵּימְרוּ מַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי אוֹכָלִין דְּחָיְישִׁינַן וּמַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי יָדַיִם דְּלָא חָיְישִׁינַן? אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי הָא עֲדִיפָא, דְּאֵין נְטִילַת יָדַיִם לְחוּלִּין מִן הַתּוֹרָה. מוּטָב שֶׁיִּטָּמְאוּ יָדַיִם דְּלֵית לְהוּ עִיקָּר מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְאַל יִטָּמְאוּ אוֹכְלִים דְּאִית לְהוּ עִיקָּר מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: What is Alternatively? Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai as follows: And if you say, what is the difference with regard to food that we are concerned and what is the difference with regard to hands that we are not concerned even so, this is preferable, there is no washing of the hands for non-sacred items by Torah law. It is preferable that hands, has no basis in Torah law, will become ritually impure and food, has a basis in Torah law, will not become ritually impure.
llm_translation: What is "another matter"? This is what Beit Hillel says to Beit Shammai: And if you say, what is the difference regarding foods that we are concerned about, and what is the difference regarding hands that we are not concerned? Even so, this is preferable, for the washing of hands for common food is not from the Torah. It is better that their hands become impure, as there is no primary importance from the Torah, and that the food does not become impure, as there is primary importance from the Torah.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים מְכַבְּדִין וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One sweeps the house and he washes his hands thereafter. And Beit Hillel say: One washes his hands and sweeps the house thereafter.
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say, "They honor and so forth."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים מְכַבְּדִין אֶת הַבַּיִת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם, שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם תְּחִלָּה, נִמְצָא אַתָּה מַפְסִיד אֶת הָאוֹכָלִין. אֲבָל נְטִילַת יָדַיִם לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי תְּחִלָּה לָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? — מִשּׁוּם פֵּירוּרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught Beit Shammai say: One sweeps the house and washes his hands thereafter, as if you say that one washes his hands first, you will have ruined the food. But Beit Shammai do not hold that the washing of the hands is first. What is the reason? Due to crumbs
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Beit Shammai say, one should honor the house and then wash hands, for if you say to wash hands first, you may end up neglecting the food. But washing hands first according to Beit Shammai, they do not agree. What is the reason? — Because of crumbs.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אִם שַׁמָּשׁ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא, נוֹטֵל פֵּירוּרִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶם כְּזַיִת, וּמַנִּיחַ פֵּירוּרִין שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן כְּזַיִת.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: If the attendant is a Torah scholar, removes the crumbs that are an olive-bulk and leaves crumbs that are not an olive-bulk,
llm_translation: The House of Hillel says: If a student of a sage is a servant, he takes olives that have pits, and he leaves olives that do not have pits.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פֵּירוּרִין שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶם כְּזַיִת — מוּתָּר לְאַבְּדָן בַּיָּד.
human_translation: supports Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Crumbs that are less than an olive-bulk one may destroy them with his hand
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yochanan. For Rabbi Yochanan said: Pomegranates that do not have a pit - it is permitted to destroy them by hand.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בֵּית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּשַׁמָּשׁ עַם הָאָרֶץ. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּשַׁמָּשׁ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Beit Hillel hold: One is forbidden to use a waiter am ha’aretz . And Beit Shammai hold: One is permitted to use an attendant am ha’aretz .
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Beit Hillel hold: It is forbidden to benefit from the sun of an am ha'aretz. And Beit Shammai hold: It is permitted to benefit from the sun of an am ha'aretz.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בְּכוּלֵּיהּ פִּרְקִין הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל, בַּר מֵהָא דַּהֲלָכָה כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא מַתְנִי אִיפְּכָא, וּבְהָא נָמֵי הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said Rav Huna said: In our entire chapter, the halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel, except for this where the halakha is in accordance with Beit Shammai. And Rabbi Oshaya would teach the opposite and in this as well, the halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said, Rabbi Huna said: In all places, the halacha is like Beit Hillel, except in the matter of the halacha it is like Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Oshaya taught the opposite, and in this matter, the halacha is like Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּמָזוֹן וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: candle, Meals
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: "Ner u'mazon u'ko..."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רָבָא. חַזְיֵיהּ לְרָבָא דְּבָרֵיךְ אַבְּשָׂמִים בְּרֵישָׁא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִכְּדִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל אַמָּאוֹר לָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּתַנְיָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּמָזוֹן, בְּשָׂמִים וְהַבְדָּלָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּבְשָׂמִים, מָזוֹן וְהַבְדָּלָה!
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda happened to Rava’s house. He saw that Rava recited a blessing over the spices first. said to him: Now since Beit Hillel and Beit Shammai do not disagree with regard to light, as we learned Beit Shammai say: candle, Meals spices, havdala . And Beit Hillel say: candle, and spices, Meals, and havdala ,
llm_translation: Rav Huna the son of Yehuda entered the house of Rava. He saw Rava that your words are perfumes at the beginning. He said to him: Since Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel do not argue, as it was taught: Beit Shammai says: "Light, and food, spices, and Havdalah." And Beit Hillel says: "Light, and spices, food, and Havdalah!"

hebrew_text: עָנֵי רָבָא בָּתְרֵיהּ: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁהוּא בַּתְּחִילָּה וְעַל הַבְדָּלָה שֶׁהִיא בַּסּוֹף, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הַמָּאוֹר וְעַל הַבְּשָׂמִים, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים עַל הַמָּאוֹר וְאַחַר כָּךְ בְּשָׂמִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים בְּשָׂמִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ מָאוֹר.
human_translation: Rava answered after him: that is the statement of Rabbi Meir. However, Rabbi Yehuda says in Beit Hillel and Beit Shammai neither disagree with regard to Meals that it is first, nor with regard to havdala , which is last. With regard to what do they disagree? with regard to the light and the spices. Beit Shammai say: over light and over spices thereafter, and Beit Hillel say: over spices and over light thereafter.
llm_translation: The poverty of Rava, his daughter-in-law: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but Rabbi Yehuda says: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the blessing said at the beginning of the meal and the blessing said at the end, what did they disagree about? — They disagreed about the order of the candle and the spices, Beit Shammai says first the candle and then the spices, and Beit Hillel says first the spices and then the candle.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָהֲגוּ הָעָם כְּבֵית הִלֵּל אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The people were accustomed in accordance with Beit Hillel according to Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: The people have adopted the practice of Beit Hillel in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים שֶׁבָּרָא כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Who created [ bara ]
llm_translation: Beit Shammai says: "That which was created, as it is."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּ״בָרָא״ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָרָא מַשְׁמַע. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּ״בוֹרֵא״, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי ״בּוֹרֵא״ דַּעֲתִיד לְמִבְרָא, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי ״בּוֹרֵא״ נָמֵי דִּבְרָא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: With regard to bara , everyone agrees that it means created Where they disagree is with regard to boreh . Beit Shammai hold: Boreh will create in the future, and Beit Hillel hold: Boreh also means that He has created
llm_translation: Rava said: In "Bara" everyone agrees that "Bara" implies creation. When they argue in "Borei," Beit Shammai holds that "Borei" means He will create, and Beit Hillel holds that "Borei" also implies creation.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר וּבוֹרֵא חֹשֶׁךְ״, ״יוֹצֵר הָרִים וּבוֹרֵא רוּחַ״, ״בּוֹרֵא הַשָּׁמַיִם וְנוֹטֵיהֶם״. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּ״בָרָא״ וּ״בוֹרֵא״ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָרָא מַשְׁמַע, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּ״מְאוֹר״ וּ״מְאוֹרֵי״. דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי חֲדָא נְהוֹרָא אִיכָּא בְּנוּרָא, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי טוּבָא נְהוֹרֵי אִיכָּא בְּנוּרָא. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: הַרְבֵּה מְאוֹרוֹת יֵשׁ בָּאוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection: “Who forms light and creates [ boreh ] darkness” “Who forms mountains and creates [ boreh ] wind” “Who creates [ boreh ] the heavens and stretches them out” Rather, said Rav Yosef: With regard to both bara and boreh , everyone agrees that mean created. Where they disagree is with regard to the light the lights As Beit Shammai hold there is one light in a fire, and Beit Hillel hold there are many lights in a fire, That was also taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: There are many lights in the fire.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "He forms light and creates darkness," "He forms mountains and creates wind," "He creates the heavens and spreads them out." Rather, Rav Yosef said: With regard to "creates" and "forms," they do not disagree, as "creates" implies forming, for they disagree regarding "light" and "lights." Beit Shammai holds that there is one kind of light in a lamp, and Beit Hillel holds that there are many kinds of light in a lamp. It was also taught similarly: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: There are many lights in light.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְבָרְכִין כּוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא נֵר מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא שָׁבַת, אֶלָּא בְּשָׂמִים מַה טַּעַם לֹא?
human_translation: one may neither recite a blessing Granted, a candle as did not rest. However, what is the reason that not spices
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We do not recite the blessing of "Kiddushin." Granted, regarding the lamp, it is because it did not rest on the Sabbath. But with regards to spices, what is the reason for not reciting the blessing?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הָכָא בִּמְסִבַּת גּוֹיִם עָסְקִינַן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּתָם מְסִבַּת גּוֹיִם לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Here we are dealing with a party gentiles the parties of gentiles are generally to idolatry.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Here we are dealing with a gathering of non-Jews, because the default gathering of non-Jews is for idol worship.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא אֵין מְבָרְכִין לֹא עַל הַנֵּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, מִכְלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה עָסְקִינַן!
human_translation: But from that which was taught in the latter clause One may neither recite a blessing over the candle nor over the spices of idolatry, by implication that the first clause we are not dealing with idolatry?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause: One does not recite a blessing neither over the lamp nor over the incense of idolatry. By implication, in the first clause, are we not dealing with idolatry!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא: ״מַה טַּעַם״ קָאָמַר: מַה טַּעַם אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הַנֵּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל גּוֹיִם — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּתָם מְסִבַּת גּוֹיִם לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura said: states What is the reason. What is the reason that one may neither recite a blessing over the candle nor over the spices of gentiles? Because the parties of gentiles are generally to idolatry
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina from Sepphoris said: "What is the reason" he said: What is the reason we do not recite a blessing over the candle and not over the perfumes of the gentiles? Because the usual practice of gentiles is for idolatry.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אוּר שֶׁשָּׁבַת — מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו, וְשֶׁלֹּא שָׁבַת — אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו. מַאי ״שָׁבַת״ וּמַאי ״לֹא שָׁבַת״?
human_translation: The Sages taught Over fire that rested, one may recite a blessing and over that did not rest, one may not recite a blessing. What is rested, and what is did not rest?
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one lit a lamp on Friday - one recites a blessing over it, but if one did not light it on Friday - one does not recite a blessing over it. What is considered "Friday" and what is considered "did not light it on Friday"?

hebrew_text: אִי נֵימָא לֹא שָׁבַת מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה אֲפִילּוּ מִמְּלָאכָה דְּהֶתֵּירָא, וְהָתַנְיָא: אוּר שֶׁל חַיָּה וְשֶׁל חוֹלֶה — מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו!
human_translation: If we say it did not rest from labor, even from labor that is permitted? Wasn’t it taught over light for a woman giving birth or a ill person, one may recite a blessing
llm_translation: If you say he did not desist due to work, even from permissible work, and it was taught: "The light of an animal and that of a sick person - one blesses upon it!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי ״שָׁבַת״ — שֶׁשָּׁבַת מֵחֲמַת מְלֶאכֶת עֲבֵירָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עֲשָׁשִׁית שֶׁהָיְתָה דּוֹלֶקֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת מְבָרְכִין עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What is rested? that rested from labor of transgression That was also taught A lantern that was continuously burning throughout the entire day one may recite a blessing over it at the conclusion of Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What is "Shabbat"? — That Shabbat is due to the work of transgression. It was also taught likewise: A lamp that was burning and lit the entire day, on the conclusion of Shabbat one blesses over it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גּוֹי שֶׁהִדְלִיק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהִדְלִיק מִגּוֹי מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו. גּוֹי מִגּוֹי — אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught A gentile who lit from a Jew or if a Jew lit from a gentile, one may recite a blessing over it if a gentile from a gentile, one may not recite a blessing over it.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A gentile who kindled from a Jew, and a Jew who kindled from a gentile, we bless upon him. A gentile from a gentile - we do not bless upon him.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא גּוֹי מִגּוֹי דְּלָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא שָׁבַת? אִי הָכִי, יִשְׂרָאֵל מִגּוֹי נָמֵי הָא לֹא שָׁבַת!
human_translation: What is different a gentile from a gentile, that not Because did not rest If so, a Jew from a gentile also did not rest
llm_translation: What is the difference between a non-Jew from a non-Jew that he did not observe the Sabbath? If so, even Israel is like a non-Jew in this regard, yet they did observe the Sabbath!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הַךְ אִיסּוּרָא אֲזַל לֵיהּ, וְהָא אַחֲרִינָא הוּא, וּבִידָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל קָא מִתְיַלְדָא — אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹצִיא שַׁלְהֶבֶת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — חַיָּיב. אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? מַה שֶּׁעָקַר לֹא הִנִּיחַ, וּמַה שֶּׁהִנִּיחַ לֹא עָקַר!
human_translation: And if you say this prohibited has gone and this is a different came into being in the possession of a Jew, however, this that was taught One who carries out a flame to the public domain is liable why is he liable? That which he lifted he did not place and that which he placed he did not lift.
llm_translation: And if you will say, that that prohibition went to him, but he is another, and in the hand of Israel is being born - rather, as it was taught: One who brings a flame out to a public domain - is liable. Why is he liable? That which he uprooted he did not establish, and that which he established he did not uproot!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיסּוּרָא נָמֵי אִיתֵיהּ, וְכִי קָא מְבָרֵךְ — אַתּוֹסֶפְתָּא דְּהֶתֵּירָא קָא מְבָרֵךְ, אִי הָכִי, גּוֹי מִגּוֹי נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rather, actually that prohibited is also extant, and when one recites the blessing, he recites the blessing over the permitted addition If so, a gentile from a gentile as well,
llm_translation: Rather, forever of prohibition truly exists, and when blessing — additional of permission blesses, if so, nation from nation truly!

hebrew_text: אֵין הָכִי נָמֵי, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם גּוֹי רִאשׁוֹן וְעַמּוּד רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so. a decree because of the first gentile, and the first pillar
llm_translation: So it is indeed stated: a decree due to the first nation and the first pillar.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ חוּץ לַכְּרַךְ וְרָאָה אוּר, אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — מְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught If one was walking outside the city, saw fire if majority of gentiles he may not recite the blessing if majority of Jews, he may recite the blessing.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one was walking outside the city and saw a light, if the majority are non-Jews — he does not recite a blessing, if the majority are Jews — he recites a blessing.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, הָא מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — מְבָרֵךְ, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — מְבָרֵךְ, הָא מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ!
human_translation: The matter itself is difficult You said majority of gentiles he may not recite the blessing. half and half one may recite a blessing. And then you teach if majority of Jews, he may recite the blessing. half and half one may not recite a blessing.
llm_translation: This is a difficult case, you said: if the majority are non-Jews — one does not recite a blessing; but if it is half and half — one recites a blessing. And further, you taught: if the majority are Israelites — one recites a blessing; but if it is half and half — one does not recite a blessing!

hebrew_text: בְּדִין הוּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה נָמֵי מְבָרֵךְ, וְאַיְּידִי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״רוֹב נׇכְרִים״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא ״רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: By right, even half and half one may recite a blessing, since in the first clause it taught: The majority of gentiles, in the latter clause it taught: The majority of Jews.
llm_translation: In judgment it is that even half on half, yes, one blesses, and since it was taught in the beginning "the majority of non-Jews," it was taught in the end "the majority of Israelites."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ חוּץ לַכְּרַךְ וְרָאָה תִּינוֹק וַאֲבוּקָה בְּיָדוֹ, בּוֹדֵק אַחֲרָיו; אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא — מְבָרֵךְ, אִם נָכְרִי הוּא — אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: the Sages taught: One who was walking outside the city and saw a child with a torch in his hand, he check after his If is a Jew, he may recite a blessing but if is a gentile, he may not recite a blessing
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: If one was walking outside the city and saw a child holding a bird, he should check behind him; if he is an Israelite, he blesses, if he is a non-Jew, he does not bless.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִירְיָא תִּינוֹק? אֲפִילּוּ גָּדוֹל נָמֵי!
human_translation: Why was it taught a child? Even if he were an adult, also
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "tinok"? Even an adult is called by that name!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הָכָא בְּסָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה עָסְקִינַן. גָּדוֹל, מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא דְּוַדַּאי נָכְרִי הוּא. תִּינוֹק, אֵימַר יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא, אִקְּרִי וּנְקֵיט.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Here we are dealing with soon after sunset. an adult, it is self-evident that he is a gentile, a child, say that he is a Jew it happened that he took
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Here we are dealing with a case close to sunset. Gadol, it is clear that he is a non-Jew. Tinok, we should say he is a Jew, and we should read and accept.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ חוּץ לַכְּרַךְ וְרָאָה אוּר, אִם עָבֶה כְּפִי הַכִּבְשָׁן — מְבָרֵךְ עָלָיו. וְאִם לָאו אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ עָלָיו.
human_translation: the Sages taught: One who was walking outside the city and saw a fire, if is as thick as the opening of a furnace, one may recite a blessing over it, And if not one may not recite a blessing over it.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one was walking outside the city limits and saw a light, if it is as bright as the face of the moon - he recites a blessing upon it. But if not, he does not recite a blessing upon it.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אוּר שֶׁל כִּבְשָׁן מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו!
human_translation: It was taught one one may recite a blessing over the fire of a furnace; and it was taught another One may not recite a blessing over
llm_translation: One taught: Regarding the hide of a ram, one recites a blessing over it. And another teaching: One does not recite a blessing over it!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּתְּחִלָּה, הָא לְבַסּוֹף.
human_translation: not difficult, this at the beginning that at the end,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in the beginning, this in the end.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אוּר שֶׁל תַּנּוּר וְשֶׁל כִּירַיִם מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו!
human_translation: It was taught one one may recite a blessing over the fire of an oven or a stove; and it was taught another One may not recite a blessing over it.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who sees the light of an oven or of two stoves, one recites a blessing upon it. And it was taught in another source: One does not recite a blessing upon it!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּתְּחִלָּה, הָא לְבַסּוֹף.
human_translation: not difficult, This at the beginning, that at the end,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in the beginning, this in the end.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אוּר שֶׁל בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְשֶׁל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו!
human_translation: It was taught one one may recite a blessing over the light of a synagogue or a study hall; and it was taught another One may not recite a blessing over it.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who sees a fire of a synagogue or study hall, blesses upon it. And it was taught in another source: One does not bless upon it!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיכָּא אָדָם חָשׁוּב, הָא דְּלֵיכָּא אָדָם חָשׁוּב.
human_translation: not difficult, this where there is an important person that where there is no important person
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that there is a person esteemed, this that there is not a person esteemed.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא הָא וְהָא דְּאִיכָּא אָדָם חָשׁוּב, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיכָּא חַזָּנָא, הָא דְּלֵיכָּא חַזָּנָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this that where there is an important person and not difficult This where there is a caretaker that where there is no caretaker
llm_translation: If you want, say this: "But what about the fact that there is a distinguished person here, and it is not difficult?" - This is where there is a cantor, this is where there is no cantor.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא הָא וְהָא דְּאִיכָּא חַזָּנָא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיכָּא סֵהֲרָא, וְהָא דְּלֵיכָּא סֵהֲרָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that where there is a caretaker and not difficult This where there is moonlight, that where there is no moonlight,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Here and here there is a vision, and it is not difficult: here where there is a razor, and here where there is no razor.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיוּ יוֹשְׁבִין בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְהֵבִיאוּ אוּר לִפְנֵיהֶם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מְבָרֵךְ לְעַצְמוֹ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד מְבָרֵךְ לְכוּלָּן — מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּרׇב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught People were seated in the study hall and they brought fire before them Beit Shammai say: Each and every individual recites a blessing for himself; and Beit Hillel say: One recites a blessing on behalf of everyone as it is stated: “The splendor of the King is in the multitude of the people”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: They were sitting in the study hall and brought light before them, Beit Shammai say: Each and every one blesses for himself. And Beit Hillel say: One blesses for all of them — because it is stated: "In the multitude of people is the king's glory."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל מְפָרְשִׁי טַעְמָא, אֶלָּא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מַאי טַעְמָא? קָסָבְרִי מִפְּנֵי בִּיטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: Granted, Beit Hillel, explain reasoning, but what is the reason of Beit Shammai They hold due to suspension of the study hall.
llm_translation: In truth, Beit Hillel explains the reason, but what is the reason of Beit Shammai? They hold that it is due to the neglect of the study hall.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לֹא הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״מַרְפֵּא״ בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, מִפְּנֵי בִּיטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: This was also taught the house of Rabban Gamliel would not say good health in the study hall, due to suspension of the study hall.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: The students of the school of Rabban Gamliel did not say "marpe" in the study hall, due to neglect of the study hall.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְבָרְכִין לֹא עַל הַנֵּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל מֵתִים. מַאי טַעְמָא? נֵר — לְכָבוֹד הוּא דַּעֲבִידָא, בְּשָׂמִים לְעַבּוֹרֵי רֵיחָא הוּא דַּעֲבִידִי.
human_translation: One may neither recite a blessing over the candle nor over the spices the dead. What is the reason? a candle is kindled for honoring the spices to neutralize the odor,
llm_translation: We do not bless neither on the candle nor on the spices of the dead. What is the reason? Candle - it is for honor of the commandment, spices - it is for pleasant fragrance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כֹּל שֶׁמּוֹצִיאִין לְפָנָיו בַּיּוֹם וּבַלַּיְלָה — אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין מוֹצִיאִין לְפָנָיו אֶלָּא בַּלַּיְלָה — מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Any before whom is taken out by day and by night, one may not recite a blessing over it. And any before whom is taken out only by night, one may recite a blessing over it.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anything that is brought before him during the day and at night - one does not recite a blessing over it. And anything that is only brought before him at night - one recites a blessing over it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא, וְשֶׁמֶן הֶעָשׂוּי לְהַעֲבִיר אֶת הַזּוּהֲמָא — אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Over spices the bathroom and oil to remove filth, one may not recite a blessing
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Regarding the fragrances of the bathroom, and the oil made to remove excrement - one does not recite a blessing over them.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלָאו לְרֵיחָא עֲבִידָא לָא מְבָרְכִין עִלָּוֵיהּ? מֵתִיבִי: הַנִּכְנָס לַחֲנוּתוֹ שֶׁל בַּשָּׂם וְהֵרִיחַ רֵיחַ, אֲפִילּוּ יָשַׁב שָׁם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ אֶלָּא פַּעַם אַחַת. נִכְנַס וְיָצָא, נִכְנַס וְיָצָא — מְבָרֵךְ עַל כׇּל פַּעַם וּפַעַם. וְהָא הָכָא דְּלָאו לְרֵיחָא הוּא דַּעֲבִידָא, וְקָמְבָרֵךְ!
human_translation: Is that to say any where it is not used for its fragrance, one may not recite a blessing over it? raises an objection One who enters the store of a perfumer, and smelled a fragrance, even if he sat there throughout the entire day, he only recites a blessing once. if one entered and exited, entered and exited, he recites a blessing on each and every occasion. Isn’t here, where are not intended for fragrance, and, one recites a blessing?
llm_translation: In the matter of every place where there is no smell, is a blessing not recited over it? It was asked: One who enters a perfumer's shop and smells a fragrance, even if he sits there the entire day, he only recites a blessing once. If he enters and exits, enters and exits — he recites a blessing each time. But here, where there is no smell at all, and he recites a blessing!

hebrew_text: אִין, לְרֵיחָא נָמֵי הוּא דַּעֲבִידָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנֵירְחוּ אִינָשֵׁי וְנֵיתוּ וְנִזְבּוֹן מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Yes, are also intended for fragrance; so that people will smell and come and purchase from him.
llm_translation: There is, for the smell, in front of it that it does, as how that they should smell people and they should give and they should be satisfied from it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ חוּץ לַכְּרַךְ וְהֵרִיחַ רֵיחַ, אִם רוֹב נׇכְרִים — אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — מְבָרֵךְ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — נָמֵי אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל מְקַטְּרוֹת לִכְשָׁפִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who was walking outside a city and smelled a scent; if the majority are gentiles he may not recite a blessing if the majority are Jews, he may recite a blessing. Rabbi Yosei says: Even if the majority are Jews, one may not recite a blessing, as the daughters of Israel burn incense to witchcraft
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one was walking outside the city and smelled a fragrance, if the majority are non-Jews — he does not recite a blessing; if the majority are Jews — he recites a blessing. Rabbi Yosei says: Even if the majority are Jews, still he does not recite a blessing, because Jewish women are involved in burning incense for idolatry.

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ לִכְשָׁפִים מְקַטְּרָן?! — הָוֵה לַהּ מִיעוּטָא לִכְשָׁפִים, וּמִיעוּטָא נָמֵי לְגַמֵּר אֶת הַכֵּלִים. אִשְׁתְּכַח רוּבָּא דְּלָאו לְרֵיחָא עֲבִיד, וְכׇל רוּבָּא דְּלָאו לְרֵיחָא עֲבִיד לָא מְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: Is that to say that they all burn incense to witchcraft? there is a minority to witchcraft, and a minority to perfume garments with incense. A majority, does not use it for fragrance, and in a case where the majority does not use it for fragrance, one does not recite a blessing.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Are all of them the ingredients for sorcery?! — It is necessary for him to have a minimal amount for sorcery, and also a minimal amount to complete the vessels. If the majority is not for fragrance, and any majority that is not for fragrance does not require a blessing."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמְהַלֵּךְ בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת בִּטְבֶרְיָא וּבְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת בְּצִפּוֹרִי וְהֵרִיחַ רֵיחַ, אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחֶזְקָתוֹ אֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי אֶלָּא לְגַמֵּר בּוֹ אֶת הַכֵּלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who walks on Shabbat eve in Tiberias at the conclusion of Shabbat in Tzippori, and smelled the scent may not recite a blessing, as the presumption is it was intended to perfume garments.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: One who walks on Friday evenings in Tiberias and on Saturday nights in Tzippori and smells a fragrance, he does not recite a blessing, because his intent is only to complete his vessels.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּשּׁוּק שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נִתְרַצָּה לְהָרִיחַ — הֲרֵי זֶה חוֹטֵא.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who was walking in the marketplace of idolators and willingly smelled he is a sinner,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one was walking in the marketplace of idolatry and desired to smell an idolatrous offering, behold, he sins.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הַנֵּר עַד שֶׁיֵּאוֹתוּ.
human_translation: And one does not recite the blessing over the candle until he derives benefit
llm_translation: And not bless on the candle until they light it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא ״יֵאוֹתוּ״ יֵאוֹתוּ מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ עוֹמֵד בְּקָרוֹב וּמִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לְאוֹרָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּרִיחוּק מָקוֹם. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּרִיחוּק מָקוֹם שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says  Rav says: Derives benefit does not   actually derive benefit  Rather, as long as if one were to stand close  he could utilize its light,  even  at a distance.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Not "ye'otu" shall they shine, they shall shine literally, but rather anyone who engages in Torah study near and benefits from its light, even from a distance. And so said Rav Ashe: Even from a distance we have learned.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיְתָה לוֹ נֵר טְמוּנָה בְּחֵיקוֹ, אוֹ בְּפַנָּס, אוֹ שֶׁרָאָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לְאוֹרָהּ, אוֹ נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לְאוֹרָהּ וְלֹא רָאָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת — אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ עַד שֶׁיִּרְאֶה שַׁלְהֶבֶת וְיִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לְאוֹרָהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection One who had a candle hidden in his lap inside an lamp, or if he saw a flame and did not utilize its light, or if he utilized its light and did not see a flame, may not recite a blessing until he sees the flame and utilizes its light.
llm_translation: Challenger: If he had a hidden lamp in his bosom, or in a lantern, or if he saw a flame and did not benefit from its light, or benefited from its light and did not see a flame - he does not recite a blessing until he sees a flame and benefits from its light.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לְאוֹרָהּ וְלֹא רָאָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — דְּקַיְימָא בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית. אֶלָּא רָאָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לְאוֹרָהּ הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? לָאו דִּמְרַחֲקָא?!
human_translation: Granted, utilizes its light and did not see a flame, can be found where is situated a corner, how can saw a flame and did not utilize its light be found? Is it not where one is distant?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one uses a lamp for its light and does not see the flame, it is established in a corner. But if one sees the flame and does not use it for its light, how can it be established in a corner? Is it not from a distance?!

hebrew_text: לָא, כְּגוֹן דְּעָמְיָא וְאָזְלָא.
human_translation: No. a case where gradually dimming.
llm_translation: Not, like Amiya and Azla.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֶּחָלִים לוֹחֲשׁוֹת — מְבָרְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן, אוֹמְמוֹת — אֵין מְבָרְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי לוֹחֲשׁוֹת? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מַכְנִיס לְתוֹכָן קֵיסָם וְדוֹלֶקֶת מֵאֵילֶיהָ.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may recite a blessing over smoldering coals over dimming [ omemot ] one may not recite a blessing. What are the circumstances of smoldering coals? Rav Ḥisda said: any that, if one places a wood chip among them, it ignites on its own
llm_translation: The sages taught: If the coals are glowing - one blesses over them, if they are dimming - one does not bless over them. What is considered "glowing"? Rav Ḥisda said: Whenever one can place a piece of straw in them and it catches fire from them.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״אוֹמְמוֹת״ אוֹ ״עוֹמְמוֹת״?
human_translation: raises a dilemma: omemot omemot
llm_translation: He inquired of them: "Omomot" or "Umomot"?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: ״אֲרָזִים לֹא עֲמָמֻהוּ בְּגַן אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Come and hear as Rav Ḥisda bar Avdimi said: “The cedars in the garden of God could not dim it amamuhu ”
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Ḥisdah son of Avdimi said: "The cedars did not equal it in the garden of God."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: ״יֵאוֹתוּ״ מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: And Rava said: benefit, actually
llm_translation: And Rava said: "Yei'otu" literally.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? אָמַר עוּלָּא: כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּכִּיר בֵּין אִיסָּר לְפוּנְדְּיוֹן. חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּכִּיר בֵּין מְלוּזְמָא שֶׁל טְבֶרְיָא לִמְלוּזְמָא שֶׁל צִפּוֹרִי.
human_translation: And how Ulla said: So that he can distinguish between an issar and a pundeyon , Ḥizkiya said: So that he can distinguish between a weight Tiberias and a weight Tzippori,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much? Ulla said: Enough to distinguish between Issar and Fundyon. Hezekiah said: Enough to distinguish between the meluzma of Teverya and the meluzma of Tzipori."

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה מְבָרֵךְ אַדְּבֵי אַדָּא דַּיָּילָא, רָבָא מְבָרֵךְ אַדְּבֵי גּוּרְיָא בַּר חָמָא. אַבָּיֵי מְבָרֵךְ אַדְּבֵי בַּר אֲבוּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda recite a blessing over of the house of Adda, the servant, Rava recite a blessing over of the house of Gurya bar Ḥama, Abaye recite a blessing over of the house of bar Avuh.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah blesses the host of the wine, Rava blesses the host of the wheat bread, Abbaye blesses the host of the cooked food.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֵין מְחַזְּרִין עַל הָאוּר כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְחַזְּרִים עַל הַמִּצְוֹת. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה מְהַדַּרְנָא, כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לְהָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, אֲנָא נָמֵי לָא מְהַדַּרְנָא, אֶלָּא אִי מִקְּלַע לִי מִמֵּילָא — מְבָרֵיכְנָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said One need not seek out light in the manner that one seeks out mitzvot. Rav Zeira said: Initially I would seek out once I heard this Rav Yehuda said Rav said, I too do not seek However, if happens to me, I recite a blessing
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One does not review the light as one reviews the commandments. Rabbi Zeira said: We were accustomed to recite the blessing over the wine first, but once I heard what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, I too do not recite the blessing over the wine first, but if it is offered to me first — I recite the blessing over it.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁאָכַל וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב זְבִיד וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב דִּימִי בַּר אַבָּא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּשָׁכַח, אֲבָל בְּמֵזִיד, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל — יַחְזוֹר לִמְקוֹמוֹ וִיבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: one who ate Rav Zevid said and some say Rav Dimi bar Abba dispute is where one forgot but intentionally, everyone agrees that he must return to place he and recite a blessing.
llm_translation: One who ate, etc. Rav Zevid said, and some say Rav Dimi bar Abba said: Disagreement when done inadvertently, but when done intentionally, all agree - he should return to his place and bless.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, ״וְשָׁכַח״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: This is obvious. We learned And forgot,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita, 'veshachach' tenan."

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְתֵימָא הוּא הַדִּין אֲפִילּוּ בְּמֵזִיד, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״וְשָׁכַח״ — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי. קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say the same is true, even willfully and that which was taught: And forgot, is to convey the far-reaching of Beit Shammai, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is the same even if done intentionally, and this that is taught "and he forgets" - to inform you the power of the House of Shammai. It has been established for us.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, מִי שֶׁאָכַל בְּרֹאשׁ הַבִּירָה וְשָׁכַח וְיָרַד וְלֹא בֵּרַךְ, יַחְזוֹר לְרֹאשׁ הַבִּירָה וִיבָרֵךְ?! אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם מִי שֶׁשָּׁכַח אַרְנָקִי בְּרֹאשׁ הַבִּירָה לֹא יַעֲלֶה וְיִטְלֶנָּה? לִכְבוֹד עַצְמוֹ הוּא עוֹלֶה, לִכְבוֹד שָׁמַיִם לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: It was taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: According to your statement, one who ate atop God’s chosen place of residence, and forgot and descended without reciting a blessing, must he return to the top of God’s chosen place of residence, to recite a blessing? Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: And according to your statement, one who forgot his purse atop God’s chosen place of residence, would he not ascend to retrieve it? If one ascends in deference to his own all the more so in deference to Heaven.
llm_translation: It was taught: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: According to your words, if one ate at the top of the tower and forgot, and descended without reciting a blessing, should he return to the top of the tower and recite a blessing?! Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: According to your words, if one forgot a purse at the top of the tower, should he not go up and take it? For his own honor he goes up, how much more so for the honor of Heaven?!

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַּלְמִידֵי, חַד עֲבַד בְּשׁוֹגֵג כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי וְאַשְׁכַּח אַרְנְקָא דְּדַהֲבָא, וְחַד עֲבַד בְּמֵזִיד כְּבֵית הִלֵּל וְאַכְלֵיהּ אַרְיָא.
human_translation: these two students One of them did so unwittingly, in accordance with Beit Shammai, and found a purse of gold. One of them did so intentionally, in accordance with Beit Hillel, and a lion ate him.
llm_translation: Behold, there were two disciples, one inadvertently performed in accordance with the school of Shammai and found a purse of gold, and one intentionally acted in accordance with the school of Hillel and ate it with a lion.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה הֲוָה קָאָזֵל בְּשַׁיַּירְתָּא, אֲכַל וְאִשְׁתְּלִי וְלָא בָּרֵיךְ. אֲמַר: הֵיכִי אַעֲבֵיד? אִי אָמֵינָא לְהוּ ״אִנְּשַׁאי לְבָרֵךְ״, אָמְרוּ לִי: בָּרֵיךְ, כׇּל הֵיכָא דִּמְבָרְכַתְּ — לְרַחֲמָנָא מְבָרְכַתְּ. מוּטָב דְּאָמֵינָא לְהוּ: אִנְּשַׁאי יוֹנָה דְּדַהֲבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִנְטַרוּ לִי, דְּאִנְּשַׁאי יוֹנָה דְּדַהֲבָא. אָזֵיל וּבָרֵיךְ וְאַשְׁכַּח יוֹנָה דְּדַהֲבָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana was once traveling with a caravan. He ate and forgot and did not recite a blessing. He said What shall I do? If I say to them: I forgot to recite a blessing, they say to me to recite a blessing wherever you recite a blessing, you recite a blessing to God. better that I say to them: I forgot a golden dove. He said to them: Wait for me, as I forgot a golden dove. He went and recited a blessing and found a golden dove.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana was walking in the marketplace, he ate and drank and did not recite a blessing. He said: How shall I act? If I say to them, "Let us recite a blessing," they will say to me, "Recite a blessing, wherever you recite a blessing — to the Merciful One you recite a blessing." It is better that I say to them: "Let us go after the golden dove." He said to them: Follow me, for we will go after the golden dove. He went, recited a blessing, and found the golden dove.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא יוֹנָה? דִּמְתִילִי כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְיוֹנָה. דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּנְפֵי יוֹנָה נֶחְפָּה בַכֶּסֶף וְאֶבְרוֹתֶיהָ בִּירַקְרַק חָרוּץ״ — מָה יוֹנָה אֵינָהּ נִיצּוֹלֶת אֶלָּא בִּכְנָפֶיהָ, אַף יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינָן נִיצּוֹלִין אֶלָּא בְּמִצְוֹת.
human_translation: What is different dove, Because the community of Israel is likened to a dove, as it is written: “The wings of a dove, covered in silver, and its pinions with the shimmer of gold” Just as a dove is saved only by its wings, so too, Israel is saved only by mitzvot.
llm_translation: And what is the difference with a dove? Because the Congregation of Israel is compared to a dove. As it is written: "As the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her pinions with shimmering gold." Just as a dove is only captured by its wings, so too Israel are only redeemed through the commandments.

hebrew_text: עַד אֵימָתַי הוּא וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And until when does he
llm_translation: Until when is it and so forth.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה שִׁיעוּר עִכּוּל? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָעֵב. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיִּצְמָא מֵחֲמַת אֲכִילָתוֹ.
human_translation: What is the duration of digestion? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: long as he is not hungry And Reish Lakish said: As long as he is thirsty due to his eating.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "How much is the measure of Akul? Rabbi Yochanan said: As long as he is not hungry. And Reish Lakish said: As long as he is thirsty due to his eating."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא לְמָר זוּטְרָא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב יֵימַר בַּר שֵׁיזְבִי לְמָר זוּטְרָא: מִי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב אַמֵּי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כַּמָּה שִׁיעוּר עִכּוּל? — כְּדֵי לְהַלֵּךְ אַרְבַּע מִילִין!
human_translation: Rav Yeimar bar Shelamya said to Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Yeimar bar Sheizevi Mar Zutra: Did Reish Lakish say that? Didn’t Rav Ami say Reish Lakish said: What is the duration of digestion? As long as to walk four mil ?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yeimar son of Shelemya said to the Master Zutra, and some say Rav Yeimar son of Sheizbi said to the Master Zutra: Who said this statement, Reish Lakish? But didn't Rav Ammi say that Reish Lakish said: What is the measure of a miscarriage? - Sufficient to walk four mil!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּאֲכִילָה מְרוּבָּה, כָּאן בַּאֲכִילָה מוּעֶטֶת.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, in a sizable meal, here, in a meager meal.
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in eating is abundant, here in eating is little.

hebrew_text: בָּא לָהֶן יַיִן וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: wine came before
llm_translation: Came to them wine and etc.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שָׁמַע כּוּלָּהּ בְּרָכָה עוֹנֶה? וְכִי לָא שָׁמַע הֵיכִי נָפֵיק?
human_translation: Is that to say that a Jew even though one did not hear the entire blessing, he responds If he did not hear how did he fulfill
llm_translation: In the matter of Yisrael, even though he did not hear the entire blessing, does it still count as a response? And if he did not hear, how does he fulfill it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִיָּיא בַּר רַב: בְּשֶׁלֹּא אָכַל עִמָּהֶן, וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ בְּשֶׁלֹּא אָכַל עִמָּהֶן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ: בְּרִי, חֲטוֹף וּבָרֵיךְ. וְכֵן אֲמַר רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: חֲטוֹף וּבָרֵיךְ.
human_translation: Ḥiyya bar Rav said: where he did not eat with them And so Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: where he did not eat with them. Rav said to his son, Ḥiyya: My son, seize and recite a blessing And similarly Rav Huna said to his son, Rabba, seize and recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Said Ḥiyya son of Rav: when he did not eat with them, and so said Rav Naḥman said Rabba son of Avuh: when he did not eat with them. Rav said to Ḥiyya his son: my son, grab and bless. And so said Rav Huna to Rabba his son: grab and bless.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּמְבָרֵךְ עֲדִיף מִמַּאן דְּעָנֵי ״אָמֵן״? וְהָתַנְיָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ יוֹתֵר מִן הַמְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: Is that to say that one who recites a blessing is preferable to one who answers amen? Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says: the one who answers amen is greater than the one who recites the blessing?
llm_translation: In the matter of one who responds "Amen" is preferable than one who recites "Amen"? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Greater is the one who responds "Amen" than the one who recites.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי: הַשָּׁמַיִם, כֵּן הוּא. תִּדַּע — שֶׁהֲרֵי גּוּלְיָירִין יוֹרְדִין וּמִתְגָּרִין בַּמִּלְחָמָה, וְגִבּוֹרִים יוֹרְדִין וּמְנַצְּחִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Nehorai said to him: By Heavens, it is so. Know as the military assistants [ gulyarin ] descend to the and initiate the war the mighty descend and prevail.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Nehorai: The heavens, so it is. Know - for revealed ones descend and engage in battle, and heroes descend and are victorious!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד הַמְבָרֵךְ וְאֶחָד הָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ בַּמַּשְׁמָע, אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּמַהֲרִין לַמְבָרֵךְ יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹנֶה אָמֵן.
human_translation: a tannaitic dispute, as it was taught Both the one who recites a blessing and the one who answers are included they hurry to the one who recites the blessing, more than the one who answers amen.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One who recites the blessing and one who responds "Amen" during the hearing, but the one reciting the blessing hurries more than the one responding "Amen."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל מֵרַב: מַהוּ לַעֲנוֹת ״אָמֵן״ אַחַר תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַחַר הַכֹּל עוֹנִין אָמֵן, חוּץ מִתִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן, הוֹאִיל וּלְהִתְלַמֵּד עֲשׂוּיִין. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּדְלָא עִידָּן מִפְטְרַיְיהוּ, אֲבָל בְּעִידָּן מִפְטְרַיְיהוּ — עוֹנִין.
human_translation: Shmuel raised a dilemma before Rav: What is answering amen after schoolchildren? said to him: One answers amen following everyone except for schoolchildren, as they to learn This applies at a time when they are not fulfilling their obligation However, at a time when they are fulfilling their obligation one answers
llm_translation: Requested translation: Shmuel asked Rav: What is the law regarding responding "Amen" after the blessings of the children of the school? He said to him: After everything, they respond "Amen," except for the children of the school, since they are engaged in learning. And these matters, if they do not interrupt them, they respond, but if they interrupt them, they do not respond.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שֶׁמֶן מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַבְּרָכָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי זִילַאי. רַבִּי זִיוַאי אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ מְעַכֵּב. רַב אַחָא אוֹמֵר: שֶׁמֶן טוֹב מְעַכֵּב. רַבִּי זוּהֲמַאי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּזֹוהָם פָּסוּל לַעֲבוֹדָה, כָּךְ יָדַיִם מְזוֹהָמוֹת פְּסוּלוֹת לִבְרָכָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught oil prevents the blessing; the statement of Rabbi Zilai. Rabbi Zivai says: oil does not prevent one Rav Aḥa says: fine oil prevents one Rav Zuhamai says: Just as one who is filthy is unfit for Temple service, so too are filthy hands unfit for the blessing.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Oil delays the blessing," the words of Rabbi Zeila. Rabbi Ziyawai says: "It does not delay." Rav Acha says: "Good oil delays." Rabbi Zuhama says: "Just as oil that is disqualified for the service in the Temple is invalid for a blessing, so too, dirty hands are disqualified for a blessing."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲנָא לָא זִילַאי וְלָא זִיוַאי וְלָא זוּהֲמַאי יָדַעְנָא אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתָא יָדַעְנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: ״וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם״ אֵלּוּ מַיִם רִאשׁוֹנִים, ״וִהְיִיתֶם קְדֹשִׁים״ אֵלּוּ מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים, ״כִּי קָדוֹשׁ״ — זֶה שֶׁמֶן, ״אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״ — זוֹ בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said I do not know of Zilai or Zivai or Zuhamai; rather, I know a baraita , as Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and some say taught in a baraita : And you shall sanctify yourselves, these are the first waters and you shall be holy, these are the final waters; for holy, this is oil am I, the Lord your God, this is blessing.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: I did not learn from Zilai, nor from Zivai, nor from Zuhama; rather, I learned from the Mishnah. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say it was taught in a Mishnah: "And you shall sanctify yourselves" - these are the first waters; "and you shall be holy" - these are the last waters; "for I am the Lord your God" - this is oil; "I am the Lord your God" - this is a blessing.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך אלו דברים
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding these matters.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָרוֹאֶה מָקוֹם שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בּוֹ נִסִּים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁעָשָׂה נִסִּים לַאֲבוֹתֵינוּ בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״. מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרָה מִמֶּנּוּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁעָקַר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה מֵאַרְצֵנוּ״.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who sees a place where miracles were performed for the Jewish people should say: "Blessed is He who performed miracles for our ancestors in this place." If one sees a place from which idolatry was uprooted, he should say: "Blessed is He who uprooted idolatry from our land."

hebrew_text: עַל הַזִּיקִין, וְעַל הַזְּוָעוֹת, וְעַל הָרְעָמִים, וְעַל הָרוּחוֹת, וְעַל הַבְּרָקִים אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁכֹּחוֹ וּגְבוּרָתוֹ מָלֵא עוֹלָם״. עַל הֶהָרִים, וְעַל הַגְּבָעוֹת, וְעַל הַיַּמִּים, וְעַל הַנְּהָרוֹת, וְעַל הַמִּדְבָּרוֹת אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … עוֹשֵׂה בְּרֵאשִׁית״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אוֹמֵר: הָרוֹאֶה אֶת הַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁעָשָׂה אֶת הַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁרוֹאֵהוּ לִפְרָקִים.
human_translation: For zikin and zeva’ot , for thunder, winds, and lightning, recites: Blessed…Whose strength and power fill the world. For mountains, hills, seas, rivers, and deserts, one recites: Blessed…Author of creation. Rabbi Yehuda says: One who sees the great sea recites Blessed…Who made the great sea. when he sees intermittently,
llm_translation: On the earthquakes, and on the tremors, and on the thunder, and on the winds, and on the lightnings one says: "Blessed is He... whose strength and might fill the world." On the mountains, and on the hills, and on the seas, and on the rivers, and on the deserts one says: "Blessed is He... who creates the beginning." Rabbi Yehuda says: One who sees the great sea says: "Blessed is He who made the great sea" - when he sees it in intervals.

hebrew_text: עַל הַגְּשָׁמִים, וְעַל בְּשׂוֹרוֹת טוֹבוֹת אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״. עַל בְּשׂוֹרוֹת רָעוֹת אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״. בָּנָה בַּיִת חָדָשׁ, וְקָנָה כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּימָנוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לַזְּמַן הַזֶּה״. מְבָרֵךְ עַל הָרָעָה מֵעֵין עַל הַטּוֹבָה, וְעַל הַטּוֹבָה מֵעֵין עַל הָרָעָה.
human_translation: For rain and good tidings, one recites Blessed…Who is good and Who does good. for bad tidings, one recites Blessed…the true Judge. one built a new house or purchased new vessels, he recites: Blessed…Who has given us life, sustained us, and brought us to this time. One recites a blessing for the bad just as for the good. Similarly, the good just as for the bad.
llm_translation: On rain, and on good tidings one says: "Blessed is the Good and the Doer of Good." On bad tidings one says: "Blessed is the True Judge." If one built a new house, or acquired new vessels, one says: "Blessed is... who has granted us life, sustained us, and enabled us to reach this time." One blesses for the bad in the manner of the good, and for the good in the manner of the bad.

hebrew_text: וְהַצּוֹעֵק לְשֶׁעָבַר — הֲרֵי זוֹ תְּפִלַּת שָׁוְא. הָיְתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁתֵּלֵד אִשְׁתִּי זָכָר״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ תְּפִלַּת שָׁוְא. הָיָה בָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְשָׁמַע קוֹל צְוָחָה בָּעִיר, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתִי״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ תְּפִלַּת שָׁוְא.
human_translation: And one who cries out over the past it is a vain prayer. one whose wife was pregnant and he says: May it be will that my wife will give birth to a male child, it is a vain prayer. one who was walking on the path and he heard the sound of a scream in the city, and he says: May it be will that will not be from my house, it is a vain prayer.
llm_translation: The one who cries out for what has already passed — this is a futile prayer. If his wife was pregnant, and he says, "May it be the will that my wife give birth to a male" — this is a futile prayer. If he was on the way and heard a cry in the city, and he says, "May it be the will that it not be in my house" — this is a futile prayer.

hebrew_text: הַנִּכְנָס לִכְרַךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁתַּיִם, אַחַת בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ, וְאַחַת בִּיצִיאָתוֹ. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: אַרְבַּע, שְׁתַּיִם בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ, וּשְׁתַּיִם בִּיצִיאָתוֹ. נוֹתֵן הוֹדָאָה עַל שֶׁעָבַר וְצוֹעֵק עַל הֶעָתִיד.
human_translation: One who enters a large city, recites two prayers: One upon his entrance, and one upon his exit, Ben Azzai says: four two upon his entrance and two upon his exit. gives thanks for the past and cries out for the future.
llm_translation: The one who enters a city recites two prayers, one upon entering and one upon leaving. Ben Azzai says: Four, two upon entering and two upon leaving. One gives thanks for the past and cries out for the future.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְבָרֵךְ עַל הָרָעָה כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּבָרֵךְ עַל הַטּוֹבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָהַבְתָּ אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּכׇל לְבָבְךָ וְגוֹ׳״. ״בְּכָל לְבָבְךָ״ — בִּשְׁנֵי יְצָרֶיךָ, בְּיֵצֶר טוֹב וּבְיֵצֶר הָרָע. ״וּבְכׇל נַפְשְׁךָ״ — אֲפִילּוּ הוּא נוֹטֵל אֶת נַפְשְׁךָ. ״וּבְכׇל מְאֹדֶךָ״ — בְּכָל מָמוֹנְךָ. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״בְּכָל מְאֹדֶךָ״ — בְּכָל מִדָּה וּמִדָּה שֶׁהוּא מוֹדֵד לְךָ הֱוֵי מוֹדֶה לוֹ.
human_translation: One is obligated to recite a blessing for the bad just as he recites a blessing for the good as it is stated: “And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, With all your heart” with your two inclinations, with your good inclination and your evil inclination, “With all your soul” even if God takes your soul. “And with all your might” with all your money, Alternatively, with all your might” with every measure that He metes out to you; thank Him.
llm_translation: A person is obligated to bless on the bad just as he blesses on the good, as it is stated: "And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, etc." "With all your heart" - with both your inclinations, with the good inclination and with the evil inclination. "And with all your soul" - even if He takes your soul. "And with all your wealth" - with all your possessions. Another explanation: "And with all your wealth" - in every measure and measure that He measures for you, acknowledge Him.

hebrew_text: לֹא יָקֵל אָדָם אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ כְּנֶגֶד שַׁעַר הַמִּזְרָח שֶׁהוּא מְכוּוָּן כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים. וְלֹא יִכָּנֵס לְהַר הַבַּיִת בְּמַקְלוֹ, וּבְמִנְעָלוֹ, וּבְפוּנְדָּתוֹ, וּבְאָבָק שֶׁעַל רַגְלָיו. וְלָא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ קַפַּנְדַּרְיָא. וּרְקִיקָה — מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: One may not act irreverently opposite the eastern gate which is aligned opposite the Holy of Holies. may not enter the Temple Mount with his staff, his shoes, his money belt [ punda ], or the dust on his feet. One may not make a shortcut and through an a fortiori inference, one may not spit
llm_translation: A person shall not make light of his head opposite the eastern gate, which is directly across from the entrance of the Holy of Holies. And one shall not enter the Temple Mount with his staff, or with his sandal, or with his wallet, or with dust on his feet. And he shall not make it a shortcut. And a wafer - from the same material and substance.

hebrew_text: כׇּל חוֹתְמֵי בְּרָכוֹת שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״עַד הָעוֹלָם״. מִשֶּׁקִּלְקְלוּ הַמִּינִין וְאָמְרוּ אֵין עוֹלָם אֶלָּא אֶחָד, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹמְרִים ״מִן הָעוֹלָם וְעַד הָעוֹלָם״.
