human_translation: At the conclusion of all blessings in the Temple, those would say: until everlasting [ haolam ] when the Sadducees strayed and declared there is but one world instituted that one recites: From everlasting [ haolam ] to everlasting [ haolam ]
llm_translation: All the sealers of blessings in the Temple used to say "forever." When the heretics corrupted the meaning and said, "there is only one world," they instituted that the sealers should say "from the world to the world."

hebrew_text: וְהִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא אָדָם שׁוֹאֵל אֶת שְׁלוֹם חֲבֵרוֹ בַּשֵּׁם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִנֵּה בֹעַז בָּא מִבֵּית לֶחֶם וַיֹּאמֶר לַקּוֹצְרִים ה׳ עִמָּכֶם וַיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ יְבָרֶכְךָ ה׳״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״ה׳ עִמְּךָ גִּבּוֹר הֶחָיִל״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״אַל תָּבוּז כִּי זָקְנָה אִמֶּךָ״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״ מִשּׁוּם ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳״.
human_translation: instituted that one should greet another in the name as it is stated: “And presently Boaz came from Bethlehem and said to the harvesters, The Lord is with you, and they said to him, May the Lord bless you” And it says: and said to him, God is with you, mighty man of valor” And it says: “And despise not your mother when she is old” And it says: “It is time to work for the Lord; they have made void Your Torah” Rabbi Natan says “Make void Your Torah” because “it is the time to work for the Lord,”
llm_translation: And they established that a person should inquire about the welfare of his friend in the name, as it is stated: "And behold, Boaz came from Bethlehem and said to the reapers, 'The Lord be with you,' and they said to him, 'The Lord bless you.'" And it says: "The Lord is with you, O mighty man of valor." And it says: "Do not despise your mother when she is old." And it says: "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah." Rabbi Natan says: "They have violated Your Torah" because of "It is time to act for the Lord."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיֹּאמֶר יִתְרוֹ בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הִצִּיל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The verse states: “And Jethro said: Blessed be the Lord, Who delivered
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words? Rabbi Yochanan said, as the verse states: "And Yitro said, 'Blessed is Hashem who saved...'"

hebrew_text: אַנִּיסָּא דְרַבִּים מְבָרְכִינַן, אַנִּיסָּא דְיָחִיד לָא מְבָרְכִינַן?! וְהָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בַּעֲבַר יַמִּינָא. נְפַל עֲלֵיהּ אַרְיָא, אִתְעֲבִיד לֵיהּ נִיסָּא וְאִיתַּצַּל מִינֵּיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: כׇּל אִימַּת דְּמָטֵית לְהָתָם — בָּרֵיךְ ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁעָשָׂה לִי נֵס בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: For a miracle multitudes we recite a blessing, for a miracle an individual we do not recite a blessing? Wasn’t a certain man was walking along the right side a lion attacked him, a miracle was performed for him, and he was rescued? He came before Rava, who said to him: Every time that you arrive there, recite the blessing, “Blessed…Who performed a miracle for me in this place.”
llm_translation: The case of the majority, we bless, the case of the individual we do not bless?! And that man who was walking on the other side of the river, a lion fell upon him, performed a miracle for him and he was saved from it. He came before Rava, and he said to him: Any time you reach that place — recite the blessing "Blessed is He who performed a miracle for me in this place."

hebrew_text: וּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל בְּפַקְתָּא דַעֲרָבוֹת וּצְחָא לְמַיָּא. אִתְעֲבִיד לֵיהּ נִיסָּא, אִיבְּרִי לֵיהּ עֵינָא דְמַיָּא, וְאִישְׁתִּי.
human_translation: And Mar, son of Ravina, was walking in a valley of willows and thirsty for water, a miracle was performed for him a spring of water was created for him, and he drank.
llm_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, was walking in the outskirts of the city of Aravot and he saw water. He performed a miracle, he created a spring of water, and he drank.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, זִמְנָא חֲדָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל בְּרַסְתְּקָא דְמָחוֹזָא וּנְפַל עֲלֵיהּ גַּמְלָא פְּרִיצָא. אִיתְפָּרַקָא לֵיהּ אָשִׁיתָא, עָל לְגַוַּהּ. כִּי מְטָא לַעֲרָבוֹת בָּרֵיךְ: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁעָשָׂה לִי נֵס בַּעֲרָבוֹת וּבְגָמָל״. כִּי מְטָא לְרַסְתְּקָא דְמָחוֹזָא בָּרֵיךְ: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁעָשָׂה לִי נֵס בְּגָמָל וּבַעֲרָבוֹת״! אָמְרִי: אַנִּיסָּא דְרַבִּים — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיחַיְּיבִי לְבָרוֹכֵי, אַנִּיסָּא דְיָחִיד — אִיהוּ חַיָּיב לְבָרוֹכֵי.
human_translation: Furthermore, once was walking in the marketplace [ risteka ] of Meḥoza and a wild camel [ gamla peritza ] attacked him. The wall cracked open, he went inside it, when he came to the willows he recited: Blessed…Who performed a miracle for me in the willows and with the camel. when he came to the marketplace of Meḥoza he recited: Blessed…Who performed a miracle for me with the camel and in the willows, say: On a miracle of the multitudes, everyone is obligated to recite a blessing; on a miracle of an individual, is obligated to recite a blessing.
llm_translation: And thus, one time, he was walking in the marketplace of Mahoza, and a loaf of bread fell upon him. He took it and placed it on his shoulder. When he came to the deserts, he recited the blessing: "Blessed is He ... who performed a miracle for me in the deserts and with a camel." When he came to the marketplace of Mahoza, he recited the blessing: "Blessed is He ... who performed a miracle for me with a camel and in the deserts!" They said: In a case of a public miracle — all people are obligated to recite blessings, in a case of an individual miracle — he alone is obligated to recite blessings.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה מַעְבְּרוֹת הַיָּם, וּמַעְבְּרוֹת הַיַּרְדֵּן, מַעְבְּרוֹת נַחֲלֵי אַרְנוֹן, אַבְנֵי אֶלְגָּבִישׁ בְּמוֹרַד בֵּית חוֹרוֹן, וְאֶבֶן שֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ לִזְרוֹק עוֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶבֶן שֶׁיָּשַׁב עָלֶיהָ מֹשֶׁה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָשָׂה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִלְחָמָה בַּעֲמָלֵק, וְאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל לוֹט, וְחוֹמַת יְרִיחוֹ שֶׁנִּבְלְעָה בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — עַל כּוּלָּן צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן הוֹדָאָה וָשֶׁבַח לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who sees the crossings of the Sea, and the crossings of the Jordan; and the crossings of the streams of Arnon; the hailstones of Elgavish on the descent of Beit Ḥoron; the rock that Og, King of Bashan, sought to hurl upon Israel; and the rock upon which Moses sat when Joshua waged war against Amalek; and Lot’s wife; and the wall of Jericho that was swallowed up in its place. On all of these one must give thanks and praise before God.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees the crossings of the sea, and the crossings of the Jordan River, the crossings of the streams of Arnon, the stones of crystal in the descent of Beit Horon, and the stone that Og, king of Bashan, sought to throw upon the children of Israel, and the stone upon which Moses sat when Joshua fought against Amalek, and the wife of Lot, and the wall of Jericho that returned to its place - for all of these one must offer thanks and praise before the Almighty.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מַעְבְּרוֹת הַיָּם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּתוֹךְ הַיָּם בַּיַּבָּשָׁה״. מַעְבְּרוֹת הַיַּרְדֵּן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַמְדוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים נֹשְׂאֵי הָאָרוֹן בְּרִית ה׳ בֶּחָרָבָה בְּתוֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּן הָכֵן וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עֹבְרִים בֶּחָרָבָה עַד אֲשֶׁר תַּמּוּ כׇּל הַגּוֹי לַעֲבוֹר אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן״.
human_translation: Granted, the crossings of the sea as it is stated: “And the Israelites went into the sea on dry ground the crossings of the Jordan, as it is stated: “The priests who bore the ark of God’s covenant stood on dry land within the Jordan, while all Israel crossed on dry land until the entire nation finished crossing the Jordan”
llm_translation: In peace, the crossings of the sea, as it is written: "And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea on dry ground." The crossings of the Jordan, as it is written: "And the priests who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord stood firm on dry ground in the midst of the Jordan, and all Israel crossed over on dry ground until all the nation had finished passing over the Jordan."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַעְבְּרוֹת נַחֲלֵי אַרְנוֹן מְנָלַן? — דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל כֵּן יֵאָמַר בְּסֵפֶר מִלְחֲמֹת ה׳ אֶת וָהֵב בְּסוּפָה וְגוֹ׳״. תָּנָא: ״אֶת וָהֵב בְּסוּפָה״ — שְׁנֵי מְצוֹרָעִים הָיוּ, דַּהֲווֹ מְהַלְּכִין בְּסוֹף מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל. כִּי הֲווֹ קָא חָלְפִי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲתוֹ אֱמוֹרָאֵי
human_translation: However, from where do we the crossing of the streams of Arnon? As it is stated: “Wherefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord: Vahev in Sufa taught: “Vahev in Sufa”; there were two lepers, who were walking at the rear of the camp of Israel. As Israel passed, the Emorites came
llm_translation: Rather, are the fords of the Arnon rivers ours? — As it is written: "Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord, 'Waheb in Suphah,' etc." It was taught: "'Waheb in Suphah' — there were two lepers who were walking at the end of the camp of Israel. When they passed by, the Amorites came.

hebrew_text: עָבְדִי לְהוֹן נְקִירָתָא וּטְשׁוֹ בְּהוֹן. אָמְרִי: כִּי חָלְפִי יִשְׂרָאֵל הָכָא — נִקְטְלִינּוּן, וְלָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי דְּאָרוֹן הֲוָה מְסַגֵּי קַמַּיְיהוּ דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וַהֲוָה מַמֵּיךְ לְהוּ טוּרֵי מִקַּמַּיְיהוּ. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲתָא אָרוֹן, אִדְּבַקוּ טוּרֵי בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וְקַטְלִינּוּן, וּנְחַת דְּמַיְיהוּ לְנַחֲלֵי אַרְנוֹן. כִּי אֲתוֹ אֶת וָהֵב, חֲזוֹ דְּמָא דְּקָא נָפֵיק מִבֵּינֵי טוּרֵי. אֲתוֹ וְאָמְרִי לְהוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וַאֲמַרוּ שִׁירָה. הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶשֶׁד הַנְּחָלִים אֲשֶׁר נָטָה לְשֶׁבֶת עָר וְנִשְׁעַן לִגְבוּל מוֹאָב״.
human_translation: and prepared caves for themselves and they hid in them. They said: When Israel passes here we will kill them. And they did not know Ark preceded Israel and would flatten mountains before them. When Ark came, the mountains adhered one to another and killed them; and their blood down to the streams of Arnon. When Et and Hev, arrived, they saw the blood that was emerging from between the mountains, and they came and told Israel recited song as it is stated: “And at the cascade of the brooks that goes down to the dwelling of Ar, and lies upon the border of Moab”
llm_translation: The servants of the princes dug a well and they threw into it. They said: When the Israelites passed by here - they were killed, and they did not know that the Ark was passing before them and was smoothing out their paths. When the Ark arrived, the paths stuck to each other, and they were killed, and their blood flowed into the valleys of Arnon. When the fire came, they saw the blood that was coming out from between the paths. They came and said to the Israelites, and they sang a song. That is what is written: "And from the desert, they went to Mattanah, and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth."

hebrew_text: אַבְנֵי אֶלְגָּבִישׁ. מַאי אַבְנֵי אֶלְגָּבִישׁ?
human_translation: the hailstones of Elgavish. What hailstones of Elgavish?
llm_translation: Stones of alabaster. What are stones of alabaster?

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אֲבָנִים שֶׁעָמְדוּ עַל גַּב אִישׁ, וְיָרְדוּ עַל גַּב אִישׁ. עָמְדוּ עַל גַּב אִישׁ — זֶה מֹשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָאִישׁ מֹשֶׁה עָנָו מְאֹד״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחְדְּלוּ הַקֹּלוֹת וְהַבָּרָד וּמָטָר לֹא נִתַּךְ אָרְצָה״. יָרְדוּ עַל גַּב אִישׁ — זֶה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״קַח לְךָ אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר רוּחַ בּוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בְּנוּסָם מִפְּנֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵם בְּמוֹרַד בֵּית חוֹרֹן וַה׳ הִשְׁלִיךְ עֲלֵיהֶם אֲבָנִים גְּדֹלוֹת״.
human_translation: It is taught stones that suspended because of [ al gav ] a man [ ish ] and they fell down because of [ al gav ] a man [ ish ]. They suspended because of a man; that is Moses, as it is written: “And the man Moses was very modest” and it is written: the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth” descended because of a man; that is Joshua, as it is written: “Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is spirit” And it is written “As they fled from before Israel, while they were at the descent of Beit Ḥoron, that the Lord cast down great stones
llm_translation: It was taught: Stones that stood on the back of a man, and descended on the back of a man. If they stood on the back of a man - this is Moses, as it is written: "Now the man Moses was very humble" (Numbers 12:3), and it is written: "And the voices and the thunder ceased, and the rain did not pour on the earth" (Joshua 10:11). If they descended on the back of a man - this is Joshua, as it is written: "Take for yourself Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is spirit" (Numbers 27:18), and it is written: "And it came to pass, as they fled from before the children of Israel, while they were at the descent of Beth-horon, that the Lord cast down great stones from heaven upon them" (Joshua 10:11).

hebrew_text: אֶבֶן שֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ עוֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן לִזְרוֹק עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ. אֲמַר מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּמָּה הָוֵי — תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי, אֵיזֵיל וְאֶיעֱקַר טוּרָא בַּר תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי וְאִישְׁדֵּי עֲלַיְיהוּ, וְאִיקְטְלִינְהוּ. אֲזַל עֲקַר טוּרָא בַּר תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי וְאַיְיתִי עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ, וְאַיְיתִי קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא עֲלֵיהּ קַמְצֵי וְנַקְבוּהּ, וּנְחֵית בְּצַוְּארֵיהּ.
human_translation: rock that Og, King of Bashan, sought to throw upon Israel, a tradition was transmitted. said: How is the camp of Israel? three parasangs. I will go and uproot a mountain three parasangs and I will hurl it upon them and kill them. He went, uprooted a mountain three parasangs and brought it on his head. And The Holy One, Blessed be He, brought grasshoppers upon it and they pierced the mountain and fell on his neck.
llm_translation: Stone that sought Og king of Bashan to throw on Israel, Gemara Gemiri to it. Said camp of Israel how much will be — three parasangs, go and uproot mountain son of three parasangs and throw on them, and killed them. Went uproot mountain son of three parasangs and brought on its head, and brought Holy One Blessed be He on it, fists and punctured it, and placed on their necks.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה בָּעֵי לְמִשְׁלְפֵהּ, מָשְׁכִי שִׁינֵּיהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא וּלְהַאי גִּיסָא וְלָא מָצֵי לְמִשְׁלְפֵהּ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״. וְכִדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״ — אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״ אֶלָּא ״שִׁרְבַּבְתָּ״.
human_translation: wanted to remove it his teeth were extended to one side and to the other and he was unable to And that is what is written: “You break the teeth of the wicked” And in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Ben Lakish, as Rabbi Shimon Ben Lakish said: What that which is written: “You break the teeth of the wicked”? Do not read You break [ shibarta ], but rather You lengthened [ shirbavta ].
llm_translation: The one who was seeking to extract it, he pulled out its teeth for this side and for that side, and he could not extract it. And that is what is written: "The teeth of the wicked you have broken." And like Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written "The teeth of the wicked you have broken" - do not read it as "you have broken" but rather as "you have shattered."

hebrew_text: מֹשֶׁה כַּמָּה הֲוָה — עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, שְׁקֵיל נַרְגָּא בַּר עֲשַׂר אַמִּין, שְׁוַור עֲשַׂר אַמִּין, וּמַחְיֵיהּ בְּקַרְסוּלֵּיהּ וְקַטְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: How was Moses? ten cubits He took an axe ten cubits jumped ten cubits, and struck in the ankle and killed him.
llm_translation: Moses, how much was he? — Ten cubits. He took a lamp of ten cubits, an ox of ten cubits, and he placed it in its cradle and killed it.

hebrew_text: וְאֶבֶן שֶׁיָּשַׁב עָלֶיהָ מֹשֶׁה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וִידֵי מֹשֶׁה כְּבֵדִים וַיִּקְחוּ אֶבֶן וַיָּשִׂימוּ תַחְתָּיו וַיֵּשֶׁב עָלֶיהָ״.
human_translation: rock upon which Moses sat, as it is written: “But Moses’ hands were heavy; and they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat thereon”
llm_translation: "And a stone upon which Moses sat - as it is written: 'And the hands of Moses were heavy, and they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat upon it.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל לוֹט — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתַּבֵּט אִשְׁתּוֹ מֵאַחֲרָיו וַתְּהִי נְצִיב מֶלַח״. וְחוֹמַת יְרִיחוֹ שֶׁנִּבְלְעָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּפֹּל הַחוֹמָה תַּחְתֶּיהָ״.
human_translation: And Lot’s wife, as it is stated: “But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt” And the wall of Jericho that was swallowed, as it is written: “And the wall fell down flat”
llm_translation: The wife of Lot - as it is stated: "And his wife looked back behind him, and she became a pillar of salt." And the wall of Jericho that collapsed - as it is written: "And the wall fell beneath it."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ — נִיסָּא, אֶלָּא אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל לוֹט פּוּרְעָנוּתָא הוּא! — דְּאָמַר ״בָּרוּךְ … דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״.
human_translation: Granted, all of these. are miracles; however, Lot’s wife is a tragedy. recites: Blessed…the true Judge.
llm_translation: In truth, all of them - a miracle, but Lot's wife is a punishment! - as it says, "Blessed is the...true Judge."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״הוֹדָאָה וָשֶׁבַח״ קָתָנֵי! תְּנִי: עַל לוֹט וְעַל אִשְׁתּוֹ מְבָרְכִים שְׁתַּיִם. עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ … דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״, וְעַל לוֹט אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ … זוֹכֵר אֶת הַצַּדִּיקִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת כַּעֲסוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, זוֹכֵר אֶת הַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בְּשַׁחֵת אֱלֹהִים אֶת עָרֵי הַכִּכָּר וַיִּזְכֹּר אֱלֹהִים אֶת אַבְרָהָם וַיְשַׁלַּח אֶת לוֹט מִתּוֹךְ הַהֲפֵכָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: But thanks and praise? and teach: Over Lot and his wife one recites two blessings. Over his wife he recites: Blessed…the true Judge, and on Lot he recites: Blessed…Who remembers the righteous. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even during a time of wrath of the Holy One, Blessed be He, remembers the righteous, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when He overthrew the cities in which Lot dwelt”
llm_translation: The text states: "And the 'acknowledgment and praise' is taught! It was taught: On Lot and his wife they bless twice. On his wife one says, 'Blessed is the True Judge,' and on Lot one says, 'Blessed is He who remembers the righteous.' Rabbi Yochanan said: Even at the moment of the anger of the Holy One, blessed be He, He remembers the righteous, as it is stated: 'And it came to pass, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, etc.'"

hebrew_text: וְחוֹמַת יְרִיחוֹ שֶׁנִּבְלְעָה. וְחוֹמַת יְרִיחוֹ נִבְלְעָה? וְהָא נָפְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי כִשְׁמֹעַ הָעָם אֶת קוֹל הַשּׁוֹפָר וַיָּרִיעוּ הָעָם תְּרוּעָה גְדוֹלָה וַתִּפֹּל הַחוֹמָה תַּחְתֶּיהָ״! — כֵּיוָן דְּפוּתְיַהּ וְרוּמַהּ כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אִבַּלְעָה בְּלוֹעֵי.
human_translation: the wall of Jericho that was swallowed Were the walls of Jericho swallowed up Didn’t they fall, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the shofar , that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat” Since the width and height were equal to one another, therefore, they were swallowed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the wall of Jericho collapsed. And the wall of Jericho collapsed? But it fell, as it is stated: 'And when the people heard the sound of the horn, the people shouted a great shout, and the wall fell beneath it!' - Since its thickness and height were equal, they were swallowed up together."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַרְבָּעָה צְרִיכִין לְהוֹדוֹת: יוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם, הוֹלְכֵי מִדְבָּרוֹת, וּמִי שֶׁהָיָה חוֹלֶה וְנִתְרַפֵּא, וּמִי שֶׁהָיָה חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים וְיָצָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Four must thanks Seafarers, those who walk in the desert, and one who was ill and recovered, and one who was incarcerated in prison and went out.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Four must give thanks: Those who go down to the sea, those who travel through deserts, one who was sick and recovered, and one who was imprisoned and was released.

hebrew_text: יוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם מְנָלַן? — דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם בָּאֳנִיּוֹת וְגוֹ׳ הֵמָּה רָאוּ מַעֲשֵׂי ה׳״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיַּעֲמֵד רוּחַ סְעָרָה יַעֲלוּ שָׁמַיִם יֵרְדוּ תְהוֹמוֹת״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יָחוֹגּוּ וְיָנוּעוּ כַּשִּׁכּוֹר״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּצְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ בַּצַּר לָהֶם וּמִמְּצוּקֹתֵיהֶם יוֹצִיאֵם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יָקֵם סְעָרָה לִדְמָמָה״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּשְׂמְחוּ כִי יִשְׁתֹּקוּ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יוֹדוּ לַה׳ חַסְדּוֹ וְנִפְלְאוֹתָיו לִבְנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: From where do we seafarers As it is written: “They who go down to the sea in ships, they see the works of the Lord” And it says: “For He commands and raises the stormy wind They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: And it says: “They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, And it says “Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and He brings them out of their distress” And it says: “He makes the storm calm, and it says: “Then are they glad because they be quiet; and it says: “They are grateful to God for His loving-kindness and His wonders for mankind”
llm_translation: Those who go down to the sea, what do they see? — As it is written: "Those who go down to the sea in ships, they saw the deeds of the Lord." And it says: "He stirred up a storm wind, the heavens rose, the depths descended." And it says: "They reeled and staggered like a drunkard." And it says: "They cried out to the Lord in their distress, and He brought them out of their trouble." And it says: "He stilled the storm to a whisper." And it says: "Let them give thanks to the Lord for His steadfast love, and His wonders to the children of men."

hebrew_text: הוֹלְכֵי מִדְבָּרוֹת מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״תָּעוּ בַמִּדְבָּר בִּישִׁימוֹן דָּרֶךְ עִיר מוֹשָׁב לֹא מָצָאוּ … וַיִּצְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ … וַיַּדְרִיכֵם בְּדֶרֶךְ יְשָׁרָה … יוֹדוּ לַה׳ חַסְדּוֹ״.
human_translation: From where do we those who walk in the desert As it is written “They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city in which to dwell” “And then they cried unto the Lord And He led them forth by the right way” “They are grateful to God for His goodness”
llm_translation: Travelers of deserts, from where do they derive their sustenance? As it is written: "They wandered in the wilderness in a desolate way; they found no city to dwell in... Then they cried out to the Lord... And He led them by the right way... Let them give thanks to the Lord for His mercy."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁחָלָה וְנִתְרַפֵּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱוִילִים מִדֶּרֶךְ פִּשְׁעָם וּמֵעֲוֹנֹתֵיהֶם יִתְעַנּוּ. כׇּל אֹכֶל תְּתַעֵב נַפְשָׁם וְגוֹ׳ וַיִּזְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ בַּצַּר לָהֶם וְגוֹ׳ יִשְׁלַח דְּבָרוֹ וְיִרְפָּאֵם וְגוֹ׳ יוֹדוּ לַה׳ חַסְדּוֹ״.
human_translation: one who was ill and recovered as it is written: “Fools, because of their transgression and because of their iniquities, are afflicted. Their soul abhors all manner of food “Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, “He sent His word and healed them, “They are grateful to God for His goodness”
llm_translation: One who became ill and recovered, as it is written: "Fools, because of their rebellious way, and because of their iniquities, were afflicted. Their soul abhorred all food, etc." And they cried out to the Lord in their distress, etc. He sent His word and healed them, etc. Let them give thanks to the Lord for His lovingkindness.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין מְנָלַן? — דִּכְתִיב: ״יֹשְׁבֵי חֹשֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָוֶת וְגוֹ׳ כִּי הִמְרוּ אִמְרֵי אֵל וְגוֹ׳״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיַּכְנַע בֶּעָמָל לִבָּם וְגוֹ׳״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּזְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ בַּצַּר לָהֶם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יוֹצִיאֵם מֵחֹשֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָוֶת וְגוֹ׳״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יוֹדוּ לַה׳ חַסְדּוֹ״.
human_translation: From where one who was incarcerated in prison As it is written: “Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, Because they rebelled against the words of God And it says: “Therefore He brought down their heart with labor; and it says: “Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and it says: “He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And it says: “They are grateful to God for His goodness.”
llm_translation: One who was imprisoned in the house of prisoners, from where do we derive this? — As it is written: "Those who dwell in darkness and the shadow of death, etc., because they rebelled against the sayings of God, etc." And it says: "They bowed down in sorrow, etc.," and it says: "They cried out to the Lord in their distress," and it says: "He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, etc.," and it says: "Let them give thanks to the Lord for His kindness."

hebrew_text: מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״בָּרוּךְ גּוֹמֵל חֲסָדִים טוֹבִים״. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: וְצָרִיךְ לְאוֹדוֹיֵי קַמֵּי עַשְׂרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וִירוֹמְמוּהוּ בִּקְהַל עָם וְגוֹ׳״. מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: וּתְרֵין מִינַּיְיהוּ רַבָּנַן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְמוֹשַׁב זְקֵנִים יְהַלְלוּהוּ״.
human_translation: What blessing recite? Rav Yehuda said: Blessed is…Who bestows acts of loving-kindness. Abaye said: And he must thanks before ten as it is written “Let them exalt Him also in the congregation of the people Mar Zutra said: Two of them Sages, as it is stated “And praise Him in the assembly of elders.”
llm_translation: What does one bless? Rav Yehudah said: "Blessed is He who bestows good kindness." Abbaye said: And one must acknowledge Him in the presence of ten, as it is written: "And they exalt Him in the assembly of the people, etc." Mar Zutra said: And two types of Rabbinic authorities, as it is said: "And in the seat of the elders He is praised."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: וְאֵימָא כּוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן?! — מִי כְּתִיב ״בִּקְהַל זְקֵנִים״? ״בִּקְהַל עָם״ כְּתִיב. וְאֵימָא בֵּי עַשְׂרָה שְׁאָר עַמָּא, וּתְרֵי רַבָּנַן! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: Say all of them Sages. Is it written: In the congregation of elders? In the congregation of the people is written; Say ten the rest of the people, two Sages. difficult,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Ashei objects to him: But why not all the Rabbis?! — Who is it written "in the assembly of elders"? It is written "in the assembly of the people." But why not the other ten tribes, and two Rabbis! This is difficult.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה חֲלַשׁ וְאִתְּפַח. עָל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה וְרַבָּנַן. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: ״בְּרִיךְ רַחֲמָנָא דְּיַהֲבָךְ נִיהֲלַן וְלָא יַהֲבָךְ לְעַפְרָא״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: פְּטַרְתּוּן יָתִי מִלְּאוֹדוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda fell sick and recovered, Rav Ḥana of Baghdad and the Sages entered to him. They said to him: Blessed is God Who gave you to us and did not give you to the dust. He said to them: You have exempted me from thanks,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah fell ill and became weak. Rav Ḥanina Bagadata and the Rabbis came to visit him. They said to him: "Blessed is the Merciful One who has given you to us to be healed, and not given you over to the grave." He said to them: "You have released him from his obligations."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי בָּעֵי אוֹדוֹיֵי בְּאַפֵּי עַשְׂרָה! — דַּהֲווֹ בֵּי עַשְׂרָה. וְהָא אִיהוּ לָא קָא מוֹדֵה! — לָא צְרִיךְ, דְּעָנֵי בָּתְרַיְיהוּ ״אָמֵן״.
human_translation: But didn’t Abaye say one must offer thanks before ten? There were ten But did not offer thanks He did not need as he answered amen after their
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Abaye said, 'He requires witnesses in the presence of ten!' - Because they were ten. And he does not admit it! - It is not necessary, as they both responded 'Amen' after him." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁלֹשָׁה צְרִיכִין שִׁימּוּר, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן — חוֹלֶה, חָתָן, וְכַלָּה. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: חוֹלֶה, חַיָּה, חָתָן, וְכַלָּה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף אָבֵל. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Three require protection A sick person, a bridegroom, and a bride. It was taught in a baraita : A sick person, a woman in childbirth, a bridegroom, and a bride And some say: Even a mourner. And some say: Even Torah scholars at night.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Three require guarding, and they are: a sick person, a groom, and a bride. In the Mishnah it was taught: a sick person, a live animal, a groom, and a bride. And some say: also a mourner. And some say: also Torah scholars at night.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים הַמַּאֲרִיךְ בָּהֶן מַאֲרִיכִין יָמָיו וּשְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם. הַמַּאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ, וְהַמַּאֲרִיךְ עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ, וְהַמַּאֲרִיךְ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said: There are three matters which, one who prolongs their they extend a person’s days and years. One who prolongs his prayer, one who prolongs his table, and one who prolongs the bathroom.
llm_translation: And said Rav Yehudah: Three things that one prolongs in them, prolongs his days and years. One who prolongs in his prayer, and one who prolongs at his table, and one who prolongs in the bathroom.

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ מְעַלְּיוּתָא הִיא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: And one who prolongs his prayer; is that a virtue? Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: "And one who prolongs in his prayer, is it arrogance? But didn't Rabbi Chiya bar Abba say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan:"

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַמַּאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ וּמְעַיֵּין בָּהּ — סוֹף בָּא לִידֵי כְּאֵב לֵב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹחֶלֶת מְמֻשָּׁכָה מַחֲלָה לֵב״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַזְכִּירִים עֲוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: קִיר נָטוּי, וְעִיּוּן תְּפִלָּה, וּמוֹסֵר דִּין עַל חֲבֵירוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם!
human_translation: Anyone who prolongs his prayer and expects it will ultimately come to heartache, as it is stated: “Hope deferred makes the heart sick” Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Three matters evoke a person’s sins, and they are: inclined wall expecting prayer and passing a case against another to Heaven,
llm_translation: One who prolongs in his prayer and scrutinizes it — ultimately leads to a pained heart, as it is stated: "A deferred hope makes the heart sick." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Three things remind a person of his sins, and they are: a leaning wall, a delayed prayer, and delivering judgment against his fellow to Heaven!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּמְעַיֵּין בַּהּ, הָא דְּלָא מְעַיֵּין בַּהּ. וְהֵיכִי עָבֵיד? — דְּמַפֵּישׁ בְּרַחֲמֵי.
human_translation: not difficult. This, expects while this, not expect How does he increasing supplication.
llm_translation: Here is the difficulty: this one who examines it, and this one who does not examine it. And how does he do it? - by being lenient with mercy.

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּאֲרִיךְ עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ: דִּלְמָא אָתֵי עַנְיָא וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ. דִּכְתִיב: ״הַמִּזְבֵּחַ עֵץ שָׁלוֹשׁ אַמּוֹת גָּבֹהַּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְדַבֵּר אֵלַי זֶה הַשֻּׁלְחָן אֲשֶׁר לִפְנֵי ה׳״, פָּתַח בְּמִזְבֵּחַ וְסִיֵּים בְּשֻׁלְחָן! רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מִזְבֵּחַ מְכַפֵּר עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְעַכְשָׁיו, שֻׁלְחָנוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְכַפֵּר עָלָיו.
human_translation: prolonging one’s table, Perhaps a poor person will come give him as it is written: “The altar, three cubits high and it is written “And he said unto me: This is the table that is before the Lord.” begins with the altar and concludes with the table. Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both say: As long as the Temple stood, the altar atoned for Israel’s Now a person’s table atones for his
llm_translation: The one who prolongs his table: perhaps a poor person will come and he will give to him. As it is written: "The altar was three cubits high," and it is written: "And He spoke to me, 'This is the table that is before the Lord.'" He began with the altar and ended with the table! Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: As long as the Temple stood, the altar atoned for Israel, but now, a person's table atones for him.

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּאֲרִיךְ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא: מְעַלְּיוּתָא הוּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים מְבִיאִין אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי תַּחְתּוֹנִיּוֹת: הָאוֹכֵל עֲלֵי קָנִים, וַעֲלֵי גְפָנִים, וְלוּלַבֵּי גְפָנִים, וּמוֹרִיגֵּי בְהֵמָה, וְשִׁדְרוֹ שֶׁל דָּג, וְדָג מָלִיחַ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְבוּשָּׁל כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה שִׁמְרֵי יַיִן, וְהַמְקַנֵּחַ בְּסִיד וּבְחַרְסִית. וְהַמְקַנֵּחַ בִּצְרוֹר שֶׁקִּנַּח בּוֹ חֲבֵרוֹ, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַתּוֹלֶה עַצְמוֹ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי.
human_translation: one who prolongs in the bathroom, Is that a virtue? Wasn’t it taught Ten things bring a person to hemorrhoids: One who eats the leaves of bulrushes, grape leaves, tendrils of grapevines, the palate and tongue of an animal, the spine of a fish, a salty fish that is not fully cooked, and one who drinks wine dregs, and one who wipes himself with lime and clay, and one who wipes himself with a stone with which another wiped himself. And some say: One who suspends himself too much in the bathroom as well.
llm_translation: The one who spends a long time in the bathroom: is he of Ma'aleh Yisrael? And it was taught: Ten things bring a person to lower levels: one who eats on reeds, and on grapevines, and on grapevine shoots, and on the bitter parts of an animal, and the stomach lining of a fish, and a salty fish that is not fully cooked, for all his needs, and one who drinks the dregs of wine, and one who wipes with lime or with pottery. And one who wipes with a bundle that his friend wiped with, and some say: even one who delays himself in the bathroom more than necessary.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּמַאֲרִיךְ וְתָלֵי, הָא דְּמַאֲרִיךְ וְלָא תָּלֵי.
human_translation: not difficult. This one prolongs and suspends this one prolongs and does not suspend
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who prolongs and hangs, this one who prolongs and does not hang.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דַּאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא מַטְרוֹנִיתָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִלְעַאי: פָּנֶיךָ דּוֹמִים לִמְגַדְּלֵי חֲזִירִים וּלְמַלְוֵי בְּרִבִּית. אֲמַר לַהּ: הֵימָנוּתָא, לְדִידִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ אֲסִירָן, אֶלָּא — עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא אִיכָּא מֵאוּשְׁפִּיזַאי לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, דְּכִי אָזֵילְנָא, בָּדֵיקְנָא נַפְשַׁאי בְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Like that when a matron [ matronita ] said to Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi El’ai: Your face is like pig farmers and usurers He said to her: Honestly, those two are prohibited to me; rather, there are twenty-four bathrooms between my lodging and the study hall, and when I walk I examine myself in all of them.
llm_translation: The one who said to him, that matron to Rabbi Yehuda the son of Rabbi Ilai: "Your face is like the towers of the fortress and like the lending houses." He said to her: "The faithfulness, according to my opinion, they are forbidden, rather — twenty-four lavatories are there from the outhouses to the study hall, for when I go, I examine myself completely."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מְקַצְּרִים יָמָיו וּשְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם: מִי שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לוֹ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה לִקְרוֹת וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא, כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה לְבָרֵךְ וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, וְהַמַּנְהִיג עַצְמוֹ בְּרַבָּנוּת.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said: Three things curtail a person’s days and years: One who is given the Torah scroll to read and he does not read, a cup of blessing over which to recite a blessing and he does not recite a blessing, and one who conducts himself with superiority.
llm_translation: And said Rav Yehudah: Three things shorten a person's days and years: One who is given a Torah scroll to read and does not read, a cup of blessing to bless and does not bless, and one who takes the lead in authority.

hebrew_text: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה לִקְרוֹת וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הוּא חַיֶּיךָ וְאֹרֶךְ יָמֶיךָ״. כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה לְבָרֵךְ וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲבָרְכָה מְבָרְכֶיךָ״. וְהַמַּנְהִיג עַצְמוֹ בְּרַבָּנוּת — דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה מֵת יוֹסֵף קוֹדֶם לְאֶחָיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִנְהִיג עַצְמוֹ בְּרַבָּנוּת.
human_translation: Torah scroll to read and he does not read, as it is written “It is your life and the length of your days” A cup of blessing over which to recite a blessing and he does not recite a blessing, as it is written: “I will bless them that bless you” And one who conducts himself with superiority, as Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Why did Joseph die before his brothers, Because he conducted himself with superiority,
llm_translation: Book of Torah to read and not reading, as it is written: "For it is your life and the length of your days." Cup of blessing to bless and not blessing - as it is written: "And I will bless those who bless you." And one who leads himself with arrogance - as Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: Why did Joseph die before his brothers? Because he led himself with arrogance.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, שְׁלֹשָׁה צְרִיכִים רַחֲמִים: מֶלֶךְ טוֹב, שָׁנָה טוֹבָה וַחֲלוֹם טוֹב. מֶלֶךְ טוֹב — דִּכְתִיב: ״פַּלְגֵי מַיִם לֶב מֶלֶךְ בְּיַד ה׳״. שָׁנָה טוֹבָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״תָּמִיד עֵינֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בָּהּ מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה וְעַד אַחֲרִית שָׁנָה״. חֲלוֹם טוֹב — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְתַחֲלִימֵנִי וְתַחֲיֵינִי״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: Three require mercy A good king, a good year, and a good dream. A good king, as it is written: “The king’s heart is in the hand of the Lord as the watercourses: good year, as it is written: “The eyes of the Lord, thy God, are always upon it, from the beginning of the year even unto the end of the year” good dream, as it is written: You will recover me [ vataḥlimeni ], and make me to live”
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "Three things require mercy: a good king, a good year, and a good dream. A good king - as it is written: 'The king's heart is in the hand of the Lord like streams of water.' A good year - as it is written: 'The eyes of the Lord your God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year to the end of the year.' A good dream - as it is written: 'You will dream and live.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַכְרִיז עֲלֵיהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: רָעָב, וְשׂוֹבַע, וּפַרְנָס טוֹב. רָעָב — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי קָרָא ה׳ לָרָעָב וְגוֹ׳״. שׂוֹבַע — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקָרָאתִי אֶל הַדָּגָן וְהִרְבֵּיתִי אֹתוֹ״. פַּרְנָס טוֹב — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה לֵּאמֹר. רְאֵה קָרָאתִי בְשֵׁם בְּצַלְאֵל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Three matters are proclaimed by the Holy One, Blessed be He, Himself: Famine, plenty, and a good leader. Famine, as it is written: “For the Lord has called for a famine; Plenty, as it is written: “And I will call for the grain, and will increase it, and lay no famine upon you” a good leader, as it is written: “And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying: See, I have called by name Bezalel,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Three things the Holy One, blessed be He, proclaims Himself, and they are: hunger, satiety, and good livelihood. Hunger - as it is written: "For the Lord has called for a famine, etc." Satiety - as it is written: "And I will call for the grain and multiply it." Good livelihood - as it is written: "And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, 'See, I have called by name Bezalel, etc.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵין מַעֲמִידִין פַּרְנָס עַל הַצִּבּוּר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִמְלָכִים בַּצִּבּוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רְאוּ קָרָא ה׳ בְּשֵׁם בְּצַלְאֵל״, אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: מֹשֶׁה, הָגוּן עָלֶיךָ בְּצַלְאֵל? אָמַר לוֹ: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אִם לְפָנֶיךָ הָגוּן — לְפָנַי לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן! אָמַר לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן, לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם. הָלַךְ וְאָמַר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: הָגוּן עֲלֵיכֶם בְּצַלְאֵל? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּלְפָנֶיךָ הוּא הָגוּן, לְפָנֵינוּ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: One may only appoint a leader over a community if he consults with the community as it is stated: See, the Lord has called by name Bezalel, The Lord said to Moses: Moses, is Bezalel suitable your said to Him: Master of the universe, if he is suitable Your then all the more so my said to him: Nevertheless, go and tell went and said to Israel: Is Bezalel suitable your They said to him: If he is suitable the Holy One, Blessed be He, and your all the more so our
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: One does not appoint a leader over the community unless they are accepted by the community, as it is stated: "See, the Lord has called by name Bezalel." The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, is Bezalel suitable in your eyes? He replied: Master of the Universe, if he is suitable before You, surely he is suitable before me! He said to him: Even so, go and say to them. He went and said to the children of Israel: Is Bezalel suitable in your eyes? They said to him: If he is suitable before the Holy One, blessed be He, and before you, surely he is suitable before us!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: בְּצַלְאֵל עַל שֵׁם חׇכְמָתוֹ נִקְרָא. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לוֹ לִבְצַלְאֵל ״עֲשֵׂה לִי מִשְׁכָּן אָרוֹן וְכֵלִים״. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְהָפַךְ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״עֲשֵׂה אָרוֹן וְכֵלִים וּמִשְׁכָּן״. אָמַר לוֹ: מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אָדָם בּוֹנֶה בַּיִת וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַכְנִיס לְתוֹכוֹ כֵּלִים, וְאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״עֲשֵׂה לִי אָרוֹן וְכֵלִים וּמִשְׁכָּן״, כֵּלִים שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשֶׂה, לְהֵיכָן אַכְנִיסֵם? שֶׁמָּא כָּךְ אָמַר לְךָ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, ״עֲשֵׂה מִשְׁכָּן אָרוֹן וְכֵלִים״?! אָמַר לוֹ: שֶׁמָּא בְּצֵל אֵל הָיִיתָ וְיָדַעְתָּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: Bezalel was called on account of his wisdom. When the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Go say to Bezalel, “Make a tabernacle, an ark, and vessels” Moses went and reversed and told “Make an ark, and vessels, and a tabernacle” He said to Moses, our teacher, the practice world a person builds a house and afterward places the vessels and you say Make an ark, and vessels, and a tabernacle. the vessels that I make, where shall I put them? Perhaps God told you the following: “Make a tabernacle, ark, and vessels” said to Perhaps you were in God’s shadow [ betzel El ], and you knew
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Bezalel was called by the name of his wisdom. At the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses, "Go, say to Bezalel, 'Make for Me a sanctuary, an ark, and vessels,'" Moses went and relayed to him, "Make an ark, vessels, and a sanctuary." Bezalel said to him, "Our teacher Moses, the way of the world is that a person first builds a house and then brings vessels into it, and you are saying, 'Make for Me an ark, vessels, and a sanctuary.' The vessels I will make, but where shall I place them? Perhaps this is what the Holy One, blessed be He, said to you, 'Make a sanctuary, an ark, and vessels'?" Moses said to him, "Were you in the shadow of God and knew?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: יוֹדֵעַ הָיָה בְּצַלְאֵל לְצָרֵף אוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ בָּהֶן שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיְמַלֵּא אֹתוֹ רוּחַ אֱלֹהִים בְּחׇכְמָה וּבִתְבוּנָה וּבְדַעַת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״ה׳ בְּחׇכְמָה יָסַד אָרֶץ כּוֹנֵן שָׁמַיִם בִּתְבוּנָה״. וּכְתִיב: ״בְּדַעְתּוֹ תְּהוֹמוֹת נִבְקָעוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Bezalel knew to join letters with which heaven and earth were created. It is written here “And I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and it is written there “The Lord, by wisdom, founded the earth; by understanding He established the heavens” and it is written: “By His knowledge the depths were broken up
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Bezalel knew how to combine the letters with which the heavens and the earth were created. It is written here: "And He filled him with the spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, and with knowledge." And it is written there: "The Lord founded the earth with wisdom, He established the heavens with understanding." And it is written: "By His knowledge the depths were broken up."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נוֹתֵן חָכְמָה אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חָכְמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָהֵב חׇכְמְתָא לְחַכִּימִין וּמַנְדְּעָא לְיָדְעֵי בִינָה״. שְׁמַע רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר מַעְרְבָא וְאַמְרַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַתּוּן מֵהָתָם מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן מֵהָכָא מַתְנִינַן לַהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְלֵב כׇּל חֲכַם לֵב נָתַתִּי חׇכְמָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, only grants wisdom to one who possesses wisdom, as it is stated: “He gives wisdom unto the wise, and knowledge to they who know understanding” Rav Taḥalifa, from the West, heard and repeated it before Rabbi Abbahu. said to him: You learned from there; we learn it from here: As it is written “And in the hearts of all who are wise-hearted I have placed wisdom”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The Holy One, blessed be He, only gives wisdom to one who already possesses wisdom, as it is stated: "He gives wisdom to the wise and knowledge to those who have understanding." Rav Tachlifa bar Ma'arava heard this and said it before Rabbi Avahu. He said to him: You speak from there (meaning, quoting a Mishnah), and we speak from here, as it is written: "And in the heart of every wise man I have placed wisdom."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל חֲלוֹם, וְלָא טְווֹת. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: חֶלְמָא דְּלָא מְפַשַּׁר כְּאִגַּרְתָּא דְּלָא מִקַּרְיָא. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָא חֶלְמָא טָבָא מִקַּיַּים כּוּלֵּיהּ וְלָא חֶלְמָא בִּישָׁא מִקַּיַּים כּוּלֵּיהּ. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: חֶלְמָא בִּישָׁא עֲדִיף מֵחֶלְמָא טָבָא. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: חֶלְמָא בִּישָׁא — עֲצִיבוּתֵיהּ מִסְתְּיֵיהּ, חֶלְמָא טָבָא — חֶדְוֵיהּ מִסְתְּיֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: חֶלְמָא טָבָא, אֲפִילּוּ לְדִידִי, בְּדִיחוּתֵיהּ מְפַכְּחָא לֵיהּ. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: חֶלְמָא בִּישָׁא קָשֶׁה מִנְּגָדָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָאֱלֹהִים עָשָׂה שֶׁיִּרְאוּ מִלְּפָנָיו״, וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה חֲלוֹם רַע.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: any dream, and not a fast. And Rav Ḥisda said: A dream not interpreted is like a letter not read. And Rav Ḥisda said: A good dream is not entirely fulfilled and a bad dream is not entirely fulfilled. And Rav Ḥisda said: A bad dream is preferable to a good dream, And Rav Ḥisda said: A bad dream, his sadness is enough for him; a good dream, his joy is enough for him. Rav Yosef said: Even for me, the joy of a good dream negates it. And Rav Ḥisda said: A bad dream is worse than lashes, as it is stated: “God has so made it, that men should fear before Him” and Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That is a bad dream
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Every dream, and not its interpretation. And Rav Ḥisdah said: A dream that is not interpreted is like a letter that is not read. And Rav Ḥisdah said: A good dream does not fulfill all of it, and a bad dream does not fulfill all of it. And Rav Ḥisdah said: A bad dream is preferable to a good dream. And Rav Ḥisdah said: A bad dream—its sadness is removed, a good dream—its joy is removed. Rav Yosef said: A good dream, even for me, its interpretation is pleasing to him. And Rav Ḥisdah said: A bad dream is more difficult than its interpretation, as it is stated: "And God has caused it to be feared before him." And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is an evil dream.

hebrew_text: ״הַנָּבִיא אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ חֲלוֹם יְסַפֵּר חֲלוֹם וַאֲשֶׁר דְּבָרִי אִתּוֹ יְדַבֵּר דְּבָרִי אֱמֶת מַה לַתֶּבֶן אֶת הַבָּר נְאֻם ה׳״. וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן בַּר וְתֶבֶן אֵצֶל חֲלוֹם? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְבַר בְּלֹא תֶּבֶן, כָּךְ אִי אֶפְשָׁר לַחֲלוֹם בְּלֹא דְּבָרִים בְּטֵלִים.
human_translation: “The prophet that has a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that has My word, let him speak My word faithfully. What has the straw to do with the grain? says the Lord” What do straw and grain have to do with a dream? Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai: Just as it is impossible for the grain without straw, so too it is impossible to dream without idle matters.
llm_translation: "The prophet who has a dream, let him tell the dream; and he who has My word, let him speak My word faithfully. What has straw in common with wheat? says the Lord." And what is the connection between straw and wheat in relation to a dream? Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Just as it is impossible to have grain without straw, so too it is impossible to have a dream without idle words."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: חֲלוֹם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּקְצָתוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים — כּוּלּוֹ אֵינוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים. מְנָא לַן? — מִיּוֹסֵף, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִנֵּה הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְהַיָּרֵחַ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Berekhya said: Even though part of a dream is fulfilled, all of it is not fulfilled. From where do we From Joseph’s as it is written: and, behold, the sun and the moon
llm_translation: Rabbi Berachiah said: A dream, even though some of it is fulfilled - all of it is not fulfilled. How do we know? - From Joseph, as it is written: "And behold, the sun and the moon, and so on."

hebrew_text: וְהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא אִמֵּיהּ לָא הֲוָת.
human_translation: and at that time his mother was no longer
llm_translation: And that hour, his mother was not there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: לְעוֹלָם יְצַפֶּה אָדָם לַחֲלוֹם טוֹב עַד עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה. מְנָלַן? — מִיּוֹסֵף, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵלֶּה תֹּלְדוֹת יַעֲקֹב יוֹסֵף בֶּן שְׁבַע עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיוֹסֵף בֶּן שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה בְּעׇמְדוֹ לִפְנֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״. מִן שַׁבְסְרֵי עַד תְּלָתִין כַּמָּה הָוֵי? — תְּלָת סְרֵי, וְשַׁב דְּשִׂבְעָא וְתַרְתֵּי דְּכַפְנָא — הָא עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: One should always anticipate good dream up to twenty-two years From where do we From Joseph, as it is written “These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, and it is written: “And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh From seventeen to thirty how many are they? Thirteen; and seven years of plenty and two of famine; twenty-two
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: A person should always wait for a good dream until twenty-two years. From where do we derive this? — From Joseph, as it is written: "These are the generations of Jacob, Joseph being seventeen years old, etc." And it is also written: "Now Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh, etc." From seventeen to thirty, how many years is that? — Thirteen years. Subtract three of satisfaction and two of the cupbearer — this makes twenty-two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְאָדָם טוֹב אֵין מַרְאִין לוֹ חֲלוֹם טוֹב, וּלְאָדָם רַע אֵין מַרְאִין לוֹ חֲלוֹם רַע.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: A good person is not shown a good dream and a wicked person is not shown a bad dream;
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "For a good person, they do not show him a good dream, and for a bad person, they do not show him a bad dream."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כׇּל שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל דָּוִד לֹא רָאָה חֲלוֹם טוֹב, וְכׇל שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אֲחִיתוֹפֶל לֹא רָאָה חֲלוֹם רַע.
human_translation: That was also taught All of David’s life he never saw a good dream, and all of Ahitophel’s life he never saw a bad dream.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder said: All the years of David he did not see a good dream, and all the years of Ahithophel he did not see a bad dream.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תְאֻנֶּה אֵלֶיךָ רָעָה״. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: שֶׁלֹּא יַבְהִילוּךָ לֹא חֲלוֹמוֹת רָעִים וְלֹא הִרְהוּרִים רָעִים. ״וְנֶגַע לֹא יִקְרַב בְּאׇהֳלֶךָ״ — שֶׁלֹּא תִּמְצָא אִשְׁתְּךָ סְפֵק נִדָּה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאַתָּה בָּא מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ. אֶלָּא אִיהוּ לָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ, אַחֲרִינֵי חָזוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Is it not written: “No evil shall befall you, And Rav Ḥisda said Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said that you will be frightened neither by bad dreams nor by evil thoughts. Neither shall any plague come near your tent, that you will never find your wife uncertain menstruating woman when you return from a journey. Rather, he does not see others see
llm_translation: "And it is written: 'No evil shall befall you.' And Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rav Yirmeya bar Abba: They should not cause you to be alarmed, neither bad dreams nor bad thoughts. 'And no plague will come near your tent' — that your wife should not be found in a state of doubt of menstruation at the time when you come from the road. Rather, let him not see her, others will see her."

hebrew_text: וְכִי לָא חֲזָא אִיהוּ, מְעַלְּיוּתָא הוּא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי זְעֵירָא: כׇּל הַלָּן שִׁבְעָה יָמִים בְּלֹא חֲלוֹם — נִקְרָא ״רַע״. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׂבֵעַ יָלִין בַּל יִפָּקֶד רָע״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שָׂבֵעַ״ אֶלָּא ״שֶׁבַע״. — אֶלָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: דַּחֲזָא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי חֲזָא.
human_translation: And when he does not see is a virtue? Didn’t Rabbi Zeira say: Anyone who sleeps seven days without a dream is called evil, as it is stated: “And he that has it shall lie satisfied [ vesave’a ], he shall not be visited with evil” Do not read satisfied [ vesave’a ], rather seven [ vesheva ], Rather, and the says as follows: saw but he did not understand what he saw.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if he did not see it, is it a presumption? And Rabbi Zeira said: Anyone who sleeps seven days without a dream is called "evil," as it says: "And a satiated man will not be visited by evil." Do not read "satiated" but "seven." Rather, this is what he meant: He saw but did not know what he saw.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָרוֹאֶה חֲלוֹם וְנַפְשׁוֹ עֲגוּמָה, יֵלֵךְ וְיִפְתְּרֶנּוּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה. ״יִפְתְּרֶנּוּ״?! וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא חֶלְמָא דְּלָא מְפַשַּׁר כְּאִגַּרְתָּא דְּלָא מִקַּרְיָא? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: יְטִיבֶנּוּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה. לַיְתֵי תְּלָתָא וְלֵימָא לְהוּ: ״חֶלְמָא טָבָא חֲזַאי״. וְלֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ הָנָךְ: ״טָבָא הוּא וְטָבָא לֶיהֱוֵי, רַחֲמָנָא לְשַׁוְּיֵיהּ לְטָב. שְׁבַע זִימְנִין לִגְזְרוּ עֲלָךְ מִן שְׁמַיָּא דְּלֶהֱוֵי טָבָא, וְיֶהֱוֵי טָבָא״. וְלֵימְרוּ שָׁלֹשׁ הֲפוּכוֹת, וְשָׁלֹשׁ פְּדוּיוֹת, וְשָׁלֹשׁ שְׁלוֹמוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ami said Rabbi Pedat said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who sees a dream his soul is distraught, should go and it interpreted before three. Interpreted? Didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: A dream not interpreted is like a letter not read? Rather, say He should better it before three. bring three and say to them: I saw a good dream. And they say to him: It is good, and let it be good, God make it good. they decree upon you from heaven seven times that it will be good, and it will be good. they recite three transformation three redemption, and three peace.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Ammi said, Rabbi Pedat said, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who sees a dream and his soul is troubled, let him go and interpret it before three. "Interpret it"?! But didn't Rav Chisda say: A dream that is not interpreted is like a letter that is not read? Rather say: Let him improve it before three. Let three come and say to him: "You have seen a good dream." And let them say to him: "It is good and may it be good, may the Merciful One transform it to good. Seven times may a decree be issued from the heavens that it should be good, and it will be good." And let them say three reversals, and three redemptions, and three peace.

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ הֲפוּכוֹת — ״הָפַכְתָּ מִסְפְּדִי לְמָחוֹל לִי פִּתַּחְתָּ שַׂקִּי וַתְּאַזְּרֵנִי שִׂמְחָה״, ״אָז תִּשְׂמַח בְּתוּלָה בְּמָחוֹל וּבַחֻרִים וּזְקֵנִים יַחְדָּו וְהָפַכְתִּי אֶבְלָם לְשָׂשׂוֹן וְגוֹ׳״, ״וְלֹא אָבָה ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ לִשְׁמֹעַ אֶל בִּלְעָם וַיַּהֲפֹךְ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Three transformations: “You transformed my mourning into dancing; You loosed my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness” “Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, and the young men and the old together; for I will transform their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow” “Nevertheless the Lord your God would not hearken unto Balaam; but the Lord your God transformed the curse into a blessing unto you”
llm_translation: Three reversals - "You have turned my mourning into dancing for me; You have loosened my sackcloth and girded me with gladness," "Then shall the maiden rejoice in the dance, and the young men and the old men together; and I will turn their mourning into joy," "But the Lord your God would not listen to Balaam, and He turned..."

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ פְּדוּיוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״פָּדָה בְשָׁלוֹם נַפְשִׁי מִקְּרׇב לִי וְגוֹ׳״, ״וּפְדוּיֵי ה׳ יְשֻׁבוּן וְגוֹ׳״, ״וַיֹּאמֶר הָעָם אֶל שָׁאוּל הֲיוֹנָתָן יָמוּת אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה הַיְשׁוּעָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And three redemptions, as it is written: “He has redeemed my soul in peace so that none came near me; “The redeemed of the Lord shall return, “The people said to Saul: Shall Jonathan die, who has wrought this great salvation
llm_translation: Three redemptions, as it is written: "He redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me," "And the redeemed of the Lord shall return," "And the people said to Saul, 'Shall Jonathan die, who has worked this salvation?'"

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ שְׁלוֹמוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״בּוֹרֵא נִיב שְׂפָתָיִם שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם לָרָחוֹק וְלַקָּרוֹב אָמַר ה׳ וּרְפָאתִיו״, ״וְרוּחַ לָבְשָׁה אֶת עֲמָשַׂי וְגוֹ׳״, ״וַאֲמַרְתֶּם כֹּה לֶחָי וְאַתָּה שָׁלוֹם וּבֵיתְךָ שָׁלוֹם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And three peace, as it is written: “Peace, peace, to him that is far off and to him that is near, says the Lord that creates the expression of the lips; and I will heal him” “Then the spirit clothed Amasai, peace, peace be unto you, and peace be to your helpers” “Thus you shall say: All hail and peace be both unto you, and peace be to your house,
llm_translation: Three peaces, as it is written: "He creates the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace to the far and to the near, says the Lord, and I will heal him" (Isaiah 57:19), "And the spirit clothed Amasai, etc." (1 Chronicles 12:18), "And you shall say, 'Peace be to you, and peace to your house, etc.'"

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אָמְרִי: כֹּל חַד וְחַד מִינַּן לֵימָא מִלְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ. פְּתַח חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וַאֲמַר: הַאי מַאן דַּחֲזָא חֶלְמָא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי חֲזָא, לִיקוּם קַמֵּי כָּהֲנֵי בְּעִידָּנָא דְּפָרְסִי יְדַיְיהוּ וְלֵימָא הָכִי: ״רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אֲנִי שֶׁלָּךְ וַחֲלוֹמוֹתַי שֶׁלָּךְ, חֲלוֹם חָלַמְתִּי וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַה הוּא. בֵּין שֶׁחָלַמְתִּי אֲנִי לְעַצְמִי וּבֵין שֶׁחָלְמוּ לִי חֲבֵירַי וּבֵין שֶׁחָלַמְתִּי עַל אֲחֵרִים, אִם טוֹבִים הֵם — חַזְּקֵם וְאַמְּצֵם כַּחֲלוֹמוֹתָיו שֶׁל יוֹסֵף. וְאִם צְרִיכִים רְפוּאָה — רְפָאֵם כְּמֵי מָרָה עַל יְדֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, וּכְמִרְיָם מִצָּרַעְתָּהּ, וּכְחִזְקִיָּה מֵחׇלְיוֹ, וּכְמֵי יְרִיחוֹ עַל יְדֵי אֱלִישָׁע. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁהָפַכְתָּ קִלְלַת בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע לִבְרָכָה, כֵּן הֲפוֹךְ כׇּל חֲלוֹמוֹתַי עָלַי לְטוֹבָה״. וּמְסַיֵּים בַּהֲדֵי כָּהֲנֵי דְּעָנֵי צִבּוּרָא ״אָמֵן״. וְאִי לָא, לֵימָא הָכִי: ״אַדִּיר בַּמָּרוֹם, שׁוֹכֵן בִּגְבוּרָה, אַתָּה שָׁלוֹם וְשִׁמְךָ שָׁלוֹם. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁתָּשִׂים עָלֵינוּ שָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: Ameimar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashi were sitting together. They said: Let each and every one of us say something that the other has not heard. One of them began and said: One who saw a dream and does not know what he saw should stand before the priests when they lift their hands and say the following: Master of the Universe, I am Yours and my dreams are Yours, I dreamed a dream and I do not know what it is. Whether I have dreamed of myself, whether my friends have dreamed of me or whether I have dreamed of others, if are good, strengthen them and reinforce them like the dreams of Joseph. And if require healing, heal them like the waters of Mara by Moses our teacher, and like Miriam from her leprosy, and like Hezekiah from his illness, and like the waters of Jericho by Elisha. And just as You transformed the curse of Balaam the wicked into a blessing, so transform all of my dreams for me for the best. And complete together with the priests so the congregation responds amen And if not he should say: Majestic One on high, Who dwells in power, You are peace and Your name is peace. May it be Your will that You bestow upon us peace.
llm_translation: Ammemar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashe were sitting together. They said: Each and every one of us should say something that his colleagues have not heard. One of them began and said: Whoever sees a dream and does not know what he has seen, let him stand before the priests in the time of the Persian empire and say thus: "Master of the universe, I am Yours, and my dreams are Yours. I dreamed a dream, and I do not know what it is. Whether I have dreamed for myself, or my colleagues have dreamed for me, or I have dreamed for others, if they are good dreams, strengthen and confirm them like the dreams of Joseph. And if they require healing, heal them like the waters of Marah by the hand of our teacher Moses, and like the affliction of Miriam, and like the illness of Hezekiah, and like the waters of Jericho by the hand of Elisha. And just as You turned the curse of the wicked Balaam into a blessing, so too turn all my dreams for me into good." And he concluded in the presence of the priests who lead the congregation, "Amen." And if not, let him say thus: "Exalted on high, dwelling in strength, You are peace and Your name is peace. May it be Your will before You to bestow peace upon us."

hebrew_text: פְּתַח אִידַּךְ וַאֲמַר: הַאי מַאן דְּעָיֵיל לְמָתָא וְדָחֵיל מֵעֵינָא בִּישָׁא, לִנְקוֹט זִקְפָּא דִּידָא דְיַמִּינֵיהּ בִּידָא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ וְזִקְפָּא דִּידָא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ בִּידָא דְיַמִּינֵיהּ, וְלֵימָא הָכִי: אֲנָא פְּלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִי מִזַּרְעָא דְיוֹסֵף קָאָתֵינָא, דְּלָא שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ עֵינָא בִישָׁא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בֵּן פֹּרָת יוֹסֵף בֵּן פֹּרָת עֲלֵי עָיִן וְגוֹ׳״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״עֲלֵי עָיִן״, אֶלָּא ״עוֹלֵי עָיִן״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְיִדְגּוּ לָרֹב בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ״ — מָה דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם מַיִם מְכַסִּים עֲלֵיהֶם וְאֵין עַיִן רָעָה שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶם, אַף זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף אֵין עַיִן רָעָה שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶם. וְאִי דָּחֵיל מֵעֵינָא בִּישָׁא דִּילֵיהּ, לִיחְזֵי אַטְרְפָא דִּנְחִירֵיהּ דִּשְׂמָאלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Another began and said: One who enters a city and fears the evil eye hold the thumb [ zekafa ] of his right hand in his left hand and the thumb of his left hand in his right hand and recite the following: I, so-and-so son of so-and-so, come from the descendants of Joseph, the evil eye has no dominion, as it is stated: “Joseph is a fruitful vine, a fruitful vine by a fountain [ alei ayin ]; Do not read alei ayin ; but rather, olei ayin , who rise above the eye Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: from here, “And let them grow like fish into a multitude in the midst of the earth” Just as fish in the sea are covered by water and the evil eye has no dominion over them so too the offspring of Joseph, the evil eye has no dominion over them. And if he is concerned about his own evil eye, look at the side of his left nostril.
llm_translation: He opened his statement and said: This one who goes to a city and is afraid of the evil eye, should take the right thumb of his right hand in his left hand, and the left thumb of his left hand in his right hand, and say thus: "I am so-and-so, son of so-and-so, from the seed of Joseph, and the evil eye has no power over me, as it is stated: 'Ben Porat Yosef, Ben Porat Alei Ayin.' Do not read it as 'Alei Ayin' but rather 'Olei Ayin.' Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said from here: "And they shall increase abundantly in the midst of the land" - just as fish in the sea are covered by water and the evil eye has no power over them, so too the seed of Joseph, the evil eye has no power over them. And if he is afraid of the evil eye of his own, he should look at the nail of his left thumb.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח אִידַּךְ וַאֲמַר: הַאי מַאן דַּחֲלִישׁ, יוֹמָא קַמָּא לָא לְגַלֵּי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִתָּרַע מַזָּלֵיהּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לְגַלֵּי. כִּי הָא דְּרָבָא, כִּי הֲוָה חֲלִישׁ, יוֹמָא קַמָּא לָא מְגַלֵּי מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אָמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: פּוֹק אַכְרֵיז: ״רָבָא חֲלַשׁ״. מַאן דְּרָחֵים לִי — לִבְעֵי עֲלַי רַחֲמֵי, וּמַאן דְּסָנֵי לִי — לִחְדֵּי לִי. וּכְתִיב: ״בִּנְפֹל אוֹיִבְךָ אַל תִּשְׂמָח וּבִכָּשְׁלוֹ אַל יָגֵל לִבֶּךָ פֶּן יִרְאֶה ה׳ וְרַע בְּעֵינָיו וְהֵשִׁיב מֵעָלָיו אַפּוֹ״.
human_translation: Another began and said: One who is sick should not reveal on the first day so that his luck should not suffer; from there on reveal Like that which Rava when he falls ill; on the first day he does not reveal it, from there on he says to his servant: Go out and announce: Rava is sick. Those who love me will pray mercy on me and those who hate me will rejoice my And it is written: “Rejoice not when your enemy falls, and let not your heart be glad when he stumbles; lest the Lord see it, and it displease Him, and He turn away His wrath from him”
llm_translation: The opening of the other side, and he said: This one who is weak, on the first day does not reveal, so that his luck will not turn bad, from here and onwards he reveals. Like Rava, when he was weak, on the first day did not reveal, from here and onwards he said to his servant: Go out and announce, "Rava is weak." Whoever has mercy on me - may they have mercy on him, and whoever hates me - may they be alone. And it is written: "Do not rejoice when your enemy falls, and do not let your heart be glad when he stumbles, lest the Lord see it and it displeases Him, and He turns His wrath away from him."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי חֶלְמָא בִּישָׁא אָמַר: ״וַחֲלֹמוֹת הַשָּׁוְא יְדַבֵּרוּ״. כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי חֶלְמָא טָבָא אָמַר: וְכִי הַחֲלוֹמוֹת הַשָּׁוְא יְדַבֵּרוּ? וְהָכְתִיב ״בַּחֲלוֹם אֲדַבֶּר בּוֹ״!
human_translation: Shmuel, when he would see a bad dream, say: “And the dreams speak falsely” When he would see a good dream, say: And do dreams speak falsely? Isn’t it written: “I speak with him in a dream”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shmuel ki hava chazei chelma b'isha amar: 'vachalomot hashav'a yedabru.' Ki hava chazei chelma tava amar: 'veki hachalomot hashav'a yedabru? Vehaktiv 'bachalom adaber bo'!" English translation: "Shmuel, when he used to see a dream in the night, would say: 'And dreams of the night speak.' When he saw a good dream, he would say: 'Do dreams of the night speak? But it is written, 'In a dream I will speak with him!'"

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״בַּחֲלוֹם אֲדַבֶּר בּוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַחֲלֹמוֹת הַשָּׁוְא יְדַבֵּרוּ״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן עַל יְדֵי מַלְאָךְ, כָּאן עַל יְדֵי שֵׁד.
human_translation: Rava raised a contradiction it is written: “I speak with him in a dream”; and it is written: “And the dreams speak falsely.” not difficult Here, by means of an angel; here, by means of a demon.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "In a dream I will speak with him," and it is written, "And in dreams, when deep sleep falls upon men, he will speak." This is not difficult: here it is by means of an angel, here it is by means of a demon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי בִּיזְנָא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמַר רַבִּי פַּנְדָּא אָמַר רַב נַחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי בִּירִים מִשּׁוּם זָקֵן אֶחָד, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי בְּנָאָה: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה פּוֹתְרֵי חֲלוֹמוֹת הָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, פַּעַם אַחַת חָלַמְתִּי חֲלוֹם וְהָלַכְתִּי אֵצֶל כּוּלָּם, וּמַה שֶּׁפָּתַר לִי זֶה לֹא פָּתַר לִי זֶה, וְכוּלָּם נִתְקַיְּימוּ בִּי. לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל הַחֲלוֹמוֹת הוֹלְכִים אַחַר הַפֶּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Bizna bar Zavda said Rabbi Akiva said Rabbi Panda said Rav Naḥum said Rabbi Birayim said in the name of one elder, and who is he, Rabbi Bena’a: There were twenty-four interpreters of dreams in Jerusalem. One time, I dreamed a dream and went to each of them What one interpreted for me the other did not interpret for me, and, all of were realized in me, to fulfill that which is stated: All dreams follow the mouth
llm_translation: Rabbi Bizna bar Zavda said, Rabbi Akiva said, Rabbi Pundah said, Rav Nahum said, Rabbi Yirmey from the name of one elder, and they counted - Rabbi Bena'ah: Twenty-four interpreters of dreams were in Jerusalem. Once I dreamt a dream and went to all of them, and what this one interpreted for me, that one did not interpret for me, yet all of them were fulfilled in me. To fulfill what is said: "All dreams follow the mouth."

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ ״כׇּל הַחֲלוֹמוֹת הוֹלְכִים אַחַר הַפֶּה״ קְרָא הוּא? אִין — וְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכָּל הַחֲלוֹמוֹת הוֹלְכִין אַחַר הַפֶּה? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי כַּאֲשֶׁר פָּתַר לָנוּ כֵּן הָיָה״. אָמַר רָבָא: וְהוּא דִּמְפַשַּׁר לֵיהּ מֵעֵין חֶלְמֵיהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״אִישׁ כַּחֲלֹמוֹ פָּתָר״.
human_translation: Is that to say that all dreams follow the mouth is a verse Yes, and in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: From where that all dreams follow the mouth As it is stated “And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was” Rava said, This is only it is interpreted for him akin to the dream, as it is stated “Each man according to his dream he did interpret”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Atu 'kol hachalomot holekhim acharei hapeh' kra hu? Ein - vekid'Rabbi Elazar. D'amar Rabbi Elazar: Minayin shekol hachalomot holekhin acharei hapeh? - Shenemar: 'Vayehi ka'asher patar lanu kein hayah.' Amar Rava: Vehu dimfashar lei me'ein chelmeih, shenemar 'ish kachalomoh patar.'" English translation: "Are all dreams following the mouth?" Is this a verse? No - as Rabbi Elazar said. For Rabbi Elazar said: From where do we know that all dreams follow the mouth? - Because it is stated: 'And it came to pass as he interpreted to us, so it was.' Rava said: And this is explained to him from the nature of his dream, as it is said: 'A man as his dream, he interprets.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּרְא שַׂר הָאֹפִים״, מְנָא יְדַע? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הֶרְאוּהוּ חֲלוֹמוֹ וּפִתְרוֹן חֲלוֹמוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: “The baker saw from where did know Rabbi Elazar said: teaches that each was shown his dream and the interpretation of the other’s dream.
llm_translation: "And the chief baker saw," from where did he know? Rabbi Elazar said: It teaches that each and every one showed him his dream and the interpretation of his fellow's dream.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִשְׁכִּים וְנָפַל לוֹ פָּסוּק לְתוֹךְ פִּיו, הֲרֵי זוֹ נְבוּאָה קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who awakened and a verse happens into his mouth, it is a minor prophecy
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "If one wakes up and a verse falls into his mouth, this is a minor prophecy."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲלוֹמוֹת מִתְקַיְּימִין: חֲלוֹם שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית, וַחֲלוֹם שֶׁחָלַם לוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ, וַחֲלוֹם שֶׁנִּפְתַּר בְּתוֹךְ חֲלוֹם. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמֵר: אַף חֲלוֹם שֶׁנִּשְׁנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַל הִשָּׁנוֹת הַחֲלוֹם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan also said: Three dreams are fulfilled: A dream of the morning, a dream that one’s fellow dreamed about him, and a dream that is interpreted within a dream. And some say that a dream that is repeated as it is stated: “And for that the dream was doubled
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said, three dreams are fulfilled: a dream of the morning, a dream that his friend dreamt for him, and a dream that is interpreted within a dream. And some say: even a dream that is repeated, as it is said: "And concerning the repeating of the dream, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: אֵין מַרְאִין לוֹ לְאָדָם אֶלָּא מֵהִרְהוּרֵי לִבּוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַנְתְּ מַלְכָּא רַעְיוֹנָךְ עַל מִשְׁכְּבָךְ סְלִקוּ״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״וְרַעְיוֹנֵי לִבְבָךְ תִּנְדַּע״. אָמַר רָבָא: תִּדַּע, דְּלָא מַחֲווּ לֵיהּ לְאִינִשׁ לָא דִּקְלָא דְּדַהֲבָא וְלָא פִּילָא דְּעָיֵיל בְּקוֹפָא דְמַחְטָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: A person is shown only the thoughts of his heart as it is stated: “As for you, O king, your thoughts came upon your bed, And if you wish, say from here, “And that you may know the thoughts of your Rava said: Know for one is neither shown a golden palm tree nor an elephant the eye of a needle
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: One does not show a person anything except for the thoughts of his heart, as it is stated: "You, O king, had thoughts while on your bed, and the thoughts of your heart you know." If you wish, say it is derived from here: "And the thoughts of your heart you shall understand." Rava said: Know that one cannot compare a person to a palm tree of gold or an elephant going through the eye of a needle.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא: אָמְרִיתוּ דְּחָכְמִיתוּ טוּבָא, אֵימָא לִי מַאי חָזֵינָא בְּחֶלְמַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חָזֵית דִּמְשַׁחֲרִי לָךְ פָּרְסָאֵי וְגָרְבִי בָּךְ, וְרָעֲיִי בָּךְ שִׁקְצֵי בְּחוּטְרָא דְּדַהֲבָא. הַרְהַר כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא, וּלְאוּרְתָּא חֲזָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא, לִשְׁמוּאֵל: אָמְרִיתוּ דְּחָכְמִיתוּ טוּבָא, אֵימָא לִי מַאי חָזֵינָא בְּחֶלְמַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חָזֵית דְּאָתוּ רוֹמָאֵי וְשָׁבוּ לָךְ, וְטָחֲנִי בָּךְ קַשְׁיָיתָא בְּרִחְיָיא דְּדַהֲבָא. הַרְהַר כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא, וּלְאוּרְתָּא חֲזָא.
human_translation: emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Rabbi Ḥananya: You say that you are extremely wise. tell me what I will see in my dream. said to him: You will see the Persians capture you, and enslave you, and force you to herd unclean animals with a golden staff. He thought the entire day and that night he saw King Shapur said to Shmuel: You say that you are extremely wise. tell me what I will see in my dream. Shmuel said to him: You will see the Romans come and take you into captivity to grind date pits in mills of gold. He thought the entire day and that night he saw
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar to Rabbi Yehoshua son of Rabbi Chananya: You said that your wisdom is great, tell me what you see in your dreams. He said to him: I saw that the Persians are anointed for you and swallow you, and my friend is in you, abominations in a golden tube. He thought about it all day, but did not see the interpretation. He said to him, the king's son, to Shmuel: You said that your wisdom is great, tell me what you see in your dreams. He said to him: I saw that the Romans are coming and returning to you, and grind you with a hard millstone in a golden basin. He thought about it all day, but did not see the interpretation.

hebrew_text: בַּר הֶדְיָא מְפַשַּׁר חֶלְמֵי הֲוָה. מַאן דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ אַגְרָא — מְפַשַּׁר לֵיהּ לִמְעַלְּיוּתָא, וּמַאן דְּלָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ אַגְרָא — מְפַשַּׁר לֵיהּ לִגְרִיעוּתָא. אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא חֲזוֹ חֶלְמָא. אַבָּיֵי יְהֵיב לֵיהּ זוּזָא, וְרָבָא לָא יְהֵיב לֵיהּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַקְרִינַן בְּחֶלְמִין ״שׁוֹרְךָ טָבוּחַ לְעֵינֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּסֵיד עִסְקָךְ וְלָא אַהֲנִי לָךְ לְמֵיכַל מֵעוּצְבָּא דְּלִבָּךְ. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַרְוַוח עִסְקָךְ וְלָא אַהֲנִי לָךְ לְמֵיכַל מֵחֶדְוָא דְּלִבָּךְ.
human_translation: Bar Haddaya was an interpreter of dreams. one who gave him a fee, he would interpret favorably, and one who did not give him a fee, he would interpret unfavorably. Abaye and Rava saw an dream Abaye gave him money while Rava did not give him They said to him: “Your ox shall be slain before your eyes was read to us in our dream. He to Rava he said: Your business will be lost and you will derive no pleasure from eating because of the sadness of your heart. To Abaye he said: Your business will profit and you will be unable to eat due to the joy in your heart.
llm_translation: Bar Hedya interpreted dreams. Whoever gives him a fee - he interprets it positively, and whoever does not give him a fee - he interprets it negatively. Abaye and Rava saw a dream. Abaye gave him a coin, but Rava did not give him. They said to him: We read in dreams, "Your ox is being slaughtered before your eyes, etc." To Rava he said: Your business is ruined, and I am not concerned for you to eat from the bitterness of your heart. To Abaye he said: Your business is thriving, and I am not concerned for you to eat from the sweetness of your heart.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַקְרִינַן ״בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת תּוֹלִיד וְגוֹ׳״ לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבִישׁוּתֵיהּ. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנָךְ וּבְנָתָךְ נְפִישִׁי, וּמִינַּסְבָן בְּנָתָךְ לְעָלְמָא, וּמִדַּמְיָין בְּאַפָּךְ כִּדְקָא אָזְלָן בְּשִׁבְיָה.
human_translation: They said to him: “You shall beget sons and daughters, but they shall not be yours; for they shall go into captivity” was read to us to Rava he said its adverse To Abaye he said: Your sons and daughters will be numerous, and your daughters will be married to outsiders and it will seem to you as if they were taken in captivity.
llm_translation: They said to him: We have read "Sons and daughters you shall beget, etc." to Rava he said: according to his understanding. To Abbaye he said: Your sons and daughters are numerous, and your daughter will be married off to the world, and they will be like blood in your nose, as it is stated, they went into captivity.

hebrew_text: אַקְרְיֻין ״בָּנֶיךָ וּבְנֹתֶיךָ נְתֻנִים לְעַם אַחֵר״. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנָךְ וּבְנָתָךְ נְפִישִׁין, אַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לְקָרִיבָךְ וְהִיא אָמְרָה לְקָרִיבַהּ, וְאָכְפָה לָךְ וְיָהֲבַתְּ לְהוֹן לְקָרִיבַהּ, דְּהָוֵי כְּעַם אַחֵר. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּבֵיתְהוּ שְׁכִיבָא, וְאָתוּ בְּנֵיהּ וּבְנָתֵיהּ לִידֵי אִיתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי. דְּאָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״בָּנֶיךָ וּבְנֹתֶיךָ נְתֻנִים לְעַם אַחֵר״ — זוֹ אֵשֶׁת הָאָב.
human_translation: The verse: “Your sons and your daughters shall be given unto another people” was read to us To Abaye he said: Your sons and daughters will be numerous. You say, your relatives and says her relatives and she will impose upon you and they will be given to her relatives, which is like another nation To Rava he said: Your wife will die and your sons and daughters will come into the hands of another woman. As Rava said Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: What is that which is written “Your sons and your daughters shall be given unto another people”? This the father’s wife,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Your sons and daughters are given to another people." To Abbaye he said: Your sons and daughters are important, you say for your nearness and she says for her nearness, and she forces you and you give them to her for her nearness, so it is like another people. To Rava he said: In their house is a bed, and their sons and daughters come to the hands of another woman. For Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of "Your sons and daughters are given to another people" - this refers to the wife of the father.
