hebrew_text: אַקְרִינַן בְּחֶלְמִין: ״לֵךְ אֱכֹל בְּשִׂמְחָה לַחְמֶךָ״. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַרְוַוח עִסְקָךְ וְאָכְלַתְּ וְשָׁתֵית וְקָרֵית פְּסוּקָא מֵחֶדְוָא דְלִבָּךְ. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּסֵיד עִסְקָךְ, טָבְחַתְּ וְלָא אָכְלַתְּ וְשָׁתֵית וְקָרֵית לְפַכּוֹחֵי פַּחְדָּךְ.
human_translation: “Go your way, eat your bread with joy, was read to us in our dream. To Abaye he said: Your business will profit and you will eat and drink and read the verse out of the joy of your heart. To Rava he said: Your business will be lost, you will slaughter but not eat, you will drink read to allay your fears.
llm_translation: We learned in a dream: "Go, eat your bread with joy." To Abbaye, Rava said to him: "Satisfy your desire and eat and drink and read a verse from the pleasantness of your heart." To Rava, Rava said to him: "You have lost your business, you slaughtered but did not eat and drink and read to strengthen the fear of you."

hebrew_text: אַקְרִינַן ״זֶרַע רַב תּוֹצִיא הַשָּׂדֶה״. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵרֵישֵׁיהּ, לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מִסֵּיפֵיהּ.
human_translation: “You shall carry much seed out into the field, was read to us To Abaye he said from the beginning To Rava he said from the end
llm_translation: We have learned: "The seed of a great man will bring forth the field." To Abbaye he said from the beginning, to Rava he said from the end.

hebrew_text: אַקְרִינַן ״זֵיתִים יִהְיוּ לְךָ בְּכׇל גְּבוּלֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵרֵישֵׁיהּ, לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מִסֵּיפֵיהּ.
human_translation: “You shall have olive trees throughout all your borders, was read to us to Abaye he said from the beginning To Rava he said from the end
llm_translation: We read: "Olive trees shall be for you in all your borders, etc." To Abbaye he said from the beginning, to Rava he said from the end.

hebrew_text: אַקְרִינַן ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נָפֵק לָךְ שְׁמָא דְּרֵישׁ מְתִיבְתָּא הָוֵית, אֵימְתָךְ נְפַלַת בְּעָלְמָא. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּדַיְינָא דְּמַלְכָּא אִתְּבַר, וּמִתְּפַסַתְּ בְּגַנָּבֵי, וְדָיְינִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִינָּךְ. לִמְחַר אִתְּבַר בֵּדַיְינָא דְּמַלְכָּא וַאֲתוֹ וְתָפְשִׂי לֵיהּ לְרָבָא.
human_translation: “All the peoples of the earth shall see was read to us To Abaye he said: Your name will become well-known as head of the yeshiva, and you will be feared by all. To Rava he said: The king’s treasury was broken and you will be apprehended as a thief, and everyone will draw an a fortiori inference from you: the next day, the king’s treasury was burglarized, and they came and apprehended Rava.
llm_translation: We learned: "And all the people of the land will see, etc." Abaye said to him: Your name was proclaimed in the great academy, when did you fall into the world? Rava said to him: You were examined by the king's judges, and you were caught with thieves, and all the judges of the world are more lenient than you. The next day he was examined by the king's judges, and they brought him and handed him over to Rava.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזַן חַסָּא עַל פּוּם דַּנֵּי. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עִיף עִסְקָךְ כְּחַסָּא. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָרִיר עִסְקָךְ כִּי חַסָּא.
human_translation: said to him: We saw lettuce on the mouth of the barrels. To Abaye he said: Your business will double like lettuce To Rava he said: Your work will be bitter like lettuce
llm_translation: They said to him: "Chazan Chasa on the mouth of Danai." To Abbaye he said: "Your business is light like Chasa." To Rava he said: "Bitter is your business like Chasa."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזַן בִּשְׂרָא עַל פּוּם דַּנֵּי. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּסֵים חַמְרָךְ, וְאָתוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְמִזְבַּן בִּשְׂרָא וְחַמְרָא מִינָּךְ. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּקֵיף חַמְרָךְ, וְאָתוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְמִזְבַּן בִּשְׂרָא לְמֵיכַל בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: They said to him: We saw meat on the mouth of barrels. To Abaye he said: Your wine will be sweet and everyone will come to buy meat and wine from you. To Rava he said: Your wine will spoil, and everyone will go to buy meat in order to eat with it,
llm_translation: They said to him: "The cantor in Sura is on the verge of judgment." To Abbaye he said: "Your wine is strong, and all the people come to buy meat and wine from you." To Rava he said: "Your wine is potent, and all the people come to buy meat to eat with it."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזַן חָבִיתָא דִּתְלֵי בְּדִיקְלָא. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּלֵי עִסְקָךְ כְּדִיקְלָא. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲלֵי עִסְקָךְ כְּתַמְרֵי.
human_translation: They said to him: We saw a barrel hanging from a palm tree. To Abaye he said: Your business will rise like a palm tree. To Rava he said: Your work will be sweet like dates
llm_translation: They said to him: "The cantor of the synagogue is like a date palm." To Abbaye he said: "Because your business is like a date palm." To Rava he said: "The leaves of your business are like dates."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזַן רוּמָּנָא דְּקָדְחָא אַפּוּם דַּנֵּי, לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲשִׁיק עִסְקָךְ כְּרוּמָּנָא. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָאוֵי עִסְקָךְ כְּרוּמָּנָא.
human_translation: They said to him: We saw a pomegranate taking root on the mouth of barrels. To Abaye he said: Your business will increase in value like a pomegranate. To Rava he said: Your work will go sour like a pomegranate.
llm_translation: They said to him: The cantor of the synagogue in Kadesh is skilled in judgment. To Abbaye he said: Perform your business like a pomegranate. To Rava he said: Your business stands like a pomegranate.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזַן חָבִיתָא דִּנְפַל לְבֵירָא. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִתְבְּעֵי עִסְקָךְ, כִּדְאָמַר ״נְפַל פִּתָּא בְּבֵירָא וְלָא אִשְׁתְּכַח״. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּסֵיד עִסְקָךְ וְשָׁדֵית לֵיהּ לְבֵירָא.
human_translation: They said to him: We saw a barrel fall into a pit. To Abaye he said: Your merchandise will be in demand as says: Bread falls in a pit and is not found. To Rava he said: Your merchandise will be ruined and you will throw it into a pit.
llm_translation: They said to him: The cantor, Havita, fell into a pit. To Abbaye, he said: Attend to your business, as it is said, "A loaf of bread fell into the pit and was not found." To Rava, he said: You have lost your business and thrown it into the pit.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזֵינַן בַּר חֲמָרָא דְּקָאֵי אַאִיסָדַן וְנוֹעֵר. לְאַבָּיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַלְכָּא הָוֵית, וְקָאֵי אָמוֹרָא עֲלָךְ. לְרָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ גְּהִיט מִתְּפִילָּךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי וְאִיתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וָאו דְּ״פֶטֶר חֲמוֹר״ וַדַּאי גְּהִיט מִתְּפִילָּךְ.
human_translation: They said to him: We saw a donkey foal standing near our heads, braying. To Abaye he said: You will be a king, head of the yeshiva, and an interpreter will stand near you To Rava he said: peter ḥamor , first-born donkey, erased from your phylacteries. said to him: I myself saw it and it is there. said to him: vav of peter ḥamor is certainly erased from your phylacteries.
llm_translation: They said to him: We saw Bar Ḥamra standing and moving. To Abbaye he said: You were a king, and the matter is upon you. To Rava he said: "The firstborn of a donkey" has exempted you from your obligation. He said to him: In my opinion, I see it and it is here. He said to him: But if indeed "the firstborn of a donkey" has exempted you from your obligation, then surely it has exempted you.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲזַל רָבָא לְחוֹדֵיהּ לְגַבֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דַּשָּׁא בָּרָיְיתָא דִּנְפַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִשְׁתְּךָ שָׁכְבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי כַּכַּי וְשִׁנַּי דִּנְתוּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנָךְ וּבְנָתָךְ שָׁכְבָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי תַּרְתֵּי יוֹנֵי דְּפָרְחָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּרֵי נְשֵׁי מְגָרְשַׁתְּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי תְּרֵי גַּרְגְּלִידֵי דְלִפְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּרֵין קוּלְפֵי בָּלְעַתְּ. אֲזַל רָבָא הָהוּא יוֹמָא וִיתֵיב בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא. אַשְׁכַּח הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי סַגִּי נְהוֹרֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָמִנְּצוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲזַל רָבָא לְפָרוֹקִינְהוּ, וּמְחוֹהוּ לְרָבָא תְּרֵי. דְּלוֹ לְמַחוֹיֵיהּ אַחֲרִיתִי, אֲמַר: מִסְתַּיי, תְּרֵין חֲזַאי.
human_translation: Ultimately, Rava went to alone. said to him: I saw the outer door fall. said to him: Your wife will die, said to him: I saw my front and back teeth fall out. He said to him: Your sons and daughters will die. said to him: I saw two doves that were flying. He said to him: You will divorce two women. said to him: I saw two turnip heads [ gargelidei ]. He said to him: You will receive two blows with a club That same day Rava went and sat in the study hall the entire day. He discovered these two blind people who were fighting with each other. Rava went to separate them and they struck Rava two they raised to strike him an additional blow, he said: enough for me, I saw two.
llm_translation: At the end, Rava went to his room. He said to him: "See the barley bread that fell." He said to him: "Your wife has lied down." He said to him: "See the pitcher and the teeth that were broken." He said to him: "Your son and daughter have lied down." He said to him: "See the two doves that have flown." He said to him: "Two divorced women have lied down." He said to him: "See the two pieces of fish that are rotten." He said to him: "Two pieces of meat have lied down." Rava went that day and sat in the study hall all day. He found there two white stones that were placed next to each other. Rava went and separated them, and said to Rava: "Two stones." If the other one is left, he said: "Two stones."

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲתָא רָבָא וִיהֵיב לֵיהּ אַגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי אֲשִׁיתָא דִּנְפַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְכָסִים בְּלֹא מְצָרִים קָנֵית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי אַפַּדְנָא דְּאַבָּיֵי דִּנְפַל וְכַסְּיַין אַבְקֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַבָּיֵי שָׁכֵיב וּמְתִיבְתֵּיהּ אָתְיָא לְגַבָּךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי אַפַּדְנָא דִידִי דִּנְפַל, וַאֲתוֹ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שְׁקוּל לְבֵינְתָּא לְבֵינְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמַעְתָּתָךְ מִבַּדְּרָן בְּעָלְמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דְּאִבְּקַע רֵישִׁי וּנְתַר מוּקְרִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אוּדְרָא מִבֵּי סָדְיָא נָפֵיק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַקְרְיוּן הַלֵּלָא מִצְרָאָה בְּחֶלְמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִיסֵּי מִתְרַחְשִׁי לָךְ.
human_translation: Ultimately, Rava came and gave him, a fee. And said to him: I saw my fall. said to him: You will acquire property without limits. said to him: I saw Abaye’s house [ appadna ] fall and its dust covered me. said to him: Abaye will die and his yeshiva will come to you. said to him: I saw my house fall, and everyone came and took the bricks. He said to him: Your teachings will be disseminated throughout the world. said to him: I saw that my head split and my brain fell out. He said to him: A feather will fall out of the pillow said to him: The Egyptian hallel , was read to me in a dream. He said to him: Miracles will be performed for you.
llm_translation: At the end, Rava came and gave him a reward. He said to him: "See the coin that fell." He said to him: "You acquired assets without distress." He said to him: "See the purse of Abaye that fell, and the coins scattered." He said to him: "Abaye is lying down, and his coins are coming to you." He said to him: "See my purse that fell, and all the people of the world are taking from one to another." He said to him: "You have heard from the master of the world." He said to him: "See that my head split and my turban fell." He said to him: "A demon came out from the house of the demon." He said to him: "Recite the verse 'Hillel has come out of Egypt' in a dream." He said to him: "Miracles will happen to you."

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בַּהֲדֵיהּ בְּאַרְבָּא. אָמַר: בַּהֲדֵי גַּבְרָא דְּמִתְרְחִישׁ לֵיהּ נִיסָּא לְמָה לִי. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא סָלֵיק נְפַל סִיפְרָא מִינֵּיהּ. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רָבָא וַחֲזָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״כׇּל הַחֲלוֹמוֹת הוֹלְכִין אַחַר הַפֶּה״. אֲמַר: רָשָׁע, בְּדִידָךְ קָיְימָא, וְצַעַרְתַּן כּוּלֵּי הַאי. כּוּלְּהוּ מָחֵילְנָא לָךְ, בַּר מִבְּרַתֵּיה דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּלִמְּסַר הַהוּא גַּבְרָא לִידֵי דְּמַלְכוּתָא דְּלָא מְרַחֲמוּ עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: was going with on a ship; said: Why am I with a person for whom miracles will be performed, As was climbing a book fell from him. Rava found and saw: All dreams follow the mouth, written therein. He said Scoundrel. It was on you, and you caused me so much suffering. I forgive you for everything except for the daughter Rav Ḥisda, May it be will that this man be delivered into the hands of a kingdom that has no compassion on him.
llm_translation: He was walking with him on the road. He said: "With the man who experiences a miracle, why do I need?" With the one who was going up, a book fell from him. Rava found it and saw that it was written in it, "All dreams follow the mouth." He said: "Wicked one, your judgment is in your favor, and you have caused them all distress. We forgive you, son of the daughter of Rav Hisda. May the Merciful One deliver that man into the hands of a kingdom that will not have mercy on him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר: מַאי אַעֲבֵיד? גְּמִירִי דְּקִלְלַת חָכָם, אֲפִילּוּ בְּחִנָּם הִיא בָּאָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן רָבָא דִּבְדִינָא קָא לָיֵיט. אָמַר: אֵיקוּם וְאֶגְלֵי, דַּאֲמַר מָר: גָּלוּת מְכַפֶּרֶת עָוֹן.
human_translation: said What will I do? We learned that the curse of a Sage, baseless, comes And all the more so Rava, as he cursed justifiably. He said I will get up and go into exile, the Master said: Exile atones for transgression.
llm_translation: He said: What should I do? It is learned that cursing a sage, even if it comes for free, and all the more so Rava who is engaged in judgment. He said: Rise and reveal, as the Master said: Exile atones for sin.

hebrew_text: קָם גְּלִי לְבֵי רוֹמָאֵי. אֲזַל יְתֵיב אַפִּתְחָא דְּרֵישׁ טוּרְזִינָא דְּמַלְכָּא. רֵישׁ טוּרְזִינָא חֲזָא חֶלְמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי חֶלְמָא דְּעָיֵיל מַחְטָא בְּאֶצְבַּעְתִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי זוּזָא, וְלָא יְהַב לֵיהּ. לָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דִּנְפַל תִּכְלָא בְּתַרְתֵּין אֶצְבְּעָתִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי זוּזָא, וְלָא יְהַב לֵיהּ, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דִּנְפַל תִּכְלָא בְּכוּלַּהּ יְדָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְפַל תִּכְלָא בְּכוּלְּהוּ שִׁירָאֵי. שָׁמְעִי בֵּי מַלְכָּא, וְאַתְיוּהּ לְרֵישׁ טוּרְזִינָא קָא קָטְלִי לֵיהּ. אָמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא אַמַּאי? אַיְיתוֹ לְהַאי דַּהֲוָה יָדַע וְלָא אֲמַר. אַיְיתוּהוּ בַּר הֶדְיָא, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַמַּטּוּ זוּזָא דִידָךְ חֲרַבוּ
human_translation: He arose and exiled himself to the seat of the Roman He went and sat by the entrance, the keeper of the king’s wardrobe The wardrobe guard dreamed a dream. said to I saw in the dream that a needle pierced my finger. said to him: Give me a zuz . He did not give him so said nothing to him. said to him: I saw a worm that fell my two fingers, said to him: Give me a zuz . He did not give him so said nothing to him. said to him: I saw that a worm fell entire hand, said to him: A worm fell all the silk They heard in the king’s palace and they brought the wardrobe keeper and were executing him. He said to them: Why me? Bring the one who knew and did not say They brought and said to him: Because of your zuz , ruin
llm_translation: A man from Rome arose. He went and sat at the entrance of the palace of the king. The head of the palace saw a dream. He said to him: "I saw a dream that requires interpretation." He said to him: "Give me money." He did not give him. He did not say to him immediately. He said to him: "I saw that a palm tree fell on my two fingers." He said to him: "Give me money," but he did not give him, and he did not say to him. He said to him: "I saw that a palm tree fell on all my hand." He said to him: "A palm tree fell on all your cities." Listen, people of the king's house, and bring him to the head of the palace to kill him. He said to them: "Why me?" They brought him to the one who knew but did not say. They brought him to Bar Hedya, and they said to him: "Take your sword."

hebrew_text: שִׁירָאֵי דְּמַלְכָּא! כְּפִיתוּ תְּרֵין אַרְזֵי בְּחַבְלָא, אֲסוּר חַד כְּרָעֵיהּ לְחַד אַרְזָא וְחַד כְּרָעֵיהּ לְחַד אַרְזָא, וּשְׁרוֹ לְחַבְלָא עַד דְּאִצְטְלִיק רֵישֵׁיהּ. אֲזַל כׇּל חַד וְחַד וְקָם אַדּוּכְתֵּיהּ וְאִצְטְלִיק וּנְפַל בִּתְרֵין.
human_translation: the king’s silk They tied two cedar with a rope, and tied one of his legs to one cedar and one of his legs to cedar, and they released the rope until his head split open. Each went and stood in its place and split and fell in two.
llm_translation: The princes of the king! They tied two cedars with a rope, one foot of one cedar to one foot of the other cedar, and they sang until their heads were removed. Each one went and stood on his own and removed his head, and fell in between the two.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל בֶּן דָּמָא בֶּן אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֶת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: רָאִיתִי שְׁנֵי לְחָיַי שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ. אָמַר: שְׁנֵי גְּדוּדֵי רוֹמִי יָעֲצוּ עָלֶיךָ רָעָה, וּמֵתוּ.
human_translation: Ben Dama, son of Rabbi Yishmael’s sister, asked Rabbi Yishmael: I saw my two cheeks fell off. said to him: Two Roman battalions spoke ill of you, and they died.
llm_translation: Ben Dama, the nephew of Rabbi Yishmael, asked Rabbi Yishmael: "I saw my two cheeks that became red." He said: "Two Roman legions have conspired evil against you, and they will die."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא לְרַבִּי: רָאִיתִי חוֹטְמִי שֶׁנָּשַׁר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲרוֹן אַף נִסְתַּלֵּק מִמְּךָ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָאִיתִי שְׁנֵי יָדַי שֶׁנֶּחְתְּכוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא תִּצְטָרֵךְ לְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָאִיתִי שְׁתֵּי רַגְלַי שֶׁנִּקְטְעוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַל סוּס אַתָּה רוֹכֵב. חֲזַאי דְּאָמְרִי לִי בַּאֲדָר מָיְתַתְּ וְנִיסָן לָא חָזֵית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאַדְרוּתָא מָיְתַתְּ וְלָא אָתֵית לִידֵי נִסָּיוֹן.
human_translation: Bar Kappara said to Rabbi I saw my nose fell off. He said to him: anger [ ḥaron af ] has been removed from you. said to him: I saw my two hands were cut off. said to him: you will not require the labor of your hands, said to him: I saw my two legs were cut off. said: You are riding a horse. I saw that to me in Adar I will die I will not see Nisan. He said to him: You will die in glory [ adruta ] and you will not be brought to temptation [ nissayon ].
llm_translation: He said to him, Bar Kapara to Rabbi: I saw my nose bleed. He said to him: Anger has also departed from you. He said to him: I saw my two hands cut off. He said to him: You will not need the work of your hands. He said to him: I saw my two legs severed. He said to him: You are riding on a horse. They saw that they told me in Adar, "You will die," and in Nisan, you did not see. He said to him: In Adar, you will die, and you did not come into the hands of testing.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: רָאִיתִי שֶׁאֲנִי מַשְׁקֶה שֶׁמֶן לְזֵיתִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּא עַל אִמּוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דִּקְטִיף לִי כּוֹכְבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל גְּנַבְתְּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דִּבְלַעְתֵּיהּ לְכוֹכְבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל זַבֵּנְתֵּיהּ וַאֲכַלְתְּ לִדְמֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי עֵינַי דְּנָשְׁקָן אַהֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דִּנְשַׁקִי סֵיהֲרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דְּדָרֵיכְנָא בְּטוּנָא דְּאָסָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי טוּנָא מֵעִילַּאי וְהוּא מִתַּתַּאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשְׁכָּבְךָ הָפוּךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי עוֹרְבֵי דְּהָדְרִי לְפוּרְיֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִשְׁתְּךָ זָנְתָה מֵאֲנָשִׁים הַרְבֵּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי יוֹנֵי דְּהָדְרִי לְפוּרְיֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נָשִׁים הַרְבֵּה טִמֵּאתָ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דְּנָקֵיטְנָא תְּרֵי יוֹנֵי וּפָרְחָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּרְתֵּי נְשֵׁי נְסַבְתְּ וּפְטַרְתִּינּוּן בְּלָא גֵּט.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Yishmael: I saw that I was irrigating olives with oil. He said to him: you had relations with your mother, said to Rabbi Yishmael: I saw that I was plucking a star. He said to him: You kidnapped an Israelite man, said to him: I saw that I swallowed a star. He said to him: You sold the Israelite man and spent the money said to him: I saw my eyes kissing one another. He said to him: You had relations with your sister, said to him: I saw myself kissing the moon. He said to him: You slept with an Israelite woman, He said to him: I saw that I was treading in the shade of a myrtle tree. He said to him: You slept with a betrothed young woman, He said to him: I saw that the shade was above me, and was below me. He said to him: Your bed is upside-down, He said to him: I saw ravens circling my bed. He said to him: Your wife committed adultery with many men. He said to him: I saw doves circling around my bed. He said to him: You defiled many women. He said to him: I saw that I was holding two doves and were flying. He said to him: You married two women and dismissed them without a divorce.
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Yishmael: I saw that I am giving oil to olives. He said to him: It is coming upon its mother. He said to him: See that you are gathering stars for me. He said to him: Son of Israel, you have stolen. He said to him: See that you are swallowing it for a star. He said to him: Son of Israel, you have sold it and eaten its blood. He said to him: See my eyes that they are kissing each other. He said to him: It is coming upon his sister. He said to him: See that you are kissing a moon. He said to him: It is coming upon a wife of Israel. He said to him: See that you are walking on the ashes of Asa. He said to him: It is coming upon a betrothed maiden. He said to him: See that a worm is from above and it is from below. He said to him: Turn your bed. He said to him: See the crows that return to their nests. He said to him: Your wife has committed adultery with many men. He said to him: See the doves that return to their nests. He said to him: You have caused many women to become impure. He said to him: See that we have plucked two doves and they have multiplied. He said to him: You have married two women and divorced them without a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דְּקָלֵיפְנָא בֵּיעֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁכְבֵי קָא מְשַׁלְּחַתְּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כּוּלְּהוּ אִיתַנְהוּ בִּי, בַּר מֵהָא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אָתְיָא הַאי אִיתְּתָא וְאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: הַאי גְּלִימָא דְּמִכַּסַּתְּ — דְּגַבְרָא פְּלוֹנִי הוּא, דְּמִית וְאַשְׁלַחְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: I saw myself peeling eggs. He said to him: You stripped dead people, said to him: Everything is true, with the exception of this one, which is not true. Meanwhile, this woman came and said to him: This cloak that you are wearing to such-and-such a man, who died and whom you stripped
llm_translation: He said to him: "I see a shell in the river." He said to him: "The fishermen are sending it." He said to him: "All of them are with me, except for the one who is not." Meanwhile, this woman came and said to him: "This robe that covers - it belongs to a certain man, who died and I inherited it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזַאי דְּאָמְרִי לִי: שְׁבַק לָךְ אֲבוּךְ נִכְסֵי בְּקַפּוֹדְקְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לָךְ נִכְסֵי בְּקַפּוֹדְקְיָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ לָאו. אֲזַל אֲבוּךְ לְקַפּוֹדְקְיָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו. אִם כֵּן: קַפָּא כְּשׁוּרָא, דֵּיקָא עַשְׂרָה. זִיל חֲזִי קַפָּא דְּרֵישׁ עַשְׂרָה שֶׁהִיא מְלֵאָה זוּזֵי. אֲזַל אַשְׁכַּח שֶׁהִיא מְלֵאָה זוּזֵי.
human_translation: He said to I saw that they said to me Your father left you property in Cappadocia. said to him: Do you have property in Cappadocia? said to him: No. Did your father go to Cappadocia? said to him: No. said to him: If so, Kappa beam; deka ten. Go look at the tenth beam that it is full of coins. He went and found that it was full of coins.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did you see that they told me to leave your father's property in Kapodkeya?" He said to him: "Do you have property in Kapodkeya?" He said to him: "No." Did your father go to Kapodkeya?" He said to him: "No." If so, a barrel like a sela, which is ten. Go and see a barrel of lentils that is worth ten zuz. He went and found that it was worth ten zuz.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הָרוֹאֶה בְּאֵר בַּחֲלוֹם — רוֹאֶה שָׁלוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּחְפְּרוּ עַבְדֵי יִצְחָק בַּנָּחַל וַיִּמְצְאוּ שָׁם בְּאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים״. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מָצָא תּוֹרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מֹצְאִי מָצָא חַיִּים״, וּכְתִיב הָכָא: ״בְּאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים״. רָבָא אָמַר: חַיִּים מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: One who sees a well in a dream sees peace, as it is said: “And Isaac’s servants dug in the valley and found there a well of living water” Rabbi Natan says: he has found Torah, As it is stated “For whoever finds me finds life” and it is written here: “A well of living water,” Rava said: actual life.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: One who sees a well in a dream - he sees peace, as it is stated: "And Isaac's servants dug in the valley and found there a well of living water." Rabbi Nathan says: One who finds Torah - as it is stated: "For whoever finds me finds life," and it is written here: "a well of living water." Rava said: Actual life.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן שָׁלֹשׁ שְׁלוֹמוֹת הֵן: נָהָר, צִפּוֹר, וּקְדֵרָה. נָהָר — דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנְנִי נֹטֶה אֵלֶיהָ כְּנָהָר שָׁלוֹם״. צִפּוֹר — דִּכְתִיב: ״כְּצִפֳּרִים עָפוֹת כֵּן יָגֵן ה׳ צְבָאוֹת וְגוֹ׳״. קְדֵרָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ תִּשְׁפֹּת שָׁלוֹם לָנוּ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: וּבִקְדֵרָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ בָּשָׂר שָׁנִינוּ. ״וּפָרְשׂוּ כַּאֲשֶׁר בַּסִּיר וּכְבָשָׂר בְּתוֹךְ קַלָּחַת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanan said: There are three peace: A river, a bird and a pot. A river, as it is written: “I will extend peace to her like a river” a bird, as it is written: “As birds hovering, so will the Lord of hosts protect Jerusalem” a pot, as it is written: “Lord, You will establish [ tishpot ] peace for us” And Rabbi Ḥanina said: We learned with regard to a pot that does not have meat in it, “Yea, they chop them in pieces, as that which is in the pot, and as flesh within the cauldron”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hanan said: There are three peace offerings: a river, a bird, and a pot. A river - as it is written: "Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river." A bird - as it is written: "Like birds hovering, so the Lord of hosts will protect." A pot - as it is written: "The Lord will give peace to us." Rabbi Hanina said: And in a pot that has no meat, we expound: "And they shall spread it out like meat in the pot."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָרוֹאֶה נָהָר בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר: ״הִנְנִי נֹטֶה אֵלֶיהָ כְּנָהָר שָׁלוֹם״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״כִּי יָבֹא כַנָּהָר צָר״. הָרוֹאֶה צִפּוֹר בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״כְּצִפֳּרִים עָפוֹת כֵּן יָגֵן וְגוֹ׳״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״כְּצִפּוֹר נוֹדֶדֶת מִן קִנָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״. הָרוֹאֶה קְדֵרָה בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר: ״ה׳ תִּשְׁפֹּת שָׁלוֹם לָנוּ״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״שְׁפֹת הַסִּיר שְׁפֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: one who sees a river in a dream rise early recite: “I will extend peace to her like a river,” before a different verse, can precede it “For distress will come in like a river” One who sees a bird in a dream rise early and recite: “As birds hovering, so will the Lord of hosts protect Jerusalem,” before a different verse, can precede it “As a bird that wanders from her nest, One who sees a pot in a dream rise early and recite: “Lord, You will establish peace for us,” before a different verse, can precede it “Set on the pot, set it on”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees a river in a dream should rise early and say, "Behold, I am inclined towards it like a peaceful river," before another verse precedes him - "For he shall come like a narrow river." One who sees a bird in a dream should rise early and say, "Like birds hovering, so will the Lord of hosts protect," before another verse precedes him - "Like a bird that wanders from its nest." One who sees a pot in a dream should rise early and say, "May the Lord grant us peace," before another verse precedes him - "The lips of the pot are lips."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה עֲנָבִים בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״כַּעֲנָבִים בַּמִּדְבָּר״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״עֲנָבֵמוֹ עִנְּבֵי רוֹשׁ״. הָרוֹאֶה הַר בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר — ״מַה נָּאווּ עַל הֶהָרִים רַגְלֵי מְבַשֵּׂר״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״עַל הֶהָרִים אֶשָּׂא בְכִי וָנֶהִי״.
human_translation: one who sees grapes in a dream rise early and recite: like grapes in the wilderness” before a different verse, can precede it “Their grapes are grapes of gall, One who sees a mountain in a dream rise early and recite: “How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of the messenger before a different verse, can precede it “For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing”
llm_translation: One who sees grapes in a dream, should arise early and say, "Like grapes in the wilderness," before another verse precedes him - "His vine is from the vine of Sodom." One who sees a mountain in a dream, should arise and say, "How beautiful are the feet upon the mountains, the herald of good tidings," before another verse precedes him - "Upon the mountains I will lift up weeping and wailing."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה שׁוֹפָר בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִתָּקַע בְּשׁוֹפָר גָּדוֹל״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״תִּקְעוּ שׁוֹפָר בַּגִּבְעָה״.
human_translation: One who sees a shofar in a dream rise early and recite: “And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great shofar shall be sounded; before a different verse, can precede it “Blow you the horn [ shofar ] in Giva”
llm_translation: One who sees a shofar in a dream, should wake up and say, "And it shall be on that day that a great shofar will be sounded," before another verse precedes it - "Blow the shofar on the hill."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה כֶּלֶב בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״וּלְכֹל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יֶחֱרַץ כֶּלֶב לְשֹׁנוֹ״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״וְהַכְּלָבִים עַזֵּי נֶפֶשׁ״. הָרוֹאֶה אֲרִי בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״אַרְיֵה שָׁאָג מִי לֹא יִירָא״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״עָלָה אַרְיֵה מִסֻּבְּכוֹ״.
human_translation: One who sees a dog in a dream rise early and recite: “But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog whet his tongue” before a different verse, can precede it “Yea, the dogs are greedy” One who sees a lion in a dream rise early and recite: “The lion has roared, who will not fear? before a different verse, can precede it “A lion is gone up from his thicket,
llm_translation: One who sees a dog in a dream, should wake up and say, "And for all the children of Israel, no dog will sharpen his tongue," before another verse precedes him - "And the dogs are mighty of soul." One who sees a lion in a dream, should wake up and say, "A lion roars, who will not fear," before another verse precedes him - "The lion has come up from his thicket."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה תִּגְלַחַת בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״וַיְגַלַּח וַיְחַלֵּף שִׂמְלֹתָיו״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״כִּי אִם גֻּלַּחְתִּי וְסָר מִמֶּנִּי כֹחִי״. הָרוֹאֶה בְּאֵר בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״בְּאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״כְּהָקִיר בַּיִר מֵימֶיהָ״. הָרוֹאֶה קָנֶה בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״קָנֶה רָצוּץ לֹא יִשְׁבּוֹר״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״הִנֵּה בָטַחְתָּ לְּךָ עַל מִשְׁעֶנֶת הַקָּנֶה הָרָצוּץ״.
human_translation: One who sees a shave in a dream rise early and recite: “And he shaved himself, and changed his raiment” before a different verse, can precede it “If I be shaven, then my strength will go from me, and I shall become weak” One who sees a well in a dream rise early and recite: “A well of living waters” before a different verse, can precede it “As a cistern wells with her waters, One who sees a reed in a dream rise early and recite: “A bruised reed shall he not break” before a different verse, can precede it “Now, behold, you trust upon the staff of this bruised reed”
llm_translation: The one who sees a shaving in a dream, should arise and say, "And he shaved and changed his garments," before another verse precedes him - "For I have been shaved and my strength has departed from me." The one who sees a well in a dream, should arise and say, "A well of living waters," before another verse precedes him - "Like a cistern that retains no water." The one who sees a reed in a dream, should arise and say, "A bruised reed he will not break," before another verse precedes him - "Behold, you have relied on the support of the broken reed."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה קָנֶה בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קְנֵה חָכְמָה״. קָנִים — יְצַפֶּה לְבִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְכׇל קִנְיָנְךָ קְנֵה בִינָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: קָרָא, קוּרָא, קִירָא, קַנְיָא — כּוּלְּהוּ מְעַלּוּ לְחֶלְמָא. תַּנְיָא: אֵין מַרְאִין דִּלּוּעִין אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁהוּא יְרֵא שָׁמַיִם בְּכָל כֹּחוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages teach: One who sees a reed [ kaneh ] in a dream should expect wisdom, as it is stated: “Get [ kene ] wisdom” reeds [ kanim ] should expect understanding, as it said: “Yea, with all your acquisitions [ kinyanekha ] acquire understanding” Rabbi Zeira said: Pumpkin [ kara ], heart of palm [ kura ], wax [ kira ], and reed [ kanya ], are all advantageous when one dreams It was taught A pumpkin is only shown to one who fears Heaven with all his might, [ delu’im ]
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees a reed in a dream - he should anticipate wisdom, as it is stated: "Acquire wisdom." Reeds - he should anticipate understanding, as it is stated: "And with all your acquisitions acquire understanding." Rabbi Zeira said: "Kara, kura, kira, kania" - all of them lead to a dream. It was taught in a Baraita: One only sees a bundle of reeds in a dream if he is God-fearing with all his might.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה שׁוֹר בַּחֲלוֹם, יַשְׁכִּים וְיֹאמַר ״בְּכוֹר שׁוֹרוֹ הָדָר לוֹ״, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּקְדְּמֶנּוּ פָּסוּק אַחֵר — ״כִּי יִגַּח שׁוֹר אֶת אִישׁ״.
human_translation: One who sees an ox in a dream, rise early and recite: “His firstling bullock, majesty is his” before a different verse, can precede it “And if an ox gore a man”
llm_translation: One who sees a bull in a dream, should arise early and say, "May his firstborn be splendid to him," before another verse precedes him - "When a bull gores a man."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּשׁוֹר. הָאוֹכֵל מִבְּשָׂרוֹ — מִתְעַשֵּׁר. נְגָחוֹ — הָוְיִין לֵיהּ בָּנִים שֶׁמְנַגְּחִים בַּתּוֹרָה. נְשָׁכוֹ — יִסּוּרִין בָּאִים עָלָיו. בְּעָטוֹ — דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ. רְכָבוֹ — עוֹלֶה לִגְדוּלָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Five matters are said the ox. he ate from its flesh will become wealthy. gored him will have sons who gore in Torah. it bit him, suffering is coming to him. it kicked him will be required to travel a great distance in the future. he was riding it, rise to greatness.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Five things were said regarding an ox. If it eats from its own flesh - it becomes enriched. If it gores - he should have sons who are proficient in Torah. If it bites - afflictions come upon him. If it kicks - a distant journey befalls him. If it mounts - it rises to greatness.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא רְכָבוֹ — מֵת! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּרָכֵיב הוּא לְתוֹרָא. הָא, דְּרָכֵיב תּוֹרָא לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught he was riding it, die? not difficult. This, that he was riding the ox, while this, that the ox was riding him.
llm_translation: "And it was taught: Rechavo - he died! It is not difficult - this one who rode was for the ox. This one, who rode the ox for himself."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה חֲמוֹר בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לִישׁוּעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה מַלְכֵּךְ יָבוֹא לָךְ צַדִּיק וְנוֹשָׁע הוּא עָנִי וְרֹכֵב עַל חֲמוֹר״. הָרוֹאֶה חָתוּל בַּחֲלוֹם — בְּאַתְרָא דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ ״שׁוּנָּרָא״ — נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ שִׁירָה נָאָה. ״שִׁינָּרָא״ — נַעֲשֶׂה לוֹ שִׁינּוּי רַע. הָרוֹאֶה עֲנָבִים בַּחֲלוֹם, לְבָנוֹת, בֵּין בִּזְמַנָּן, וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּן — יָפוֹת. שְׁחוֹרוֹת בִּזְמַנָּן — יָפוֹת. שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּן — רָעוֹת. הָרוֹאֶה סוּס לָבָן בַּחֲלוֹם, בֵּין בְּנַחַת, בֵּין בְּרָדוּף — יָפֶה לוֹ. אָדוֹם, בְּנַחַת — יָפֶה, בְּרָדוּף — קָשֶׁה.
human_translation: One who sees a donkey in a dream should anticipate salvation, as it is said: “Behold, your king comes unto you; he is triumphant, and victorious, lowly, and riding upon a donkey” One who sees a cat in a dream in a place where they call it shunra , a nice song [ shira na’a ] will be composed for him. shinra , it is a sign that he will undergo a change for the worse [ shinui ra ]. One who sees grapes in a dream white whether in their season or not in their season, it is a good black in their season, it is a good not in their season, it is a bad One who sees a white horse in a dream, whether walking or running, it is a good for him. red walking, it is a good running, it is a bad
llm_translation: One who sees a donkey in a dream - should anticipate salvation, as it is stated: "Behold, your king comes to you; righteous and victorious is he, humble and riding on a donkey." One who sees a cat in a dream - in a place where they call it "Shunra" - a pleasant song is made for him. If they call it "Shinra" - an evil change is made for him. One who sees grapes in a dream, whether they are ripe or unripe - they are beautiful. If they are black when ripe - they are beautiful. If they are not ripe - they are bad. One who sees a white horse in a dream, whether it is walking calmly or running - it is good for him. A red horse, walking calmly - is good, running - is harsh.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּחֲלוֹם — תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִשְׁמַעַת. וְדַוְקָא יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אַבְרָהָם, אֲבָל טַיָּיעָא בְּעָלְמָא — לָא. הָרוֹאֶה גָּמָל בַּחֲלוֹם — מִיתָה נִקְנְסָה לוֹ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְהִצִּילוּהוּ מִמֶּנָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״וְאָנֹכִי אֵרֵד עִמְּךָ מִצְרַיְמָה וְאָנֹכִי אַעַלְךָ גַם עָלֹה״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״גַּם ה׳ הֶעֱבִיר חַטָּאתְךָ לֹא תָמוּת״.
human_translation: One who sees Ishmael in a dream, his prayer heard, specifically Ishmael, son of Abraham, not a random Arab. One who sees a camel [ gamal ] in a dream, death was decreed upon him from heaven but he was spared. Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What verse “I will go down with you into Egypt; and I will also surely bring you up again [ gam alo ]” ( ), Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here, “The Lord also [ gam ] has put away your sin; you shall not die”
llm_translation: One who sees Ishmael in a dream - his prayer is heard. And specifically Ishmael son of Abraham, but a random Arab - no. One who sees a camel in a dream - death is decreed upon him from Heaven, and they saved him from it. Rabbi Chama son of Rabbi Chanina said: What is the verse? "And I will go down with you to Egypt, and I will also surely bring you up." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: From here: "For Hashem has also turned away your sin; you shall not die."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה פִּינְחָס בַּחֲלוֹם — פֶּלֶא נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ. הָרוֹאֶה פִּיל בַּחֲלוֹם — פְּלָאוֹת נַעֲשׂוּ לוֹ. פִּילִים — פִּלְאֵי פְּלָאוֹת נַעֲשׂוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: One who sees Pinehas in a dream, that a miracle will be performed on his behalf, One who sees an elephant [ pil ] in a dream miracles [ pelaot ] will be performed for him. elephants miracles upon miracles will be performed for him.
llm_translation: One who sees Pinchas in a dream - wonders were done for him. One who sees an elephant in a dream - wonders were done for him. Elephants - wonders of wonders were done for him.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא כׇּל מִינֵי חַיּוֹת יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מִן הַפִּיל וּמִן הַקּוֹף! לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: Was it not taught All species of animals are good in a dream, with the exception of an elephant and a monkey? not difficult.
llm_translation: And it was taught: all kinds of animals are good in a dream, except for the elephant and the monkey! This is not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא דִּמְסָרַג, הָא דְּלָא מְסָרַג. הָרוֹאֶה הוּנָא בַּחֲלוֹם — נֵס נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ. חֲנִינָא, חֲנַנְיָא, יוֹחָנָן — נִסֵּי נִסִּים נַעֲשׂוּ לוֹ. הָרוֹאֶה הֶסְפֵּד בַּחֲלוֹם — מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם חָסוּ עָלָיו וּפְדָאוּהוּ. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּכְתָבָא.
human_translation: This it saddled, while this is not saddled. One who sees Huna in a dream, a miracle will be performed for him, Ḥanina, Ḥananya, or Yoḥanan, many miracles will be performed for him, a eulogy in a dream, the heavens had mercy upon him, and spared him this only applies written
llm_translation: This one who was imprisoned, this one who was not imprisoned. One who sees a dream of a reed - a miracle is done for him. Chanina, Chananya, Yochanan - miracles upon miracles were done for him. One who sees mourning in a dream - they have compassion on him from heaven and redeem him. And these matters are written.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹנֶה ״יְהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא מְבָרַךְ״ — מוּבְטָח לוֹ שֶׁהוּא בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. הַקּוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — רָאוּי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו שְׁכִינָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין דּוֹרוֹ זַכַּאי לְכָךְ.
human_translation: One who answers May His great name be blessed is assured that he is one the World-to-Come. One reciting Shema is worthy of having the Divine Presence rest upon him, but his generation is unworthy,
llm_translation: The one who answers "Yehai Shemei Rabbah Mevarakh" - it is assured to him that he is a son of the World to Come. One who recites the Shema - it is fitting that the Divine Presence should rest upon him, but his generation is not deserving of this.

hebrew_text: הַמַּנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לִגְדוּלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״. וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִילִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ. הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל בַּחֲלוֹם — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָא סַיֵּים.
human_translation: One who don phylacteries in a dream should anticipate greatness, as it is stated: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you; And it was taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: That the Name of the Lord is called upon you, refers to phylacteries of the head, One who pray in a dream, an auspicious omen. This only applies had not finished
llm_translation: The one who places tefillin in a dream - will merit greatness, as it is stated: "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you, etc." And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: These are the tefillin of the head. One who prays in a dream - it is a good sign for him. And these matters are not concluded.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל אִמּוֹ בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לְבִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אִם לַבִּינָה תִקְרָא״. הַבָּא עַל נַעֲרָה מְאוֹרָסָה — יְצַפֶּה לְתוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ מֹשֶׁה מוֹרָשָׁה קְהִלַּת יַעֲקֹב״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״מוֹרָשָׁה״ אֶלָּא ״מְאוֹרָשָׂה״. הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱמֹר לַחׇכְמָה אֲחֹתִי אָתְּ״. הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ בַּחֲלוֹם — מוּבְטָח לוֹ שֶׁהוּא בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָא יָדַע לַהּ וְלָא הַרְהַר בַּהּ מֵאוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: One who he had relations with his mother [ em ] in a dream, he should anticipate understanding, as it is stated: “Yea if [ im ] you call for understanding” One who had relations with a betrothed young woman he should anticipate Torah, as it is stated: “Moses commanded us Torah, an inheritance [ morasha ] of the congregation of Jacob” Do not read morasha ; rather, me’orasa , betrothed. One who had relations with his sister in a dream, should anticipate wisdom, as it is stated: “Say unto wisdom: You are my sister” One who he had relations with a married woman in a dream is assured that he is one the World-to-Come. This only applies he did not know her and was not thinking about her that evening;
llm_translation: One who comes upon his mother in a dream - should anticipate understanding, as it is stated: "For you shall call understanding." One who comes upon a betrothed maiden - should anticipate Torah, as it is stated: "Moses commanded us the Torah, an inheritance of the congregation of Jacob," do not read "morashah" (inheritance) but "me'orasah" (betrothed). One who comes upon his sister in a dream - should anticipate wisdom, as it is stated: "Say to wisdom, 'You are my sister.'" One who comes upon another man's wife in a dream - can be assured that he is of the world to come. And these matters, he did not know her, nor did he think about her from the light.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: הָרוֹאֶה חִטִּים בַּחֲלוֹם — רָאָה שָׁלוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשָּׂם גְּבוּלֵךְ שָׁלוֹם חֵלֶב חִטִּים יַשְׂבִּיעֵךְ״. הָרוֹאֶה שְׂעוֹרִים בַּחֲלוֹם — סָרוּ עֲוֹנוֹתָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְסָר עֲוֹנֶךָ וְחַטָּאתְךָ תְּכֻפָּר״. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֲנָא לָא סְלַקִי מִבָּבֶל לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד דַּחֲזַאי שְׂעָרֵי בְּחֶלְמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: One who sees wheat in a dream has seen peace, as it is stated: “He makes your borders peace; He gives you in plenty the fat of wheat” one who sees barley [ se’orim ] in a dream his iniquities are taken away, as it is stated: “And your iniquity is taken away [ vesar avonekh ], and your sin expiated” Rabbi Zeira said: I did not ascend from Babylonia to Eretz Yisrael until I saw barley in my dream.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: One who sees wheat in a dream - he has seen peace, as it is stated: "He will set your borders in peace, He will satisfy you with the fat of wheat." One who sees barley in a dream - his sins are removed, as it is stated: "And your iniquity will be removed, and your sin will be atoned for." Rabbi Zeira said: I did not ascend from Babylon to the land of Israel until I saw barley in a dream.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה גֶּפֶן טְעוּנָה בַּחֲלוֹם — אֵין אִשְׁתּוֹ מַפֶּלֶת נְפָלִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶשְׁתְּךָ כְּגֶפֶן פֹּרִיָּה״. שׂוֹרֵקָה — יְצַפֶּה לַמָּשִׁיחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֹסְרִי לַגֶּפֶן עִירֹה וְלַשֹּׂרֵקָה בְּנִי אֲתֹנוֹ״.
human_translation: One who sees a vine laden in a dream, his wife will not miscarry, as it is stated: “Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine, a vine branch should anticipate the Messiah, as it is stated: “Binding his foal unto the vine and his donkey’s colt unto the vine branch”
llm_translation: One who sees a loaded vine in a dream - his wife does not miscarry fetuses, as it is stated: "Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine" (Psalms 128:3). If she is barren - he should anticipate the Messiah, as it is stated: "He ties his foal to the vine and his donkey's colt to the choice vine" (Genesis 49:11).

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאָה תְּאֵנָה בַּחֲלוֹם — תּוֹרָתוֹ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת בְּקִרְבּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נוֹצֵר תְּאֵנָה יֹאכַל פִּרְיָהּ״. הָרוֹאֶה רִמּוֹנִים בַּחֲלוֹם, זוּטְרֵי — פָּרֵי עִסְקֵיהּ כְּרִמּוֹנָא, רַבְרְבֵי — רָבֵי עִסְקֵיהּ כְּרִמּוֹנָא. פַּלְגֵי, אִם תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא — יְצַפֶּה לְתוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁקְךָ מִיַּיִן הָרֶקַח מֵעֲסִיס רִמֹּנִי״. וְאִם עַם הָאָרֶץ הוּא — יְצַפֶּה לְמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּפֶלַח הָרִמּוֹן רַקָּתֵךְ״. מַאי רַקָּתֵךְ — אֲפִילּוּ רֵיקָנִין שֶׁבָּךְ, מְלֵאִים מִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן.
human_translation: One who sees a fig tree in a dream, his Torah is preserved within him, as it is stated: “One who keeps the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof” One who sees pomegranates in a dream, small, his business will flourish like the seeds of pomegranate, large, his business will increase like a pomegranate. slices of pomegranates if he is a Torah scholar, he should anticipate Torah, as it is stated: “I would cause you to drink of spiced wine, of the juice of my pomegranate” And if is an ignoramus, he should anticipate mitzvot, “Your temples are like a split pomegranate” What is “Your temples [ rakatekh ]”? Even the most ignorant [ reikanin ] among you, are full of mitzvot like a pomegranate.
llm_translation: One who sees a fig in a dream - his Torah is preserved within him, as it is said: "He who guards a fig will eat its fruit." One who sees pomegranates in a dream, this refers to scholars - their actions are like pomegranates, some are like Ravrevai (large pomegranates), some are like Ravbervei (small pomegranates). If he is a Torah scholar - he should aspire to Torah, as it is said: "I have caused you to drink the pure wine of my pomegranate." And if he is an ignorant person - he should aspire to fulfill commandments, as it is said: "Your temples are like a slice of pomegranate." What is the meaning of "your temples"? Even if they are empty, they should be filled with commandments like a pomegranate.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה זֵיתִים בַּחֲלוֹם, זוּטְרֵי — פָּרֵי וְרָבֵי וְקָאֵי עִסְקֵיהּ כְּזֵיתִים. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי פֵּרֵי, אֲבָל אִילָנֵי — הָוְיִין לֵיהּ בָּנִים מְרוּבִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּנֶיךָ כִּשְׁתִלֵי זֵיתִים וְגוֹ׳״. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי הָרוֹאֶה זַיִת בַּחֲלוֹם — שֵׁם טוֹב יוֹצֵא לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זַיִת רַעֲנָן יְפֵה פְרִי תֹאַר קָרָא ה׳ שְׁמֵךְ״. הָרוֹאֶה שֶׁמֶן זַיִת בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לִמְאוֹר תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיִקְחוּ אֵלֶיךָ שֶׁמֶן זַיִת זָךְ״. הָרוֹאֶה תְּמָרִים בַּחֲלוֹם — תַּמּוּ עֲוֹנוֹתָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תַּם עֲוֹנֵךְ בַּת צִיּוֹן״.
human_translation: One who sees olives in a dream, small, his business will flourish, increase and be durable like olives. this applies only fruit but, trees, he will have many children, as it is stated: “Your children like olive plants, Some say that one who sees an olive tree in a dream, a good reputation will spread for him, as it is stated: a leafy olive tree, fair with goodly fruit” One who sees olive oil in a dream should anticipate the light of Torah, as it is stated: “That they bring unto you pure olive oil One who sees palm trees [ temarim ] in a dream his transgressions have ceased, as it is stated: “Your iniquity is finished, O daughter of Zion”
llm_translation: One who sees olives in a dream, this is a good sign - he will have offspring and his business will prosper like olives. And these are the words of fruit, but trees - they will have many children, as it is stated: "Your children are like olive plants, etc." Some say, one who sees an olive in a dream - a good name will be given to him, as it is stated: "A fresh olive tree, beautiful in fruit and form, the Lord called your name." One who sees olive oil in a dream - he will merit the light of Torah, as it is stated: "And they shall take for you pure olive oil." One who sees dates in a dream - his sins will be consumed, as it is stated: "Your iniquity is consumed, O daughter of Zion."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, הָרוֹאֶה עֵז בַּחֲלוֹם — שָׁנָה מִתְבָּרֶכֶת לוֹ, עִזִּים — שָׁנִים מִתְבָּרְכוֹת לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדֵי חֲלֵב עִזִּים לְלַחְמְךָ״. הָרוֹאֶה הֲדַס בַּחֲלוֹם — נְכָסָיו מַצְלִיחִין לוֹ. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ נְכָסִים — יְרוּשָּׁה נוֹפֶלֶת לוֹ מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר. אָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: וְהוּא דַּחֲזָא בְּכַנַּיְיהוּ. הָרוֹאֶה אֶתְרוֹג בַּחֲלוֹם — הָדוּר הוּא לִפְנֵי קוֹנוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פְּרִי עֵץ הָדָר כַּפֹּת תְּמָרִים״. הָרוֹאֶה לוּלָב בַּחֲלוֹם — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא לֵב אֶחָד לְאָבִיו שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: One who sees a goat in a dream, his year will be blessed; goats, his years will be blessed, as it is stated: “And there will be goats’ milk enough for your food, One who sees myrtle in a dream, his property will be successful. And if he does not property, he will receive an inheritance. Ulla said, and some say it was taught in a baraita : This where he saw on their stem. One who sees a citron [ etrog ] in a dream he is honored [ hadur ] before his Creator, as it is stated “The fruit of goodly trees [ hadar ], branches of palm trees” One who sees a palm branch [ lulav ] in a dream, he has but one heart for his Father in heaven.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, "One who sees a goat in a dream - he will have a blessed year, goats - two blessings for him, as it is said: 'And the curds of the goats for your food.' One who sees myrtle in a dream - his possessions will prosper for him. And if he has no possessions - an inheritance falls to him from elsewhere. Ulla said, and some say it was taught in a baraita: 'And he saw in their nests.' One who sees an etrog in a dream - it is glorious before its Creator, as it is said: 'The fruit of a splendid tree, palm branches.' One who sees a lulav in a dream - he has only one heart to his Father in heaven."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה אַוּוֹז בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חׇכְמוֹת בַּחוּץ תָּרֹנָּה״. וְהַבָּא עָלֶיהָ הָוֵי רֹאשׁ יְשִׁיבָה. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ, וּבָאתִי עָלֶיהָ, וּסְלֵקִית לִגְדוּלָּה.
human_translation: One who sees a goose in a dream should anticipate wisdom, as it is stated: “Wisdoms cry aloud in the streets, he has relations with will become head of the yeshiva. Rav Ashi said: I saw had relations with it and I ascended to greatness
llm_translation: One who sees a goose in a dream - should anticipate wisdom, as it is said: "Wisdom calls out in the streets." And one who attains it should be appointed as the head of the academy. Rav Ashe said: I saw it, I attained it, and I elevated it to greatness.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה תַּרְנְגוֹל בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לְבֵן זָכָר. תַּרְנְגוֹלִים — יְצַפֶּה לְבָנִים זְכָרִים. תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת — יְצַפֶּה לְתַרְבִּיצָה נָאָה וְגִילָה. הָרוֹאֶה בֵּיצִים בַּחֲלוֹם — תְּלוּיָה בַּקָּשָׁתוֹ. נִשְׁתַּבְּרוּ — נַעֲשֵׂית בַּקָּשָׁתוֹ. וְכֵן אֱגוֹזִים, וְכֵן קִשּׁוּאִים, וְכֵן כׇּל כְּלֵי זְכוּכִית, וְכֵן כׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּרִים כָּאֵלּוּ.
human_translation: One who sees a rooster in a dream a male child. roosters should expect male children. a hen [ tarnegolet ] should anticipate a beautiful garden and rejoice [ tarbitza na’a vegila ], One who sees eggs in a dream, his request is pending, broke, his request granted, The same is true of nuts, and the same is true of cucumbers, and the same is true of all glass vessels, and the same is true of anything similarly fragile
llm_translation: One who sees a rooster in a dream - he should anticipate a male child. Roosters - he should anticipate male children. A hen - he should anticipate a beautiful and revealed attire. One who sees eggs in a dream - it depends on his request. If they are broken - his request is fulfilled. The same applies to nuts, and the same applies to cucumbers, and the same applies to all vessels of glass, and the same applies to all that are broken like these.

hebrew_text: הַנִּכְנָס לַכְּרַךְ — נַעֲשׂוּ לוֹ חֲפָצָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּנְחֵם אֶל מְחוֹז חֶפְצָם״. הַמְגַלֵּחַ רֹאשׁוֹ בַּחֲלוֹם — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ. רֹאשׁוֹ וּזְקָנוֹ — לוֹ וּלְכׇל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ.
human_translation: One he entered a city, his desires will be fulfilled, as it is stated: “And He led them unto their desired haven” One who shaves his head in a dream, it is a good omen for him, shaved his head and his beard for him and his entire family.
llm_translation: One who enters the bathhouse - his desires are fulfilled for him, as it is stated: "And He comforted them according to their desires" (Psalms 106:15). One who shaves his head in a dream - it is a good sign for him. His head and his beard - for him and for all his family.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹשֵׁב בַּעֲרֵיבָה קְטַנָּה — שֵׁם טוֹב יוֹצֵא לוֹ. בַּעֲרֵיבָה גְּדוֹלָה — לוֹ וּלְכׇל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּמִדַּלְיָה דַּלּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: One who sits in a small boat a good reputation will spread for him. in a large boat a good reputation will spread for him and his entire family. this only applies the boat was floating high
llm_translation: One who dwells in a small city - a good name comes to him. In a large city - to him and to all his family. And these are the words of the exalted who are humble.

hebrew_text: הַנִּפְנֶה בַּחֲלוֹם — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִהַר צֹעֶה לְהִפָּתֵחַ״. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָא קַנַּח.
human_translation: One who defecates it is a good omen for him, as it is stated: “He that is bent down shall speedily be loosed; this only applies he does not wipe
llm_translation: One who turns in a dream - it is a good sign for him, as it is said: "He hastens to open." And these are matters that are not acquired.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹלֶה לַגַּג בַּחֲלוֹם — עוֹלֶה לִגְדוּלָּה. יָרַד — יוֹרֵד מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ. אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה — עָלָה. הַקּוֹרֵעַ בְּגָדָיו בַּחֲלוֹם — קוֹרְעִים לוֹ גְּזַר דִּינוֹ. הָעוֹמֵד עָרוֹם בַּחֲלוֹם, בְּבָבֶל — עוֹמֵד בְּלֹא חֵטְא. בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — עָרוֹם בְּלֹא מִצְוֹת. הַנִּתְפָּס לְסַרְדְּיוֹט — שְׁמִירָה נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ. נְתָנוּהוּ בְּקוֹלָר — הוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ שְׁמִירָה עַל שְׁמִירָתוֹ. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּקוֹלָר, אֲבָל חַבְלָא בְּעָלְמָא — לָא.
human_translation: One who climbs up to the roof in a dream, he will ascend to greatness. he climbed down, will descend from greatness he Abaye and Rava both said: Once one ascended he ascended, One who rips his clothing in a dream, rip up his sentence. One who stands naked in Babylonia in a dream, he stands free of transgression. in Eretz Yisrael, naked without mitzvot. One he was apprehended by a soldier [ sardeyot ], protection was provided him he is wearing a neck chain [ kolar ], they have increased his level of protection. this only applies in a neck chain; if simply a noose, it does not
llm_translation: The one who ascends to the roof in a dream - ascends for greatness. If he descends - he descends from his greatness. Abaye and Rava both say: Once he ascended - he ascended. One who tears his garments in a dream - they decree a harsh decree upon him. One who stands naked in a dream, in Babylonia - stands without sin. In the Land of Israel - naked without commandments. One who is caught for theft - protection is provided for him. If they put a collar on him - they add protection to his protection. And these matters with a collar, but a rope in general - no.

hebrew_text: הַנִּכְנָס לַאֲגַם בַּחֲלוֹם — נַעֲשֶׂה רֹאשׁ יְשִׁיבָה. לְיַעַר — נַעֲשֶׂה רֹאשׁ לִבְנֵי כַלָּה.
human_translation: One who enters a marsh in a dream, he will become head of a yeshiva, a forest will be made head of the advanced students [ kalla ],
llm_translation: If one enters a lake in a dream - he will become the head of a yeshiva. If one enters a forest - he will become the head for the sons of the bride.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ חֲזוֹ חֶלְמָא: רַב פָּפָּא דְּעָיֵיל לְאַגְמָא — נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ יְשִׁיבָה. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּעָיֵיל לְיַעַר — נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ לִבְנֵי כַּלָּה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ לְאַגְמָא עָיְילִי, אֶלָּא רַב פָּפָּא דִּתְלֵי טַבְלָא — נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ יְשִׁיבָה, רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּלָא תְּלֵי טַבְלָא — נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ לִבְנֵי כַּלָּה. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנָא עֲיַילִית לְאַגְמָא וּתְלַאי טַבְלָא וְנַבַּחִי בַּהּ נַבּוֹחֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, saw a dream: Rav Pappa, that he entered a marsh was appointed head of a yeshiva. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, that he entered a forest was appointed head of the advanced students. Some say that both of them they entered a marsh, Rav Pappa, that a drum hung was appointed head of the yeshiva, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, did not that a drum hung around was appointed head of the advanced students. Rav Ashi said: I I entered a marsh and hung a drum and beat it,
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, saw a dream: Rav Papa, who went to the marsh - became the head of the yeshiva. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, who went to the forest - became the head of the bridegrooms. Some say they both went to the marsh, but Rav Papa tied a strap - he became the head of the yeshiva, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, who did not tie a strap - became the head of the bridegrooms. Rav Ashi said: I went to the marsh and tied a strap, and I was successful in it.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַמַּקִּיז דָּם בַּחֲלוֹם — עֲוֹנוֹתָיו מְחוּלִין לוֹ.
human_translation: tanna before Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak taught: One who lets blood in a dream, his transgressions have been forgiven,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "One who spits blood in a dream - his sins are forgiven for him."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: עֲוֹנוֹתָיו סְדוּרִין לוֹ! מַאי סְדוּרִין — סְדוּרִין לִימָּחֵל.
human_translation: Was it not taught his transgressions are enumerated before him? What enumerated? enumerated to be forgiven.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "His sins are arranged for him!" What is meant by "arranged"? Arranged for him to be forgiven.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָרוֹאֶה נָחָשׁ בַּחֲלוֹם פַּרְנָסָתוֹ מְזוּמֶּנֶת לוֹ. נְשָׁכוֹ — נִכְפְּלָה לוֹ. הֲרָגוֹ — אָבְדָה פַּרְנָסָתוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁנִּכְפְּלָה פַּרְנָסָתוֹ. וְלָא הִיא, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת הוּא דַּחֲזָא חִוְיָא בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ וְקַטְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: tanna before Rav Sheshet taught: One who sees a snake in a dream, his livelihood is accessible to him bit him will double. he killed he will lose his livelihood. Rav Sheshet said to all the more so his livelihood will double. But that is not so. Rav Sheshet saw a snake in his dream and killed it,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: One who sees a snake in a dream, his sustenance is designated for him. If it bit him - his sustenance is doubled for him. If he killed it - his sustenance is lost. Rav Sheshet said to him: All the more so if his sustenance is doubled. But it is not so, for Rav Sheshet saw a snake in his dream and killed it.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מִינֵי מַשְׁקִין יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם חוּץ מִן הַיַּיִן, יֵשׁ שׁוֹתֵהוּ וְטוֹב לוֹ, וְיֵשׁ שׁוֹתֵהוּ וְרַע לוֹ. יֵשׁ שׁוֹתֵהוּ וְטוֹב לוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַיִן יְשַׂמַּח לְבַב אֱנוֹשׁ״, וְיֵשׁ שׁוֹתֵהוּ וְרַע לוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּנוּ שֵׁכָר לְאוֹבֵד וְיַיִן לְמָרֵי נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: tanna before Rabbi Yoḥanan taught: One who sees any kind of drink in a dream it is good except for wine, there is who drinks it and it is good for him, and there is who drinks it and it is bad for him. There is who drinks and it is good for him, as it is stated: “And wine that makes glad the heart of man” and there is who drinks it and it is bad for him, as it is stated: “Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish and wine unto the bitter in soul”
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rabbi Yochanan: All types of beverages are good for a dream except for wine. Some drink it and it is good for them, and some drink it and it is bad for them. Some drink it and it is good for them - as it is stated: "And wine gladdens the heart of man." And some drink it and it is bad for them - as it is stated: "Give strong drink to him who is perishing, and wine to those in bitter distress."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְתַנָּא: תְּנִי: תַּלְמִיד חָכָם לְעוֹלָם טוֹב לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְכוּ לַחֲמוּ בְלַחֲמִי וּשְׁתוּ בְּיַיִן מָסָכְתִּי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to the tanna: teach a Torah scholar, always good as it is stated: “Come, eat of my bread and drink of the wine which I have mingled”
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan to the Tanna: Teach: A Torah scholar is always good for him, as it is said: "Go, eat your bread with joy, and drink your wine with a merry heart."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִשְׁכִּים וְנָפַל פָּסוּק לְתוֹךְ פִּיו — הֲרֵי זֶה נְבוּאָה קְטַנָּה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים הֵם: הָרוֹאֶה דָּוִד בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לַחֲסִידוּת. שְׁלֹמֹה — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה. אַחְאָב — יִדְאַג מִן הַפּוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who awakened a verse falls into his mouth, a minor prophecy. The Sages taught: There are three kings One who sees David in a dream should expect piety; Solomon should expect wisdom; Ahab should be concerned about calamity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: If one wakes up and a verse falls into his mouth - this is a minor prophecy. The Rabbis taught: There are three types of kings: one who sees David in a dream - he can expect piety. Solomon - he can expect wisdom. Ahab - he should worry about retribution.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה נְבִיאִים הֵם: הָרוֹאֶה סֵפֶר מְלָכִים — יְצַפֶּה לִגְדוּלָּה. יְחֶזְקֵאל — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה. יְשַׁעְיָה — יְצַפֶּה לְנֶחָמָה. יִרְמְיָה — יִדְאַג מִן הַפּוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: three books of Prophets One who sees the book of Kings should anticipate greatness, Ezekiel should anticipate wisdom, Isaiah should anticipate consolation; Jeremiah should be concerned about calamity,
llm_translation: Three prophets they are: the one who sees the book of Kings - he looks forward to greatness. Ezekiel - he looks forward to wisdom. Isaiah - he looks forward to comfort. Jeremiah - he worries about retribution.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּתוּבִים גְּדוֹלִים הֵם: הָרוֹאֶה סֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים — יְצַפֶּה לַחֲסִידוּת, מִשְׁלֵי — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה, אִיּוֹב — יִדְאַג מִן הַפּוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: three great Writings One who sees the book of Psalms should anticipate piety; Proverbs should anticipate wisdom; Job should be concerned about calamity.
llm_translation: Three written scriptures are great: one who sees the book of Psalms - he should anticipate piety, Proverbs - he should anticipate wisdom, Job - he should be concerned about punishment.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּתוּבִים קְטַנִּים הֵם: הָרוֹאֶה שִׁיר הַשִּׁירִים בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לַחֲסִידוּת. קֹהֶלֶת — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה. קִינוֹת — יִדְאַג מִן הַפּוּרְעָנוּת. הָרוֹאֶה מְגִלַּת אֶסְתֵּר — נֵס נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ.
human_translation: There are three minor Writings One who sees Song of Songs in a dream should anticipate piety, Ecclesiastes should anticipate wisdom; Lamentations should be concerned about calamity; one who sees the scroll of Esther, a miracle will be performed on his behalf.
llm_translation: Three small books they are written: Song of Songs - one who sees in a dream - will anticipate piety. Ecclesiastes - will anticipate wisdom. Lamentations - will worry about retribution. One who sees the Scroll of Esther - a miracle has been done for him.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲכָמִים הֵם: הָרוֹאֶה רַבִּי בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה — יְצַפֶּה לַעֲשִׁירוּת. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע — יִדְאַג מִן הַפּוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: There are three Sages One who sees Rabbi in a dream should anticipate wisdom; Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya should anticipate wealth, Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha should be concerned about calamity,
llm_translation: Three sages they are: The one who sees, Rabbi in a dream - he will look forward to wisdom. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah - he will look forward to wealth. Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha - he will be concerned about poverty.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הֵם: הָרוֹאֶה בֶּן עַזַּאי בַּחֲלוֹם — יְצַפֶּה לַחֲסִידוּת. בֶּן זוֹמָא — יְצַפֶּה לְחׇכְמָה. אַחֵר — יִדְאַג מִן הַפּוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: three Torah scholars One who sees Ben Azzai in a dream should anticipate piety; Ben Zoma should anticipate wisdom; Aḥer , should be concerned about calamity,
llm_translation: Three students of the sages they are: The one who sees Ben Azzai in a dream - he should anticipate piety. Ben Zoma - he should anticipate wisdom. Another - he should be concerned about punishment.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִינֵי חַיּוֹת יָפוֹת לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מִן הַפִּיל וְהַקּוֹף וְהַקִּפּוֹד. וְהָאָמַר מָר, הָרוֹאֶה פִּיל בַּחֲלוֹם פֶּלֶא נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דִּמְסָרַג, הָא דְּלָא מְסָרַג.
human_translation: All types of animals are auspicious for a dream except for an elephant, a monkey and a long-tailed ape. Didn’t the Master say: A miracle will be performed for one who sees an elephant in a dream? not difficult. This where it is saddled, this where it is not saddled.
llm_translation: All kinds of animals are beautiful in a dream, except for the elephant, monkey, and porcupine. And Mar said, "One who sees an elephant in a dream, a miracle is done for him!" It is not difficult, this one that has a trunk, this one that does not have a trunk.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִינֵי מַתֶּכֶת יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מִמָּר, פְּסָל, וְקַרְדּוֹם. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דַּחֲזַנְהוּ בְּקַתַּיְיהוּ. כׇּל מִינֵי פֵּירוֹת יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מִפַּגֵּי תְמָרָה. כׇּל מִינֵי יְרָקוֹת יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מֵרָאשֵׁי לְפָתוֹת. וְהָאָמַר רַב: לָא אִיעַתַּרִי עַד דַּחֲזַאי רָאשַׁי לְפָתוֹת! כִּי חֲזָא — בְּכַנַּיְיהוּ חֲזָא. כׇּל מִינֵי צִבְעוֹנִין יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מִן הַתְּכֵלֶת. כׇּל מִינֵי עוֹפוֹת יָפִין לַחֲלוֹם, חוּץ מִן קַרְיָא וְקִפּוֹפָא וְקוּרְפְּרַאי.
human_translation: All types of metal are auspicious for a dream, except for a hoe, a chisel, and an axe, this applies when they are seen on their handles. All kinds of fruit are auspicious for a dream except for unripe dates. All kinds of vegetables are auspicious for a dream except for turnip heads. Didn’t Rav say: I did not become wealthy until I saw turnip heads When Rav saw he saw them on their stems; all kinds of colors are auspicious for a dream, except for sky-blue [ tekhelet ]. All kinds of birds are auspicious except for an eagle-owl, and an owl, and a kurferai,
llm_translation: All types of metal are good for a dream, except for iron, copper, and lead. And these matters were seen in a dream. All types of fruits are good for a dream, except for dates. All types of vegetables are good for a dream, except for cabbage heads. And Rav said: I did not become great until I saw cabbage heads! For when he saw them, he became great. All types of dyes are good for a dream, except for sky-blue. All types of birds are good for a dream, except for the crow, owl, and raven.

hebrew_text: (הַגּוּף, הַגּוּף, מֵעֵין, מְשִׁיבִין, וּמַרְחִיבִין, סִימָן).
human_translation: The body, the body, microcosm, ease, comfort mnemonics
llm_translation: The body, the body, from the eye, they respond and expand, a sign.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה נִכְנָסִין לַגּוּף, וְאֵין הַגּוּף נֶהֱנֶה מֵהֶן: גּוּדְגְּדָנִיּוֹת, וְכַפְנִיּוֹת, וּפַגֵּי תְמָרָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין נִכְנָסִין לַגּוּף, וְהַגּוּף נֶהֱנֶה מֵהֶן, אֵלּוּ הֵן: רְחִיצָה, וְסִיכָה, וְתַשְׁמִישׁ. שְׁלֹשָׁה מֵעֵין הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, אֵלּוּ הֵן: שַׁבָּת, שֶׁמֶשׁ, וְתַשְׁמִישׁ.
human_translation: Three enter the body the body does not benefit from them: Cherries, bad dates, and unripe dates. Three do not enter the body the body benefits from them, and they are: Washing, anointing, and usage [ tashmish ], Three are microcosms of the World-to-Come, and they are: Sabbath, the sun and usage.
llm_translation: Three enter the body, and the body does not benefit from them: gnats, midges, and palm fibers. Three do not enter the body, and the body benefits from them: washing, anointing, and marital relations. Three are like the World to Come: Sabbath, sunlight, and marital relations.

hebrew_text: תַּשְׁמִישׁ דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא תַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה — הָא מִכְחָשׁ כָּחֵישׁ! אֶלָּא תַּשְׁמִישׁ נְקָבִים.
human_translation: Usage of what If you say conjugal relations, doesn’t that weaken Rather, usage of his orifices,
llm_translation: The use of what? If you say the use of the bed - that is a weak argument! Rather, the use of women.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מְשִׁיבִין דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: קוֹל, וּמַרְאֶה, וָרֵיחַ. שְׁלֹשָׁה מַרְחִיבִין דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: דִּירָה נָאָה, וְאִשָּׁה נָאָה, וְכֵלִים נָאִים.
human_translation: Three ease one’s mind, and they are: Voice, sight, and smell, Three give a person comfort, and they are: A beautiful abode, a beautiful wife, and beautiful vessels.
llm_translation: Three expand the mind of a person, these are: sound, sight, and smell. Three broaden the mind of a person, these are: a beautiful dwelling, a beautiful wife, and fine utensils.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁשָּׁה וַעֲשָׂרָה סִימָן: חֲמִשָּׁה אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים, אֵלּוּ הֵן: אֵשׁ, דְּבַשׁ, וְשַׁבָּת, וְשֵׁינָה, וַחֲלוֹם. אֵשׁ — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לְגֵיהִנָּם. דְּבַשׁ — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לַמָּן. שַׁבָּת — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. שֵׁינָה — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לַמִּיתָה. חֲלוֹם — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לַנְּבוּאָה.
human_translation: five, six, and ten are mnemonics five one-sixtieth They are: Fire, honey, Shabbat, sleep, and a dream. fire one-sixtieth of Gehenna; honey is one-sixtieth of manna; Shabbat is one-sixtieth of the World-to-Come; sleep is one-sixtieth of death; a dream is one-sixtieth of prophecy.
llm_translation: Five, six, and ten signs: Five, one of sixty, these are: fire, honey, Sabbath, sleep, and dream. Fire - one of sixty to Gehinnom. Honey - one of sixty for the manna. Sabbath - one of sixty for the World to Come. Sleep - one of sixty for death. Dream - one of sixty for prophecy.

hebrew_text: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים סִימָן יָפֶה לַחוֹלֶה, אֵלּוּ הֵן: עִטּוּשׁ, זֵיעָה, שִׁלְשׁוּל, קֶרִי, וְשֵׁינָה, וַחֲלוֹם. עִטּוּשׁ — דִּכְתִיב: ״עֲטִישׁוֹתָיו תָּהֵל אוֹר״. זֵיעָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּזֵעַת אַפֶּיךָ תֹּאכַל לֶחֶם״. שִׁלְשׁוּל — דִּכְתִיב: ״מִהַר צֹעֶה לְהִפָּתֵחַ וְלֹא יָמוּת לַשַּׁחַת״. קֶרִי — דִּכְתִיב: ״יִרְאֶה זֶרַע יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים״. שֵׁינָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״יָשַׁנְתִּי אָז יָנוּחַ לִי״. חֲלוֹם — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְתַחֲלִימֵנִי וְהַחֲיֵנִי״.
human_translation: Six matters are good omens for the sick: Sneezing, sweating, diarrhea, a seminal emission, sleep, and a dream. Sneezing, as it is written: “His sneezes flash forth light” Sweat, as it is written: “In the sweat of your face shall you eat bread” Diarrhea, as it is written: “He that is bent down shall speedily be loosed; and he shall not go down dying into the pit” A seminal emission, as it is written: “That he might see his seed, prolong his days” Sleep, as it is written: “I should have slept; then had I been at rest” A dream, as it is written: “Wherefore You recover me [ vataḥalimeni ], and make me to live”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Six things are a good sign for a sick person, these are they: sneezing, perspiration, bowel movement, seminal emission, sleep, and a dream. Sneezing - as it is written: "His sneezes flash forth light." Perspiration - as it is written: "By the sweat of your brow you shall eat bread." Bowel movement - as it is written: "He hastens to open and will not die to the pit." Seminal emission - as it is written: "He will see offspring and live long days." Sleep - as it is written: "I slept; then I rested." Dream - as it is written: "And You will dream about me and give me life."

hebrew_text: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים מְרַפְּאִין אֶת הַחוֹלֶה מֵחׇלְיוֹ וּרְפוּאָתוֹ רְפוּאָה, אֵלּוּ הֵן: כְּרוּב, וּתְרָדִין, וְסִיסִין יְבֵשִׁין, וְקֵיבָה, וְהֶרֶת, וְיוֹתֶרֶת הַכָּבֵד. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף דָּגִים קְטַנִּים. וְלָא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁדָּגִים קְטַנִּים מַפְרִין וּמַבְרִין כׇּל גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם.
human_translation: Six matters cure a sick person from his illness, and their cure is cure. They are: Cabbage, beets, dried foley, the stomach, the placenta, and the diaphragm Some say small fish Furthermore, small fish cause one’s entire body to flourish and become healthy.
llm_translation: Six things heal the sick from his illness, and the healing is a complete healing. These are they: Carob, and Fenugreek, and Egyptian Thorn, and Liver, and Harith, and the excess of the liver. And some say: Also small fish. And not only that, but small fish break down and cleanse the entire body of a person.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים מַחֲזִירִין אֶת הַחוֹלֶה לְחׇלְיוֹ, וְחׇלְיוֹ קָשֶׁה, אֵלּוּ הֵן: הָאוֹכֵל בְּשַׂר שׁוֹר, בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן, בְּשַׂר צָלִי, בְּשַׂר צִפֳּרִים, וּבֵיצָה צְלוּיָה, וְתִגְלַחַת, וְשַׁחֲלַיִם, וְהֶחָלָב, וְהַגְּבִינָה וְהַמֶּרְחָץ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים אַף אֱגוֹזִים. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים אַף קִשּׁוּאִים.
human_translation: there are ten matters that relapse of his illness, and his illness is severe, and they are: ox meat, fatty meat roasted meat, poultry, a roasted egg, shaving, cress, milk, cheese, and bathhouse. And some say nuts, and some say even cucumbers.
llm_translation: Ten things bring back the sick to his illness, and his illness is severe, these are they: one who eats the flesh of an ox, fatty meat, roasted meat, poultry meat, a roasted egg, shaving, cupping, milk, cheese, and bathing. And some say also nuts. And some say also gourds.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן קִשּׁוּאִים — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן קָשִׁין לַגּוּף כַּחֲרָבוֹת. אִינִי, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ לָהּ שְׁנֵי גוֹיִם בְּבִטְנֵךְ״: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״גּוֹיִם״ אֶלָּא ״גֵּיִים״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֵלּוּ אַנְטוֹנִינוּס וְרַבִּי, שֶׁלֹּא פָּסַק מִשֻּׁלְחָנָם לֹא צְנוֹן וְלֹא חֲזֶרֶת וְלֹא קִשּׁוּאִין, לֹא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה וְלֹא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: taught school of Rabbi Yishmael: Why are they called cucumbers [ kishu’im ]? Because they are as harmful [ kashim ] to the body as swords. Is that really so? Is it not written: “And the Lord said unto her: Two nations [ goyim ] are in your womb” Do not read goyim , rather gayim , proud ones. And Rav Yehuda said Rav said: these Antoninus and Rabbi whose tables, never lacked for radish, lettuce or cucumbers, neither in summer nor in the rainy season.
llm_translation: The Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Why is it called kishuim oil? Because they are hard on the body like swords. Is it not so? But it is written: "And the Lord said to her, 'Two nations are in your womb.'" Do not read "nations" but rather "goyim" (bodies), and Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: These are Antoninus and Rabbi, who did not cease from their table neither with onions nor leeks nor kishuim, neither in the days of the sun nor in the days of rain.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּרַבְרְבֵי, הָא בְּזוּטְרֵי.
human_translation: not difficult. This to large ones, this to small ones.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in Rabravei, this in Zutrrei.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵת בַּבַּיִת — שָׁלוֹם בַּבַּיִת. אָכַל וְשָׁתָה בַּבַּיִת — סִימָן יָפֶה לַבַּיִת. נָטַל כֵּלִים מִן הַבַּיִת — סִימָן רַע לַבַּיִת. תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב פָּפָּא בִּמְסָאנָא וְסַנְדָּלָא. כֹּל דְּשָׁקֵיל שָׁכְבָא — מְעַלֵּי, בַּר מִמְּסָאנָא וְסַנְדָּלָא. כׇּל דְּיָהֵיב שָׁכְבָא — מְעַלֵּי, בַּר מֵעַפְרָא וְחַרְדְּלָא.
human_translation: the Sages taught: a corpse in his house, peace in his house. ate and drank in the house, it is good omen for the house. removed vessels from the house, is a bad omen for the house, Rav Pappa explained with regard to a shoe and a sandal, Everything a corpse takes good except a shoe and a sandal; everything that a corpse gives good except dust and mustard,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one dies in the house — peace in the house. If one eats and drinks in the house — a good sign for the house. If one removes utensils from the house — a bad sign for the house. Rav Papa translated it in Masa'na and Sandala: Whoever takes off his shoes, he should be elevated, son of Masa'na and Sandala. Whoever gives his shoes, he should be elevated, son of Afra and Hardela.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרָה מִמֶּנּוּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה מַרְקוּלִיס, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁנָּתַן אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לְעוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ״. מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרָה מִמֶּנּוּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁעָקַר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה מֵאַרְצֵנוּ. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרָה מִמָּקוֹם זֶה כֵּן תֵּעָקֵר מִכׇּל מְקוֹמוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָשֵׁב לֵב עוֹבְדֵיהֶם לְעׇבְדֶךָ״. וּבְחוּץ לָאָרֶץ אֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״וְהָשֵׁב לֵב עוֹבְדֵיהֶם לְעׇבְדֶךָ״ מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוּבָּהּ גּוֹיִים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר כֵּן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֲתִידִים לְהִתְגַּיֵּיר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָז אֶהְפֹּךְ אֶל עַמִּים שָׂפָה בְרוּרָה״.
