human_translation: a place from which idolatry was eradicated the Sages taught One who sees Mercury [ Markulis ] recites: Blessed…who has shown patience to those who violate His will, a place from which idolatry was eradicated should recite: Blessed…Who eradicated idolatry from our land. And just as it was eradicated from this place, so too may it be eradicated from all places of Israel, and restore the hearts of their worshippers to worship You. Outside of Eretz one need not recite: And restore the hearts of their worshippers to worship You, since it is predominantly populated by gentiles. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even outside of Eretz one is required to recite that because will convert, as it is stated: “For then will I turn to the peoples a pure language,
llm_translation: Place that was uprooted from it foreign worship. The Rabbis taught: One who sees a marculis, he says: "Blessed is He ... who gave long patience to those who transgress His will." Place that was uprooted from it foreign worship, he says: "Blessed is He ... who uprooted foreign worship from our land. And just as it was uprooted from this place, so may it be uprooted from all the places of Israel, and turn the hearts of its worshippers to Your service." And outside the land, there is no need to say "and turn the hearts of its worshippers to Your service" because most of them are gentiles. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even outside the land, one must say the same, because they are destined to convert, as it is said: "Then I will turn to the peoples a pure language."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הָרוֹאֶה בָּבֶל הָרְשָׁעָה צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ חָמֵשׁ בְּרָכוֹת. רָאָה בָּבֶל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁהֶחֱרִיב בָּבֶל הָרְשָׁעָה״. רָאָה בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁהֶחֱרִיב בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע״. רָאָה גּוֹב שֶׁל אֲרָיוֹת אוֹ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁעָשָׂה נִסִּים לַאֲבוֹתֵינוּ בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״. רָאָה מַרְקוּלִיס, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁנָּתַן אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לְעוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ״. רָאָה מָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין מִמֶּנּוּ עָפָר, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … אוֹמֵר וְעוֹשֶׂה גּוֹזֵר וּמְקַיֵּים״.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna taught: One who sees the wicked Babylonia must recite five blessings. One who saw Babylonia, recites: Blessed…Who destroyed the wicked Babylonia. One who saw Nebuchadnezzar’s house, recites: Blessed…Who destroyed the house of wicked Nebuchadnezzar. One who saw the lion’s den or the furnace were thrown recites: Blessed…Who performed miracles for our ancestors in this place. One who saw Mercury, recites: Blessed…Who has shown patience to those who violate His will. One who saw a place from which earth is taken, recites: Blessed…Who speaks and acts, decrees and fulfills.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna expounded: One who sees Babylon the wicked should recite five blessings. He saw Babylon, he says: "Blessed is He... Who destroyed Babylon the wicked." He saw the house of Nebuchadnezzar, he says: "Blessed is He... Who destroyed the house of Nebuchadnezzar the wicked." He saw a lion's den or a fiery furnace, he says: "Blessed is He... Who performed miracles for our ancestors in this place." He saw Markulis, he says: "Blessed is He... Who grants patience to those who transgress His will." He saw a place from which dust is taken, he says: "Blessed is He... Who speaks and does, decrees and fulfills."

hebrew_text: רָבָא כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי חֲמָרֵי דְּשָׁקְלִי עַפְרָא, טָרֵיף לְהוּ יְדָא עַל גַּבַּיְיהוּ, וְאָמַר: רְהוּטוּ צַדִּיקֵי לְמֶעְבַּד רְעוּתָא דְמָרַיְיכוּ. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא כִּי הֲוָה מָטֵי לְבָבֶל הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל עַפְרָא בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ וְשָׁדֵי לְבַרָּא, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְטֵאטֵאתִיהָ בְּמַטְאֲטֵא הַשְׁמֵד״. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנָא, הָא דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתַּאי בָּרֵיכְתִּינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: when Rava would see donkeys carrying earth he would slap their backs with his hand and say Run, righteous ones, and fulfill the will of your Master. When Mar, son of Ravina, would arrive in Babylonia he would take earth in his kerchief and throw it outside, to fulfill that which is said: “And I will sweep it with the broom of destruction” Rav Ashi said: I never heard the Rav Hamnuna, However, based on my independent reasoning, I recited all of the blessings.
llm_translation: Rava, when he would see donkeys carrying dirt, would tear his garment on their account and say: "The righteous are in distress to fulfill the will of their Creator." Mar, son of Ravina, when he would go to Babylon, would take dirt in his cloak and scatter it behind him, in order to fulfill what is said, "And I will scatter it as with a scattering wind." Rav Ashi said: "As for me, what Rav Hamnuna said did not please me, but from my knowledge I have reconciled them all."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: נִתְקַלְּלָה בָּבֶל — נִתְקַלְּלוּ שְׁכֵנֶיהָ. נִתְקַלְּלָה שׁוֹמְרוֹן — נִתְבָּרְכוּ שְׁכֵנֶיהָ: נִתְקַלְּלָה בָּבֶל — נִתְקַלְּלוּ שְׁכֵנֶיהָ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂמְתִּיהָ לְמוֹרַשׁ קִפֹּד וְאַגְמֵי מָיִם״. נִתְקַלְּלָה שׁוֹמְרוֹן נִתְבָּרְכוּ שְׁכֵנֶיהָ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי שֹׁמְרוֹן לְעִי הַשָּׂדֶה לְמַטָּעֵי כָרֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Babylonia was cursed, its neighbors were cursed Samaria was cursed, its neighbors were blessed. Babylonia was cursed its neighbors were cursed as it is written: “I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water” Samaria was cursed, its neighbors were blessed, as it is written: “Therefore I will make Samaria a heap in the field, a place for the planting of vineyards”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah ben Elazar said: Babylon was cursed — its neighbors were cursed. Samaria was cursed — its neighbors were blessed. Babylon was cursed — its neighbors were cursed, as it is written: "And I will make it a possession for the hedgehog and pools of water." Samaria was cursed, its neighbors were blessed — as it is written: "And I will set up Samaria as a heap in the field, a place for planting vineyards."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הָרוֹאֶה אוּכְלוּסֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … חֲכַם הָרָזִים״. אוּכְלוּסֵי גּוֹיִם, אוֹמֵר: ״בּוֹשָׁה אִמְּכֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said: One who sees multitudes of Israel, recites: Blessed…Who knows all secrets. multitudes of gentiles recites: “Your mother shall be sore ashamed,
llm_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said: One who sees a gathering of Israelites, he says, "Blessed is the wise... the knower of secrets." If he sees a gathering of non-Jews, he says, "Shame on your mother..." and so forth.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה אוּכְלוּסֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … חֲכַם הָרָזִים״ — שֶׁאֵין דַּעְתָּם דּוֹמָה זֶה לָזֶה, וְאֵין פַּרְצוּפֵיהֶן דּוֹמִים זֶה לָזֶה. בֶּן זוֹמָא רָאָה אוּכְלוּסָא עַל גַּב מַעֲלָה בְּהַר הַבַּיִת, אָמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ … חֲכַם הָרָזִים וּבָרוּךְ … שֶׁבָּרָא כׇּל אֵלּוּ לְשַׁמְּשֵׁנִי״.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who sees multitudes of Israel recites: Blessed…Who knows all secrets. whose minds are unlike each other and whose faces are unlike each other, Ben Zoma once saw a multitude [ okhlosa ] of Israel on a stair on the Temple Mount. recited: Blessed…Who knows all secrets and Blessed…Who created all these to serve me.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees a crowd of Israelites says, "Blessed is the... Wise of secrets" — for their minds are not similar to one another, and their appearances are not similar to one another. Ben Zoma saw a crowd on the upper step of the Temple Mount, he said: "Blessed is the... Wise of secrets, and blessed is... who created all these to serve me."

hebrew_text: הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: כַּמָּה יְגִיעוֹת יָגַע אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן עַד שֶׁמָּצָא פַּת לֶאֱכוֹל: חָרַשׁ, וְזָרַע, וְקָצַר, וְעִמֵּר, וְדָשׁ, וְזָרָה, וּבָרַר, וְטָחַן, וְהִרְקִיד, וְלָשׁ, וְאָפָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָכַל. וַאֲנִי מַשְׁכִּים וּמוֹצֵא כׇּל אֵלּוּ מְתוּקָּנִין לְפָנַי. וְכַמָּה יְגִיעוֹת יָגַע אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן עַד שֶׁמָּצָא בֶּגֶד לִלְבּוֹשׁ: גָּזַז, וְלִבֵּן, וְנִפֵּץ, וְטָוָה, וְאָרַג, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מָצָא בֶּגֶד לִלְבּוֹשׁ, וַאֲנִי מַשְׁכִּים וּמוֹצֵא כׇּל אֵלֶּה מְתוּקָּנִים לְפָנַי. כׇּל אוּמּוֹת שׁוֹקְדוֹת וּבָאוֹת לְפֶתַח בֵּיתִי, וַאֲנִי מַשְׁכִּים וּמוֹצֵא כׇּל אֵלּוּ לְפָנַי.
human_translation: he would say: How much effort did Adam the first exert before he found bread to eat: plowed, sowed, reaped, sheaved, threshed, winnowed separated ground sifted, kneaded, and baked and thereafter he ate. And I, wake up and find all of these prepared for me. how much effort did Adam the first exert before he found a garment to wear? sheared, laundered, combed, spun and wove, and thereafter he found a garment to wear. And I, wake up and find all of these prepared for me. all nations, diligently come to the entrance of my home, and I wake up and find all of these before me.
llm_translation: He used to say: How many toils did Adam the first man toil until he found a morsel to eat: he plowed, and sowed, and reaped, and gathered into sheaves, and threshed, and winnowed, and selected, and ground, and sifted, and kneaded, and baked, and only then did he eat. And I arise early and find all these prepared before me. And how many toils did Adam the first man toil until he found a garment to wear: he sheared, and whitened, and combed, and spun, and wove, and only then did he find a garment to wear, and I arise early and find all these prepared before me. All the nations are like a drop in a bucket, and they come to the door of my house, and I arise early and find all these before me.

hebrew_text: הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹרֵחַ טוֹב מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? — כַּמָּה טְרָחוֹת טָרַח בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בִּשְׁבִילִי, כַּמָּה בָּשָׂר הֵבִיא לְפָנַי, כַּמָּה יַיִן הֵבִיא לְפָנַי, כַּמָּה גְּלוּסְקָאוֹת הֵבִיא לְפָנַי, וְכׇל מַה שֶּׁטָּרַח — לֹא טָרַח אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִילִי. אֲבָל אוֹרֵחַ רַע מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? — מַה טּוֹרַח טָרַח בַּעַל הַבַּיִת זֶה? פַּת אַחַת אָכַלְתִּי, חֲתִיכָה אַחַת אָכַלְתִּי, כּוֹס אֶחָד שָׁתִיתִי, כׇּל טוֹרַח שֶׁטָּרַח בַּעַל הַבַּיִת זֶה — לֹא טָרַח אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו.
human_translation: would say: A good guest, what does he say? How much effort did the host expend on my behalf, how much meat did bring before me. How much wine did he bring before me. How many loaves [ geluskaot ] did he bring before me. All the that he expended, he expended only for me. However, a bad guest, what does he say? What effort did the host expend? I ate one bread, I ate one piece of meat I drank one cup All the effort that the home owner expended he only expended on behalf of his wife and children.
llm_translation: He used to say: What does a good guest say? — How many efforts the host has made for me, how much meat he has brought before me, how much wine he has brought before me, how many delicacies he has brought before me, and all that he has exerted — he exerted only for my sake. But what does a bad guest say? — What effort has this host made? I ate one piece of bread, I ate one piece of meat, I drank one cup, all the effort that this host has made — he made only for his wife and children.

hebrew_text: עַל אוֹרֵחַ טוֹב מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? — ״זְכֹר כִּי תַשְׂגִּיא פׇעֳלוֹ אֲשֶׁר שֹׁרְרוּ אֲנָשִׁים״. עַל אוֹרֵחַ רַע כְּתִיב: ״לָכֵן יְרֵאוּהוּ אֲנָשִׁים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: With regard to a good guest, what does he say? “Remember that you magnify his work, whereof men have sung” With regard to a bad guest it is written: “Men do therefore fear him;
llm_translation: On a good path, what does it say? - "Remember that you magnify his work, which men behold." On a bad path it is written: "Therefore men fear him."

hebrew_text: ״וְהָאִישׁ בִּימֵי שָׁאוּל זָקֵן בָּא בַאֲנָשִׁים״. אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב זְבִיד, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: זֶה יִשַׁי אֲבִי דָּוִד שֶׁיָּצָא בְּאוּכְלוּסָא, וְנִכְנַס בְּאוּכְלוּסָא, וְדָרַשׁ בְּאוּכְלוּסָא. אָמַר עוּלָּא: נְקִיטִינַן אֵין אוּכְלוּסָא בְּבָבֶל. תָּנָא: אֵין אוּכְלוּסָא פְּחוּתָה מִשִּׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא.
human_translation: “And the man in the days of Saul was old, and came among men” Rava, and some say Rav Zevid, and some say Rav Oshaya, said: This Yishai, father of David, who went out with multitudes, and entered with multitudes, and taught Torah with multitudes. Ulla said: We hold there is no multitude in Babylonia. taught: A multitude is no fewer than six hundred thousand
llm_translation: "And the man in the days of Saul was old among men." Rava said, and some say Rav Zevid, and some say Rav Oshaya: This is Jesse the father of David who went out to the assembly, and entered the assembly, and expounded in the assembly. Ulla said: We do not take an assembly in Babylon. It was taught: An assembly is not less than sixty myriads.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁחָלַק מֵחׇכְמָתוֹ לִירֵאָיו״. חַכְמֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁנָּתַן מֵחׇכְמָתוֹ לְבָשָׂר וָדָם״. הָרוֹאֶה מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁחָלַק מִכְּבוֹדוֹ לִירֵאָיו״. מַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁנָּתַן מִכְּבוֹדוֹ לְבָשָׂר וָדָם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who sees the Sages of Israel recites: Blessed…Who has shared of His wisdom with those who revere Him. Sages of the nations of the world recites: Blessed…Who has given of His wisdom to flesh and blood. One who sees kings of Israel recites: Blessed…Who has shared of His glory with those who revere Him. kings of the nations of the world recites: Blessed…Who has given of His glory to flesh and blood.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees the sages of Israel, says, "Blessed is He who has imparted of His wisdom to those who fear Him." One who sees the sages of the nations of the world, says, "Blessed is He who has imparted of His wisdom to flesh and blood." One who sees the kings of Israel, says, "Blessed is He who has imparted of His glory to those who fear Him." One who sees the kings of the nations of the world, says, "Blessed is He who has imparted of His glory to flesh and blood."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם יִשְׁתַּדֵּל אָדָם לָרוּץ לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְלֹא לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁאִם יִזְכֶּה — יַבְחִין בֵּין מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One should always strive to run toward kings of Israel And not only toward kings of Israel, but also toward kings of the nations of the world, so that if he will be privileged he will distinguish between the kings of Israel and the kings of the nations of the world.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Always should a person strive to run to meet the kings of Israel. And not only to meet the kings of Israel, but even to meet the kings of the nations of the world, for if he merits it — he will discern between the kings of Israel and the kings of the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת סַגִּי נְהוֹר הֲוָה. הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְקַבּוֹלֵי אַפֵּי מַלְכָּא, וְקָם אֲזַל בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַצְבֵי לְנַהְרָא, כַּגְנֵי לְיָיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּא חֲזִי דְּיָדַעְנָא טְפֵי מִינָּךְ. חֲלַף גּוּנְדָּא קַמַּיְיתָא. כִּי קָא אָוְושָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא: אֲתָא מַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא קָאָתֵי. חֲלַף גּוּנְדָּא תִּנְיָינָא. כִּי קָא אָוְושָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא: הַשְׁתָּא קָא אָתֵי מַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא קָא אָתֵי מַלְכָּא. חָלֵיף תְּלִיתַאי. כִּי קָא שָׁתְקָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וַדַּאי הַשְׁתָּא אָתֵי מַלְכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet was blind. Everyone was going to greet the king and Rav Sheshet stood up and went along with them. This heretic found him said to him: jugs to the river, where do the broken go? said to him: Come see that I know more than you The first troop passed, when the noise grew louder, this heretic said to him: The king is coming. Rav Sheshet said to him: is not coming. The second troop passed, when the noise grew louder, this heretic said to him: Now the king is coming. Rav Sheshet said to him: The king is not coming. The third passed, when there was silence, Rav Sheshet said to him: Certainly now the king is coming.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet Sagai was sitting. They were all going to receive the king's anger, and Rav Sheshet got up among them. He found that heretic, and said to him: "Like a pitcher to the river, or like a garden to the forest?" He said to him: "Come and see that I know more than you." He passed by a reed fence. When he was silent, that heretic said to him: "The king is coming now." Rav Sheshet said to him: "He is not coming." He passed by a fig tree. When he was silent, that heretic said to him: "Now the king is coming." Rav Sheshet said to him: "The king is not coming." He passed by a third thing. When he was silent, Rav Sheshet said to him: "Surely now the king is coming."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא: מְנָא לָךְ הָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּמַלְכוּתָא דְאַרְעָא כְּעֵין מַלְכוּתָא דִרְקִיעָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״צֵא וְעָמַדְתָּ בָהָר לִפְנֵי ה׳ וְהִנֵּה ה׳ עֹבֵר וְרוּחַ גְּדוֹלָה וְחָזָק מְפָרֵק הָרִים וּמְשַׁבֵּר סְלָעִים לִפְנֵי ה׳ לֹא בָרוּחַ ה׳ וְאַחַר הָרוּחַ רַעַשׁ לֹא בָרַעַשׁ ה׳. וְאַחַר הָרַעַשׁ אֵשׁ לֹא בָאֵשׁ ה׳ וְאַחַר הָאֵשׁ קוֹל דְּמָמָה דַקָּה״.
human_translation: This heretic said to him: How do you know this? said to him: Royalty on earth is like royalty in the heavens, as it is written “And He said: Go forth, and stand upon the mount before the Lord. And, behold, the Lord passed by, and a great and strong wind rent the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before the Lord; but the Lord was not in the wind; and after the wind an earthquake; but the Lord was not in the earthquake; and after the earthquake a fire; but the Lord was not in the fire; and after the fire a still small voice.
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic: From where do you derive this? He said to him: The kingdom of the earth is like the kingdom of the sky, as it is written: "Go out and stand on the mountain before the Lord, and behold, the Lord passed by, and a great and strong wind splitting mountains and shattering rocks before the Lord; not in the wind was the Lord, and after the wind an earthquake; not in the earthquake was the Lord. And after the earthquake, fire; not in the fire was the Lord, and after the fire, a still, small voice."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא מַלְכָּא, פָּתַח רַב שֵׁשֶׁת וְקָא מְבָרֵךְ לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא: לְמַאן דְּלָא חָזֵית לֵיהּ קָא מְבָרְכַתְּ? וּמַאי הֲוִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא מִינָא? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: חַבְרוֹהִי כַּחְלִינְהוּ לְעֵינֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת נָתַן עֵינָיו בּוֹ, וְנַעֲשָׂה גַּל שֶׁל עֲצָמוֹת.
human_translation: When the king came, Rav Sheshet began to bless him. The heretic said to him: Do you bless someone you do not see? And what ultimately happened to this heretic? Some say his friends gouged out his eyes, and some say Rav Sheshet fixed his gaze upon him, and became a pile of bones.
llm_translation: When the king arrived, Rav Sheshet began and was blessing him. That heretic said to him: For whom are you blessing him that you do not see him? What is the reason that that heretic was on him? Some say: His friends blinded him in his eyes, and some say: Rav Sheshet gazed at him, and a heap of bones was made.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שֵׁילָא נַגְּדֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּבְעַל גּוֹיָה. אֲזַל אֲכַל בֵּיהּ קוּרְצֵי בֵּי מַלְכָּא, אֲמַר: אִיכָּא חַד גַּבְרָא בִּיהוּדָאֵי דְּקָא דָּיֵין דִּינָא בְּלָא הַרְמָנָא דְמַלְכָּא. שַׁדַּר עֲלֵיהּ פְּרִיסְתְּקָא. כִּי אֲתָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא נַגֵּדְתֵּיהּ לְהַאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דְּבָא עַל חֲמָרְתָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִית לְךָ סָהֲדִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין. אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ אִדְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּאִינִישׁ, וְאַסְהֵיד. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנַן מִיּוֹמָא דִּגְלֵינַן מֵאַרְעִין לֵית לַן רְשׁוּתָא לְמִקְטַל. אַתּוּן, מַאי דְּבָעֵיתוּן עֲבִידוּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Sheila a man who had relations with a gentile woman be flogged. went to inform the king and said: There is one man among the Jews who renders judgment without the king’s authority [ harmana ]. sent a messenger [ peristaka ] for When came, they said to him: Why did you flogging for this man? He said to them: he had relations with a female donkey. they said to him: Do you have witnesses He replied: Yes, Elijah the prophet came appeared as a person and testified. They said to If so, he is liable for the death penalty; He replied: Since the day we were exiled from our land we do not have the authority to execute, you, do with him as you wish.
llm_translation: Rabbi Sheilah encountered that man from Baal Goyah. He went and ate at the king's palace. He said: "There is one man among the Jews who can judge a case without the king's decree." He sent him a dish. When he came, they said to him: "Why did you act this way towards him?" He said to them: "Because he is on a donkey." They said to him: "Do you have any witnesses?" He said: "No." Elijah came and appeared to him as a man, and testified. They said to him: "If so, he is a son of a murderer!" He said to them: "Since the day we were exiled from our land, we have no authority to execute. You, what you want to do, do to him."

hebrew_text: עַד דִּמְעַיְּינִי בֵּיהּ בְּדִינָא, פְּתַח רַבִּי שֵׁילָא וַאֲמַר: ״לְךָ ה׳ הַגְּדֻלָּה וְהַגְּבוּרָה וְגוֹ׳״. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מַאי קָאָמְרַתְּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא: ״בְּרִיךְ רַחֲמָנָא דְּיָהֵיב מַלְכוּתָא בְּאַרְעָא כְּעֵין מַלְכוּתָא דִרְקִיעָא, וִיהַב לְכוּ שׁוּלְטָנָא וְרָחֲמִי דִּינָא״. אֲמַרוּ: חַבִּיבָא עֲלֵיהּ יְקָרָא דְמַלְכוּתָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי! יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ קוּלְפָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דּוּן דִּינָא.
human_translation: As considered the sentence, “Yours, O Lord, is the greatness, power, They asked him: What did you say? He told them: This is what I said: Blessed is Merciful One who grants kingdom on earth microcosm of the kingdom in heaven, and granted you dominion and love of justice. They said to him: honor of royalty is so dear to you. They gave him a staff said to him: Judge.
llm_translation: Until my eyes were filled with tears in the judgment, Rabbi Sheilah opened and said: "Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the might, etc." They said to him: What are you saying? He said to them: Thus I am saying: "Blessed be the Merciful One who gives kingship in the land like the kingship in the heavens, and gives you authority and mercy in judgment." They said: Beloved is the honor of this entire kingship! They gave him a cup. They said to him: Judge the judgment.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק, אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַהוּא גַּבְרָא: עָבֵיד רַחֲמָנָא נִיסָּא לְשַׁקָּרֵי הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָשָׁע, לָאו חֲמָרֵי אִיקְּרוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר בְּשַׂר חֲמוֹרִים בְּשָׂרָם״. חַזְיֵיהּ דְּקָאָזֵיל לְמֵימְרָא לְהוּ דִּקְרִינְהוּ חֲמָרֵי, אֲמַר: הַאי רוֹדֵף הוּא. וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: אִם בָּא לְהׇרְגְּךָ — הַשְׁכֵּם לְהׇרְגוֹ. מַחְיֵיהּ בְּקוּלְפָא וְקַטְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: As he was leaving, that man said to Does God perform such miracles for liars? He replied: Scoundrel! Aren’t called donkeys? As it is written: “Whose flesh is as the flesh of donkeys” saw that he was going to tell that he called them donkeys. He said: a pursuer. And the Torah said: If one comes to kill you, kill him first. He struck him with the staff and killed him.
llm_translation: When he went out, that man said to him: Does the Merciful One perform miracles for liars like this? He said to him: Wicked one, are they not donkeys' wine that are called? As it is written: "whose flesh is donkeys' flesh." He saw that he was about to say that they were donkeys' wine, he said: This one is a pursuer. And the Torah said: If someone comes to kill you, rise early to kill him. He choked him with a clod and killed him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: הוֹאִיל וְאִתְעֲבִיד לִי נִיסָּא בְּהַאי קְרָא, דָּרֵישְׁנָא לֵיהּ: ״לְךָ ה׳ הַגְּדֻלָּה״ — זוֹ מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עֹשֶׂה גְדֹלוֹת עַד אֵין חֵקֶר״. ״וְהַגְּבוּרָה״ — זוֹ יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְא יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַיָּד הַגְּדֹלָה וְגוֹ׳״. ״וְהַתִּפְאֶרֶת״ — זוֹ חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה שֶׁעָמְדוּ לוֹ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּדֹּם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְיָרֵחַ עָמָד וְגוֹ׳״. ״וְהַנֵּצַח״ — זוֹ מַפַּלְתָּהּ שֶׁל רוֹמִי. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְיֵז נִצְחָם עַל בְּגָדַי וְגוֹ׳״. ״וְהַהוֹד״ — זוֹ מִלְחֶמֶת נַחֲלֵי אַרְנוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל כֵּן יֵאָמַר בְּסֵפֶר מִלְחֲמֹת ה׳ אֶת וָהֵב בְּסוּפָה וְגוֹ׳״. ״כִּי כֹל בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ״ — זוֹ מִלְחֶמֶת סִיסְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִן שָׁמַיִם נִלְחָמוּ הַכּוֹכָבִים מִמְּסִלּוֹתָם וְגוֹ׳״. ״לְךָ ה׳ הַמַּמְלָכָה״ — זוֹ מִלְחֶמֶת עֲמָלֵק, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי יָד עַל כֵּס יָהּ״. ״וְהַמִּתְנַשֵּׂא״ — זוֹ מִלְחֶמֶת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִנְנִי אֵלֶיךָ גּוֹג נְשִׂיא רֹאשׁ מֶשֶׁךְ וְתֻבָל״. ״לְכֹל לְרֹאשׁ״ — אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ רֵישׁ גַּרְגִּיתָא מִן שְׁמַיָּא מַנּוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said: Since a miracle was performed on my behalf with this verse I will interpret it homiletically: Yours, O Lord, is the greatness; that is the act of creation, and so it says: “Who does great things past finding out” And the power; that is the exodus from Egypt, as it is stated: “And Israel saw the great work Egyptians” And the glory; that is the sun and the moon that stood still for Joshua, as it is stated: “And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, And the triumph; that is the downfall of Rome, and so it says “Their lifeblood is dashed against My garments And the majesty; this is the war of the valleys of Arnon, as it is stated: “Wherefore it is said in the book of the Wars of the Lord: Vahev in Sufa, For all that is in the heaven and in the earth is Yours; this is the war of Sisera, as it is stated: “They fought from heaven, the stars in their courses Yours is the kingdom, O Lord; this is the war of Amalek, and so it says: The hand upon the throne of the Lord: And you are exalted; this is the war of Gog and Magog, and so it says: “I am against you, O Gog, the chief prince of Meshekh and Tubal” As head above all; Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even one responsible for distributing water, is appointed by heaven.
llm_translation: He said: Since he wanted to perform a miracle for me with this verse, we expound it: "Yours, O Lord, is the greatness" - this refers to the creation of the world, as it also says: "Making great things without searching." "And the might" - this refers to the exodus from Egypt, as it is said: "And Israel saw the great hand, etc." "And the glory" - this refers to the sun and moon standing still for Joshua, as it is said: "And the sun stood still, and the moon, etc." "And the victory" - this refers to the fall of Rome, as it also says: "And they shall be victorious over my garments, etc." "And the splendor" - this refers to the battle of the rivers of Arnon, as it is said: "Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord, 'Waheb in Suphah,' etc." "For all that is in the heavens and on the earth" - this refers to the battle against Sisera, as it is said: "The stars fought from heaven, from their courses, etc." "Yours, O Lord, is the kingdom" - this refers to the battle against Amalek, as it also says: "For the hand is on the throne of God." "And the exaltation" - this refers to the battle of Gog and Magog, as it also says: "Behold, I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal." "To all, O Lord, belongs greatness" - Rav Hanan bar Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even a head of a needle from the heavens they will give to him.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תַּנָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: ״לְךָ ה׳ הַגְּדֻלָּה״ — זוֹ קְרִיעַת יַם סוּף. ״וְהַגְּבוּרָה״ — זוֹ מַכַּת בְּכוֹרוֹת. ״וְהַתִּפְאֶרֶת״ — זוֹ מַתַּן תּוֹרָה. ״וְהַנֵּצַח״ — זוֹ יְרוּשָׁלַיִם. ״וְהַהוֹד״ — זוֹ בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the name of Rabbi Akiva: Yours, O Lord, is the greatness; this is the splitting of the Red Sea; the power; this is the plague of the firstborn; the glory; this is the giving of the Torah; the triumph; this is Jerusalem; the majesty; this is the Temple.
llm_translation: In a baraita it was taught in the name of Rabbi Akiva: "To You, O Lord, is the greatness" - this is the splitting of the Red Sea. "And the might" - this is the plague of the firstborn. "And the beauty" - this is the giving of the Torah. "And the eternity" - this is Jerusalem. "And the splendor" - this is the Temple.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה בָּתֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיִשּׁוּבָן, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … מַצִּיב גְּבוּל אַלְמָנָה״. בְּחוּרְבָּנָן, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״. בָּתֵּי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם בְּיִשּׁוּבָן, אוֹמֵר: ״בֵּית גֵּאִים יִסַּח ה׳״. בְּחוּרְבָּנָן, אוֹמֵר: ״אֵל נְקָמוֹת ה׳ אֵל נְקָמוֹת הוֹפִיעַ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who sees the houses of Israel inhabited recites: Blessed…Who establishes the border of the widow. in ruins he recites: Blessed…the true Judge. the houses of the nations of the world inhabited recites: “The Lord will destroy the house of the proud, And in ruins he recites: “God of vengeance, Lord, God of vengeance, shine forth”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees the houses of Israel in their return, says: "Blessed is the One who establishes the boundary of the widow." In their destruction, he says: "Blessed is the True Judge." Regarding the houses of the nations of the world in their return, he says: "The house of the proud, the Lord will destroy." In their destruction, he says: "God of vengeance, Lord God of vengeance, appear."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא וְרַב חִסְדָּא הֲווֹ קָא אָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא. כִּי מְטוֹ אַפִּתְחָא דְּבֵי רַב חָנָא בַּר חֲנִילַאי נְגַד רַב חִסְדָּא וְאִתְּנַח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא: אַמַּאי קָא מִתְּנַחַתְּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב: אֲנָחָה שׁוֹבֶרֶת חֲצִי גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה בֶן אָדָם הֵאָנַח בְּשִׁבְרוֹן מׇתְנַיִם וְגוֹ׳״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אַף כׇּל גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה כִּי יֹאמְרוּ אֵלֶיךָ עַל מָה אַתָּה נֶאֱנָח וְאָמַרְתָּ אֶל שְׁמוּעָה כִי בָאָה וְנָמֵס כׇּל לֵב וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Ulla and Rav Ḥisda were once walking along the road when they came upon the doorway of the house of Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai. Rav Ḥisda groaned and sighed. Ulla asked him: Why are you sighing? Didn’t Rav say: Sighing breaks half of one’s body? As it is stated: “Sigh, therefore, you son of man; with the breaking of your loins” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said even entire body, as it is stated: “And it shall be, when they say unto you: Why are you sighing? That you shall say: Because of the tidings, for it comes; and every heart shall melt,
llm_translation: Oula and Rav Chisda were walking on the road. When they reached the entrance of the house of Rav Chana bar Chanilai opposite Rav Chisda, they sat down. Oula said to him: Why are you sitting down? But didn't Rav say: A sigh breaks half of a person's body, as it is said: "And you, son of man, sigh with breaking of loins, etc." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even his entire body, as it is said: "And it shall be when they say to you, 'Why are you sighing?' that you shall say, 'Because of the news that is coming; every heart will melt, etc.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי לָא אֶתְּנַח — בֵּיתָא דַּהֲווֹ בַּהּ שִׁיתִּין אָפְיָיתָא בִּימָמָא וְשִׁיתִּין אָפְיָיתָא בְּלֵילְיָא, וְאָפְיָין לְכׇל מַאן דִּצְרִיךְ, וְלָא שְׁקַל יְדָא מִן כִּיסָא, דִּסְבַר דִּילְמָא אָתֵי עָנֵי בַּר טוֹבִים וְאַדְּמָטוּ לֵיהּ לְכִיסָא קָא מִכְּסִיף. וְתוּ, הֲווֹ פְּתִיחִין לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע בָּבֵי לְאַרְבַּע רוּחָתָא דְעָלְמָא, וְכֹל דַּהֲוָה עָיֵיל כָּפֵין נָפֵיק כִּי שָׂבַע. וַהֲווֹ שָׁדוּ לֵיהּ חִטֵּי וּשְׂעָרֵי בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת אַבָּרַאי, דְּכׇל מַאן דִּכְסִיפָא מִילְּתָא לְמִשְׁקַל בִּימָמָא, אָתֵי וְשָׁקֵיל בְּלֵילְיָא. הַשְׁתָּא נְפַל בְּתִלָּא — וְלָא אֶתְּנַח?
human_translation: said to How can I not sigh? this house where there were sixty cooks during the day and sixty cooks at night who would cook for anyone in need, and never removed his hand from his pocket thought: Perhaps a well-born poor person come and until he put his hand in his pocket would be embarrassed. Moreover, four doors open in four directions, and anyone who entered hungry left satiated. And they would scatter wheat and barley outside during years of drought anyone who was embarrassed to take during the day could come and take at night. Now has fallen in ruins, I not sigh?
llm_translation: He said to him: How is it that you are not worried? — A house that had in it twelve bakeries, six baking during the day and six baking during the night, and they would bake for anyone who needed, and did not take a hand from the purse, for he thought perhaps a poor man might come among the good and they would give him from the purse, and he would take silver. And they would leave open for him four doors to the four winds of the world, and anyone who came in with empty hands would go out satisfied. And they would spread for him wheat and barley in two baskets at the entrance of the city, so that anyone who needed something to weigh during the day would come and take during the night. Now, if he falls into poverty today — would he not be worried?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ נִגְזְרָה גְּזֵירָה עַל בָּתֵּיהֶן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים שֶׁיֶּחֶרְבוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּאׇזְנָי ה׳ צְבָאוֹת אִם לֹא בָּתִּים רַבִּים לְשַׁמָּה יִהְיוּ גְּדֹלִים וְטוֹבִים מֵאֵין יוֹשֵׁב״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחֲזִירָן לְיִשּׁוּבָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת לְדָוִד הַבֹּטְחִים בַּה׳ כְּהַר צִיּוֹן״. מָה הַר צִיּוֹן עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחֲזִירוֹ לְיִשּׁוּבוֹ, אַף בָּתֵּיהֶן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחֲזִירָן לְיִשּׁוּבָן. חַזְיֵיהּ דְּלָא מְיַישְּׁבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּיּוֹ לְעֶבֶד שֶׁיְּהֵא כְּרַבּוֹ.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: From the day that the Temple was destroyed a decree was issued upon the houses of the righteous that they would be destroyed, as it is stated: “In mine ears said the Lord of hosts: Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: future, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will restore them to their inhabited state, as it is stated: “A Song of Ascents of David. They who trust in the Lord are as Mount Zion, just as in the future the Holy One, Blessed be He, will restore Mount Zion to its inhabited state, so too, in the future the Holy One, Blessed be He, will restore the houses of the righteous to their inhabited state, Seeing that he was still not satisfied, said to him: It is enough for a servant to be like his master.
llm_translation: He said to him: So said Rabbi Yochanan - From the day the Temple was destroyed, a decree was issued concerning the houses of the righteous that they should be destroyed, as it is stated: "In the ears of the Lord of hosts: If not for many desolate houses, great and good, without inhabitants." And Rabbi Yochanan said: The Holy One, blessed be He, will ultimately restore them to their former state, as it is stated: "A Song of Ascents. Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion." Just as Mount Zion is destined to be restored by the Holy One, blessed be He, so too the houses of the righteous are destined to be restored by the Holy One, blessed be He, to their former state. He saw that he was not satisfied with his answer. He said to him: It is enough for a servant to be like his master.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה קִבְרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … אֲשֶׁר יָצַר אֶתְכֶם בַּדִּין, וְזָן אֶתְכֶם בַּדִּין, וְכִלְכֵּל אֶתְכֶם בַּדִּין, וְאָסַף אֶתְכֶם בַּדִּין, וְעָתִיד לַהֲקִימְכֶם בַּדִּין״. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ, מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: ״וְיוֹדֵעַ מִסְפַּר כּוּלְּכֶם, וְהוּא עָתִיד לְהַחְיוֹתְכֶם וּלְקַיֵּים אֶתְכֶם. בָּרוּךְ … מְחַיֵּה הַמֵּתִים״. קִבְרֵי גוֹיִם, אוֹמֵר: ״בּוֹשָׁה אִמְּכֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who sees graves of Israel recites: Blessed…Who formed you in judgment, and Who nourished you in judgment, and Who sustained you in judgment, and collected in judgment, and in the future will raise you in judgment. Mar, son of Ravina, concludes in the name of Rav Naḥman: And Who knows the number of you all, and Who in the future will restore you to life and sustain you. Blessed…Who revives the dead. graves of gentiles recites: “Your mother shall be sore ashamed,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who sees the graves of Israel, says: "Blessed is He... who formed you in judgment, and sustains you in judgment, and deals kindly with you in judgment, and will gather you in judgment, and is destined to revive you in judgment." Mar, son of Ravina concludes with it, in the name of Rav Nachman: "And He knows the number of all of you, and He is destined to revive you and fulfill you. Blessed is He... who revives the dead." Regarding the graves of gentiles, one says: "Your mother should be ashamed, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָרוֹאֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּימָנוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לַזְּמַן הַזֶּה״. לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … מְחַיֵּה הַמֵּתִים״. אָמַר רַב: אֵין הַמֵּת מִשְׁתַּכֵּחַ מִן הַלֵּב אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשְׁכַּחְתִּי כְּמֵת מִלֵּב הָיִיתִי כִּכְלִי אוֹבֵד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees his friend after thirty days recites: Blessed…Who has given us life, sustained us and brought us to this time. after twelve months recites: Blessed…Who revives the dead. Rav said: A dead person is only forgotten from the heart after twelve months as it is stated: “I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind; I am like a lost vessel”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: One who sees his friend after thirty days, says: "Blessed is He who has granted us life, sustained us, and enabled us to reach this time." After twelve months, he says: "Blessed is He who revives the dead." Rav said: The deceased is not forgotten from the heart until after twelve months, as it is stated: "I am forgotten like a dead person out of mind; I am like a lost vessel."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא. פְּגַעוּ בֵּיהּ בְּרַב חֲנִינָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בַּהֲדֵי דַּחֲזֵינָךְ בָּרֵיכִינַן עֲלָךְ תַּרְתֵּי: ״בָּרוּךְ … אֲשֶׁר חָלַק מֵחׇכְמָתוֹ לִירֵאָיו״ וְ״שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזִתִינְכוּ חַשֵּׁבְתִּינְכוּ עִלָּוַאי כְּשִׁיתִּין רִבְּווֹן בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּבָרֵיכְנָא עֲלַיְיכוּ תְּלָתָא: הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי, וּ״בָרוּךְ … חֲכַם הָרָזִים״. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: חֲכִימַתְּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי! יָהֲבִי בֵּיהּ עֵינַיְיהוּ, וּשְׁכֵיב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, were once walking along the road when they met Rav Ḥanina the son of Rav Ika. They said to him: When we saw you we recited two blessings over you: Blessed…Who has shared of His wisdom to those who revere Him, Who has given us life… He said to them: I too, once I saw you, considered you in my eyes as six hundred thousand house of Israel, and I recited three blessings over you. I recited those two Blessed…Who knows all secrets, They said to him: Are you all that clever? They fixed their gaze upon him and he died.
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, were walking on the road. They met Rav Chanina, son of Rav Ika. They said to him: "As we see you, we bless you with two blessings: 'Blessed is He who has imparted of His wisdom to those who fear Him' and 'Who has granted us life.'" He said to them: "I too, since I saw you, I have considered you as if you have increased the population of the House of Israel, and I bless you with three blessings: 'May you be blessed... Who is wise in the secrets'." They said to him: "Wisdom of all these! Close your eyes and lie down."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָרוֹאֶה אֶת הַבַּהֲקָנִים, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … מְשַׁנֶּה הַבְּרִיּוֹת״. מֵיתִיבִי: רָאָה אֶת הַכּוּשִׁי, וְאֶת הַגִּיחוֹר, וְאֶת הַלַּוְוקָן, וְאֶת הַקִּפֵּחַ, וְאֶת הַנַּנָּס, וְאֶת הַדַּרְנִיקוֹס, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … מְשַׁנֶּה אֶת הַבְּרִיּוֹת״. אֶת הַקִּטֵּעַ, וְאֶת הַסּוֹמֵא, וְאֶת פְּתוּיֵי הָרֹאשׁ, וְאֶת הַחִגֵּר, וְאֶת הַמּוּכֵּה שְׁחִין, וְאֶת הַבַּהֲקָנִים, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … דַּיֵּין אֱמֶת״!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees spotted people recites: Blessed…Who makes creatures different. raises a challenge: One who saw a person with black skin, a person with red skin, a person with white skin [ lavkan ], an tall and thin person, a dwarf, or one with warts [ darnikos ] recites: Blessed…Who makes creatures different. an amputee, a blind person, a flat-headed person, a lame person, one afflicted with boils, or spotted people recites: Blessed…the true Judge,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees the lightning says, "Blessed is He who changes the creations." The objection was raised: If one sees a black person, a red person, a white person, a yellow person, a person with a skin disease, or a person with boils, he says, "Blessed is He who changes the creations." If one sees a dwarf, a hunchback, a bald person, a leper, or lightning, he says, "Blessed is the true Judge!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא מִמְּעֵי אִמּוֹ, הָא בָּתַר דְּאִיתְיְלִיד. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי דּוּמְיָא דְּקִטֵּעַ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: not difficult. This, from in his mother’s womb, this, after he was born. is also precise it taught similar to an amputee, conclude from this.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this from the intestines of his mother, this after it is born. Sufficiently clear, as it is taught similar to the cutting of the umbilical cord. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאָה פִּיל, קוֹף וְקִפֹוף, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … מְשַׁנֶּה אֶת הַבְּרִיּוֹת״. רָאָה בְּרִיּוֹת טוֹבוֹת, וְאִילָנוֹת טוֹבוֹת, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁכָּכָה לוֹ בְּעוֹלָמוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who sees an elephant, a monkey, or a vulture recites: Blessed…Who makes creatures different. One who saw beautiful creatures beautiful trees recites: Blessed…Who has such things in His world.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees an elephant, an ape, or a long-tailed ape says, "Blessed is He who varies the creatures." If one sees good creatures or good trees, he says, "Blessed is He who has such in His world."

hebrew_text: עַל הַזִּיקִין: מַאי זִיקִין? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כּוֹכְבָא דְּשָׁבֵיט. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נְהִירִין לִי שְׁבִילֵי דִשְׁמַיָּא כִּשְׁבִילֵי דִנְהַרְדָּעָא, לְבַר מִכּוֹכְבָא דְּשָׁבֵיט דְּלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי נִיהוּ. וּגְמִירִי דְּלָא עָבַר כִּסְלָא, וְאִי עָבַר כִּסְלָא — חָרֵב עָלְמָא. וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּעָבַר! — זִיוֵיהּ הוּא דְּעָבַר, וּמִתְחֲזֵי כִּדְעָבַר אִיהוּ. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: וִילוֹן הוּא דְּמִקְּרַע, דְּמִגַּלְגַּל וּמִחֲזֵי נְהוֹרָא דְרָקִיעַ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כּוֹכְבָא הוּא דְּעָקַר מֵהַאי גִּיסָא דְכִסְלָא וְחָזֵי לֵיהּ חַבְרֵיהּ מֵהַךְ גִּיסָא, וּמִיבְּעִית, וּמִחֲזֵי כְּמַאן דְּעָבַר.
human_translation: over zikin , What are zikin ? Shmuel said: A comet. Shmuel also said: The paths of the sky are as clear to me as the paths Neharde’a, except for comets, that I do not know what they are. And we learn that a comet does not pass Orion and if it does pass Orion, the world will be destroyed. Don’t we see that pass The aura passes and it appears as though passes. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said vilon , rips and furls and the light of firmament is seen, Rav Ashi said a star that is uprooted from one side of Orion, and another from the other side sees it and gets startled and appears as if it is passing.
llm_translation: On the topic of comets: What are comets? Shmuel said: A star of a rod. And Shmuel said: I consider the paths of the sky like the paths of the Nahrda'a River, except for the star of a rod, of which I do not know what it is. And we have a tradition that if it passes in Kislev, there will be a sword in the world. But we see that it has passed! — Its radiance is what passed, and it appears as if it passed. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: It is a curtain that is torn, rolling and showing the light of the firmament. Rav Ashe said: It is a star that uproots from this constellation of Kislev and appears to its companions from that constellation, and it moves away and appears as if it passed.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל רָמֵי. כְּתִיב ״עֹשֶׂה עָשׁ כְּסִיל וְכִימָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״עֹשֵׂה כִימָה וּכְסִיל״. הָא כֵּיצַד? אִלְמָלֵא חַמָּה שֶׁל כְּסִיל, לֹא נִתְקַיֵּים עוֹלָם מִפְּנֵי צִינָּה שֶׁל כִּימָה, וְאִלְמָלֵא צִינָּה שֶׁל כִּימָה — לֹא נִתְקַיֵּים עוֹלָם מִפְּנֵי חַמָּה שֶׁל כְּסִיל.
human_translation: Shmuel raised a contradiction it is written: “Who makes Ursa Major, Orion, and Pleiades, And it is written: “He Who makes Pleiades and Orion” So how Were it not for Orion’s heat, the universe could not exist because of the cold of Pleiades; were it not for the cold of Pleiades, the universe could not exist because of the heat of Orion.
llm_translation: Samuel raises an objection. It is written, "He makes the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades" (Job 9:9), and it is also written, "He makes the Pleiades and Orion" (Amos 5:8). How so? Were it not for the heat of Orion, the world could not endure the cold of the Pleiades, and were it not for the cold of the Pleiades, the world could not endure the heat of Orion.

hebrew_text: וּגְמִירִי אִי לָאו עוּקְצָא דְעַקְרַבָּא דְּמַנַּח בִּנְהַר דִּינוּר, כֹּל מַאן דַּהֲוָה טָרְקָא לֵיהּ עַקְרַבָּא לָא הֲוָה חָיֵי. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְאִיּוֹב: ״הַתְקַשֵּׁר מַעֲדַנּוֹת כִּימָה אוֹ מֹשְׁכוֹת כְּסִיל תְּפַתֵּחַ״.
human_translation: And we learned if the tail of Scorpio not in the River of Fire, anyone stung by a scorpion would not survive. And that is what the All-Merciful said to Job “Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades or loosen the bands of Orion?”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And the Gemara asks: If it is not the sting of the scorpion that is placed in the Nile River, then anyone who had a scorpion in his house would not survive. And this is what the Merciful One said to Job: "Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades or loosen the cords of Orion?"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כִּימָה״? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כִּמְאָה כֹּכְבֵי. אָמְרִי לַהּ דִּמְכַנְּפִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ דִּמְבַדְּרָן.
human_translation: What is Pleiades [ Kima ]? Shmuel said: approximately a hundred [ keme’a ] stars some say that concentrated and some say that dispersed.
llm_translation: What is "Kima"? Shmuel said: Like a hundred stars. Some say it is called "Mekannefi," and some say it is called "Mivadran."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עָשׁ״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: יוֹתָא. מַאי ״יוֹתָא״? אָמְרִי לַהּ זְנַב טָלֶה. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רֵישָׁא דְעִגְלָא. וּמִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר זְנַב טָלֶה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעַיִשׁ עַל בָּנֶיהָ תַנְחֵם״. אַלְמָא חָסְרָה וּמִתְחַזְיָא
human_translation: What is Ursa Major [ Ash ]? Rav Yehuda said: Yota . What is Yota ? some say tail of Aries, while others say the head of Taurus. And it stands to reason in accordance with the one who said tail of Aries, as it is written: “Or can you guide Ursa with her sons?” apparently it was incomplete and appears
llm_translation: What is "עָשׁ"? Rav Yehudah said: Yota. What is "Yota"? They said to it: the tail of a lamb. And they said to it: the head of a calf. And it is logical like the one who said the tail of a lamb, as it is written: "And a lioness over her cubs consoles herself." This implies that she is lacking and is seen.

hebrew_text: כְּטִרְפָּא דִּטְרִיף. וְהַאי דְּאָזְלָא בָּתְרַהּ, דְּאָמְרָה לַהּ: הַב לִי בְּנַי. שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בִּקֵּשׁ לְהָבִיא מַבּוּל לְעוֹלָם נָטַל שְׁנֵי כּוֹכָבִים מִכִּימָה וְהֵבִיא מַבּוּל לָעוֹלָם. וּכְשֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ לְסׇתְמָהּ, נָטַל שְׁנֵי כּוֹכָבִים מֵעַיִשׁ וּסְתָמָהּ.
human_translation: as if it was appended And that follows is saying Give me my children, When the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to bring a flood into the world, He took two stars from Pleiades and brought the flood upon the world. And when He wished to fill He took two stars from Ursa Major and filled
llm_translation: As a scholar of the Talmud, I will now provide a word-for-word English translation of the given text, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse: Talmudic text: Like the remedy of the one who caused the injury. And this one who went after her, she said to him: "Give me my sons." When the Holy One, blessed be He, sought to bring the Flood upon the world, He took two stars from Kimah and brought the Flood upon the world. And when He sought to conceal it, He took two stars from Ayish and concealed it.

hebrew_text: וְלַיהְדַּר לַהּ? — אֵין הַבּוֹר מִתְמַלֵּא מֵחוּלְיָתוֹ. אִי נָמֵי — אֵין קָטֵיגוֹר נַעֲשָׂה סָנֵיגוֹר.
human_translation: And return it, A pit cannot be filled by its own earth; Alternatively, a prosecutor cannot become an advocate;
llm_translation: And to return to her? - The pit does not fill up from its own sand. Alternatively - the accuser does not become the defender.

hebrew_text: וְלִיבְרֵי לַהּ תְּרֵי כֹּכְבֵי אַחֲרִינֵי! — ״אֵין כׇּל חָדָשׁ תַּחַת הַשָּׁמֶשׁ״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחֲזִירָן לָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַיִשׁ עַל בָּנֶיהָ תַנְחֵם״.
human_translation: Then created two other stars “There is nothing new under the sun” Rav Naḥman said: future, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will restore to as it is stated: “Or can you guide [ tanḥem ] Ursa with her sons?”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And to the words of the Torah, two other stars! — 'There is nothing new under the sun.' Rav Nachman said: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to restore them to her, as it is stated: 'And comfort upon her children.'"

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַזְּוָעוֹת. מַאי זְוָעוֹת? אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: גּוּהָא. רַב קַטִּינָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא. כִּי מְטָא אַפִּתְחָא דְּבֵי אוֹבָא טַמְיָא גְּנַח גּוּהָא. אָמַר: מִי יָדַע אוֹבָא טַמְיָא הַאי גּוּהָא מַהוּ? רְמָא לֵיהּ קָלָא: קַטִּינָא קַטִּינָא, אַמַּאי לָא יָדַעְנָא? בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא זוֹכֵר אֶת בָּנָיו שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִים בְּצַעַר בֵּין אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מוֹרִיד שְׁתֵּי דְמָעוֹת לַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל, וְקוֹלוֹ נִשְׁמָע מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ, וְהַיְינוּ גּוּהָא.
human_translation: And over zeva’ot What zeva’ot ? Rav Ketina said: An earthquake. Rav Ketina was once walking along the road when he came to the entrance of the house of a necromancer and an earthquake rumbled. He said: Does this necromancer know what is this earthquake? raised his voice Ketina, Ketina, why would I not know? when the Holy One, Blessed be He, remembers His children who are suffering among the nations of the world, He sheds two tears into the great sea. The sound is heard from one end of the earth to the other. And that is an earthquake.
llm_translation: Regarding the abominations. What are abominations? Rav Katina said: A valley. Rav Katina was walking on the road. When he reached the entrance of the house of Ovah the tanner, a valley was stolen. He said: Who knows if Ovah the tanner has this valley? He raised his voice and said: Katina, Katina, why did we not know? At the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, remembers His children who are exiled among the nations of the world, He sheds two tears into the great sea, and His voice is heard from one end of the world to the other, and this is the valley.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: אוֹבָא טַמְיָא כַּדִּיב הוּא, וּמִילֵּיהּ כְּדִיבִין. אִי הָכִי — גּוּהָא גּוּהָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? וְלָא הִיא, גּוּהָא גּוּהָא עָבֵיד, וְהַאי דְּלָא אוֹדִי לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיטְעֵי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַבָּתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: The necromancer is a liar and his statements are lies. If so, it would necessitate an earthquake earthquake, That is not so, causes an earthquake earthquake; and the fact did not admit that so that everyone would not mistakenly follow him.
llm_translation: Rav Katina said: Ova Tamya is like a wolf, and its words are like wolves. If so, does it require so much effort? But no, it does require much effort, and this one does not admit, so that it does not spread throughout the world after it.

hebrew_text: וְרַב קַטִּינָא דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: סוֹפֵק כַּפָּיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְגַם אֲנִי אַכֶּה כַפִּי אֶל כַּפִּי וַהֲנִיחֹתִי חֲמָתִי״. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אֲנָחָה מִתְאַנֵּחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲנִיחוֹתִי חֲמָתִי בָּם וְהִנֶּחָמְתִּי״. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: בּוֹעֵט בָּרָקִיעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵידָד כְּדֹרְכִים יַעֲנֶה אֶל כׇּל יֹשְׁבֵי הָאָרֶץ״. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: דּוֹחֵק אֶת רַגְלָיו תַּחַת כִּסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ הַשָּׁמַיִם כִּסְאִי וְהָאָרֶץ הֲדֹם רַגְלָי״.
human_translation: Rav Ketina also stated his own claps His hands as it is stated: “I will also smite My hands together and I will satisfy My fury; Rabbi Natan says: sighs as it is stated: and I will satisfy My fury upon them, and I will be eased” And the Rabbis say: kicks the firmament, as it is stated: He cries out like those who tread grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: forces His feet beneath the throne of glory as it is stated: “The heaven is My throne, and the earth is My footstool”
llm_translation: Rav Katinah said: "He claps his hands," as it is stated: "And I will also smite My hands together, and I will satisfy My fury." Rabbi Natan says: "He sighs and groans," as it is stated: "And I will pour out My fury upon them and satisfy My anger." And the Sages say: "He kicks the firmament," as it is stated: "He makes a crashing noise like thunder; God thunders with His majestic voice." Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "He places his feet under the Throne of Glory," as it is stated: "So says the Lord: The heavens are My throne, and the earth is the footstool for My feet."

hebrew_text: וְעַל הָרְעָמִים. מַאי רְעָמִים? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲנָנֵי בְּגַלְגַּלָּא. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוֹל רַעַמְךָ בַּגַּלְגַּל הֵאִירוּ בְרָקִים תֵּבֵל רָגְזָה וַתִּרְעַשׁ הָאָרֶץ״. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: עֲנָנֵי דְּשָׁפְכִי מַיָּא לַהֲדָדֵי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְקוֹל תִּתּוֹ הֲמוֹן מַיִם בַּשָּׁמַיִם״. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: בַּרְקָא תַּקִּיפָא דְּבָרֵיק בַּעֲנָנָא, וּמְתַבַּר גְּזִיזֵי דְבַרְזָא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: עֲנָנֵי חַלְחוֹלֵי מְחַלְחֲלִי, וְאָתֵי זִיקָא וּמְנַשֵּׁב אַפּוּמַּיְיהוּ, וְדָמֵי כְּזִיקָּא עַל פּוּם דַּנֵּי. וּמִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּבָרֵיק בַּרְקָא, וּמְנַהֲמֵי עֲנָנֵי, וְאָתֵי מִטְרָא.
human_translation: also over thunder What thunder? Shmuel said: clouds in the curvature as it is stated: “The voice of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; the lightning lighted up the world; the earth trembled and shook” And the Rabbis say: clouds pouring water into one another, as it is stated: “At the sound of His giving a multitude of waters in the heavens” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: a powerful lightning bolt that flashes in the cloud and shatters the hailstones. Rav Ashi said: clouds are hollow, and the wind comes and blows across their mouths, wind blowing in the mouth of a jug. And it stands to reason in accordance with Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov; as lightning flashes, the clouds rumble, and the rain comes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And on the 'Ra'amim.' What are 'Ra'amim'? Shmuel said: Clouds in a whirlwind. As it is said: 'The sound of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; lightning lit up the world, the earth trembled and quaked.' And the Rabbis say: Clouds that pour water for Hadadei, as it is said: 'At the sound of a tumult of waters in the heavens.' Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: The strong lightning in the cloud, and the sparks of lightning are separated. Rav Ashe said: Clouds that swirl and whirl, and come with anger and settle their wrath, and their blood is like the blood of a hyssop on the edge of their mouths. And it is consistent with Rav Acha bar Yaakov, lightning in the cloud, and the roar of the clouds, and rain comes." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְעַל הָרוּחוֹת. מַאי רוּחוֹת? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זַעְפָּא. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גְּמִירִי, דְּזַעְפָּא בְּלֵילְיָא לָא הָוֵי. וְהָא קָא חֲזֵינַן דְּהָוֵי! — הָהוּא, דְּאַתְחֵיל בִּימָמָא. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גְּמִירִי, דְּזַעְפָּא תַּרְתֵּי שָׁעֵי לָא קָאֵי, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תָקוּם פַּעֲמַיִם צָרָה״. וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּקָאֵי! — דְּמַפְסֵיק בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי.
human_translation: also that over wind What are winds? Abaye said: gale force winds. Abaye said: We learned that there are no gale force winds at night. Don’t we see that there are This begins during the day. And Abaye said: We learned that a gale force wind does not last two hours, to fulfill that which is stated: “Trouble shall not rise up a second time” Don’t we see that it does last it stops in between.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And concerning the winds. What are the winds? Abaye said: Anger. And Abaye said: It is certain that anger does not occur at night. But we see that it does occur! — That is when one starts in the daytime. And Abaye said: It is certain that anger does not last for two hours, in order to fulfill what is said: 'A trouble will not arise twice.' But we see that it does last! — Because one interrupts between the episodes."

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַבְּרָקִים אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁכֹּחוֹ וּגְבוּרָתוֹ מָלֵא עוֹלָם״. מַאי בְּרָקִים? אָמַר רָבָא: בַּרְקָא. וְאָמַר רָבָא: בַּרְקָא יְחִידָאָה, וּבַרְקָא חִיוָּרָא, וּבַרְקָא יְרוּקְתָּא, וַעֲנָנֵי דְּסָלְקָן בְּקֶרֶן מַעֲרָבִית וְאָתְיָין מִקֶּרֶן דְּרוֹמִית, וְתַרְתֵּי עֲנָנֵי דְּסָלְקָן חֲדָא לְאַפֵּי חֲבֶרְתָּהּ — כּוּלְּהוּ קַשְׁיָין.
human_translation: also over lightning one recites: Blessed…Whose strength and power fill the world. What is lightning? Rava said: bright light. And Rava said: A single lightning, white lightning, green lightning, clouds that rise in the western corner and come from the southern corner, and two clouds that rise with one facing the other are all trouble.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And concerning the lightning, it says, "Blessed is He ... whose strength and might fill the world." What are "lightning"? Rava said: Lightning. And Rava said: A single lightning, and a yellow lightning, and a green lightning, and clouds that come out from the western horn and come from the southern horn, and two clouds that come out together from one side of their companion - all of them are difficult.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּלֵילְיָא, אֲבָל בְּצַפְרָא — לֵית בְּהוּ מְשָׁשָׁא.
human_translation: What practical difference pray for God’s mercy, this only applies at night. In the morning, however, they are insignificant.
llm_translation: For what purpose does she go out? To seek mercy. And these matters are at night, but in the morning - there is no concern.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: הָנֵי עֲנָנֵי דְצַפְרָא לֵית בְּהוּ מְשָׁשָׁא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחַסְדְּכֶם כַּעֲנַן בֹּקֶר וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, הָא אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: כַּד מִפְתָּח בָּבֵי מִיטְרָא, בַּר חַמָּרָא, מוּךְ שַׂקָּיךְ וּגְנִי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּקְטִר בְּעֵיבָא, הָא דִּקְטִר בַּעֲנָנֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: Morning clouds have no substance, as it is written: “For your goodness is as a morning cloud, Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But people say If there is rain when people open their doors donkey-driver, fold your sack and go to sleep, not difficult, this, covered with thick clouds, this covered with flimsy clouds
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Those clouds of Zafra do not have any pleasure in them, as it is written: "And your kindness is like the morning cloud." Rav Papa said to Abbaye: People say, "Just as the opening of the house of Mitra, son of Hamra, remove your sackcloth and go!" It is not difficult: this one who burns incense in the house, this one who burns incense in the clouds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לֹא נִבְרְאוּ רְעָמִים אֶלָּא לִפְשׁוֹט עַקְמוּמִית שֶׁבַּלֵּב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָאֱלֹהִים עָשָׂה שֶׁיִּרְאוּ מִלְּפָנָיו״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָרוֹאֶה אֶת הַקֶּשֶׁת בֶּעָנָן צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּפּוֹל עַל פָּנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּמַרְאֵה הַקֶּשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בֶעָנָן וְגוֹ׳ וָאֶרְאֶה וָאֶפֹּל עַל פָּנַי״. לָיְיטִי עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִחֲזֵי כְּמַאן דְּסָגֵיד לְקַשְׁתָּא. אֲבָל בָּרוֹכֵי וַדַּאי מְבָרֵךְ. מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? — ״בָּרוּךְ … זוֹכֵר הַבְּרִית״. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: ״נֶאֱמָן בִּבְרִיתוֹ וְקַיָּים בְּמַאֲמָרוֹ״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכָּךְ נֵימְרִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ: ״בָּרוּךְ … זוֹכֵר הַבְּרִית, וְנֶאֱמָן בִּבְרִיתוֹ וְקַיָּים בְּמַאֲמָרוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Thunder was created only straighten the crookedness of the heart, as it is stated: “And God has so made it, that men should fear before Him” And Rabbi Alexandri said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees a rainbow in a cloud must fall upon his face, as it is stated: “As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud And when I saw it, I fell upon my face” in the West, they would curse because it appears as one who is bowing to the rainbow. blessing however, one certainly recites a blessing. What does one recite? Blessed…Who remembers the covenant It was taught in a baraita Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says Who is faithful to His covenant and fulfills His word. Rav Pappa said: Therefore we will say them both Blessed…Who remembers the covenant and is faithful to His covenant and fulfills His word.
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Rain clouds were created only to straighten the crookedness in the heart, as it is stated: "And God made it so that they should fear Him." And Rabbi Alexandri said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: One who sees a rainbow in a cloud should fall on his face, as it is stated: "Like the appearance of the rainbow that is in the cloud... and I saw and fell upon my face." He should recite a blessing upon seeing it in the west, because it appears as if he is bowing to the rainbow. But the Baruchim certainly recite a blessing. What blessing do they recite? - "Blessed... Who remembers the covenant." In a Baraita it was taught: Rabbi Ishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, said: "He is faithful in His covenant and fulfills His word." Rav Pappa said: Therefore, we say to both of them: "Blessed... Who remembers the covenant, and is faithful in His covenant and fulfills His word."

hebrew_text: עַל הֶהָרִים וְעַל הַגְּבָעוֹת. אַטּוּ כׇּל הָנֵי דַּאֲמַרַן עַד הַשְׁתָּא, לָאו מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית נִינְהוּ? וְהָכְתִיב ״בְּרָקִים לַמָּטָר עָשָׂה״! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּרוֹךְ וּתְנִי. רָבָא אָמַר: הָתָם מְבָרֵךְ תַּרְתֵּי — ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁכֹּחוֹ מָלֵא עוֹלָם״, וְ״עוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית״. הָכָא ״עוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית״ — אִיכָּא, ״שֶׁכֹּחוֹ מָלֵא עוֹלָם״ לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: over mountains and hills Is that to say that all those that we mentioned until now, are not acts of creation? is it not written: “He makes lightning for the rain” Abaye said: Combine teach that Rava said: There, one recites two Blessed…Whose power fills the world, and: Author of creation. Here, one Author of creation, need not Whose power fills the world.
llm_translation: On the mountains and on the hills. All those that we said until now, are they not considered part of the creation of the world? But it is written, "He makes lightning for the rain!" Abaye said: Interpret and explain. Rava said: There, one blesses twice - "Blessed... whose strength fills the world," and "Who performs the act of creation." Here, "Who performs the act of creation" is present, but "Whose strength fills the world" is not present.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָרוֹאֶה רָקִיעַ בְּטׇהֳרָתָהּ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … עוֹשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית״. אִימַּתִּי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי אָתֵי מִטְרָא כּוּלֵּי לֵילְיָא, וּבְצַפְרָא אָתֵי אִסְתָּנָא וּמְגַלְּיָא לְהוּ לִשְׁמַיָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees the firmament in its purity recites: Blessed…Author of creation. When Abaye said: When rain all night and in the morning a northern wind blows, exposing the heavens.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sees the sky in its purity says, "Blessed is He who... makes the creation." When is this? Abaye said: When the entire sky comes from the rain, and in the morning the sky clears up and reveals its brightness to the heavens.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא. דְּאָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא נִרְאֵית רָקִיעַ בְּטׇהֳרָתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַלְבִּישׁ שָׁמַיִם קַדְרוּת וְשַׂק אָשִׂים כְּסוּתָם״.
human_translation: And disagree with Rafram bar Pappa Rav Ḥisda said, as Rafram bar Pappa said Rav Ḥisda said: Since the day the Temple was destroyed the firmament has not been seen in its purity, as it is said: “I clothe the heavens with blackness and I make sackcloth their covering”
llm_translation: The dispute of Refram son of Papa, Rav Hisda said. For Refram son of Papa said, Rav Hisda said: Since the day the Temple was destroyed, the sky has not appeared in its purity, as it is stated: "I will clothe the heavens with darkness and make sackcloth their covering."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה חַמָּה בִּתְקוּפָתָהּ, לְבָנָה בִּגְבוּרָתָהּ, וְכוֹכָבִים בִּמְסִילּוֹתָם, וּמַזָּלוֹת כְּסִדְרָן, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … עוֹשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית״. וְאֵימַת הָוֵי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כׇּל עֶשְׂרִין וּתְמָנְיָא שְׁנִין, וְהָדַר מַחְזוֹר וְנָפְלָה תְּקוּפַת נִיסָן, בְּשַׁבְּתַאי בְּאוּרְתָּא דִּתְלָת נַגְהֵי אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who sees the sun in its cycle, the moon in its might, the planets in their orbit, or the signs of the zodiac in their order recites: Blessed…Author of creation. And when is it Abaye said: Every twenty-eight years cycle returns and the Nisan, equinox, falls within Saturn on the night of the third and eve of the fourth
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees the sun at its appointed time, the moon in its strength, the stars in their courses, and the constellations in their order, should say: "Blessed is He who... makes the work of creation." And when is this? Abaye said: Every twenty-eight years, the cycle returns and the equinox of Nisan falls on the evening of the fourth day of the week.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר הָרוֹאֶה הַיָּם וְכוּ׳ לִפְרָקִים. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: One who sees the great sea recites: How much intermittently? Rami bar Abba said Rav Yitzḥak said: Thirty days.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who sees the sea, etc., in sections. Until when? Ramei bar Abba said in the name of Rav Yitzchak: Until thirty days.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: הָרוֹאֶה פְּרָת אַגִּשְׁרָא דְבָבֶל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … עוֹשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית״. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּשַׁנְיוּהּ פָּרְסָאֵי — מִבֵּי שַׁבּוּר וּלְעֵיל. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: מֵאִיהִי דְקִירָא וּלְעֵיל. וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: הָרוֹאֶה דִּגְלַת אַגִּשְׁרָא דְּשָׁבִיסְתְּנָא, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … עוֹשֵׂה בְּרֵאשִׁית״.
human_translation: And Rami bar Abba said Rav Yitzḥak said: One who sees the Euphrates River near the bridge of Babylonia recites: Blessed…Author of creation. And now that the Persians have rerouted from Beit Shavor upriver. Rav Yosef said: from Ihi Dekira upriver. And Rami bar Abba said: One who sees the Tigris on the bridge of Shabistana recites: Blessed…Author of creation.
llm_translation: Ramai bar Abba said in the name of Rav Yitzchak: One who sees the Euphrates River of Babylon should say, "Blessed is He who... creates the beginning." And now that the Persians have changed it — from Shabur and upwards. Rav Yosef said: From where the Kira and upwards. Ramai bar Abba said: One who sees the Tigris River of Shavistena should say, "Blessed is He who... creates the beginning."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״חִדֶּקֶל״ — אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁמֵּימָיו חַדִּין וְקַלִּין. מַאי ״פְּרָת״? — שֶׁמֵּימָיו פָּרִין וְרָבִין.
human_translation: What is Ḥidekel [ Rav Ashi said: its waters are sharp [ ḥadin ] and light [ kalin ] What is Perat because its waters are fruitful [ parin ] and multiply [ ravin ];
llm_translation: "What is 'Chiddekel'?" - Rav Ashei said: Its waters are sharp and light. What is 'Perat'? - Its waters are fruitful and abundant.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי דַּחֲרִיפֵי בְּנֵי מָחוֹזָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּשָׁתוּ מַיָּא דְּדִגְלַת. הַאי דְּגִיחוֹרֵי — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְשַׁמְּשִׁי בִּימָמָא. וְהַאי דְּנָיְידִי עֵינַיְיהוּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּדָיְירוּ בְּבַיִת אָפֵל.
human_translation: Rava said: The inhabitants Meḥoza are sharp because they drink the water of the Tigris; they are red because they engage in relations in the daytime; and their eyes move because they live in dark houses.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Those who are sharp in the town of Mahoza - because they drink the water of the Diklat. Those who are bald - because they expose themselves to the sun. And those who have weak eyes - because they live in a dark house.

hebrew_text: עַל הַגְּשָׁמִים כּוּ׳. וְעַל הַגְּשָׁמִים ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ מְבָרֵךְ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: מֵאֵימָתַי מְבָרְכִין עַל הַגְּשָׁמִים — מִשֶּׁיֵּצֵא חָתָן לִקְרַאת כַּלָּה.
human_translation: over rain And over rain one recite the blessing: Who is good and does good? Didn’t Rabbi Abbahu say, and some say it was taught in a baraita : From when does one recite the blessing on rain? From when the groom went out to meet the bride.
llm_translation: On rain, yes. And on rain, "He who is good and does good," one blesses? And Rabbi Abahu said, and some say it was taught in a baraita: From when do we bless on rain? From when the groom goes out to meet the bride.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְבָרְכִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״מוֹדִים אֲנַחְנוּ לָךְ עַל כׇּל טִפָּה וְטִפָּה שֶׁהוֹרַדְתָּ לָנוּ״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ הָכִי: ״אִילּוּ פִינוּ מָלֵא שִׁירָה כַּיָּם וְכוּ׳ אֵין אֲנַחְנוּ מַסְפִּיקִין לְהוֹדוֹת לְךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״, עַד ״תִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה״. ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ רוֹב הַהוֹדָאוֹת״.
human_translation: What blessing does one recite? Rav Yehuda said: We thank You for each and every drop that You have made fall for us. And Rav Yoḥanan concludes as follows: If our mouths were as full of song as the sea…we could not sufficiently praise You O Lord our God, until: Shall bow Blessed are You, O Lord, abundant thanksgivings
llm_translation: What do we bless? Rav Yehudah said: "We thank You for every drop that You have provided for us." And Rabbi Yochanan concludes it thus: "If our mouths were filled with song like the sea, we still would not be able to thank You enough, Hashem our God," until "we prostrate." "Blessed are You, Hashem, the source of abundant thanksgivings."

hebrew_text: ״רוֹב הַהוֹדָאוֹת״ וְלָא כׇּל הַהוֹדָאוֹת? אָמַר רָבָא: אֵימָא — ״הָאֵל הַהוֹדָאוֹת״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכָּךְ נֵימְרִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ, ״רוֹב הַהוֹדָאוֹת״ וְ״הָאֵל הַהוֹדָאוֹת״.
human_translation: Abundant thanksgivings, and not: All thanksgivings? Rava said: say: The God of thanksgivings. Rav Pappa said: Therefore, we will recite them both: Abundant thanksgivings, and: The God of thanksgivings.
llm_translation: "The majority of acknowledgments" and not all acknowledgments? Rava said: Perhaps - "the God of acknowledgments." Rav Papa said: Therefore, they were said together, "the majority of acknowledgments" and "the God of acknowledgments."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא! — לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דִּשְׁמַע מִשְׁמָע, הָא דַּחֲזָא מִחְזֵי.
human_translation: However, it is difficult, not difficult. This, where one heard This, where one saw
llm_translation: And rather a contradiction! — Not a contradiction, this one who hears from hearing, this one who sees from seeing.

hebrew_text: דִּשְׁמַע מִשְׁמָע הַיְינוּ בְּשׂוֹרוֹת טוֹבוֹת, וּתְנַן: עַל בְּשׂוֹרוֹת טוֹבוֹת אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״!
human_translation: One heard that is good tidings. And we learned that upon good tidings one recites: Who is good and does good.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Dishma mishma hainu besorot tovot, u'tanan: Al besorot tovot omer 'Baruch hatov vehameitiv'!" English translation: "Hearing is indeed hearing good tidings, and we learned: Regarding good tidings one says, 'Blessed is the good and the one who does good!'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דַּחֲזָא מִחְזֵי, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲתָא פּוּרְתָּא, הָא דַּאֲתָא טוּבָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דַּאֲתָא טוּבָא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא — הָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא, הָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא.
human_translation: Rather, This, and that, and not difficult. This, refers to where a little fell, that, where a lot fell. And if you wish, say this and that where a lot fell, and not difficult. This, refers to where one owns land, that, refers to where one does not own land,
llm_translation: Rather: both and both see, and not difficult: this that came poor, this that came good. And if you wish, say: this and this that came good, and not difficult — this that has land, this that does not have land.

hebrew_text: אִית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ מְבָרֵךְ?! וְהָא תְּנַן: בָּנָה בַּיִת חָדָשׁ, וְקָנָה כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לַזְּמַן הַזֶּה״. שֶׁלּוֹ וְשֶׁל אֲחֵרִים — אוֹמֵר: ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״?
human_translation: One who owns land recites: Who is good and does good? Didn’t we learn One who built a new house or purchased new vessels recites: Blessed…Who has given us life…and brought us to this time. to him and others he recites: Who is good and does good?
llm_translation: He has land, "the good and the beneficent" he blesses?! But didn't we learn: If one builds a new house and acquires new utensils, he says: "Blessed is He... who has granted us life, sustained us, and enabled us to reach this time." For his own and for others' — he says: "the good and the beneficent"?

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ שׁוּתָּפוּת, הָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ שׁוּתָּפוּת. וְהָתַנְיָא: קׇצְרוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר, עַל שֶׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּימָנוּ״, עַל שֶׁלּוֹ וְעַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ — אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״.
human_translation: not difficult. This, refers to where one in partnership that, refers to where one does not have a partnership. And was taught The gist of the matter is, for is his, he recites: Blessed…Who has given us life and sustained us; for belongs to him and to another he recites: Who is good and does good.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that has partnership, this that does not have partnership. And it was taught: If one shortens a matter, regarding his own he says, "Blessed is He... Who has granted us life and sustained us," regarding his and his friend's he says, "Blessed is He... Who is good and does good."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּלֵית לְאַחֲרִינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ לָא מְבָרֵךְ ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״? וְהָתַנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לֵיהּ יָלְדָה אִשְׁתּוֹ זָכָר, אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ … הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״! הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּאִיכָּא אִשְׁתּוֹ בַּהֲדֵיהּ דְּנִיחָא לַהּ בְּזָכָר.
human_translation: And in every case where others are not with him, one does not recite: Who is good and does good? Wasn’t it taught If they told him that his wife gave birth to a male, he recites: Who is good and does good? There too, his wife is with him, as she is also happy that a male
llm_translation: In every case where there is no other child following him, one does not recite "Who is good and does good?" And it was taught: They said to him, "His wife gave birth to a male child," he says, "Blessed is ... Who is good and does good!" There too, because there is his wife following him, it is pleasing to him that it is a male child.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מֵת אָבִיו וְהוּא יוֹרְשׁוֹ, בַּתְּחִלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״, וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״. הָתָם נָמֵי דְּאִיכָּא אֲחֵי דְּקָא יָרְתִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come and hear father died and he is his heir, initially recites: Blessed…the true Judge, and ultimately, he recites: Blessed…Who is good and does good. There, too, where he has brothers who inherit along with him.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one's father dies and he inherits him, initially he says, "Blessed is the True Judge," and ultimately he says, "Blessed is the One who is good and does good." There, it is stated because there are brothers who are content with him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שִׁינּוּי יַיִן אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, שִׁינּוּי מָקוֹם צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵף בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ שִׁינּוּי יַיִן אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, אֲבָל אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״! הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּאִיכָּא בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה דְּשָׁתוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come and hear a change in wine one need not recite the blessing: a change in place, one must recite a blessing And Rabbi Yosef bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Although said that a change in wine one need not recite a blessing he does recite: Blessed…Who is good and does good. There, too, members of the group are drinking with him.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Changing wine does not require a blessing, changing location does require a blessing. And Rabbi Yosef bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even though they said changing wine does not require a blessing, nevertheless one should say, "Blessed is He who is good and does good!" There too, because there are members of the group who partook of it.

hebrew_text: בָּנָה בַּיִת חָדָשׁ וְקָנָה כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין לוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ לוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: built a new house or purchased new vessels Rav Huna said: They only taught he does not have something similar, However, if he has something similar he need not recite a blessing, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even one has something similar he must recite a blessing
llm_translation: He built a new house and acquired new utensils, etc. Rav Huna said: They only taught that if he does not have the equivalent of them, but if he has the equivalent of them, he does not need to recite a blessing. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if he has the equivalent of them, he must recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּכִי קָנָה וְחָזַר וְקָנָה, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: by inference that if he purchases and then purchases everyone agrees that he is not required to recite a blessing,
llm_translation: From the principle that if one acquired and then acquired again, everyone agrees that a blessing is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא קָנָה וְחָזַר וְקָנָה, אֲבָל קָנָה וְחָזַר וְקָנָה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קָנָה חָזַר וְקָנָה — צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. מִכְּלָל דְּכִי יֵשׁ לוֹ וְקָנָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: Some say Rav Huna said: They only taught if he did not purchase and purchased However, if he purchased and purchased again, he need not recite a blessing. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even if one purchased and purchased again, he must recite a blessing. by inference that if one has and purchased everyone agrees that he must recite a blessing.
