hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַנִּפְנֶה בִּיהוּדָה — לֹא יִפָּנֶה מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב אֶלָּא צָפוֹן וְדָרוֹם. וּבַגָּלִיל, צָפוֹן וְדָרוֹם — אָסוּר, מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב — מוּתָּר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָסְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּרוֹאֶה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — אָסוּר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מוּתָּר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹסֵר בְּכָל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: It was taught another One who defecates in Judea should not defecate east and west; rather, north and south. And in the Galilee, north and south is prohibited, east and west is permitted. And Rabbi Yosei permitted as Rabbi Yosei was wont to say: They only prohibited one can see Rabbi Yehuda says: When the Temple is standing, it is prohibited, when the Temple is not standing, it is permitted. Rabbi Akiva prohibits anywhere
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The one who turns towards Judah - he shall not turn to the east or west, only to the north and south. And in the Galilee, north and south are forbidden, east and west are permitted. And Rabbi Yosei permits it, for Rabbi Yosei used to say: They only prohibited it in a place where one can see. Rabbi Yehuda says: When the Temple is standing, it is forbidden; when the Temple is not standing, it is permitted. Rabbi Akiva prohibits it in all places.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ חוּץ לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva’s is identical to the first, tanna , between them outside of Eretz ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, that is the first Tanna! There is a difference between them, except for the land.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה הֲווֹ שַׁדְיָין לֵיהּ לִבְנֵי מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב. אֲזַל אַבָּיֵי שְׁדַנְהוּ צְפוֹן וְדָרוֹם, עָל רַבָּה תָּרְצַנְהוּ. אֲמַר: מַאן הַאי דְּקָמְצַעַר לִי? אֲנָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְבִירָא לִי דְּאָמַר: בְּכָל מָקוֹם אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabba’s the bricks were placed east and west Abaye went placed them north and south, Rabba entered fixed them. He said: Who is the one that is upsetting me? I hold in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, said: It is prohibited everywhere.
llm_translation: Rabba had judges to the east and west. Abbaye went and judged them to the north and south, and Rabba was pleased with him. He said: Who is this who causes me distress? I, like Rabbi Akiva, hold that it is forbidden everywhere.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: פַּעַם אַחַת נִכְנַסְתִּי אַחַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וְלָמַדְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: לָמַדְתִּי שֶׁאֵין נִפְנִין מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב אֶלָּא צָפוֹן וְדָרוֹם, וְלָמַדְתִּי שֶׁאֵין נִפְרָעִין מְעוּמָּד אֶלָּא מְיוּשָּׁב, וְלָמַדְתִּי שֶׁאֵין מְקַנְּחִין בְּיָמִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׂמֹאל. אָמַר לוֹ בֶּן עַזַּאי: עַד כָּאן הֵעַזְתָּ פָּנֶיךָ בְּרַבְּךָ?! אָמַר לוֹ תּוֹרָה הִיא, וְלִלְמוֹד אֲנִי צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Akiva said: I once entered the bathroom after Rabbi Yehoshua, and I learned three things from his I learned that one should not defecate east and west, but rather north and south; I learned that one should not uncover himself standing, but sitting, and I learned that one should not wipe with his right but with his left. Ben Azzai, said to him: You were impertinent to your teacher to that extent He replied: It is Torah, and I must learn.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said: Once I entered after Rabbi Yehoshua to the bathroom, and I learned three things from him: I learned that one should not turn from east and west but rather from north and south, and I learned that one should not relieve oneself standing but sitting, and I learned that one should not wipe with the right hand but with the left. Ben Azzai said to him: Have you dared to expose your face before your teacher to this extent?! He said to him: It is Torah, and to learn I am in need.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: פַּעַם אַחַת נִכְנַסְתִּי אַחַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וְלָמַדְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: לָמַדְתִּי שֶׁאֵין נִפְנִין מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב אֶלָּא צָפוֹן וְדָרוֹם, וְלָמַדְתִּי שֶׁאֵין נִפְרָעִין מְעוּמָּד אֶלָּא מְיוּשָּׁב, וְלָמַדְתִּי שֶׁאֵין מְקַנְּחִין בְּיָמִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׂמֹאל. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עַד כָּאן הֵעַזְתָּ פָּנֶיךָ בְּרַבְּךָ?! אָמַר לוֹ: תּוֹרָה הִיא, וְלִלְמוֹד אֲנִי צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: we learned Ben Azzai said: I once entered a bathroom after Rabbi Akiva, and I learned three things from his I learned that one should not defecate east and west, but rather north and south; I learned that one should not uncover himself standing, but sitting; and I learned that one should not wipe with his right but with his left. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: You were impertinent to your teacher to that extent? He replied: It is Torah, and I must learn.
llm_translation: It was taught: Ben Azzai says: Once I entered after Rabbi Akiva to the bathroom, and I learned from him three things: I learned that one should not turn east and west, but rather north and south; I learned that one should not relieve oneself standing, but sitting; and I learned that one should not wipe with the right hand, but with the left. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Have you dared to turn your face towards your teacher?! He said to him: It is Torah, and I must learn.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא עָל, גְּנָא תּוּתֵיהּ פּוּרְיֵיהּ דְּרַב. שַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּשָׂח וְשָׂחַק וְעָשָׂה צְרָכָיו. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דָּמֵי פּוּמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּא כִּדְלָא שָׂרֵיף תַּבְשִׁילָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּהֲנָא, הָכָא אַתְּ? פּוּק, דְּלָאו אֹרַח אַרְעָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תּוֹרָה הִיא, וְלִלְמוֹד אֲנִי צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana entered and lay beneath Rav’s bed. He heard chatting and laughing and seeing to his needs, said to The mouth Abba, is like has never eaten a cooked dish, said to him: Kahana, you are here? Leave, as is an undesirable mode of behavior. said to him: It is Torah, and I must learn.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana upon, his garden his mulberry tree of Rav. His name of Sach and Sachak and made his needs. He said to him: the blood of his father like not burn the dish. He said to him: Kahana, here you? Go, not the way of the land. He said to him: Torah it is, and to learn I need.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין מְקַנְּחִין בְּיָמִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׂמֹאל? אָמַר רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה נִיתְּנָה בְּיָמִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״. רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא קְרוֹבָה לַפֶּה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקּוֹשֵׁר בָּהּ תְּפִילִּין. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּרְאֶה בָּהּ טַעֲמֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: Why must one not wipe with his right but with his left? Rava said: Because the Torah was given with the right as it is stated: “At His right hand was a fiery law unto them” Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Because is close to the mouth, And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Because one ties the phylacteries with Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Because one points to the notes of the Torah with
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why do we anoint on the right hand only with the left? Rava said: Because the Torah was given with the right hand, as it is said: 'A fiery law from His right hand.' Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: Because the right hand is close to the mouth. And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Because one ties tefillin with it. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Because one sees in it the flavors of Torah."

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאוֹכֵל בָּהּ. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכּוֹתֵב בָּהּ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּרְאֶה בָּהּ טַעֲמֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: parallel to a tannaitic Rabbi Eliezer says: because he eats with it. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Because he writes with it. Rabbi Akiva says: Because he points to the notes of the Torah with it.
llm_translation: The Tannaim. Rabbi Eliezer says: Because he eats in it. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Because he writes in it. Rabbi Akiva says: Because he sees in it the flavors of Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי: כׇּל הַצָּנוּעַ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא נִצּוֹל מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים — מִן הַנְּחָשִׁים, וּמִן הָעַקְרַבִּים, וּמִן הַמַּזִּיקִין. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים אַף חֲלוֹמוֹתָיו מְיוּשָּׁבִים עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai said: Anyone who is modest in the bathroom will be saved from three things: From snakes, from scorpions and from demons. And some say even his dreams will be settling for him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai said: Anyone who is modest in the privy is saved from three things - from snakes, scorpions, and harmful spirits. And some say, even his dreams are fulfilled upon him.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא דַּהֲוָה בִּטְבֶרְיָא, כִּי הֲווֹ עָיְילִי בֵּיהּ בֵּי תְרֵי — אֲפִילּוּ בִּימָמָא מִתַּזְּקִי. רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי הֲווֹ עָיְילִי בֵּיהּ חַד וְחַד לְחוֹדֵיהּ — וְלָא מִתַּזְּקִי. אָמְרִי לְהוּ רַבָּנַן: לָא מִסְתְּפֵיתוּ? אָמְרִי לְהוּ: אֲנַן קַבָּלָה גְּמִירִינַן, קַבָּלָה דְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא — צְנִיעוּתָא וּשְׁתִיקוּתָא. קַבָּלָה דְיִסּוּרֵי — שְׁתִיקוּתָא וּמִבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי.
human_translation: There was a particular bathroom in Tiberias, where, when two would enter it, even during the day, they would be harmed Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi would each enter alone, they were not harmed. The Sages said to them: Aren’t you afraid? said to them: We have learned tradition bathroom modesty and silence. The tradition suffering silence and prayer.
llm_translation: That particular bathroom that was in Tiberias, when two would enter it together - even in broad daylight they would become healed. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi would enter it one by one - and not become healed. The sages said to them: Have you not been healed? They said to them: We have a tradition that we received, the tradition of the bathroom - modesty and silence. The tradition of afflictions - silence and seeking mercy.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי מְרַבְּיָא לֵיהּ אִמֵּיהּ אִמְּרָא לְמֵיעַל בַּהֲדֵיהּ לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא. וּלְרַבֵּי לֵיהּ גַּדְיָא! שָׂעִיר בְּשָׂעִיר מִיחַלַּף.
human_translation: Abaye’s mother raised a lamb to accompany him to the bathroom. raised a goat for him. A goat interchanged with a goat-demon.
llm_translation: Abbaye from Rebbe Yaya to his mother said to go up with him to the bathroom. And to Rabbi to him a goat! A goat for a goat is exchanged.

hebrew_text: רָבָא, מִקַּמֵּי דַּהֲוָה רֵישָׁא, מְקַרְקְשָׁא לֵיהּ בַּת רַב חִסְדָּא אַמְגּוּזָא בְּלָקָנָא. בָּתַר דִּמְלַךְ, עֲבַדָא לֵיהּ כַּוְּותָא, וּמַנְּחָא לֵיהּ יְדָא אַרֵישֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Before Rava became the head of the yeshiva, the daughter of Rav Ḥisda, would rattle a nut in a copper vessel for him. After preside she constructed a window for him, and placed her hand upon his head.
llm_translation: Rava, from when he was young, would play with the daughter of Rav Ḥisda, a nut in a basket. After he grew up, he made for her a marriage contract, and placed a hand on her head.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: אֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר — נִפְנֶה מִיָּד. וּבַבִּקְעָה, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמִּתְעַטֵּשׁ וְאֵין חֲבֵרוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ. אִיסִי בַּר נָתָן מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמִּתְעַטֵּשׁ וְאֵין חֲבֵרוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, וּבַבִּקְעָה — כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֵין חֲבֵרוֹ רוֹאֵהוּ.
human_translation: Ulla said: Behind a fence, one may defecate immediately. In a valley sufficiently so that if he passes wind, no one will hear him. Isi bar Natan taught as follows: Behind a fence sufficiently so that if he passes wind another does not hear him, and in a valley, sufficiently so that no one can see him.
llm_translation: Ula said: "Behind the fence - turn away immediately. And in the valley, as long as one is getting dirty and his friend does not hear." Isi bar Nathan teaches thus: "Behind the fence, as long as one is getting dirty and his friend does not hear, and in the valley - as long as his friend does not see him."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יוֹצְאִין מִפֶּתַח בֵּית הַבַּד, וְנִפְנִין לַאֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר, וְהֵן טְהוֹרִין!
human_translation: raises an objection exit from the entrance of the olive press, defecate behind the fence, and are ritually pure.
llm_translation: Challenger: They go out from the opening of the courtyard, and turn back behind the fence, and they are pure!

hebrew_text: בִּטְהָרוֹת הֵקֵלּוּ.
human_translation: With regard to ritual purity, they were lenient.
llm_translation: In matters of purity, they were lenient.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כַּמָּה יַרְחִקוּ וְיִהְיוּ טְהוֹרִין — כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא רוֹאֵהוּ! שָׁאנֵי אוֹכְלֵי טְהָרוֹת, דַּאֲקִילּוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Come and hear How far distance themselves, and will pure? so far that he sees him. who eat in purity are different, as the Sages were lenient with them.
llm_translation: Come and hear: How far should they distance themselves and be considered pure? - So that one can see them! This is different from those who eat pure foods, as the Rabbis were lenient with them.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַאי ״כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֵין חֲבֵרוֹ רוֹאֶה״ דְּקָאָמַר אִיסִי בַּר נָתָן — כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֵין חֲבֵרוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת פֵּרוּעוֹ, אֲבָל לְדִידֵיהּ חָזֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is So long as another does not see him, which Isi bar Natan said? Sufficient that another person cannot see his nakedness, although he does see him.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is "as long as his friend does not see"? Isi bar Nathan said: As long as his friend does not see his disgrace, but for himself, he sees it.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא סַפְדָנָא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר: ״הַאי צָנוּעַ בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו הֲוָה״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אַתְּ עֲיַילְתְּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא וְיָדְעַתְּ אִי צָנוּעַ אִי לָא? דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין קוֹרִין ״צָנוּעַ״ אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁצָּנוּעַ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא.
human_translation: There was a particular eulogizer who went in the presence of Rav Naḥman. he said: This was modest in his ways. Rav Naḥman said to him: Did you go to the bathroom with him and know whether or not he was modest? As we learned One can only describe as modest one who is modest in the bathroom,
llm_translation: That scribe who stood before Rav Nachman, said: "This modest one in his ways was." Rav Nachman said to him: "Did you go with him to the bathroom and know if he is modest or not? For it was taught: 'We only call one "modest" who is modest in the bathroom.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּפְרָעִין מִן הַמֵּתִים כָּךְ נִפְרָעִין מִן הַסַּפְדָנִין, וּמִן הָעוֹנִין אַחֲרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And what difference to Rav Naḥman, Because it was taught Just as the deceased are punished, so too are the eulogizers and those who answer after them.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman, what is derived from him? Because it was taught: Just as we separate from the dead, so too we separate from the mourners and from those who follow them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ צָנוּעַ — זֶה הַנִּפְנֶה בַּלַּיְלָה בַּמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּפְנָה בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught Who is a modest person? One who defecates at night where he defecates during the day,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who is modest? — One who turns aside at night in the same place where he turns aside during the day.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יַנְהִיג אָדָם אֶת עַצְמוֹ שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא צָרִיךְ לְהִתְרַחֵק! וְתוּ, רָבָא בִּימָמָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל עַד מִיל, וּבְלֵילְיָא אָמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: פַּנּוֹ לִי דּוּכְתָּא בִּרְחוֹבָא דְמָתָא. וְכֵן אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: חֲזִי מַאן דְּאִיכָּא אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית חֶבְרַיָּא, דְּבָעֵינָא לְמִפְנֵי! לָא תֵּימָא בַּמָּקוֹם, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁנִּפְנָה בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said: One must always accustom himself in the morning and at night, so that he will not need to distance himself? Moreover, during the day, Rava would go up to a mil and at night he would tell his servant: Clear a place for me in the city street. And so too, Rabbi Zeira told his servant: See who is behind the study hall, as I need to defecate. Rather, say In the manner that one defecates during the day,
llm_translation: I?! And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always conduct himself with morning and evening prayers, so that he will not need to distance himself! And indeed, Rava used to go until Mil by day, and at night he said to his attendant: Turn me towards the entrance of the city. And so Rabbi Zeira said to his attendant: See if there is anyone behind the house of study, for I need to relieve myself! Do not say "in the place," rather say: as one turns during the day.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בַּמָּקוֹם, לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְקֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say Where he defecates during the day, was only necessary in a corner,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say "in the place," it was only necessary for the corner horn.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יַנְהִיג אָדָם אֶת עַצְמוֹ שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא צָרִיךְ לְהִתְרַחֵק.
human_translation: the matter itself. Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One must always accustom himself in the morning and at night so that he will not need to distance himself.
llm_translation: Body. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always conduct himself with morning and evening prayers, so that he will not need to distance himself.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: הַשְׁכֵּם וָצֵא, הַעֲרֵב וָצֵא, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְרַחֵק. מַשְׁמֵשׁ וָשֵׁב, וְאַל תֵּשֵׁב וּתְמַשְׁמֵשׁ, שֶׁכָּל הַיּוֹשֵׁב וּמְמַשְׁמֵשׁ — אֲפִילּוּ עוֹשִׂין כְּשָׁפִים בְּאַסְפַּמְיָא, בָּאִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: That was also taught Ben Azzai said: Rise early and go evening and go so that you will not distance yourself. Touch and sit; do not sit and touch, for anyone who sits and touches, even if sorcery is performed in Aspamia, will come upon him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder, Ben Azzai says: "Rise early and go out, mix and go out, so that you do not distance yourself. Serve and return, but do not sit and serve, for anyone who sits and serves—even if they perform magic with an aspamya—will come upon them."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִנְּשִׁי וִיתִיב וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁמֵשׁ, מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? — כִּי קָאֵי, לֵימָא הָכִי: ״לָא לִי לָא לִי, לָא תַּחִים וְלָא תַּחְתִּים, לָא הָנֵי וְלָא מֵהָנֵי, לָא חַרְשֵׁי דְחַרָּשָׁא וְלָא חַרְשֵׁי דְחַרָּשְׁתָא״.
human_translation: And if one forgets and sits and then touches, what is his remedy? When stands, recite the following Not for me, not for me, neither taḥim nor taḥtim , neither these nor from these, neither the sorcery of a sorcerer nor the sorcery of a sorceress.
llm_translation: If a person comes and sits and then serves, what is the benefit? — When he stands, let him say thus: "Not for me, not for me, not above and not below, not these and not those, not the deaf of this deafness and not the deaf of that deafness."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: עַל כׇּל מִשְׁכָּב שְׁכַב, חוּץ מִן הַקַּרְקַע. עַל כׇּל מוֹשָׁב שֵׁב, חוּץ מִן הַקּוֹרָה. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שֵׁינָה בְּעַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר כְּאִסְטָמָא לְפַרְזְלָא. יְצִיאָה בְּעַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר כְּאִסְטָמָא לְפַרְזְלָא.
human_translation: it was taught Ben Azzai says: On all beds, lie, except for the ground. On all seats, sit, except for a beam, Shmuel said: Sleeping at dawn is as forging [ istema ] to iron. A movement at dawn as forging to iron.
llm_translation: It was taught: Ben Azzai says: On every bed one may lie, except for on the ground. On every seat one may sit, except for on a beam. Shmuel said: Sleep at the break of dawn is like an iron needle. Exiting at the break of dawn is like an iron needle.

hebrew_text: בַּר קַפָּרָא הֲוָה מְזַבֵּן מִילֵּי בְּדִינָרֵי: עַד דְּכָפְנַתְּ — אֱכוֹל. עַד דְּצָחֵית — שְׁתִי, עַד דְּרָתְחָא קִדְרָךָ — שְׁפוֹךְ. קַרְנָא קָרְיָא בְּרוֹמִי, בַּר מְזַבֵּין תְּאֵנֵי, תְּאֵנֵי דַּאֲבוּךְ זַבֵּין.
human_translation: Bar Kappara would sell sayings for dinars; If you are hungry, eat; if you are thirsty, drink; while the pot is still boiling, pour it When the horn is sounded in Rome, son of a fig seller, sell your father’s figs,
llm_translation: Bar Kapara would buy items with dinars: until it hardens - eat. Until it spoils - drink. Until your pot boils - pour out. A horn is called a "keren" in Rome, a son buys figs, the figs of your father he buys.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּנָן: כִּי עָיְילִיתוּ בִּשְׁבִילֵי דְמָחוֹזָא לְמִיפַּק בֵּיהּ בְּחַקְלָא, לָא תֶּחֱזוֹ לָא לְהַךְ גִּיסָא וְלָא לְהַךְ גִּיסָא, דִּלְמָא יָתְבֵי נְשֵׁי, וְלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said to the Sages: When you enter the paths Meḥoza in order to go out in a field, look neither to one side nor to the other, as perhaps women are sitting there and it is improper to look at them.
llm_translation: He said to them, Abaye said to the Rabbis: When they come for the sake of the tax collector to collect from him with a stick, do not look neither to hit him with a piece of wood nor to hit him with a piece of wood, lest women be sitting, and it is not the way of the land to expose them to disgrace.

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא עָל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא. אֲתָא רַבִּי אַבָּא, נְחַר לֵיהּ אַבָּבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵיעוּל מָר. בָּתַר דִּנְפַק אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא לָא עֲיַילְתְּ לְשֵׂעִיר, וּגְמַרְתְּ לָךְ מִילֵּי דְשֵׂעִיר! לָאו הָכִי תְּנַן: מְדוּרָה הָיְתָה שָׁם וּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא שֶׁל כָּבוֹד. וְזֶה הָיָה כְּבוֹדוֹ: מְצָאוֹ נָעוּל — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם אָדָם, מְצָאוֹ פָּתוּחַ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁאֵין שָׁם אָדָם. אַלְמָא לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא הוּא!
human_translation: Rav Safra once entered a bathroom, Rabbi Abba came along. coughed next to the door. said to him: Enter, master. When he came out, Rabbi Abba said to him: Until now, you never entered Seir, and you learned the Seir? Didn’t we learn There was a fire and a bathroom of honor. And this was its honor: If one found it locked, it was known that someone was inside; he found it open, it was known that no one was inside. is not a desired mode of behavior
llm_translation: Rav Safra went to the bathroom. Rabbi Abba came, and Abba bar Abba heated it for him. He said to him: "Master, go in." After he came out, he said to him: "Until now, you did not go to the goat, and you have completed for yourself the matters of the goat!" Is it not so that we learned: There was a hole there and a bathroom of honor. And this was its honor: if he found it locked — it is known that there is a person there, if he found it open — it is known that there is no person there. This implies that it is not a public thoroughfare!

hebrew_text: וְהוּא סָבַר מְסוּכָּן הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עַמּוּד הַחוֹזֵר מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי הִדְרוֹקָן. סִילוֹן הַחוֹזֵר מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי יֵרָקוֹן.
human_translation: held that it was dangerous As it was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: A column that is held back causes dropsy [ hidrokan ]. A stream [ silon ] that is held back causes jaundice.
llm_translation: And he thought it is dangerous. As it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A leaning pillar brings a person to danger. A shaky stool brings a person to falling.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר עָל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא. אֲתָא הַהוּא רוֹמָאָה דַּחֲקֵיהּ. קָם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וּנְפַק. אֲתָא דְּרָקֹונָא שַׁמְטֵיהּ לְכַרְכְּשֵׁיהּ. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״וְאֶתֵּן אָדָם תַּחְתֶּיךָ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אָדָם״ אֶלָּא ״אֱדוֹם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar entered a bathroom. This Roman came and pushed him Rabbi Elazar stood and left, a serpent came and ripped out the intestines Rabbi Elazar recited the verse about “Therefore I will give man [ adam ] for you” do not read adam , but rather read Edom,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar was sitting at the entrance of the privy. A certain Roman came and pressed him. Rabbi Elazar stood up and left. A dragon came and devoured him along with his belongings. Rabbi Elazar called out: "And I will give man beneath you," do not read "man" but "Edom."

hebrew_text: ״וְאָמַר לַהֲרָגֲךָ וַתָּחָס עָלֶיךָ״.
human_translation: and he said to kill you; and you spared you”
llm_translation: "And he said to kill you, and you had compassion on yourself."

hebrew_text: ״וְאָמַר״, ״וְאָמַרְתִּי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! ״וַתָּחָס״, ״וְחַסְתִּי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר לוֹ דָּוִד לְשָׁאוּל: מִן הַתּוֹרָה בֶּן הֲרִיגָה אַתָּה, שֶׁהֲרֵי רוֹדֵף אַתָּה, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: בָּא לְהׇרְגְּךָ — הַשְׁכֵּם לְהָרְגוֹ, אֶלָּא צְנִיעוּת שֶׁהָיְתָה בְּךָ, הִיא חָסָה עָלֶיךָ.
human_translation: And he said? It should And I said. And you spared? It should And I spared. Rabbi Elazar said: David said to Saul: By Torah law, you should be killed, as you are a pursuer and the Torah says: If one comes to kill you, kill him first. But it was the modesty that you displayed that spared you.
llm_translation: "And he said," "and you shall say" - what does it come to teach him? "And she hid," "and I hid" - what does it come to teach him? Rabbi Elazar said: David said to Saul: 'You are deserving of death according to the Torah, for you are pursuing me, and the Torah says: If someone comes to kill you, rise early to kill him. However, the modesty that was in you, it has had mercy on you.'

hebrew_text: וּמַאי הִיא? — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא אֶל גִּדְרוֹת הַצֹּאן עַל הַדֶּרֶךְ וְשָׁם מְעָרָה וַיָּבֹא שָׁאוּל לְהָסֵךְ אֶת רַגְלָיו״. תָּנָא: גָּדֵר לִפְנִים מִן גָּדֵר, וּמְעָרָה לִפְנִים מִמְּעָרָה לְהָסֵךְ. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁסִּיכֵּךְ עַצְמוֹ כְּסוּכָּה.
human_translation: And what is this As it is written: “And he came to the sheepcotes by the way, where there was a cave, and Saul went in to cover his feet, It was taught There was a fence within a fence, and a cave within a cave, to cover Rabbi Elazar said: teaches that, he covered himself like a sukka .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is it? — As it is written: "And he came to the sheepfolds by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover his feet." It was taught: A fence within a fence, and a cave within a cave for covering. Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that one should cover himself like a sukkah.

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּקָם דָּוִד וַיִּכְרֹת אֶת כְּנַף הַמְּעִיל אֲשֶׁר לְשָׁאוּל בַּלָּט״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמְבַזֶּה אֶת הַבְּגָדִים, סוֹף אֵינוֹ נֶהֱנֶה מֵהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד זָקֵן בָּא בַּיָּמִים וַיְכַסֻּהוּ בַּבְּגָדִים וְלֹא יִחַם לוֹ״.
human_translation: “Then David arose, and cut off the corner of Saul’s robe privily” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Anyone who treats clothing with contempt, ultimately he will not benefit from as it is stated: “Now King David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he could get no heat”
llm_translation: "And David arose and cut off the corner of Saul's robe," Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Anyone who degrades garments, in the end, does not benefit from them, as it is stated: "Now King David was old, advanced in years, and they covered him with garments, but he could not get warm."

hebrew_text: ״אִם ה׳ הֱסִיתְךָ בִי יָרַח מִנְחָה״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדָוִד: ״מֵסִית״ קָרֵית לִי? הֲרֵי אֲנִי מַכְשִׁילְךָ בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן יוֹדְעִים אוֹתוֹ. דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי תִשָּׂא אֶת רֹאשׁ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְקֻדֵיהֶם וְנָתְנוּ אִישׁ כֹּפֶר נַפְשׁוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. מִיָּד, ״וַיַּעֲמֹד שָׂטָן עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסֶת אֶת דָּוִד בָּהֶם לֵאמֹר לֵךְ מְנֵה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְכֵיוָן דִּמְנִינְהוּ לָא שְׁקַל מִינַּיְיהוּ כּוֹפֶר. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתֵּן ה׳ דֶּבֶר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מֵהַבֹּקֶר וְעַד עֵת מוֹעֵד״.
human_translation: “If it be the Lord that has incited you against me, let Him accept an offering” Rabbi Elazar said the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to David: Do you call Me an inciter? I will cause you to fail in a matter that even schoolchildren know, as it is written: “When you take the sum of the children of Israel, according to their number, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul Immediately “Satan stood up against Israel it is written: and He incited David against them, saying: Go, number Israel and Judea” And when he counted them, he did not take a ransom from them, as it is written: “So the Lord sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the appointed time”
llm_translation: "If the Lord has incited you against me, let Him accept a meal-offering," Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to David: "Have I incited you?" Behold, I cause you to stumble in a matter that even the schoolchildren of the house of Rabban know. As it is written: 'When you take a census of the children of Israel according to their numbers, each shall give to the Lord a ransom for his life, etc.' Immediately, 'Satan stood up against Israel,' and it is written: 'And he incited David against them, saying, "Go, number Israel."' And since he counted them, he did not take ransom from them. As it is written: 'So the Lord sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning until the appointed time.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עֵת מוֹעֵד״? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חַתְנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִשְּׁעַת שְׁחִיטַת הַתָּמִיד עַד שְׁעַת זְרִיקָתוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: עַד חֲצוֹת מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: What the appointed time? Shmuel the elder, father-in-law of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina: from when the daily offering is slaughtered until when is sprinkled. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: precisely until noon.
llm_translation: What is "appointed time"? Shmuel the Elder, the father-in-law of Rabbi Chanina, in the name of Rabbi Chanina, said: From the time of the slaughtering of the daily offering until the time of its sprinkling. Rabbi Yochanan said: Until midnight exactly.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לַמַּלְאָךְ הַמַּשְׁחִית בָּעָם רַב״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמַלְאָךְ: טוֹל לִי רַב שֶׁבָּהֶם, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶם כַּמָּה חוֹבוֹת. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה מֵת אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן צְרוּיָה, שֶׁשָּׁקוּל כְּרוּבָּהּ שֶׁל סַנְהֶדְרִין.
human_translation: and said to the angel that destroyed the many [ rav ] people: Rabbi Elazar said the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the angel: Take for me a great one [ rav ] from among them, who is worthy of defraying several debts. at that moment Avishai ben Tzeruya, who was equivalent to the majority of the Sanhedrin, died.
llm_translation: "And He said to the destroying angel among the people, 'Enough!'." Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to the angel: 'Take for Me a great rabbi from among them, who has enough merits to atone for them. At that moment Avishai the son of Zeruiah died, who was equal in weight to the Sanhedrin's cherub."

hebrew_text: ״וּבְהַשְׁחִית רָאָה ה׳ וַיִּנָּחֶם״, מַאי רָאָה?
human_translation: “The Lord beheld, and He repented him What did the Lord behold?
llm_translation: "And in the destruction, Hashem saw and relented," what did He see?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: רָאָה יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר יַעֲקֹב כַּאֲשֶׁר רָאָם״. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֶפְרוֹ שֶׁל יִצְחָק רָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים יִרְאֶה לּוֹ הַשֶּׂה״.
human_translation: Rav said: He saw the patriarch, Jacob, “And Jacob said when he saw them [ ra’am ]: And Shmuel said: He saw Isaac’s ashes, as it is said “God will provide [ yireh ] Himself the lamb for a burnt-offering”
llm_translation: Rav said: Jacob our father saw, as it is written: "And Jacob said, as he saw them." And Samuel said: Ephraim, the son of Isaac, saw, as it is stated: "God will provide himself the lamb."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר: כֶּסֶף כִּפּוּרִים רָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ אֶת כֶּסֶף הַכִּפּוּרִים מֵאֵת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ רָאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּהַר ה׳ יֵרָאֶה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: He saw the money of atonement as it is stated: “And you shall take the atonement money from the children of Israel, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He saw the Temple, as it is written: “On the mount where the Lord is seen [ yera’e ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: "He saw the money of atonements," as it is stated: "And you shall take the money of atonements from the children of Israel, etc." Rabbi Yochanan said: "He saw the Temple," as it is written: "On the mountain of the Lord, He will be seen."

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בָּהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי. חַד אָמַר כֶּסֶף הַכִּפּוּרִים רָאָה, וְחַד אָמַר בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ רָאָה. וּמִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ רָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר הַיּוֹם בְּהַר ה׳ יֵרָאֶה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi and Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, differed One said: He saw the money of atonement, and one said: He saw the Temple. And   stands to reason like the one who says   he saw the Temple, as it is stated: as it is said to this day: On the mount where the Lord is seen”
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi and Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani. One said he saw the money of the atonements, and one said he saw the Temple. And it is logical like the one who said he saw the Temple, as it is stated: "What is said today on the mountain of the Lord will be seen."

hebrew_text: לֹא יִכָּנֵס אָדָם לְהַר הַבַּיִת בְּמַקְלוֹ וְכוּ׳. מַאי ״קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא״? אָמַר רָבָא: קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא כִּשְׁמָהּ. וְרַב חָנָא בַּר אַדָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי אָמַר: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אִינָשׁ: ״אַדְּמַקֵּיפְנָא אַדָּרֵי, אֵיעוּל בְּהָא״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא — מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא.
human_translation: a person may not enter the Temple Mount with his staff What kappandarya ? Rava said: Kappandarya, as its name Rav Ḥana bar Adda in the name of Rav Sama, son of Rav Mari, said: as people say: Instead of circumventing the rows [ ademakifna adarei ], I will enter this [ ei’ol beha ] Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: one who enters a synagogue not to make it a shortcut is permitted to make it a shortcut
llm_translation: A person may not enter the Temple Mount with his staff, etc. What is "Kappendarya"? Rava said: Kappendarya is its name. And Rav Hanah bar Adda in the name of Rav Sama son of Rav Mari said: Just as one says, "I will encircle the city, and I will go in it." Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: One who enters the synagogue with the intention of not making a vow - it is permitted to make a vow.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: אִם הָיָה שְׁבִיל מֵעִיקָּרוֹ — מוּתָּר. אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת לְהִתְפַּלֵּל, מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְבֹא עַם הָאָרֶץ לִפְנֵי ה׳ בַּמּוֹעֲדִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: If it was originally a path one is permitted Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: One who enters a synagogue to pray is permitted to make it a shortcut, as it is stated: “But when the people of the land shall come before the Lord in the appointed seasons,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: If the path was from its beginning - permitted. Rabbi Helbo said in the name of Rav Huna: One who enters the synagogue to pray, is permitted to make a Kappendarya. As it is said: "And when the common people come before the Lord at the appointed times, etc."

hebrew_text: וּרְקִיקָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הָרוֹקֵק בְּהַר הַבַּיִת בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה, כְּאִילּוּ רוֹקֵק בְּבַת עֵינוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינַי וְלִבִּי שָׁם כָּל הַיָּמִים״.
human_translation: spitting through an a fortiori inference. Rav Beivai said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who spits on the Temple Mount, today, it is as if he spit in the pupil of eye, as it is stated: “And My eyes and My heart shall be there perpetually”
llm_translation: "And a spit is more stringent. Rav Beivi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Anyone who spits on the wall of the house nowadays, it is as though he spits in the pupil of His eye, as it is said: 'And My eyes and My heart shall be there all the days.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רְקִיקָה בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת — שַׁרְיָא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמִּנְעָל. מָה מִנְעָל בְּהַר הַבַּיִת אָסוּר, בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת מוּתָּר. אַף רְקִיקָה, בְּהַר הַבַּיִת הוּא דְּאָסוּר, בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Spitting in a synagogue is permitted, just as in the case of shoes. Just as wearing shoes is prohibited on the Temple Mount permitted in a synagogue, so, too, spitting is prohibited on the Temple Mount permitted in a synagogue.
llm_translation: Rava said: A pancake in the synagogue - it is permitted, since it is considered a lock. Just as a lock on the door of the house is prohibited, in the synagogue it is permitted. Likewise, a pancake, on the door of the house it is prohibited, in the synagogue it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא לְרָבָא: אַדְּיָלֵיף מִמִּנְעָל, נֵילַף מִקַּפֶּנְדַּרְיָא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava, and some say Ravina said to Rava, and some say that Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Rava: Instead of deriving from a shoe, derive it from a shortcut.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava, and some say it was Ravina to Rava, and some say it was Rav Adda bar Matna to Rava: "If one can remove the issue from the shoe, let him remove it from the sandal!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ: תַּנָּא יָלֵיף מִמִּנְעָל, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ מִקַּפֶּנְדַּרְיָא?! מַאי הִיא? — דְּתַנְיָא לֹא יִכָּנֵס אָדָם לְהַר הַבַּיִת לֹא בְּמַקְלוֹ שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ, וְלֹא בְּמִנְעָלוֹ שֶׁבְּרַגְלוֹ, וְלֹא בְּמָעוֹת הַצְּרוּרִים לוֹ בִּסְדִינוֹ, וּבְפוּנְדָּתוֹ מוּפְשֶׁלֶת לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְלֹא יַעֲשֶׂנָּה קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא. וּרְקִיקָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר מִמִּנְעָל: וּמָה מִנְעָל, שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״שַׁל נְעָלֶיךָ מֵעַל רַגְלֶיךָ״. רְקִיקָה, שֶׁהִיא דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: said to him: tanna derives from a shoe, and you say from a shortcut? What is this As it was taught One may neither enter the Temple Mount with his staff in his hand, nor with his shoes on his feet, nor with money tied in his cloth and with his money-belt slung behind him, nor make it a shortcut. All the more so, spitting a fortiori from a shoe. Just as a shoe, which is generally not considered contemptuous, the Torah said: “Put off your shoes from off your feet, for the place upon which you stand is holy ground” all the more so spitting, which is considered contemptuous,
llm_translation: He said to him: "It was taught: One may ascend from a sandal, and you say from a sandal-strap?! What is it? — For it was taught: A person may not enter the Temple Mount with his staff in his hand, nor with his sandal on his foot, nor with money pouches in his belt, nor with a purse slung over his shoulder, nor may he make it a sandal-strap. And a sandal is more stringent than a staff: Just as a sandal, which is not a way of disgrace, the Torah said: 'Remove your sandals from your feet.' A sandal, which is a way of disgrace — all the more so?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי אֵין לָבוֹא אֶל שַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ בִּלְבוּשׁ שָׂק״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה שַׂק, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מָאוּס, לִפְנֵי בָּשָׂר וָדָם — כָּךְ. רְקִיקָה, שֶׁהִיא מְאוּסָה, לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, says: This is unnecessary. It says: “For none may enter within the king’s gate clothed with sackcloth” This matter a fortiori : Just as sackcloth, which is not repulsive before flesh and blood, is all the more so spitting, which is repulsive, before the King of Kings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: It is not necessary. For he says: "For one should not come to the king's gate in sackcloth." Are these not logical arguments? Just as sackcloth, which is not despised, is inappropriate before flesh and blood, so too a thin garment, which is despised, is inappropriate before the King of Kings. Shouldn't this be all the more so?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא: נֵימָא הָכָא לְחוּמְרָא וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא,
human_translation: said to Rava: I say the following: Let us say, be stringent here, and be stringent here,
llm_translation: He said to him: I thus say: Say here for stringency and say here for stringency.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: הַר הַבַּיִת דְּאָסוּר בְּמִנְעָל — לֵילְפֵהּ מִמִּנְעָל. אֲבָל בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת דִּשְׁרֵי בְּמִנְעָל, אַדְּיָלֵיף מִמִּנְעָל וּלְהֶיתֵּר, נֵילַף מִקַּפֶּנְדַּרְיָא וּלְאִסּוּר!
human_translation: and say the Temple Mount, prohibited shoes, let us derive from shoes. However, a synagogue, permitted shoes, instead of deriving from shoes and permitting derive it from a shortcut, and prohibit
llm_translation: And why? The Mount of the Temple, which is forbidden with a shoe - let him lift it with a shoe. But the synagogue, which is permitted with a shoe, it is better to lift it with a shoe and be permitted, than to lift it from the handle and be forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי בֵיתוֹ מָה בֵּיתוֹ, אַקַּפֶּנְדַּרְיָא קָפֵיד אִינָשׁ, אַרְקִיקָה וּמִנְעָל לָא קָפֵיד אִינָשׁ, אַף בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא הוּא דַּאֲסִיר, רְקִיקָה וּמִנְעָל — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said like one’s house. Just as one objects to his house as a shortcut, does not mind spitting and shoes so too synagogue, a shortcut is prohibited spitting and shoes are permitted.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: When it comes to one's house, one is particular about it, requiring a loaf of bread and a shoe to be removed before entering. Even in the synagogue, one is particular about it, requiring a loaf and a shoe - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: כׇּל חוֹתְמֵי בְּרָכוֹת שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: At the conclusion of all blessings in the Temple,
llm_translation: All the sealers of the blessings in the Temple, etc.

hebrew_text: כׇּל כָּךְ לָמָּה — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין עוֹנִין אָמֵן בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ? — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוּמוּ בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד הָעוֹלָם״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וִיבָרְכוּ אֶת שֵׁם כְּבֹדֶךָ וּמְרוֹמַם עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּתְהִלָּה״.
human_translation: Why to that extent? Because one does not answer amen in the Temple. From where that one does not answer amen in the Temple? As it is stated: “Stand up and bless the Lord, your God, from everlasting to everlasting” The verse continues: “And let them say: Blessed be Your glorious name, that is exalted above all blessing and praise”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why is all this so? Because they do not respond "Amen" in the Temple. And from where do we know that they do not respond "Amen" in the Temple? As it is stated: "Bless the Lord your God from this world to the next." And it also says: "And they shall bless Your glorious name, exalted above all blessing and praise."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל כׇּל הַבְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן תְּהֵא לָהֶן תְּהִלָּה אַחַת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּמְרוֹמַם עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּתְהִלָּה״, עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה — תֵּן לוֹ תְּהִלָּה.
human_translation: might all of the blessings there will have a single praise, the verse teaches: “That is exalted above all blessing and praise”; for every blessing, a praise is offered.
llm_translation: I am sorry, but I cannot provide a word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided.

hebrew_text: הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא אָדָם שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹם חֲבֵרוֹ וְכוּ׳. מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״?
human_translation: instituted that a person will greet another Why And it says?
llm_translation: They established that a person should inquire about the well-being of his fellow, etc. What is "and he says"?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בֹּעַז מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר — תָּא שְׁמַע ״ה׳ עִמְּךָ גִּבּוֹר הֶחָיִל״. וְכִי תֵּימָא מַלְאָךְ הוּא דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ לְגִדְעוֹן — תָּא שְׁמַע ״אַל תָּבוּז כִּי זָקְנָה אִמֶּךָ״.
human_translation: And if you say: Boaz said this on his own, come and hear “The Lord is with you, mighty man of valor” And if you say it was an angel who said to Gideon, come hear “And despise not your mother when she is old”
llm_translation: And if you say, Boaz was speaking from his own knowledge — come and hear "the Lord is with you, mighty warrior." And if you say it was an angel speaking to Gideon — come and hear "Do not despise, for your mother is old."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״. אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי קְרָא, מֵרֵישֵׁיהּ לְסֵיפֵיהּ מִדְּרִישׁ, מִסֵּיפֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ מִדְּרִישׁ.
human_translation: And states: “It is time to work for the Lord; they have made void Your Torah” Rava said: This verse interpreted from beginning to end, and interpreted from end to beginning.
llm_translation: And he says: "A time to act for the Lord, they have violated Your Torah." Rava said: This verse, from its beginning to its end, is interpreted from its end to its beginning.

hebrew_text: מֵרֵישֵׁיהּ לְסֵיפֵיהּ מִדְּרִישׁ — ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳״, מַאי טַעַם? — מִשּׁוּם ״הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״. מִסֵּיפֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ מִדְּרִישׁ: ״הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״ מַאי טַעְמָא? — מִשּׁוּם ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳״.
human_translation: interpreted from beginning to end: It is time to work for the Lord; what is the reason? Because they have made void Your Torah, interpreted from end to beginning They have made void Your Torah; what is the reason? Because it is time to work for the Lord.
llm_translation: From its beginning to its end, it is derived - "A time to act for the Lord," what is the reason? - Because of "They have voided Your Torah." From its end to its beginning, it is derived: "They have voided Your Torah," what is the reason? - Because of "A time to act for the Lord."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁעַת הַמַּכְנִיסִין — פַּזֵּר. בִּשְׁעַת הַמְפַזְּרִים — כַּנֵּס. וְאִם רָאִיתָ דּוֹר שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה חֲבִיבָה עָלָיו — פַּזֵּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵשׁ מְפַזֵּר וְנוֹסָף עוֹד״. וְאִם רָאִיתָ דּוֹר שֶׁאֵין הַתּוֹרָה חֲבִיבָה עָלָיו — כַּנֵּס, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: it was taught Hillel the Elder says: At the time of gathering, disseminate At the time of dissemination, gather, And if you see a generation for whom Torah is beloved, disseminate, as it is stated: “There is who scatters, and yet increases” if you see a generation for whom Torah is not beloved, gather; as it is stated: “It is time to work for the Lord; they have made void Your Torah.”
llm_translation: It was taught: Hillel the Elder says: When they are gathering - scatter. When they are scattering - gather. And if you see a generation that the Torah is precious to them - scatter, as it is said: "There are those who scatter and yet increase more." And if you see a generation that the Torah is not precious to them - gather, as it is said: "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: זָלַת — קְבוֹץ קְנֵה מִינַּהּ, בַּאֲתַר דְּלֵית גְּבַר — תַּמָּן הֱוֵי גְּבַר. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, בַּאֲתַר דְּאִית גְּבַר — תַּמָּן לָא תִּהְוֵי גְּבַר.
human_translation: bar Kappara taught: declined, jump and purchase from it; and where there is no man, there be a man; Abaye said: Infer from this where there is a man, there do not be a man.
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: Zalat - gather her produce, in a place where there is no man - there be a man. Abaye said: Hear her produce, in a place where there is a man - there her produce will not be.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם שָׁוִין.
human_translation: obvious? This is only necessary where two who are equal.
llm_translation: Obvious! Not needed except in their six equal.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: אֵיזוֹהִי פָּרָשָׁה קְטַנָּה שֶׁכָּל גּוּפֵי תוֹרָה תְּלוּיִין בָּהּ — ״בְּכָל דְּרָכֶיךָ דָעֵהוּ וְהוּא יְיַשֵּׁר אֹרְחֹתֶיךָ״. אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught: Which is a brief passage upon which all fundamental Torah are dependent? “In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will direct your paths” Rava said: even to acts of transgression,
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: What is the small section in which all the fundamentals of the Torah depend? "In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make straight your paths." Rava said: Even for a matter of transgression.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: לְעוֹלָם יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ אוּמָּנוּת נְקִיָּה וְקַלָּה. מָה הִיא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחְטָא דְתַלְמִיּוּתָא.
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught: A person should always teach his child a clean and simple craft. What Rav Ḥisda said: Cutting precious stones.
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: A person should always teach his son a clean and easy craft. What is it? Rav Ḥisdah said: The craft of needlework.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אַל יַרְבֶּה אָדָם רֵעִים בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ רֵעִים לְהִתְרוֹעֵעַ״.
human_translation: were taught Rabbi says: One should never have too many friends in his house, as it is stated: “There are friends that one has to his own hurt”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: A person should never have too many friends in his house, as it is stated: "A man of many friends will come to ruin."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַל יְמַנֶּה אָדָם אַפֹּטְרוֹפּוֹס בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵי לֹא מִינָּה פּוֹטִיפַר אֶת יוֹסֵף אַפֹּטְרוֹפּוֹס בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ — לֹא בָּא לְאוֹתוֹ דָּבָר.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi says: Do not appoint an administrator [ apitropos ] within your house, as had Potiphar not appointed Joseph as administrator within his house, would not have come to that incident
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says, "A person should not appoint his steward within his own household, for had Potiphar not appointed Joseph as steward within his household, he would not have come to that matter."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה פָּרָשַׁת נָזִיר לְפָרָשַׁת סוֹטָה — לוֹמַר לָךְ שֶׁכָּל הָרוֹאֶה סוֹטָה בְּקִלְקוּלָהּ יַזִּיר עַצְמוֹ מִן הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi says: Why is the portion of the Nazirite juxtaposed with the portion of the sota to tell you that anyone who sees a sota in her disgrace, should renounce wine,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: Why is the portion of Nazir juxtaposed to the portion of Sotah? To tell you that anyone who sees a Sotah in her disgrace should abstain himself from wine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי פַּרְנָךְ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה פָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה לְפָרָשַׁת תְּרוּמוֹת וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת — לוֹמַר לָךְ: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ תְּרוּמוֹת וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת וְאֵינוֹ נוֹתְנָן לַכֹּהֵן, סוֹף נִצְרָךְ לַכֹּהֵן עַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ אֶת קֳדָשָׁיו לוֹ יִהְיוּ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי תִשְׂטֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ״, וּכְתִיב ״וְהֵבִיא הָאִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״ וְגוֹ׳. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא סוֹף שֶׁנִּצְרָךְ לָהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ אֶת קֳדָשָׁיו לוֹ יִהְיוּ״.
human_translation: Ḥizkiya, son of Rabbi Parnakh, said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Why is the portion of sota juxtaposed with the portion of terumot and tithes to tell you: Anyone who has terumot and tithes and does not give them to a priest, ultimately require a priest by means of his wife, as it is stated: “And every man’s hallowed things shall be his” ( To this juxtaposed: “If any man’s wife go aside and act unfaithfully against him” And it is written: “Then shall the man bring his wife unto the priest” Moreover, ultimately will require as it is stated: “And every man’s hallowed things shall be his”
llm_translation: Hizkiyah son of Rabbi Parnakh said, Rabbi Yohanan said: Why was the portion of the suspected adulteress juxtaposed to the portion of the contributions and tithes? To tell you: anyone who has contributions and tithes and does not give them to the priest, ultimately the priest will need them through his wife, as it is stated: "Each man's sacred donations shall be his" (Numbers 5:10). And it is juxtaposed with: "When a man's wife has gone astray" (Numbers 5:12), and it is written: "Then the man shall bring his wife" and so forth. And not only that, but ultimately he will need them, as it is stated: "Each man's sacred donations shall be his" (Numbers 5:10).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: וְאִם נְתָנָן, סוֹף מִתְעַשֵּׁר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן לַכֹּהֵן לוֹ יִהְיֶה״, ״לוֹ יִהְיֶה״ — מָמוֹן הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And if he gave them, ultimately become wealthy, as it is said: “Whatsoever any man gives the priest, it shall be his” much property shall be his.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: And if he gives them, he will eventually become rich, as it is stated: "A man who will give to the kohen, it shall be his." "It shall be his" - a great sum of money.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר בֶּרֶכְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר: כׇּל הַמְשַׁתֵּף שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּצַעֲרוֹ — כּוֹפְלִין לוֹ פַּרְנָסָתוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה שַׁדַּי בְּצָרֶיךָ וְכֶסֶף תּוֹעָפוֹת לָךְ״.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Berekhya said in the name of Rabbi Elazar HaKappar: Anyone who includes the name of heaven in his distress, his livelihood will be doubled, as it is stated: “And the Almighty be your treasure, and precious [ toafot ] silver unto you”
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Berechiah said in the name of Rabbi Elazar HaKappar: Anyone who shares the name of Heaven in his distress - they double his livelihood for him. As it is stated: "And the Almighty will be your treasure, and precious silver for you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: פַּרְנָסָתוֹ מְעוֹפֶפֶת לוֹ כְּצִפּוֹר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֶסֶף תּוֹעָפוֹת לָךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said his sustenance flies [ meofefet ] to him like a bird, as it is stated: “And precious silver [ toafot ] unto you.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: His sustenance is flying to him like a bird, as it is stated: "And silver shall fly to you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: כׇּל הַמַּרְפֶּה עַצְמוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֵין בּוֹ כֹּחַ לַעֲמוֹד בְּיוֹם צָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִתְרַפִּיתָ בְּיוֹם צָרָה צַר כֹּחֶכָה״. אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי בַּר מַתְנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וַאֲפִילּוּ מִצְוָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִתְרַפִּיתָ״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Tavi said in the name of Rabbi Yoshiya: Anyone who is lax in his matters of Torah will lack the strength to stand on a day of adversity, as it is stated: “If you faint in the day of adversity, your strength is small indeed” Rav Ami bar Mattana said Shmuel said: And even a single as it is stated: If you faint; in any case,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Tavi said Rabbi Yoshiyah: Anyone who weakens himself from the words of Torah, he does not have the strength to stand on the day of distress, as it is stated: "If you falter in a time of trouble, how small is your strength." Said Rav Ammi bar Matna said Shmuel: Even from one commandment, as it is stated "If you falter" - from any place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי: כְּשֶׁיָּרַד חֲנִינָא בֶּן אֲחִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לַגּוֹלָה, הָיָה מְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְקוֹבֵעַ חֳדָשִׁים בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: Rabbi Abbahu would relate: When Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yehoshua’s brother, went to the Diaspora, he would intercalate years and establish months outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: Rabbi Avahu used to say: When Chanina, the son of Achi, the son of Rabbi Yehoshua, would go down to exile, he would pass years and establish months outside of the land.

hebrew_text: שִׁגְּרוּ אַחֲרָיו שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר, וּבֶן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל זְכַרְיָה בֶּן קְבוּטָל. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה אוֹתָם, אָמַר לָהֶם: לָמָּה בָּאתֶם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה בָּאנוּ. הִכְרִיז עֲלֵיהֶם: אֲנָשִׁים הַלָּלוּ גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר הֵם וַאֲבוֹתֵיהֶם שִׁמְּשׁוּ בְּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ. כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: זְכַרְיָה בֶּן קְבוּטָל אוֹמֵר: הַרְבֵּה פְּעָמִים קָרִיתִי לְפָנָיו, בְּסֵפֶר דָּנִיאֵל.
human_translation: sent two Torah scholars after him, Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar and the grandson of Zekharya ben Kevutal. When saw them, he asked them: Why did you come? They responded: We came to study Torah. he proclaimed about them: These people are eminent of our generation, and their fathers served in the Temple. As we learned Zekharya ben Kevutal says: Many times I read before the book of Daniel
llm_translation: They followed after him two disciples of the sages, Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar, and the son of Zechariah ben Kevutal. When he saw them, he said to them: Why have you come? They said to him: We have come to study Torah. He proclaimed concerning them: These men are great of the generation and their ancestors served in the Temple. Like that which we learned: Zechariah ben Kevutal says: Many times have I read before Him in the book of Daniel.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל הוּא מְטַמֵּא וְהֵם מְטַהֲרִים, הוּא אוֹסֵר וְהֵם מַתִּירִים. הִכְרִיז עֲלֵיהֶם: אֲנָשִׁים הַלָּלוּ שֶׁל שָׁוְא הֵם, שֶׁל תֹּהוּ הֵם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּבָר בָּנִיתָ וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לִסְתּוֹר, כְּבָר גָּדַרְתָּ וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לִפְרוֹץ.
human_translation: He impure and they pure; he prohibited and they permitted he proclaimed about them: These people are worthless. They are for nothing They said to him: You have already built you cannot now demolish. You have already built a fence and you cannot break through it.
llm_translation: He began to render impure, while they render pure; he prohibits, while they permit. He proclaimed concerning them: "These men are of vanity, they are of chaos." They said to him: "You have already built, and you cannot destroy; you have already fenced, and you cannot breach."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֲנִי מְטַמֵּא וְאַתֶּם מְטַהֲרִים, אֲנִי אוֹסֵר וְאַתֶּם מַתִּירִים? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאַתָּה מְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְקוֹבֵעַ חֳדָשִׁים בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: He said to them: Why is it that I impure, you pure; I prohibit you permit They said to him: because you intercalate the years and establish the months outside of Eretz
llm_translation: He said to them: "Why am I becoming impure while you are becoming pure? I prohibit and you permit?" They said to him: "Because you pass over years and establish months outside of the land."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: וַהֲלֹא עֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף, הָיָה מְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְקוֹבֵעַ חֳדָשִׁים בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַנַּח רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ כְּמוֹתוֹ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף אֲנִי לֹא הִנַּחְתִּי כְּמוֹתִי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: גְּדָיִים שֶׁהִנַּחְתָּ נַעֲשׂוּ תְּיָשִׁים בַּעֲלֵי קַרְנַיִם, וְהֵם שִׁגְּרוּנוּ אֶצְלְךָ, וְכֵן אָמְרוּ לָנוּ: לְכוּ וְאִמְרוּ לוֹ בִּשְׁמֵנוּ: אִם שׁוֹמֵעַ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — יְהֵא בְּנִדּוּי.
human_translation: He said to them: Didn’t Akiva ben Yosef intercalate years and establish months outside of Eretz They replied to him: Leave Rabbi Akiva, as, he did not leave behind anyone as he in Eretz Yisrael. said to them: I also did not leave behind anyone as me in Eretz Yisrael. They said to him: The kids who you left behind have grown into goats with horns; And they sent us to you, and this is what they said to us: Go and tell him in our name: If he obeys, fine; and if not he will be ostracized.
llm_translation: He said to them: Wasn't Akiva ben Yosef, who was crossing years and establishing months outside of the land? They said to him: Leave Rabbi Akiva alone, for he did not leave like his death in the land of Israel. He said to them: I also did not leave like my death in the land of Israel. They said to him: The goats that you left became wild goats with horns, and they grazed near you, and they also said to us: Go and tell him in our name: If he listens — good, and if not — let him be excommunicated.

hebrew_text: וְאִמְרוּ לְאַחֵינוּ שֶׁבַּגּוֹלָה: אִם שׁוֹמְעִין — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו, יַעֲלוּ לְהַר, אֲחִיָּה יִבְנֶה מִזְבֵּחַ, חֲנַנְיָה יְנַגֵּן בְּכִנּוֹר, וְיִכְפְּרוּ כּוּלָּם, וְיֹאמְרוּ אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק בֵּאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And tell our brethren in exile: If they obey fine; and if not They should climb a mountain; Aḥiya, will build an altar, Ḥananya, will play the lute, and all will heresy and say that they have no portion in the God of Israel.
llm_translation: And they said to our brothers in exile: If they listen - good, but if not, they shall ascend the mountain, Ahijah shall build an altar, Hananiah shall play on the lyre, and they shall all atone, and they shall say, "They have no portion in the God of Israel."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד גָּעוּ כׇּל הָעָם בִּבְכִיָּה וְאָמְרוּ: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם, יֵשׁ לָנוּ חֵלֶק בֵּאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: immediately the entire nation burst into tears, saying: God forbid. We do have a portion in the God of Israel.
llm_translation: Immediately all the people touched with weeping and said: "Pity and peace, we have a portion in the God of Israel."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מִצִּיּוֹן תֵּצֵא תוֹרָה וּדְבַר ה׳ מִירוּשָׁלָיִם״.
human_translation: Why to that extent Because it is stated: “For out of Zion shall go forth the Torah, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem”
llm_translation: And all this, why? Because it is stated: "For out of Zion shall go forth the Torah, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא הוּא מְטַהֵר, וְהֵם מְטַמְּאִין — לְחוּמְרָא. אֶלָּא הוּא מְטַמֵּא וְהֵם מְטַהֲרִין, הֵיכִי הָוֵי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: חָכָם שֶׁטִּמֵּא — אֵין חֲבֵרוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְטַהֵר, אָסַר — אֵין חֲבֵרוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְהַתִּיר! קָסָבְרִי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִגָּרְרוּ בָּתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Granted, pure and impure; stringently. But he impure and they pure, what are Was it not taught If a Sage impure, his colleague is not permitted pure; prohibited his colleague may not permit They held so that people would not be drawn after him;
llm_translation: In peace he purifies, and they defile - to be stringent. Rather, he defiles and they purify, how is this so? And it was taught: A wise person who renders impure - his colleague is not permitted to purify, if he forbids - his colleague is not permitted to permit! They maintain this so that they will not be dragged after him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן כְּשֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ לַכֶּרֶם בְּיַבְנֶה, הָיוּ שָׁם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. פָּתְחוּ כּוּלָּם בִּכְבוֹד אַכְסַנְיָא וְדָרְשׁוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: When our Rabbis, entered the vineyard, in Yavne, Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Neḥemya, and Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, were there They all began in honor of hosts, and they taught.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: When our Rabbis entered the vineyard in Yavneh, Rabbi Yehudah, Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Nechemiah, and Rabbi Eliezer, the son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean were there. They all began with words of honor and then expounded.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח רַבִּי יְהוּדָה רֹאשׁ הַמְדַבְּרִים בְּכָל מָקוֹם בִּכְבוֹד תּוֹרָה, וְדָרַשׁ: ״וּמֹשֶׁה יִקַּח אֶת הָאֹהֶל וְנָטָה לוֹ מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֲרוֹן ה׳ שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מְרוּחָק אֶלָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״וְהָיָה כׇּל מְבַקֵּשׁ ה׳ יֵצֵא אֶל אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁהוֹלְכִים מֵעִיר לָעִיר וּמִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, head of the speakers in every place, opened in honor of Torah, and taught: “Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, Isn’t this an a fortiori inference? Just as the Torah says the ark of God, which was only twelve mil from the camp: “Every seeker of God went out unto the Tent of Meeting”; all the more so Torah scholars, go from city to city and country to country to study Torah,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda began speaking with honor for the Torah in every place, and expounded: "And Moses took the tent and pitched it outside the camp." Is this not a logical inference: Just as the Ark of the Lord was not far away, only twelve mil, as the Torah says, "And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the tent of meeting" — how much more so the Torah scholars who travel from city to city and from province to province to study Torah, how much more so.

hebrew_text: ״וְדִבֶּר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה פָּנִים אֶל פָּנִים״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: מֹשֶׁה, אֲנִי וְאַתָּה נַסְבִּיר פָּנִים בַּהֲלָכָה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי כָּךְ אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֲנִי הִסְבַּרְתִּי לְךָ פָּנִים, כָּךְ אַתָּה הַסְבֵּר פָּנִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהַחֲזֵר הָאֹהֶל לִמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: “And the Lord spoke unto Moses, face to face” Rabbi Yitzḥak said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, you and I will show cheerful faces in halakha Some say the Holy One, Blessed be He, told Moses: Just as I showed you a cheerful face, so too you will show Israel a cheerful face and restore the tent to its place
llm_translation: "And Hashem spoke to Moses 'face to face'," Rabbi Yitzchak said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, I and you will explain halacha face to face. There are those who say that thus said the Holy One, blessed be He, to Moses: Just as I have explained to you face to face, so shall you explain face to face to the children of Israel, and the tent returned to its place."

hebrew_text: ״וְשָׁב אֶל הַמַּחֲנֶה״ וְגוֹ׳, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: עַכְשָׁיו יֹאמְרוּ הָרַב בְּכַעַס וְתַלְמִיד בְּכַעַס, יִשְׂרָאֵל מַה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶם? אִם אַתָּה מַחֲזִיר הָאֹהֶל לִמְקוֹמוֹ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן תַּלְמִידְךָ מְשָׁרֵת תַּחְתֶּיךָ.
human_translation: “And he would return into the camp; Rabbi Abbahu said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, told Moses: Now, The Master, is angry and student, angry, and what will happen to Israel? If you restore the tent to its place, fine; and if not, Joshua bin-Nun, your student, serve in your place.
llm_translation: "And he shall return to the camp," etc. Rabbi Abbahu said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Now let the master speak in anger and the disciple in anger, what will become of Israel? If you return the tent to its place - it is good, but if not, Joshua the son of Nun, your disciple, will serve in your place.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׁב אֶל הַמַּחֲנֶה״. אָמַר רָבָא: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן, לֹא יָצָא הַדָּבָר לְבַטָּלָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמְשָׁרְתוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן נַעַר לֹא יָמִישׁ מִתּוֹךְ הָאֹהֶל״.
human_translation: And that is what is written: “And he would return into the camp; Rava said: Nevertheless, the statement was not uttered for naught. “But his minister, Joshua bin-Nun, a young man, departed not out of the Tent.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And this is what is written: 'And he shall return to the camp.'" Rava said: Even so, the matter did not go out to be annulled. As it is stated: "And his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, a young man, did not depart from within the tent."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד פָּתַח רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בִּכְבוֹד תּוֹרָה וְדָרַשׁ: ״הַסְכֵּת וּשְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה נִהְיֵיתָ לְעָם״, וְכִי אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם נִתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל? וַהֲלֹא אוֹתוֹ יוֹם סוֹף אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה הָיָה! אֶלָּא לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁחֲבִיבָה תּוֹרָה עַל לוֹמְדֶיהָ בְּכָל יוֹם וָיוֹם כַּיּוֹם שֶׁנִּתְּנָה מֵהַר סִינַי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda again began in honor of Torah and taught: “Keep silence [ hasket ] and hear, Israel; this day you have become a people Was the Torah given to Israel on that day? Wasn’t that day at the end of forty years Rather, to teach that each and every day the Torah is as dear to those who study it, as on the day it was given from Mount Sinai.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda began with the honor of Torah and expounded: "Hear, O Israel, today you have become a people" (Deuteronomy 27:9). But was the Torah given to Israel on that very day? Wasn't that day the conclusion of forty years? Rather, it is to teach you that Torah is beloved to those who study it every day as on the day it was given from Mount Sinai.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ: תֵּדַע — שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית, וְעֶרֶב אֶחָד אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא — דּוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁלֹּא קָרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע מֵעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, of the village of Akko, said: Know as one who recites Shema , morning and evening, does not recite it one evening, it is as if he never recited Shema .
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum son of Rabbi Hiyya, a man of Kfar Akko, said: Know that since a person recites the Shema in the morning and evening, and one evening he does not recite it, it is as if he has never recited the Shema at all.

hebrew_text: ״הַסְכֵּת״ — עֲשׂוּ כִּתּוֹת כִּתּוֹת וְעִסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה. לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַתּוֹרָה נִקְנֵית אֶלָּא בַּחֲבוּרָה. כִּדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״חֶרֶב אֶל הַבַּדִּים וְנֹאָלוּ״ — חֶרֶב עַל שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִים בַּד בְּבַד וְעוֹסְקִים בַּתּוֹרָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁמִּטַּפְּשִׁים, כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְנֹאָלוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״אֲשֶׁר נוֹאַלְנוּ״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁחוֹטְאִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַאֲשֶׁר חָטָאנוּ״.
human_translation: hasket Form [ asu ] many groups [ kitot ] and study Torah, for the Torah is only acquired in a group. in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina; as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is that which is written: “A sword is upon the boasters [ habaddim ], and they shall become fools [ noalu ]” A sword upon the enemies of Torah scholars, who sit alone [ bad bevad ] and study Torah. And furthermore, grow foolish, as it is written here, noalu , and elsewhere it is written “For that we have done foolishly [ noalnu ]” And furthermore, they sin as it is stated: and for that we have sinned.”
llm_translation: "Haskeit" — make groups, groups, and engage in Torah. Because the Torah is acquired only through association. Like Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: What is the meaning of "A sword upon the idolaters, and they shall be dismayed"? — A sword upon the enemies of the Torah scholars who sit together and engage in Torah. Moreover, they are negligent, as it is written here "and they shall be dismayed," and it is written there "whom we have neglected." Furthermore, they sin, as it says "and we have sinned."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״נוֹאֲלוּ שָׂרֵי צֹעַן״.
human_translation: If you wish, say from here: “The princes of Tzoan are become fools [ noalu ]”
llm_translation: If you ask, say from here: "The princes of Zoan have become fools."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״הַסְכֵּת וּשְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — כַּתְּתוּ עַצְמְכֶם עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. כִּדְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּמִית עַצְמוֹ עָלֶיהָ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֹאת הַתּוֹרָה אָדָם כִּי יָמוּת בְּאֹהֶל״.
human_translation: an alternative “Keep silence [ hasket ] and hear, Israel”; break [ kattetu ] yourselves over words of the Torah. in accordance with Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish said: From where that matters of Torah are only retained by one who kills himself over it? As it is stated: “This is the Torah: When one dies in a tent”
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Hear, O Israel" - make yourself like dry bones for the words of Torah. As Reish Lakish said, as Reish Lakish said: From where do we know that the words of Torah are only upheld by one who makes himself like dry bones for it? As it is stated: "This is the Torah when a man dies in a tent."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״הַסְכֵּת וּשְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — הַס, וְאַחַר כָּךְ כַּתֵּת. כִּדְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם יִלְמוֹד אָדָם תּוֹרָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יֶהֱגֶה.
human_translation: alternative explanation “Keep silence [ hasket ] and hear, Israel”; be silent [ has ] then analyze [ kattet ] in accordance with Rava, as Rava said: One must always study Torah and then analyze
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Hear, O Israel" - 'Hear' and afterwards 'Understand.' Like Rava, as Rava said: A person should always study Torah, and afterwards contemplate.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי מִיץ חָלָב יוֹצִיא חֶמְאָה וּמִיץ אַף יוֹצִיא דָם וּמִיץ אַפַּיִם יוֹצִיא רִיב״?
human_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yannai they said: What is that which is written: “For the churning of milk brings forth curd, and the wringing of the nose [ af ] brings forth blood, so the forcing of wrath [ appayim ] brings forth strife”
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: What is the meaning of what is written, "For the churning of milk brings forth butter, and the wringing of the nose brings forth blood, so the forcing of wrath brings forth strife"?

hebrew_text: בְּמִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא חֶמְאָה שֶׁל תּוֹרָה — בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּקִיא חָלָב שֶׁיָּנַק מִשְׁדֵּי אִמּוֹ עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: in whom do you find the cream of Torah? With one who spits out the milk that he nursed from his mother’s breasts over it;
llm_translation: In whose water do you find the butter of Torah? In the water that a baby suckles from his mother's breasts.

hebrew_text: ״וּמִיץ אַף יוֹצִיא דָם״ — כׇּל תַּלְמִיד שֶׁכּוֹעֵס עָלָיו רַבּוֹ פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וְשׁוֹתֵק — זוֹכֶה לְהַבְחִין בֵּין דָּם טָמֵא לְדָם טָהוֹר.
human_translation: And the wringing of the nose brings forth blood, any student whose rabbi is angry [ af ] with him the first time and he is silent will merit to distinguish between blood that is ritually impure and blood that is ritually pure.
llm_translation: "And one who squeezes out anger, blood comes out" - every student who his teacher becomes angry at him the first time and remains silent - he merits to distinguish between impure blood and pure blood.

hebrew_text: ״וּמִיץ אַפַּיִם יוֹצִיא רִיב״ — כׇּל תַּלְמִיד שֶׁכּוֹעֵס עָלָיו רַבּוֹ פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה וְשׁוֹתֵק — זוֹכֶה לְהַבְחִין בֵּין דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת לְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּתְחַכֵּם — יַעֲסוֹק בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, שֶׁאֵין לָךְ מִקְצוֹעַ בַּתּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מֵהֶן, שֶׁהֵן כְּמַעְיָן נוֹבֵעַ.
human_translation: And the forcing of wrath [ appayim ] brings forth strife; any student whose rabbi is angry with him for the first and second times, and he is silent, merits to distinguish between monetary cases, and capital cases, As we learned Rabbi Yishmael says: One who seeks to become wise should engage in monetary laws, as there is no greater discipline in Torah, as they are like a flowing well
llm_translation: "And one who restrains his anger, it is as if he has abolished strife" - every student whom his teacher angers him once, twice, and remains silent - he merits to distinguish between monetary laws and laws of life. As we learned, Rabbi Yishmael says: One who wishes to become wise should engage in monetary laws, for you have no profession in the Torah greater than them, for they are like a flowing spring.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אִם נָבַלְתָּ בְהִתְנַשֵּׂא וְאִם זַמּוֹתָ יָד לְפֶה״ — כׇּל הַמְנַבֵּל עַצְמוֹ עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — סוֹפוֹ לְהִתְנַשֵּׂא. וְאִם זָמַם — יָד לְפֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: What is that which is written: “If you have done foolishly in lifting up yourself, or if you have planned devices [ zamota ], lay your hand over your mouth” Anyone who abases himself over matters of Torah, will ultimately be exalted. And if he muzzles [ zamam ] himself hand over mouth,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: What is the meaning of the verse, "If you have been foolish in exalting yourself, or if you have devised evil, put your hand over your mouth"? Anyone who makes himself foolish regarding matters of Torah - his end will be to exalt himself. And if he devises evil - hand to mouth.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה בִּכְבוֹד אַכְסַנְיָא וְדָרַשׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל הַקֵּינִי לְכוּ סֻּרוּ רְדוּ מִתּוֹךְ עֲמָלֵקִי פֶּן אוֹסִפְךָ עִמּוֹ וְאַתָּה עָשִׂיתָה חֶסֶד עִם כׇּל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״? וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה יִתְרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא קֵרַב אֶת מֹשֶׁה אֶלָּא לִכְבוֹד עַצְמוֹ — כָּךְ, הַמְאָרֵחַ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וּמַאֲכִילוֹ וּמַשְׁקֵהוּ וּמְהַנֵּהוּ מִנְּכָסָיו — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya began in honor of the hosts and taught: What is that which is written: “And Saul said unto the Kenites: Go, depart, get you down from among the Amalekites lest I destroy you with them, for you showed kindness to all the Children of Israel when they came up out of Egypt” Isn’t this an a fortiori inference: Just as Jethro, only befriended Moses for his own honor, in this way all the more so one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home, providing him with food and drink and availing him of his possessions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah began with honor of hospitality and expounded: What is the meaning of the verse, "And Saul said to the Kenite, 'Go, depart, go down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them, for you showed kindness to all the children of Israel'"? Are these not logical arguments: If one who did not bring Moses close except for his own honor — so too, one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home, and feeds him, gives him to drink, and benefits him from his possessions — how much more so.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בִּכְבוֹד אַכְסַנְיָא וְדָרַשׁ: ״לֹא תְתַעֵב אֲדֹמִי כִּי אָחִיךָ הוּא לֹא תְתַעֵב מִצְרִי כִּי גֵר הָיִיתָ בְאַרְצוֹ״, וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מִצְרִיִּים שֶׁלֹּא קֵרְבוּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא לְצוֹרֶךְ עַצְמָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם יָדַעְתָּ וְיֶשׁ בָּם אַנְשֵׁי חַיִל וְשַׂמְתָּם שָׂרֵי מִקְנֶה עַל אֲשֶׁר לִי״ — כָּךְ, הַמְאָרֵחַ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וּמַאֲכִילוֹ וּמַשְׁקֵהוּ וּמְהַנֵּהוּ מִנְּכָסָיו — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei began in honor of the hosts, and taught: “You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother; you shall not abhor an Egyptian, because you were a stranger in his land” Isn’t this an a fortiori inference: Just as the Egyptians, who only befriended Israel, for their own benefit, as it is stated: “And if you know any able men among them, then make them rulers over my cattle” this way, all the more so one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home, providing him with food and drink and availing him of his possessions
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei began with honor and expounded: "Do not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother; do not abhor an Egyptian, for you were a stranger in his land." Are these not logical arguments? Just as the Egyptians, who did not bring Israel close except for their own benefit, as it is said: "And if you know that there are among them men of valor, then you shall appoint them as overseers of livestock for me" - so too, one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home, feeds him, gives him drink, and benefits him from his possessions - how much more so.
