hebrew_text: פָּתַח רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי בִּכְבוֹד אַכְסַנְיָא וְדָרַשׁ: ״וַיְבָרֶךְ ה׳ אֶת עֹבֵד אֱדֹם הַגִּתִּי בַּעֲבוּר אֲרוֹן הָאֱלֹהִים״, וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אָרוֹן שֶׁלֹּא אָכַל וְשָׁתָה, אֶלָּא כִּבֵּד וְרִבֵּץ לְפָנָיו — כָּךְ, הַמְאָרֵחַ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וּמַאֲכִילוֹ וּמַשְׁקֵהוּ וּמְהַנֵּהוּ מִנְּכָסָיו — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, began in honor of the hosts, and taught: “The Lord has blessed the house of Oved-edom…because of the ark of God” Isn’t this an a fortiori inference: Just as in reward for honoring the ark, which neither ate nor drank, but before which swept and sprinkled this way all the more so one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home, providing him with food and drink and availing him of his possessions
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, began with honor and expounded: "And the Lord blessed the household of the Edomite because of the Ark of God." Is it not a logical inference: Just as the Ark did not eat or drink, but only honored and lay before it, so too, one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home, and feeds him, gives him drink, and sustains him from his possessions — how much more so.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא בְּרָכָה שֶׁבֵּרְכוֹ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר זְבִידָא: זוֹ חָמוֹת וּשְׁמוֹנֶה כַּלּוֹתֶיהָ שֶׁיָּלְדוּ שִׁשָּׁה שִׁשָּׁה בְּכָרֵס אֶחָד.
human_translation: What is blessing with which was blessed? Rav Yehuda bar Zevida said: This is Ḥamot and her eight daughters-in-law, each of whom bore six in a single womb,
llm_translation: "What is the blessing that they blessed him with?" Rav Yehudah son of Zevida said: This is the mother-in-law and her eight daughters who each gave birth to six children in one delivery."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פְּעֻלְּתַי הַשְּׁמִינִי״, וּכְתִיב ״כִּי בֵרְכוֹ אֱלֹהִים״. ״כׇּל אֵלֶּה מִבְּנֵי עֹבֵד אֱדֹם הֵמָּה וּבְנֵיהֶם וַאֲחֵיהֶם אִישׁ חַיִל בַּכֹּחַ לַעֲבֹדָה שִׁשִּׁים וּשְׁנַיִם לְעֹבֵד אֱדֹם״.
human_translation: as it is stated: sons…Peulletai the eighth,” and it is written: “For God blessed him” “All these were of the sons of Oved-edom; they and their sons and their brethren, able men in strength for the service; sixty-two of Oved-edom”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "My eighth work," and it is written "for God has blessed him." "All these are the sons of Esau, who are the descendants of Edom, they and their sons and their brothers, each one a man of valor, for service, sixty-two in all for the service of Edom."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין הַלֵּוִי: כׇּל הַדּוֹחֵק אֶת הַשָּׁעָה — שָׁעָה דּוֹחַקְתּוֹ. וְכׇל הַנִּדְחֶה מִפְּנֵי הַשָּׁעָה — שָׁעָה נִדְחֵת מִפָּנָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin HaLevi said: If one forces the moment moment forces him If one yields to the moment moment yields to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin said: Anyone who forces the hour - the hour forces him. And anyone who is pushed away by the hour - the hour is pushed away from him.

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף. דְּרַב יוֹסֵף סִינַי וְרַבָּה עוֹקֵר הָרִים, אִצְטְרִיכָא לְהוּ שַׁעְתָּא. שְׁלַחוּ לְהָתָם: סִינַי וְעוֹקֵר הָרִים, אֵיזֶה מֵהֶם קוֹדֵם? שְׁלַחוּ לְהוּ: סִינַי קוֹדֵם, שֶׁהַכֹּל צְרִיכִין לְמָרֵי חִטַּיָּא. אַף עַל פִּי כֵן לֹא קִבֵּל עָלָיו רַב יוֹסֵף, דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ כַּלְדָּאֵי: מָלְכַתְּ תַּרְתֵּין שְׁנִין.
human_translation: from Rabba and Rav Yosef, as Rav Yosef Sinai, and Rabba one who uproots mountains, The moment arrived when they were needed; They sent there, Which takes precedence, Sinai or one who uproots mountains? They sent to them Sinai takes precedence, everyone needs the owner of the wheat, Nevertheless, Rav Yosef did not accept as the Chaldean told him: You will preside two years.
llm_translation: From Rabba and Rav Yosef. For Rav Yosef is from Sinai and Rabba uproots mountains, it was necessary for them to have a moment. They sent there: Sinai and uprooter of mountains, which of them is prior? They sent to them: Sinai is prior, for all require the master of wheat. Nevertheless, Rav Yosef did not accept it, for they say to him: "A kingdom lasts two years."

hebrew_text: מְלַךְ רַבָּה עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין שְׁנִין, מְלַךְ רַב יוֹסֵף תַּרְתֵּין שְׁנִין וּפַלְגָא.
human_translation: Rabba presided twenty-two years. Rav Yosef presided two and a half years.
llm_translation: King Rabba twenty and two years, King Rav Yosef twenty two years and a half.

hebrew_text: כֹּל הָנָךְ שְׁנֵי דִּמְלַךְ רַבָּה, אֲפִילּוּ אוּמָּנָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ לָא קְרָא.
human_translation: all those years that Rabba presided, did not even call a bloodletter to his home.
llm_translation: Any pleasure of two drops of a great king, even a craftsman to his house did not call.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין הַלֵּוִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״יַעַנְךָ ה׳ בְּיוֹם צָרָה יְשַׂגֶּבְךָ שֵׁם אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב וְלֹא אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם וְיִצְחָק? מִכָּאן לְבַעַל הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס בְּעׇבְיָהּ שֶׁל קוֹרָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Avin HaLevi said: What is that which is written: “The Lord will answer you on the day of distress; the name of the God of Jacob set you upon high” the God of Jacob and not the God of Abraham and Isaac? from here One who owns a beam should approach the thick portion of the beam.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avin said: What is the meaning of what is written, "May the Lord answer you on a day of distress, may the Name of the God of Jacob fortify you"? The God of Jacob and not the God of Abraham and Isaac? From here we learn for the one who enters into the thickness of the beam.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין הַלֵּוִי: כׇּל הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִסְּעוּדָה שֶׁתַּלְמִיד חָכָם שָׁרוּי בְּתוֹכָהּ, כְּאִילּוּ נֶהֱנֶה מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּבֹא אַהֲרֹן וְכֹל זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֶאֱכׇל לֶחֶם עִם חֹתֵן מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הָאֱלֹהִים״, וְכִי לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהִים אָכְלוּ? וַהֲלֹא לִפְנֵי מֹשֶׁה אָכְלוּ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Avin HaLevi said: One who partakes of a meal at which a Torah scholar is present, it is as if he enjoyed the radiant splendor of the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “And Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God” Did they eat before God? Didn’t they eat before Moses?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avin HaLevi said: Anyone who benefits from a meal in which a Torah scholar is present, it is as if he benefits from the radiance of the Divine Presence, as it is stated: "And Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses' father-in-law before God." But did they eat before God? Did they not eat before Moses?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ כׇּל הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִסְּעוּדָה שֶׁתַּלְמִיד חָכָם שָׁרוּי בְּתוֹכָהּ — כְּאִילּוּ נֶהֱנֶה מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה.
human_translation: Rather, to tell you one who partakes in a meal at which a Torah scholar is present, it is as if he enjoyed the radiant splendor of the Divine Presence.
llm_translation: Rather to say to you, all who benefit from the feast of a Torah scholar, it is as if they benefit from the radiance of the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין הַלֵּוִי: הַנִּפְטָר מֵחֲבֵרוֹ אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, שֶׁהֲרֵי יִתְרוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, עָלָה וְהִצְלִיחַ. דָּוִד שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, הָלַךְ וְנִתְלָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Avin HaLevi said: One who takes leave from another should not say to him: Go in peace, but rather, Go to peace. As we see Jethro said to Moses: “Go to peace” Moses ascended and was successful. David said to Absalom: “Go in peace” went and was hanged.
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Avin the Levite: One who takes leave of his fellow should not say to him "go in peace," but rather "go to peace," for Jethro who said to Moses "go to peace," went and succeeded. But David who said to Absalom "go in peace," he went and was hanged.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין הַלֵּוִי: הַנִּפְטָר מִן הַמֵּת אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה תָּבוֹא אֶל אֲבֹתֶיךָ בְּשָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin HaLevi also said: One who takes leave from a dead person should not say to him: Go to peace, but rather, Go in peace, as it is stated: “But you shall go to your fathers in peace”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avin said: One who is released from the deceased should not say to him "Go in peace," but rather "Go in peace," as it is stated: "And you shall come to your fathers in peace."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר חִיָּיא: הַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְנִכְנָס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה — זוֹכֶה וּמְקַבֵּל פְּנֵי שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״יֵלְכוּ מֵחַיִל אֶל חָיִל יֵרָאֶה אֶל אֱלֹהִים בְּצִיּוֹן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi bar Ḥiyya said: One who leaves the synagogue and enters the study hall and engages in Torah is privileged to receive the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “They go from strength to strength, every one of them appears before God in Zion”
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi bar Hiyya said: One who goes out from the synagogue and enters the study hall and engages in Torah study - he merits and receives the presence of the Divine Presence, as it is stated, "They will go from strength to strength; each one will appear before God in Zion."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵין לָהֶם מְנוּחָה לֹא בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְלֹא בָּעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵלְכוּ מֵחַיִל אֶל חָיִל יֵרָאֶה אֶל אֱלֹהִים בְּצִיּוֹן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: Torah scholars have rest neither in this world nor in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “They go from strength to strength, every one of them appears before God in Zion.”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Ashe said Rav: The students of the sages have no rest neither in this world nor in the world to come, as it is stated: "They will go from strength to strength; each will appear before God in Zion."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מַרְבִּים שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל בָּנַיִךְ לִמּוּדֵי ה׳ וְרַב שְׁלוֹם בָּנָיִךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Torah scholars increase peace in the world, as it is said: “And all your children [ banayikh ] shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: The disciples of the sages increase peace in the world, as it is stated: "And all your children shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children."

hebrew_text: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״בָּנָיִךְ״ אֶלָּא ״בּוֹנָיִךְ״. ״שָׁלוֹם רָב לְאֹהֲבֵי תוֹרָתֶךָ וְאֵין לָמוֹ מִכְשׁוֹל״. ״יְהִי שָׁלוֹם בְּחֵילֵךְ שַׁלְוָה בְּאַרְמְנוֹתָיִךְ״. ״לְמַעַן אַחַי וְרֵעָי אֲדַבְּרָה נָּא שָׁלוֹם בָּךְ. לְמַעַן בֵּית ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֲבַקְשָׁה טוֹב לָךְ״. ״ה׳ עֹז לְעַמּוֹ יִתֵּן ה׳ יְבָרֵךְ אֶת עַמּוֹ בַשָּׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: Do not read your children [ banayikh ], but your builders [ bonayikh ]. “Those who love Your Torah have great peace; there is no stumbling block for them” “May there be peace within your walls, prosperity within your palaces” “For the sake of my brothers and friends, I shall say: Peace be within you. For the sake of the House of the Lord, our God, I will seek your good” “May the Lord give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace”
llm_translation: Do not read "banayich" but rather "bonayich." "Great peace to those who love Your Torah, and there is no stumbling block for them." "May there be peace within your walls, tranquility within your palaces." "For the sake of my brothers and friends, I will speak peace be within you. For the sake of the house of the Lord our God, I will seek your good." "The Lord will give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך הרואה וסליקא לה מסכת ברכות
llm_translation: We will return to you, the viewer, and conclude the tractate of Berakhot.
